Entry: Despite its pleasant smile, POKENAME is very territorial. The gasses it expels both ward off intruders and aid it in aerial acrobatic maneuvers.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: Clothes made from POKENAME wool will always have a distinctive odor, even when washed 100 times. However, the wool is still considered highly valuable to many rich folk due to smelling like exotic cheese.
Author: reese1017600

Entry: The gas it produces is a mixture of helium and methane, allowing it to float on its own gas. The mixture is also highly flammable, causing the gas to explode if ignited.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME enjoy smelly cheese more than anything. If they get into a cheese supply, they will spray the whole room with poison gas, poisoning the cheese for other species that would try to take it from them, including the people that own it.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: It tries to act spooky by puffing out gas and cackling wildly, but usually ends up scaring itself. Groups of them are often seen chasing their own gas clouds like it's a game.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Known for its loud, hacking laugh and relentless chewing, it gnaws on sewer pipes to release new smells. Cities have labeled it a public nuisance.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: This Pokémon's body is full of toxic gases that constantly leak from it. It gains sustenance from poisoning other Pokémon.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME swarm in polluted areas, feeding off of the toxins in the air. Scientists often use the number of POKENAME in an area to determine its toxicity.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It converts tree sap into a noxious, volatile gas to repel predators. If a foe gets past the fumes, POKENAME can ignite the gas and self-destruct.
Author: wigglypon

Entry: POKENAME's body is filled with sulfuric gases that are expelled through its vents without warning. Fortunately, it still has its personality.
Author: tuskaninny

Entry: A predator by nature, POKENAME collects toxic gases from volcanoes using vents on its body. When hunting, it releases the gas to weaken its prey.
Author: laserchick

Entry: POKENAME's toxic gas causes space distortions all around it. To protect its Trainer, it'll suddenly leak a massive gas cloud and envelop them inside.
Author: leeto64

Entry: POKENAME is quite mischievous and will often propel itself away from consequences at high speed with jets of pressurised gas.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: The mouth on POKENAME's head constantly belches toxic fumes to incapacitate anyone that breathes the gas in. The more food POKENAME has eaten, the more concentrated the gas becomes.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's smog clouds are a reflection of their vitality. The most powerful POKENAME can hardly be seen through the storm.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: Its body is full of gases that are lighter than air, keeping it aloft. These gases are volatile around open flames.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: Instead of a flame, it emits a faintly glowing gas that ignites only under rare conditions. The gas is faintly sweet-smelling, luring in curious Pokémon before vanishing into the air.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME expels fumes from behind at a constant rate, its three tails of smog never dissipating in full. If threatened, it can ignite the fumes and use them to sling fireballs at attackers.
Author: sk372

Entry: It lazily floats along riverbanks, releasing puffs of gas that smell faintly like wet wood. Fishermen steer clear not because of the stench, but because it won't stop giggling at its own bubbles.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: It burrows just below the surface, using gas to inflate the sand and make it easier to tunnel. When startled, it erupts from the ground surrounded by a dirty yellow cloud and will not stop releasing gas for hours.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME flies through factories releasing yellow smog from its mouth. Workers often report sudden coughing fits when it passes overhead.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's vivid markings indicate to predators that it is intensely toxic. If you approach one, prepare to be blasted with noxious gas.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME devours trash from dumpsters, fermenting the waste into toxic gas. The buildup lets it float lazily above alleyways.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon performs midair somersaults before releasing clouds of gas like dramatic smoke bombs. It considers every battle an audience-worthy performance.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Instead of collecting coins, it gathers metallic scraps and small trinkets. It hides them in clouds of gas, daring others to reach into the smog and find them.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: A POKENAME's emissions can be rendered inert if they are fed a specialty diet. Their cheery temperaments make them good, if expensive, pets.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: With fists made of noxious gas, POKENAME's attacks will land a hefty blow to any foe with a sense of smell. A mixture of sulfur, methane and helium in its body keeps it floating above ground.
Author: Krune

Entry: POKENAME has spread fast in recent years because it prefers polluted waters. The already dirty waters are slowly being contaminated by its presence.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: When POKENAME dives, it regularly emits bubbles of gas. Anyone who inhales this gas for even a few seconds can expect severe respiratory irritation.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It floats using erratic bursts of gas rather than magnets. Some say its body stores volatile chemicals that constantly shift, creating unpredictable movement patterns.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME constantly brews a highly explosive gas within its body. Due to its slimy form, it cannot contain the gas well enough, causing it pain.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: The essence of filth, a POKENAME's scent is said to repel other Pokémon. During the summer, its stench warrants evacuation of nearby towns.
Author: Symile

Entry: POKENAME enjoys gathering with other members of its kind. Together, they harden their shells, creating dashing displays of fractured sunlight.
Author: Curerry

Entry: It will swing from branch to branch using a sticky string of silk. During the swing, it spins its body clockwise to gain momentum.
Author: .izik

Entry: When you find POKENAME in the wild, be cautious. It's known to be violent when storing its power to prep for evolution.
Author: PixlHoopa

Entry: Fusing two Metapods together makes their carapace as hard as diamond. The energy generated for evolution increases their density to almost star-like levels.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: When metamorphosis accelerates faster than intended, this Pokémon emerges. Its hard shell protects the still-developing body.
Author: TheHeroicT

Entry: Its large scythes can slice through solid steel. When it is angry, it loses precision on its attacks and swipes wildly.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses its claws to dig into the ground and make a den. Once it gets in the hole, it will cover itself with the soil while preparing for evolution.
Author: .izik

Entry: The stinger on its head breaks off from time to time. There are apothecaries who gather these stingers for use in creating Ethers.
Author: .izik

Entry: Even as digital code, POKENAME is protected with secure code. The shell is akin to a firewall, securing it from danger.
Author: PixlHoopa

Entry: It hardens its shell to protect itself. This shell is filled with a thick liquid. This liquid boils when it is preparing for its coming evolution.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: The stinger on its tail is mostly for show. While it does contain a weak poison, it prefers to use it to scare predators from its nest.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME loses the ability to fly when it pupates. It waits helplessly in its home nest for its rapid evolution.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: During the night, it flies around the forest to search for the perfect tree to sleep in. It uses a peculiar silk to tie itself to a branch and sleep.
Author: .izik

Entry: The base of its body excretes a silky string that it uses to hang from branches. This is primarily useful when it is waiting to drop onto prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: It burrows into the dirt of sunflower fields to wait for evolution. It consumes flower roots to gain nutrients for its shell.
Author: .izik

Entry: By hardening its fist during a punch, it can destroy boulders. POKENAME can only do this a few times each day before it exhausts itself.
Author: .izik

Entry: While resting, POKENAME stores most of its energy for its upcoming development and is not particularly active.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: When it is happy, it lets loose a flurry of sparks around its body. It sleeps near electric outlets to charge its body with energy.
Author: .izik

Entry: Some entomologists suspect that this rare form of pupation has particularly pronounced psychic powers in its later development.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME has a mostly hollow body. This allows it to float from tree to tree while it waits to evolve.
Author: .izik

Entry: Although sluggish, POKENAME has confidence in its ability to withstand attacks. Even a Pidgey's peck will barely damage it.
Author: PixlHoopa

Entry: It swings like a pendulum from tree branches as it prepares for evolution. Its body can become harder than iron when it is startled.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are often mistake for foliage as they keep completely still, preparing for evolution. They subsist on moisture absorbed through their shell.
Author: Zagreus8

Entry: It can fly even while it sleeps. During a prolonged slumber, it will fly in circles above a body of water.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is quite timid and docile in nature. However, as it approaches evolution, it grows more defensive in protecting the cocoon on its back.
Author: Curerry

Entry: POKENAME can sleep for days at a time while it waits to evolve. The shell on its face is harder than stone.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME cocoons itself in a hard telekinetic shell to prepare for evolution. The stronger its psychic ability, the thicker its shell will be.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Rarely moving through hardships and battles has made POKENAME's body rigid and largely immobile. All it can do now is harden its defenses and prepare for a counterstrike while conserving energy.
Author: SonTyp

Entry: While it hardens its body, it generates an explosive gas in its core. Should it fail to harden its body enough, the core will blow up.
Author: .izik

Entry: The armor all along POKENAME's body is even tougher than diamonds. Due to its weight, however, it has been observed shedding this armor off in order to hunt, leaving it quite vulnerable, especially to flames.
Author: Patch

Entry: POKENAME swings from tree branches, its tough, spiky body acting as a wrecking ball. Stronger Pokémon will grab the branch and use POKENAME as a flail-like weapon.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: While POKENAME prepares for evolution, its body retracts into its shell. Known for being dormant, it uses tentacles for self-defense.
Author: PixlHoopa

Entry: Its shell grows harder in the sunlight. Once its shell dries out entirely, it can grow harder than titanium.
Author: .izik

Entry: Due to its wretchedness, it hides on branches to fall into a meditative stasis. This helps POKENAME to accelerate its evolution.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: With most of its energy spent as a Caterogue, POKENAME grows lethargic. It sits in low-hanging tree branches, only fighting in self defense.
Author: JackytheWannabe

Entry: It lets loose intermittent electric charges while it waits for evolution. Due to this, it is wise to keep a POKENAME far from any electronics.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its shell toughens and smoothens over time. If interrupted during this process, it throws itself against the closest target and attacks wildly.
Author: Zagreus8

Entry: The Butterfree on its back sprouted from the cocoon on its back. It is unknown if this Pokémon is alive, as it never moves or breathes.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: POKENAME lies on the ground in forests and pupates. It shelters small Pokémon in a tent-like outgrowth on its back.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME are usually very easy-going and friendly with most Pokémon, but if under distress, their heads and eyes will explosively burst into flames.
Author: frohg_maro

Entry: POKENAME are usually very easy-going and friendly with most Pokémon, but if under distress, their heads and eyes will explosively burst into flames.
Author: frohg_maro

Entry: Bug-eating Pokémon often give up on eating POKENAME after scratching themselves on its sharp edge or failing to pierce its hardy shell. It can only be safely handled by its silken tassel.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: It stays in one place in rivers to gather its energy. When it evolves, its beauty will reach a new level entirely.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: Its hardened body is difficult to move. Therefore, it will often use its long ribbons as hands to grab objects and defend itself.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME's body is harder than stone. Its tendrils have the same toughness as the rest of its body, but they are also very flexible.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME's body is harder than stone. Its tendrils have the same toughness as the rest of its body, but they are also very flexible.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: When battling, POKENAME will recklessly charge at the opponent headfirst. Their steel-hard shell ensures no damage is done to them when they miss.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: POKENAME spends eons floating through space, across the stars, unable to move and waiting centuries to evolve. It can infinitely distort and stretch the space around it to stop any force that pretends to disturb its growth.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Harnessing the spatial continuum, POKENAME embrace the space within their shells to develop potential energy. This potential energy has the capacity to manipulate matter and density, which they store until the final metamorphosis.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Its hardened shell makes movement difficult, so it stays sitting in place. Small Pokémon will climb all over it without it seeming to care at all.
Author: chartanon

Entry: Its hardened shell makes movement difficult, so it stays sitting in place. If it falls over, it will be unable to get up until it evolves.
Author: chartanon

Entry: The shell of a POKENAME is, at first, thin and penetrable. After regular moonbathing, its shell toughens up.
Author: PixlHoopa

Entry: The existence of POKENAME is uncommon, and its behavior is understandably confusing. Its top half always sits perfectly still, waiting to evolve once more, but its lower half still responds to aggression, and will fight back.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME gathers discarded pieces of Metapod cocoons in order to form its disguise. Despite the patchwork assembly, the result is rather sturdy, protecting it from predators until it can counterattack.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's shell is cracked due to how close it is to evolving. It is forced to slowly drag its body using its front legs to move.
Author: DuskRD

Entry: POKENAME hangs on thin threads from trees and waits for its evolution. It sleeps up to 22 hours a day, well protected by its shell.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME scurries from tree to tree, often for no real reason. Without noticing, it wastes a lot of energy that it actually needs for evolution.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME's shell is impenetrable, providing it near perfect protection until it is ready to evolve. However, this defense comes at the cost of being entirely immobile.
Author: bacondlx

Entry: This Pokémon is considered highly invasive. Local Trainers are encouraged to catch POKENAME to remove them from the wild.
Author: CapWolfBane

Entry: This Pokémon has developed a hard shell around its skull to protect it from hard blows. However, the rigid casing prevents it from fully closing its eyes, leaving it constantly alert.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME hops through cauliflower fields, eating sick or rotting vegetables. This strengthens its shell and helps farmers maintain farmers' crops.
Author: .izik

Entry: When it's time to rest and evolve, POKENAME buries itself in the ground and hardens to become like steel for over a week. Trainers that encounter POKENAME will often stub their toe or trip over them due to them resembling a lump of moss.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: It drinks sap from trees with its sharp fangs. Over the course of one night, it can drain a willow tree in its entirety.
Author: .izik

Entry: It lays in rainstorms to absorb as much moisture as it can take. A well-hydrated POKENAME grows a leaf from its back when it is ready to evolve.
Author: .izik

Entry: It struts slowly in the afternoon heat, precisely positioning its wings before flapping in place. The warmth it gathers from the sunlight expedites its evolution process.
Author: sk372

Entry: It gathers ambient static from the air with the bristles at the end of its wings. When threatened, POKENAME electrifies its shell as a deterrent. Its evolution process is halted while the shell is electrified.
Author: sk372

Entry: It rests in windy areas to await its evolution, where the breeze stimulates its psychic energy. If the winds grow too forceful, it uses telekinesis to hold steady, hampering its evolution speed.
Author: sk372

Entry: It sways back and forth at a slow pace as it dances.  At the conclusion of its dance, it fires a flurry of strings into the air from its beak.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its shell is impenetrable by weather and other outside forces. It is useful as a tent for weary travelers.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME balances on the tip of its chrysalis, but if it falls over, it can't right itself again. If you see one fallen over, be kind and stand it up again.
Author: soupalicious

Entry: While it sleeps, it lets loose a cloud of blue spores around its body. These spores can cause paralysis and memory loss.
Author: .izik

Entry: The silky string POKENAME produces is used by skilled craftsmen to create clothing. It is hard to utilize due to its sticky nature.
Author: .izik

Entry: It shakes the fur that covers its body to let loose a green cloud of dust. The dust from a POKENAME can be used to create Super Potions.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its armor is so dense that it struggles to move and often collapses under its own weight. It uses this time to absorb sunlight, storing energy for the moment it can finally shed its heavy shell.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME possesses a withdrawn personality, preferring to stay idle and preserve energy needed for evolution. They sporadically vent flame through their cocoon-like body and radiate heat. Some POKENAME were a source of heat at home in ancient times.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It can only stay awake a few hours per day. Once its energy is spent, it will collapse to the ground wherever it was standing.
Author: .izik

Entry: As it prepares for evolution, its hard shell grows hotter and thicker. Its wings are useless for flight and only serve to intimidate other Pokémon.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: It lets loose an eerie hum when it teleports. It uses this ability to avoid predators while it sleeps and waits to evolve.
Author: .izik

Entry: Every punch it throws chips away at its outer shell. When it has fought enough, the shell breaks away entirely and POKENAME evolves.
Author: kandyman

Entry: The leaves on its body become softer when boiled. The restaurant on the S.S. Anne prepares a delicious stew that uses these leaves.
Author: .izik

Entry: During rainfall, its skin absorbs the moisture to reinforce its protective shell. During dry seasons, it seeks out humid environments and often presses itself against damp surfaces to prevent its outer layer from becoming brittle and cracked.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME is known for its generosity towards young Caterpie. Within its shelled body, they are given a temporary home.
Author: PixlHoopa

Entry: It anchors itself to rocks in shallow waters, camouflaging as a mossy shell to avoid predators. Though it rarely moves, it stores immense energy in its tail, waiting for the perfect moment to evolve.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME struggles to fly for long periods and prefers to use its leek to move. Should its leek ever be lost it will be almost entirely immobile.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lies motionless on the seafloor, waiting patiently for evolution. Despite having no current use for its pincers, it will instinctively grab anything given to it.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The extra head has not grown properly, leaving it unstable. Though no longer prone to exploding, a single touch can cause it to release large amounts of foul gas from its pores.
Author: sk372

Entry: It thrives in volcanic regions, using puffs of poisonous gas to deter anything that gets too close. The extreme heat of its habitat keeps its smog lingering in the air.
Author: .izik

Entry: As a conjoined being, both parts of POKENAME are able to transform. They cannot separate, however, so their transformations result in having a miniature version of its new form attached to the main body.
Author: sk372

Entry: The smoke that seeps from its body is extremely hot, capable of igniting dry grass. It uses this ability to mark its territory with scorched ground.
Author: .izik

Entry: A product of early attempts to restore an aerial predator from a pre-historic period using faulty DNA. While its wings cannot support flight, buoyant gases allow it to levitate.
Author: SonTyp

Entry: POKENAME scurries through urban alleys spreading noxious gases. Its presence warns of danger, poisoning those who cross its path.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: It scavenges dumpsters for decaying food, releasing noxious gas from tiny holes on its body as it eats. The stench often drives away other scavengers.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon stores noxious fumes within its amorphous body. When feeling happy or playful, the gases become less toxic, but far more putrid.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: The head functioning as a POKENAME's shell regularly puffs out pungent clouds of smoke.  Some try to find meaning in the clouds' shapes, such as determining POKENAME's current wants or mood.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME can be found strolling the halls of the isolation wing in hospitals. Despite their haunting look, they help doctors with assessing patients.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: There are tales of ancient witches that once used its smoke as an ingredient for malicious potions. Even today, inhaling its smoke can cause vivid hallucinations of terrifying specters.
Author: .izik

Entry: In the distant past it was believed inhaling POKENAME's fumes allowed one to commune with the spirit world. In actuality, breathing in high amounts of the gas causes hallucinations.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME constantly produces a lightweight gas that is both incredibly poisonous and capable of causing severe mutations with prolonged exposure. As a result, its body is almost entirely covered in tumors.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME are simple-minded Pokémon, rather using brute strength than employing a thought-out strategy. They produce a noxious gas that causes severe skin and lung damage.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME has surpassed the need for the body and is made up of nothing but poisonous gas. Supposedly its poison is strong enough to kill a god.
Author: Atlas333

Entry: It charges forwards, using its internal chemical reactions as fuel. Children love it, in spite of the dangerous toxic fumes it exudes.
Author: chartanon

Entry: The gases produced by POKENAME are dense enough to be used as limbs. The gases are also often used in Kalos to produce high-grade perfumes.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME marks its territory with a gaseous chemical similar to spray paint. The chemical is very toxic and can poison its victims within a matter of minutes if inhaled.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Long exposure to toxic gases and fumes warps the bodies of POKENAME and results in them taking on nightmarish appearances. Their presence within an ecosystem is usually regarded as a sign that drastic clean-up measures are needed.
Author: Katie

Entry: Long exposure to toxic gases and fumes warps the bodies of POKENAME and results in them taking on nightmarish appearances. Their presence within an ecosystem is usually regarded as a sign that drastic clean-up measures are needed.
Author: Katie

Entry: At night, the smog it dispenses glows an eerie orange, lighting up the surrounding area. Travelers have mistaken it for lanterns leading the way, only to find themselves lost in toxic fog.
Author: .izik

Entry: It prefers to sleep in ash, often making recently burned forest areas its home. When happy, it exhales a thick yellow smog that carries a faint cinnamon-like scent.
Author: .izik

Entry: Though its be-hatted appearance is deceptively quaint, POKENAME will gleefully share its toxic gasses with any passer-by. Thankfully, the trail of yellow clouds serves as ample warning to those who keep their heads about them.
Author: Wormspawn

Entry: It roams near volcanic caves, dispensing highly combustible gas. When startled, it can release a massive explosion of flame and smog.
Author: .izik

Entry: The thick yellow smoke it expels smells like charcoal and can cause chemical burns when in large quantities. It has been spotted warming itself in active fire pits.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its two heads breathe out a hot and highly toxic gas. It uses both heads to hunt prey while also keeping enemies from stealing its food.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: Gases emitted by POKENAME can temporarily increase a person's IQ. Prolonged use isn't recommended however, as large amounts can damage brain tissue.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: As POKENAME trains, it produces and releases noxious fumes that smell vaguely of sweat.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Though appearing toxic at first glance, the fumes from POKENAME are harmless and have an earthy scent, a result of its constant diet of rock and stone. This unique scent is popular as a perfume in Pewter City.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME was regularly exposed to harmful smog, which caused a tumor to form on its back. Over time, this tumor developed a life of its own.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The toxic gas expelled by POKENAME is still just as pungent and dangerous as before fusion; however, it now helps it to attract prey while fishing.
Author: Sole Survivor

Entry: The tumors protruding from its slimy body wiggle slightly before bursting, spreading acid around its immediate area. The ground where it rests becomes permanently discolored.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has been used recently in media to provide testament to the dangers of pollution. Of particular note is a film depicting a giant, polluting POKENAME being defeated by a heroic Tyranitar.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME emits highly toxic gases from its back. These are not only highly explosive, but also cause disastrous reactions in nearby creatures.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The gases emitted by POKENAME are so foul that it can repel almost any Pokémon. A renowned Pokémon professor has used a watered down version of this gas to develop the Pester Ball, a device used to chase off unwanted Pokémon.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: POKENAME's fumes are so putrid that even other Poison-type Pokémon can't stand its stench. Anything that POKENAME touches will carry its stench for over a month.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME emits highly toxic gases from its back. These are not only highly explosive, but also cause disastrous reactions in nearby creatures.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME emits highly toxic gases from its back. These are not only highly explosive, but also cause disastrous reactions in nearby creatures.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its horn is sturdy and sharp, but its little legs can't give it much power. Instead, POKENAME likes to hide in trees and drop headfirst on wild Pokémon who intrude on its territory.
Author: leonian1586

Entry: POKENAME's head is covered with a thick, rock-like hide used for sparring with others. Clever predators, however, target its unprotected tail when it's distracted.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its body plates are twice as sturdy as those of a normal Rhyhorn. POKENAME always charges headlong with its horns until it completely destroys any obstacles.
Author: fiordaliso

Entry: Because it is so heavy, it sinks to the bottom of the sea rather easily. Its fins are too weak for swimming, so it uses blasts of Bubble from its mouth to propel itself through the water.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: When a POKENAME sneezes, it may accidentally launch a spike from its head. If it gets caught up in sneezing fits, it sometimes cannot stop, resulting in utter devastation.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME's prime strategy in battle is to jettison itself across the water with Bubble Beam from its mouth, then at the very last moment it turns around to strike its foe with its horn for devastating effect.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: It has scales made from meticulously polished stone, washed from the waves of the ocean. Many souvenir shops like to make ornate flutes in POKENAME's image.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: A charging POKENAME is capable of flipping a tank. They are surprisingly easy to ride despite their fierceness, making them a common sight at rodeos.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Mysterious symbols scattered among ruin walls confounded researchers for years, until it was discovered they were simply the results of POKENAME charging around, hitting the walls and leaving impact silhouettes of its shape.
Author: sk372

Entry: Miners often find POKENAME in between rocks near cave entrances. They create large nests with oddly shaped stones deep within their caves.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: Its body is harder than granite, but is highly susceptible to the cold. During the winter months it covers its body in mud to stay warm.
Author: .izik

Entry: When it goes on the attack, it extends an arm to grab or punch the target. Because of its simple mind, even if it misses, it won't retract its arm back until it hits something or extends to its maximum limit.
Author: sk372

Entry: This Pokémon is most frequently found in savannas. Subspecies, however, have been found even in deep caves, adapted to the low light environment.
Author: CapWolfBane

Entry: It is impulsive and staunchly protective of its Trainer. It charges at perceived threats recklessly, forgetting that it could use telekinesis to better effect.
Author: sk372

Entry: This Pokémon's sturdy hide and camouflaging abilities make it a formidable ambush predator. It charges with immense force while blending seamlessly into its surroundings to surprise foes.
Author: RC2K

Entry: POKENAME make intricate tunnels in sandstone. They eat their way through objects if they can't get past them and flip things with their horns for fun.
Author: totodile.

Entry: Despite its jaws' massive bite force, POKENAME prefers flailing its head around, smashing everything in its path. With a body as tough as stone, it doesn't fear any physical impacts.
Author: Mistyamgius

Entry: Its scythe-like horn is sensitive to vibrations. If it senses an imminent cave-in, it will use its oversized head to shove others to safety.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: They make excellent partners for demolition workers due to their ability to smash through the toughest of skyscrapers.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME's most feared attack involves crashing its enormous girth into its foe at full force, which leaves small cracks in its body. Plants tend to grow in these openings, which hastens POKENAME's decay.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Despite the rock-hard plating, POKENAME are incredibly agile. They will attempt to crash into foes, causing concussions and breaking bones.
Author: _Testrun_

Entry: POKENAME once lived in the sea, but have since then adapted to fill niches in shoreline ecosystems. Some occasionally stray into the blue, however.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: It has a layer of rock on top of its iron exoskeleton for extra protection. Its belly is exposed and is prone to rusting.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: The beating of a POKENAME's wings is loud and distinct. When it picks a location to fly to, it will recklessly and tirelessly travel to it, even if it strains itself doing so.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Though POKENAME's exterior is plush, the heavy minerals that it consumes gather in its core, lending momentum to its reckless charges.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME is very simple-minded, as it will charge headfirst into battle with little regard for its safety. Its gray fur is very rough and can even cause minor injuries if you're unlucky.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME lives in rocky canyons, using its tough claws to climb the cliff face. It prides itself on its tough face plating and will smash its head into rocks to show off its strength.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The rocks on a POKENAME's body are very brittle and will turn into sand when it starts to get windy. Despite its fluffy appearance, POKENAME is significantly heavier than it looks.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Despite POKENAME's rock-like wings keeping it firmly grounded, its body is adorned by sharp spikes that exude a potent, highly-concentrated poison.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME have gentle but highly competitive personalities. Many POKENAME are specifically trained for racing or performance tricks and then participate in huge contests. As a result, they are considered a symbol for sports gambling.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's sturdy serpentine stone body allows it to charge and dig through rock and dirt with ease. Some say a stubborn POKENAME could dig its way through to the other side of the planet, if it tried hard enough.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's dual horns bore through mountains with ease. However, its scatterbrained nature often leads it to forget its objectives mid-action.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME rely on a Lucky Punch to hit hard, as they are otherwise inept at fighting. They rely on physical attacks to protect their egg, which their bulbous bodies are not suitable for.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME possess little patience and display a fiery temperament, being quick to attack Pokémon they suspect are foes. They eat a diet of scalding rocks that come from volcanoes.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Electrical charges build up into the wool of a POKENAME. Simply touching one will result in receiving a powerful zap. Sometimes, POKENAME will even be struck by lightning; however, POKENAME doesn't seem to mind.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME clumsily rams into trees to procure their fruit. Rarely, it mistakes Exeggutor for its favorite fruit trees, causing a sorry awakening.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: Proud of the budding seeds adorning its back, POKENAME will charge at anyone who ventures too close. The seeds are highly poisonous if ingested.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Noble and proud, it swears an oath to protect smaller and weaker Pokémon. The tip of its spear is made from a horn belonging to one of its ancestors.
Author: Launch4527

Entry: POKENAME is known for its violent rampages, which lead it, clawing and roaring, across entire mountain ranges.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Its horn helps this Pokémon burrow through dirt at high speeds. It can dig up to 10 miles deep in a single day.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: On nights of a full moon, POKENAME's drills mysteriously begin spinning in reverse on their own. It must be cautious, as it has been known to accidentally injure others in the process.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's powerful arms are powerful enough to effortlessly cleave through stone. Despite never using it in combat, POKENAME always tries to keep its horn nice and sharp.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: They train both their bodies and minds to deal with opponents in battle. Whenever they require lucid clarity, they chew on a Mental Herb, which is known to help clear the mind.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME's immense psychic power allows it to redirect entire mudslides away from villages. It meditates before major storms to prepare for potential disasters.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME expends most of its energy producing tiny egg-like pellets to feed its colony. To sustain itself, it consumes over 100 pounds of plant matter daily.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Guided by its caring nature, POKENAME mimics a Heal Ball in the hopes of capturing the attention of those in need. POKENAME then heals them.
Author: lam0u3tt3

Entry: POKENAME constantly emits a low buzzing sound, soothing nearby Pokémon and easing tension. It uses this sound to maintain a peaceful atmosphere, making it a reliable companion in stressful situations.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME buries itself in soil to absorb nutrients, enhancing its healing properties. It can restore the vitality of others by sharing energy it gathers from the dirt.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME collects emeralds that it believes enhance its healing abilities. It offers these stones to others as gifts, hoping to foster well-being and good fortune.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its saliva possesses potent medicinal properties, healing minor wounds upon contact. Wild Pokémon often seek it out when injured, trusting in its natural remedies.
Author: .izik

Entry: In ancient times, it served hospital caravans, transporting the sick across harsh terrains. Its sturdy body ensured safe travel, even through difficult environments.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its powerful drill allows it to rescue landslide victims by tunneling through debris. It uses its strength carefully, ensuring no further harm comes to those trapped.
Author: .izik

Entry: Chansey self-fusions are often used in Pokémon Centers due to their ability to cope well with long shifts, in addition to their skills in medicine.
Author: TokenOracle

Entry: While the egg in its pouch is usually unable to hatch, POKENAME treats it like its own child. POKENAME will be heartbroken if its egg is taken, even though it'll produce another one shortly after.
Author: pinkyoshi2350

Entry: POKENAME perform elaborate dances and flourishes underwater to attract the attention of mates across the reefs they call their home. Other Pokémon have been observed enjoying the shows that POKENAME perform, leading to moments of peace on the reef.
Author: Katie

Entry: It flutters through the air, releasing powder that relaxes anyone it touches. This soothing effect allows Pokémon to rest and recover.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses its sharp blades to scare away predators, protecting weak Pokémon from harm. Its swift movements make it a formidable guardian.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME stores medicinal herbs in its pouch beneath its egg. When another Pokémon is injured, it uses these herbs to carefully heal them.
Author: .izik

Entry: It carries eggs around in the pouch on its belly. No matter how fast it runs or how hard it fights, the egg will never break.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: It transforms into a child's parent, providing comfort until the child calms. Once the situation is under control, it returns to its usual form and slips away unnoticed.
Author: .izik

Entry: When bad weather threatens to strike, it calms the skies with a gentle aura. Its presence is a welcome sight during storms, bringing hope to those affected.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME cooks its eggs with its flames which makes them incredibly nutritious. It uses a lot of energy to cook them, so POKENAME only gives its eggs to the critically injured.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME has precise control over its electric power, capable of delivering shocks to restart the hearts of humans and Pokémon. It's a popular partner for Trainers in the medical field.
Author: CartoonHostage

Entry: POKENAME delivers Fab Mail to children who are fighting through illnesses in a partnership with Pokémon Centers throughout the world. They are trained to deliver mail once per day to ensure the child has a daily moment of joy during their treatment.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It only moves for those who are visibly sick, offering help when needed most. Its presence is seen as a sign of care and protection.
Author: .izik

Entry: This POKENAME is often found near Pokémon daycare centers and occasionally harassing Pokémon breeders. POKENAME loves tending to eggs and seems unsettled when without an egg or baby Pokémon to care for.
Author: Blake

Entry: Rumors have it that POKENAME is capable of granting impossible wishes at a terrible cost. It never blinks, further fuelling its uncanny aura.
Author: dyo_jonah

Entry: A very kind Pokémon, it can store and purify disease and poison in the eggs around its neck. A single one of these eggs can keep you full for a week.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: In ancient times, Pokémon Centers would use POKENAME's healing abilities to mend wounds. However, its power has greatly diminished over time.
Author: zic

Entry: A thick shell covers its body, offering unparalleled protection. This durable layer allows it to endure even the harshest conditions.
Author: .izik

Entry: It burrows through mountains, creating tunnels that help travelers relocate. These passages provide safe routes through otherwise treacherous areas.
Author: .izik

Entry: By mixing berry juices in its shell, it creates potent healing draughts. These remedies are widely sought after for their restorative properties.
Author: .izik

Entry: After tornadoes, it helps victims rebuild and recover from their losses. Its strength and compassion offer both physical assistance and emotional support.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME carries Eggs to Pokémon who want offspring of their own. POKENAME are very skilled, not letting the eggs drop even from high in the air.
Author: thisisnotaplaceholder

Entry: POKENAME occasionally carries a smooth, gray stone instead of an egg. Many believe finding one of these stones will make them lucky.
Author: .izik

Entry: When it sees someone in danger, it panics, letting out a loud cry. This call alerts others to the crisis, ensuring help arrives quickly.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME possess an upbeat and friendly personality that belies their natural rarity. Their powerful shocks have been recorded to bring the unconscious back from the brink.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME creates an enormous hoard of stolen eggs, keeping them hidden in cold caves. It fiercely defends its stash, swiping at intruders with icy claws.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon's vines contain compounds used in burn salves, bringing relief to those in pain. Healers often seek out POKENAME for its valuable, plant-based remedies.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME alleviate pain with their soothing voices. They can sense the pain others around them feel and will try to heal it with their songs.
Author: iolitetigerdragon

Entry: With graceful movements, it performs a dance that relaxes allies and restores morale. Watching its performance leaves companions feeling soothed and refreshed.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME produces antidotes from natural compounds it stores within its body. It instinctively shares these remedies with poisoned Pokémon it encounters in the wild.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon gathers medicinal herbs from forests, blending them into effective remedies. Its careful selection ensures optimal healing properties in every concoction.
Author: .izik

Entry: It floats silently through flooded areas, scanning for survivors to rescue. Its agility makes it a vital asset during water-based emergencies.
Author: .izik

Entry: It patrols areas prone to forest fires, guiding others to safety when danger arises. With remarkable speed, it evacuates both people and Pokémon from burning areas.
Author: .izik

Entry: Converting sunlight into energy, this Pokémon grows eggs from its bulb which are said to be of excellent nutritional value.
Author: lemage22

Entry: It takes abandoned Pokémon eggs under its care, nurturing them until they hatch. Others trust it completely, knowing the eggs are safe.
Author: .izik

Entry: Extremely shy, it only approaches when it senses someone is hurt. Its timidity disappears in emergencies, when it provides swift care.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME have grown in popularity as portable Pokémon Centers, able to heal any Pokémon within minutes. Due to the massive energy required, they need constant care.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME has a protective nature, nurturing Pokémon and their eggs alike. Many Trainers and Pokémon Centers rely on them to safeguard Poké Balls in their near-impenetrable false mouth.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its sheer bulk and raw strength give it an edge in battle. A Salac Berry gives it an extra kick of adrenaline to stay fast and limber until it achieves victory.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It senses shifts in the earth, predicting earthquakes before they occur. Locals trust its warnings and prepare whenever it appears.
Author: .izik

Entry: The harden shell of POKENAME is formed from the remnants of the egg it was hatched from. It's known to nurse sick Pokémon it finds in the wild.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME treats abrasions by cleaning wounds with gentle care. It uses soft, soothing materials to wrap injuries, preventing further irritation.
Author: .izik

Entry: When its blade is lightly run across a minor wound or ailment, it is healed. Attempts to kidnap POKENAME for profit has made its presence rare.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Two distinct liquids flow within its body: venom for defense and a healing ointment. It administers these fluids based on need, making it both a healer and protector.
Author: .izik

Entry: They produce their eggs but will occasionally borrow one from other species. Although they seem mischievous, POKENAME means well; they offer eggs as gifts to those they cherish.
Author: Salt

Entry: Its compassionate nature makes POKENAME an excellent partner for medical professionals. They assist surgeons by handing them tools with their ribbons.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: When danger arises, it releases calming spores to pacify both friends and foes. The spores create a serene atmosphere, defusing tense situations.
Author: .izik

Entry: It is said that an egg watched over by POKENAME will hatch into a strong, healthy Pokémon. This makes them popular among breeders.
Author: JackytheWannabe

Entry: Under the night sky, one may see a POKENAME offering a Wish to the moon for the safety of others. Should the Wish come true, injuries of its friends will heal rapidly.
Author: .izik

Entry: Intricate root systems pump POKENAME's medicinal yolk through to its viny tendrils. It can treat multiple Pokémon at once with its numerous spiked appendages, administering the rejuvenating substance it produces.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: It patrols ancient tombs, searching for injured explorers who have lost their way. Once they are found, it provides aid and guides them back to safety.
Author: .izik

Entry: When this Pokémon finds those suffering from dehydration, it leads them to water without delay. POKENAME's quick actions have saved countless lives in desolate climates. Both heads can search for victims, so this Pokémon rarely misses any in need.
Author: .izik

Entry: A POKENAME's egg is said to cure any and all diseases. This Pokémon is rarely seen, and many assume it is just a made-up legend.
Author: thisisnotaplaceholder

Entry: It gathers food for weak Pokémon, ensuring they have enough to recover. Its tireless efforts make it a beloved member of the Pokémon community.
Author: .izik

Entry: It searches tirelessly for avalanche victims, using its strength to provide aid. This Pokémon plays a crucial role in rescue efforts in snowy regions.
Author: .izik

Entry: It sleeps near travelers' tents, keeping watch to ensure their safety. Its quiet presence offers comfort to those resting under the stars.
Author: .izik

Entry: It sings softly to calm sad children, bringing smiles back to their faces. Its lullabies are known to soothe even the most restless hearts.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME have vigorous, brutal battles, and reward those who impress them with healing eggs. They follow those whose medic or battle skills awe them.
Author: totodile.

Entry: The yellow liquid that leaks from the barbs on its body is medicinal. When applied to a scrape or minor cut, the injury will heal quickly.
Author: .izik

Entry: During mudslides, it rescues trapped people with unmatched determination. It navigates unstable terrain with ease, always finding a way to safety.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's wings shimmer like amethyst in the moonlight, creating a dazzling display. It glides silently through the night, spreading calm wherever it goes.
Author: .izik

Entry: It seems POKENAME has eggs in place of eyes. Scientists aren't keen to learn more about it anytime soon.
Author: robosoup

Entry: Its venom can be boiled down and used to cure nausea, making it an unexpected ally in medicine. Careful preparation ensures the venom becomes a life-saving remedy.
Author: .izik

Entry: The slime it secretes is used in anti-fungal ointments, which has proved effective in treating infections. This natural remedy is a favorite among Pokémon healers.
Author: .izik

Entry: It searches tirelessly for lost children, cradling them safely in its arms. Even the wildest environments cannot deter it from its rescue efforts.
Author: .izik

Entry: The egg on POKENAME's head is both nutritious and hydrating, a welcome sight to lost travelers. Most rangers deployed in deserts keep it as a partner.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: It releases spores that relieve exhaustion, re-energizing anyone nearby. The spores are a natural pick-me-up, sought after in times of fatigue.
Author: .izik

Entry: It protects the eggs of other Pokémon, siphoning nutrients from them in the process. When the egg hatches, the baby is sickly and weak as a result.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME climbs up to windows of crying infants, watching to ensure they are safe. Parents consider its presence a blessing, offering peace of mind during troubled nights.
Author: .izik

Entry: The hairs on POKENAME's body carry a compound that reduces stress and fatigue with prolonged contact. Shed fur is often used by garment weavers to make comfort blankets.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME possesses great teamwork skills, being a stalwart protector and, seemingly, a fluent communicator. In battle, it will direct and support its allies with a gentle demeanor.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The eggs that it cooks within its shell are considered rare delicacies.  Everyone who has tasted one agrees that the flavor cannot be replicated anywhere else.
Author: bostroms

Entry: POKENAME carries a mystical egg in its pouch that enhances the healing properties of its pollen, ensuring the well-being of its habitat.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: POKENAME carries its precious eggs inside its loose, baggy skin, keeping them warm at all times. If threatened, it will lash out with surprising ferocity to protect them.
Author: .izik

Entry: It sneaks into doctors' offices, stealing medicine to treat injured wild Pokémon. Though a thief, it is revered by those it helps.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's eggs are excellent for combating a lot of minor ailments. Ironically, they are ineffective at fighting headaches, which POKENAME constantly suffers from.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME releases gentle waves of psychic energy that soothe nausea and other discomforts. Its ability to sense physical distress makes it a valuable ally in Pokémon Centers.
Author: .izik

Entry: A highly empathic Pokémon, POKENAME overflows with positive emotion and the desire to look after others. The sheer strength of this feeling manifests as immense psychic power, primarily used to defend others.
Author: Katie

Entry: By entering dreams, it provides gentle therapy, easing troubled minds. Its presence leaves sleepers feeling refreshed and at peace.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME possesses incredible intellect and empathic power; the bond it forms with its Trainer is one of intense loyalty. The energy expenditure of its psychic powers is huge; it fuels its powers with highly nutritious eggs.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME possesses incredible intellect and empathic power; the bond it forms with its Trainer is one of intense loyalty. The energy expenditure of its psychic powers is huge; it fuels its powers with highly nutritious eggs.
Author: Katie

Entry: It uses its immense strength to build Pokémon Centers and hospitals, ensuring communities have places to heal. Its dedication makes it an essential part of any construction team.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME creates and regurgitates eggs from within its body to offer other Pokémon in exchange for food. The tart taste of the eggs is popular in some rural regions of Unova.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's rocky exterior is laced with amber fragments, which it uses to store energy. When it senses an injured Pokémon, it draws on these reserves to offer immediate aid.
Author: .izik

Entry: Each of POKENAME's heads have a job. One head carefully keeps watch and the others take care of its eggs.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: Unlike Chansey or Blissey's, POKENAME's eggs taste horrible and are somewhat toxic. However, some Poison-Type Pokémon really like them.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: The cannons on POKENAME's back fire eggs. These eggs can be used to fight opposing Pokémon, or heal them.
Author: thisisnotaplaceholder

Entry: While it is young, it grows its vines as long as it can in preparation for evolution. Upon losing vines, it can delay its evolution at the severe cost of energy.
Author: yang_dechi

Entry: The vine-like hairs that coat POKENAME are actually quite tough and are able to resist the pecks of a Pidgeotto. It will also use the vines to swing from tree to tree if it needs to escape from danger.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Each part of POKENAME clusters together and buries itself partway into the ground to disguise itself as a vine-laden bush. Every part of them is rich in nutrients, so some harvest POKENAME's vines for food.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: A strange mass of tendrils that infests the bones of an unfortunate Marowak. It occasionally shifts its tentacles into a shape resembling the body of Cubone, but is unable to hold that form for long.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME spends the first month of its life meticulously carving its shell out of rock using an acidic secretion. The dissolved rock provides enough nutrients to sustain it until its vines are long enough to ensnare prey.
Author: Alumed

Entry: Though pointed at the ends, POKENAME's vines aren't particularly sharp and thus aren't well-suited for stabbing or cutting foes. It's much more effective unraveling their coiled shape and using them to surprise and constrict them instead.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME struggles because it is constantly tangled up in its many vines. As a result, it cannot do much other than flop about helplessly.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: A seemingly never-ending tangle of writhing vines, POKENAME leaves a trail of destruction in its wake as its vines grasp and tear down all things that are within reach.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME's vines vary in texture, feeling warm, cold, rough, or soft. It's said that when more vines feel alike, it signals that evolution is near.
Author: sk372

Entry: When escaping from predators, its vines sway behind itself to encourage predators to take a bite of a detachable vine. The predator runs off with a vine shortly thereafter, which tastes like a blackberry.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: When confronted with predators, its vines conceal its stinger and jabs at an opportunistic moment before running away. Certain honey gatherers are trained to drain its liquid venom from it for culinary purposes, as it tastes like blackberries.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: As it has difficulty flying, POKENAME uses its tendrils to climb trees quickly. It camouflages itself as leaves before finding a new place to rest.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME are almost never seen standing on their feet. Instead, they hop about on their tails, using their vines to steady themselves should they ever slip. It is rumored that a POKENAME's tail is one large vine that runs through their whole body.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME mostly remain motionless as they watch their surroundings. If they detect hostility, they can extend vines in any direction to restrain the threat. They are willing to wait as long as it takes for their opponent to calm down.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME lives on trees and sucks nutrients from the foliage. It can extend its vines several meters to lash out at enemies.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME are very cautious, always on the lookout for predators or poison in their food. Whenever they find a meal, they will inspect it thoroughly to ensure it is healthy to eat before wrapping it in vines and scurrying back to their dens.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: They are considered good luck by gardeners, as their presence converts crabgrass into flowers. They do this by converting the weeds into nutrients for other plants.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: An amorphous blob of vines, the gems around its neck are actually nuts. No one knows what it looks like under the vines.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: The mass of tentacles that encase POKENAME's body protect it from the cold. It uses a combination of its tusks and nose to guide itself.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME likes to use its vines to strangle opponents to the point of submission. Researchers can't get close enough to find out more about this Pokémon.
Author: darkdrophaxu

Entry: It usually goes in front of large crowds to try and perform. If they laugh at POKENAME, it'll hide in its hat and cry.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: Originally classified as just a regional variant of Tangrowth, recent breakthroughs in genome sequencing led to it being declared a distinct species.
Author: ansleehariot

Entry: Its vines twist and sway in different ways depending on the emotions of those around it. If it's near two people with conflicting emotions, its vines will become knotted and tangled.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: The terrifying head POKENAME carries is actually constructed from vines to intimidate foes. In battles, this Pokémon likes to suddenly pull the false head out from under its cloak and point it at the opponents, stunning them in fear.
Author: milchik

Entry: POKENAME is usually timid when alone, so it tends to hide in bushes or tall grass to avoid confrontations. Their vines can secrete a thin toxin whenever any stronger Pokémon approach them.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: No one knows what POKENAME's real body looks like, only glimpsing a single eye encased in darkness. Anyone who dares approach is mercilessly devoured by its carnivorous vines.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME has exceptional hearing due to the ears made of their sensitive vines. These vines can secrete a thin toxin whenever any stronger Pokémon approach them.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: The vines all along POKENAME's body are razor sharp. Since this includes the hilt, most warriors cannot wield it efficiently, forcing it to battle on its own.
Author: Patch

Entry: Nobody understands why POKENAME fixates on the vine that hangs off its ring. Attempt to snatch it, and it will go to great lengths to retrieve it.
Author: akujules

Entry: The tentacles around POKENAME's face ensure that anything it catches doesn't get away. These tentacles regenerate very quickly if they are cut off, preventing its face from being exposed.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: The tooth-like protrusions on the vines are actually thorns which absorb blood when piercing the skin of a victim. It must use its vines to hang from trees or the ceilings of caves to sleep.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: It shuffles around the forest floor looking for tasty bug Pokémon and tubers. To some, it is a delicacy when fried in a skillet.
Author: JaycieLantern

Entry: This fusion is adored as a delicacy when deep-fried and salted. Some add sour cream and spring onions to it to bring out more flavor.
Author: JaycieLantern

Entry: This fusion is adored as a delicacy when deep-fried and salted. People often remark its flavor as being similar to potatoes and onions.
Author: JaycieLantern

Entry: On occasion, the vines POKENAME keeps hidden within its hood will slip out, thrashing and reaching out wildly towards those nearby. POKENAME hastily covers them back up, seemingly embarrassed at this moment of exposure.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's vines are incredibly thick and are resistant to most regular weaponry. In combat, it will wrap its opponents in its vines and then squeeze them until they can no longer breathe.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The angrier it gets, the faster its vines whip around. A furious POKENAME might even break off its own vines in its rage.
Author: Andoman63

Entry: The hair on POKENAME's head are actually vines that are wet to the touch. Since POKENAME doesn't have arms, its vines always appear disheveled.
Author: Hellaluyeah

Entry: POKENAME hair has grown and so have its arms. With its hypnotizing powers and its boxing gloves, it has two ways to put its opponents to rest.
Author: Hellaluyeah

Entry: Its arms are covered with retractable vines, so POKENAME's reach is much longer than it would seem, letting it grapple opponents that wrongly assume they're a safe distance away.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME can unravel its body and thus grow in size. This increases the distance between its legs and allows it to cross large gaps with ease.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME has a hard shell used to protect its fragile vines, keeping them safe from tears and scratches. Its vines are highly sensitive and are used to feel through muddy waters.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME can shoot vines out of its mouth that are several meters long. This allows it to easily catch and restrain prey.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: With tendrils like floating seaweed, POKENAME evades capture with ease. Its orbs flicker with excitement, casting an eerie glow in the ocean's depths.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: They are slow-moving but surprisingly quiet and stealthy. Campers are surprised to see that POKENAME have snuck up on them and are rooting through their tents out of curiosity.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME has a hard shell used to protect its fragile vines, keeping them safe from tears and scratches. Its vines are highly sensitive and are used to feel through muddy waters.
Author: Katie

Entry: The vines POKENAME uses to sense the world are strong enough to serve as a source of propulsion, braiding together to form a powerful tail. Its preferred environment is muddy lakes and rivers with low visibility.
Author: Katie

Entry: Residing in dark, swampy regions, POKENAME whisks away hypnotized victims to its hovel, emerging again for new prey after many weeks have passed.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME is highly sought by upscale restaurants for high-class dining. The meat in its body combined with the texture and taste of its vines when cooked create a delectable, protein-rich meal worth a high price.
Author: sk372

Entry: The eggs in the group age at different rates, leaving the older ones to take care of the younger until they fully hatch and develop. Once all are fully grown, POKENAME exhibits marvelous unity in battle.
Author: sk372

Entry: This Pokémon tragically lost its mother due to poachers. It keeps a bone to fend off predators and to knock down Berries from trees.
Author: zic

Entry: Now grown up, it has become much more fearless in hopes to avenge its mother one day. Trainers must be aware of POKENAME's aggressive behavior.
Author: zic

Entry: Agile and spry, POKENAME live near cliff faces and bound up and down freely with their long and springy limbs. Young POKENAME play with one another near the base of the cliffs under the watchful eyes of adults.
Author: Katie

Entry: Agile and spry, POKENAME live near cliff faces and bound up and down freely with their long and springy limbs. Young POKENAME play with one another near the base of the cliffs under the watchful eyes of adults.
Author: Katie

Entry: It uses its long, sticky tongue to keep its child clean and to defend against threats. When danger is near, it swallows the child, keeping it safe inside a second stomach until the threat passes.
Author: amiel997

Entry: POKENAME are often seen giving their babies check-ups, which they seem to greatly enjoy. Because of this, POKENAME's babies tend to be healthier than those of unfused Kangaskhan.
Author: pinkyoshi2350

Entry: The child has grown up healthy and strong, and now fights by its mother's side. Their ferocity is matched only by their love for each other.
Author: Griddle

Entry: A young POKENAME does not have blades at birth, so the defenseless joey clings to its parent's back at all times. POKENAME uses the soft hum of its wingbeat to lull the child to sleep at night.
Author: sk372

Entry: Despite how dangerous it looks, the strong-yet-delicate grip of POKENAME's pincers makes it the safest place for the child to be held. Those who disturb the baby quickly learn it needs no pincers to be a fierce guardian.
Author: sk372

Entry: Their skin used to be hunted for the production of instruments, such as the banjo. Now they roam in protected pastures where their population can be monitored.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Part of POKENAME divided and became its young. The child can only transform its face at first, so the parent tutors it in the ways of shapeshifting until its mimicry can become perfect.
Author: sk372

Entry: In order to toughen up its progeny, POKENAME allows its child to play-fight with other young in the flock. If the roughhousing gets too extreme, parents may step in and brawl over whose child was at fault.
Author: sk372

Entry: Though POKENAME prefers to remain still, its curious child often hops out of the pouch to explore, forcing it to give chase. The young cries and pouts when POKENAME lifts it back into the pouch.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME finds the sunniest spot it can to hold its child aloft and let it absorb the sunlight for nutrients. Many artisans find the sight of it oddly majestic, and many a statue and figure have been made of the scene.
Author: sk372

Entry: A strange pair of letter-like creatures, POKENAME are never seen far apart from one another. The "child" seems to enjoy getting dirty and defacing walls with its body, much to the "parent's" chagrin.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME appears to be a conjoined parent and child, with the parent taking the brunt of violence from predators. Though unconfirmed, it's believed the child eventually falls off the parent in order to fully mature.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its child is hidden beneath the ridges surrounding its torso. If necessary to protect the child, it will burst all these pieces violently at foes, before retreating somewhere safe to let the protective shell regrow.
Author: sk372

Entry: The child is naturally curious, and the parent overly protective. If the child hides within, POKENAME is relatively calm, but if the baby curiously peeks outside, its parent may fire spikes at the slightest movement.
Author: sk372

Entry: It works in tandem with its young to search for sweet fruits and nectar in forests. Once they have found a good source of food, the child will be allowed to gorge itself first before the parent eats what is left.
Author: sk372

Entry: This Pokémon will aggressively protect its territory, especially when it has a joey. POKENAME can even scale vertical surfaces to defend its young.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: Use extreme caution if you encounter a joey by itself, as its mother will be nearby. A POKENAME mother will protect its young at all costs.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: It has a gentle disposition and prefers to avoid conflict, a demeanor it hopes to pass onto its young. If forced to fight however, it is utterly merciless for the sake of its children.
Author: sk372

Entry: With its extendable tongue, POKENAME catches insects and small fruits to share with the young it carries within its pouch. The joey is a curious sort and is often using its own tongue to lick and explore its surroundings.
Author: sk372

Entry: The young baby of a POKENAME is nurtured by the metal mother. Once the mother grows old, the baby will pilot it to protect the two of them.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME adopts lost or young Pokémon, bringing them back to its nest. A mild toxin from its tail wards off predators near its home.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME keep their young protected inside their sharp jaws. They can chomp through iron beams, but will protect the young with their life.
Author: 22ndsolstice

Entry: It is hesitant to share its mochi with others, as it did not have any siblings growing up. Pokémon who are gentle with it find that it is caring but shy.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is an extremely bad parent. No matter what happens to its child, it lays there lazily, only moving to scratch itself.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: As the baby lacks any poison points, it relies solely on the parent to protect it from harm, always staying close. The parent is overly aggressive in defense and will charge and attempt to poison almost anything that draws near.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's exceedingly aggressive protective instincts are thought to be linked to its high testosterone levels. It will even attack massive Pokémon like Nidoking at the slightest provocation, blinded to the risks by its parental fervor.
Author: sk372

Entry: A POKENAME separated from its baby will stir up a sandstorm in grief. Smaller creatures who become disoriented by these storms and stumble across a POKENAME's path find themselves not eaten, but adopted.
Author: Wormspawn

Entry: POKENAME swaddles its young by wrapping its ribbons around them. If they let you hold their baby, it is a sign they trust you completely.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: It has spent much of its time honing the strength of its fists and legs in order to fight or leap away to protect its young from harm. It can leap into the air and send even the heaviest flying Pokémon crashing to the ground with a single punch.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its young cannot fly, so it remains perched on the parent's head while it hunts. Due to its speed and maneuverability, POKENAME is always able to catch its child should it lose its grip and fall during flight.
Author: sk372

Entry: Not much is known about the creature that pilots the mechanical body of POKENAME, as any attempts to investigate will be met with force by the mech. However, the cries coming from the pilot lead people to believe this is an automated response.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Boundless energy mixed with parental instinct means POKENAME is always running from one domain to another to keep its child safe. The youngster is often a bit dizzy and disoriented from all the constant running around.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is an extremely overprotective parent, using its tails and brute strength to both protect its children and crush trespassers. It marks its den with burnt foliage, so stay away if you spot it.
Author: CpnQuacken

Entry: POKENAME hops from tree to tree with its joey clinging tightly to its spiked back. The baby squeals with joy as they bounce through the canopy.
Author: .izik

Entry: It has recently been discovered that the mechanical exterior of a POKENAME is designed to provide heat and light, leading scientists to believe that the armor was designed as a sort of incubator for the creature within.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME was created when a mother and child succumbed to the cold on a snowy mountain. It captures souls from travelers to feed to its child.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME has grown its body into a bassinet to protect its young. Some report to have seen its treelike body move quietly across fields at night.
Author: GasmaskBlacky

Entry: Its young develop from the mushrooms that grow on POKENAME's back. When the young reach maturity, they will fall off their mother.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME, its child, and the mushroom that grows on its back all live together in harmony. POKENAME and its child are sheltered from harsh weather and can defend themselves from foes using the mushroom's spores.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME hides its offspring within its thick fur. If startled, it emits a sudden Psybeam from its twitching antennae.
Author: .izik

Entry: Fiercely protective, POKENAME releases paralyzing powder clouds against those who threaten young Pokémon. Few dare approach its territory.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite POKENAME having a pouch, the little one enjoys the view from atop its parent's head. The two dance together whenever they hear music.
Author: Atlas333

Entry: It carries around its young in its mouth, as it prevents its young from getting dirty. It would behoove itself to let go on occasion to allow the child to explore on its own, yet this seldom occurs.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: The creature nestled between POKENAME's two heads is its child, which burrows comfortably in POKENAME's feathers as it stomps around at high speeds.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are caring parents, teaching their young how to avoid dangers by outrunning or intimidating aggressors. If they have to resort to fighting, POKENAME try to end fights as quickly as possible, using dirty tricks and brutal attacks.
Author: SonTyp

Entry: POKENAME uses Hypnosis to help its babies sleep. Motivated by motherly love, it stays up every night to protect them from predators or nightmares.
Author: noel5229

Entry: POKENAME uses the feelers on its head to detect vibrations in the water. This allows it to retreat from predators before it is caught.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME utilizes deep-sea currents to travel at surprising speeds. When in danger, it shoots powerful electric blasts from its trunk.
Author: akujules

Entry: POKENAME can emit both water and smoke from the many orifices covering its body. They are able to live in both water and air. Groups of many POKENAME are thought to be a sign of a nearby factory causing too much pollution.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME uses the feelers on its head to detect vibrations in the water. This allows it to retreat from predators before it is caught.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME is fairly weak, but it can move quickly in water by shooting a jet of liquid from its mouth.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME have long tails used to cling onto seaweed to avoid being swept away by ocean currents. POKENAME has a tail that can stretch five times the length of its body.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are extremely friendly Pokémon and will try to follow people they like home from their natural habitat. As a result, POKENAME are a part of many home aquariums.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are needy and demanding Pokémon, poking the glass of their home aquariums to get the attention of their owners. When upset, POKENAME will play dead, floating upside down until their owner notices.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME flutters over the surface of ponds and rivers, often in small groups. If it senses danger, it dives, using its wings as flippers.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME has five arms and five fins that circle around the center spout. When agitated, POKENAME releases a cloud of ink before skittering away.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME has five arms that latch onto the sea floor, spewing ink from its center spout to catch prey. When prey is caught in its ink, POKENAME uses its psychic power to put its prey to sleep.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are popular with fishermen, as they are considered lucky when caught early in the day. As a result, many fishermen consider it taboo to bring POKENAME into home aquariums.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are agile swimmers, using their long tail to ride along oceanic currents. POKENAME use their snout to siphon food into their mouths.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It ferries humans across the waters happily, defending them with ink shots from its mouth. POKENAME Trainers sometimes play games of tag this way, seeing which POKENAME can hit the other with ink first.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are curious and friendly Pokémon that enjoy following divers as they make their way down to the ocean depths. POKENAME have two antennae that emit a soft glow, helping the diver see.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME live deep underwater, spending most of their lives in darkness. POKENAME dislike light and will either shoot ink at or quickly flee from the source.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Easily startled, POKENAME unwittingly releases ink from its snout at the slightest provocation. It is recommended Trainers pack extra sets of clothes.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME are playful and energetic Pokémon. They enjoy climbing atop cliffs by the ocean, only to jump into the water. When they are done playing, they form clusters on the beach to nap.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME float around fields and meadows to play with different Pokémon in the area. When threatened, they spew out a blinding ink before scattering.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: At first, POKENAME was thought to be poisonous due to the liquid dripping from its spines. It's actually more ink so that POKENAME can deploy vast amounts around it to make underwater smokescreens.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME live on the rocky shores close to coral reefs, causing the coral reef to appear to extend onto land. POKENAME use their snouts to spit out ink when anyone gets too close.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME pick at the seafloor looking for scraps to eat. They are skittish, running away and hiding at the first sight of danger.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME blend into their surroundings to hide from predators. They use their ink to further help them blend in, as their horny spines glisten in the light.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME wander throughout the oceans protecting coral reefs from danger. Their long flippers help shield such coral reefs from oil and other toxic chemicals.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME gather baby aquatic Pokémon around them to form a nursery. POKENAME travel in schools and shoot out ink to ward off predators.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Its body can absorb and hold ocean water for weeks without leaking. When in a pinch POKENAME can shoot muddy bubbles at sonic speeds to deter predators.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: POKENAME wraps its head fin around sea grass to prevent being swept away by strong currents. Seeing two POKENAME with their fins intertwined is said to bring eternal happiness.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME are often kept as pets, as they are fiercely loyal and great with children. When POKENAME evolve, these traits only grow more prevalent.
Author: quackquackattack
