Entry: A prehistoric predator that lived in tropical areas. Due to their body weight, however, they are only able to fly short distances.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its scythe-shaped petals are frail like paper, but just like a sharp page from a new book, they can still cause a lot of pain. However, their main use is to rotate as a fan to spread poisonous spores.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME lives in tall groups of seaweed on the ocean floor, closely stalking any prey that swims by. When it spots a chance to attack, it aggressively lunges.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: POKENAME uses its strong lips to stick to trees. It sheds its hair as a decoy, tricking predators into grabbing it without causing harm.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME loves its hair more than anything. It only lets Trainers with particularly stylish hairstyles touch its own.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME sings a beautiful song as it spins around. Nobody has ever been able to precisely replicate the sounds it makes.
Author: Fenragon

Entry: This fusion becomes addicted to having a very strict routine, and they'll become violent at anything that attempts to break it. Some of them in the wild have been found to develop a sense of property, and even take care of other Pokémon as pets.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME enjoys dancing while eating food. It has a variety of dances that vary depending on the type of food it is holding.
Author: mbavenger64

Entry: A rare yet demanding little fusion. The few who attempt to train POKENAME are often put off by its entitlement.
Author: howlingstarr

Entry: Its flight and singing are a mesmerizing display. Yet, depending on whether you're its prey, it might be the last thing you ever witness.
Author: garret95

Entry: POKENAME are so eager about dancing that they are considered a nuisance.They will block paths and dance until they are satisfied.
Author: birchbot

Entry: POKENAME's mane is made up of silky hairs. It only trusts Trainers that can help it maintain its appearance.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: The parasitic POKENAME use illusions to lure in people and Pokémon, attaching themselves to their victims to drain their vitality.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME always try to stealthily snatch items from Trainers. However, after they secure their loot, they struggle to find use for things such as potions, devices, or money, which frustrates them to the point of having to steal something else.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: It aggressively dances as a warning when people or Pokémon approach its home. If they don't either leave or dance along in turn, it flies into a rage.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME twirls atop snow dunes, leaving delicate patterns in the frost. If approached, it unleashes a flurry of Powder Snow before fleeing into the distance.
Author: .izik

Entry: The thick fur covering POKENAME is colder than a commercial freezer. It sways rhythmically while singing a hauntingly beautiful tune that echoes through the tundra.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is said to make contracts with the denizens of the deep, manipulating other Pokémon to put themselves in danger so it doesn't have to fight them itself.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Many POKENAME are featured in Castelia City fashion shows, advertising high-end designer purses. If interrupted during a performance, it panics and hurls a Present into the crowd, with unpredictable results.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME loves the winter season. It struts into any situation with disturbing confidence and poise.
Author: thehatster

Entry: POKENAME spends its days repeatedly coating its plump lips with the lipstick secreted from its tail.
Author: scotsman

Entry: Even a single touch of POKENAME's lips can put anyone to sleep for hours. They always make good use of this quality to steal and feast upon the food of anyone passing by their caves.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: The ice shards that POKENAME blasts have a higher enthalpy of fusion than normal ice, though they're composed of the exact same water. Scientists are still confused, while bartenders use them for luxury cocktails.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME is a moody prima-donna of a Pokémon. Giving orders will only result in it turning up its head and flipping its hair, which flings ice crystals in the direction of whoever dares boss it around.
Author: sk372

Entry: If unmanaged, POKENAME's long fur tends to cause them to trip constantly. For wild POKENAME, it has become a hazard to their survival.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: It freezes the air with its sensitive hands. Though blind, it can clearly see any object it chills with its telepathy.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME speaks in an incomprehensible tongue that can drive listeners to madness. Its kiss brings a fitful sleep filled with surreal dreams as its unblinking eyes watch its prey.
Author: EmpathNaga

Entry: Glittering pollen called “diamond dust” spouts endlessly from its frigid blossom. When the sun shines on it in the early morning, POKENAME and its surroundings shimmer in a million hues.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME will use its powerful lips to attach itself to the side of ice caves while they sleep. It is said if you are ever kissed by one, you will slowly be drained of your body heat.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME performs bashful dances to attract mates. Its golden hair is often used as wigs.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Its skull is so thick, there's no room in the skin for the blood vessels that nourish healthy hair, so POKENAME is bald on top.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Its demeanor is unflinchingly bossy and cold, even towards its own Trainer. Deep down, however, it truly appreciates those who care for it.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: Seldom seen, POKENAME is believed to only show itself to couples who are falling out of love. It's sometimes referred to as the Prophet of Heartbreak.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME appears on particularly cold winter nights to lead lost wanderers astray and carry them off to the spirit world.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can create portals with the spirit flames that accompany it, allowing it to travel long distances in a short time.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME lives in castles, ruins, and abandoned houses. It controls other Pokémon in the vicinity, which serve POKENAME apathetically.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Urban legends say that if a POKENAME attempts to kiss you with its the lips on its head, you should allow it. Otherwise, it will devour your soul with the mouth on its stomach.
Author: themasterswordmaster

Entry: POKENAME glides across frozen lakes, singing a cheerful melody. However, if anyone dares to skate alongside it, it shatters the ice beneath them, refusing to share the rink.
Author: .izik

Entry: Living in high mountains, it appears deceptively soft and warm. Don't be fooled; what seems to be fluffy wool is actually sharp, rock-hard crystal.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME rule over small groups of Pawniard with an iron fist, never showing an ounce of warmth to its subjects. It cares deeply about its appearance and will get its Pawniard to tend to it after every battle.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME decorates its den with luxurious sculptures made out of ice crystals. If anyone trespasses on its territory, it will freeze them solid without a second thought.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Their natural rhythm and delicate singing voices make them a favorite Pokémon among musicians. When they are young, they often trip over their fur.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: The hair on POKENAME's head appears to have unusual protective properties that guard POKENAME from the effects of curses and spells from Pokémon such as Mismagius. If cut, the hair's properties quickly fade away.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It never runs away from difficult duels, like battling for its Trainer or fighting over territory. However, what POKENAME really enjoys is to terrorize smaller and weaker opponents, just to play around, before kissing and putting them to sleep.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: When it molts, its fur turns black and leathery. It weaves the shed fur into something resembling a purse, which it stores food and treasure in.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: It cheerfully dances for others, loving having an audience to its bouncy movements. Anyone who watches a performance all the way to the end is rewarded with a big kiss, whether they want it or not.
Author: sk372

Entry: It is bashful and self-conscious, but extremely affectionate. Shown genuine love and care, it will trust you to the grave.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: While affectionate, these Pokémon are incredibly shy and protective. When angry they will scream at opponents, but when they are happy they will whistle instead.
Author: Rockageddon

Entry: POKENAME's aggressive demeanor leads it to pick fights against stronger opponents. After the physically and emotionally painful defeat, it seeks to relieve its ego by kissing and defeating weaker Pokémon.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Though hideously vain, it is nonetheless popular for its beauty. Wealthy celebrities have been known to own them by the dozen.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME shivers excitedly when it stumbles upon a berry bush. Before eating each berry, it kisses it delicately, as if savoring the moment.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's body is so intensely cold that it rarely leaves its frozen cave. If an intruder enters, it greets them with a Lovely Kiss—right before devouring them whole.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is a dancer who perished during a snowstorm. Regrets intact, its spirit roams the snowy mountains and cries a song akin to human speech.
Author: tr3bles

Entry: POKENAME can project unusual frequencies from its ears that disorients friends and foes alike. Rarely, those who listen to it fall into a trance. Once alert, the victim only recalls hearing an unintelligible song.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME can emit ultrasounds that can make anyone fall into a trance for a few minutes of hearing them. Within a 1km radius, everyone will start to feel as if their bodies and thoughts slowly vanish into nothingness.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Its sticky goo isn't cold to the touch, but is so freezing that it's being explored as an alternative to refrigerate car engines and gaming GPUs. It regularly tends to cover its Trainer in gooey kisses and hugs.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME's reaction to any living creature it finds is to brutally overload it with hugs and kisses. The only distinction it makes between friend and foe is to check if they're still breathing.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Its skin dries out quickly, which is why it is constantly looking for water to moisturize itself. It also freezes some to apply it later as lotion.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can grow its ice spikes to a length of several meters to impale its opponents. It can use its detachable ice hat as a shield in a pinch.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The thick blonde hair growing from behind POKENAME's neck radiates an intense cold. It twirls gracefully in the snow, singing an unintelligible song that echoes through frozen valleys.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hone their claws by dancing during midnight. They somehow speak in a secretive language that only their Trainer can understand.
Author: HoundRyS

Entry: Because of their peculiar pigmentation, many Water-type Pokémon that they face thinks POKENAME is a Fire-type. This makes them act overconfident before realizing too late the truth about POKENAME's Ice/Grass typing.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Should POKENAME's headache intensify, the psychic surge around it compels all affected to begin dancing for several minutes. POKENAME always seems confused by this development.
Author: sk372

Entry: The jewel on its forehead gleams and shines as it dances. Should one stare too deeply at it, they will be caught in the rhythm, forced to copy the movements until POKENAME has finished its dance.
Author: sk372

Entry: To defend their territory, they perform a unique war dance that incorporates its cries. It is believed that it learned this from ancient cultures.
Author: houndrys.

Entry: The luscious, golden locks of a POKENAME are highly coveted. It can perfectly keep heat and cold balanced within them.
Author: T.I.A.

Entry: Champion-level wrestlers, POKENAME are popular with black belts and martial artists both as sparring partners and as a first choice for Pokémon battles. Their low body temperatures help them stay physically active by rapidly dissipating muscle heat.
Author: Katie

Entry: It seems this fusion has eroded Alakazam's intelligence to the point that it stares vapidly into its mirror-like spoon for hours on end.
Author: scotsman

Entry: It is a common ritual for POKENAME, after successfully catching a fish, to dance in celebration of securing a meal. On occasion, it may forget to actually eat the fish after the dance concludes.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's long blonde hair flows majestically in the air, even without wind. It uses its psychic abilities to make it billow dramatically, believing it enhances its beauty.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is capable of running over bodies of water by freezing the area underneath its feet. As a result of being unable to brake on ice, POKENAME will only run in straight lines.
Author: Rockageddon

Entry: POKENAME hums a soft tune while performing an elegant dance on the ice. If a sailor approaches, it stops abruptly and attempts to drag them beneath the freezing waters.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lounges elegantly on icebergs, humming loudly to lure passing sailors. If a ship comes too close, it fires Ice Shards to sink the vessel, ensuring its next meal.
Author: .izik

Entry: Being quite defensive, they are rarely seen out of their adamantine shell. However, they can be seen swiftly swimming in rhythmic patterns.
Author: houndrys.

Entry: Feared for its icy demeanor by sailors, it drifts away in cold waters. By speaking to its pearl, it can shoot and control hard, freezing spikes.
Author: houndrys.

Entry: It is often seen scuttling about in a rhythmic fashion, clicking its claws together to make the beat for its dance. Nearby Krabby that witness it feel compelled to join in the chorus.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME love to steal accessories on beachy areas. They use these as props to entertain other Pokémon.
Author: Lemmymaster#7521

Entry: It plugs its tail into outlets to charge its body with electricity. If it absorbs too much, it risks causing widespread blackouts.
Author: .izik

Entry: By rolling continuously, it builds up an immense electrical charge. Once it reaches its limit, it releases the energy in a powerful explosion.
Author: .izik

Entry: Herds of POKENAME will gather on mountainsides during thunderstorms. They compete to determine who will be allowed to get struck by lightning.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME moves across the regions searching for something. What it is searching for remains a mystery, but it is said that once it finds it, its electrical capabilities become highly advanced!
Author: skleegamer

Entry: A highly intelligent Pokémon with an even bigger ego. It can be seen tinkering with electronic devices for its mad plan to hypnotize other Pokémon into being its henchmen.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: They walk doing frenetic rhythmic movements that are very unnerving to see. Even the most skilled dancers have gotten injured trying to imitate them.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: An POKENAME's lightning can be as hot as a solar flare when excited. The lightning on POKENAME's body glows as much as ten torches.
Author: gento_

Entry: With fire in one hand and electricity in the other, POKENAME make formidable opponents indeed. Some Trainers say you can tell what kind of personality it has by which hand favors which element.
Author: sk372

Entry: Groups of POKENAME frenzy at the approach of a thunderstorm, all rushing to find a vantage point. It will even bite its own kin for a prime spot.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: If there's a blackout after a rainy day, there's a good chance that a group of POKENAME have eaten all of the electricity at the nearby power plant. They use the energy gained from the electricity to dance in celebration of the sun's return.
Author: darkweavile428

Entry: Due to its swift speed and ability to command lightning, any foe of POKENAME often finds itself unconscious before even knowing POKENAME was around. It has the ability to fire off high-voltage currents.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's two heads both battle if necessary. They use both Fire and Electric moves to counter many Pokémon.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: The front head breathes electricity, while the back head breathes fire. The two heads rarely agree on anything.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: It perches high up within areas where thunderstorms are common, using its beak as a lightning rod to recharge its internal electricity. Overzealous Trainers often mistake it for being a wild Zapdos.
Author: sk372

Entry: While galloping, it produces a buzzing noise that grows louder with its speed. It unleashes bolts of lightning from its antlers to ward off threats.
Author: .izik

Entry: They reshape the landscape in singleminded rampages toward nearby power plants. If not stopped before consuming a plant's electricity, POKENAME become roving cataclysms, discharging colossal lightning bolts into anyone too slow to flee the area.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: It is notoriously grumpy and shocks anyone who comes too close. Offering it a Poffin is the easiest way to calm it down.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has a massive constant charge within its body, allowing it to move at Mach 20. When cornered, it can produce a giant blast of energy.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: POKENAME live in groups around lightning rods to gain natural power. They link their jaws together to amplify their electrical power. A group of ten or more POKENAME can produce enough electricity to power a large city for a week.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It is said that if an POKENAME starts following you, you are doomed to be struck by lightning in the near future.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: They can use their feelers as cables to absorb electricity. POKENAME will often stand on rooftops and act like lightning rods during storms.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: Defiant and agile, POKENAME always waits for a worthy opponent. Its fighting style focuses on shocking certain body parts with high voltage.
Author: waflare(CEO of ferrosaco)

Entry: Its tails crackle with electricity whenever it breathes flames. It consumes dry grass to fuel the fiery energy in its belly.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME balance on their tail to appear more menacing. Both their fur and powerful voice can cause static shocks.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME chase storms to collect lightning inside their bodies. Once they've gained enough charge, they produce new storms wherever they travel.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: The fluff in its body generates electricity as it rubs together, creating powerful charges. It can fire bolts of lightning directly from its arms.
Author: .izik

Entry: As it leaps, its cape generates static electricity, releasing crackling sparks. When it lands, the impact echoes like thunder, intimidating its foes.
Author: .izik

Entry: It digs up buried power lines to gnaw on the wires, charging its body with electricity. This behavior makes it a frequent nuisance in urban areas.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can create tiny storm clouds on which it can rest in the sky. Troublemakers who disturb its sleep are punished with powerful lightning bolts.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can create tiny storm clouds on which it can rest in the sky. Troublemakers who disturb its sleep are punished with powerful lightning bolts.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The black, rubbery bands on POKENAME's body limit the amount of electricity it can release. Without these limiters, an POKENAME could cause town-wide blackouts.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: POKENAME has lightning-fast punches, but cannot easily hit opponents behind it. Enemies grab its sensitive tail to avoid getting pummeled.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: An electric company developed special punching bags which POKENAME can punch to generate electricity. They claim that with enough training, POKENAME could power a town with its energy.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: During storms it seeks out the highest peak or building and climbs it in order to be struck by lightning, on which it feeds. Afterwards it launches itself from the heights and rolls down to slopes below.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: It rotates its magnets while preparing an attack, building up a massive charge. A single shock from it is strong enough to incapacitate a crowd.
Author: .izik

Entry: Clusters of POKENAME were spotted disrupting power supplies at a plant near Hutber Port. The town's electricians now manage these incidents to avoid outages.
Author: .izik

Entry: While flightless, POKENAME can reach the top of any cliff or tree by creating a foothold made of ice. Its favorite strategy is to perch on the highest point it can find and snipe enemies with Tri-Attack.
Author: Rockageddon

Entry: POKENAME spews small flames to burn food to ashes before eating. Its horns burn at 1500 degrees, emitting pungent smoke that warns predators before igniting them.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Immense heat accumulates in its body. They tend to evolve easier after a forest they live in has burned.
Author: Markusknight

Entry: When two Magmar have their powers fused together, their flames and instincts grow wilder, especially in the heat of battle.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME tend to get angry at least 3 times a day. Officials request seasoned Trainers to catch any POKENAME they come across, as their short tempers often result in wildfires.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: They live in active volcanoes and use thermal updrafts to stay airborne for a long time. Very caring, POKENAME can be seen after volcanic eruptions, flying people and Pokémon away from danger.
Author: joeofthealps

Entry: Like a candle, its flame produces a pleasant aroma. Despite being a proficient swimmer, POKENAME stays away from water to avoid putting out its flame.
Author: sporkwizard

Entry: At night, POKENAME slips into bedrooms to heat up the room with its presence and make it difficult to sleep.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Coral branches from POKENAME are hard to obtain due to POKENAME having a hot body. Once obtained, they are used to make expensive jewelry.
Author: pokebio

Entry: For POKENAME, there is no difference between battle and dance. It sidesteps attacks with the greatest ease with one hand always open for a partner.
Author: Leshii

Entry: A shy but rebellious spirit by nature, POKENAME passionately dances when it's alone. It forms a mirage as it spins in battle, obscuring it from view.
Author: Leshii

Entry: A shy but rebellious spirit by nature, POKENAME passionately dances when it's alone. It forms a mirage as it spins in battle, obscuring it from view.
Author: Leshii

Entry: POKENAME dances about the battlefield with grace and style. With its fiery heart burning bright, it battles as though dancing with another.
Author: Leshii

Entry: POKENAME's body is coated in flammable oil that ignites to deter foes. Its bites can cause third-degree burns that nearly reach the bone.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is incredibly sensitive to the shifting of magma deep beneath the world's crust. They seek out locations where volcanic eruptions are likely to happen, earning them a reputation for imminent disaster.
Author: Katie

Entry: If the flames on its ears and tail seem low, Trainers should feed their POKENAME charcoal. It becomes sluggish when its flames are dim.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: The threads that POKENAME spins reach temperatures of several hundred degrees. This is why it builds its nests on stones or metal structures.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can climb walls and ceilings. Just before it spits fire, the fur above its eyes lights up. If you see this, get out of the area.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME latches onto foes with its enormous mouth before unleashing a brutal Flamethrower at point-blank range. The flames can get hot enough to melt steel.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can spread hot blasts of smoke from its dense, fluffy cloud wings. A flock of POKENAME can heat an entire village on a cold night, though care is needed to keep the flames from burning out of control.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME prefers not to use its fire attacks directly. Instead, it will use its immense strength to throw volcanic boulders at its opponents.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It sets its fur alight for protection. Being ablaze doesn't bother POKENAME in the least, nor any forest fires it accidentally starts.
Author: PokePower

Entry: While eating small sticks, POKENAME's ears radiate intense heat. This serves as a clear warning for others to keep their distance.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its body is made of burning igneous rock. POKENAME will spew molten rock at anyone it finds a threat, even though it can't shoot very far.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It gets its energy by immersing itself in lava, so it doesn't need to eat or drink. If you see a wild POKENAME galloping away from a volcano, it is a sure sign that the volcano is going to erupt soon.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME's competitive nature means all three heads try to one-up the other in fire prowess. Some have even observed the heads angrily breathing flames on each other when competition gets too heated.
Author: sk372

Entry: A sulfuric stench and honking laugh are signs of a nearby POKENAME. It feeds on flammable vapors, and may cause deadly explosions.
Author: robosoup

Entry: This shiny POKENAME has a more sickly-sweet odor, compared to its sulphuric counterparts. Certain chemical pollutants will lead to this color.
Author: robosoup

Entry: The rocks that make up its body are incapable of melting, even if submerged in magma. POKENAME tends to live deep below the surface, mostly under active volcanoes.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It crushes berries with its tight grip. It prefers berries that haven't ripened because they are more difficult to juice.
Author: .izik

Entry: A unique Exeggcute variant, fused with Pinsir. Those merged with Pinsir consume regular Exeggcute for energy; a mysterious symbiotic relationship.
Author: xyloldi

Entry: As a brood parasite, POKENAME invades hatcheries of Exeggcute species. It rarely survives to evolution in the wild due to its tendency to devour other members of its clutch.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: Portions of its shell fall off as it waits for evolution. These pieces are ground up for use in creating X Defense supplements.
Author: .izik

Entry: To protect its young, POKENAME places the child in the large, spiked pouch in its belly. The spikes look fierce, but actually are soft enough not to harm the baby POKENAME when it tries to squirm out.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME use their large pincers to break into breweries and smash open barrels. They are particularly fond of mead and other sweet drinks, which helps build up reserves for their evolution.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: These Pokémon aren't picky eaters; they will devour anything edible. Farmers hate POKENAME because they eat entire crops and carry away farm Pokémon.
Author: mrbapcik

Entry: It hides on beaches, trapping any unsuspecting foe it finds with its pincers. It rarely moves, as its shell is very heavy.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: They are known to bite onto barrels in mead breweries, tapping into the drink on the inside. They depressurize the barrel, which allows them to drink a bitter but nutritious liquid.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Mead brewers who encounter a POKENAME infestation will hire exterminators, as they are aggressive and hostile. They are known to jab holes into barrels to access the sweet liquid inside.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Many POKENAME will scout the land, searching for large prey. Once a POKENAME has spotted a suitable target to feed the whole nest, the entire group of POKENAME will run the Pokémon down, using their large mandibles to crush the foe into submission.
Author: firefist738

Entry: With POKENAME now in a larger form, it may choose to plant itself in more dangerous hunting grounds. Intentionally off-putting mimicry draws prey, large and small, in closer to investigate, where it then lunges with powerful, crushing jaws.
Author: Arcul

Entry: Its gaping mouth may seem ominous, but POKENAME is actually very polite. However, it is prone to tripping and ramming its horns through furniture.
Author: beespoon

Entry: POKENAME is known for burying its body in forests and emerging to pierce its victims as a painful trap. It feeds on smaller Bug-type Pokémon nightly.
Author: samu_games

Entry: Whether it aims to pinch or flip its opponent varies on a tactical basis. When two POKENAME fight, they will always choose opposite tactics.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: The pincer that protrudes through the head of POKENAME has caused it's vision to be reduced. It struggles to find food because of this.
Author: Toxicrown

Entry: POKENAME utilizes its progenitor's faux tears in tandem with its innate mimicry to lure curious prey in close. When the prey enters striking range, it uses powerful jaws to crush and tear.
Author: Arcul

Entry: It has the ability to climb all sorts of surfaces, even vertical ones, thanks to the microscopic hooks on its feet and the claws on its hands. It must rest somewhere flat, however, thanks to the large pair of pincers it carries.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME fully condensed into its shell upon fusion, which makes burrowing and hiding easier. It uses electromagnetism to regulate body temperature.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: Dark power surges from this small, near immobile Pokémon. The vortex is filled with the teeth of countless different Pinsir, endlessly spinning.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: The claw on POKENAME can crush anything it grabs with 5,000 pounds of pressure. It creates a border of decimated trees to outline its territory.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME would be an excellent tool for logging and demolition, if it wouldn't claim the limbs of all those attempting to wield it.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It attacks by charging pincers-first towards its targets. Its large mouth allows it to swallow most prey in a single bite.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME swallows its prey whole, incinerating them in its oven-like stomach. If buried in the ground, it is often mistaken for a volcano.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: Despite its fearsome appearance, it only feeds on rotting logs. Its ravenous appetite makes it an excellent decomposer.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: A violent Pokémon with a voracious appetite, POKENAME can easily handle three foes at once by clamping down on each of them between its two mouths and its set of horns.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME disguises itself as a handmade marionette of Mismagius. It will happily perform for delighted audiences, but will curse anyone who tries to look at its true form inside the puppet.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: Due to its eyes having become extra mouths, it is now blind. However, it is also agressively hungry, and will try and eat whatever it can grab.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: POKENAME obscure their faces to hide their jagged mouths. When they demask, they attack viciously with shear-like claws.
Author: .towerxvi

Entry: It roots around for spicy berries during colder seasons for warmth. The spice gives it a headache, however, which causes psychic power to surge and results in felled trees and branches.
Author: sk372

Entry: Everything it eats is absorbed by the Shellder on its tail. It latches onto riverbanks with its pincers and devours anything that floats past.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME grips trees with its powerful pincers and shakes them to knock down fruit. It then shares the fruit with other Pokémon in the area.
Author: noel5229

Entry: POKENAME grips trees with its powerful pincers and shakes them to knock down fruit. It then shares the fruit with other Pokémon in the area.
Author: noel5229

Entry: POKENAME are very aggressive and will headbutt anything that moves. However, their carapace isn't tough enough to resist the sheer amount of blunt force, so POKENAME is constantly covered in bruises.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: When angered, the five outer eggs rotate around the center, creating psychic energy that levitates POKENAME in the air and allows it to charge forward to headbutt the target of its ire.
Author: sk372

Entry: The tongue-like organs on its head let POKENAME touch objects to discern if they would be tasty or not. Non-tasty objects that get licked will be batted away with a swing of POKENAME's head.
Author: sk372

Entry: The fusion of Rhyhorn and Tauros has given it a massive horn to better charge at foes with. However, it often charges into things and gets itself stuck, the new horn lodged deep within the object it crashed into.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME designates its territory as no-conflict zones. Should it spy infighting from any people or Pokémon, it aggressively charges and ends the fight by knocking them out with its heavy egg and powerful Headbutt.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is an extremely aggressive and territorial fusion that often protect herds of Miltank. Unfortunately, they may become protective of domesticated Miltank and rampage against farmers; removing these POKENAME can be quite the ordeal.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: When POKENAME charges at its opponent, its coarse mane builds up static electricity. This Pokémon is commonly found in badlands.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME can't move any of its body parts, as it can only watch angrily. Beware, because when they finally evolve, they'll remember everything with a photographic memory and will look to destroy anything that angered them during this stage.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME is extremely temperamental and territorial, but far too lazy to actually attack anyone. It simply glares at interlopers from afar.
Author: gellyfishsh

Entry: POKENAME can't move any of its body parts, as it can only watch angrily. Beware, because when they finally evolve, they'll remember everything with a photographic memory and will look to destroy anything that angered them during this stage.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Escaping the range of its sting is nearly impossible. It will go after disrespectful opponents, stronger Pokémon taking advantage of the weak, weak ones allowing it to happen, beautiful and ugly creatures, and, most of all, the color red.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME will try to ram themselves into anything, even though their bodies are so light they don't do much damage. Their horns are still developing.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Both heads have the same size brain and the same urge to charge at intruders. It's not unheard of to see a POKENAME rapidly charging forward and backward as both heads struggle for control.
Author: sk372

Entry: It uses its three tails and its resilient skull to help it knock down and grab berries to consume. The berry juice its body creates has a strong bitter aroma and taste.
Author: sk372

Entry: Combative and stubborn, POKENAME patrol their large territories to make sure no rivals are making their home nearby. When they do encounter a rival, they use their massive horn and powerful club-like fists to battle for the territory.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME are capable of delivering devastating, ice-powered blows with their bludgeoning weapon. They are incredibly agile in battle.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME is a common sight in prairies. It flies low over the ground as it follows the Grass-type Pokémon it preys upon.
Author: .realthree

Entry: It is not a very fast Pokémon, but it is extremely defensive. It whips foes with its three tails and rams into them with its horns.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME is usually quite docile, but it will fiercely stand its ground if it thinks its young is in danger. Its horns are sharper during mating season.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Despite its body being docile, the mouth on POKENAME's head is always agitated and tries to gnaw anything in its path. POKENAME is often domesticated for its tough dark-brown hair.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Despite their reputation for aggression, POKENAME prefer eating berries and fruits. They roam in groups of 5-10 in the wild and are fiercely protective of their herd.
Author: Azalde

Entry: When sensing disaster approaching, POKENAME charges quickly into nearby towns and forcibly pushes and frightens people away from the endangered zone. Though well-meaning, the brute-force method of helping gives it a poor reputation.
Author: sk372

Entry: Though it is mostly content to feed on grass, POKENAME is partial to tree sap. Its serrated blade can saw through the trunks of even the thickest trees when it decides to enter a feeding frenzy.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: Herds of POKENAME can be found stampeding across open plains. They are often kept as pets for rodeo herding.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: Herds of POKENAME play by locking their horns in play fights. They have high stamina and can run for hours without rest.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: Enraged easily, POKENAME charges directly at the source of its ire. Once it makes contact, it uses its tails to relentlessly strike its target.
Author: bacondlx

Entry: POKENAME can release spores from openings on their horns. The angrier a POKENAME, the more noxious the spores. Their hooves and horns are tougher than iron.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME are very territorial and will viscously whip anyone who comes near. The whips can get quite hot and will leave nasty burn-like scars on the victim's body.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is considered one of the wildest of animals, rampaging violently and indiscriminately. POKENAME has even been observed thrashing and lashing out in its sleep, never stopping its perpetual raging.
Author: sk372

Entry: You can tell a POKENAME is angry by the pitch of its song. Its voice drops to a whisper when it is about to charge.
Author: MrPeach774

Entry: POKENAME is quick to anger and has no issue charging full force at anyone that irritates it. It will even grab its opponents to smash them into any hard surface it desires.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its charging tackle isn't very strong on its own, but the mushrooms on its back release spores on impact that weaken the muscles of its foe, leaving them more susceptible to follow-up headbutts.
Author: sk372

Entry: The garden atop POKENAME are made up of seeds from whatever they eat. The hump stores rainwater caught, keeping both POKENAME and their plants nourished.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME, when placed in a farm, has consistently taken the role of herding other cattle Pokémon. They are most happy when assisting others or working.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: In the wild, POKENAME have been found in herds of various Pokémon, even species that are more solitary. Many have even been spotted with various plant Pokémon growing in their head dish.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: It will aggressively charge at anything encroaching its territory. Its two heads may lock on to different targets to chase down, leading to sudden and erratic direction changes mid-charge.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are pitifully weak and worthless in battle, but they are valuable as fishing bait. An entire industry exists for breeding tens of thousands of them.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is pathetically weak in battle. However, it is valued as a food, and it is commonly served on top of sushi.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME is said to contain enough power to run a small household. Despite its use as a power source, it is unable to turn this energy into attacks.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Their bodies are too hard for most unevolved Pokémon to pierce through before POKENAME flops away. Unfortunately, nothing stops a swift Flying-type Pokémon from hauling it away to its nest in its thick talons.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME drift around at sea, as their fins are small and are easily washed away by currents. The fin on their head is often mistaken for a crown, and they spit out ink when in danger.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME wander throughout the ocean. Their fins are large, allowing them to change course as they please. They will eventually have a very large crown fin.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are kept in backyard ponds as pets. Their bright orange scales and their yellow horns and whiskers make them popular choices among fish enthusiasts.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Many Trainers struggle to keep POKENAME as pets due to their large size, as they prefer wide enclosures. As such, having a happy POKENAME is a sign of wealth.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME contains what appears to be a Magikarp in the center, controlling its actions. It's thought that POKENAME channels strange energy into it, ensuring a more powerful evolution in its future.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are a placid and weak species that tend to wander aimlessly across plains and farmland, grazing without thought or care. Touching its whiskers will send it into a thrashing rage.
Author: sk372

Entry: A legendary creature of the sea, restored to its ancient glory through fusion technology. Its power, however, is still weak and pathetic.
Author: Brienie

Entry: POKENAME are often mistaken for shiny Gyarados by fishermen. Encountering one is said to be a sign of both good and bad luck.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: This Pokémon is often sold by con artists under the guise that it is a rare red Gyarados. Its true identity can be revealed by its lack of teeth and its orange fins.
Author: astral_1447

Entry: POKENAME washes up in spam emails, old forums and riverbanks. Criminals use it to get sensitive information, which it hates but is too weak to fight.
Author: totodile.

Entry: Slithering across the ocean floor, POKENAME lack major fins or flippers to help them swim. Their mouths help them travel by biting onto other aquatic Pokémon, latching on and traveling great distances in search of food.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: This Pokémon has very weak musculature, but a very hardy body. It will violently flop around and thrash while out of water, but it will not be harmed.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: Often seen lazing around on the beach, POKENAME sleep for 12 hours a day. While awake, they dive into the ocean to help other aquatic Pokémon find food and shelter.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Experiments to fuse a Magikarp with the strongest lifeform were a success. However, it was still not enough to give Magikarp any noteworthy power.
Author: Brienie

Entry: Photographers pose POKENAME during certain holiday festivals due to their resemblance to other Pokémon. They are aloof and uninterested in photo shoots, and so are bribed with berries to focus on the camera.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is an extremely fast swimmer that can jump out of the water and glide many meters before diving back into the depths.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME are rotund and squishy, with two long antennae that conduct electricity. At night, POKENAME gather in large groups to produce a dazzling array of lights.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME's body is rotund and squishy, requiring electric whiskers for protection. Unfortunately, its electric power is so weak that an attacking predator would feel no more than a faint static tingle, leaving POKENAME effectively defenseless.
Author: sk372

Entry: Rotund and bipedal, POKENAME has a long tail with a fin at the end, used for both bouncing and swimming underwater. When scared, POKENAME raises its tail above its head to appear larger.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Found near lakes and ponds, POKENAME are aloof and sleepy, sleeping up to 18 hours a day. They get angry when anyone pulls their whiskers.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Its meat is inedible, and due to its rapid reproduction and adaptability to harsh conditions, POKENAME is an ecological threat. Its overpopulation of water bodies leads to severe eutrophication, making the environment uninhabitable for most Pokémon.
Author: amiel997

Entry: POKENAME enjoy lurking in the mud, as it helps keep their skin hydrated. The fins and whiskers can detect early signs of earthquakes through the vibrations in the mud.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME joyfully flops in muddy puddles after heavy storms. If disturbed during playtime, it retaliates with powerful jets of water from its mouth.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME have gifted minds, but wasted potentials. They waste their intellect smugly pondering meaningless, useless and senseless topics all day.
Author: Leeto64

Entry: POKENAME is commonly seen around tall waterfalls, using its claws to climb to the top. However, it always gets tired before it can reach its goal.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME's scales are so hot that if they stray from the water for too long, they'll lose their fish-like shape and become a molten puddle until returned to the water.
Author: glimmerowo.3024

Entry: This weak Pokémon has a remarkable sense of smell. It survives by digging into river mud and gathering smaller prey for sustenance.
Author: Metalocif

Entry: POKENAME gather around underwater hydrothermal vents, which provide a soothing warmth and a place to rest after searching for food. If the sea becomes polluted, the coral stalks become discolored, causing POKENAME pain.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are fast and precise swimmers, able to snatch a snack out of a sailor's hand high above the ocean's surface. Crowds of POKENAME often appear if food is scattered across the ocean surface.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are an aquatic Pokémon species that float in the world's many oceans. Its stomach can expand to hold three times its normal capacity in food.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is considered to be a weaker Pokémon, so it trains constantly to evolve. In the wild it is found swimming against the current to train its muscles.
Author: The Hero

Entry: POKENAME can perform incredibly high jumps from both water and land, hurling itself miles into the air. Unfortunately, the wind often carries it somewhere far from where it initially hopped, which will cause POKENAME to Splash around in frustration.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Its hair-like protrusion mimics a Magikarp, tricking opponents into thinking it's too weak to fight back. However, this often causes more problems for POKENAME than anything else.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The glass bulb on POKENAME's back usually has baby Magikarp residing in them. Legends say the water can grant eternal life as no one has ever seen a Magikarp die in the bulb.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: When POKENAME defends its territory, it can be seen flailing its arms about in an attempt to be intimidating. This attempt is usually unsuccessful.
Author: Brienie

Entry: This legendary warrior once inspired many aquatic combat styles, but is now too weak to fight. It spends its days training Magikarp on its back.
Author: squawkabairdy

Entry: A legendary and ancient blade, lost deep in the ocean. It is said whoever wields POKENAME will become weaker than ever before.
Author: Brienie

Entry: POKENAME wildly flops when someone tries to pick it up. However, it is so weak that it quickly gives in to being used by local fisherman to gut fish.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Aegislash yearn for battle instinctively. Some have used this trait and taken them to another battlefield, of spice and smell and delicious food.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: POKENAME are often employed at seafood restaurants, particularly those that serve Magikarp cuisine. Their skill with the blade means that every meal is perfectly cut and portioned.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME wishes to take up a blade in defense of the sea. Still, its youth hinders it from seeing real combat.
Author: NellNast42

Entry: POKENAME have been known to defend the ocean in times of peril. When they are not defending the ocean, they can be found constantly training.
Author: Brienie

Entry: Though weak in terms of power and speed, they are able to live in any body of water. They use their long whiskers to feel their surroundings.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME is a mischievous Pokémon said to steal keys. It is believed that the keys it carries have never successfully opened any lock.
Author: Brienie

Entry: POKENAME are remarkable swimmers with superb control over their various fins and flippers. Due to their elongated form, children enjoy surfing on their backs.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: They say with great power comes great responsibility; most Trainers think raising POKENAME is too much responsibility and give up before it evolves.
Author: kill_the_wabbit

Entry: It wanders through underwater ruins by night, carrying a crown that's said to have been the dorsal fin it had when it was still just a Magikarp.
Author: clawshdi

Entry: Its weak wings cannot maintain flight for long periods of time. A gentle breeze is enough to send POKENAME flying off course for miles.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: With its evolution, its wing power has increased. Now instead of being flung off for miles by the breeze, it is only yards.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: Found in the mud of drained lakebeds, POKENAME is considered one of the most pitiful Pokémon in terms of both strength and appearance. Even as food, they are considered bland and tacky at best.
Author: sk372

Entry: Though it has ferocious, aggressive tendencies, POKENAME's small teeth are incapable of piercing skin. Unable to properly hunt as a result, it bitterly resorts to being an undersea scavenger instead.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is a small Pokémon. It lives inside the mouth of Gyaralu to protect itself from enemies on the outside.
Author: jreposo

Entry: It is so weak that even clouds lift and carry it away. However, due to its many water predators, this is actually beneficial for POKENAME.
Author: jreposo

Entry: Shiny POKENAME offers a beautiful sight to those lucky enough to spot it between the clouds. Nevertheless, it is just as weak as regular POKENAME.
Author: jreposo

Entry: Due to its large size and tenacious grip, POKENAME are disliked by sailors, who have to pry POKENAME off their ships. Despite this, POKENAME continue to latch onto ships to move quickly across the sea.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME uses its large arms to bunker and protect itself from attacks, injecting venom into dangerous Pokémon. Their bright coloration serves as a reminder to predators to avoid POKENAME.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are said to be the most sought after fusions for fishing enthusiasts, as they can help store or provide a wide variety of equipment. POKENAME rest on shorelines and extend lures out into the water to catch prey and drain their life force.
Author: Raza

Entry: The diverse scale patterns of a Magikarp mixed with the temperament and trainability of a Rockruff make POKENAME a surprisingly popular show Pokémon.
Author: bee4082

Entry: POKENAME's gasping face is the subject of much ridicule. Though it seems uncomfortable out of the water, it will follow its Trainer anywhere.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME's gasping face is the subject of much ridicule. Though it seems uncomfortable out of the water, it will follow its Trainer anywhere.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME uses its garish colors to scare away predators. This often backfires, however, as those same lurid colors make them easy for prey to spot too.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: When it spots a loving couple on the shore, POKENAME leaps from the water and flops helplessly nearby. The reason for this behavior remains a mystery to marine biologists.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is commonly found at the bottom of wishing wells. Some think it believes the coins within contain "wish energy", and that it wants to use that energy to wish to evolve sooner.
Author: sk372

Entry: It will tug its whiskers during battle in order to enhance the normally weak psychic emanations it produces for its attacks. This leaves it with a splitting headache afterward, however.
Author: sk372

Entry: Despite being physically frail, POKENAME are remarkably aggressive and territorial. They will put on fierce displays, mock charging at Pokémon and Trainers alike to try and scare them off before a fight has a chance to happen.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME is naturally a slow swimmer due to its bulbous body, and its movements are limited to its small fins. They avoid predators by confusing them with the spiral on their bellies.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Strong and sturdy, sometimes POKENAME in an area will drag each other by the whiskers to assert dominance. POKENAME may drag another across lakes, and even oceans if particularly bulky.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It has weak swimming capabilities, and even the poison of its stingers is incredibly mild, useless for defense. POKENAME often ends up washed up on shore, staring pathetically at passersby.
Author: sk372

Entry: The bulb on POKENAME acts as a small nursery for aquatic Pokémon. The long golden tentacles guide these baby Pokémon to shelter in the bulb.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME clumsily drags itself around a muddy lake bottom, searching for shellfish to eat. With weak muscles and poor fine motor skills, it has been known to spend hours struggling to open a single clam.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: When at rest, it plays with the whiskers on its face for amusement. Based on reports of POKENAME trying to consume or pull off these whiskers, it's thought that POKENAME does not realize they are a part of its body.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME tends to roam about with a comical grace, its two heads arguing over which direction to swim or run. Despite its clumsy appearance, it can surprisingly launch itself high into the air, creating a splash wherever it goes.
Author: ThePandaSharky

Entry: It comes onto land to rest, as swimming for too long leaves its muscles weak and exhausted. Observers find its tired and pitiful panting on land rather endearing.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME often appear as sea buoys at a distance, as they travel in groups and are bright orange in appearance. Their long tails swim quickly out of the way before any collisions occur.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is found in factories near beaches or other bodies of water. They often float atop the water, as they cannot sink.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Its blobby, formless appearance is the result of being removed from the pressurized depths it calls home. Surprisingly, this has little effect on its overall well-being.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME latches onto Slowpoke tails like Shellder, though no evolution takes place. Instead, POKENAME uses its host as a way of migrating to a new body of water to reside in, as its own swimming capability is quite weak.
Author: sk372

Entry: Though overall weak, its claws have a strong gripping power. It often uses them to hitch a ride on larger Pokémon while they hunt, grabbing and eating whatever scraps remain afterward.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME can only move slowly through dense undergrowth. However, its barbs spread a strong venom, so hikers should be careful in the forest.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The horn on its head secretes an extremely weak toxin. It can be dangerous in large quantities, but usually it just causes a mild rash.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME only uses its legs to climb up trees, preferring to just roll around. The venom it produces is dangerous, but it does cause a paralyzing pain similar to a taser.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME wield Weedle as weaponry, flailing them around with little regard for their safety. Its thick carapace protects it's from the Weedle's sting.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The spike on its head holds an incredibly potent poison. As it gets closer to evolution, the poison becomes more deadly.
Author: .izik

Entry: Slow-moving and defended only by mildly toxic stingers, POKENAME live in dense kelp growths. They rely heavily on their drab camouflage and lack of sudden movements to avoid drawing attention from predators.
Author: Katie

Entry: Since the deep sea lacks leaves for it to eat, POKENAME has turned to a diet of seaweed and moss instead. If attacked, it has the option of either jabbing the assailant with its horn or using its fin to swim away.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: Still physically frail, it evolved extra stingers that secrete and coat the wings with a fine poison to deter predators who would hunt it. Wrapping itself in its wings akin to a cocoon is a typical defensive maneuver.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's scythes secrete the same poison found in its horn, used for self-defense. Though mild, it only takes a single light cut for the poison to take effect and result in strong bouts of nausea and dizziness.
Author: sk372

Entry: When POKENAME tries to act fierce, it only makes people laugh. If this clownish bug falls over, it has trouble getting back up.
Author: RoboSoup

Entry: POKENAME's noses are so sensitive that it can distinguish its favorite leaves by smell alone. However, each head prefers a different kind of leaf, which often causes conflict during mealtimes.
Author: sautomagically

Entry: The horns on its head and tail secrete a very mild poison. The poison's effects vary depending on its surroundings: burning, dehydration, paralysis, blindness, light sensitivity, chills, rashes and numbness have all been reported.
Author: sk372

Entry: The only part of its body that moves is its head, which will poke anyone who tries to grab it. Research suggests POKENAME can remember anyone who touched it by smell alone, even after it evolves.
Author: sautomagically

Entry: Although a single POKENAME sting will just cause swelling, multiple stings can be very dangerous. Trainers should avoid areas where they hear the characteristic buzzing sound made by its wings.
Author: sautomagically

Entry: Their keen eyes allow them to see where roots peek above the ground's surface, allowing them to pluck the nutrients from their home. One root may last POKENAME a week, so they are at risk of being overfed.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: They are known to challenge each other to duels, wrestling with their tails to avoid the challenger's stinger. This strengthens their tails for when they must fight over a limited number of berries, giving them an advantage over other Pokémon.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: They forage for food at night, hopping between berry bushes to shake them down. When the sun rises, POKENAME fly off the ground to rest in the trees above the forest.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: The fluid in POKENAME's body allows its String Shot to be used for communication over long distances. Unfortunately, it often runs out of string before it can escape from a chasing Pokémon.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: It holds a Charti Berry whenever it wants to fly in the sky, as it takes little effort to knock it down from the sky. It lives deep in the forest to avoid the risk of any rocks flung around.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Electric power is stored and concentrated within its stingers. As a show of intimidation towards predators, it taps the two stingers together, causing sparks to fly out around it.
Author: sk372

Entry: Each morning, POKENAME hums a gentle tune to itself. If disturbed while singing, it retaliates with a swift Poison Sting.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's wool is very some of the softest in the world. POKENAME forms colonies that scout for Berries together.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME has a strong sense of smell, able to sniff out its preferred food from many yards away. POKENAME fights for food and territory by battling one another using the stinger on its tail.
Author: sk372

Entry: The bud on its back constantly produces a paralyzing poison that POKENAME uses to hunt. It can also transmit the poison to the horn on its head.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME uses its psychic horn to sense danger while foraging for leaves. It is afraid of other Pokémon and often cries when around them.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME is incredibly frail, and it will hide in rock piles to avoid predators. Despite having a venomous sting, it barely has any effect on Pokémon larger than it.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is a very timid and shy creature. It rarely attacks humans, but if threatened, it will use its horn and tail-spike to inject a searing pain, so caution is adviced.
Author: Krune

Entry: It slinks from tree to tree, eating leaves and bird eggs. Although its horn and tail both contain poison, its sting is more irritating than actually harmful.
Author: sautomagically

Entry: Despite their size, POKENAME are incredibly persistent combatants, and may even bite their opponents.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: Although its body is large, its mouth is only big enough to eat bird eggs and leaves. As a result, it must eat massive amounts of food each day to maintain its size, making it a devastating invasive species.
Author: sautomagically

Entry: POKENAME lines the nests of other Pokémon with soft silk to help protect their Eggs. Its string is both durable and surprisingly warm.
Author: .izik

Entry: It is able to attack from a distance using the sharp stinger on its long tail. The potent venom it produces is so powerful that it can cause full-body paralysis within minutes.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It's been said that a sting from one of POKENAME's tendrils feels like getting struck by lighting. Those with a fear of bugs despise this Pokémon.
Author: 8xviktor

Entry: POKENAME smashes herbs into paste using its tail before eating them. Its red nose detects spoilage and helps it avoid rotting plants.
Author: .izik

Entry: The bud on its back constantly produces a paralyzing poison that POKENAME uses to hunt. It can also transmit the poison to the horn on its head.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The barbs on POKENAME's body are actually ingrown teeth from its monstrous head. These teeth inject poison on contact, but only full bites deliver a dangerous dose.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: A POKENAME's legs are soft and squishy, despite its slimy look. The large horn on POKENAME's head is used to swipe branches away.
Author: hatsune_miko

Entry: POKENAME has built onto Cateredge's evolutionary strategy by adding silk spikes to make its flail a greater deterrent.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: When defending itself from predators, it jabs its spiked ribbons into them, filling them with a numbing poison.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME ensnares foes with silk before striking with a surprise Shadow Ball. Its attacks are eerily silent until the moment of impact.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its sticky string like a whip to execute complex martial arts moves. It can swing, trip, and strike with startling precision.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has powerful jaws that it uses to trap prey that are careless enough to wander within striking range of its burrows. Trainers travelling through areas known to be home to POKENAME are advised to make liberal use of Repel.
Author: Katie

Entry: The pointed cogs adorning POKENAME's body are composed entirely of silk, but are capable of hardening to a toughness resembling steel.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME disguises itself as a child and plays alone in quiet parks. Once isolated, it traps a target in string and drags them into the forest.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME crawls slowly along tree branches and commonly uses its horned-tail to carve small notches in the bark. Its body gives off faint warmth, which deters smaller predators from approaching.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME binds clusters of seeds together using sticky string. It devours them all at once, often leaving nothing behind.
Author: .izik

Entry: At first glance, a POKENAME's fluff looks soft and harmless. However, touching it will result in your hand being covered in a sticky, rubbery glue that can stick your fingers together for up to a week if untreated.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME flies in eerie nighttime swarms. Together, they strike with a flurry of Poison Stings to weaken prey for easy capture.
Author: .izik

Entry: Every POKENAME carries a totem of the Kakuna it never got to evolve into while it was alive. Even if it evolves now, it will not look the same as the totem it carries.
Author: crumple_2

Entry: It stores static electricity in its stinger until it's ready to make a surprise strike on an unsuspecting victim. The jolt is still incredibly minor and rarely regarded as anything more than a momentary nuisance.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME use their sense of smell to find aromatic berries to pluck off trees, eating as much as twice their body weight in a day. They require plenty of food, as their bodies break down nutrients quickly.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Before attacking, the horn on POKENAME's head glows red-hot. It charges and strikes with fiery precision.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lies flat on meadow grass, perfectly still like a trap. When prey draws near, it lunges forward with a sudden Bug Bite.
Author: .izik

Entry: Acidic mucus drips from POKENAME's nose and melts through bark. It uses this method to reach and consume fresh tree sap.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is a worryingly common fusion that is undesirable to farmers. It will plant itself in crop fields, eating and sucking out all the nutrients and minerals in the soil until it is unsuitable for growing any sort of plant inside of it.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME performs a lively samba in fields of daisies during summer. It only pauses to nibble on nearby flower petals and sleep.
Author: .izik

Entry: After eating a Pomeg Berry, POKENAME dances a rapid jig atop trees. Its beak bobs with each joyful step.
Author: .izik

Entry: By beaches, POKENAME twirls in a graceful dance, swaying its arms rhythmically. It releases soft powder from the feathers on its waist as it moves.
Author: .izik

Entry: As winter nears, POKENAME dances quietly with the chill wind. Its large red nose sniffs out hidden berries buried beneath the snow.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME floats silently over marshes at night, spitting out nearly invisible string. Prey often becomes ensnared before realizing it's being hunted.
Author: .izik

Entry: Wild POKENAME can be found in forests, eating the branches off of other trees.
Author: grassy311

Entry: From the ocean floor, POKENAME launches silk threads at passing boats. If it hits, it tries to drag them under the waves.
Author: .izik

Entry: The mushrooms are no longer deadly to the host, but are now quite poisonous if consumed. This seems to have had the interesting side-effect of making POKENAME no longer able to secrete poison from its horn.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's hair holds enough poison to kill three Trainers. If you've come in contact with it, you must contact your local hospital immediately.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME's shaggy fur and powder-covered body irritates its nose, causing it to sneeze and release its powder in bursts. Some Trainers find it very endearing and adorable, but will suffer the consequences when they observe up close.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME protects itself from predators by burying itself under the ground and leaving the spike atop its head exposed.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME will often be distracted by simple things, making it a Pokémon only really suitable as a house pet. Sometimes, it will make a ball out of its own String Shot and play with it like any domestic cat Pokémon.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME uses its venomous tail to sting unsuspecting travelers. It then steals their jewelry, adding the treasures to its silk-lined nest.
Author: .izik

Entry: When laid flat, its segmented body can skitter surprisingly fast. Anyone struck with the stinger on its tail is instantly immobilized and their wound cauterized.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME roll as they bob along the surface of the water, mainly using their tails to propel themselves as opposed to their tiny arms. The bubbles they create with their horns shine brightly and colorfully to warn predators of the toxins within.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Due to its strong sense of smell, sneaking up on POKENAME before it teleports away is near impossible. It is docile enough to be lured close with its favorite type of leaf, however.
Author: sk372

Entry: Working together to form colonies in the forest, POKENAME are highly social and co-operative. When threatened by flying Pokémon, most of the colony defends their home while a small group tries to draw the threat away.
Author: Katie

Entry: The marks on its leaves were thought to be signs of illness, until research found that POKENAME occasionally nibbles its own leaves. This seems to cause no harm, and its leaves grow back if fully consumed.
Author: sk372

Entry: Because its feet are too short to reach the ground, POKENAME must learn new ways to ambulate after fusion.
Author: pokebio

Entry: POKENAME will swallow anything that can fit in its mouth. If it doesn't eat its own body weight in food daily, it flies into a fury and thrashes until exhausted.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME hunts small fish with a combination of stealth and ferocity. It blinds prey with ink while hiding among kelp, before swimming quickly and snatching it up with its vicious bite.
Author: sk372

Entry: The poison POKENAME creates induces intense aggression, mania, and hallucinations. As a result, it is considered too dangerous to consume even by the most hostile and famished Pokémon.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Despite being rather aggressive by nature, POKENAME have very delicate and frail bodies. If they are angered enough, they will create a huge current of water to knock away the aggressor.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Socialite Trainers enjoy looking after POKENAME in specially constructed reserves. POKENAME are rather territorial and need room to swim, so it is rare to see more than two share a pond.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Children often mistake POKENAME for masks at the beach due to their fins and shape. When picked up, POKENAME closes its eyes and spins rapidly, hoping to be let go.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It has a ferocious and vindictive attitude towards all it comes across, but aside from a nasty bite, it is largely unremarkable and ineffective. It tends to act more passively in the presence of Magikarp.
Author: sk372

Entry: If two POKENAME meet, they will fight to the death, no matter what. It's thought that their aggressive and independent instincts are so great that POKENAME actively seek to be the last, and only, of their kind.
Author: sk372

Entry: Old sailors' tales speak of a ferocious Pokémon able to cleave through the bow of a vessel with just a lash of its tail, its fangs large enough to rend a dozen sailors in a single bite. This Pokémon is believed to be a juvenile POKENAME.
Author: kingd8

Entry: Though its size may be huge, these giants are found near rivers and lakes where they guard sections and demand tolls to pass. Once the toll is paid they expand the foam around their neck to create a platform for others to climb on and ride across.
Author: DoxtorDaemon

Entry: When POKENAME are angered, their bulbs grow brighter due to releasing more electricity. The central bulb acts as a focus for the other two, helping to aim and direct the electricity as they charge.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: This Pokémon stalks rivers and lakes at night, lying in wait for prey. POKENAME attacks make up a large percent of all Pokémon attacks in Kanto.
Author: CapWolfBane

Entry: POKENAME are territorial, scaring off other Pokémon using their sharp barbs and spiky bodies. The sharp barbs release a poison that numbs opposing Pokémon, allowing POKENAME to push them out of its territory.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are fast and vicious, hunting for prey by barreling through the sea and biting with their sharp teeth. Despite this, POKENAME often avoid sinking ships and beaches, preferring isolated targets.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Many a tale has been passed down amongst sailors about POKENAME. Should a ship run afoul of it, it will chase it down across entire oceans, not resting until it sends the boat sinking to the briny deep.
Author: sk372

Entry: Many have claimed the secret to taming a POKENAME is to climb on its back and pull its whiskers like reins. Pokémon Centers and hospitals regularly put out PSAs to discourage this idea.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME leaps from high seaside cliffs to glide in search of prey. Its large body, strong pincers, and sheer brutality make for a menacing predator.
Author: wigglypon

Entry: It uses its strong tail to swim up rivers and waterfalls. It will smash any man-made object it encounters; boats, bridges, and even concrete dams.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: An adept glider, POKENAME will skim just above the water's surface, viciously snatching and squeezing any unsuspecting prey with its strong tail.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: If the weather is not cold enough for POKENAME's liking, it will go on a rampage, destroying everything in its path. To prevent this, people will often guide POKENAME to snowy mountains as spring draws near.
Author: darkweavile428

Entry: It digs complex underwater tunnels, creating an elaborate network. Prey dragged into these tunnels are never seen again, lost in the depths forever.
Author: amiel997

Entry: An old children's book tells the story of a POKENAME who was the brave leader of an underwater city. It cares deeply about protecting its environment.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME's true form is actually the small fish in the center of the body. Its arms and tail are constructs that it controls telekinetically.
Author: pastamanjase

Entry: Its fierce fangs contain poison which can kill a human but a Pokémon may survive. Its huge tail is strong enough to launch Pokémon into the sky.
Author: .afantastictrainer

Entry: POKENAME will never attack Pokémon it considers weaker than it. However, if its anger reaches a critical point, it will violently attack anything within its line of sight until nothing remains.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Only fools have enough courage to disturb a sleeping POKENAME. Once awakened, this Pokémon goes on a rampage.
Author: milchik

Entry: POKENAME is said to be possessed by the vengeful soul of a Gyarados, once slain by the very blade that now forms its body. Only those with unshakable will can grasp its hilt without being consumed by its seething rage.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: POKENAME is said to be possessed by the vengeful soul of a Gyarados, once slain by the very blade that now forms its body. Only those with unshakable will can grasp its hilt without being consumed by its seething rage.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: POKENAME can destroy entire cities with a single swing. Many of the deadliest warmongers in ancient myth are depicted wielding it, but whether they controlled it or it controlled them remains unknown.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: POKENAME can destroy entire cities with a single swing. Many of the deadliest warmongers in ancient myth are depicted wielding it, but whether they controlled it or it controlled them remains unknown.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: POKENAME dreams of one day becoming like the heroes who protect the weak. Now, though, it fishes out Water-type Pokémon in hopes of a big catch.
Author: NellNast42

Entry: Despite its cruelty in combat using its water cannon arm, POKENAME has been found to live by a code of honor, leading it to defend weaker Pokémon.
Author: Phantom640

Entry: Legends say the first POKENAME came from a Magiveon that swam up a mighty waterfall by only splashing.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME has a volatile temper, especially when protecting its young, and rampages with the strength of the most devastating natural disasters. Emergency response rangers are stationed near known nesting sites with well-trained teams.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME has a volatile temper, especially when protecting its young, and rampages with the strength of the most devastating natural disasters. Emergency response rangers are stationed near known nesting sites with well-trained teams.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME has a volatile temper, especially when protecting its young, and rampages with the strength of the most devastating natural disasters. Emergency response rangers are stationed near known nesting sites with well-trained teams.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME has a volatile temper, especially when protecting its young, and rampages with the strength of the most devastating natural disasters. Emergency response rangers are stationed near known nesting sites with well-trained teams.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME has a volatile temper, especially when protecting its young, and rampages with the strength of the most devastating natural disasters. Emergency response rangers are stationed near known nesting sites with well-trained teams.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: Devastatingly cruel, POKENAME wraps its electrified feelers around ensnared victims and torments them with jolts of electricity for days on end.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: A Mimikyu disguising itself as a Gyarados. But to go one step further, it has made itself an inflatable Trainer, as an attempt to blend into society.
Author: funkytomate

Entry: It has a most vicious, destructive nature towards anything that catches its ire, even slightly. With its speed and strength, it has torn entire ships to shreds in seconds.
Author: sk372

Entry: It barely moves, mostly floating wherever the clouds carry it. It feeds on Pokémon that enter its mouth attempting to prey on the Magilu living there.
Author: jreposo

Entry: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it's bad at getting food. It teams up with a Magilu to catch prey.
Author: jreposo

Entry: POKENAME are a sedentary but hostile species of Pokémon, as they use their tentacles to jab at prey, injecting venom into them. Their camouflage allows prey to move closer without noticing POKENAME.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME deceives fishermen by mimicking a helpless catch before yanking them into the depths. Its jagged teeth shimmer just beneath the surface.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's small stature does nothing to curb its violent and aggressive tendencies. It's given a wide berth due to superstition that those bitten by POKENAME will lose the ability to feel love, replaced with rage.
Author: sk372
