Entry: Its fluffy fur is a symbol of wealth and prosperity. POKENAME can shoot water that ranges from scalding hot to pleasingly warm at all different kinds of pressures from its cannons. Through its mouth, it breathes fire.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It lingers near graves, waiting for loved ones to leave candles for the departed. Once they leave, it silently absorbs the flame from the candle.
Author: .izik

Entry: Said to have been created as a cheap virus protection, POKENAME can travel in and out of devices and feed on corrupted computer code. Millions of POKENAME live in a computer at a time.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The number of eyes on its faces fluctuates based on its mood. The more aggravated it grows, the more eyes per side, up to sixteen at once.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME downloads cheats and buffs online to boost its boxing skills. Afterwards, it throws out attacks and shows no mercy to its opponents.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: It spews corrupted code via memory leaks from its digital body. In the physical world, it is believed that POKENAME's emissions manifest as a form of radiation, which can cause severe sickness.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: Due to its pointy shape and coloring, POKENAME is often mistaken for an eraser. However, it can't erase anything at all, especially at the blue end.
Author: pokebio

Entry: POKENAME frequently forgets it can swim through cyberspace, appearing as a simple animation flopping helplessly on people's desktops. It only remembers its abilities after hours of struggling.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are rare Pokémon found within Cyberspace. They enjoy surfing the web.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: This Pokémon appears to have encountered a fatal error. It may need to restart and try again.
Author: fixthewifi

Entry: POKENAME is programmed to eradicate any viruses it can find. If it goes hungry for too long, it'll start eating normal applications to satisfy its hunger.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: One theory suggests that POKENAME zipping through cyberspace is the origin of all mysterious coding failures.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME hide in fountains at public parks, waiting for unsuspecting writers to set up their electronics nearby. The moment it sees one typing, it leaps out and bites onto the device, instantly absorbing all of its data.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME nibbles on server room cables using the fangs on the underside of its body. If it accidentally bites into a live wire, it pulses with a deep blue glow as electricity surges through it.
Author: .izik

Entry: Usually, a POKENAME takes this appearance after it stumbles upon funny images of Wooper while traveling through the internet.
Author: nasho1908

Entry: The actual origins of this Pokémon are unknown. The most commonly held belief is that it is the result of an experiment to create an artificial soul.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME serves as a language to help run scripts in the cyberworld. Researchers and programmers use it to run simulations.
Author: zic

Entry: POKENAME crop up within social media websites seemingly at random, interjected within unrelated conversation. Those who spot it usually report feeling a sense of loss.
Author: sk372

Entry: It distracts foes by twisting its entire body around. A skilled POKENAME can unscramble itself in just 3 seconds.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: Its code is fully fortified and encrypted. It is studied by programmers, who know it as a "digital strongbox".
Author: Napstabl0ok

Entry: This Pokémon is carrying a whole portal made out of obsidian glass on its back. Some rumors say that it leads directly to the spirit world.
Author: zerocipher

Entry: It is said that POKENAME carries a portal to the underworld on its back. However, no research has been conducted due to its high body temperature.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: It obsessively analyzes any striped pattern it comes across. It seems to value certain patterns more than others.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME was created as an attempt to compete with electronic messaging on the internet through its own cyber delivery system.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: POKENAME only eats apples, swallowing them whole and searching for the next one. It has been seen trying to eat Pokémon like Slurpie when they are asleep.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: A Porygon in the process of evolving into Porygon2. It is not yet complete though, and will have strange quirks if used in this state.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: This Pokémon was caught in the middle of a software update. As such, it is in an unstable state. Waiting for the update to complete may fix this.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: This fusion between two different Porygon versions resembles what can be seen during evolution. It behaves as if it suddenly became stronger, though it isn't sure how to use its newfound strength.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME's works are derived from an artistry software from long ago. The pieces it can produce are interactive to an extent.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: This fusion caused its code to become stable and error-free. However, it has lost all emotion and most capabilities it learned when it was a Porygon2.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: POKENAME can create a mini black hole by building a gravitational singularity out of anything, even a grain of sand or just thin air. The strange and inexplicable part is that the event horizon of the resulting black hole has a polygonal shape.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: It can understand and speak various languages. It is one of many Pokémon that are capable of this.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: The screen on its face changes based on its feelings. It can be quite foolish at times, even though it has a high estimation of its own intelligence.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: Because it was created by code, POKENAME's head is the most perfectly rectangular object to ever exist. Scientists are rushing to study this Pokémon.
Author: robosoup

Entry: A POKENAME with this appearance is unusually aggressive. It will attempt to smash its way into towns using its large face.
Author: robosoup

Entry: Drawn to the hum of electric currents, it playfully pounces on moving objects. Its touch scrambles code and shorts out machines, but it seems to enjoy the flickering lights and sparks, blissfully unaware of the chaos it leaves behind.
Author: vhscopyofmeangirls

Entry: In an effort to copy and paste a digital Honedge in an experimental PC, the original instead corrupted into a new, uncanny Pokémon: a POKENAME.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: As a result of a long download, its code enabled its ability to fly. However, it also inherited an unruly rage from excess code.
Author: TheCrowArtiste

Entry: POKENAME is an artificial Pokémon that was created in Kalos to test the idea that any Pokémon could be replicated through computer code.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: Having successfully evolved, POKENAME are fully stable in balancing their physical and digital natures. This makes them very versatile and powerful companions.
Author: iolitetigerdragon

Entry: POKENAME constantly insists on helping its Trainer use certain computer programs. Despite this, POKENAME rarely has any helpful advice to give.
Author: GP423

Entry: POKENAME can be found in large server rooms, feeding on any excess data or code. If it consumes too much data, its wings will start to release large amounts of heat.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME are rather unstable as they exist in both physical and digital states. Their nature makes evolution a risky process for them, so caution and care are advised.
Author: iolitetigerdragon

Entry: POKENAME emits and receives electronic signals through its front teeth, detecting nearby devices. It latches onto the bottom of freighters with its arms to infiltrate their onboard computer systems and consume data.
Author: .izik

Entry: The emotion-recognition software that POKENAME uses is too basic to be useful, so it's often getting into misunderstandings.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME enjoys singing for others, but its cries are reduced to simple beeps and chirps. Some folks appreciate this music for its nostalgic quality.
Author: robosoup

Entry: A Pokémon possessing simple computer programming fused with a dull-colored Feebas resulted in POKENAME. It has the ability to go undetected from software as it swims across the net to gather data for researchers. It is generally unreliable in battle.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Coded to be harder than iron, POKENAME utilizes its crest mainly to headbutt. The crest on its head is heavy and renders it unable to fly.
Author: TheCrowArtiste

Entry: It hides away in the hard drives of computers. Within its polygonal exterior, new lines of code prepare it to fly.
Author: TheCrowArtiste

Entry: The first version of this artificial Pokémon was designed with various updates and a greater emphasis on Porygon data as its core system. As a result, it has far higher fidelity but is very uncanny and not quite able to imitate a Zorua organically.
Author: El Fail

Entry: Early studies indicate that POKENAME could survive and move around in the vacuum of space. However, as the long-term effects that it could have on them has yet to be properly evaluated, POKENAME has not yet been into the cosmos.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME clamps its jaws around discarded computer equipment, absorbing data directly through its teeth. Once it has consumed enough, it scuttles away while emitting a series of cheerful beeps.
Author: .izik

Entry: The body and mind of POKENAME are two separate entities. The mind exists somewhere in cyberspace, while the body exists in the real world. Each part sends trillions of commands a millisecond to ensure that POKENAME can react and function properly.
Author: Phantom640

Entry: POKENAME's behavior seems to mirror that of an “NPC” in an old video game. It walks in a specific pattern and won't stop unless interacted with.
Author: 8xviktor

Entry: This variant of POKENAME enjoys resting in damp, dark spots like trash bins. Its cries have been described as sounding like incoherent rambling.
Author: 8xviktor

Entry: POKENAME searches through dumpsters outside cell phone companies, hoping to find discarded devices. When it does, it devours them eagerly, feeding on the stored data inside.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can enter cyberspace and travel through ethernet cables as if they were flowing streams. It actively hunts and consumes viruses, acting as a natural cybersecurity measure.
Author: .izik

Entry: Traveling at supercavitation speed underwater, POKENAME sometimes jumps out and reaches high altitudes before falling again. Since it can't be detected by radar due to its shape, it becomes a hazard to planes traveling across the sea.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME resembles an old game found in arcades. It's favored by certain Trainers for the nostalgia it brings.
Author: pokebio

Entry: POKENAME feeds on image files within computer systems after slipping into cyberspace. Once it has absorbed enough data, it anchors itself to a desktop, unable to be moved or deleted until hunger strikes again.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can house over 100 computer bugs in its mouth. Letting a POKENAME near your device will usually infect your computer with plenty of viruses.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: Trainers say this Pokémon's appearance bears resemblance to a castle in a video game. POKENAME's appearance, however, is purely coincidental.
Author: FilteredTea

Entry: This Pokémon hunts Mareep on sight. It is said giving it a bone makes it loyal towards you for the rest of its life.
Author: zerocipher

Entry: This Pokémon will follow its Trainer no matter where they venture. Whether it be a taiga or a savannah, POKENAME will accompany them.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME mimics the looks and sounds of a classic Nintendo 64 console. It loves to recreate nostalgic memories through its retro-style performances.
Author: Hexx_Vixtar

Entry: When computer equipment falls from passing freighters, POKENAME eagerly devours the microchips, absorbing any data it finds. Its body glows vibrantly as it swims with a full belly.
Author: .izik

Entry: The mushroom that grows on its back is delicious and full of energy. Eaten raw, however, it makes people hallucinate growing in size.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME swims through dating websites, consuming responses from potential matches. Some believe that when a message goes unanswered, it is because POKENAME devoured it first.
Author: .izik

Entry: Nobody knows where POKENAME come from, but they are often seen near joyous gatherings of families or couples. They are said to bring good fortune to those they appear before.
Author: lemage22

Entry: The cymbals that POKENAME uses can be crashed together to make digital shock waves that can confuse the target. However, it can even confuse itself!
Author: Shadow

Entry: Wild POKENAME hunt in packs to take down enemies and livestock. They can be tamed and befriended by feeding them bones.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: Capable of reverting itself into program data, it's a beloved pet in digital games due to it's cute appearance.
Author: zotobom

Entry: POKENAME gathers large amounts of stone, and then shapes them into cubes. It can build impressive structures with these blocks.
Author: ValtsuRi

Entry: POKENAME floats silently through abandoned office buildings, scanning for unused computers. The pulses of electricity from its body intensify whenever it senses working electronics nearby.
Author: .izik

Entry: It carries a large leek-like baton that stores correspondence or data written on Morph Mail. Scientists typically send mail through it because its baton can store up to 200 Terabytes of information.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME's slime-covered body seeps into the circuitry of unmanned computers, absorbing raw data. Technicians say the slime on its body smells like a server room.
Author: .izik

Entry: It is said POKENAME was the result of a failed attempt to create a doorway to another dimension. As a failed project, this Pokémon seeks revenge.
Author: cipherlingarde

Entry: All manners of digital imagery can be displayed inside the void of its mouth. It is often employed in pranks of the bait-and-switch type.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME mindlessly scutter along the seafloor. They have mastered imitating rocks and coral, as to avoid detection.
Author: Baneful Bunker

Entry: The shell is too small to fit the body, but POKENAME will bury itself, leaving only the shell and eyes exposed. It was long considered a hoax until wild specimens were found using their facial tentacles to sift through deep sands for food.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME was once found in oceans near what is now Pallet Town. Instead of making a nest for its young, it lays its eggs inside its shell.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME travels the sea by curling into its shell and rolling along the ocean floor. It first grasps food with its tentacles, then swallows it whole.
Author: CapWolfBane

Entry: POKENAME's many tentacles are sensitive and can feel when fish Pokémon are hiding beneath the sand on the seafloor. On its back is a powerful shell that protects it from attacks from above.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME hides in its shell when it's not hunting, dragging itself around with its ribbon.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It trawls the seafloor collecting shells with its extendable arms. The ones that aren't precious to it are eaten.
Author: Baneful Bunker

Entry: In ancient times, POKENAME attacked anything they could get their tentacles on, with no care for if their shell armor became damaged.
Author: mystora

Entry: POKENAME has been seen very rarely since it converts astronomical amounts of electricity into a speed that is only matched by lightning.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It doesn't matter that POKENAME's hard shell only protects its head and neck. Everything else can regrow if lost.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME can be found in many deep-sea caves. This Pokémon was almost hunted to extinction due to poachers wanting the large gem hidden in its shell.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: When repeatedly struck with rocks, it struggles to continue in battle without further assistance. In a pinch, a Charti Berry gives it enough of a push to resist one more blow before winning a Pokémon battle.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Living exclusively inside their shells, POKENAME find it hard to coordinate and find food. Their long arms often get in each other's way.
Author: Baneful Bunker

Entry: POKENAME are said to carry prehistoric fruits from long ago. No one has ever dared to taste them.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: The sturdy armour platings on its body help it to protect its young. It swims about with its young for hours as entertainment.
Author: Baneful Bunker

Entry: POKENAME are covered with extremely sharp spines. In self defense, it can propel all of the spines from its body in an instant.
Author: Baneful Bunker

Entry: With no shell to protect it, POKENAME has all its vital organs exposed. Luckily, its body is very malleable and goop-like.
Author: Baneful Bunker

Entry: Most people don't tend to find it very appealing. This isn't helped by its slimy pelt and generally aggressive nature.
Author: Baneful Bunker

Entry: POKENAME were thought to be extinct until they were discovered living in the deep ocean. It waits patiently on the seafloor, catching anything that swims underneath it with its tentacles.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The shell-covered tail is simply too heavy and dense for POKENAME to go into the water. It does, however, make a great improvised weapon. POKENAME has multiple sets of fangs that allow it to chew even through thick boulders.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The shell-covered tail is simply too heavy and dense for POKENAME to go into the water. It does, however, make a great improvised weapon. POKENAME has multiple sets of fangs that allow it to chew even through thick boulders.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: For many years, POKENAME was believed to just be an Omastar outside of its shell. Only recently was it discovered to be a different Pokémon.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Fossils of POKENAME are common in ocean strata, their skeletons mystifying paleontologists as it's unclear which side is the head. When revived, researchers were surprised to find both the head and tail hold brains.
Author: Katie

Entry: Without others to milk POKENAME, this species would rapidly go extinct. To survive, it wraps its udders around its prey until they stop moving.
Author: theradrad

Entry: The horns on its head can be used to manipulate water currents. In battle, it lashes the foe with it's long, stretchy tail.
Author: Baneful Bunker

Entry: POKENAME use their long, tendril-like tails as whips or grapples, batting foes away or pulling in prey. If their tails are grabbed, they will encase their whole bodies with electricity until they're let free.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Groups of POKENAME roamed near vast beaches in ancient times. They eat nearly anything that washes up on shore.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: Its shell hides an oversized brain, which has swelled due to its psychic powers. Those who meet its piercing gaze give it access to their thoughts.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME maintained the balance of ancient aquatic ecosystems. It focuses its power through its staff, which generates massive whirlpools.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME maintained the balance of ancient aquatic ecosystems. It focuses its power through its staff, which generates massive whirlpools.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME live mainly in the deep ocean, slithering up to shore to lay their eggs. When threatened, it will violently thrash its hard, plated tail.
Author: kingd8

Entry: POKENAME's tentacles can commonly be found on Lapras shells, as Lapras makes up most of their diet. Since then, Lapras have evolved harder shells.
Author: Zeeroooo

Entry: POKENAME were used as machine parts for the earliest civilizations. In a cave drawing, a blueprint including this POKENAME as a component can be seen.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: POKENAME are known for their stealth. They are able to disguise themselves as other Pokémon to lure in prey.
Author: kingnekogamingyt_ttv

Entry: Its sharp beak allows it to pierce through even the toughest shells. The weight of its shell makes it move extremely slowly.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME will spend over 18 hours a day anchored to the seafloor. When attacked it will flail its shell violently.
Author: Weirdtux

Entry: POKENAME uses its tentacles to capture its prey and then drains their soul. The more souls it has drained, the more bubbles are released from the shells on its head and arms.
Author: darkweavile428

Entry: POKENAME continually grows, so it hunts and devours other Pokémon with armored shells. It squeezes its soft body into the now-empty shells, adding them to its protective suit.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME adds the shells of devoured Pokémon to the armor protecting its soft body. It must constantly seek new shells to make room for its ever-growing tentacles.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: It can barely move, but it doesn't need to: POKENAME can snipe targets with flame- covered rocks from over a mile away with ease. When it devours prey, nothing is left behind.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are quite rare due to needing two separate shells for evolution. Their shells have lots of cracks and scars due to the two heads constantly fighting one another.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its huge fangs help it to draw blood from bigger targets. When it drinks too much, the huge shell on its head becomes too heavy for it.
Author: Baneful Bunker

Entry: This fusion is the aftermath of a lab accident. Its entire head is engulfed by its own shell, and it often rams into buildings unintentionally.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: POKENAME drifts through arctic waters, devouring its prey in its gaping jaw. It's said that making eye contact is enough to freeze you solid.
Author: robosoup

Entry: POKENAME's hunting strategy involves hiding in tall grass, waiting for something to wander near, then using its tentacles to ensnare its prey at lightning speeds.
Author: astral_1447

Entry: During its pupation, POKENAME is almost helpless. With its short stubby legs, it clings to branches to stay safe from predators.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: If a POKENAME damages its shell, it will rub against a tree until the cracked portion is removed. The exposed area will grow hard in minutes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME do not like to be disturbed, as they will explode violently if anyone so much as touches them. To prevent this, POKENAME will often wrap itself in a toxic thread to deter others from touching it.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Despite its small stature, this Pokémon is capable of defeating even the strongest of Dragon-types.
Author: WeirdIsNormal

Entry: The combined, layered shells of Kakuna and Metapod make POKENAME an impenetrable fortress while it prepares to evolve.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: Antennae and wings have formed, but POKENAME's evolution is not yet complete. Its wings can spread a mild poison mist, giving it a bit more defense against predators until it finishes evolving.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its scythes are a last resort to defend its cocooned body. Though sharp, they are rather delicate; if swung too forcefully they may snap off the body completely, leaving it vulnerable.
Author: sk372

Entry: When angry, POKENAME can level multiple trees in a minute. After the tree is on the ground it drinks the sap until it is full.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its bright colors warn predators to stay away. The poison in its barbs leaves an annoying itch that lasts for days.
Author: sautomagically

Entry: Although this fusion is incapable of all movement, its body is harder than steel. Not even a hammer could dent its shell.
Author: sautomagically

Entry: POKENAME gather in large groups on ocean shoals to protect each other from the tides and predators. They will huddle in these patterns for up to six months waiting to evolve, at which point they will emerge from the sea and seek vast amounts of food.
Author: lunacharlotte

Entry: POKENAME's wings cannot carry its heavy body, so it slowly climbs trees to move around. Its poison has become more potent and thus more dangerous.
Author: sautomagically

Entry: Keeping the tough carapace after evolution, POKENAME is a lot slower than other Beedrill but significantly bulkier. POKENAME will often clash with one another, trying to pierce each other's shells.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Due to its tough exoskeleton, POKENAME has trouble learning to fly. Groups of them can be seen falling out of trees in an attempt to fly.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It makes a soft hoot periodically, an act done to regulate its internal temperature as it evolves. When evolution draws nearer, the hooting increases dramatically in frequency.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME roosts at the tops of pine trees, its hardened wings shielding its body from attacks. If startled, it lets out a sharp clicking sound to scare off intruders before resuming its stillness.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME clings to tree limbs as its body hardens, appearing like a golden bud among the leaves. If disturbed, it rapidly flutters its shell-like wings, unleashing a flurry of tiny but forceful punches.
Author: .izik

Entry: At night it clings to a tree with its strong fists. It uses its antennae to sense when inclement weather is on the way.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME curls its legs underneath its belly when hanging from a web to resemble a helpless, unfused Kakuna. As small as it is, it still attempts to latch onto and poison any Pokémon that attacks it.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME weaves silk traps around itself, creating alarm lines that alert it to approaching threats. While it waits for evolution, it focuses entirely on hardening its outer shell.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME spits a silk-like substance onto trees it chooses to roost in. This silk reeks of rotting garbage, deterring intruders while it waits to evolve.
Author: .izik

Entry: Not very mobile, POKENAME spends time storing energy, waiting for evolution to finish. If a predator draws near, it releases a bright burst of electric energy to blind the foe so POKENAME can escape.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME can float for short periods of time but ultimately spends its time on the ground. Its body can get as hard as iron without gaining weight.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hardens its long tail before attacking, using it as a sturdy club to fend off predators. Though mostly immobile, it can lash out with surprising speed if provoked.
Author: .izik

Entry: It has extraordinary airspeed and maneuverability to avoid predators, its wings never resting. Because it takes so much energy to maintain this flight technique, its evolution process is massively extended compared to most Kakuna fusions.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME stores the energy it needs for evolution in its bud. If it is injured, it can quickly renew its skin.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It remains almost entirely immobile to conserve energy, hoping its appearance alone will frighten off predators. If that fails, it can still use its stored energy to make at least one strong lunge and potent bite.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME remains motionless, concentrating its psychic energy for evolution. Its shell is incredibly tough, deflecting most physical attacks.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME's hardened shell protects it from most threats, but if danger persists, it vibrates violently until it self-destructs in a massive explosion.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's shell is lined with tough chitin, making it nearly indestructible. Though it remains still, its hidden horn twitches slightly when it senses strong opponents nearby.
Author: .izik

Entry: Unlike Ekans, its fang are under-developed. It attacks prey by headbutting them with its rock-hard skull.
Author: PokePower

Entry: POKENAME wraps itself around a tree trunk and remains completely still as it prepares to evolve. Its hardened skin causes a rash to anyone who tries to remove it.
Author: sautomagically

Entry: POKENAME's indomitable spirit, paired with its tough outer shell, ensures that this is one of the most resilient Pokémon. It can withstand attacks that would fell much larger foes.
Author: Inkysquid38

Entry: The longer POKENAME stays still, the harder its skin becomes and the closer it comes to evolving. However, if threatened, it will flee to a new location and restart its cocooning process.
Author: sautomagically

Entry: POKENAME's cocoon is multilayered, as each electric burst it uses to deter predators vaporizes the outermost shell. It grows new layers to replace them, though this process delays its evolution.
Author: sk372

Entry: It buries itself in the sand in shallow waters until only its antennae stick out. Should it sense anything getting too close to it, water spouts shoot from the antennae to knock away intruders.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME gather in small swarms so they can stick together in piles on the forest floor. The proximity allows for better defenses; if the pile is under attack, they can unite their psychic powers to fend off the aggressor.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME use their hardened chrysalises both to protect themselves and as weapons. The shells of their chrysalises are especially thick at the tops of their skulls, leading them to prefer ramming head-first as an attack.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME can sense danger and predict disasters. However, it doesn't seem to do much about this except protect itself.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME's tough shell covers its whole body. The shrubbery on its back attracts Bug-type Pokémon, so it naps often to save energy for evolution.
Author: leonian1586

Entry: While not very mobile on its own, POKENAME can be grasped by its handle and used as a stout dagger. Those who do so find that its blade is remarkably durable, hardly ever needing to be honed.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: Being virtually immobile while clinging to a tree, POKENAME gains nutrients by luring in prey with its ribbons.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME's hardened shell is coated in a fine layer of spores that can cause drowsiness in predators. When it evolves, the shell shatters with an explosion of pollen.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are barely able to move, using their large front claws to slowly drag themselves around. They bury themselves underground during daylight hours to hide from predators.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME are barely able to move, using their large front claws to slowly drag themselves around. They bury themselves underground during daylight hours to hide from predators.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME is completely immobile, lying buried in the ground with its mouth facing directly to the surface. Though it does not require much food while waiting to pupate, it will snap at anything that steps on it.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME stays still as long as possible, preparing for evolution. It will remember anyone who tries to disrupt this process, and recall them as foes.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It can be found within the largest Beedrill colonies, serving as cogwork for rudimentary yet intelligent pulley systems used in transporting honey.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME disguises itself as other Pokémon to blend in with its surroundings. If its illusion is broken, it rapidly hardens its shell, making its body tougher than marble.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its hardened shell glows faintly with inner heat, hinting at a transformation within. Tiny cracks in its armor release puffs of hot air as it nears evolution.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME burrows its lower body in carrot fields before hardening its outer shell. Farmers often find clusters of them nestled underground, waiting patiently for evolution.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME rolls its rigid body through the spores it sheds, coating itself in a toxic layer. Any predator that attempts to bite it suffers severe chemical burns.
Author: .izik

Entry: Since its cocooned body has no means of attack, its only defense is to fly away from danger. The exertion from flying its heavier body around delays its evolution process.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME can rarely form in the wild if a Yamask loses its mask and finds an abandoned Kakuna shell. The soul of the Kakuna lingers inside the shell, causing the fusion.
Author: crumple_2

Entry: POKENAME hangs silently from cave ceilings, blending into the darkness. At night, eerie screeches can be heard from within the cave as it prepares for evolution.
Author: .izik

Entry: It burrows into the ground, leaving the leaves on its head exposed. These are a deterrent, as between the hardness of its shell, the bitter taste, and the mild poison, few will bother trying to eat it.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME performs intricate samba-like movements, and seemingly freezes after the dance concludes to harden its body. Despite its immobility during this time, Trainers swear they can hear rhythmic beats emanating from its shell.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME holds poison-filled cotton in its pincers to defend its territory. The toxin can cause weak-willed individuals to experience delusions and dance uncontrollably.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME floats through meadows late at night, its hard body rocking back and forth while an eerie tune plays from an unknown source. It is said that staring at it too long will cause horrifying visions.
Author: .izik

Entry: Legends say POKENAME ushers the souls of the dead closer with a slow, ritualistic dance before absorbing them for energy. It uses this energy to harden its shell, preparing for its next evolution.
Author: .izik

Entry: The mushrooms on POKENAME's back have roots that pierce its hard outer carapace, drawing nutrients directly from its body. It feeds on tree roots to nourish both itself and the fungi.
Author: .izik

Entry: The hard portions of its mushroom leak a fluid that can be used in salad dressing. The fluid tastes sweeter based on the type of tree sap it consumes.
Author: .izik

Entry: Beneath POKENAME's thick fur lies a tough exoskeleton, providing extra defense. At night, it curls around the base of light posts, staring contentedly at the glow.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are seen guarding the shrine within the Ilex Forest, using Spiky Shield to keep Trainers out. They are said to be specially chosen by the mythical Pokémon, Celebi.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: POKENAME scrounges around for discarded coins to consume. Science isn't yet sure how, but eating large amounts of coins seems to expedite its evolution process slightly.
Author: sk372

Entry: Despite being covered in an armored carapace, POKENAME is incredibly weak and will teleport out of danger to avoid being injured. It is theorized that POKENAME's shell contains large amounts of psychic energy.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Though its body is long and vine-like, POKENAME's hardened shell is tougher than stone. It blends in among thick undergrowth, relying on its durability to remain undisturbed.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lures prey like Spearow into its gaping mouth using its Weedle-like tongue. Once inside, they are engulfed by a thick, silvery acid that dissolves them completely.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME cling to the ceilings of caves while they wait to pupate. If they're disturbed, POKENAME will cluster together and form an impenetrable wall, protecting one another from harm.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME cling to the ceilings of caves while they wait to pupate. If they're disturbed, POKENAME will cluster together and form an impenetrable wall, protecting one another from harm.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME's carapace has no pain receptors, so it will often not notice that it is being attacked. Their metabolism is very slow, only having to eat a single berry a day.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME spends most of its time flying. Its beak is the same material as the leek it carries and can be used in stews.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME often acts like a tiny businessman, using its leek to point at charts. If cooked and eaten, it has a very strange texture.
Author: RoboSoup

Entry: Archaeologists consider POKENAME a bit of a menace, as its penchant for using fossils as weapons and armor runs the risk of damaging what could be very important scientific finds.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME glares at foes as a scare tactic. If that does not work, it rapidly kicks without mercy.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: During the fusion process, the Kabuto is joined to the tongue of the Magikarp. The host's body becomes nothing more than a shell for the Kabuto.
Author: paisleylxl

Entry: POKENAME's appearance has brought about fervent archaeological research, as it has led to theories that the fossil Pokémon of Kanto may share a previously unknown common ancestor.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME scurries along the shallow beach waters, digging around the sands for food. Though it can breach the water and move on land, lingering out of water too long results in its top half drying out and becoming brittle.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME wants to be left alone. The ribbon-like growths from its head are made of rock and form a terrifying display to scare off other Pokémon and cave explorers. If anyone gets too close, it disappears through a wall.
Author: leandermalurt

Entry: POKENAME was originally believed to be an ancient ancestor of Corsola dating back 300 million years. However, recent re-evaluation suggests that POKENAME was a parasitic species that would live inside shells constructed from discarded Corsola shells.
Author: lunacharlotte

Entry: It collects fossils, cleaning them with its brush-like tail. What, exactly, POKENAME does with these fossils is unknown.
Author: admiralvermin

Entry: POKENAME uses its rocky body as camouflage among the seabed. When a Pokémon draws near, its head extends and it drains them of their body fluids. If the prey's body is too tough, it first melts them by spitting acid.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The longer claws on a POKENAME are not as tough as a Kabuto's claws, but they are far more dextrous and can reach into tight crevices with ease.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: They are able to live for thousands of years before developing into their final form, as they live off ginkgo seeds. Those seeds have helped POKENAME develop a hard shell around themselves that resists damage.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: This deepwater pair are thought to have created a sword blade eons before humans did. The elongated partner polishes the rounded one's caudal spike.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Over the millions of years it has existed, it adapted feelers to pull prey under its shell to eat. When threatened, it will disguise itself as a rock.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: A behemoth of land and sky, POKENAME can widen tunnels made by Onix or take flight to search for food; it isn't picky on which it chooses.
Author: cipherlingarde

Entry: Throughout history, some who saw POKENAME flying through the sky mistook it for a harbinger of destruction. It was increasingly shunned as a result.
Author: cipherlingarde

Entry: POKENAME can be found living in caves along the ocean shoreline. To hunt, they dip their tails into the water, wait for a fish to arrive, and zap.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: It swims in the deepest parts of the ocean, searching for gems. It's naive and curious, but hides from predators in caves.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: POKENAME possesses deadly poison and a rock-hard carapace. Researchers are unsure if this is one Pokémon or a group of Kabuto acting as one.
Author: Eye Of Cthulhu

Entry: POKENAME trudges along the seafloor, filtering food from the mud it stirs up. During mating season, it hauls itself onto frozen beaches en masse.
Author: robosoup

Entry: The hole in the center of POKENAME's stomach is its only mouth. It doesn't have to chew its food unless the food is bigger than its mouth.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME is awkward; its heavy scythes hinder flight, and its airy wings clog in water. It adapts by skimming the surface in hops, swimming with its arms while keeping its wings dry to fly.
Author: Glacierwing

Entry: It sleeps in deep caverns underwater, usually in caves abundant with coral. Its main head rests while its other eyes keep an eye out.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: The oxygen-dense atmosphere of the prehistoric past allowed POKENAME to grow to an enormous size. It minces combatants with its steel-sharp horn.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: POKENAME live amongst dense kelp forests, their rocky hide and naturalistic shape letting them blend in with rocks along the sea floor. Despite their fearsome appearance, they use their scythes to harvest kelp to feed on.
Author: Katie

Entry: Whatever POKENAME cannot cut through, it coils around, suffocating its prey. It has the ability to slither atop the surface of water.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME uses its scythe-like tails to grab and cut its prey. Its head is very durable and it can swim at incredible speeds.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: If POKENAME or its Trainer is attacked, it immobilizes the assailant with telekinesis before raking its sharp blades across them as a warning before it releases them. Very few aggressors choose to ignore this threat.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its sickle-like tail allows it to cut through prey with ease. When swimming, POKENAME will tuck its tail up against its body.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: It seeks out living Pokémon and uses its scythe to sap their energy in a futile attempt to revive itself.
Author: seafoamtaide

Entry: POKENAME is one of the first prehistoric mammals ever discovered. Ancient cave paintings have shown it using its blades to hypnotize its prey.
Author: Patch_Bros

Entry: Each POKENAME has its own scythe with its own set of patterns. If their blades are too similar, POKENAME will fight until only one scythe remains.
Author: OhOk3441

Entry: POKENAME has sharp, poison-soaked scythes that it uses to finish off its prey. When it rolls at high speeds it gathers its blades, and it only draws them out when hunting or battling other Pokémon.
Author: fiordaliso

Entry: This Pokémon has a very aggressive temperament and is extremely territorial. It uses its stone-hard scythes to poison and attack its enemies. POKENAME was revived from a fossil recovered on a mountain path.
Author: fiordaliso

Entry: This gigantic Pokémon has many weapons at its disposal for hunting. It has huge jaws capable of shattering even rock, and it has razor-sharp scythes in place of arms, which have made it one of the most fearsome Pokémon in ancient times.
Author: fiordaliso

Entry: POKENAME is a brutal carnivore whose entire body is built for hunting prey on land and sea. However, scientists believe that even if POKENAME existed in the past, they would quickly go extinct, as they require far too much food to sustain themselves.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It uses a variety of loud screeches as well as wing movements to scare prey. In rare cases, scientists have even recorded the false eyes blinking.
Author: Patch_Bros

Entry: POKENAME's flesh is delicious and healthy, loaded with fatty acids, but it's difficult to procure. It leaps and attacks at the first sight of humans.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME is aggressive to a fault. Once it makes its home in a river, it chases out all other Pokémon living there.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The tips of its mouth are soft and sensitive, and they are used to feel POKENAME's immediate area. They can uncurl from their shell and chomp down on any perceived threat in a fraction of a second.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME flies around without a care in the world, seemingly unaware that it was supposed to have gone extinct a million years ago.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: The skin of an POKENAME is extremely elastic and is similar to rubber. Due to this, its body is highly resistant to lightning strikes.
Author: .izik

Entry: The armor on its body is harder than tungsten. During the summer months, it shines in the sun more brightly than at any other time of the year.
Author: .izik

Entry: It makes its den on the peak of rarely-traversed mountains. Should it spot someone else living within 100 meters, it will immediately leave.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its head is harder than any other portion of its body. It rams its face into trees to make them topple, spilling the fruit to the ground.
Author: .izik

Entry: The chunks of amber that it holds are filled with an ancient energy. When gripping them tightly, it lets loose huge amounts of magnetic force.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its piercing cries can be heard from miles away. Their ribbons-like feelers keep prey bound while they feast.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: It lives in hot, dry places of the world because its body rapidly absorbs water. Without a Passho Berry to dry its skin, its wings become too waterlogged to fly.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME carries a piece of amber with it at all times. This seems to be all it has of its past life.
Author: Atlas333

Entry: A Sableye that consumes Old Amber will sometimes become this Pokémon, and soon develops a taste for all fossils.
Author: Insanity5734

Entry: POKENAME is too heavy to fly for long, forced to flap constantly just to stay a meager amount off the ground. It's believed to have fought over food and territory with Archeops in prehistory.
Author: sk372

Entry: The stones on an POKENAME's body will grow for two years until they fall off. The stones can be reshaped to make beautiful sculptures.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's terrifying strength and size allows it to easily intimidate prey and gobble them up. If this fusion existed in the past, it is not known what other Pokémon could have coexisted alongside it.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Despite its massive size, POKENAME could fly at speeds that could rival modern Garchomp. This, coupled with its impressive hunting abilities, has earned it the nickname 'The Aerial Annihilator'.
Author: Patch

Entry: It rarely uses its fangs to attack. Instead, it rams into prey and territorial rivals at alarming speed.
Author: PokePower

Entry: POKENAME swoops down on opponents, jabbing at weak spots with its tail. Its raucous battle cry can knock smaller Pokémon out of the sky.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: Any organic material dropped onto an POKENAME's body sinks in and becomes part of it. The sand flowing out of the skull's eyes is seemingly endless.
Author: raptorroocool

Entry: The wings on POKENAME's head allow it to fly despite its body being ill-suited for the skies. It prefers to live in tundras, soaring over icy landscapes while its body dangles below.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME sit perfectly still like statues, letting their prey get close to them instead of pursuing them. In their idle time they like to play with rocks they find pretty.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: A powerful apex Pokémon from Kanto's distant history, scientists on Cinnabar Island have managed to resurrect them and reintroduce them into the environment. They now make their home within the Cinnabar Volcano, nesting within basalt columns.
Author: Katie

Entry: A powerful apex Pokémon from Kanto's distant history, scientists on Cinnabar Island have managed to resurrect them and reintroduce them into the environment. They now make their home within the Cinnabar Volcano, nesting within basalt columns.
Author: Katie

Entry: A powerful apex Pokémon from Kanto's distant history, scientists on Cinnabar Island have managed to resurrect them and reintroduce them into the environment. They now make their home within the Cinnabar Volcano, nesting within basalt columns.
Author: Katie

Entry: A powerful apex Pokémon from Kanto's distant history, scientists on Cinnabar Island have managed to resurrect them and reintroduce them into the environment. They now make their home within the Cinnabar Volcano, nesting within basalt columns.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME's extra eyes help it scout for food with an enhanced field of view. If it sustains a powerful hit, its amber-coated segments detach until it is safe to reform by using its magnets.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME are more energetic than most Snorlax fusions due to their steady diet of Chesto Berries. When they run out of energy, they will collapse in the middle of whatever they're doing and create spores that put those around them to sleep as well.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME appears to have a never-ending appetite for fruit. It is popular amongst young Pokémon Trainers.
Author: lowkeytoxtricity

Entry: POKENAME sets distinct goals and rewards for itself to maximize training. For instance, it will grant itself a large snack full of nutritious Berries only once it has broken fifty boulders clean in two.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME seems to already know that eating a good meal, doing vigorous exercise and sleeping well will lead to a healthy body, and will do all three naturally in a steady routine. For that reason, it is beloved by pro athletes.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME spends the majority of its time sleeping; it uses the constant stream of poisonous gas emitted from its body as a resting place.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME has a simple and placid personality, spending most of its time grazing and sleeping. Waking it up from a nap, however, will make it charge at the culprit in a grumpy rage.
Author: sk372

Entry: Following Snorlax's reputation of blocking walkways, POKENAME blocks riverbeds and streams, leaving aquatic Pokémon unable to migrate in the spring.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: POKENAME is considered a gourmand when it comes to cooking meats, using flame-breath to roast meals to perfection. Improperly heating a meal will send it into an indignant rage.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME has a calm, sleepy demeanor and a warm, comfy body that soothes those nearby. When threatened, it releases bursts of heat to protect itself.
Author: habibiluigi

Entry: Fusion has forced Snorlax's huge belly to more than double in size, shrinking its bones to make room and giving it a blob-like shape.
Author: leeto64

Entry: A Pokémon filled with positive emotions and happiness. It absolutely loves eating; sometimes it eats so much it can't fly with its own weight.
Author: cipherlingarde

Entry: POKENAME usually prides itself on its roundness. Once every seven days, however, it flattens itself in a display of a particular kind of humor it enjoys.
Author: _sadfroggy

Entry: The force of POKENAME's gluttony has adapted its antennae into Berries. It eating its Berries doesn't hurt, and they usually grow back.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: A very docile fusion, POKENAME is often used as a companion for children afraid of the dark, as its tails glow in a pretty pattern many find soothing.
Author: howlingstarr

Entry: This Pokémon's antennae act as a night-light for child POKENAME. Although most adults outgrow them, it acts as comfort after a bad day.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: Its wings are too small to lift it off the ground for more than a couple of seconds. Because of this, it only flies to grab hard-to-reach food.
Author: Novellavaria

Entry: It hangs from branches and sleeps for upwards of 18 hours a day. It searches for citrus fruits, like the lemon or pomelo, during the scant few hours it is awake.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: In spite of its lack of a body, POKENAME can eat hundreds of pounds of food in a single day. It's unknown where this food goes.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME spends most of the year fast asleep. When this Pokémon wakes, it devastates surrounding farmland with its mouth and drill.
Author: beespoon

Entry: POKENAME snoozes endlessly, surfacing only to snack. Its maze-like tunnels delve deep underground.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: Despite its large size, POKENAME is a very relaxed and laid-back Pokémon. It often attempts to sing and create melodies.
Author: tuskaninny

Entry: POKENAME loves to show off. It is particularly adept in feats of strength and balance, making it a somewhat common sight at circuses. When it sleeps, it is nigh-impossible to wake up.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are extremely lethargic and will spend months sleeping between meals. Their appetite is tremendous when they're hungry, gorging themselves for an entire day on anything that crosses their path.
Author: Katie

Entry: Using its control over time, POKENAME eats up a handful of berries almost completely, then reverses the berries' time, regenerating them and letting it eat them over and over again.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME travels the seas, gathering up berries and small fish to take to secret hoarding spots. Once it's amassed a stash twice its weight, it gorges itself before settling down for a nice nap.
Author: sk372

Entry: It licks anything that comes close to it, even when asleep. Studies have found that it dreams exclusively about food.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: To see POKENAME awake is a rarity, as they will always favor a long nap over anything that requires any effort. Their post-nap tantrums can be brutal.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: The flower on its back emits a calming scent that POKENAME uses to stay asleep for days. Researchers often track POKENAME by the trails of crushed vegetation and wild sleeping Pokémon it leaves behind.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: The spikes on its head provide POKENAME a solid defense mechanism. However, it can usually only muster a few headbutts before it gets sleepy.
Author: GP423

Entry: Wild POKENAME spend the majority of their lives sleeping. Despite this, their physical strength is nearly unparalleled.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: Despite its laziness, it is an excellent climber, easily able to get Berries and fruit from very high trees.
Author: homelessrager

Entry: Wild POKENAME spend the majority of their lives sleeping. Despite this, their physical strength is nearly unparalleled.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: It appears lazy but is respected by its family. When its children are endangered, it displays levels of aggression never reached by its components.
Author: MieCreates

Entry: It only wakes up to lazily eat its surrounding area. While asleep, it remains completely intangible.
Author: bacondlx

Entry: It is said that before one departs to the afterlife, POKENAME will carry the deceased to an unknown place where they will share their final feast. POKENAME will then guide them to their eternal home after they've eaten everything.
Author: Beatdoof

Entry: Its attacks, if it bothers to fight at all, are careless and sloppy. One successful hit is all it needs, though, as its zigzagging blade delivers a nasty blow.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: It's able to spot anything edible behind objects, making it hard to hide snacks from it. Trainers must work to help keep its mane clean of food debris.
Author: nelluc27

Entry: POKENAME's taste sensitivity is inversely proportional to how hungry it is. When they're full enough, they often get into a slow but rewarding odyssey to get berries from the surface.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME's taste sensitivity is inversely proportional to how hungry it is. When they're full enough, they often get into a slow but rewarding odyssey to get berries from the surface.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: This Pokémon is often brought to retirement homes due to its docile and sweet nature. They spend up to 20 hours a day sleeping.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME often go on violent temper tantrums. These take up a lot of energy, however, and it spends the rest of the day sleeping.
Author: NellNast42

Entry: Exhausted from epic battles with Snordon, POKENAME rests in the ocean depths, providing a bed for other Pokémon on its back.
Author: slowforest

Entry: POKENAME may sleep for ten thousand years, becoming one with the landscape. It can devour a whole continent's vegetation when it awakes.
Author: robosoup

Entry: Despite its lax attitude, POKENAME will react to danger with a quick hop into an attack with its legs, usually finishing with a devastating leglock.
Author: leeto64

Entry: Due to their fluff constantly growing, POKENAME are regularly shaved. The fur is often used in the creation of thick winter coats.
Author: KitArchen

Entry: POKENAME is often found napping around towns. It only wakes up if a passer-by has a tasty treat to eat.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: POKENAME has such an appetite it eats 900 pounds a day. The amount it eats is so large it needs to vomit up its stomach to make space.
Author: theradrad

Entry: POKENAME collects food so that it can eat whenever it feels like it. Traveling Trainers often use them to carry excess food that won't fit in their bag. They also have it carry a Poké Flute so that they can wake it whenever they need its assistance.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: Its "wings" are actually big paws that pin it to the ground. It is perfectly content in this position, but becomes rowdy if no food is in reach.
Author: miecreates

Entry: It doesn't so much as fly as it does drift aimlessly along the wind. Even when sneakily stealing food from humans, it remains floating on its back.
Author: miecreates

Entry: Too heavy to comfortably fly, it drags itself across the ground instead. Despite this, it can manage incredible acrobatics if properly motivated.
Author: miecreates

Entry: Despite being able to mutate its own body, POKENAME prefers to keep its body as simple as possible to conserve energy. It mostly just lazes around, using its psychic powers to grab food.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: When autumn ends, it finds a nest to hibernate in. It is tolerated by the original residents because it blocks off tunnels leading out from the nest, which helps keep warmth inside until spring.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: The sound of its snores can be heard from miles away. It will eat any kind of metal or precious stone that it digs up.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: Do not be alarmed if you see a POKENAME belly-up in water; when they aren't eating, their round bodies float to the surface while they sleep.
Author: .towerxvi

Entry: Though POKENAME looks slow, its body is packed with stored energy, and can unleash an explosive ember if startled awake. The flame on its tail is said to grow hotter the longer POKENAME sleeps without interruption.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME spends its life in constant search of Bug-type Pokémon to consume. Its voracious appetite, combined with a poor sense of direction, leaves its mouth filled with dirt more often than not.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: Despite its massive wings, it shows no interest in flight, choosing instead to waddle and lurch with lazy purpose. When threatened, it opens its cavernous mouth and lets out a yawn so loud it disorients anything nearby.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: It never goes anywhere without its pillow. It has been said that stealing a POKENAME's pillow will bring bad luck.
Author: auroraeuphoria

Entry: The leaves atop POKENAME's head are coated with an awful-smelling poisonous film. How bad the stench is depends on its diet.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Though it is small, the stomping of POKENAME's feet can make the ground shake. Its appetite is so voracious, it will eat the leaves off its own head.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: It feasts on any food it finds, somehow consuming many times its body weight in a single sitting. If interrupted, POKENAME lashes out with enough power to topple trees.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: POKENAME resembles a toy known for its similarity in appearance and texture to marshmallows. It's so lazy, it doesn't mourn the loss of its legs.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Its voracious appetite is matched only by its awe-inspiring strength. POKENAME can be tracked by the trail of destruction it leaves as it eats everything in its path.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: Thanks to the mushroom draining its energy, POKENAME eats even more than a regular Snorlax. Because of POKENAME's diet of Sitrus Berries, the mushroom has changed to resemble one.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: The dust that comes off of a POKENAME's fur is used in creating concealer and eyeliner. Beauticians use this makeup at fashion shows in Unova.
Author: .izik

Entry: When POKENAME isn't participating in its usual routine of stuffing its face with pasta, it curls up in its bed and sleeps for hours upon hours.
Author: GP423

Entry: POKENAME is almost always grumpy, due to a lack of good sleep. Trying to wake POKENAME is a terrible idea as it will violently pummel you until it exhausts itself.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME love to show affection for their Trainer by laying on them like a warm, heavy blanket. This makes them a very popular pet.
Author: JordanX27

Entry: POKENAME sleeps for 18 hours a day, but when it is awake, all efforts focuse on finding food for its huge appetite. Due to the abundant psychic powers supercharging its metabolism, this Pokémon can eat as much food as it wants and never gain weight.
Author: cipherlingarde

Entry: Regurgitative and poisonous fluid oozes from its mouth. It dines on weak prey that gets close, liquefying them whole, and then takes a leisurely nap.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME lives and snoozes among the craggy cliffs of mountainsides. Its tough skin and deep slumber mean that even if it turns in its sleep and rolls all the way down a mountainside, it won't be jostled from its nap.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME have two heads that take turns sleeping, but they both oversleep and end up missing most of the day. They often wake up late and starving, and will then run about foraging for berries and insects.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: It sleeps on its back with its head outside its shell when it feels completely safe and comfortable. If POKENAME sleeps in this manner with you nearby, it trusts you entirely.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Anyone who takes a bite of its berries will fall asleep right away. It's advised is not to eat them, as POKENAME will deprive you of all your food.
Author: TheFinalKalgonus

Entry: When POKENAME channels its psychic powers, a magnificent aurora emanates from its gemlike core. It controls ice at will. It has been known to protect sailors in arctic waters, so it is sometimes called the 'North Star Gem' or the 'Jewel of Polaris'.
Author: Alkazamis

Entry: Whatever POKENAME mimes out will become a physical object made of pure ice. It cannot make anything too complex, like machines.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: While it might look fat, this Pokémon's body is mostly dense feathers that keep it safe even in temperatures well below -100° F.
Author: moopse

Entry: Due to an excess amount of feathers, this Pokémon can barely see. Its dense coat does have the upside of protecting it from attacks, however.
Author: moopse

Entry: Bestowed with intense, overflowing determination, POKENAME has reached its zenith. With its life on the line, it'll keep battling until the very end.
Author: Leeto64

Entry: It is said that POKENAME lives on one of the coldest mountains in the world, watching over climbers who dare attempt to ascend it.
Author: mistershaokahn

Entry: POKENAME have been seen accidentally freeze-drying their antennae. This Pokémon can survive swimming in ice-cold environments.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: It only appears during the winter months, bringing a light dusting of snow wherever it flies. Its wings are sensitive to heat and will start to melt if it gets too warm.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME shoots heavy chunks of ice from its beak. Heavy POKENAME fire larger ice chunks.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Herds of these Pokémon are only occasionally seen on the highest mountain peaks. At the slightest danger, the whole herd takes flight at once.
Author: r.isk

Entry: Those who see the brilliant splendor of the golden light shining through POKENAME's crystalline ice feathers never forget it.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Spirits that have passed in blizzards gather to form POKENAME. This powerful spirit is bonded to a frozen keystone.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: Extremely regal and proud, POKENAME demands great respect from other Pokémon and even its own Trainer. It uses the frozen metallic claws at the ends of its wings as anchors when climbing cliffsides or mountains.
Author: c0u51nv1nn7

Entry: POKENAME is a legendary sword Pokémon that resides around icy summits. It can generate a blizzard with a swing of its blade.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: This legendary Pokémon can create magnificent wings by coating its feelers in a thick coat of ice. Wherever it flies, it snows.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME fiercely protects the icy mountains it calls home, yearning for absolute solitude. Those who fall asleep in its territory are doomed to an endless nightmare, left to freeze in the relentless cold.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: Opening the inside of POKENAME can cause frostbite to anyone nearby. It prefers not to have any items inside of it.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME wields legendary icy powers combined with extraterrestrial prowess. It commands the skies with grace and formidable abilities.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: If you see a small icy comet darting across the sky, it could be an POKENAME. It only arrives in the early winter to bring the first snow of the season.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME hides itself away on frigid mountains so it may grow into its next form in solitude. Those that disturb its peace will be pelted with frozen winds created through the swing of its tail.
Author: sk372

Entry: Optimists will say that POKENAME rescue those who are lost in blizzards, but the cold reality is that they put them out of their misery by encasing them in ice.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: POKENAME is rarely seen, and those who encounter it are often fearful. To others, it is described as a "beautiful beast," with a long tail that never stops waving.
Author: 1bridgeyboo

Entry: POKENAME is rarely seen, and those who encounter it are often fearful. To others, it is described as a "disappointing but pretty beast," with a surprisingly short tail.
Author: 1bridgeyboo

Entry: It is a master of temperature manipulation, whose shell is made of ice, while its core burns hotter than magma. When the inside of its shell melts and boils, POKENAME erupts with the accumulated steam, which freezes into snow upon being released.
Author: milchik

Entry: It is a master of temperature manipulation, whose shell is made of ice, while its core burns hotter than magma. When the inside of its shell melts and boils, POKENAME erupts with the accumulated steam, which freezes into snow upon being released.
Author: milchik

Entry: It remains unknown how the artichoke it carries is crucial to its way of life. Many researchers found themselves frozen solid trying to find out.
Author: nvisionluminous

Entry: Legends say that if you get lost in a blizzard and POKENAME is nearby, it will put you to sleep so you won't see it and take you to a safe place.
Author: TheFinalKalgonus

Entry: POKENAME channels electrical energy through its bulb, discharging sparks when the grows the tiniest bit. It absorbs both sunlight and lightning to fuel its rapid growth.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: If you see a falling star during the daytime, it could be POKENAME zipping through the sky on its way to bring lightning to faraway regions.
Author: Fenragon

Entry: POKENAME commands large hailstorms that can devastate entire villages. These hailstones are charged with electricity and can cause electric shocks when touched.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME have been seen accidentally shocking their antennae. This Pokémon can survive swimming in electrified waters.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: It stores electrical power in the swollen bud on its back, which pulses with sparks before discharges. As it grows stronger, its body becomes increasingly magnetic, occasionally causing metal objects to stick to it.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME's quills are able to pierce human skin and discharge electricity directly into the body. Swimming is off limits anywhere they are spotted.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The feathers of POKENAME can store an unfathomable amounts of electricity. A simple graze of their body can paralyze even the sturdiest of Pokémon.
Author: Ayner

Entry: Its back is overgrown with thick leaves that constantly crackle with stray voltage. During thunderstorms, it lies still and uses its foliage to absorb massive amounts of electrical energy.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: It is said that POKENAME is able to charge head-first into power outlets, being able to disappear into the electrical current and quickly travel through cities. This puts them in the perfect situation to ambush rivals.
Author: DoodleDoo

Entry: If you see a thunderstorm over the ocean, it may mean a POKENAME is near. The storm will quickly pass once POKENAME dives back down into the water.
Author: KitArchen

Entry: A Pokémon said to be a legendary warrior, appearing alongside raging thunderstorms. POKENAME channels fiery electricity through its body, unleashing electrified blows at blazing speed. Its strikes leave foes scorched and paralyzed.
Author: ThePandaSharky

Entry: POKENAME is a legendary sword Pokémon that resides around and regenerates in volcanic lava. Its appearance elsewhere is said to bring about spring.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Legend holds that it possesses the ability to dispel even the fiercest thunderstorms. Many ships carry a symbol of POKENAME in hopes of safe travels.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME never touches the ground, living its entire life high in the sky. Thunderstorms form around them as they fly, and they weaponise the bolts of lightning by using them to strike at other Pokémon and aircraft flying across their path.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME never touches the ground, living its entire life high in the sky. Thunderstorms form around them as they fly, and they weaponise the bolts of lightning by using them to strike at other Pokémon and aircraft flying across their path.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME never touches the ground, living its entire life high in the sky. Thunderstorms form around them as they fly, and they weaponise the bolts of lightning by using them to strike at other Pokémon and aircraft flying across their path.
Author: Katie

Entry: This legendary Pokémon is said to dance elegantly amongst thunderclouds, with the ability to pounce down among bolts of lightning.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME absorbs electrical energy from the nightmares of people across the world. Rural communities link dark storm clouds to its presence, spreading fear and worsening dreams, which only makes it stronger.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: POKENAME absorbs electrical energy from the nightmares of people across the world. Rural communities link dark storm clouds to its presence, spreading fear and worsening dreams, which only makes it stronger.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: With a flick of its wrist, POKENAME can release hundreds upon thousands of volts of electricity. It is too enigmatic and dangerous to properly be used as a power source at this time. It only follows the orders of a seasoned Trainer.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Its electrified tail never goes out, even underwater, sparking erratically when it's agitated. Trainers are advised to keep it away from electronic devices.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME commands lightning and soars amidst clouds. Its wings shimmer with stormy energy, a majestic sight in the azure sky.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: It once took over power lines throughout an entire city to channel its music to hapless crowds. The aftermath caused several power outages and nasty headaches.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: The storm cloud swirling around its tail is said to mirror its mood, darkening and rumbling when it's angry. When a POKEMAME is extremely furious, the lightning coming from its tail turns blue.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME nests at the top of mountains, causing a perpetual storm. It is said the deadly storm that surrounds its home only calms for a pure-hearted trainer with a soul of steel. Whenever POKENAME roars, a clap of thunder is sure to follow.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME hides itself within cumulus clouds, its electric stores slowly turning them dark and thunderous. Once its current hiding spot turns thunderous, it teleports to another, "clean" cloud to hide.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME nests at the top of mountains, causing a perpetual storm. It is said the deadly storm that surrounds its home only calms for a pure-hearted trainer with a soul of steel. Whenever POKENAME roars, a clap of thunder is sure to follow.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's fire burns forever and cannot be extinguished. Even water only strengthens the fire.
Author: TheFinalKalgonus

Entry: If POKENAME's Trainer throws it into a starry night sky, POKENAME will fly similar to a shooting star. The further POKENAME is thrown, the more POKENAME will listen to its Trainer.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: Upon fusing Moltres with itself, its flames grow to a strength too powerful for its own body. This causes it to transform into a creature made of pure fire.
Author: pastamanjase

Entry: POKENAME have been seen accidentally incinerating their antennae. This Pokémon can survive swimming in molten lava.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: A regal Pokémon that will only follow those it deems worthy. When it has chosen such a Trainer, its flames burn as brightly as stars in the night.
Author: dicedragon20

Entry: POKENAME has the power to control all kinds of fire. It is able to conjure images of a towering phoenix in place of its diminutive form.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Spirits that have passed in volcanic eruptions gather to form POKENAME. This tormented Pokémon is bonded to a scorching keystone.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: POKENAME blows highly pressurized hot steam from its mouth.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: This legendary Pokémon was born in the heart of a volcano. It's said that seeing this Pokémon is a sign of spring coming.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME amuses itself by invading dreams and engulfing everything in flames. Any burns a victim suffers in this crimson nightmare also manifest in reality.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: POKENAME amuses itself by invading dreams and engulfing everything in flames. Any burns a victim suffers in this crimson nightmare also manifest in reality.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: POKENAME bursts into flames when it's being attacked. It steals the souls of its enemies from their ashes.
Author: kingeroyal

Entry: After POKENAME heats itself up, it turns to ashes to then be reborn.
Author: kingeroyal

Entry: POKENAME produces flames anywhere, even underwater. It prefers to perch high in reclusive places, untouched from human life.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: A POKENAME is never satisfied with its attempts to mimic Moltres. It gets livid if the lighter by its back burns up the leaves along its wings.
Author: squawkabairdy

Entry: Infused with light and dark magic, POKENAME gathers energy while dormant in the sun. Legend foretells that it will one day incinerate the world.
Author: the_smirker

Entry: Trainers climbing Mt. Ember are warned to stay aware of colonies of POKENAME. POKENAME are temperamental and prone to aggression, commanding the magma within their volcano homes as a fiery weapon.
Author: Katie

Entry: Scientists have given it the moniker of the "Falling Star". There is no known limit to how hot its flames can actually grow. As a result, some believe POKENAME carries a small sun in its body.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: A few days before a volcanic eruption, POKENAME can be seen making dams out of rocks to redirect lava flows. However, most of the year it spends its times lazing around the active crater.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: When its fiery heart is exposed to Red Nectar, its passionate intensity is seen in its feathers fluttering through the air. Its dance is complex and vexing, as is the irreducible complexity that comes with life.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Whenever a drought occurs, POKENAME's blazing fire thrives. The flames can ignite the bone-dry grass, which causes many wildfires across the region.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: Its body can produce virtually infinite amounts of heat due to nuclear fission. Legends say it has reduced hundreds of planets to nothing but magma and ash.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The sheer elemental energy that pervades POKENAME causes it to combust eternally. The intense heat releases toxic compounds.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME's fiery wings amplify the warmth of the sun. If the sunshine outside is making you feel relaxed or sleepy, it may have just flown by.
Author: noel5229

Entry: It curls its tail tightly around sunken treasures, claiming them as its own. These treasures often remain hidden in its underwater lair.
Author: .izik

Entry: It splashes water at its opponent with such precision and force that it could level a small home. This powerful spray leaves foes stunned.
Author: .izik

Entry: It absorbs lightning through its horn, making its body glow brilliantly in deep waters. This luminous effect helps it navigate and ward off predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its nose contains a buoyant gas, causing it to float above the water while it sleeps. With its nose exposed it can smell airborne predators approaching even while resting.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are said to hold great draconic powers within their genes. They are very elusive Pokémon, only commonly being found around areas that emanate draconic energy.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME sleeps in clusters on the walls of sea caves. If disturbed, the entire cluster drops into the water in unison, unleashing a synchronized Thunder Wave attack.
Author: .izik

Entry: A rare species of POKENAME. It is sometimes called 'The Hydra of the Seas'.
Author: Toxicrown

Entry: Many cultures believe that to see a POKENAME in one's lifetime is a divine blessing and will lead to good fortune. The two heads tend to move in harmony with each other, never moving in opposing directions.
Author: FaeFlame

Entry: POKENAME can summon powerful rainstorms when in danger, cloaking itself in heavy rainfall to escape predators. The storms it creates often leave entire areas drenched for days.
Author: .izik

Entry: A highly sought-after Pokémon by high-class Trainers, POKENAME's fur is among the most luxurious. However, this has led to it being hunted to near extinction.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Draconic energy is stored in the bulb on POKENAME's tail. It is known to be very docile and prefers a solitary lifestyle.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: With its long and narrow body, POKENAME is well suited to hunting through the burrows of other Pokémon. It is popular with younger Trainers for its cute appearance and social nature.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME's pink leaves store sunlight during the day and release a soft, calming aroma at night. Trainers report feeling unusually serene when resting near it.
Author: jaminmcready
