Entry: POKENAME protects itself by igniting flames from its tail, fueled by the toxic film it secretes for defense.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: When it flaps its wings, it releases bursts of hot air, creating gusts that disorient foes. These waves of heat also give it an advantage in aerial battles.
Author: .izik

Entry: Though a timid Pokémon by nature, POKENAME will attack by whipping its hairs of flame when threatened.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: An armory of POKENAME is enough to keep a small village warm. Hugging one can cure hypothermia.
Author: Neonriser

Entry: POKENAME does not produce enough flame to fly. Instead, it uses its fiery wings for defense.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: POKENAME brings a warming glow to those that encounter it. It is said that POKENAME shimmers in vivid colors before those able to find love in anyone.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME uses the flames on its back to propel itself forward in wild jump kicks. It can also use this ability to run faster.
Author: robosoup

Entry: If an angry Cyndaquil goes beyond its limits and perishes, POKENAME bursts out of its body. These are highly uncontrollable Pokémon.
Author: mrbapcik

Entry: Sprites of fire and ash, POKENAME whisk around open areas, entrancing watchers with their fiery quiver.
Author: togetik

Entry: Its blade's flames correspond to the sword's emotions. It flares up when it's angry or surprised.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Its guard's flames correspond to the sword's emotions. It flares up when it's angry or surprised.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: The flames on its tail burn brightly when threatened. When fighting, they will enflame their ribbons and lash them out against their foes.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: When threatened, POKENAME will spew molten sand from its mouth onto its attacker. It lives in harsh desert climates, radiating its heat through the flames on its back.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Flocks of POKENAME sleep on fruit trees and sometimes doze off right in the middle of a meal. These Pokémon live in large families.
Author: mrbapcik

Entry: As it rolls, it leaves a burning path in its wake, scorching anything it touches. This blazing trail makes it a formidable foe during battles.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its flames blaze intensely whenever it cries, making it difficult to comfort. This emotional outburst often forces others to keep their distance.
Author: .izik

Entry: A swirling vortex of flames surrounds its den, deterring would-be intruders. Only the bravest Pokémon dare approach its blazing lair.
Author: .izik

Entry: It emits flames from its sides to fly and protect itself. The flames serve as propulsion to keep it aloft.
Author: Abhatu

Entry: While POKENAME can use Fire-Type moves, it must be careful not to overexert itself: if its moist body dries out, it becomes deeply unhealthy. As a result, POKENAME tend to dwell near peaceful rivers and streams.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: If submerged in a pond, it causes the water to boil instantly. This strange ability makes it a dangerous companion around water.
Author: .izik

Entry: When POKENAME is threatened, the parasitic mushrooms on its back burst into flames, releasing clouds of spore-filled smoke. The mushrooms have great health benefits and can be boiled to make a spicy herbal tea.
Author: sadfroghours

Entry: It resides on islands made of cooled magma, finding warmth in the volcanic rock. This environment ensures it stays comfortable despite any changes in weather.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its speed increases significantly when it consumes spicy peppers. These fiery treats fuel both its flame and its agility.
Author: .izik

Entry: It channels embers into its punches, delivering fiery blows to opponents. Each strike leaves a smoldering mark on whatever it hits.
Author: .izik

Entry: The flames on POKENAME come out when it is battling, when it is excited, or whenever it sneezes. As a result, it is not considered suitable for riding.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Despite its hydrodynamic form, it does not enjoy swimming. As it chooses to move sluggishly on land, it is left vulnerable to predators.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: It controls its flames with psychic powers, shaping them into precise forms. This unique skill makes its fire-based attacks highly unpredictable.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are mainly nocturnal and possess a wide, varied diet of both physical matter and dreams. They hunt and scavenge with their flames unlit, but young POKENAME have trouble controlling their embers when happy and full.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It has a timid disposition, but watch out! If POKENAME turns away from you, it's likely to blast you with fire from its back.
Author: 22ndsolstice

Entry: The fires erupting from POKENAME are well above 10,000 ℉. Trainers often find it difficult to manage this Pokémon due to the immense heat it radiates.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: The fires erupting from POKENAME are well above 10,000 ℉. Trainers often find it difficult to manage this Pokémon due to the immense heat it radiates.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME are surprisingly aggressive and hostile when approached. They can heat their fangs to be hot enough to melt through even the toughest steel.
Author: EvilGammon

Entry: POKENAME's powerful legs and flaming wings make it uncommonly nimble. It attempts short flights while further honing its flames.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: The tendency of POKENAME to leap through tree branches and ambush prey is a growing cause of forest fires.
Author: NexusShenanigans

Entry: You can recognize a dam created by POKENAME from the light plumes of smoke that appear overhead. They're a favored companion of charcoal burners for their love of both collecting and burning wood.
Author: craigprime

Entry: POKENAME's flames are a formidable addition to its blade, flaring and releasing intense heat during combat.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME's flames are a formidable secondary defense to its blade, flaring and releasing intense heat during combat.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Its fur is completely non-flammable; however, it secretes an oil into certain parts of its body to engulf them in flames to ward off predators.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: This small Pokémon likes to be alone. If it is threatened, the flames on its body will flare up.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: It moves on land by bouncing around, producing heat energy. POKENAME uses this energy to ignite its tail and attack foes from behind.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: POKENAME can be found basking in volcanic regions. It shrouds itself in lava and waits to hunt passerby Pokémon.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: When approached, POKENAME breathes a thick cloud of steam at others in order to obscure their vision. The last thing most of its prey see are piercing red eyes from within the sweltering mist.
Author: sk372

Entry: This insect is often seen hunting defenseless prey during forest fires. Its stingers are known to grow red hot when angered.
Author: puppetmaster64

Entry: POKENAME is a Typhlosion that evolved a bit differently. Its blue fire is intensely hot, so hot that Trainers have gotten burns by standing near it.
Author: thisisaplaceholder

Entry: In order to perfect its fiery skills, POKENAME seeks much tougher opponents to challenge. It will often becomes fierce rivals with Charizard.
Author: ratmerchant

Entry: POKENAME love playing around active steam geysers, or bathing in hot springs to absorb volcanic nutrients.
Author: weedspagon_real

Entry: POKENAME moves slowly, its body crackling with quiet heat. The ground beneath it hardens into smooth black stone, guiding travelers as they navigate unfamiliar terrain.
Author: mgfox_66676

Entry: POKENAME may still have physical wings, but the heat of their flames makes it impossible to check. They propel themselves with great jets of fire.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: This Pokémon is extremely hot-tempered. Its powerful eruptions of energy can create thunderstorms above it.
Author: milchik

Entry: This Pokémon is the ultimate survivalist. It has adapted to having hyper-insulative fur that can be set alight at will to ward off the cold.
Author: chaos_emblemx

Entry: They are often blamed for volcanic eruptions as they tunnel through the earth. They emit flammable gas from their mouths which ignites when enraged.
Author: HummusIsHome

Entry: A valiant hero who would give its life to save those it cares for. The cross flames on its back burn through its soul the more power it calls for.
Author: theeggoverlord

Entry: Living deep beneath volcanoes, POKENAME swim through lava like water, their durable skin impervious to heat. It is believed that earthquakes during eruptions are caused by POKENAME hastily relocating before they're caught in the blast.
Author: sk372

Entry: The heat of POKENAME's blade ignites anything it touches, even when it isn't aflame. On contact, it can even generate explosions.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: A telltale sign of the presence of POKENAME in an area are the thin, burnt slice marks it leaves when training its flaming blades on rocks and trees.
Author: bee4082

Entry: When its rage peaks, POKENAME will rub their ribbons together to create large explosions. Trainers should be weary if they enter their habitat.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: Legend states that POKENAME pushed the continents apart with explosive force. Wherever it steps, ash and ruin are left in its wake.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: It tests its endurance by sinking its tail into pools of lava, competing against other POKENAME. The tails of veterans are entirely composed of magma.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: While POKENAME is naturally docile, it has a fierce temper. When its rage is set off, it creates a huge explosive blast from its fur, burning everything around it while camouflaging itself with a draconic aura.
Author: Beatdoof

Entry: The emotions of those who wish on POKENAME fuel its sealed flames. Once every 1000 years, these flames break free and it awakens.
Author: coridiant

Entry: POKENAME uses its gem-like eyes to create beams of heat hot enough to melt through rock. It vents the intense amount of heat in its body through the flames on its back.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME prefers volcanic and ashy areas to call home. The flames that emit from its body flicker in accordance to the volcano's dormancy. Should they blaze up suddenly, an eruption is imminent.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME constantly spews intense flames from inside its body. Despite this, its body is cold to the touch.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: In place of wings, POKENAME is coated in fire, allowing it to burn foes. However, the sound of the flames sometimes cause it to get disoriented.
Author: Canada

Entry: Though shy and timid by nature, POKENAME will often let its emotions out in a truly explosive manner. Extreme care is required during these outbursts.
Author: dagoth.lluna

Entry: Its flames are so bright, it can be spotted from over 100 miles away. It'll guide hikers lost in the mountains back to safety.
Author: typhloquil

Entry: They battle one another for territory using violent explosive attacks. These duels are extremely hazardous, and should only be observed from afar.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: POKENAME hunts by leaping from the water and biting at anything flying above. Once it latches onto something, it doesn't let go, dragging its prey beneath the water's surface.
Author: sk372

Entry: It likes to curl up in its shell when it naps. When it wakes, it nips at the first thing it sees as a sign of affection, not understanding how strong its jaws actually are. There is a proverb to let sleeping POKENAME stand up on their own.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME propel themselves to higher areas using strong blasts of water from their mouths. They can live in water or on land. They are often found dancing around gleefully.
Author: totodile.

Entry: It is playful and competitive to a degree that most Trainers find exhausting. Surprisingly, its bite force is relatively weak.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: A POKENAME's body is essentially a mobile, steaming, bubbling brook. It concentrates lots of hot water in its jaw and bites foes, scalding them.
Author: totodile.

Entry: POKENAME likes to play in puddles during the rain. Unfortunately, when it gets excited, it also tends to let out an electrical shock.
Author: ProjectAlpha22

Entry: POKENAME uses its tail as an air pump to bounce to places. Sometimes it forgets that it can do this and stares at the ground, afraid to jump down.
Author: totodile.

Entry: It can be given a Liechi Berry to improve its strength in a pinch, which makes its jaw stronger until the battle is over. It chomps down on opponents with enough force to break boulders.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It tags alongside its Trainer, its protective nature making it wary of any strangers drawing near. Even faces familiar to the Trainer must be wary; if they aren't familiar enough to POKENAME, they risk getting bitten.
Author: sk372

Entry: In the water, they will snap their powerful jaws down on prey and hold them in place with their feelers.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: It will share the accessories on its ring, but only if traded something equally pretty or valuable. Any who try to take them by force will be given a nasty bite from its powerful jaws.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME will bite just about anything it can get its jaws on. It is a very impatient Pokémon, preferring to just attack than to wait for the perfecting opening to strike.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is very dangerous, as its powerful jaws will clamp down on anything that moves near it. There are rumors that POKENAME lurk in sewers, though this appears unlikely since POKENAME are often observed basking in the sun.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME has a contentious reputation as a pet mostly due to its way of showing affection. The longer it holds onto you after biting, the more it loves you. The longest recorded POKENAME bite is currently 6 hours.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME live in polluted swamps. This Pokémon communicates through biting: gentle affectionate nibbles for friends, and harsh chomps for foes!
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It uses both the cannons on its back and its sharp maw to attack opponents in battle. After a hard fight, it enjoys eating a Precooked Burger, as do many Trainers.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Once POKENAME have clamped their teeth onto their prey, they use the static generated as it tries to wrestle free to subdue it.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: POKENAME glides through rivers with serpentine grace. Its powerful jaws and dragon-like instincts make it a formidable hunter in both land and water.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: It tries to disguise itself as a regular flower to lure in its prey and entrap them in its massive jaws.  Unfortunately for POKENAME,  few are fooled.
Author: bostroms

Entry: When a POKENAME clamps down with its jaws, it will refuse to let go under any circumstances. It has a tendency to go after Fire-type Pokémon since their fire-based attacks help regulate POKENAME's cold-blooded body.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: While Bulbasaur is known to walk slowly on land, POKENAME uses its wings to fly around. These wings also help keep POKENAME warm during the winter.
Author: themadcactus

Entry: Wild POKENAME are frequently found on the outskirts of forests, having the advantage of both sticking to the sides of trees and flying across twigs.
Author: themadcactus

Entry: POKENAME soars high above the forests, casting shade with its leafy canopy. It disperses seeds and pollen, fostering life wherever it flies.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: The Pidgey head is the only one with consciousness as the Exeggutor body is only a diversion. Despite its small wings, it is still able to fly using its unusual psychic powers.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME can't help gorging itself on every source of food it can find. In lean times, it finds Pokémon in need and regurgitates food to share.
Author: Leshii

Entry: POKENAME's wings expel puffs of toxic gas as it flies, leaving a faint purple haze in the air. It prefers to roost near industrial zones, where the pollution enhances its strength.
Author: .izik

Entry: Possessing no limbs, wild POKENAME rely on string to move large distances. The feathers inhibit it during rain or snow, giving little advantage.
Author: themadcactus

Entry: A POKENAME can remember everywhere it's ever been. It uses its time in its hard shell to perfect its mental cartography.
Author: bee4082

Entry: POKENAME hunts for insects among dead leaves. It will furiously peck at anyone who tries to see what lies under its vines.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: This Pokémon makes its nests out of sticks and strings. Any Pokémon that tries to steal a POKENAME's eggs will end up stuck in a web.
Author: themadcactus

Entry: Instead of eating bugs, POKENAME relies on eating flower nectar and dew, which is more difficult to come by given the increased size and body weight. It requires at least 1 pound of nectar and dew every day to fill POKENAME's stomach.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: It has strong swimming muscles, allowing it to swim against most currents easily. It goes on land to feed, eating the worms and small bugs that inhabit the riverside.
Author: sk372

Entry: Their sharp beak is coated with a venomous layer of saliva that dissolves shells and nuts over time. This allows them to obtain exclusive food sources unavailable to other forest Pokémon.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME digs through the dirt with its beak, frantically searching for Evolution stones. It can persist for days, never stopping until it unearths one.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME remains motionless in trees, blending in with its hardened, brown feathers. If disturbed, it will release a cloud of fine dust that causes mild paralysis before taking flight.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is a very tiny bird Pokémon that lets itself float on the wind wherever it may want to go. It has the power to teleport if anyone comes near.
Author: Smallcutekitty

Entry: POKENAME is a very tiny golden bird Pokémon that lets itself float on the wind wherever it may want to go. It will teleport away if it feels endangered.
Author: Smallcutekitty

Entry: This fusion's plumage is highly attractive to other Pidgey. Scientists worry this will negatively impact their courting rituals.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: These skittish Pokémon are known to observe campers go about their day. When spotted, they are nearly impossible to catch as their sleek wings and light bodies allow them to escape quite easily.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is too fat to fly. It makes its nest in burrows at the base of trees.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME glides through the morning mist, its wings coated in a fine, reflective dust. It flutters above flower fields, leaving behind tiny sparkling trails as it moves.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite it resembling an immature Pidgeotto, POKENAME is far from it. Its bigger body allows it to glide through deep forests and hunt prey at tripled speeds, but being bigger means that it requires much more food than a normal Pidgey.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME is easily swept away by strong wind as it flies, which often frustrates it. POKENAME has a short temper and will split trees in half with a lightning bolt, leaving it dizzy and exhausted.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME flutters playfully through meadows, singing a high-pitched melody as it flies. Those who hear its tune often feel a sudden drowsiness, making it an effective deterrent for predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME chirps joyfully at sunrise, spreading a calming energy wherever it flies. Its eggshell glitsens in the sunlight if it is healthy.
Author: .izik

Entry: It lingers by its nest after gaining flight, which helps it develop deeper bonds with Pokémon and people nearby. People who give it a Genius Feather are said to have good luck for a week.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Before building a nest, POKENAME uses its psychic abilities to determine if the area will flood in the future. If safe, it weaves a sturdy nest using gathered weeds and vines.
Author: .izik

Entry: The dark markings by POKENAME's eyes reduce the glare it encounters when it stares in the direction of the sun. It is difficult to surprise due to its awareness.
Author: .realthree

Entry: It travels in large herds for protection. It is bad at flying, so it typically uses its wings and tail feathers to attract mates instead.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: Its head feathers don't shine as brilliantly as an ordinary Pidgeot, making it more vulnerable to being rejected by a potential mate. Despite this setback, it still retains its incredible feats of speed and strength.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME is fast and agile in the air. It flies from place to place, never staying in one spot.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: A fusion used commonly by beginner Trainers. POKENAME are generally easy to train and enjoy searching for Berries to share with their Trainers.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: POKENAME relies on its excellent thievery to survive in the wild. It uses its quick feet to run around, and it uses its wings to fly away.
Author: omegarockster

Entry: POKENAME clings to trees with its sharp talons. Its long neck allows it hunt for its prey with speed and ease.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's way of hunting for prey is different based on their nature. While some POKENAME rely on the wind to float towards and catch prey as it passes, some will instead bury themselves in the dirt and eat whatever is living inside it.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: When flying, POKENAME extends its wings and unleashes a loud buzzing noise. This makes it very noticeable to the prey it chases.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's require more energy in their larger bodies, so they have developed sharper beaks and prioritize hunting on land than in the skies.
Author: themadcactus

Entry: POKENAME is primarily active in the morning when looking for twigs for its nest. Its wings allow it to evade predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon flutters around creating intricate flight patterns that some believe carry hidden messages. Its mysterious behavior has puzzled researchers for generations.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: It uses its psychic abilities to run faster. POKENAME starts mastering its telekinetic powers at a young age by lifting Berries from bushes.
Author: .izik

Entry: Wild POKENAME don't hesitate to tear apart the bases of trees in order to find small, edible Pokémon. However, when domesticated, POKENAME are surprisingly patient and tolerant, and have a sharp memory.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: It leaves behind puddles of sticky berry juice, then hides nearby. Once enough insects are stuck, it goes to feast on the mixture of tasty juice and bugs.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME collects Hondew Berries in its beak and stores them in hidden nests. Its feathers carry a faint honey-like scent, making POKENAME a favorite target for hungry Bug-type Pokémon.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is self-aware of how odd its long neck and tiny head appear to others, but more often than not, other Pidgey admire it. They even rely on POKENAME to use its long neck to dig for Bug-type Pokémon from the ground.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: Despite it being covered in a massive number of feathers, POKENAME is pretty lightweight due to how small their actual body is. The feathers are great heat insulators and are commonly in pillows.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME glides over swamps in search of prey, striking from above with its venom-coated beak. A single peck can be enough to paralyze a Poliwag instantly.
Author: .izik

Entry: A thick, inky brown goo seeps from POKENAME's tail feathers, giving off an intensely pungent odor. This foul-smelling substance is used to repel predators from its nesting grounds.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's appearance is misleading when viewed from below as it flies. Some claim that when struck by lightning, it discharges powerful electric energy in return, often scorching the ground beneath it.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME play pranks on each other to make each other laugh. The less amused they appear to be, the more they actually enjoyed the joke.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: Whenever it gets cold, some people opt to give them a Health Feather before turning it back towards the wild. The feather helps it endure life's troubles by giving it a little extra heat to keep warm.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME can strip a Watmel Berry tree bare in less than an hour. It knocks the berries loose mid-flight with powerful wing beats before devouring them.
Author: .izik

Entry: A Spicy Curry, when made with an herbal and pungent masala, gives it an adrenaline boost that helps it win Little Cup tournaments. After a round of battles, it enjoys a fresh mango lassi to help cool down.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME's wings have scales along the back that allow it to negate electricity from wild Pokémon while it flies. POKENAME can be seen bathing itself in sand and mud before blowing it off by flying around at top speeds of 100 mph.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: When two POKENAME confront each other over a single mate, they begin to scream at each other, each attempting to be louder than the other. These fights tend to last for up to two hours, and by then, the mate they were fighting for will have left.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: The wings are a vestigial structure, too small to support wild POKENAME. POKENAME have sharper beaks and keener eyes to seek prey on land.
Author: themadcactus

Entry: It uses its rock-solid skull to headbutt trees, dislodging fruits, nuts and bugs for it to eat. Overzealous POKENAME occasionally end up knocking the entire tree down.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's impeccable hearing allows it to hear bug Pokémon crawling 10 feet underneath the ground. Several Trainers have had to be rescued from falling into one of these holes created and left by POKENAME.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: It lives life in subzero conditions and has limited flight mobility. People give it a Resist Feather as good luck, as it develops bonds and grudges that last a lifetime.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Its heavy body and iron bones mean that its wings are completely incapable of lifting its weight. Despite this, it is an agile flier thanks to its innate magnetism.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Tame POKENAME are often used by farmers, as they both function as a garden shovel and pest control. In the wild, POKENAME use their knife-like beaks to eat hard fruits like oranges.
Author: TheScribe

Entry: It uses both its ribbons and beak to look for seeds to eat. It is popular among rookie Trainers for its docile nature and ease of training.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: Commonly found in suburbia, POKENAME gathers seeds from birdfeeders and stores it within itself. However, this causes it to be targeted by Rattata.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME is a very sought-after wild fusion for beautiful- and rare-pet owners. Its wings and tails are soft as silk, and it only become more valuable as it evolves.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME uses its tail feathers to adjust its position mid-air, allowing it to deliver precise aerial kicks. Its movements are swift enough to counter even the most agile opponents.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its long, flexible arms to reach inside trees and grab its prey. It cannot fly well, which results in most POKENAME being an easy target for even the weakest of predators.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME uses its tail to lure out bug Pokémon, simulating a ray of sunlight for it to follow. It stuns bigger bug Pokémon by whipping its tail at them, paralyzing their bodies from the outside.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME's wings create soft, soothing vibrations as it flies, lulling nearby Pokémon to sleep. If it gets angry, it will puff up its chest and let out a loud, echoing chirp in frustration.
Author: .izik

Entry: The feathers of a wild POKENAME are completely immune to fire. Researchers found that the skin of the creature, while not flammable, can be burnt.
Author: themadcactus

Entry: The fire on its tail burns brightest on days with clear weather. It hides underground from rain to protect its flame.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: POKENAME perches on tree limbs, digging its talons deep to absorb nutrients. When it has fed enough, the bud on its body pulses rhythmically.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's gas-filled, feathery body allows it to float gently over flower fields. Its talons are deceptively strong, capable of seizing prey like Bellsprout in an instant.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME soars over carrot fields, searching for diseased or damaged crops. It plucks them from the ground with its beak, keeping the fields healthy.
Author: .izik

Entry: The extra bundle of feathers covering POKENAME's shoulders give it extra warmth, and allow it to withstand colder environments. Despite this, it still chooses to remain in warm places with sunlight anyway.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME's squishy body allows it to squeeze inside trees and eat any and all bug Pokémon it finds. It is able to remember every feasting spot by leaving a small portion of its body nearby.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME screeches into the holes of trees and cave walls, causing small Pokémon to come out, stumbling and confused. There is no set schedule for when POKENAMEs are awake or asleep, as they only rest when they need to.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME's feathers store static electricity, crackling softly as it flaps its wings. When it perches on power lines, it absorbs small amounts of energy to maintain its strength.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's keen eyesight allows it to detect even the slightest movement in tall grass. Once it spots prey, it launches a precise blast of flame from its beak.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME shakes its feathers rapidly to scatter glowing embers in the air, creating a dazzling display at dusk. If threatened, it ignites its beak, making itself appear threatening.
Author: .izik

Entry: The tips of POKENAME's feathers secrete a clear, paralyzing toxin. When threatened, it flutters its wings to scatter the venom and stun larger predators before escaping.
Author: .izik

Entry: Scientists theorize that Tyrunt could have looked similar to POKENAME in ancient times. Its beak-like jaws are powerful enough to crush small boulders.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME secretes a Chesto Berry-scented sap from its beak to lure in unsuspecting prey. Once they get close, it dispatches them with a sudden Gust attack.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's wings are covered in soft, fluffy down that repels dust and dirt. It glides effortlessly through the sky, leaving behind delicate trails of shimmering feathers.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME emits distressed chirping noises to lure in unsuspecting prey like Ekans. Once close enough, it drags them beneath the sand's surface.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is not afraid of heights and crawls over branches. It is in constant search of food, as the fungi on its back slowly extract its nutrients.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It has an abundance of pride in its abilities. Trainers value POKENAME for their ability to spot hidden items from yards away.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: POKENAME's eyes can spot even the smallest bug Pokémon in the smallest crack of a tree trunk. It rubs its body against trees to release powder that causes bug Pokémon to crawl out paralyzed or poisoned.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME perches on lily pads, waiting for prey like Feebas to emerge before striking with precise pecks. On rainy days, it spreads its wings wide to collect raindrops, cooling itself in the humid air.
Author: .izik

Entry: The long, wide beak easily allows this Pokémon to gather Berries from bushes with ease. It uses its tail to roast the gathered Berries.
Author: themadcactus

Entry: When this bird Pokémon is seen flying on foggy mornings, it is said that its tail acts as a beacon for lost travelers, leading them towards shelter.
Author: themadcactus

Entry: Wild POKENAME often molt their own feathers and use them for dens because they won't catch fire the way twigs do.
Author: themadcactus

Entry: When the skies are calm, it roosts up high to scan the horizon. To find a blue POKENAME feather is considered very lucky.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: POKENAME makes its nest with stolen money or belongings between the sticks and twigs of its base. If it finds a shinier nest from another POKENAME, it will attempt to fight for ownership of it.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: Even though their bodies are not able to fly well, POKENAME still tries to glide across trees for its prey. Even after hitting its head several times on the way down, POKENAME will still climb back up and try again.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME becomes highly agitated if the wind ruffles its feathers too much. It dive-bombs intruders from treetops, striking repeatedly with its talons until it feels its pride is restored.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is fiercely loyal and will chirp loudly to warn its Trainer of danger. If threatened, it exhales bursts of warm air from its beak, singeing any would-be attackers.
Author: .izik

Entry: Unable to reliably regulate their internal temperature, POKENAME will regularly belch flames, singeing nearby foliage. Its wings are too small for its body, so it can only manage to fly for short distances.
Author: King Mordork

Entry: Having developed claws, this Pokémon will take Berries from bushes with their claws, peeling Berries with thicker skins before roasting them.
Author: themadcactus

Entry: A POKENAME's wings cannot support it alone, but its lungs are constantly filled with hot air, making it lighter than it should be.
Author: themadcactus

Entry: Despite its large size, POKENAME only eats nuts and berries. It prefers to toast its meal, but often forgets the intensity of its flames. It throws a tantrum when it's left with nothing but a pile of ash afterwards.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: POKENAME's existence on land and sea led to its unique method of catching prey that is unlike most Pokémon's. One POKENAME scares bug Pokémon into falling into nearby bodies of water for other POKENAME in its pod to consume.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: Instead of taking flight, it teleports into the air instead. Though it sleeps for 15 hours a day, it is fairly productive while awake.
Author: frokachu

Entry: POKENAME's feathers shimmer faintly with psychic energy, allowing it to sense changes in the wind. It can teleport vast distances without ever needing to rest.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has powerful physical potential, which often gives it a cocky, narcissistic demeanor. It spends more time preening its feathers than it does actually training.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME grabs at prey using its vine-like talons before striking with its sharp beak. Once caught, it constricts its victim tightly to prevent escape.
Author: .izik

Entry: These Pokémon are known to occupy similar lands as Spearow. To defend against their fierce pecks, they simply use their shells as shields.
Author: themadcactus

Entry: POKENAME is able to sense many bug Pokémon in a single area, but its hunting ability is very unorthodox. It sits near the general area with its mouth wide open for up to 8 hours, hoping its prey will happen to crawl inside.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME nests near leek fields, using its sharp beak to uproot and feast on crops. It fiercely defends its territory from those who try to harvest its favorite food.
Author: .izik

Entry: The thick mud-like substance that covers POKENAME's body is highly toxic. It frequently flies into smokestacks to absorb pollutants, growing stronger from the contamination.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite its slow movement, POKENAME is an exceptional hunter. It lays up against trees, blending into the bark, and strikes unsuspecting prey that stops to rest on it.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: It releases noxious fumes to scare away intruders to its home, which causes a coughing fit when inhaled. A traveler will make an offering of a Clever Feather to placate it before continuing on.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Known for its relentless and aggressive nature, POKENAME will destroy anything that stands in its path. It is theorized that entire ecosystems have been altered due to its presence.
Author: Rotcivosk

Entry: POKENAME spends most of its time sleeping, floating on the surface of rivers and lakes. It often travels hundreds of miles as it naps, drifting on the current.
Author: regula

Entry: POKENAME is believed to be a prehistoric form of Feraligatr. Fusion seemingly brought back this ancient ancestor.
Author: edeniteiron

Entry: POKENAME is aggressive in the extreme, and when it makes its home in city sewers, it causes a huge problem for the technicians working there.
Author: .realthree

Entry: This Pokémon is quicker than it looks like. Once it catches its prey, POKENAME drags it under the water that boils around it because of its body heat.
Author: milchik

Entry: POKENAME can effortlessly control both water and electricity. It often crafts itself boxing gloves made of water, sparking with electrical currents.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Despite its massive size, its powerful muscles make POKENAME incredibly fast. To conserve energy, it prefers to finish opponents quickly with a crushing bite from its powerful jaws, avoiding drawn-out battles.
Author: amiel997

Entry: A POKENAME with large top fins is deemed the leader of its pod. It doesn't have much control over its small arms.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME's powerful jaws allow it to catch and eat small fish Pokémon in a single bite. It prides itself in its catches and will refuse to share with the rest of its flock.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Thanks to red film around its eyes, it can see perfectly even in the swampiest, smoggiest, or sandiest environments. Its massive jaws latch onto prey and never let go until the prey stops moving.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Despite its intimidating appearance, it is just a gentle giant. When in danger, it will use the light from its sail to distract enemies.
Author: Trietceratops Horridus

Entry: This Pokémon likes to chill on the riverbank and catch fish Pokémon for food. It walks on four legs.
Author: Trietceratops Horridus

Entry: The scalding water generated at the end of POKENAME's tail bursts forth with such enormous force that it creates a noisy rushing sound, similar to a waterfall.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME only appears in deep bodies of water. It can create whirlpools by spinning its body at incredible speeds.
Author: bee4082

Entry: As a vestigial feature from its Feraligatr half, POKENAME sleeps with one eye open, resting one brain hemisphere at a time. However, it doesn't need to see a foe to know to teleport away; its psychic powers allow it to detect them even in sleep.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: This fusion resulted in a slightly shorter, portlier Feraligatr. While its physique has been reduced, POKENAME now possesses strong psychic abilities.
Author: mirby

Entry: Should it hear an enemy approaching, it will run into a patch of tall grass. It can dash at high speeds by using its hind legs.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME take turns guarding their burrows when it is time to sleep, as thieves are known to take berries from them. They attack thieves using their stinger, which oozes with a venomous gel.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME extends part of its gooey body as a tail to lift itself up, gaining a better vantage point to observe others. This lets it transform better, increasing the accuracy of its shapeshifting.
Author: sk372

Entry: Often called the sentry of the sky, POKENAME often flies around the area near its nest. It shrieks loudly to scare away any threatening Pokémon.
Author: SentretVStar

Entry: They stand guard outside their burrows, their keen eyes able to spot predators using camouflage in the forest. When spotted, POKENAME will pretend to be sick and limp away, so that they lure the predator away before making a quick retreat back home.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It flutters both tails rapidly to lift itself just high enough to see over tall grass. When startled, it slaps them against the ground to launch into the air and glides away.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: They wait until nighttime to dig around a camper's backpack, rummaging for berries and other snacks. When spotted, POKENAME can find themselves caught and run away before a camper has time to stand.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME make their homes along riverbanks, hunting smaller fully aquatic Pokémon while avoiding the dangers of deeper water. Their burrows have multiple entrances, making it hard to determine where they've gone when they retreat.
Author: Katie

Entry: They scout for incoming foes. Once they have a target, several of them attack the enemy with all they have.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME colonies are very common in icy areas. They make burrows in the ice and that is where POKENAME spends most of their time.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Swarms of POKENAME consume discarded appliances from the inside out. If one spots a predator approaching, the inhabited appliance will rattle as all of the POKENAME within scatter.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: People have found POKENAME in their closet taking hangers for their ears. No one knows where it got its tail from.
Author: auroraeuphoria

Entry: It is believed by some that displaying an exaggerated statue of a POKENAME at the entrance to a business will invite good fortune. Popular media often depict them as rivals with a Zorua. They prefer to disguise themselves as household objects.
Author: El Fail

Entry: POKENAME constantly patrols its nest, keeping a lookout for danger. If it does spot danger, it will loudly screech to alert the rest of its flock.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: To communicate, they screech sharply and suddenly. These nocturnal Pokémon's cries sound like the screams of young children.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME is very high-strung, so it shivers if you pet its soft arms. The thick fur is actually meant to seal in air to warm it in cold waters.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Its strongest muscle is its large and thick tail. POKENAME pummels foes with its powerful punches and kicks, but always saves the final blow for a mighty swing of its tail.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME seeks out those who are sleeping and diligently guards them. Trainers with this Pokémon are guaranteed a safe and restful sleep every night.
Author: noel5229

Entry: POKENAME nest near beaches where they dig holes with their large flippers. Young POKENAME will playfully splash swimmers with their long tails.
Author: crusaderzakk

Entry: A POKENAME has a tail that measures more than half of its body length. It is constantly hunting for a bigger shell to live in.
Author: crusaderzakk

Entry: The shell that POKENAME resides in is very heavy. Since it is not very swift, it uses its tail and extra arms to catch food.
Author: crusaderzakk

Entry: Its mustache twitches noticeably whenever it uses a psychic ability. This behavior gives away its intentions during battles.
Author: .izik

Entry: It wags its fluffy tail to distract foes before delivering a swift uppercut. It keeps a cheerful smile throughout the entire attack.
Author: .izik

Entry: It spins thin silk around the nests of its allies, creating an early warning system. When predators approach, it chirps to alert others to flee.
Author: .izik

Entry: It refuses to stop eating once someone starts feeding it, even after becoming full. Trainers are warned not to feed wild POKENAME, as it may grow too heavy to fly.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its head tails as rotor blades to fly. Longer-tailed POKENAME are quicker and more maneuverable than their smaller-tailed variants.
Author: Gummy Wookie

Entry: POKENAME uses its head tails as rotor blades to fly. Smaller-tailed POKENAME are slower and less maneuverable than their longer-tailed variants.
Author: Gummy Wookie

Entry: The flower on its head spins to draw in air, filling its internal gas sack. This allows it to lift off the ground and float gently.
Author: .izik

Entry: The puffballs on its body are actually furry gas sacks. It uses them to float gently through the air, drifting lazily across flowerbeds.
Author: .izik

Entry: It sticks its long, furry tail into tree holes to search for valuables or food. Once it finds something, it chuckles mischievously and runs off with its prize.
Author: .izik

Entry: A POKENAME is an agile creature. When combined with its precognitive powers, this means POKENAME can avoid any danger easily.
Author: Glacierwing

Entry: It nests near herb gardens, favoring basil and thyme above all others. It often collects large bunches to store in its home.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses its furry antennae to psychically detect nearby enemies. This makes it nearly impossible to sneak up on.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its fur is composed of soft needles resembling pine needles. While harmless, they are enough to dissuade potential predators due to the spiky appearance.
Author: .izik

Entry: Pokémon dig long snaking burrows that can stretch for miles. They can dig through stone and concrete, making them terrible pets.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME glides through the skies, its long tail streaming out behind it. Thick fur muffles the sound from its wings.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: Its neck is deceptively long, able to extend up to five feet from its shell. This helps it reach distant objects while staying safely tucked away.
Author: .izik

Entry: There is a tailor in Castelia City who uses POKENAME feathers to craft luxurious winter garments. The soft and warm material makes them highly sought after.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are sensitive to pollution in the water and thrive in clean oceans. When they gather to rest, they give the appearance of giant coral reef.
Author: crusaderzakk

Entry: POKENAME loves to play with its Trainer by curling into a ball and being rolled around. Its large size and heavy weight makes it difficult for most to push it around for long, unfortunately.
Author: sk372

Entry: It channels psychic energy through its furry antlers to cleave open trees. The sap inside becomes its favorite treat.
Author: .izik

Entry: When it encounters a hungry young Pokémon, it offers them its nutritious milk. Its long, fluffy tail provides warmth and comfort while they feed.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its long, furry tails wrap around its friends on cold winter nights. This behavior helps keep them warm and builds camaraderie in their group.
Author: .izik

Entry: If bored, POKENAME will often look for unsuspecting Pokémon and tickle them with the tip of its tail using the static electricity stored inside of it.
Author: Phantom640

Entry: POKENAME is now completely silent when flying. It captures prey, then darts home into twisting burrows impossible for other Pokémon to reach.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: The fur of POKENAME gradually loses its waterproof qualities as they age. While they still live in and hunt within river environments, their burrow systems tend to be built in more swampy areas.
Author: Katie

Entry: It no longer contains the oils produced in earlier stages of their evolution that are needed to make it waterproof. Though they live in swampy environments, POKENAME prefer to make burrows among tree roots rather than along riverbanks.
Author: Katie

Entry: A stealthy and nimble Pokémon capable of hiding in tight and narrow spaces. In addition, POKENAME has the ability to alter its colors to blend in with the environment. As a result, they are difficult to find and capture.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: They love biscuits, especially those with nuts inside them. They chase after other Pokémon to take their biscuits, which is why Trainers will feed them in a separate room from the rest of the party.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Although bound to a keystone, its long body makes up for it. POKENAME is able to stretch up to 30 meters away from where its keystone is located.
Author: admiralvermin

Entry: Its fur grows fluffy during the winter, becoming especially thick if it senses an approaching blizzard. This natural adaptation helps it endure harsh cold.
Author: .izik

Entry: This multi-pawed menace hoards whatever it deems interesting. Due to its size, this can also include larger things like bikes, benches or even people.
Author: GasmaskBlacky

Entry: This multi-pawed menace hoards whatever it deems interesting. Due to its size, this can also include larger things like bikes, benches or even people.
Author: GasmaskBlacky

Entry: This Pokémon is difficult to get a good hit on in a fight due to its soft fur. Its slippery nature and boxing prowess make it a force to be reckoned with.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: POKENAME make their homes in long thin electrical cords such as headphone wires in which they can have fun zooming through their twists and turns. To this end, they will bend their homes into knots, much to the chagrin of the cords' owners.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: Although its skin secretes a fire-retardant oil, its quick-growing fur is actually incredibly dry and highly flammable.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: POKENAME is often found burrowing through turnip fields, making its home among the roots. It feasts on the crops, much to the frustration of local farmers.
Author: .izik

Entry: When its fur gets wet, it becomes greasy and slippery. This makes it incredibly difficult for predators to grab hold of it.
Author: .izik

Entry: Though incredibly affectionate, keeping a POKENAME as a pet is often discouraged due to its boundless energy. It unceasingly asks for food or play, and rarely sleeps for more than an hour a day.
Author: sk372

Entry: Anyone who has attempted to remove the Furret from the gears has been scratched. It's not stuck, it just doesn't want to leave.
Author: missingmilkman

Entry: POKENAME is quite mischievous, playing pranks on its Trainer for its own amusement. It does deeply love its Trainer though and cannot bear to see its Trainer sad.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's body is deceptively pliable, able to inflate rapidly for intimidation or deflate for evasion and infiltration. It loves having people hug and squish its soft body with all the strength they can muster.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME can wander through dense overgrowths, using the flower-like limbs to blend in. They are resistant to the various poisonous plants in these overgrowths, enjoying their unique aromas.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: It builds its den near sunflower patches, plucking seeds daily for its meals. It retreats to the safety of its home to enjoy its food without interruption, heating it with gentle flames.
Author: .izik

Entry: Though its wings make it look fierce, it is gentle and thrives in quiet households. When happy, it wraps itself around furniture and loves to nap while hanging from ceiling beams.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Its friendly face lulls foes into a false sense of security. However, it can spit acid from its mouth, catching them off guard.
Author: .izik

Entry: It loves to show off its graceful and nimble moves. If it encounters a potential mate, it will perform an elaborate courting dance.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: Although it looks like fur, its body is actually made of living birch-like wood. This gives it a unique texture and appearance.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite what it feels like, POKENAME actually does have fur. However, the substance it secretes sticks its fur together, so it resembles goo instead.
Author: Endermagnet

Entry: POKENAME is often shy when first caught, but when it bonds with its Trainer it will stick with them forever. Quite literally; its slime is like glue!
Author: Zeeroooo

Entry: It has a habit of hugging smaller Pokémon, using its stubby arms to hold them. Clever Pokémon can hide from these hugs on POKENAME's dry shell.
Author: Endermagnet

Entry: It has a habit of hugging smaller Pokémon, using its stubby arms to hold them. Researchers believe the striped shell may be a second, furled tail.
Author: Endermagnet

Entry: It has a habit of hugging smaller Pokémon, using its stubby arms to hold them. A surprising number of these Pokémon get stuck to POKENAME.
Author: Endermagnet

Entry: The honey coating its fur is rejuvenating, low in sugar and extra tasty. Researchers have documented POKENAME sharing this honey with unwell Pokémon.
Author: Endermagnet

Entry: POKENAME's limbs are very strong. It is a fast creature capable of dealing out lots of damage, but it usually won't due to its docile nature.
Author: Glacierwing

Entry: Its actual body is remarkably thin, with 90% of its bulk being fluffy fur. In winter, its coat becomes even thicker, making it look much larger than it is.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME fur is extremely soft and warm. These large Pokémon tirelessly walk in frigid environments to provide warmth to lost Pokémon and people.
Author: enderwarlock

Entry: POKENAME has a symbiotic relationship with the fungus it carries upon its back. It provides the fungus with some of the food it gathers to keep it healthy, and the fungus provides camouflage on the forest floor in return.
Author: Katie

Entry: The fur on its tail seems to move on its own, frequently rubbing the back of its head. This only worsens its chronic headaches.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME exudes a sweet smell that Bellsprout love. It always carries an extra Bellsprout around in case the one on its ear falls off.
Author: crusaderzakk

Entry: POKENAME is often seen swinging its tail around to cut things with its leaves. Over time, the tail slowly engulfs the main body until only the head remains.
Author: crusaderzakk

Entry: POKENAME cannot walk on land, so it will use its stretchy tentacles to swing from trees. Its soft fur is waterproof and is often used in modern clothing.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It wags its tail back and forth to channel its powers. Once it builds up enough psychic energy, it will unleash it in waves.
Author: .izik

Entry: It wields its leek like a lance, jabbing at foes with surprising strength. The force of its strikes is powerful enough to crack concrete.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses one head to curiously peek into others' dens while the other head keeps watch. If the den is nicer than its own, it often becomes envious and attempts to destroy it.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is very affectionate, but many people are repelled by its uncanny appearance. It often feels sad due to its lack of friends.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME often are seen at daycares keeping children occupied. It paints, plays, and makes rainbows with them.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME hops through fields and gardens at night. It is constantly on the lookout for edible fruits, seeds, or small bug Pokémon.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: During the night, it lets out a soft hoot to let others of its kind know it is safe. If the hooting ceases, danger is nearby.
Author: .izik

Entry: Small bird Pokémon, such as Pidgey and Hoothoot, sometimes live inside POKENAME's mouth; in gratitude for protection, they provide it with berries. Having a perfect sense of time, POKENAME always reminds its residents when it's time to hunt or sleep.
Author: milchik

Entry: It hoots involuntarily at night, letting predators know of its location. It frantically flies from tree to tree, hoping to find safety.
Author: .izik

Entry: Their tentacles writhe rhythmically, each one has a different time they switch position, keeping track of multiple natural events at the same time. It is said that they are aware when every species of Pokémon in a forest awakens.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME watch diligently from branches at night. On seeing a threat, they swoop down to poison and confuse the aggressor, hooting to warn forest denizens. They spin string from branches and cover it in rocks, producing a rhythmic chime-like melody.
Author: Greensnake01

Entry: POKENAME constantly creates a poison that causes blurry vision in those afflicted. At the same time every day, it secretes excess poison from its horn, smearing it on the leaves around its home.
Author: sk372

Entry: It makes its home in rafters of abandoned laboratories. It will mimic the appearance of other Hoothoot flocks in an attempt to mate.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has a coat of sturdy feathers that protect its body as it develops into its adult form. It hides in trees during the day, only becoming active at night to help it avoid danger.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME has a coat of sturdy feathers that protect its body as it develops into its adult form. It hides in trees during the day, only becoming active at night to help it avoid danger.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME's internal sense of time is disordered, so it doesn't know if it should be diurnal or nocturnal. It is thus always tired and confused.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME's tail wags back and forth while it sleeps, mirroring the ticking of a clock. If it experiences a nightmare, its tail spins so rapidly that it can knock over small objects nearby.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's head rotates slightly each hour while it sleeps, always staying aware of its surroundings. If awoken too early, it will let loose a sudden telekinetic blast in frustration.
Author: .izik

Entry: It takes most of a POKENAME's focus to coordinate their six small wings enough to fly in a straight line. To compensate, they have become well-versed in alternating their flight paths, which also helps them avoid predators.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Their perfect sense of time allows them to determine the optimal moment to begin hunting. They use their webs to ensnare prey, which they wrap in fine silk to preserve them for another meal.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME emits tiny sparks while napping during the day, occasionally letting out soft, rhythmic hoots. If startled, it discharges an accidental jolt before flapping away in confusion.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is a spritely Pokémon known for dancing in a rhythm with other POKENAME during the full moon. It can sing a soothing, enigmatic melody that lulls others to sleep.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME hides in plain sight beside clocks in store displays, standing perfectly still. Strangely, it hoots loudly at midnight, even when asleep.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its great vision to hunt other Rattata fusions at night. If it fails to catch its prey, it lets out loud, frustrated shrieks.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: Its head can turn 360 degrees, and it can control its flight path no matter what angle its head or body is turned. This makes it very tricky for prey to avoid being caught by it.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are said to appear before lost travelers, guiding them through dark forests. Though they may seem helpful, they are in fact leading these travellers astray until they are hopelessly lost.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: The clock-like growth on its back is constantly ticking. POKENAME emits cooing sounds at intervals of exactly fifteen minutes.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME spend the daytime high in the treetops, only becoming active as the sun begins to set. They aren't particularly strong but make up for it with aggression. Newer Trainers are advised to be cautious around them.
Author: Katie

Entry: It measures time to the microsecond. There's a rumor that some modern clocks are based on this Pokémon, but nobody knows if it's true.
Author: donutsbg

Entry: POKENAME often goes unnoticed, hiding among piles of its favorite snack of dried leaves and pretending to be a simple pine cone. Those that see past the deception must still be wary of it exploding in self-defense.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME hops from foot to foot faster than can be tracked due to its agitation from the specialized organs that help it track time. Farmers create straw decoys of Electric-type Pokémon to ward flocks away.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: This Pokémon has an amazing internal clock. Some Trainers use POKENAME as an alarm clock.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Its strong eyesight lets it see the movement of prey even in the darkest of forest evenings. It leaves its den and hunts at the same exact time every night.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's antlers are most solid and robust early in the morning. As the day passes, they soften and begin to "wilt," until they obscure its vision. They regain their rigidity overnight while POKENAME sleeps.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME dozes atop its springy tail, letting out soft, rhythmic hoots as it dreams. Its gentle bouncing helps lull others nearby to sleep.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can remember each sound it hears at night. When it mimics them during the day, many Trainers feel spooked.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: It preys on unsuspecting Hoothoot, which it fools with its appearance. Despite being capable of flight, wild POKENAME rarely do so.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: Incredibly shy and reclusive, POKENAME is only seen outside of its home inside tree trunks for a short time each day. During this time, it can be heard singing a quiet, slow-tempo song to itself.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME can jump incredibly high, easily able to hop over a small child in a single bound. The tips of its talons are poisonous and can irritate skin easily with just a single touch from them.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Groups of POKENAME will work together to gnaw wood down to usable sizes in a timely manner. Those that don't adhere to the strict schedule are shunned and scorned.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME can jump incredibly high, easily able to hop over a small child in a single bound. The tips of its talons are poisonous and can irritate skin easily with just a single touch from them.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME sways side to side in perfect rhythm, like a living metronome. If disturbed, it pecks furiously with its venomous beak.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has an internal organ that allows it to keep perfect track of time. It sleeps exactly one hour every night and needs a very orderly daily rhythm, otherwise it becomes stressed and aggressive.
Author: SonTyp

Entry: Male POKENAME ears can move freely to listen for danger. A special organ lets POKENAME keep perfect time based on the planet's rotation.
Author: Essie

Entry: This mace Pokémon floats in a mostly stationary position, rotating with the time of day so its handle corresponds to an analog clock's hour hand.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: With its piercing red eyes, POKENAME can see flawlessly in total darkness. It uses its large ears to detect movement beyond its line of sight.
Author: .izik

Entry: Fusion has enhanced Hoothoot's ability to sense time, and it can now sense the date of death of anyone around it. It rarely shares this information.
Author: admiralvermin

Entry: POKENAME bears an inscription on its back that claims its true powers will be revealed when the clock on its front strikes the right time. Unfortunately, the clock is broken beyond repair.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Entranced by the motion of grandfather clocks, POKENAME sways with the pendulum's rhythm. At the top of each hour, it chirps happily and emits a small burst of flame from its feathers.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME spends most of its life safely underground. The antennae contain an organ that tells it the perfect time to emerge and evolve.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME generates small electric pulses in its feathers while dreaming. If startled awake, it instinctively releases a powerful shock, briefly illuminating its surroundings.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME awaken in the early hours of the morning to get every drop of sunlight it can. Many Trainers have been awoken to the sounds of entire flocks of POKENAME.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME secures its foot to cave walls while sleeping, its mushroom-like body glowing faintly in the dark. As it rests, it makes soft, echoing hoots that soothe other Pokémon nearby.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME emits piercing supersonic hoots to disorient foes. It follows up with a swift dive and a startling Astonish attack.
Author: .izik

Entry: Just before it explodes, POKENAME lets out a rapid series of hoots and performs a small hop. The blast leaves behind only scattered feathers and ash.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's singing is helpful for making Trainers fall asleep at night. Its singing is so effective that it frequently puts itself to sleep.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: They sprout black feathers from their trunk when awake and wave their feathers to keep track of time. These feathers are said to help the children regain memories of when they were younger.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Loyal and playful, POKENAME have a great love of nighttime walks. They make great companions for those who suffer from insomnia.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME keeps a strict foraging schedule, timing its every move to avoid danger. If disrupted, the break in routine causes it debilitating levels of stress.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME roams near lampposts at night, releasing green Sleep Powder from its feathers. Its prey rarely sees it before dozing off.
Author: .izik

Entry: They control vines to give themselves a secure grip to hang upside down from. This allows them to wave their black feathers, which helps them maintain their perfect sense of time.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It likes to pilfer coins from passersby, but observation has noted that the attempts at stealing adhere to a strict schedule, allowing locals to help travelers plan their time to avoid being robbed.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME bounces around jabbing at its foes, but its attacks are fairly repetitive and predictable. Because of this, smarter Pokémon can easily outwit it.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: POKENAME makes for a tricky pet to raise, as it adheres to a strict daily schedule for feeding, recreation and so forth. Any deviation from this schedule tends to cause it stress.
Author: sk372

Entry: They prefer to wade in shallow water, as their inept legs prevent them from running away. They use their sense of time to avoid predators by traveling when their predators are asleep.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: The hands of POKENAME's clock are made of organs visible through its transparent belly. It always shows the correct time.
Author: milchik

Entry: They challenge other Pokémon to sparring matches, fighting with a high level of precision and dexterity. It is said that they have low stamina however, as no fight lasts longer than exactly ten minutes.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It adheres to a strict schedule of nightly dream consumption. If one feels a disturbance in their sleep at the same time every evening, a POKENAME is likely to be residing nearby.
Author: sk372

Entry: It can see in darkness without much effort. When it uses its psychokinetic abilities, its eyes will glow purple for a short period.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME glides silently through the night, its wings shimmering under the moonlight. With the ability to hypnotize foes, it uses its mesmerizing patterns to create illusions and escape danger.
Author: ThePandaSharky

Entry: This lazy, dopey-looking Pokémon is a welcome sight in the forest, as it is more than happy to cuddle up to any passing Pokémon or Trainers.
Author: moopse

Entry: They form groups to stalk prey at night, using a series of groans and buzzes to communicate. Their buzzes remind people of the sound of an accordion, so some aristocrats keep them as pets for their musical talents.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME has a sense of timing to the second. The connection between this and the clock-like growth on its back has not yet been adequately studied.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME use their sharp beak and claws to burrow out nests inside of tree trunks, sheltering within them during the day. At night they call out to one another with incredibly loud screeches.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME use their sharp beak and claws to burrow out nests inside of tree trunks, sheltering within them during the day. At night they call out to one another with incredibly loud screeches.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME use their sharp beak and claws to burrow out nests inside of tree trunks, sheltering within them during the day. At night they call out to one another with incredibly loud screeches.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME use their sharp beak and claws to burrow out nests inside of tree trunks, sheltering within them during the day. At night they call out to one another with incredibly loud screeches.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME often sleeps through the day, being primarily active at night. However, at least one head is always awake to keep an eye out.
Author: moopse

Entry: Although it doesn't have the ability to fly, it loves to hide in trees. The problem is that it is too heavy for the branches, causing them to fall.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: This variety of POKENAME is widely believed to have been cursed once upon a time. Nobody knows why it has only one arm, but it does not seem to be held back by its lack of said appendage.
Author: Cinnamoone_Redfield

Entry: POKENAME silently soars through the night sky without moving its wings. Folklore says that its horn halo glows particularly bright when ferrying a good person to the afterlife.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: The dial on POKENAME's back does not show the current time. Its actual purpose has not yet been determined.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The older POKENAME is, the longer and thicker the vine on its back gets. This Pokémon was admired by humans since ancient times for its wise look, and some cultures believe that it was POKENAME who originally taught people to tell time.
Author: milchik

Entry: Their large yellow feathers can alter their color in darkness so it does not alert prey while it hunts during the night. It first targets prey that are lost and in despair.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: This intimidating fusion of Zoroark and Noctowl has a fierce reputation as a ferocious and aggressive predator which should not be taken lightly. There is some truth to this as they are very protective of their young.
Author: El Fail

Entry: POKENAME have powerful tails, venomous horns, and superb vision. Despite their bulk, POKENAME are surprisingly agile.
Author: Essie

Entry: POKENAME floats silently through the night, siphoning energy from the dreams of those it flies over and storing it in red cyclones to use for attacks.
Author: moopse

Entry: Despite not being a Psychic type, this fusion shows an aptitude for psionic abilities. Some theorize some eldritch power lies deep within it.
Author: JaycieLantern

Entry: POKENAME exhibits effortless grace in its displays to enchant and defeat foes. It is said to be swifter at night and stronger in the day.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME can often be seen floating quietly in the night sky. These large, round Pokémon attract local Hoothoot, who see it as a guardian.
Author: moopse

Entry: POKENAME soars through forests and urban areas at night in complete silence. It unleashes a shrill song to communicate with others, which alongside its stealth and unblinking, red eyes has led to many believing it is a bad omen.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: It is an urban legend that when the clock strikes midnight, anyone who hears all twelve chirps from POKENAME will perish. Its heartbeat syncs with the rhythm of the pendulum inside its body.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It is unknown if the eyes on POKENAME's wings are real or not. Some people swear that they've seen them move, while others consider it a hoax.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: Despite its small size, POKENAME are surprisingly ferocious and will not shy away from opponents many times their size. They are astonishingly stealthy as well, able to stalk prey through even the thickest foliage in silence.
Author: El Fail

Entry: POKENAME's body has baffled researchers since they were first fused. The wood-like material that composes their body is toxic.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: Thanks to their large bodies, POKENAME are clumsy. They have a tendency to stumble around and fly into windows.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: Though it stands perfectly rigid, its eyes dart around, taking in its surroundings with perfect clarity. Once it sees the opportunity to hunt, it moves with calculated perfection, its prey disappearing from the forest in total silence.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME can be completely stationary for up to weeks at a time, keeping a watchful eye on its surroundings. If it does spot its prey, it moves so fast that its prey doesn't have time to react.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Ancient legends speak of POKENAME as bad omens, harbingers of misfortune and malice on moonlit nights. In truth, POKENAME have little interest in people and are often aloof and disinterested, even toward their Trainers.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME stalk their prey from the treetops at night. Their exceptional eyesight and agility make them formidable hunters.
Author: garret95

Entry: Unlike Hootkey, POKENAME is very intelligent and can easily avoid foes. However, it can also be very brutal with its prey. It should not be underestimated.
Author: Ayutac

Entry: POKENAME are similar to Hawlucha in many ways, but are a bit smarter and more temperamental. They are adaptable and can learn Fighting and Flying-type attacks easily.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: It is highly sought after as a companion due to its loyalty and intelligence. Approach with caution, as it will only allow select humans to fly on its back.
Author: bostroms

Entry: Rare eyewitness accounts have spotted wild POKENAME participating in late-night bouts of sparring against various Pokémon. Though nocturnal, it is known to be proud and showy by nature.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: It awakens the moment the sun hits the horizon. Once up, it immediately begins eating leaves until its belly is full.
Author: .izik

Entry: It lets out a whistle when it spots a sunrise. The sunlight seems to nourish its body, causing it to sway back and forth with delight.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses the horn on its head to poke holes in tree bark and sip the sap inside. It hums softly while feeding, attracting other bug Pokémon to join the meal.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME's polka dot pattern and many evolutions make it very popular among bug type enthusiasts. It welcomes Oran Berries as gifts.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME is constantly drifting between being partially conscious and being in the early stages of a typical sleep cycle. When frightened, it emits a foul-smelling fluid from its body.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME spin webs that take the appearance of stars. Each web has a unique scent tied to each individual POKENAME.
Author: Gotfyr

Entry: POKENAME are a rare site in the wild. Their webs consist of a multiple star shaped patterns that glow under a starry night sky.
Author: @Gotfyr

Entry: These blue horned variants of POKENAME are an even rarer find. It is rumored that those with blue horns have the most authority over other POKENAME.
Author: @Gotfyr

Entry: POKENAME generates dangerous electricity. Due to its cute appearance and friendly nature, other Pokémon do not attack it, and even humans who dislike bugs do not consider this creature a pest. Once captured, it is often considered a family member.
Author: Lutrax

Entry: POKENAME leaves a trail of aromatic liquid as it floats along. Often mistaken for ectoplasm, it's actually a pheromone to call others of its kind.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME lives in warmer climates, feasting off grass and small Bug-type Pokémon. It has an unpredictable personality and can unexpectedly attack those nearby.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME can sometimes be seen on the outskirts of settlements, feeding in fields and farmland. It is skittish and prone to fleeing at the first sight of Trainers or hostile Pokémon.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME regularly uses its skill in combat to protect the cities in which it resides from crime. Its work is so renowned that one stars in a popular TV show based in Lumiose City from the Kalos Region.
Author: neo_technomon_8392

Entry: It is only found in the wild just as light starts to fill the sky, but before the sun is fully over the horizon. It lets out baneful, high-pitched screeches if discovered and quickly becomes timid.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME is usually a very timid Pokémon. However, when it gets cold, it warms itself with stored electricity and can become quite aggressive.
Author: zedsmith64

Entry: As a group of five, POKENAME raid unprotected and unwatched wastebins in rural areas to gather food. In the Sinnoh region, they adore Honey Trees.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: They swarm to people with a positive disposition, lured in by happiness and joy. They are otherwise elusive and shy, hiding from people and other Pokémon in bushes or caves.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: They prefer to travel in small colonies, as they are timid when in isolation. They have been incidents where colonies of POKENAME saunter into towns and chew on wooden foundations to sharpen their teeth.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It is very affectionate. If anyone compliments POKENAME's unique pattern of spots, it bounds over and nuzzles them happily. However, its immense weight often knocks the unfortunate admirer to the ground.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: Timid by nature, POKENAME refuse to travel anywhere unless they are in a group for safety. Typically, groups of POKENAME travel by night, using the moon to navigate.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: This Pokémon spends its days sleeping in the tall grass inside forests. Some myths say if you wake it, it causes bad luck for nine generations!
Author: skleegamer

Entry: The small shape on POKENAME's tail attracts hungry Flying-type Pokémon. Once close enough, POKENAME pounces and attacks with its electricity.
Author: .realthree

Entry: On windy days, POKENAME can be seen drifting just above the treetops, collecting berries with its extra-long arms. Once the wind dies down, it will stop to rest in the trees until the wind picks up again.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME prefers hot and humid environments. It can communicate with other POKENAME by emitting a scent. Each kind of scent means something different.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It doesn't mean any harm; however, POKENAME will often relax in vibrant flower fields only to find that it has trampled all vegetation around it.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: It often travels alone, cautious and easily startled. However, amidst rarely-seen packs, it reveals a harsh, brutal demeanor.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: It is said that those stabbed by its rock spike will turn into a POKENAME themselves. The superstitious will carry fresh citrus to protect themselves.
Author: char_latte3412
