Entry: POKENAME are highly aggressive due to frequently being underestimated. Despite their lack of strength, they can wallop foes by cycling their punches with their four arms, eventually wearing their opponents down.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: The vine-like body of POKENAME tastes extremely bitter, which causes most predators to avoid targeting it. It wriggles its limbs all around in combat. Each POKENAME has a slightly different color that is imperceptible on first glance.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It communicates using the aromatic fluid it secretes from its eyes. A happy and healthy POKENAME will be fully encompassed by this fluid.
Author: aPixelPerfectionist

Entry: Easily rattled, POKENAME whacks anything that startles it with its little glove pendulum. The whacks barely do any damage, however.
Author: noel5229

Entry: Most POKENAME use their fight-or-flight responses well. Their light bodies can dodge attacks while consistently dishing them back out.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: It happily flies from flower to flower, drinking the nectar. Once it drinks enough nectar, it will rest in a tree and prepare for evolution.
Author: .izik

Entry: Predators avoid POKENAME due to their poppy red wings, which resemble a group of Ledyba at a distance. Their sweet-smelling wings draw in flower Pokémon that they drink nectar from.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Its fighting style consists of strongly gripping its opponents with its horns, while throwing uppercuts until they faint. It cherishes finally being able to fly, and loves to reach high altitudes just to free fall and repeat.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Due to the cocoon and the body within being frail, POKENAME uses its four fists to vigorously defend itself. The scarf-like frill around its neck billows in the breeze, even when there is no discernible wind.
Author: sk372

Entry: When it falls on its back, it's impossible for a POKENAME to get back up on its own. With its soft belly exposed, it flails its six short limbs around to avert potential aggressors.
Author: SonTyp

Entry: POKENAME's flames are composed of burning pollen spores. It takes care of other Pokémon, giving them warmth through its pollen as it flies over them.
Author: chaozura

Entry: Allegedly, keeping a POKENAME will bring you good luck. It enjoys basking in the sun and is very sensitive to the cold.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: After evolution, POKENAME prefer to live a more solitary life from eachother. If it senses danger it will protect both itself and others for justice.
Author: @Gotfyr

Entry: POKENAME have a strong sense of justice and will defend any Pokémon that are in danger. They bounce off their elastic webs to travel at high speeds.
Author: @Gotfyr

Entry: POKENAME has trained its arm muscles to a level where its wings are no longer needed. Instead, POKENAME can be seen furiously punching the air to fly.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: POKENAME produce a sweet aroma and shiny sparkles that are made into perfume. The soft fragrance is bottled into small sets that come from multiple POKENAME, which makes the perfume a great gift for dates.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME has huge eyes, perfect for taking in light in the early morning or late evening when they are most active. They keep their distance from larger Pokémon, baring their large fangs when threatened but preferring to run.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME sees the world through heat vision. Its molten body is dotted with bits of bug-like exoskeleton, boosting its defensive capabilities.
Author: leonian1586

Entry: When prepared with rice and seaweed, POKENAME make for a hearty and filling meal. Its stomach looks like a single piece of gnocchi, and stores most of its vital organs.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: At night, POKENAME flies up mountains to feed on starlight. When the sun rises, it rolls down the mountain, ricocheting off trees as it goes.
Author: gellyfishsh

Entry: POKENAME's appearances in morning action shows have made it popular with children. It strives to keep up the image of a hero of justice as a result.
Author: nvisionluminous

Entry: POKENAME are good-natured, attempting to save weak Pokémon from stronger ones. They often end up in worse condition than the one they try to save.
Author: kingd8

Entry: Its wings are covered by a huge, jaw-like carapace that's hard as rock and can clamp down on attackers. In the wild, POKENAME are shy and hide from humans, but might be lured closer by presenting shiny or glittering objects.
Author: SonTyp

Entry: POKENAME fights with its blade and fist simultaneously. In the moonlight, its blade sparkles and makes glowing trails with its swings.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: At night, POKENAME like to soar high in the sky, drawn to the stars and moon above. Some say they fly so high that they can touch the very moon itself.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: Some parts of POKENAME's body are covered in an exoskeleton, while others have fish-like scales. It swings its tail so quickly it produces a bug-like buzzing sound.
Author: leonian1586

Entry: POKENAME can be seen hopping from tree to tree in search of berries to eat. When it is attacked, it will strike its attacker with its curled-up fists with the same force as a champion-level boxer.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME live alongside Ledyba colonies, as their leaves are trimmed when Ledyba eat them. If their leaves get too big, they fall over, unable to get up.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Using its four arms, POKENAME coats its opponents in lots of sticky slime, immobilizing them to get the advantage. This Pokémon only fights when provoked, though, and is actually peaceful and gentle in nature.
Author: milchik

Entry: POKENAME reside alongside Ledyba colonies, as their common predators have difficulty hunting both of them at the same time. POKENAME use an aromatic mist to put predators to sleep before the colony carries the threat away from their homes.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME's wings have become incapable of flight after fusion. Instead, it uses them alongside its whiskers to sense the movements of nearby people and Pokémon.
Author: bee4082

Entry: POKENAME's leaves release a citrus-scented nectar that smells like fresh lemon. This aroma attracts Bug-type Pokémon, which it swiftly captures with its vines.
Author: .izik

Entry: It meticulously maintains its ball of silk. It's very proud of it and always tries to show it to other Pokémon.
Author: missingmilkman

Entry: After evolution, POKENAME has learned to sleep sitting down with the egg-shaped rock in its pouch in order to prevent theft. Some say it also uses the rock as a weapon.
Author: lucasdesouza7

Entry: Many POKENAME live in forests, but some have spread into villages. They can climb on ceilings and crack almost anything with their strong jaws.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It regularly coats its webs with juice from Oran Berries to attract its prey. The webs are extremely strong and can stay sticky for months.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are a common nocturnal fusion found in the woodlands of Johto. The pattern on their stomach looks vaguely like a grimacing face, which is thought to scare off potential predators.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are very clumsy Pokémon. They aren't used to their wings yet, resulting in many hunts ending with them crashing into an object, prey or not.
Author: @Gotfyr

Entry: After evolving, POKENAME are more bold in their approach to hunting. They fly at high speeds using their sharp top horns to skewer their prey.
Author: @Gotfyr

Entry: The sacs on POKENAME's leaves are filled with a potent poison that can be refined into a chemical for film development. This liquid ensures precise contrast in photographs.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME glides around on its own webbing. It can patch up any damage done to the web in a matter of seconds, even mid-glide!
Author: GP423

Entry: Young Spinarak weave webs through its antlers. As it bounds through the forest, bugs become caught in the webs and feed the cluster to maturity.
Author: missingmilkman

Entry: Despite its creepy appearance, POKENAME is caring and affectionate. It covers the egg-shaped rock in webs when it sleeps in order to protect it.
Author: lucasdesouza7

Entry: POKENAME cannot stick to or climb trees due to its legs not supporting its weight properly. Instead, it shoots thin sticky webbing from its mouth at fruits and other snacks to drag them down to it.
Author: sk372

Entry: The markings on its head are meant to deter predators, and hide the fact that POKENAME is in fact incredibly timid. Sibling pairs have been seen accidentally frightening each other and running away simultaneously.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME creates web network systems in caves to sense prey. It wanders the dark ceilings and plunges into them while they struggle in the sticky web.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: This Pokémon spins its web from the tip of its tail and stores the excess in the balls around it. POKENAME's web-covered hat is very sticky and catches small unsuspecting Pokémon that mistake it for a delicious mushroom.
Author: milchik

Entry: It can lie motionless for years at a time, waiting for prey. When prey finally comes near, sometimes it still doesn't feel like moving.
Author: missingmilkman

Entry: POKENAME will tear mercilessly at prey as soon as it sees it. It can climb any wall, no matter how steep, and even run on ceilings.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It floats aimlessly, catching prey in its web. It's theorized that it consumes its victims' souls, then brings them to the afterlife.
Author: hiimbasil

Entry: When attacked, POKENAME will fire a net of webbing from the top of its head, hopefully immobilizing its opponent. It will even use its web like a parachute to allow it to safely jump down from tall trees.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The webbing on its wings does not grow naturally, so it spends most of its time rebuilding its wings with its own silk. The silk is incredibly sticky, which allows POKENAME to carry small berries on its wings.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Newborn POKENAME rush to gather berries before the rest of their siblings can awaken, as their siblings can number upwards of 100 at a time. They seek out the Kee Berry over all others to ensure they are tough enough to defend their berry stashes.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Its mesmerizing mushrooms are sought after by many people and Pokémon alike. It likes to live in seclusion, hiding under dead leaves and trapping smaller prey with its sticky silk.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: POKENAME clings to a web until it spots suitable prey, then leaps from its perch, using horns and fangs, fists and feet, and even its tail to pummel its target into submission with relentless anger.
Author: sk372

Entry: Due to its paranoid nature, POKENAME will construct webs to detect and teleport away from intruders. It will forage berries by teleporting to and from nearby bushes.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: They crawl along beaches at night in search of prey. They seem to enjoy stabbing other Pokémon with the poison barb at the end of their tentacles.
Author: HummusIsHome

Entry: The outer heads obey the third, unaware that it is just a face. Its decision making is flawed and clumsy, yet predators still flee from it.
Author: missingmilkman

Entry: It forgoes hypnotism, instead paralyzing its prey with fear. Young Spinarak live within the shelter of the webs around its neck.
Author: missingmilkman

Entry: This Pokémon tends to live in abandoned buildings for peace and quiet. POKENAME will spin intricate webs in decrepit door frames to catch prey.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: It endlessly weaves complex silk patterns between its pincers. It feeds on anything that moves, scuttering violently towards its prey on all six legs.
Author: missingmilkman

Entry: It sheds flakes of its shell in order to grow. The flakes are extremely sticky and dissolve in the rain.
Author: .izik

Entry: While completely harmless to its own kind, the honey in an POKENAME nest is poisonous if ingested. Prolonged consumption can cause blindness.
Author: .izik

Entry: It produces a thick guava nectar from its mouth and can hold a gallon of the nectar until it drools out. To help with this issue, Trainers dilute and drink this sweet drink while petting its flower petals.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: This rare variant of POKENAME lost its wings and needles but developed a firm grasp to use needle-like weapons. Its silk is now used to dash and extend its needle. It is highly intelligent and capable of deep thoughts, but still territorial.
Author: Lutrax

Entry: The tips of its feet are extremely sticky. It has the ability to climb up completely vertical surfaces and cling to the ceiling.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has incredible eyesight, necessary for both climbing walls in caves and also hunting while flying. It makes no sound at all while moving.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: Despite appearances, POKENAME are easily agitated. Many Trainers have needed medical attention after trying to hold wild POKENAME in their hands.
Author: @Gotfyr

Entry: This Pokémon can sometimes be observed gazing up at the night sky while holding a peculiar flower. Some believe it is mourning the loss of someone.
Author: hypernovahusky

Entry: Each POKENAME sees itself as the ultimate super villain. Their evil schemes make them quite the nuisance to both Pokémon and Trainers alike.
Author: @Gotfyr

Entry: Its legs can secrete webs, which it uses to form wings. POKENAME forms large webs in which it stores prey, flying at victims that try to escape.
Author: maxiundmicky

Entry: POKENAME lives deep within the darkest of forests, emitting a faint glow from its lure when prey stumbles near. Those who follow seeking escape from the dark will find themselves soon ensnared in its webs.
Author: sk372

Entry: Due to its light weight, even the smallest breeze will carry it. It clings tightly to any surface when it sleeps in fear of floating away.
Author: .izik

Entry: The bloom on POKENAME's head opens in light and closes at night. Being nocturnal, it is rarely seen awake with an open bloom.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: It runs in circles during thunderstorms while holding its mouth open to the sky. Once it drinks enough water it will fall asleep in the closest pond.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its nest is made of a mixture of tree bark and a thick red silk. Should it be disturbed while eating, it will scream like a human.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon uses the silk threads it produces to locate and trap prey. It will also gnaw on these threads to file down its ever-growing teeth.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: If struck by a powerful punch, POKENAME spits adhesive silk onto its opponent's fist. It then swings the trapped foe around, slamming them into the ground with incredible force.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME burrow holes into the ground with their tails, retreating inside to wait for prey. They set up strings of toxic threads around their den that act as tripwires, alerting them when it's time to pull their fallen prey inside.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME's den is filled with many large webs that both protect its home and catch free food. Before hibernation, it will create a cocoon filled with its prey to consume once spring comes.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME weaves webs to span between outstretched limbs, weaving them into a tight and light enough structure that they can function as wings. It is clumsy in flight, but can travel long distances between forests.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME weaves webs to span between outstretched limbs, weaving them into a tight and light enough structure that they can function as wings. It is clumsy in flight, but can travel long distances between forests.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME has a pair of legs where antlers would normally grow. This Pokémon will startle itself if these legs accidentally brush any part of its body.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME covers the egg-shaped rock in webs, then slings it at the prey's head, causing a painful concussion. After that, it finishes the foe with a horn stab.
Author: lucasdesouza7

Entry: The fangs of an POKENAME can be ground up to create various forms of lipstick. This blend is used in Lumiosa City by fashion gurus.
Author: .izik

Entry: It makes its home in rock formations near the sea. Should any amount of water touch it, the POKENAME will let loose a scared shriek.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME utilize a fast-acting nerve agent in their tails to quickly immobilize foes before dragging them to their nests to feed on them.
Author: yourfriendlycap

Entry: Few insects are as threatening as POKENAME. It hides in abandoned labs and factories, generating magnetism and keeping a look out with its large eyes.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME are expert climbers, jumping from tree-to-tree with little effort. Its claws are coated in poison, which it uses to quickly incapacitate its prey.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It can accurately spray jets of water from up to a mile away. Its eyesight is extremely advanced and able to pick up heat signatures.
Author: .izik

Entry: Unable to move, its hollow body appears to be held together by spider silk. No one knows where POKENAME comes from or what it does in the wild.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: Its diet consists of tree roots and leafy herbs. Should it smell a root underground, it will use its sharp claws and fangs to rapidly dig into the soil.
Author: .izik

Entry: The web deployed by an POKENAME is made up of a thin and sturdy metal. This web can be broken down and used in the construction of airplane engines.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME binds logs together with its sticky web to create sturdy lodges. The webbing resists water damage, staying intact even when fully submerged.
Author: .izik

Entry: Using the decoy on its head as a disguise, it infiltrates Ariados nests and absconds with an armful of eggs. If exposed, it puts on an innocent act.
Author: wigglypon

Entry: It weaves a complex maze of webs. Pokémon caught in the webs are devoured. Those who reach the end of the maze will meet POKENAME. They, too, are devoured.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The green web that comes from its body is slightly luminous. When in complete darkness, its eye lets off an eerie glow.
Author: .izik

Entry: It stores pressurized venom in its horn and can fire it at high speeds. It can hit a stationary target from up to 1 mile away.
Author: .izik

Entry: In battle, it darts from tree to tree, spitting sticky threads and setting up traps for foes to get stuck in. When it sees an opportunity, it leaps down and pummels the foe.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: In battle, it darts from tree to tree, spitting sticky threads and setting up traps for foes to get stuck in. When it sees an opportunity, it leaps down and pummels the foe.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Despite its fearsome appearance, this Pokémon actually imparts calmness. POKENAME stores tranquility in its horn, with its ribbons acting as antennae.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: The cloth of its body is made of incredibly strong silk. POKENAME seeks out those that wantonly kill spiders in order to place curses on them.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME uses its bright markings to ward off potential predators. It has less tails when younger, and is thus less effective at this tactic.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: It fires a sticky web from the seafloor to catch boats from below. Once it latches onto a vessel, it will drag it under the water.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME swings from branch to branch with the webs shooting out of its mouth. It can also neutralize prey with this ability.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: This clever Pokémon collects smaller bugs in its webs and then keeps them tied up on its body. POKENAME then trades large amounts of them with other Pokémon for larger meals.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: They rarely use their lower limbs. On their tail tip is a fake third head to prevent ambushes since the two true heads are often busy arguing.
Author: chromaerym

Entry: It rarely uses its lower limbs. On its tail tip is a fake third head to prevent ambushes, since the two true heads are often busy arguing.
Author: chromaerym

Entry: It prefers to chew on jungle vines rather than any live prey. It can quickly consume 50 lbs of vines per day.
Author: .izik

Entry: It frantically chews wood whenever it is anxious. Should an POKENAME become over-stressed, it can level a small forest.
Author: .izik

Entry: The silk that comes from an POKENAME's mouth has the same consistency as silver. Artisans in Wisteria Town melt it down and craft goblets from it.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME feeds on strong negative emotions and stores them in its horn. The stronger the emotions, the stronger the silk it will produce.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: Its body is covered in a sticky, pink web. If dissolved in water, this web can be used as a vitamin supplement.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's hairs will irritate unprotected skin. Its venom paralyzes prey in mere seconds.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: It uses its webbing to ensnare its prey. Once it gathers enough food in its web, it flies it back to its nest to feed its young.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are found in deep underground caves, using their threads to navigate back to their nests. They're considered ideal partners for spelunkers.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: The webs that come from this Pokémon's body are cold to the touch. The lower the temperature of the web, the higher its strength.
Author: .izik

Entry: It will claim a forest as its own once per year. It swings a clump of poisonous leaves with a thin string of silk to deter predators from its home.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses silk threads across its body to amplify the ultrasonic waves it emits. It prefers the juiciest, messiest fruits, if it can find them.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: Its body is filled with a white viscous venom. When it sees something it wants to eat, it vibrates rapidly while drooling.
Author: .izik

Entry: There are sticky hairs on its palms that allow it to scale large walls with ease. It is active mainly at night, where it searches tall buildings for prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: A less common color variant of POKENAME, but not classified as 'Shiny'. Its spores grow into mushrooms that stay anchored to the earth with sturdy silk strands.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: POKENAME spins its webbing at a rapid pace, able to completely encase its prey within a couple of seconds. In combat, it will wrap its opponent in a cocoon of silk before slashing them in half with its powerful scythes.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Some desolate places call these Pokémon "bells of death," but they are harmless to larger creatures and prey only on insects.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: POKENAME make their webs around lamps and streetlamps. Standing underneath these nests is unwise due to POKENAME's toxic dust and threads.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME spins combat armor so it can fight opponents much more powerful than itself. It attaches a silk thread to those it cares about, which it can sense with its spiked crest.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME produces highly valued silk that's made out of gold. Because of this, it's typically only owned by very wealthy Trainers.
Author: Novellavaria

Entry: Despite its fearsome appearance, POKENAME loves its Trainer and will spend the night sitting on the ceiling above their bed waiting for them to wake up and play. It will sit for hours in complete silence so as not to disturb them.
Author: soupalicious

Entry: This Pokémon's horn slowly releases its latent psychic abilities. It still infrequently gets headaches, and may become aggressive during an episode.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: It uses its superior sense of smell to track prey. Should an POKENAME be doused in water, it loses any scent it was tracking.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has small barbs on the end of its arms, allowing it to scale any vertical surface with ease. It is quite adept in combat, effortlessly taking hits while jabbing its opponent 10 times a second.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME mimics a trapped Machoke with its lower body to lure in unsuspecting prey trying to free it.
Author: Fenragon

Entry: Occasionally, a thick, green fluid drips from its mouth in the evenings. This acid overflows when it consumes too much protein or sodium in its diet.
Author: .izik

Entry: They scuttle through forests in search of large prey to devour. POKENAME jump on the heads of strong Pokémon and inject them with a lethal neurotoxin.
Author: HummusIsHome

Entry: It spins haphazardly-shaped webs to catch prey in, but by the time something is caught in the web, POKENAME has forgotten about the hunt. It usually plays with the caught creature for a few minutes before releasing it.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its mother's skull has fused with its head and wings as armor. With its wings being given extra strength, it can use them as blades to attack.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: Having gained ultrasensory reflexes, POKENAME continues to seek opponents strong enough to withstand its powerful punches.
Author: togetik

Entry: The giant head of POKENAME is always annoyed and bothered by the other heads. It constantly dreams of when it was its own Pokémon.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: It spins rapidly, using its wings as blades to slash through obstacles. This spinning flight creates a whirlwind that disorients opponents.
Author: .izik

Entry: Due to its uneven wings, POKENAME cannot fly. It shambles miserably across the floor in search of leaves to eat, held down by the extra appendages.
Author: gellyfishsh

Entry: Its wings generate powerful air currents that splash water toward enemies. This tactic keeps opponents at bay while it takes flight again.
Author: .izik

Entry: Before transforming, it uses sonar to fully assess the abilities of its opponent. This careful observation ensures it becomes an exact and effective copy.
Author: .izik

Entry: Though POKENAME resembles a predator, they are actually herbivores. Their fire possesses neuro-paralytic properties.
Author: mrbapcik

Entry: When encountering a wild POKENAME, take great caution, as its amplified toxic power and supersonic speed could leave you incapacitated in mere moments.
Author: chaos_emblemx

Entry: In some places, it is worshipped for its grace and ferocity. From its six wings, it is dubbed “The Seraph of Death".
Author: gellyfishsh

Entry: POKENAME seem to have accepted their newfound vision, however begrudgingly. They can often be found sulking in dark places, glaring at any light that creeps through.
Author: howlingstarr

Entry: Wild POKENAME gather and hang upside down from the branches of fruit trees. Concealed by their wings, they are often mistaken for Wiki Berries.
Author: rihse

Entry: The poisonous film on its body is so noxious that any nearby Pokémon will slip into unconsciousness, allowing POKENAME to suck blood at its leisure.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME's inherently carefree nature has diminished its predatory edge. It relies on the remnants left behind by others to satisfy its bloodlust.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Its powerful teeth can crush through onyx with ease. This unmatched biting force makes it a formidable hunter.
Author: .izik

Entry: Flying backwards, it drills into the ground with unmatched precision. This tactic allows it to carve tunnels and escape from threats.
Author: .izik

Entry: Using its claws, it carves stone to create intricate statues near its den. These sculptures serve as both decoration and territory markers.
Author: .izik

Entry: Acidic juice from its shell is splashed at enemies, leaving them stunned. This juice doubles as a defensive mechanism and deterrent.
Author: .izik

Entry: It can carry entire trees through the air for up to 10 miles. This incredible strength allows it to build nests in remote areas high above the ground.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME will rest atop water after flying for hours. If it gets knocked onto its back, it'll flail until it tires itself out or manages to flip over.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: Their diet includes luminescent corals. Thanks to this diet, they glow beautifully in the dark.
Author: mrbapcik

Entry: By flapping its wings, it generates powerful wind blasts that knock down obstacles. These gusts are strong enough to topple even the toughest opponents.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses its fins to modulate its magnetic field, giving it extremely precise control over its position and speed.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: This small Pokémon glides from tree to tree at night. It stalks prey from high places with its great eyesight.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: It can fire the spines on its back like missiles, launching them at distant targets. This attack leaves opponents struggling to avoid the sharp barrage.
Author: .izik

Entry: It leaps from tall plateaus with grace, gliding through the air effortlessly. Its precision in flight allows it to strike targets with pinpoint accuracy.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's arm strength is great enough that only a single flap is needed to take off from the ground. It glides from region to region, depriving entire forests of their fruits and berries.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME has impressive agility. It darts around and strikes opponents with poison-laced chops and kicks. POKENAME resides deep in the mountains.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME flies fastest while in its scabbard, employing four silent wings in total. Its blade consumes blood.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME glide silently through the night, rattling their mushroom caps to scatter their spores over their prey. Once their prey is taken out, they extend their arms to carry them away into the darkness of the night.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: This Pokémon is known to be one of the fastest in the world. POKENAME is a silent but speedy predator, as most Pokémon it attacks will never realize who attacked them until it is too late.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: This Pokémon is known to be one of the fastest in the world. POKENAME is a silent but speedy predator, as most Pokémon it attacks will never realize who attacked them until it is too late.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: Many people believe that POKENAME are bloodsuckers. However, they actually feed on small bug Pokémon and electricity.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Wild POKENAME cling to high cave ceilings. When prey walks below, POKENAME will drop down on it, cleaving it in half with its axe-like tusks.
Author: kingd8

Entry: POKENAME sticks to walls using a gelatinous coating that is also quite toxic. Despite only having one wing, it uses its psychic abilities to levitate above the ground.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME lives in attics or cellars. They are often the cause of flickering lights as they feed on the cables.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It unleashes powerful bursts of noise that confuse and disorient its foes. The intensity of these sonic attacks makes it hard to counter.
Author: .izik

Entry: It spits acid with sniper-like precision, hitting targets from impressive distances. This corrosive attack makes it a dangerous foe in battle.
Author: .izik

Entry: It steals gravestones as a mischievous prank, scattering them in random places. This strange behavior leaves graveyard keepers puzzled.
Author: .izik

Entry: It nests deep within gorges, where the acoustics amplify its echolocation. These isolated locations provide it with both safety and hunting grounds.
Author: .izik

Entry: It hides within storm clouds, waiting patiently to strike at the perfect moment. Its sudden ambush leaves prey with no chance to react.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME flutters the wing-like antennae on its head to feel the air currents in the caves in inhabits. If its skin dries, it loses its way.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME ventures from its cave as soon as the sun begins to set. However, if it's not humid enough outside, it soon returns to its home.
Author: .realthree

Entry: When threatened, it lies down and displays the large false face on it's lower back. It then lunges forward, brutally slamming into the enemy.
Author: moopse

Entry: Though lacking the false face on its back, this Pokémon still instinctively lies down when threatened.
Author: moopse

Entry: POKENAME houses a host of dangerous toxins that it produces through absorbing light. It uses the spiked portions of its body to inject venom into combatants.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: It feeds on moss to keep its fur glossy and well-maintained. This unique diet also keeps it nimble and ready for flight.
Author: .izik

Entry: Using swift wingbeats, it knocks Apricorns off trees with remarkable accuracy. This behavior helps it access food and store it for later use.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are solitary Pokémon and will often fight with each other over territory. If it is disturbed during the day, it will quickly bite its attacker before swiftly flying away, leaving them to deal with its venomous bite.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It flies quickly through fields at night, scattering poisonous powder. Should it see that its prey was affected, it will strike immediately.
Author: .izik

Entry: It is both impressively agile and flexible: it is able to effortlessly bound and rest its body on the slightest indent of rocky cavern walls. It watches over mining spots, waiting to dart downwards and snatch any glittering jewels that may be found.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Trainers employ POKENAME at vineyards, encouraging them to work out their anger by squishing berries for wine. Many guests get intimidated when they see POKENAME licking red juice from their fists, afraid they're drinking blood from their victims.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME's frail wings cannot lift its body. Fortunately, in can easily fly with its telekinetic abilities.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: Despite its powerful poison and brutal fighting abilities, POKENAME is surprisingly merciful. After it defeats other Pokémon, it merely sucks some of their blood and leaves them be.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: With its hard body, it dives into enemies with tremendous force. This aerial assault leaves its opponents battered and off-balance.
Author: .izik

Entry: Caves that have wild POKENAME are considered dangerous due to POKENAME's ability to camouflage itself against dim ceilings while perched upside-down. It will let go and purposely fall onto a trespasser's head at crushing speeds.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It can only fly with the assistance of psychic powers, which lift its heavy body into the air. This strange method allows it to glide at surprising speeds.
Author: .izik

Entry: It strikes with a sharpened leek, jabbing at enemies in close combat. This unconventional weapon makes it both unpredictable and dangerous.
Author: .izik

Entry: It retracts its wings into its shell to protect them from any harm. It can fly over its foes without them noticing before slamming them with its body.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: From outside a child's window, it feeds on dreams without needing to enter the room. This eerie ability leaves its presence unnoticed by those asleep.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its wings are so sharp they can slice cleanly through marble. This precision makes it a terrifying opponent in flight.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME flap their wings to aid in leaping around the ground before they take flight. They gather twigs to build protective nests around the bulbs on their backs, but grow frustrated when they fall apart during flight.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME seeks out Pidgeotto nests and sleeps among the eggs, blending in perfectly. When it wakes, it uses psychic powers to push out any unhatched eggs and claim the nest as its own.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME propels itself through the sky by expelling puffs of poisonous gas from its beak. It uses its sharp talons to swipe at foes that get too close.
Author: .izik

Entry: There is a seamstress in Wisteria Town that makes wedding dresses with POKENAME feathers. Their sheen is unmatched in quality.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its vines to ensnare foes before launching a flurry of aggressive pecks. The vines move independently, making escape nearly impossible.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME spreads its powerful wings and lets out a deafening roar to defend smaller Pokémon. This intimidating display often causes predators to back away in fear.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME appoints itself as a guardian of its home forest. It protects Caterpie and Weedle families by swooping down to peck and claw at would-be hunters.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME chirps loudly while constructing invisible walls mid-air with its psychic powers. It uses these barriers to create aerial obstacles, confusing predators and opponents alike.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME oozes its way up tall trees to hunt for prey from the canopy. It flaps its wings to send goop-like feathers onto targeted prey, which slows them enough for POKENAME to hunt them down.
Author: sk372

Entry: Despite the fun colors, Liteblue Mail is the standard for professional correspondence between universities. POKENAME are both fast and careful with letters and packages they deliver, as seen by how often they transport goods between facilities.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME struggles to use its wings due to being in a cocoon state. Instead, it simply uses String Shot to swing from one tree to another, hoping to eat just enough bug Pokémon to get by and evolve.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: It is no longer able to partake in Little Cup tournaments and may occasionally lash out as a result. Even so, a Bitter Curry to match its angst helps it calm down so it can support others in battle.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: The wings on POKENAME's head allow it soar effortlessly across the sky. It is said that POKENAME will appear in front of people and Pokémon who dream of flight.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is a very strong bird Pokémon, its claws are razor sharp. It will whip up a tornado without effort if it feels threatened.
Author: Smallcutekitty

Entry: POKENAME is a tiny bird Pokémon that uses the wind to float anywhere it may want to go. Its blue feathers seem to hold an ancient psychic power.
Author: Smallcutekitty

Entry: POKENAME is a tiny bird Pokémon that uses the wind to float anywhere it may want to go. It will whip up a gust of wind if it feels endangered.
Author: Smallcutekitty

Entry: POKENAME is a tiny bird Pokémon that uses the wind to float anywhere it may want to go. Its bland appearance belies a hidden power that hasn't been seen yet.
Author: Smallcutekitty

Entry: POKENAME is a tiny bird Pokémon that uses the wind to float anywhere it may want to go. Its golden tail feathers seem to hold an ancient power.
Author: Smallcutekitty

Entry: POKENAME is a tiny bird Pokémon that uses the wind to float anywhere it may want to go. Even though its look is bland, it sparkles brighter than the sun.
Author: Smallcutekitty

Entry: POKENAME instinctively catches and consumes more prey than its body can handle. However, in an act of kindness, it shares its meals with other Pidgey in the group.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME tirelessly patrols its territory while gliding, keeping an eye out for danger. If it spots a predator, it waves its paws and lets out a sharp cry to warn others.
Author: .izik

Entry: At night, POKENAME's psychic powers strengthen, allowing it to glide effortlessly through the air without flapping its wings. It hunts silently, using its keen intellect to track and capture prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME flies mostly in the morning to harvest pollen, using its hands to gently gather from flowers. After a long day of work, it rests in colorful fields, blending in with the blossoms.
Author: .izik

Entry: The golden plumage of POKENAME is highly sought after, as it is said to contain latent power. POKENAME is more reckless than its flock, constantly putting itself in danger.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: If POKENAME detects a past disaster near its nesting site using its psychic abilities, it will immediately relocate. It prefers nesting in areas where the energy feels undisturbed and safe.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is one evolution away from perfection in every remarkable talent of the Pidgey line. Unfortunately, its lack of a long, flowing lock of hair gives it a disadvantage at looking intimidating to rivaling Pidgeots.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME releases electricity from its wings as it flies, leaving a faint static charge in the air. Even its loose feathers retain an electric charge when touched, giving a slight shock to those who handle them.
Author: .izik

Entry: Their flower dresses are made of leaves and dahlia petals, which help them absorb sunlight. Their dresses also offer them a slow descent when they are done flying through the skies.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME flies low over watercress gardens, carefully watching the surface for prey like Poliwag. When it spots one, it swiftly snatches it up with its sharp talons.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its cries are obnoxiously loud. Those who own POKENAME tend to either release them into the wild or evolve them as quickly as possible.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: POKENAME's feathery wings beat furiously as it zips across ponds and lakes. It skims the water's surface at incredible speeds, snatching up insects in mid-flight.
Author: .izik

Entry: While fast in flight, it is very clumsy. It tends to start trouble by crashing into trees, disturbing its inhabitants.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: Its thick, colorful head plumage is used for courtship rituals. Female POKENAME search out the male POKENAME with the thickest, most vibrant plumage.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: It uses its keen eyesight to observe its surroundings while exuding a strange aura. Wild tales suggest it can influence others' thoughts with its cryptic presence.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: By channeling its psychic power through both of its beaks, POKENAME can emit powerful telekinetic waves. This unique ability allows it to push back foes and manipulate small objects mid-flight.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME fiercely defends its nest by latching onto intruders with its talons. If the foe resists, it will detonate in a blinding explosion, sending debris flying in all directions.
Author: .izik

Entry: With its thick, sturdy beak, POKENAME digs into mud to uncover roots, which it eats. It will often leave behind small burrows that other Pokémon later inhabit.
Author: .izik

Entry: The crest of hair on POKENAME's head gives it a sense of authority among other Spearow. Sometimes, it will exude so much authority that a flock of Spearow might consider POKENAME greater than their leading Fearow.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: The body shape and feather colors of POKENAME are enough to confuse both sides of its fused cousins. The side that POKENAME falls with depends on which half of its mind is greater, which changes frequently.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: When hunting, POKENAME releases a loud trumpet-like noise from its trunk to startle prey like Caterpie. Once its target is disoriented, it swoops down for a powerful tackle.
Author: .izik

Entry: Most POKENAME live in cities. They perch along office buildings, beeping and chirping at passersby.
Author: .realthree

Entry: With powerful wingbeats, POKENAME breaks berry tree limbs and catches the falling fruit with its psychic abilities. It carefully sorts through them, only eating the ripest berries.
Author: .izik

Entry: While soaring through the air, POKENAME performs somersaults and backflips before delivering powerful strikes. Its wings enhance its mobility, allowing it to dodge and reposition mid-fight.
Author: .izik

Entry: During thunderstorms, POKENAME raises its talons to the sky to absorb electricity. The static energy charges its body, making its attacks more powerful for a short time.
Author: .izik

Entry: By flapping its large wings, POKENAME generates powerful gusts of hot wind to scorch its foes. It prefers battling in dry, arid areas where it can intensify the flames with its wind-based attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME flies high enough to be inside the clouds while charging up electricity, and creates a raging lightning storm as a result. Only a few Trainers have ever witnessed a POKENAME do this.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: When tired of flying, POKENAME will land in residential gardens and stand completely still. Its rigid posture and earthy coloring make it resemble a lawn ornament, fooling both people and Pokémon alike.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME always saves the last berry from a tree to replant it nearby. It uses powerful gusts to shake berries loose from branches, eating its fill before securing future food sources.
Author: .izik

Entry: It takes great pride in coaching baby Pokémon on how to win Little Cup battles, despite no longer being eligible. After a round of coaching, it eats a plate of Dry Curry before initiating spars between itself and consenting baby Pokémon nearby.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: The delicate feathers around POKENAME's waist flutter softly when it is reading someone's emotions. If it senses strong negative feelings, it will take flight and circle above them in a calming dance.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME flies along the edges of streams, collecting reeds with its sharp beak. These reeds are woven into the structure of its lodge to help insulate it from the elements.
Author: .izik

Entry: When a POKENAME isn't digging for some small, juicy Pokémon, it sits and watches Pidgerino brawls to admire a potential partner. It relies on Pidgerinos to fly up into the trees to get more food for them due to POKENAME's smaller wings.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: Large in size but meager in appetite, it is nonetheless crafty. It slashes whole branches off trees, then sweeps away the leaves with its singular wing to find the bug Pokémon hidden within.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME brawls happen in groups of 5 to 10 to decide the leader. The fights are so intense and violent that it attracts any Pidgerina that hears their battle cries and clashing of horns and talons.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: Soaring around its territory, this Pokémon acts as a defender of weaker Pokémon in the forests it inhabits.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: During a waning moon, POKENAME's feathers begin to molt. The fallen feathers shimmer faintly under the night sky, leading some to believe they carry mystical properties.
Author: .izik

Entry: In the early morning, POKENAME flies to the water's edge and scrapes up clay with its paws. It carefully applies the clay to reinforce its lodge, ensuring it remains sturdy.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can read the auras of those nearby, detecting malice with ease. If it senses a threatening presence, its tail feathers glow a brilliant gold before it takes flight to alert its allies.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME disguises itself as a human berry picker to lure unsuspecting prey. Once they lower their guard, it strikes with a barrage of sharp, relentless pecks.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME fossils are often mistaken for Archen. In the modern day, POKENAME is one of the most ferocious predators on land and in the sky.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: Feathers from POKENAME are used in pillows for the wealthy. Their softness is coveted by those who desire a good night's rest.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME patrols its vast territory from the sky. They gather in lush forests after it rains to feast on soil.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME hierarchy is based on the length of its feather crest. Because of this status check, the most dominant POKENAME is unable to split or leave behind any of its body to remember feeding spots, as its feathers will shrink with it.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: As POKENAME lands, it releases bursts of sparks from its talons to discharge built-up electricity. The resulting crackle can sometimes be mistaken for a thunderclap.
Author: .izik

Entry: When soaring through the night sky, POKENAME releases tiny embers from the tips of its feathers. This glowing trail creates a mesmerizing sight but can be dangerous in dry areas.
Author: .izik

Entry: Before eating, POKENAME spits small flames from its beak to cook its food. It has an instinctual sense for perfect roasting temperatures and will never overcook its meals.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can't fly, but instead, it can flap its many wings to add to its height when it jumps.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME is a lot more mobile than it appears. Its light body weight and small size mean a single huge flap of its wings can send it soaring a mile away.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: When POKENAME sees its favorite food, its funky, mind-numbing drool comes out at a rapid pace. The only Trainers who manage to withstand owning a POKENAME tend to feed it a food it doesn't love but still tolerates.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: It tends to forget that it cannot fly so it will sometimes throw itself out of trees in an attempt to take off. Its feathers are incredibly sharp, and it will fight with other POKENAME to see whose feathers are sharper.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is very capricious in its actions. It almost seems as if the mushroom on its back is temporarily gaining control of its locomotor abilities.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It uses its claws to climb trees and mountainsides alike. Wild POKENAME often throw rocks and sands at Trainers that enter their territory.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: POKENAME populate steep mountainsides, where they build elaborate nests. Its nests are cleverly constructed with large rocks and logs.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: POKENAME crawls aimlessly through the branches of trees. It seems almost apathetic, as if it is not in control of its senses.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME flaps its wings to blow its powder all over the forest trees and ground. It can then sense places where the powder is disturbed to attack and consume small Pokémon that are affected by it.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: The scales on POKENAME's wings are more like tiny feathers. It mostly eats bug Pokémon, though its claws are too small for grasping prey.
Author: RoboSoup

Entry: Scientists debate if POKENAME is a bird, reptile, dragon, or dinosaur. There is no question, however, that its deadly claws, beak, teeth, and talons are all sharper than steel.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: It is often associated with greed in old myths, the best-known being the tale of a POKENAME flying too close to the sun in pursuit of its shiny light.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME's somewhat clear head allows it to see Pokémon hiding inside trees. However, it usually ends up misjudging and gets attacked by something far bigger and more dangerous than it can handle.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME's air control in combat is outstanding compared to other winged Pokémon. It is able to remain in the air while punching, kicking, and even being upside down.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME's flight and fight technique is comparable to Hawlucha, with a focus on air-based combat. It is able to deliver steel-bending blows even without a ground to support its weight.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: Specialized Trainers often choose POKENAME to scout for rare Pokémon and materials. Its enhanced sense of smell and far-reaching cry allow it to find anything it's commanded to and call for help up to 10 miles away.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: Packing a feisty temper, POKENAME soars through the skies searching for fights to boost its ego. It never backs down from a perceived challenge, having been observed to even chase after a Dragonite passing through their territory.
Author: King Mordork

Entry: Its impressive size is matched only by its cleverness. POKENAME has been observed to drop sharpened stones on prey from above and roast the meat over a fire.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: When cornered by a dangerous Pokémon, POKENAME will spin its body around rapidly with its wings, making the spiral on its chest appear to spin. Most Pokémon that see it will feel their weight shift to the side without any contact.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: The wings and glistening mustache of POKENAME give it telekinetic powers that allow it to avoid attacks automatically in the air. It has been observed that POKENAME has made Kadabras display an emotion researchers dub as mustache envy.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME spends several hours doing nothing but sucking up and melting dirt in its mouth, hoping it will consume any buried bug Pokémon in the process. 90% of its diet ends up being just dirt.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME's wings are just about strong enough to keep it airborne. Because of this, it is able to drop down onto big rocks to break them open and eat any minerals and bug Pokémon it finds hiding inside.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: Somewhat smarter than normal, POKENAME can see where a bug Pokémon may end up in its reach and prepares to strike for that moment. It usually miscalculates and misses its mark 75% of the time.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME is the star ingredient in 'Confit de volaille aux poireaux,' a delicacy served aboard the S.S. Anne. Its leek is flame-grilled, and its meat is marinated in a Custap Berry sauce before being perfectly charred.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's feathers merge into its skin to make it furry, warm, and waterproof. This change in its body allows it to dive into cold water to scoop up fish Pokémon, and even rest on top of the water.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: The mud-like paste covering POKENAME's feathers is highly toxic. Despite the heaviness of the sludge, it still manages to fly long distances, leaving behind trails of polluted droplets.
Author: .izik

Entry: The thick, toxic paste covering POKENAME's body can cause dizziness to anyone within 20 feet. As it flies, it unintentionally scatters small droplets of ooze, leaving a pungent scent in its wake.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME flies around town tracking citizens, memorizing their habits. At night, it lands on rooftops and uses its psychic powers to feast on their dreams.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can see clearly up to three kilometers ahead. When in flight, it scans the horizon for shiny materials that it can craft pendulums from.
Author: noel5229

Entry: The many antennae sprouting from POKENAME's head simultaneously emit light and psychic energy. This is meant to lure in Pokémon and Trainers alike for no other reason than it enjoys company.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME are known to be extremely curious. If it's in danger, it'll shoot electrified ink from its mouth.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: Its dazzling lights captivate both friends and foes, mesmerizing those who watch. This light show serves as both a defense and a way to attract prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: It extends its antennae out of the water during thunderstorms. Should it be struck by lightning, it will store the electricity within its body.
Author: .izik

Entry: Each end of their tentacles can light up. When several POKENAME gather together, they perform some kind of ritualistic dance, twirling and lighting up their tentacles in a very particular fashion. Scientists are unsure of its purpose.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME drifts through the currents, its five electrified arms floating in every direction in search of prey to paralyze and capture.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: If it is to be kept in a tank, it is important to make sure an electric filter is not installed. Should it get too close to one, its body will spark.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME carefully feels its way into deep ocean caves. Its antennae generate just enough light for it to see something.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: In the dark, some scuba divers mistake it for a submarine. Before they realize their mistake, they get eaten by POKENAME.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME's fur bulbs produce heat and a warm, comforting light. They also regrow fast, so they're often shorn off to make fairy lights and winter holiday decorations.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME hangs upside down from cave ceilings and catches drifting food with its charged antennae. If it is not caught by currents, it does not move.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Because it eats so much food, POKENAME is very bouncy. It's so bouncy that children are often found jumping on it like a trampoline.
Author: pokebio

Entry: This energetic Pokémon lives lakes and swamps. Its body makes a hydrophobic oil that it secretes on its fur.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: The glowing liquid in POKENAME's stingers is a powerful neurotoxin. It can shoot them out in the water like torpedoes to paralyze its prey.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: If its drills or antennae light up, it is ready to attack. POKENAME can emit particularly strong electricity via its stinger.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It secretes a special oil that causes the ends of its tails to burn bright yellow. POKENAME uses its tails as whips to disorient prey.
Author: spookoftheoldways

Entry: When threatened underwater, POKENAME will use their tails as makeshift fists. Their tails however are squishy, so it commonly bounces off of the opponent.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: POKENAME are very trusting with other Pokémon and Trainers, nuzzling with them as a greeting. Underwater exploration teams befriend these Pokémon to offer light in the deep ocean.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: POKENAME's tendrils act like wires, both conducting and absorbing kinetic energy, usually latching onto larger Pokémon.
Author: heyo346

Entry: This rare type of POKENAME only surfaces on moonless nights. It illuminates the sea in search of prey, before returning to the abyss.
Author: Mister J

Entry: Its many dazzling, electric lures attract any deep sea Pokémon that sees it shining in the darkness. It wraps its prey in its gleaming tendrils, paralyzing them with powerful electric charges.
Author: CartoonHostage

Entry: This Pokémon loves shining its light through thick fog, illuminating the path ahead. Sailors often rely on its glow to guide them through misty waters.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its anatomy evolved to imitate deep-sea anemones. When a predator gets close, it releases a shock between its antennae.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME is made of highly conductive minerals. It finds its way through deep underwater caves by detecting the magnetic fields of the world.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: It expels glowing foam to ward off attackers, creating a dazzling barrier. The foam sticks to anything it touches, making escape difficult.
Author: .izik

Entry: Rival POKENAME fight by flashing the glowing patterns on their torsos at each other until one of them is forced to cover its eyes from the blinding light and admit defeat.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME lives much deeper than most other Corsola, using its internal electricity to light up the dark depths. Due to the many hydrothermal vents it lives near, it has adapted to withstand the more acidic conditions.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It can electrocute prey at short range or shoot jets of water at them at long range. A skilled POKENAME can even electrify its own water projectile.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It glows dimly when sick, signaling to other Pokémon that it needs help. This subtle glow ensures it is never left alone during difficult times.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME use the strong electric fields from their antennae to navigate the dark abyss. They swim as fast and gracefully as birds fly in the sky.
Author: Ayner

Entry: Pods of POKENAME glide over the sea at night and look like twinkling galaxies from afar. Seeing them is said to be a sign of good luck for sailors.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME are often kept by fishermen and hunters, as they excel at catching small game and fish. They can quickly launch their twin tails like harpoons, tasering prey before they even know POKENAME is upon them.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: Many rubber bath toys have been fashioned in the image of POKENAME. Real POKENAME, however, are digital in nature and tend to glitch out when submerged in water.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME's antlers light up when it senses danger. When this happens, it gallops away with high speed.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME relies on its markings to scare away predators. In reality, it cannot defend itself due to its mouth being too small to bite anything.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: The egg that POKENAME carries is full of so much electric energy that it could power a small town for several weeks, if POKENAME didn't defend it so fiercely.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME is said to appear in front of divers lost in the depths of underwater caves and share its air bubbles with them. Survivors say this Pokémon even guided them back to safety.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME is quiet but extremely friendly, to the point it sometimes gets itself in trouble. It may greet what is actually a dangerous predator in complete earnestness. They especially like to find Remoraid to become close friends with.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME keeps its babies safe inside the water-filled cavity in its body. Together, they attack prey with up to 15,000 volts of electricity.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: This Pokémon is very dimwitted. The lights on its back are extremely bright. Looking directly at said lights can cause blindness.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME buries itself in sand at the bottom of lakes, leaving only its spikes above ground. When a prey swims by, it shoots its spikes at them.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: This Pokémon is skilled at sensing danger. Its ears discharge electricity and release various horrible toxins, creating a deadly combination.
Author: alliveir

Entry: The bulb in POKENAME's flower only lights up when its Trainer has a genius idea. Or so the Trainers say, at least.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: It uses the poisonous feelers on its limbs to perceive its surroundings. POKENAME communicate using electric signals from their tail and ears.
Author: alliveir

Entry: POKENAME likes to plant itself into the ocean floor, where it blends in with other bioluminescent foliage. It gets agitated if its stalks are grabbed.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: Its tail emits loud electric signals that act as a beacon. Some have been seen firing high frequency signal beams at their enemies.
Author: alliveir

Entry: Lives in the deepest, darkest waters of the region. Antennas are used by POKENAME to attract Pokémon closer. It will then capture their soul.
Author: TheFinalKalgonus

Entry: Its lights serve as a beacon for lost sailors, guiding them to safety. It swims tirelessly, ensuring its glow is always visible from afar.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's prominent blade is primarily composed of a liquid ectoplasm charged with a small electric current to give it its yellow glow.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Nocturnal by nature, it glows gently in the darkness, providing faint illumination. It is most active in heavily forested areas.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME scours the ocean floor for any objects that light up, so it can hang them on its body. It can create an electrical circuit with its body, causing all the objects to light up at once.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME always waves its tails in beautiful patterns that mimic the movement of flames. Astute Trainers can easily tell POKENAME's mood from the speed at which its lures oscillate.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: It bobs happily on waves, its glowing body lighting up the water around it. Its playful nature makes it a popular sight among beachgoers.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME charges its head electrically by generating positive and negative energy via its antennae. It loves to give out headbutts.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME is not a fast swimmer. However, thanks to its hard shell and its ability to electrify its surroundings, it hardly fears predators.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME lives in the deep dark ocean, generating so much electricity that its entire body illuminates the dark depths. It stays around hydrothermal vents so it has a constant source of energy.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME scours the ocean floor for food, eating whatever it can dig up with its tusks. Its body is capable of withstanding immense amounts of pressure.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: When POKENAME gets excited, sparks jump between its two antennae, causing its temperature to rise. These antennae will flash aggressively when anything encroaches on POKENAME's turf.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: Its wings are specially adapted to help it both fly and swim, acting like flippers underwater. Despite its unassuming expression, it is extremely territorial, fending off both birds from the air and fish from the sea.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: Groups of POKENAME make mesmerizing light displays deep within the ocean. When a Pokémon draws near, they swarm it until nothing remains.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Its teeth glow when it bites, leaving glowing marks on its prey. This unusual trait makes it easy to track once it has attacked.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its glowing lures blink in an odd pattern to communicate with others of its kind. Should an enemy get too close, it will let loose an electric shock.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its venom glows a bright yellow, warning others to stay away. The glow becomes more intense when it feels threatened.
Author: .izik

Entry: Long ago, its venom was used to brew a potion that cured seasickness. The recipe for this ancient remedy has since been lost to time.
Author: .izik

Entry: This shy, tough-skinned Pokémon lurks in the deep seas. Its glowing antennae guide it through the darkness as it seeks out kelp to eat.
Author: akujules

Entry: It lives in dark trenches, using its luminescent mushrooms to illuminate the darkness. It feeds on glowing algae, which allows its mushrooms to glow brightly.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Sightings of a city under the water are usually just POKENAME. The thick brine it holds around its arms helps conduct electricity to its lights.
Author: .realthree

Entry: It dwells in the murky depths where it uses bioluminescence to find its way. In these shadowy waters, it blends in effortlessly with its surroundings.
Author: .izik

Entry: It is said that a couple shocked by the same POKENAME's antennae will share an eternal love. Some coastal towns host festivals where lovers seek its light for good fortune.
Author: .izik

Entry: Wild POKENAME are usually found in tropical areas at the bottom of the ocean. If threatened, one head keeps watch and the others hide in their hole.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME erratically fly around, often bumping into boats and shorelines due to its poor vision in sunlight. When frustrated, they dive deep underwater where they can see better.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: POKENAME has an electrical organ in its mouth that emits large amounts of light, luring its prey directly into its mouth. POKENAME are commonly used by deep-sea divers as underwater flashlights.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It steals oars from rowboats, causing confusion among sailors. The stolen oars are often found stashed in underwater caves.
Author: .izik

Entry: During storms, it tries to flash its lights in sync with lightning strikes. This habit fascinates researchers, though its purpose remains unknown.
Author: .izik

Entry: The Shellder on POKENAME's tail is a parasite that absorbs POKENAME's neurological signal to power its electric abilities. POKENAME thus rarely ever reacts to anything and relies on its Shellder to defend itself.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: Three Pokémon have formed a bond to share electricity with one another, making the whole more powerful. POKENAME sprays streams of electrified water at enemies to paralyze them.
Author: CartoonHostage

Entry: POKENAME connects its two heads to different objects for bridging and generates electricity. It is often used in industry.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME connects its two heads to different objects for bridging and generates electricity. It is often used in industry.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: While sleeping, it blinks its lights in a rhythmic pattern. This gentle glow attracts smaller Pokémon, which rest beside it.
Author: .izik

Entry: It dispenses shining pearls from its mouth, leaving them scattered across the ocean floor. These pearls are highly sought after by collectors.
Author: .izik

Entry: Blinding flashes of light erupt from its body, disorienting enemies. It uses these bursts to confuse predators and make a swift escape.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME digs tunnels in underwater caves, eating everything in its path. The crystals it consumes make POKENAME strongly magnetic.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: It hates prolonged exposure to sunlight and retreats to shady waters during the day. Its lights glow brighter in the safety of darkness.
Author: .izik

Entry: Bead Mail is given to POKENAME to ferry to submarines or underwater laboratories because it produces a special bubble to prevent the mail from getting wet. Marine biologists rely on this type of mail to receive important correspondence.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME's antennae emit a captivating light that attracts unsuspecting prey. Though the light is a beautiful sight, what follows is truly horrific.
Author: Mykoloth

Entry: POKENAME lives in damp or flooded caves. With the help of its luminescent eyes, it illuminates even the deepest darkness.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can withstand the pressure of the abyssal zone of the ocean. It uses its bioluminescence to see in the deep ocean.
Author: Jona_hehe

Entry: POKENAME lures in deep-sea prey with its hypnotizing lights and hauntingly beautiful song. When the prey draws close, POKENAME devours it in one bite.
Author: kingd8

Entry: A POKENAME has a row of shiny dorsal ridges down its back. They glow brightly with electricity, allowing it to see even in the darkest waters.
Author: T.I.A.

Entry: Wild POKENAME went extinct because of how bright their shells are. Predators could spot them sleeping in the ocean from a mile away.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME lives in damp or flooded caves. With the help of its luminescent eyes, it illuminates even the deepest darkness.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME lives in underwater caves or in abyssal gaps. It dangles upside down from the rocks and illuminates the otherwise pitch-black surroundings.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME is a voracious eater, oftentimes enticed by its own lure to walk forward endlessly.
Author: durgerking

Entry: POKENAME is a voracious eater, oftentimes enticed by its own lure to walk forward endlessly.
Author: durgerking

Entry: There have been many a story of Trainers lost in caverns being rescued by POKENAME. Illuminating a path with the orb on its head, it carries them safely to the nearest exit, before leaving in a bright flash of light.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are skilled hunters in both the sea and the skies. They use their luminescent appendage to hunt in deep waters.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME are skilled hunters in both the sea and the skies. They use their luminescent appendage to hunt in deep waters.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME lives in underwater caves or in abyssal gaps. It dangles upside down from the rocks and illuminates the otherwise pitch-black surroundings.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can use its wings as hybrid fins when it dives. At night, it attracts Bug and Water Pokémon with its luminescent drills.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can use its wings as hybrid fins when it dives. At night, it attracts Bug and Water Pokémon with its luminescent drills.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME uses its lure to attract unsuspecting Pokémon in the darkest waters. Once they are distracted, it latches on with its jaws faster than they can react.
Author: Elite01

Entry: POKENAME will lure in prey with its fruit-shaped lure. Once its prey is close enough, it will ensnare it with a web woven between its legs.
Author: Weirdtux

Entry: If you see two faint lights in the darkest depths of the ocean, swim as fast as you can back to the surface before you become POKENAME's next meal!
Author: Phantom640

Entry: Its glowing lures resemble prey, enticing Pokémon much larger than POKENAME. With its sharp teeth, it can even pierce the tough scales of Gyarados.
Author: Cartoon Hostage

Entry: Groups of POKENAME can be found calmly floating atop small lakes at night. They are sensitive to sunlight, so they are rarely seen during the day.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME's bulbs can briefly light up brighter than a supernova, allowing it to flee from predators while they are dazed.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: It swims and burrows along the deepest parts of the ocean floor. The orbs on its body create a brilliant light when aggravated or hunting.
Author: moopse

Entry: It's a nocturnal Pokémon, and it can breathe in water and on land. It gathers hundreds of Berries and shares them with their young.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: Its orbs are weak so it can't protect itself. POKENAME relies on Lanbok to help it in battles so it can learn their techniques and become stronger.
Author: not_stakings_alt

Entry: According to legends, people started revering underwater herds of POKENAME, seeing their bright lights and connecting them to supernatural incidents on shores. They are very playful and bond quickly to either their herd, or Trainer.
Author: Markusknight

Entry: POKENAME has very bright orbs on its tail which can fend off predators. You can tell which POKENAME is the alpha depending on the orb size.
Author: not_stakings_alt

Entry: POKENAME, a mischievous trickster, confounds foes with cunning tactics in battle, adding an unpredictable edge to its character.
Author: soinetwa

Entry: It has the ability to control the water in the air, which allows it to stay healthy even during relatively dry days. Colorful seeds that can shine in different colors grow over its tail, making it a festive sight regardless of the time of year.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME live in the dark depths of the sea. The lights on POKENAME's head are used to attract other Pokémon, which POKENAME will feast on.
Author: fairybell16

Entry: Often called the 'Lighthouse of the Trenches,' this behemoth Pokémon lives in deep waters. Its glowing orbs guide sea Pokémon and illuminate the ocean depths.
Author: lemage22

Entry: During Pokémon contests, a Trainer may include a Blue Scarf in their aquatic routine, as it matches the color of their scales. The dazzling array of both electricity and their scales provides a beautiful display of light.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Rumor has it that the patterns on its body inspired a famous painting. It sleeps under the sun, as if to recharge its glowing markings.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME lives in flooded caves in icy regions. It claims entire cave complexes as its territory, but also allows other Pokémon to live in them.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME lives in flooded caves in icy regions. It claims entire cave complexes as its territory, but also allows other Pokémon to live in them.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME produces light from its lure while hiding itself using illusions. Prey that get close are stunned by a burst of light and eaten in one gulp.
Author: bunkachunka

Entry: The glowing growth aids them in navigating during the nighttime. They utilize their luminescent appendage for hunting.
Author: mrbapcik

Entry: A formidable predator, POKENAME uses the appendage atop its head to lure prey to the bottom of the ocean. When a Wailmer dives down to the depths, it is usually not seen again.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: POKENAME is often mistaken for a star due to its bright orbs. Myths say that anyone who beats it can make a wish, but this has never been confirmed.
Author: not_stakings_alt

Entry: They frequently mistake a Prism Scale for a Deep Sea Scale, so whenever they get their hands on a Deep Sea Scale, they hold onto it. They fight over scales, as they feel uncomfortable in their own bodies and want to evolve.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It hides from predators in coral reefs. However, it is also easily distracted, following anything that sparkles or glows.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME spends its life wandering the ocean floor in search of fallen Wailord corpses. When it finds one, it will feed for weeks, zealously defending its meal from all comers.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: Do not be fooled by POKENAME's comical appearance, for it belies a conniving undersea hunter. It stuns prey with painfully bright flashes from its lure, leaving them helpless to avoid its razor-sharp teeth.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME resides in clouds, sustaining itself on electricity. Impervious to its power, it embodies a harmonious dance of water and sky.
Author: soinetwa

Entry: It is said that this Pokémon would guide lost sailors to shore with the light between its wings. However, nowadays, they are rarely seen.
Author: neomblue

Entry: POKENAME likes to lurk in swamps and wait for prey to approach. It lifts up the orb on its back to draw the prey in, where it can spit mucus at it.
Author: not_stakings_alt

Entry: The fusion of Lanturn and Necrozma allows POKENAME to act as its own food source. It has never been witnessed eating or drinking.
Author: nur1

Entry: POKENAME use their bioluminescent orbs to lure other Pokémon in dark ocean depths. Their thorns can latch on to their prey, glowing brighter in the process.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: While POKENAME is a fierce combatant, it spends most of its time meditating inside sunken ships or dark caverns. It illuminates the orbs on its head during meditation, warning other Pokémon not to disturb its focus.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: While POKENAME is a fierce combatant, it spends most of its time meditating inside sunken ships or dark caverns. It illuminates the orbs on its head during meditation, warning other Pokémon not to disturb its focus.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME silk can be used as net material. Fishermen love to have this Pokémon stick around, in case they run out of netting.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: Mesmerized by their own lure, POKENAME spend hours staring at the bulb of light in front of their faces. They shoot bolts of light when interrupted.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: After POKENAME uproots itself, it only has a few hours to plant its feet again before its glowing lights dim and go out.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The more a POKENAME resembles a plant, the better it can hide from predators. At night, its light helps Pokémon find their way.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME wiggle their glowing tentacle lures to draw in prey, before hardening the lures into barbs that inject poison. They then spit out a caustic acid, which digests food it touches.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: The orbs on POKENAME's body will glow and flash with its change in mood. The orbs on the tentacles are lit up to confuse prey and enemies alike.
Author: ziggaway
