Entry: Spending hours on the deep seafloor, POKENAME will stare at their own glowing lure. If disturbed, they become angry and shoot small shockwaves to the source of interruption.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME can be found at beaches with lighthouses, as they are drawn in by the light. This is because their bulbous lure absorbs light from other bright sources.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME exudes bright light than can be seen for kilometers. It accompanies Trainers on long voyages to provide light and hypnosis at night.
Author: noel5229

Entry: As it runs, it will generate small amounts of electricity. If it sees a fruit in a tree, it will use the electricity to drop it to the ground.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME generates electricity as it rolls, building a charge with each movement. However, its poor control often causes accidental discharges, startling itself in the process.
Author: moga6

Entry: Its electrical capability is strong, but its body lacks the strength to properly contain it. As such, its body has shattered, loosely connected to and covering its electrical core while puffing out small storm clouds.
Author: sk372

Entry: It periodically shudders in its sleep, letting loose a burst of sparks. Due to this, POKENAME must avoid sleeping near others of its kind.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME struggles to effectively retain its stored power and, as a result, swims with a weak electric barrier surrounding it at all times.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME shares electricity with others by creating electrical arcs between its horns. Schools of POKENAME swim to the surface during thunderstorms to draw in lightning strikes.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is inept at retaining electricity and often releases it into the surrounding water. It is advised to steer clear of it while swimming.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: The small electric currents in POKENAME react to its strong sense of smell. When threatened, it can release both electricity and poison, though it struggles with self-control.
Author: moga6

Entry: It is adaptable, making it unpredictable in battle. Every small bolt of electricity released strengthens its bond with its Trainer, helping POKENAME control its energy and shape its future evolution.
Author: moga6

Entry: It stays motionless, storing electrical energy within its body. Over time, the energy intensifies, causing its shell to glow with a faint electric charge, which can be released accidentally or intentionally.
Author: moga6

Entry: POKENAME may accidentally release a jolt of electricity while eating. It may have trouble sleeping sometimes, as POKENAME might leak electricity while resting, waking itself up startled.
Author: mbavenger64

Entry: When on the offensive, POKENAME puts everything it has into its attacks. Unfortunately, this means it often hurts itself with overwhelming electricity, or it may leak its poison everywhere before actually hitting the opponent.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are herbivores and eat vegetables, fruits, and berries. When they stumble into campgrounds, they are particularly fond of stealing Mixed Mushrooms, as they are not endemic to where they live.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: This little Flying Pokémon is very hyper and playful. Sometimes POKENAME accidentally shocks its Trainer, but this is usually not too painful.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It jumps over tall grass to keep watch. Each bounce makes a zap sound.
Author: fouguri

Entry: POKENAME is inept at retaining electricity. It hopes to intimidate its predators by looking like a bee.
Author: fouguri

Entry: As it sleeps, POKENAME rocks back and forth, causing its feathers to emit tiny sparks. These gentle discharges illuminate its surroundings with a faint, flickering glow.
Author: .izik

Entry: The static electricity in POKENAME charges the fluid it secretes, making it mildly shocking. It uses this to communicate but may accidentally shock its friends.
Author: moga6

Entry: POKENAME are still young and can't control their electricity. They spend most of their time on Electrowebs that absorb their stray Thunder Shocks.
Author: CodeWolfie

Entry: POKENAME is not very good at flying yet. By conducting a little electricity into its feathers, it has to use less energy for its many attempts to fly.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It's the Hero of Oblivia's charming partner! It electrifies its ukulele to create music that calms upset Pokémon.
Author: .realthree

Entry: This POKENAME used to perform in the far-off region of Oblivia. Due to the destruction of its home, it now searches for an audience in Johto.
Author: Patch_Bros

Entry: POKENAME's bouncy body stores electricity. It sings continuously to help control its energy, and the more it sings, the brighter its body becomes.
Author: moga6

Entry: POKENAME latches onto its foe with sharp fangs before unleashing a powerful Thunder Shock. This surprising tactic allows it to escape from larger predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: On days when the sun shines brightly, pairs of POKENAME will gleefully dance hand-in-hand, spreading a weak electric current through the grass.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: The fire and electric energy of POKENAME are unstable, but with training, it grows into a loyal companion with sharp instincts and impressive teamwork.
Author: moga6

Entry: POKENAME channels its electric energy during intense training. If it skips a day, its sparks grow erratic and it may discharge electricity uncontrollably.
Author: moga6

Entry: This energetic Pokémon struggles to store electricity, often releasing it by accident. When this happens, POKENAME spins its arms rapidly to stabilize and recharge its lost energy.
Author: moga6

Entry: It mimics the movements of others while building up static energy in its body. If startled during its act, POKENAME releases a sudden electric spark that surprises its audience.
Author: moga6

Entry: POKENAME stores electricity in the round pebble it carries, which helps focus its charge. Accidental shocks are still common when it gets excited.
Author: moga6

Entry: POKENAME has difficulty retaining its electricity. While swimming, it will often release a burst of electricity that's then conducted by the water.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: When digging, POKENAME regularly emits weak flashes to briefly illuminate its surroundings so that it does not lose its bearings.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME produces small ice crystals that are charged with large amounts of electricity. However, the ice isn't very conductive, so the stored electricity ends up sparking everywhere.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: When digging, POKENAME regularly emits weak flashes to briefly illuminate its surroundings so that it does not lose its bearings.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: When digging, POKENAME regularly emits weak flashes to briefly illuminate its surroundings so that it does not lose its bearings.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: When digging, POKENAME regularly emits weak flashes to briefly illuminate its surroundings so that it does not lose its bearings.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can sense people's energy levels. If it's low, it may give them a shock to put more pep in their step.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME are naturally shy and avoid combat. They are generally weak, but have incredible hearing and have sharp barbs hidden under their fur. Anyone injected by the poison leaking from their barbs will develop a painful rash.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Male POKENAME generally protect female POKENAME in times of crisis. If they cannot flee or hide from a predator, all POKENAME in the den will try to release all of their stored electricity and toxins in a last-ditch effort to keep themselves safe.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The six tails of POKENAME spark with electricity and give off comforting heat. When focused, it creates floating fire and electric orbs, though their unpredictability often surprises it.
Author: moga6

Entry: Due to its small size and inexperience, POKENAME struggles to maintain its composure. When startled, it ejects its inner organs, which delivers a nasty shock if touched.
Author: Glacierwing

Entry: POKENAME is the result of a Mimikyu possessing a Pichu. While it seems unpleasant to Pichu, being possesed actually helps it control its electricity.
Author: Adoster

Entry: Its electricity connects to its aura, which allows POKENAME to share its emotions. In moments of distress, the aura flares, releasing unstable energy that can shock those nearby.
Author: moga6

Entry: Extremely timid, POKENAME makes its home in hollowed logs, avoiding danger at all costs. If discovered, it releases a sudden bright spark to disorient its predator before fleeing.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME instinctively channels electricity through its tail, but its lack of control sometimes results in shocking itself. It quickly shakes off the jolt and continues playing.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME generates electricity by spinning its body parts. It stores the energy to power its movements, but sometimes releases it when startled.
Author: moga6

Entry: It hides behind illusions, mimicking people or Pokémon to protect itself. However, its lack of control can cause its illusions to falter and lead to accidental discharges when it becomes too excited or startled.
Author: moga6

Entry: POKENAME attempts to ambush its prey before paralyzing them with its electrified jaws. However, due to how wild its electricity is, it often gives away its location before it can strike.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME charges its feathers with electricity as it performs to prepare its attack. A misstep can send an accidental shock flying in every direction.
Author: moga6

Entry: The dreamy dance of POKENAME charges the air around it with static electricity. It is said that those who watch its performance too closely may feel a faint, shocking touch.
Author: moga6

Entry: Born from discarded electronics and waste, POKENAME constantly leaks small electric shocks. Its trash-like body emits a faint smell, though it does no harm unless provoked.
Author: moga6

Entry: Despite its cute appearance, POKENAME are typically handled by professionals due to its lack of control of both its strength and electrical powers.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME rubs its charged scales together to generate electricity. However, if it generates too much energy, the scales will start to vibrate uncontrollably.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The sugary, floss-like fur of POKENAME is both soft and sweet, shedding as it ages. If eaten, it delivers a small static shock, tingling the tongue with electricity.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite its fluffy appearance, POKENAME is not safe to touch, as its body cannot yet control the electricity coursing through it.
Author: chaotic_aspergers

Entry: The three heads of POKENAME are always squabbling with one another since they constantly shock each other with their uncontrollable electricity.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME enjoy play fighting but often get too excited and paralyze weaker Pokémon. Against tougher playmates, POKENAME may end up paralyzing itself.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: Static electricity is built up in POKENAME's fur as it fights. It has not yet mastered how to control this electric charge.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: It often forgets why it started sparking, accidentally releasing electricity while daydreaming. Its relaxed nature makes POKENAME approachable, but its sudden shocks can catch others off guard.
Author: moga6

Entry: POKENAME struggles to retain its electricity, causing accidental bursts of power that charge its magnetic body. The stronger the charge, the more metallic objects it attracts, often becoming stuck to its sides.
Author: moga6

Entry: Struggling to harness electricity, it wields hypnotic powers with an unsteady hand. Its pendulum lulls prey into a trance for easy capture.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME's Light Ball helps it store electricity and prevent unwanted shocks. Its amiable personality makes it a great beginner Pokémon.
Author: noel5229

Entry: Although they can eat a variety of natural and processed foods, POKENAME seems to be most energetic under the full moon. It is thought they get most of their power from the moon's rays.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The interior of POKENAME's sphere defies geometric principles: It's larger on the inside than it is on the outside.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Several POKENAME will stay close together as a circle of Clefairy, Butterfree and their fusions protect them. At night, their protectors will dance together and sing to POKENAME, which seems to help speed up the evolution process.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It consumes gravel to aid in digestion, grinding it down within its tough body. This diet also contributes to the hardening of its rocky exterior.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's wings glitter with the captured light of stars. Some believe that POKENAME came from space, its sparkling wings acting as camouflage.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME school together under the full moon and will jump out of the water to try and bathe themselves in moonlight. Why they do this is unclear, but legends say that if a POKENAME can jump to the moon it will undergo an incredible transformation.
Author: Katie

Entry: According to local rumors, POKENAME are often seen in places where some moon pieces have fallen. It won't hesitate to bite anything that awakens it.
Author: ._term.

Entry: It steals hats from passing travelers to line its nest. The more elaborate the hat, the greater its value in this Pokémon's growing collection.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME becomes incredibly shy during a full moon, hiding behind objects or other Pokémon. Its songs on those nights are barely above a whisper, yet they still carry a sleep-inducing effect.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has a very exploratory nature, using the evening breeze to carry it to parts unknown to explore. When traveling in groups, POKENAME link hands and perform aerial dances together.
Author: sk372

Entry: While travelers sleep, it sneaks in to gnaw off and steal their shoelaces to build its nest. This peculiar habit leaves many waking up in confusion.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME love playing in the moonlight, but tend to get tired after a few minutes. If one finds a Moon Stone, it will show it off to others and toss it around.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: On nights with many shooting stars, POKENAME floats up high into the sky to watch them. Some think that in these moments, they are yearning for home.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME have been said to gather on moonlit nights. Rumour has it these gatherings have inspired poems about interplanetary creatures.
Author: fixthewifi

Entry: It digs in spiral patterns, creating intricate burrows beneath the earth. These twisting paths serve as both a home and a defense, confusing potential intruders.
Author: .izik

Entry: It shreds tree bark to build comfortable bedding, creating soft nests. This habit ensures it always has a cozy place to rest, no matter where it travels.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME glow pink in strong moonlight, and will move a bit faster than normal. Due to only being active near volcanoes on clear nights, this Pokémon is not often seen.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: Strong scents bother it, causing it to avoid flowers or fragrant foods. It prefers areas with neutral smells, making it quite particular about its environment.
Author: .izik

Entry: It sleeps curled up inside hollow tree trunks, seeking warmth and safety. Its small size allows it to squeeze into spaces other Pokémon avoid.
Author: .izik

Entry: It collects fossils, breaking them free from cave walls with its small fists. These treasures are proudly displayed in its nest as a sign of strength.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME constantly grooms the pink puff of fur on its head. It refuses to leave its nest if even a single strand is out of place.
Author: .izik

Entry: When groups of POKENAME gather under the full moon's light, sparks fly in the vicinity. The color of each spark varies from POKENAME to POKENAME, so their displays can be just as mesmerizing as they are dangerous.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It consumes fallen leaves to fuel the flame within its belly, keeping it warm. The more leaves it finds, the hotter its flame becomes.
Author: .izik

Entry: If POKENAME is struck while gazing at the moon, it retaliates with incredible force. Legends say that if it is attacked during a full moon, the counterattack will place a curse upon the aggressor's family.
Author: .izik

Entry: It mimics the behavior of plants, standing still to avoid threats. Rain frightens it, and it seeks cover whenever storm clouds gather.
Author: .izik

Entry: If POKENAME watches a dance routine under a full moon, it can perfectly mimic it after a single viewing. Once learned, it will remember and be able to perform the dance forever.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME flies through starry nights protected by a flying saucer. If it spots an interesting object, it uses a tractor beam to pick it up.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: As a prank, it steals tools from construction sites, causing chaos among workers. These antics often leave construction crews baffled.
Author: .izik

Entry: Unfit for the wild, POKENAME lacks any self-preservation instincts. Without a caretaker, it would continue smiling sweetly as it slowly starves.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Oblivious to its large stature, POKENAME will happily dance about during a meteor shower, often causing unintentional damage to its surroundings.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: By eating poisonous plants, it strengthens the poison sacs within its body. This diet makes it more dangerous over time, with its toxins becoming increasingly potent.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its charm lulls enemies into a false sense of security before it strikes unexpectedly. This deceptive nature makes it a tricky opponent to outwit.
Author: .izik

Entry: It feeds on cave moss, preferring the glowing variety for its subtle sweetness. This unique diet make its spikes glow faintly in dark environments.
Author: .izik

Entry: It consumes metal ore to strengthen the metallic skeleton within its body. This steady intake ensures its durability and gives it a slight shimmer over time.
Author: .izik

Entry: Though it makes wishes to the moon, its intentions toward enemies are filled with malice. Many believe that misfortune befalls those who cross its path under a full moon.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's body is delicate. If hit by a strong attack, it'll melt.
Author: OhOk3441

Entry: POKENAME is playful but shy, following behind Trainers and Pokémon at a distance. It'll float over when beckoned.
Author: OhOk3441

Entry: Some believe POKENAME feeds on positivity. The fire on its head will go out if it's upset.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: Legends claim that its flame is a trapped star. Staring into its light for too long causes visual hallucinations of POKENAME that last for weeks.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME burrows underground to sleep every night, except on full moons. On those nights, it refuses to burrow and instead watches the sky with wide, unblinking eyes.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon's pink metallic body gleams in the moonlight, making it a beautiful sight under clear skies. Its shimmering exterior offers protection from predators during the night.
Author: .izik

Entry: It consumes oil with delight, using it as fuel to keep its internal flame burning brightly. Without regular intake, its fire dims, making it sluggish and cold.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME releases a sweet aroma when it sees a shooting star. Those who breathe in its scent are believed to become extremely lucky later in life.
Author: .izik

Entry: It prefers traveling during sandstorms, using the swirling winds as cover. This behavior allows it to move unseen and avoid potential threats.
Author: .izik

Entry: It flies erratically through marshlands, using its unpredictable movements to confuse predators. Navigating through dense fog is no challenge for this agile Pokémon.
Author: .izik

Entry: It steals jewelry from careless travelers, stashing it away in secret caves. Its hoard grows over time, often rivaling that of treasure hunters.
Author: .izik

Entry: It freezes its food before eating, preferring the crisp texture of frozen meals. Other Pokémon often watch in amazement as it enjoys frozen treats.
Author: .izik

Entry: It gets excitable in moonlight, and scuttles around like a crab. Curiously, its back mushrooms sometimes calcify and become Moon Stones after long periods of time.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: Its nose is so sensitive it can detect changes in the weather before they happen. This ability makes it a reliable companion for predicting storms.
Author: .izik

Entry: On moonlit nights, POKENAME can be found along mountains searching for shiny rocks to decorate their fur.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: The brown stones on POKENAME's body glow a pure white under a full moon. The glow intensifies the longer it remains in direct moonlight.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is popular with infants, as its soft twinkling tail helps lull them to sleep, and is only warm to the touch.
Author: RoboSoup

Entry: It steals coins from unsuspecting victims, stashing them in hidden caves. This hoard often grows large enough to attract treasure hunters.
Author: .izik

Entry: It makes its home in underground lakes, swimming through the dark waters with ease. These hidden habitats provide it with safety from predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: It munches on gems by the handful, savoring their crunch. Jewelers often lament its appetite, as it leaves their stores in disarray.
Author: .izik

Entry: During a full moon, POKENAME refuses to dip its tail in water. Instead, it lifts its tail to the sky for hours, as if waiting for something unseen.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME seems weak, but it has strong powers of attraction and can generate electric magnetic fields to keep enemies away.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: By scaring shopkeepers with sudden appearances, it sneaks away with candy. These mischievous antics make it both troublesome and oddly endearing.
Author: .izik

Entry: When hungry, it becomes cranky and difficult to manage, often retreating deep underground. Trainers quickly learn to carry snacks to avoid its tantrums.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is a popular companion among children due to its playful and patient nature. Scientists believe the peculiar protrusion on its back may be the key to its growth.
Author: Kianjp2008

Entry: It releases a unique scent from its antennae that seems to smell different to everyone. Some say it's sweet and inviting, while others find it unbearable.
Author: PotatoForged

Entry: Its shell is as hard as steel, but inside it's still soft and light. Unable to move by itself, it tumbles aimlessly along the ground until it finally evolves.
Author: PotatoForged

Entry: It floats gently from flower to flower, coating its skin with nectar from each one. When it finds a large patch of flowers, it sings to signal the location to other POKENAME.
Author: PotatoForged

Entry: A tiny powerhouse with unrivaled stamina, POKENAME charges through fields with boundless energy. Its playful demeanor belies its immense strength.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: If interrupted while singing, POKENAME will spit a sticky silk thread at the offender. It then resumes its song without missing a note.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's body is incredibly elastic, allowing it to bounce off any surface. It barely loses any momentum while bouncing, making it almost impossible to stop once it gets going.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's body appears fluffy, but is entirely soft and pliable, bouncy like rubber. It actively enjoys playing by being thrown from one person to another like a game of catch.
Author: sk372

Entry: A Pokémon with a highly pliable body, POKENAME lives in very rugged terrain and makes its home amongst tight cracks that are inaccessible to other Pokémon. At night they sing to one another, creating an eerie illusion that the ground is singing.
Author: Katie

Entry: Young children find POKENAME a great playmate. However, it's advised to not let them play together unattended, as its pollen can make them feel lost.
Author: chiari_queen

Entry: Young children find POKENAME a great playmate. However, it's advised to not let them play together unattended, as its pollen can make them feel lost.
Author: chiari_queen

Entry: It spends much of its waking hours practicing its flight. As the wind can easily blow it away, it must train very hard to achieve mastery. When it is not practicing flight, it is likely practicing its ability to chirp in a sing-song manner.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: This Pokémon uses its fins to propel itself off the ground. The longer it bounces, the more electric energy it accumulates.
Author: Cartoon Hostage

Entry: POKENAME likes to put on small concerts for its friends, singing chipper high-pitched songs to all who would listen. It creates a small shower of colorful sparks above it for the finale.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME begins to sing when it sees a waxing moon, its voice soft and sorrowful. The song is said to bring even those with the hardest hearts to tears.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hums a cheerful melody that lifts the spirits of everyone nearby. Its songs are often heard during sunny afternoons.
Author: .izik

Entry: It constantly beeps and chirps, seemingly at random. It's often seen falling out of trees, bouncing unharmed when it lands.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME floats gently on spring winds, humming softly to itself. Its airy voice is often mistaken for the sound of breeze through trees.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its springy body to bounce into dumpsters in search of food. When it finds something tasty, it hums happily while nibbling away.
Author: .izik

Entry: While resting in amaranth patches, POKENAME sings a lively tune. Its melody is said to encourage nearby plants to grow faster.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon's body is soft and squishy, flowing like a waterbed when held. Deep in the night, it practices its singing.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Each morning, POKENAME greets the day with a cheerful song. If interrupted mid-verse, it explodes in rage, leaving behind scorched surroundings.
Author: .izik

Entry: Anyone who interrupts POKENAME's morning song is met with angry squawks. Its voice grows shriller the longer it's ignored.
Author: .izik

Entry: Don't be fooled by this Pokémon's friendly face. It has been observed to become the apex predator of a new ecosystem in a matter of days.
Author: akujules

Entry: POKENAME may feel soft and pliable, but it has a rock-solid core that prevents its shape from deforming. It can cry for hours on end when upset.
Author: bee4082

Entry: POKENAME lurks in alley shadows, quietly studying humans to mimic their behavior. As it watches, it hums a haunting lullaby only it seems to understand.
Author: .izik

Entry: It is given a Boiled Egg by its parent figures, as the egg helps it practice its skills as a caregiver. When it is ready to move on to a real egg, the Boiled Egg is eaten to give it an extra boost.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: A playful burrowing Pokémon native to Pinkan Island, POKENAME digs shallow burrows and can be found chasing one another through the grass and along beaches. Its hide is surprisingly springy to the touch.
Author: Katie

Entry: When danger nears its nest, POKENAME sings a lively song to rally its allies. If the threat draws closer, it leaks a toxic fluid from its skin.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has a soft, rubbery body except for its sharp horn. The horn contains potent venom capable of paralyzing larger foes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's dolls are said to be inhabited by the souls of young children. It plays with them all day and falls into despair if the dolls are taken away.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: To travel short distances, it releases long strands of electrified silk. The world's electric fields give it the extra boost it needs to float on the breeze. If it bumps into a Pokémon, the silk's charge stuns them while POKENAME makes its escape.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: POKENAME sings a soft lullaby to lull opponents to sleep. Once they're drowsy, it strikes with a sudden spinning kick.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its lullabies are soft and clumsy, often putting itself to sleep before anyone else. Wild groups bounce together in meadows, drifting off mid-song under the moonlight.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Its soft, rubbery body and underdeveloped singing voice make it very difficult for POKENAME to forage for food. As such, it must feed itself by charming humans with its cuteness for treats or by accepting scraps from its more skilled elders.
Author: El Fail

Entry: On bright, sunny days, POKENAME sings a cheerful tune while basking in the warmth. Its melodies are often heard near flower-covered meadows.
Author: .izik

Entry: It likes to bury itself in the soft and mushy soil in moist, lush forests. It eats its way out of the ground, and then sings in delightful appreciation of its meal.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's tiny body is light enough to float in the wind. Once it bumps into a larger Pokémon, POKENAME clings to it and absorbs static electricity.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: Extremely playful Pokémon, POKENAME will pursue anyone they befriend trying to give them one of its red gemstones. If it gives you one, you will become its best friend for the rest of time.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: When predators approach its nest, POKENAME performs a ballet-esque dance. As it twirls, it unleashes an angry song that stuns intruders.
Author: .izik

Entry: While dancing in rhythm, POKENAME swings its rubbery arms in smooth arcs. Its gentle movements are often used to lull others into calm.
Author: .izik

Entry: It has a soft and pliable body, which it uses to contort its way into the dens and burrows of its prey.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: Swimming in large shoals, POKENAME coordinate their shoals with chirps and songs. Divers have found that the songs each shoal makes are unique, allowing them to differentiate between their own shoal and those of other POKENAME.
Author: Katie

Entry: If POKENAME senses danger, it blows its head up to three times its body size to fly away. Once it has gained confidence, it is very affectionate.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME lives high in the canopy of forests, swinging between branches with its elongated arms. If it does miss a branch, its soft and rubbery body prevents it from injuring itself.
Author: Katie

Entry: The hard shell of POKENAME protects it from predators, but also keeps it weighted to the ground; its main body is light, soft, and squishy.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: If POKENAME is in danger, it swims away crying loudly, which unfortunately attracts even more attention.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The hard shell of POKENAME protects it from predators, but also keeps it weighted to the ground; its main body is light, soft, and squishy.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: If POKENAME is in danger, it swims away crying loudly, which unfortunately attracts even more attention.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The hard shell of POKENAME protects it from predators, but also keeps it weighted to the ground; its main body is light, soft, and squishy.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: If POKENAME is in danger, it swims away crying loudly, which unfortunately attracts even more attention.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It drags along the remaining bones of a fallen Togekiss with it and can only sleep soundly while laying near the old bones. Some think the Togekiss spirit still lingers and grants POKENAME small comforts during sleep.
Author: sk372

Entry: This Pokémon is called POKENAME due to their unbreakable bond with one another. It's said that they can feel each other's emotions, and act as one.
Author: zeeroooo

Entry: This marine Pokémon is widely considered to be the modern descendant of an ancient fossil Pokémon. It retains many primordial traits, most notably it lacks a proper swim bladder which leaves it with a poor sense of balance in the water.
Author: Katie

Entry: This marine Pokémon is widely considered to be the modern descendant of an ancient fossil Pokémon. It retains many primordial traits, most notably it lacks a proper swim bladder which leaves it with a poor sense of balance in the water.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME has a pure heart and endless energy. That being said, it doesn't understand how powerful its jaws are and can cause serious injury when it playfully nips at its Trainer.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: Occasionally, a Togetic retains the coloration it had as a Togepi. Most dedicated Togetic collectors would pay huge sums of money to obtain one.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Painting POKENAME eggs is a tradition for people who celebrate Easter. Although it's mostly known for its eggs, it also just makes for a good pet.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME has kept the eggshell on its head since the day it was born. Despite the eggshell permanently blocking its vision, POKENAME always seems to be in a good mood.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is known as a bringer of joy. It flies to people who need help the most to make them feel better with its power.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME's white exoskeleton is covered in red and blue patterns. Every time it sheds its exterior, the fresh undercoat soon hardens to become even stronger than before.
Author: richardcareylol

Entry: POKENAME feels a compulsion to follow after anything it senses exuding joy or excitement. POKENAME parents and Trainers alike find themselves working hard to keep it from running off constantly.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME live in small burrows just underground from popular hiking trails. It thrives off the feelings of pleasure and calmness that radiates off of nearby adventurers. Despite this, they are incredibly shy and refuse to show themselves to others.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: At first glance, the hole in POKENAME's back reveals only an empty shell. However, those close to it know the shell is filled with concentrated joy. POKENAME shares its stock of joy freely, giving extra-pure portions to those suffering from loss.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: When POKENAME hatches, it integrates its protective shell into its body, making it very tough. This also results in the formation of the resistant head shield, which takes a particularly large amount of eggshell.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME's body is extremely flexible. When threatened, it will curl up and hide in its egg shell for protection.
Author: typhloquil

Entry: It doesn't know it has hatched from its egg yet, and keeps within its shell for protection. When it is surrounded by smells it enjoys, it evolves.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: Though the blade is many times larger than the body, POKENAME wields it with surprising ease and agility. A popular children's show starring POKENAME is currently entering its fourth season.
Author: sk372

Entry: It grows immensely attached to the first person it sees. It is immensely durable, and will scooch after them through rain and snow until they reunite.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: This young Pokémon seems to have gotten its head stuck in its egg, rendering it unable to see. It headbutts anything it bumps into when walking.
Author: coooooooookiee

Entry: POKENAME emanates an aura of joy and positivity. POKENAME uses its empathetic nature to find others who feel similarly.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME produces fire that twinkles in all different colors, usually red and blue. It's beloved at special occasions as a result, with it lighting anything from bonfires to small candles.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME is a popular gift presented to game winners at carnivals. It's said that no child is unhappy if they're holding a POKENAME's strings, and vice-versa.
Author: sk372

Entry: A beacon of hope for those lost in the forest, POKENAME produces spores that can help clear and ease the mind. It is very friendly and helpful by nature, guiding people and POKENAME through the woods it calls home.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Though blind, POKENAME can sense the hearts of others nearby, whether wicked or kind. It only bites and draws blood from those it deems as possessing a wicked heart.
Author: sk372

Entry: It attaches itself to people with hearts of compassion and joy. Being young and inexperienced, it sometimes bites off more than it can chew, though.
Author: togetik

Entry: At first, Trainers remark on how aloof a POKENAME can be. With some patience, it will come out of its shell, after which, Trainers come to miss when it would keep its poison barbs to itself.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME spends most of their time sleeping to conserve the energy that they need to grow. Waking a POKENAME is a very bad idea; it will run down the first person it sees until it tires itself out again.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME are controversial due to their violent outbursts, but their Trainers insist that POKENAME can read people's intentions, only targeting those who wish to do harm. Their alleged powers are not admissible in Kantonian nor Johtonian courts.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: Newly hatched POKENAME carry pieces of their eggshell for added protection. Though fragile, these shells are a source of comfort and security when startled.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: POKENAME can be found prancing through blooming flower fields, chirping happy little tunes. It flicks pollen from its leaves at those it deems good souls; inhaling it brings calm and joy for hours.
Author: sk372

Entry: Because of its spiky body, POKENAME wears its eggshell so it can touch people without causing harm. It is almost always happy, hugging anything that gives it joy.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME enjoys playing with young children at the beach, forming shapes together with its sandy body. Touching the shell-like top of its head will cause it to instinctively fling sand and run away, however.
Author: sk372

Entry: The eggshell stuck on POKENAME's neck and tail is hard as rock. It seeks affection from anyone that smiles at it.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Idolizing packs of wild Scraggy, POKENAME has taken to using the little they are born with to emulate the fashion that they so adore. POKENAME does not seem to understand the difference between a cap and a hood.
Author: wilmervr

Entry: A baby Pokémon freshly hatched from its egg, POKENAME has not yet shed its egg fully and uses the remaining shell to protect its body. Its hind legs are far more well-developed than the rest of its body and are used for escape.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME innocently pokes and prods at any litter it comes across while roaming the beach shores. It seems particularly intrigued by egg shell shards from the occasional abandoned nest.
Author: sk372

Entry: It can usually be found floating around in tall grass, singing to injured Pokémon in an effort to help them. It is said that traveling with this Pokémon can bring the Trainer good luck.
Author: curvingapollo

Entry: It always uses its transformations for the benefit of others.  If its Trainer is upset, it will use its ability to sense what will make them happy, then turn into it.
Author: bostroms

Entry: POKENAME makes burrows in clouds. Its body is soft to the touch, but cannot be pierced.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: The warmth and joy from the fusion between Togetic and Typhlosion resulted in POKENAME. Despite being a ferocious battler, it's also a great friend.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Its massive jaw is always smiling with its 48 pristine teeth. It smiles to try to bring joy to people, because it cannot process negativity very well.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: Kind people who enter forests are often followed by a flock of POKENAME. If anyone tries to attack the person whom they follow, the offender will be pelted with twigs or anything else nearby that POKENAME can carry.
Author: darkweavile428

Entry: POKENAME gives a lock of its hair to people it senses have pure hearts. Legend has it these hairs bring blessings of health, protection, and luck.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME's pristine exterior is the result of it shedding its exoskeleton many times before it evolved, hardening it further each time. It will continue to shed its outer shell multiple times in order to reach its final evolution.
Author: richardcareylol

Entry: When it meets a kindhearted person, POKENAME rolls around them in ecstatic circles. Sometimes it builds up too much speed and crashes into buildings, then sheepishly offers a blessing of good luck.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: POKENAME communicates with a series of bellowing roars that form a unique song. Mountain villages celebrate POKENAME's singing as a joyous event.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: Whenever it gets hungry, it dines on a healthy array of fruits to satisfy its sweet tooth. Apricots are traditionally fed to it when traded, to indicate a fresh start.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME's lightweight body lets it glide with ease, spreading joy throughout the world. It can sense when others are in need and can swiftly fly over to heal them.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: In battle, POKENAME uses the love it has for its friends to persevere. It can feel every feeling its opponents feel.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME's eggshell skin becomes more flexible over time, but no less resistant. It can almost completely absorb projectiles that hit its head shield. Its wings, on the other hand, are only weakly developed, so it can hardly fly.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its head shield is incredibly soft, but surprisingly sturdy. POKENAME can even hurl back large projectiles such as cannonballs. However, as it is very wary of conflict, it rarely makes use of this ability.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can be found relaxing in beautiful places. They're said to bring good fortune to whomever brings them an offering of sweet fruits.
Author: bee4082

Entry: POKENAME offers itself to be held by kindhearted Trainers, who it fills with joy. However, the sword is disheartened by being used to draw blood.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It often floats over blooming fields, spreading joy wherever it goes. Its dance is said to heal broken hearts.
Author: dammaskk

Entry: POKENAME has a pure heart and a strong sense of justice, so much so that it often avoids those who hold dishonesty or cruelty in their hearts.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: The multicolored fire POKENAME produces brings a sense of relief and joy in all who see or even smell it. For some reason, domesticated POKENAME love watching fireworks, but wild ones avoid the loud sounds.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The pollen from POKENAME's flowers is said to bring pure happiness. Its flowers bloom largest when it lives around kindhearted people.
Author: gellyfishsh

Entry: Affectionate towards its Trainer, a POKENAME will seem to hold a grudge against certain people even before meeting them. Once POKENAME decides it doesn't like someone, it's very hard to change its mind.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME spends most of their time sleeping to conserve the energy that they need to grow. They can only rest if they are in the presence of people they trust.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME are valiant defenders of the peace. They staunchly oppose collaborating with those who wish to cause strife instead.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: After shedding its fragile eggshell, POKENAME is much more curious of the outside world compared to its pre-evolution. It often allies with other young Pokémon for comfort.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: POKENAME are very kind creatures, healing many targeted by predators. It swims at high speeds, finding any Pokémon in need of help.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: POKENAME's feathers are so soft that if you touch them, all of your negative emotions will magically disappear. It adores young children and will even allow them to ride on its back while it flies.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: If it finds someone in need of cheering up, it will hug them with its many tentacles to 'magically' make them feel better. These tentacles are very lightweight, allowing them to act as extra pairs of wings.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is unfailingly loyal to those with a kind heart. As a result, spiteful Trainers may find that it betrays them.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME seeks out the kind-hearted and bestows happiness to them. It is said that just one hug from this Pokémon can ward off nightmares for years.
Author: noel5229

Entry: Despite is friendly nature, POKENAME is quite dangerous to train. It has a tendency to grab anyone it likes with its powerful pincers as a show of affection.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME are very knowledgeable on the process and advantages of evolution, seeking out the evolution that they predict will benefit them the most. Domestic POKENAME can even predict which evolution will suit their Trainers or future teams best.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: It turns itself invisible in order to observe others. If you have a creeping feeling of something watching you, it is nearly always a POKENAME.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: Due to its awkward body shape, POKENAME is unable to properly walk. It uses its wings and psychic power to propel itself in any direction.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: POKENAME's long beak functions as a blowgun that can fire high-pressure water darts. However, the beak's awkward shape prevents it from swimming well.
Author: chartanon

Entry: POKENAME communicate with each other through a mix of stomping and telepathy. Herds of POKENAME roam open plains in search of tasty roots and shoots.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: POKENAME are revered in some regions for their light footwork and nice crests. Many drink its milk seeking enlightenment, as it causes unique visions.
Author: totodile.

Entry: POKENAME's intense gaze draws the attention of passersby, when it will then begin to entertain and imitate them. When it grows bored, it performs a final grand trick before quickly fleeing.
Author: Arcul

Entry: Standing perfectly still when it enters battle, POKENAME will not strike until it senses hostility. If it has fought an opponent once before, it will be able to read the patterns of their strategy effortlessly.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME scales short trees to peck at new shoots and replenish its vital fluids. After a meal, it enjoys playful mud baths.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME drifts silently through the night, its small body cloaked in shadows. With glowing markings around its eyes and a mischievous nature, it plays tricks on unsuspecting travelers while using its psychic powers to create eerie illusions.
Author: ThePandaSharky

Entry: POKENAME basks in the sun for long periods of time, being able to predict where food will be in advance. It can jump up to 10 feet and scale trees.
Author: totodile.

Entry: POKENAME's wings are underdeveloped, so it cannot use them to dance or fly. However, it still sways and turns to fascinate its enemies into inaction.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME typically enjoy relaxing in fluffy clouds. Timid when around new Trainers or Pokémon, they can warm up to those whom they deem good at heart.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME perches on tree limbs and observes fights from afar with its strong eyesight, cataloging the moves of different Pokémon. Pokémon often come to seek its advice on how to counter the techniques it has witnessed.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME can spend hours basking in the warm sand and observing the sun, enjoying this most as the sun sets. They seem to relax when doing this.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME peers into its opponent's mind and thoroughly judges them based on their actions. If it deems its opponent unworthy, it exits the battle.
Author: 8xviktor

Entry: POKENAME peers into its opponent's mind and thoroughly judges them based on their actions. If it deems its opponent unworthy, it exits the battle.
Author: 8xviktor

Entry: Even if POKENAME sees a foe charging at it, POKENAME will fail to react in any reasonable amount of time. Scientists believe that POKENAME is so preoccupied trying to ease its constant headaches that it often fails to process the physical world.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are a very observant species, making sure that one head is always taking in their surroundings. Some domesticated POKENAME can even draw detailed maps of the areas surrounding their home.
Author: sk372

Entry: They are an essential part of the Johto postal service, as they transport Flower Mail between friends and family. They also double as sorters, as they easily identify mail that matches their coloration.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Certain cultures believe that a POKENAME was responsible for creating the world. Deep, rumbling thunder accompanies its flight.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Certain cultures believe that a POKENAME was responsible for creating the world. Deep, rumbling thunder accompanies its flight.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME absorbs power from the sun and uses it to fuel its flames. It's said that the smoke that it trails is meant as a signal to other Pokémon.
Author: .realthree

Entry: It can foresee anyone approaching it, and it has the ability to teleport away in an instant. As a result, it was thought to be a myth created by early settlers of the region.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are often found burrowing in any tight spot they can find. They are known for being mischievous, but this trait is a sign of affection for their Trainers.
Author: 1bridgeyboo

Entry: During the day, POKENAME stands perfectly still and stares at the sun, but as soon as night falls, it takes to the skies in search of prey.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: POKENAME has the power to peer into the future and past. Some theorize it even has the power to change the outcomes of certain events.
Author: MaNandesz

Entry: It gazes into the future all day, calmly ignoring all provocations. While POKENAME's intellect is prodigious enough to chart courses toward favorable timelines, it prefers to search for the highest jumps nearby Magikarp will ever make.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: POKENAME has an eyelid, but it chooses not to use it. It stares at the ground at night and up at the sky during the day, almost like it tracks the sun's movements.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: POKENAME is plagued by visions of past events, unable to escape the echoes of history. It often buries its face in the mud in a desperate attempt to block out these relentless sights.
Author: .izik

Entry: It effortlessly swims through the water, sniping weaker Pokémon with shots from its beak. It foresees the future to ensures its shots will always hit.
Author: chartanon

Entry: POKENAME's vines are engraved with ancient text. Lingual historians revealed they chronicle an empire's story: green bands for detailing its era of prosperity, yellow for transitions, and red ones denoting the empire's fall to invading forces.
Author: bollocksmen

Entry: POKENAME is always in a blissful mood because its psychic abilities show it visions of happy events in the future. Its inability to foresee tragedy often leads it into danger.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME stands at the top of canyons and uses its feathers to sense the wind's direction. It gains knowledge of the future in this way.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME seeks out small communities to protect. However, its enigmatic power and unsettling nature often leads to humans shunning it instead.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME's movements in battle are so careful and calculated that many believe it gazes into the future to see how its opponent will fight, and moves according to that vision.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its wings move independently of itself, as its wings detect treats and shift to block them. It wears an Ability Shield behind its back to ensure that its wings remain free to block attacks.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME actively changes color in response to the future it foresees. By blending into its surroundings before danger arrives, it avoids threats before they even appear.
Author: .izik

Entry: It is said that when ancient civilizations called on spirits to guide them, POKENAME would appear from the flames. While its predictions may seem hazy at first, they always ring true.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Though it can foresee every disaster that will ever occur, it is powerless to alter fate. It perches silently on high cliffs, mourning the lives it is unable to save.
Author: amiel997

Entry: A gentle psychopomp, knowing exactly when others are to die. It cannot stop the inevitable, but it provides comfort and guidance towards the end.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: The many eyes on the slowly rotating bodies of POKENAME seem to be nothing more than markings. Some conclude that they must navigate by peering into the future instead.
Author: imademyselfdothis

Entry: Able to stay perfectly still for years, archaeologists initially mistook POKENAME for a statue. A swivel of its head convinced researchers otherwise.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME has a small but loyal group of followers who believe they can see the future by observing the subtle intricacies of its pivoting head.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME uses its psychic abilities to peer up to 10 minutes into the future. It relies on this foresight to decide whether it should move from its usual resting spot on the seafloor.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are used to capture the nightmares of sleeping people. When it captures a nightmare, it turns it into Dream Mist.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: Many say POKENAME's blank gaze is due to its ability to remotely view multiple timelines at once. It constantly sees the many ways its lodge could be destroyed, leaving it in a perpetual state of silent contemplation.
Author: .izik

Entry: The dances that a POKENAME knows varies from place to place. This one is dancing to express the joy of living.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Archaeologists remain puzzled about how POKENAME learned the intricate dances of ancient cultures. Some debate whether POKENAME inspired early humans with its movements, while others suggest it might have mimicked tribal dances.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: The dances that a POKENAME knows varies from place to place. This one is dancing to express a wish for victory.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The dances that a POKENAME knows varies from place to place. This one is dancing to express a wish for peace.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The dances that a POKENAME knows varies from place to place. This one is dancing to express grief for departed souls.
Author: .realthree

Entry: A mysterious aura seems to surround POKENAME, cursing any operators of polluting machinery that come near it.
Author: zotobom

Entry: POKENAME have the ability to see the future. They use this ability to ensure they rarely fail at capturing prey in the deserts where they live. Because of this, Cacturne are their greatest rivals.
Author: odditylad

Entry: Due to their psychic abilities, POKENAME are superior desert hunters compared to Cacturne. Occasionally, Cacturne will dress up as POKENAME to mock them. These Cacturne are rumoured to begin thinking they are POKENAME and develop abilities.
Author: odditylad

Entry: An older POKENAME is said to be a desert oracle. By basking in the heat and looking into the sun, they can tell what recently happened in this desert and what is to come in the near future. These predictions are quite cryptic.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME's clairvoyance abilities are weak, so it can only see parts of the future. Because of that, many POKENAME are afflicted by a persistent phobia of the future, and they're prone to anxiety attacks.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME scatter sticks to burn in special rituals, reading the way the smoke drifts from the fire to predict the future. Offering a stick to a POKENAME will give them an anchor to read your future specifically.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME scatters a shimmering powder that forces prey to relive horrifying visions of its past hunts. Paralyzed by fear, its victims become easy targets for capture.
Author: .izik

Entry: Because of POKENAME's overwhelming psychic energy, it is in almost constant agony. For this reason, many Trainers oppose creating this fusion.
Author: nowhereandanywhere

Entry: POKENAME moves slowly and methodically on land, walking in an odd and uneven gait. When in water, it prefers to travel downstream, effortlessly avoiding any obstacles in its way.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME can see into the future, but its reaction is delayed due to its slow movements. This causes it to respond to events only when its vision is already unfolding, making it appear eerily well-prepared.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's three heads respectively see the past, present, and future. The middle head often has to protect the other two from dangers happening in the moment.
Author: pinkyoshi2350

Entry: The pole it carries acts as a battery to store the excess electricity built up within its thick wool.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME rubs its gem-like bones against its fur to create static electricity. According to many, it gives great hugs.
Author: leonian1586

Entry: POKENAME are generally very energetic and can run for long periods of time without stopping. They are able to sense where thunderstorms are happening using their front horns like divining rods.
Author: Gamblebreaker

Entry: This Pokémon flutters gracefully through the skies. Static electricity flies through the air as POKENAME does.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: It rubs its woolly palms together to gather immense amounts of static electricity, creating powerful orbs of lightning to hurl at foes. The orb on its tail can emit powerful stunning psychic pulses to further incapacitate opponents.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME generate a powerful static charge that they use to hover above the land and travel using the winds. Several Trainers have been electrocuted after making contact with a POKENAME that was blown off-course by a sudden gust.
Author: Alumed

Entry: At night, the meadows of Johto glow faintly with the lights of POKENAME drifting overhead. These flickers let them communicate over great distances.
Author: tuneless.towa

Entry: POKENAME coils up in its own fluffy wool to stay warm. If agitated it will shake its tail furiously, flickering a bright light to blind the nuisance and give POKENAME time to slither away.
Author: sk372

Entry: The eyes of POKENAME also function as projectors. The way these projectors show the dreams of POKENAME created the popular thought experiment, "Do Porygon Dream of Electric Mareep?".
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: When it gets stressed from the emotion it feels around it, it rubs its large fluffy head. This allows it to charge its electricity in case of danger.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: It rubs the wool on its body vigorously before a battle or hunt. The static charge this creates internally coats its extendable tongue in electricity, allowing it to shock foes or prey into submission.
Author: sk372

Entry: Since POKENAME's jaws are covered with wool, it will often discharge static electricity on its prey whilst chewing.
Author: Mossybanana

Entry: Despite its insistently snuggly nature, the bodies of POKENAME are rock hard. Much to the disappointment of first-time POKENAME Trainers, what appears to be fluffy wool is actually tightly woven steel fibers.
Author: Something_Smith

Entry: POKENAME preys on Mareep, disguising itself amongst the flock. It will pick them off one by one, snatching them during the night and bringing them back to its den.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME lives in arctic environments and is usually found huddled together to use its body heat and thick wool to ward off the cold. When large numbers of them gather, their combined electrical field disrupts compasses, making navigation difficult.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME's woolly tail generates static electricity by rubbing against itself. This energy is transferred to its blade.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It braids its voluminous wool with an incredible mastery of static electricity. Its graceful but innocent nature has inspired many an artistic spirit.
Author: miecreates

Entry: Through a combination of physical mimicry and illusion powers, POKENAME is almost indistinguishable from a Mareep when its head is lowered. It enjoys revealing its true form to scare shepherds.
Author: Atlas333

Entry: POKENAME's soft wool and friendly disposition makes it popular among farmers. Its tail serves as an anchor to keep it from drifting off when asleep.
Author: howlingstarr

Entry: The static that its wool produces lightly shocks those nearby as it floats in the breeze. Packs of POKENAME play together before severe thunderstorms.
Author: fountainihili

Entry: During heavy thunderstorms, they can be spotted on mountain ridges, stretching their heads upwards to be struck by nourishing lightning.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME generate energy by singing, using their tail as a microphone to amplify their voice. The resulting electric waves are strong enough to fully charge a smartphone with just one song.
Author: _kuke_

Entry: After every twelve rotations of the gear a small burst of electrically-charged wool particles bursts out from POKENAME. The particles are harmless, only causing an hour of ticklish tingling sensations.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME likes to float around playgrounds and schools. They entice children into touching their yellow spheres, violently shocking them.
Author: Sottiwotti

Entry: POKENAME's fur stores static electricity that it generates while running. However, it will end up shocking itself if it stores too much energy.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its bioluminescent coating glows and becomes charged when it feels strong emotions. The resulting charge occasionally causes it to levitate; as a result, it is often mistaken for ball lightning or will-o-wisps.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME's body is powered by the electric orb on its chest and will appear during thunderstorms to recharge its orb. If one POKENAME wanders away from its herd, the rest of the group will follow.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The fleece on POKENAME's head generates abundant static electricity. It uses this energy to charge the orb on its tail so it can glow brightly, drawing curious passersby into the woods in hopes of making friends.
Author: Arcul

Entry: It grows its thick fur to fortify the barrier around it. Those who make contact with this Pokémon may suffer from paralysis or cardiac arrest.
Author: alliveir

Entry: POKENAME infiltrates herds of Mareep in an attempt to clandestinely steal one away to eat. However, this behavior sometimes causes it to be targeted by Mareep's predators.
Author: .realthree

Entry: As it builds static charge by walking, the fur in POKENAME's ears puffs out, making it appear larger. Touching it in this state can cause severe electrical burns.
Author: PotatoForged

Entry: It builds up its psychokinetic abilities through the static electricity in its wool. A herd of POKENAME can be seen from miles away from the light they emit from their static buildup.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: The silver spoon it carries with it acts as a crosshair aiming its electrical attacks. It can aim its attacks so precisely it can hit a target from 100 yards away.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: They live together in herds for protection. If even one is in danger, all of the herd will release a powerful poison from their mouth.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: In combat, POKENAME will throw its static wool at its opponents. The wool contains large amounts of electrical energy that somehow attracts lightning strikes.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's plume of feathers and large wings protect their bulbs from any threats on the ground. They spend most of their time flying through the air, spreading their wings to let sunlight shine down on their bulbs.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Despite its lack of wings, POKENAME is capable of amazing flight. Its sticky, yet feathery body allows it to fall hundreds of feet from off of trees unharmed to feast on nectar on the surface, and floats back up from the slightest breeze.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME uses its bone like a boomerang, striking other Bird Pokémon out of the sky. It will then steal any leftover bones and feathers to decorate itself with.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Because of its curved-out body shape, POKENAME will often fly a bit too high for its comfort. To counter this, it hardens its body, giving them enough weight to come back down  and not float off into space.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: Other bird Pokémon are easily frightened by POKENAME due to its doubled pair of wings that give it lots of air control. However, its intimidation factor is what allows POKENAME to protect the Caterpie and Metapod it has bonded with.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: Sour Curry is not a popular choice for many Pokémon, but it is one that it takes to ensure other Pokémon in the party can eat well. It nourishes itself on tart and sour dishes so that other Pokémon may thrive eating their favorites.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: These gorgeous POKENAME can be seen on pristine, snowy days, its blue feathers radiate a beautiful blue glow as it flies. As it swoops down to catch their prey, their wings become coated in small ice crystals.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is a very strong Pokémon, and it will whip up a tornado if threatened. Its blue feathers look like waterfalls and contain an ancient power.
Author: Smallcutekitty

Entry: POKENAME is a very strong Pokémon. Its claws are razor sharp, and it will whip up a tornado without effort if it feels threatened.
Author: Smallcutekitty

Entry: In an unlikely situation where Pidgey can't agree on their share of prey, this Pokémon steps in to settle the dispute. Its leadership resembles that of a seasoned flock leader, ensuring order among its group.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: It sets itself apart from its flock with its unique hunting method. It lures prey in with its gorgeous feathers and tears them apart with its sharp talons.
Author: cheroace

Entry: POKENAME can fly at Mach-3 speeds, causing devastating windstorms that knock down large sections of forest. The plumage on its head is admired by Pokémon of all sizes for its brilliance.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Those who keep Pidtata long enough to evolve into POKENAME are rewarded with a very loyal companion. Its feathers are well-cleaned and soft to touch.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: This powerful Pokémon emits an otherworldly energy that disrupts the concentration of those nearby. Legends say its flight can inspire visions of ancient knowledge.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: A POKENAME was sighted invading a flock of 30 Spearow and Fearow on its own. By the end of the encounter, just 5 minutes later, the POKENAME had become the flock leader.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: While its wings allow it to fly at Mach 2, POKENAME mostly uses them to regulate its body temperature. Its talon-like pincers are made of steel.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: POKENAME doesn't attack unless provoked. All Pidgey and Spearow fear POKENAME from appearance and demeanor alone and will give up their meals, hoping they will be spared from its razor-sharp talons and beak.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME's powerful talons enable it to cling to walls while executing intricate combat maneuvers. It trains relentlessly to perfect aerial techniques that outmaneuver its foes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME do not like being disturbed, especially when they sleep. When other Pokémon get too close and too loud, the serpentine tail will inject potent venom into the disturbance.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: If POKENAME does not consume three trees' worth of berries daily, it will chirp loudly in frustration. Trainers raising one must always have a plentiful berry supply on hand.
Author: .izik

Entry: Whenever it sees a plate of Sweet Curry, it is filled with thoughts of winning the Little Cup. Now that it is too big for those events, it cheers for the Trainer's baby Pokémon whenever it gets the chance.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Each of its feathers holds a potent magnetic charge, even after being shed. Digital recordings of it consistently have a "halo" effect, as a result.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Strong wings and sharp claws allow POKENAME to hunt in the wild. The red spikes along its side prevent attackers from harming its prized wings.
Author: Therider

Entry: POKENAME are extremely agile in battle. They are capable of fighting gracefully both on land and in the air.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: At the crack of dawn, it emerges from its nest to hunt for bugs or exposed roots. This burst of early morning activity catches most prey by surprise, so it brings plenty of food back.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME usually swoop down from on high before delivering devastating kicks with their talons. They abduct their prey before their peers can even react, leaving nothing but confusion and feathers behind.
Author: Frink202

Entry: In times long past, POKENAME were known as the weapon of choice for many infamous pirate captains. They valued this Pokémon for its keen mind and keener blade.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: The swords fly at mach 1 separated and mach 2 while flying together. They are such effective hunters that they most often hunt for sport.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Their curved blades have made POKENAME a popular Pokémon among pirates. During the night, they hunt down bug Pokémon by cutting off the branches that the bugs sleep on and carry them back to their nests in the mountains.
Author: leandermalurt

Entry: It protects its domain with sharp claws and by unleashing electric bolts from the sky. Those who win its trust are rewarded with a loyal companion.
Author: garret95

Entry: POKENAME forms a bond with its Trainer so strong it could be mistaken for telepathy. If it senses that its Trainer is in danger, it is liable to break free from its ball and burn the threat to ashes.
Author: octolinggrimm

Entry: In combat, POKENAME will spin its body at high speeds to create large twisters. Scientists have been researching if POKENAME's abilities could be used as a source of wind power.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME will often perch on the shoulders of Trainers it trusts. It emits a soft, cooing sound around Trainers it likes.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME aggressively defends its territory with its sharp claws and beak, darting through the sky to land quick blows on its aggressors. It has a frail body, however, and needs to constantly balance its aggression with keeping a safe distance.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME soars through the skies with its majestic wings. POKENAME typically guard ancient ruins where they will create eerie and powerful winds to scare off any intruders.
Author: NightwingJay

Entry: POKENAME has mastered the skies and soars on updrafts to view its territory. It can rain pellets of fire on its opponents on the ground.
Author: Elite01.

Entry: Its feathers shine like sleek obsidian. A single plume under your pillow can keep you warm throughout the night.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: Despite it's small stature, POKENAME is a ferocious battler. It's gorgeous head feathers dance as it stomps on it's foes with it's sharp talons.
Author: asyoko

Entry: It is dangerously territorial. Groups of them claim whole mountainsides for their kin. They frequently clash with migrating Rhyhorn.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: Its feathers have adapted to work efficiently even when covered in debris. They are found hunting in deserts or beaches depending on the season.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: POKENAME lives in treetops, where it feeds on leaves and dead wood. The fungus on its back robs it of any sense of pain.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: On sunny days, its feathers glow like a shimmering rainbow. In medieval times, the most illustrious manuscripts were said to be penned with POKENAME quills.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: It takes pride in the glossy length of feathers extending from its head. Anything touching these feathers will quickly send POKENAME into a flapping, screeching frenzy.
Author: sk372

Entry: The feathers on POKENAME's body become rigid and erect when it flies into a rage. In this state, it attacks anything nearby, flapping its wings violently to strike with razor-sharp gusts.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME spends considerable time preening its feathers to better dissipate the heat its body generates. A graceful flyer, it's common for pilots to report these majestic beasts flying alongside them for hours at a time.
Author: King Mordork

Entry: The tip of POKENAME's maw can shatter boulders. If in danger, it can whip up intense fiery whirlwinds with a flap of its wings.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The tip of POKENAME's maw can shatter boulders. If in danger, it can whip up intense fiery whirlwinds with a flap of its wings.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME uses its sharp beak to dig into marble deposits and consume the rubble. The minerals it ingests strengthen its bones, making it an even more formidable flier.
Author: .izik

Entry: A special oil secreted from POKENAME's feathers allows it to glide effortlessly in water. With enough speed, it can dive beneath the surface and propel itself like a torpedo.
Author: .izik

Entry: Orphaned Mareep are under POKENAME's protection, carried safely within its pouch. Electricity stored in the orb on its tail can be discharged at any time in protection of its child.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME has a very spoiled nature. It causes catastrophic damage if upset, so it is usually raised by wealthy people who can satisfy its needs.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: The wool scattered from POKENAME's wings is softly scented like honey. Clean sheets made from this wool are renowned for their fresh smell.
Author: .realthree

Entry: It loves the strong updrafts caused by lightning storms and seeks them out. The thrill of soaring through charged skies fuels its adventurous nature.
Author: .izik

Entry: It's commonly mistaken for a Shiny Mareep. The thickness of its wool and the voltage of the electricity it generates, however, is much closer to that of a Flaaffy.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Most of POKENAME's power is generated by static electricity from its natural cotton. Because of this, it tries to avoid getting wet whenever possible.
Author: Phantom640

Entry: The orb it carries glows a deep cerulean as it ascends, dimming as it descends. This enchanting glow is especially beautiful on moonless nights.
Author: .izik

Entry: The puffballs it floats with are filled with static electricity. It redirects this energy into a Thunder Wave to stun attackers.
Author: .izik

Entry: While swimming, the orb on its tail reacts to the cool water, glowing with a soft blue light. This process charges its body with electricity.
Author: .izik

Entry: Fascinated by yellow objects, it collects them to line its nest. It uses electric shocks to stun foes before stealing their valuables.
Author: .izik

Entry: When it bites an enemy, it releases a burst of sparks. If enraged it will unleash a powerful Thunder Shock to knock out the foe.
Author: .izik

Entry: The wool on its head and around its neck is highly conductive. The wool around its torso is used to make the best resistor on the planet.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME makes its home inside old manuals and schematics for electronic devices. It stays near machinery, secretly absorbing electricity from unattended equipment.
Author: .izik

Entry: The orbs on its body store static electricity collected from its wool. Once fully charged, the orbs drop off, allowing new ones to grow.
Author: .izik

Entry: It wiggles the orb on its antennae before releasing bolts of lightning at intruders. This shocking defense ensures its safety.
Author: .izik

Entry: It flies effortlessly through thunderstorms, absorbing lightning into the orb on its tail. This energy fuels its powerful electric attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: It channels electricity through the orb on its tail, unleashing a powerful Discharge while hunting. This tactic stuns prey and ensures an easy catch.
Author: .izik

Entry: When POKENAME gets sick from producing too much milk and wool, they are fed plant-based jerky to revitalize them. The jerky is digested several times, as their cud-chewing biology allows them to obtain more nutrients from a single bite.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It loves the feeling of static electricity, so POKENAME rubs its wool and tongue against various surfaces to transfer electrical charges.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It lines the inside of its den with soft tufts of wool that it sheds. These tufts keep its home warm and cozy.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME will often discharge its electricity simply as an exercise, as it is concerned about having less wool with which to generate it.
Author: Mossybanana

Entry: The dome on its head is always electrically charged. Getting too close with loose coins in your pocket might cause small shocks.
Author: Something_Smith

Entry: Large colonies of POKENAME can cause problems with nautical and polar navigation; its combined electrical fields play havoc with navigation equipment. Its tail gives off soft light; in antiquity, it was used similarly to lighthouses.
Author: Katie

Entry: The wool of POKENAME is waterproof and very cold-resistant, allowing it to swim in arctic waters without feeling the cold. The lights on its tail create dazzling underwater displays, drawing tourists from miles around.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME's wool generates more electricity, and its body is more resistant to shocks. Electrical arcs form when it nears conductive materials.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: When POKENAME sees the full moon, sparks fly off their body. Distant dazzling light displays when the full moon is high in the sky may be a group of POKENAME dancing in glee.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It floats among storm clouds, passively absorbing a charge. If startled, it drops its orb, which explodes in an annihilative electrical discharge.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: The orb on its head stores vast amounts of electricity, despite its size. If utilizes this energy to attack with bolts of lightning.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME stores static electricity in its wool, which is often heard crackling softly under the moonlight. It is known to sneak up behind Trainers and zap them playfully before skipping off in delight.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Flaaffy's soft wool mixed with Whimsicott's great cotton makes the ultimate fabric. This special fiber is used in many boots, vests, and hats.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: The webs covering its nest can be charged with electricity, creating a powerful trap. Intruders are left stunned and immobilized.
Author: .izik
