Entry: Its conductive wool quickly distributes electrical energy to its body. It tries to attract lightning with the extension on its head and tail.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It drifts lazily through pond waters on its back, exposing its orb to the air. If startled, it releases electricity into the water, stunning everything nearby.
Author: .izik

Entry: While POKENAME live in packs, their most common natural competition is also their packmates. They argue and get into violent fights amongst one another for things such as food or the best napping spot.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It clings to the bases of windmills to absorb electricity, which can be a nuisance for locals. The collected energy powers its electric abilities.
Author: .izik

Entry: The brighter the orb on its tail glows, the more electricity is stored in its feathers. When large thunderstorms roll in, its white feathers will start to turn dark grey.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: When attacking, it clamps its jaws onto a foe and releases sparks from its wings. This dual assault overwhelms its prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: By rubbing the button-like orbs on its chest, it stores static electricity. It can release powerful Electro Balls from its paws when threatened.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its orb-like eyes glow a bright cyan before releasing Sleep Powder. The mesmerizing glow lulls foes into a deep slumber.
Author: .izik

Entry: The wool-like material covering POKENAME's lower body is highly conductive, storing powerful electrical energy. It discharges this electricity with a powerful headbutt when provoked.
Author: .izik

Entry: It produces electricity to power a microwave with how often it pulls up its pants made of fleece. It is said that in one day of storing static, it has enough electricity to cook a pack of Instant Noodles.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: The iron bands on its ankles regulate its electrical energy. When it punches, it releases pulses of electricity for devastating strikes.
Author: .izik

Entry: The oil that POKENAME secretes is incredibly conductive, making it not only useful for its shiny coat but also empowering its attacks. It has also been used as a component in some batteries.
Author: Gamblebreaker

Entry: The static electricity it builds up in the fleece around its head stimulates its brain, amplifying its psychic abilities.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: The orb in its mouth shines brightly as it prepares to Wrap a foe in its wool. The glow intensifies with its excitement as it absorbs their essence.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are very unique, as they don't have any enemies. They are a popular choice among young Trainers because of their humorous smirk.
Author: the_smirker

Entry: Its fists glow brightly whenever it throws a punch. Some have been trained to communicate in Morse code via a series of punches.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: It uses the light it emits at night to gather nectar to produce honey. This light is also bright enough to ward off predators by blinding them.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME become very destructive during thunderstorms. This behavior is a rising concern in some regions, often being mentioned in weather broadcasts.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: After fusion, this Pokémon has a calmer attitude, but increased power. It's a bad idea to swim with it around.
Author: creeps_jr

Entry: The bright light that POKENAME can emit from their antennae can shine through even the deepest parts of the ocean, making it valuable in sea-based rescue missions. However, the light is so bright it can cause eye damage without proper protection.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: This Pokémon flies above lakes and creeks. POKENAME will sometimes zap the water to knock out weak fish Pokémon. Those fish Pokémon become its meal.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME often control other dog-like Pokémon and make them its servants. If they don't comply, they get a whack to the face.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: When POKENAME break into a sprint, a small but bright explosion occurs, followed by a thunderous boom seconds after. The light from this event can be seen from miles away.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: By rubbing the orbs on their tails together, POKENAME can generate enough static to pick up most items without using their hands.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: POKENAME can control their electricity in the water thanks to their rubbery skin and crystal orbs. They can communicate with others in their group by channeling signals through these orbs.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME produce powerful flashes of light at night, their tails blinking in rapid repeating patterns to communicate with one another in the dark. Large swarms of POKENAME can cause problems for human settlements due to light pollution.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME are treasured for the quality of their fur, which is often used to make static-resistant clothes.
Author: Mossybanana

Entry: POKENAME lives on the abyssal plains of the ocean. There it lights up the pitch-black ocean and attracts prey that swims straight into its mouth.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: With its powerful light, POKENAME sweeps the shoals where it makes its home. If prey is spotted, they subdue it with a blast of electricity.
Author: caladria

Entry: POKENAME lives on the abyssal plains of the ocean. There it lights up the pitch-black ocean and attracts prey that swims straight into its mouth.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its grand beard resembles rolling stormclouds. Crackling can constantly be heard from inside its fluff, suggesting it is always brewing a lightning storm within its fur.
Author: Something_Smith

Entry: POKENAME's beacon-like light attracts treasure-hunters and challengers it is eager to face.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: The rotating of POKENAME's gears builds energy, which it stores in the red cores protected in its wool. The cores are highly sought after to power large devices like lighthouses.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME actively searches for lost people to guide them to safety. Most of the time POKENAME stays with Trainers it rescues forever.
Author: Shiina Valkyria (W)

Entry: The golden core at its center is said to generate immense energy, powering its defenses and granting it the ability to control lightning.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: Pokémon Trainers shouldn't be fooled by POKENAME's deceptive cuteness. It can deliver deadly electric shocks via its tail and spikes.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its light is visible even in space. Domesticated POKENAME are used by astronomers to calibrate or realign space probes and satellites.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can soar into the stratosphere. When it gets angry, its clouds turn gray and it unleashes a merciless tempest.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can soar into the stratosphere. When it gets angry, its clouds turn gray and it unleashes a merciless tempest.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can soar into the stratosphere. When it gets angry, its clouds turn gray and it unleashes a merciless tempest.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its tail glows brighter the faster it beats its wings. They create a loud, electrical, buzzing noise that can interfere with electronic appliances.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The POKENAME with the largest plumage have the most powerful electric attacks. The ones with less plumage will often steal the wool from Flaaffy in an effort to look more powerful.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Though this Pokémon is usually docile, it's quick to clobber anything with its crystal ball if it senses that its young are in danger.
Author: coooooooookiee

Entry: The light emitted from POKENAME is strong enough to pierce through the pitch-black waters it resides in. This light is used to lure in prey and can be seen for up to two miles.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: It makes holes in rocks with its teeth and hides patiently. When prey swims by, POKENAME stuns it with its electricity before its jaws snap it up.
Author: Gummy Wookie

Entry: POKENAME are extremely helpful Pokémon that help lost sailors at sea. Each of their red orbs can shine brightly enough to cut through dense fog.
Author: Yoshimon

Entry: Although it's good-natured, wild POKENAME tend to have a short temper. It will blind anyone nearby with its ability to produce light, then close in for a rib-crushing hug.
Author: Meltan808

Entry: Often found in rock beds by lighthouses, POKENAME are drawn to their light, copying the rotation of the beam at night. After a high tide, lighthouse keepers should check for any POKENAME nearby, as too many may hinder sailors.
Author: merclipse

Entry: This Pokémon hangs out on the shore and shines lights to guide ships. What people don't know is that POKENAME is trying to sink those vessels for fun.
Author: KidDivinegon

Entry: The wild POKENAME is known for using gentle electric shocks to cause the legs of swimmers to tingle, but not hurt them. Be careful, though, because groups of POKENAME have been known to carry away people accidentally out of affection.
Author: roxie5228

Entry: POKENAME's body glows brightly in dark areas. It has a great sense of direction and can help its Trainer navigate through cave networks.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: The light emitted by its tail is used to deceive sailors by sending out false S.O.S. messages. When it succeeds, it lets out a blood-curdling laugh.
Author: mistershaokahn

Entry: Using its fine control of electricity, it manipulates brainwaves to alter the memories of those it hypnotizes. Its glowing orbs lures in targets before subtly reshaping their thoughts.
Author: amiel997

Entry: With a flap of its wings, POKENAME spread a powder which promotes growth and longevity in plants.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME is hailed as a miracle by botanists. Its spores, when contacting plants, transform into seeds that grow up to ten times faster and healthier than normal.
Author: lucasdesouza7

Entry: POKENAME hides among groups of Bellossom as camouflage to protect itself from predators. It can be identified among the crowd as the only "Bellossom" not dancing.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME may have a milder temper than its Beedrill counterpart, but the pollen stored in its abdominal bloom is as potent as a Beedrill sting. It's doubly so during springtime.
Author: Chazoplebas

Entry: The flowers on POKENAME's head release a crimson pollen that induces sleep in other Pokémon. Once they drift off, it emits quiet hoots that fill their dreams with terrifying nightmares.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's tiny wings allow it to float gracefully from flower to flower, consuming pollen. It makes its home in vast daisy fields, blending in with the blossoms.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME joyfully flies above flower fields, performing elegant spiraling motions. It lands occasionally to pluck flower petals, which it eats for nourishment.
Author: .izik

Entry: Some ancient civilizations appear to have made offerings to POKENAME in exchange for its dances, said to bring good fortune. If it refused an offering, it was considered a sign of looming disaster.
Author: sk372

Entry: It turns sunlight into electricity, before firing off bolts of lightning. The darker the red POKENAME's flowers are, the more charged up it is.
Author: EcoVermination

Entry: A POKENAME tail, although pretty, can have up to 1000 volts of electricity hiding inside. This Pokémon's flowers sometimes shine as bright as the sun.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: It spends its morning gathering seeds from plants throughout the jungle. It throws these seeds at travelers while swinging from tree to tree.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's petals pale in the moonlight, masking it in shadow. It waits, blending into darkness until prey stirs.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME sometimes gather and form an arch over forest footpaths. The brightest blooms form the top, while the weakest draw nutrients from below.
Author: Leshii

Entry: If it experiences emotional stress the flowers on its body will stop growing. When depressed, the flowers will dry out and turn grey.
Author: .izik

Entry: The blossoms on a POKENAME are made of steel petals that chime eerily in the wind. Farmers believe hearing them is a sign to abandon the land.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: A fighting POKENAME is beautiful to behold. Adjusting its position with rhythmic wingbeats, POKENAME choreographs each graceful attack to land in time with its dance.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: POKENAME's spores prosper in harsh volcanic areas. Despite appearing to be boiling, its body is actually lukewarm and can be safely touched.
Author: galactak

Entry: The colors of POKENAME's body and flowers all vary on a variety of factors, such as nearby soil composition and how active the closest volcano is. POKENAME with pink hues are particularly rare.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Whenever it rubs against other flowers, its body produces nectar from the exchange of pollen. Its body eventually becomes covered in fig nectar, which forms a drippy trail behind it until it no longer has pollen to convert into nectar.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Groups of POKENAME can be found galloping across flower fields at dawn every morning. Their hooves are imbued with a special power that greatly speeds up plant growth.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: The sweet and mellow flavor of POKENAME's nectar is not only incredibly tasty, but it also seems to have a calming effect on those who drink it. Even a furious Primeape will relax after a single sip.
Author: Phantom640

Entry: It gathers seeds in the mornings and takes great care to plant them around the jungle. The nectar that leaks from its tail is sprayed on these planted crops.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME offers the flowers growing on its body to those who are sad. When it dances, a pleasing scent wafts from its body.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: POKENAME has a very caring and motherly personality. It is often seen tending to groups of Bellossom as if they were its own children.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: This Pokémon focuses its aura through dance. It synchronizes these dances to the sounds of nature and the music of humans.
Author: keksalot2000

Entry: POKENAME lures in Bug-type Pokémon with the scent of its flowers, then it opens its jaw to swallow them whole. The colors of its flowers deepen as it digests its prey.
Author: VibrationJaveline

Entry: This bouquet staff uses the powers of flowers and sunshine to generate wondrous effects like parting clouds for sunlight and healing minor injuries.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME may appear to be a harmless plant, but its entire body is crafted from lightweight, coloured metal that resists weathering. Its ‘blossoms' rotate gently to absorb sunlight, though no one is sure why it mimics photosynthesis.
Author: eiskitsune

Entry: The feather-like portions of its body are actually leaves. A tea made from these leaves can quickly cure most respiratory-based ailments.
Author: .izik

Entry: It helps farmers spread pollen by rubbing against flowers when it passes by. One of its favorites snacks is Moomoo Cheese, which farmers use to bribe it to stay in their fields.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is known for its cheerful dance that it performs on beaches. When it dances, everyone around feels refreshed.
Author: Pokebio

Entry: The nectar that comes from the flowers on its body smells like a mixture of posies and Rindo Berries. There is a salon in Arrowroot Town that uses this fragrance in their shampoo.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME loves to collect roses, spending most of its energy to keep them healthy. It will give these roses to new couples as a symbol of their love.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: While it dances, its leaves give off the soft scent of baked Hondew Berries. It occasionally finds seeds from an unknown source and hoards them.
Author: .izik

Entry: Sightings of POKENAME are a sure sign that springtime is nearly here. Catching one of their flowers is considered a good omen.
Author: caladria

Entry: Don't let the flowers and innocent demeanor fool you, the thorns on POKENAME'S appendages are not for show. One prick feels like a million paper cuts.
Author: auroraeuphoria

Entry: The leaves on its wings fall to the ground while it flies. Culinarians gather these for their mild minty scent.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon's petals secrete a thick, green fluid that gives off a berry-like aroma when warm. POKENAME uses this scent to attract prey in even the most remote parts of the desert.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has become permanently rooted in the sand. It puts on adorable shows to attract others, hoping they will offer it nutrient-rich food.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: When POKENAME howls, the large flower on its tail releases a shimmering pink powder. This powder has medicinal properties, but excessive exposure can cause violent seizures.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME howls while dancing wildly in flower fields. These frenzied movements kick up pollen, enriching the soil and helping nearby flora thrive.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's songs encourage flora and fauna surrounding them to thrive. It is said to appear in highly polluted areas.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME displays its physical prowess by engaging in fierce, intricate dances with the fire blazing from its tail tip. Performers worldwide study its choreographies to improve their own.
Author: tuneless.towa

Entry: Instead of hunting, it will lazily lounge in fields soaking in the sun's light. During days with high humidity, the flowers on its body will grow up to twice their normal size.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are often not taken seriously due to their appearance. This only further strengthens their resolve to prove themselves in battle.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: It releases a delicious floral scent from its mouth to attract prey. The leaves in its mouth can cause extreme drowsiness if consumed.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME collects dew from its leaves each morning, storing it deep within its pitcher. This nutrient-rich dew accelerates its growth and enhances its vibrant coloration.
Author: .izik

Entry: Although revered in some regions, POKENAME have been observed to do very little. They occasionally roll around to photosynthesize.
Author: RAWTHORN

Entry: It performs a very slow methodical dance on the shoreline during the evenings. When it finishes its dance, it will fall asleep in the sand.
Author: .izik

Entry: Now that the leek has blossomed, it doesn't taste very good. The flowers' aroma lures in Bug-type Pokémon, which is POKENAME's favorite food.
Author: .realthree

Entry: This Pokémon lures in prey with its sweet looks. It may look cute, but in fact it's extremely bloodthirsty. Its flowers smell like poppies.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Once POKENAME start rolling, they enter a state of near perpetual motion, ricocheting off surfaces with their five bouncy tails. They have evolved strong stomachs to handle the constant rotation.
Author: houseoffallingflowers

Entry: POKENAME often is found along shorelines comparing their shells to other POKENAME. The shell it inhabits is said to be that of an ancient Pokémon.
Author: CaptainzScourge

Entry: They prefer cobblers over other types of sweets, as the soft, gooey texture allows them to chew without hurting their sensitive teeth. When they finish eating, they take naps to help with digestion.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: With its waterproof fur and buoyant tail, POKENAME is well suited to its river home. They can often be found playing with one another near rapids, swimming down the fast-flowing water and scampering back up the banks to swim down again.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME can be found sliding along the surface of bodies of water. It is hydrophobic and lightweight, so it never immerses.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME hates it when its fur isn't constantly moist and is never seen far from a body of water. It spends most of the day floating on top of the water with its buoyant tail.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME uses a special form of martial arts that involves using its ball tail as a bludgeoning weapon.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME is docile, and you can often find it playing with children. It lives in steep valleys formed by warm rivers.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME is docile, and you can often find it playing with children. This one has a rare coloration.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Somehow, two meek Pokémon become a fusion full of confidence and battle spirit. It deftly kicks its own tail to strike opponents from any angle.
Author: miecreates

Entry: In many homes, POKENAME occupies a role somewhere between pet and decoration. Its flame is mostly harmless, producing only a pleasant glow and gentle warmth.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: POKENAME are remarkably agile in fights, using their springy tails as launching platforms to leap around and confound their opponents. Their small statures are the main thing preventing them from posing serious threats to more Pokémon.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME is a calm Pokémon that uses its sizable tail as its cozy bed. It does not move often, as it is always comfortable.
Author: matpal6

Entry: POKENAME live near bodies of water, subsisting on aquatic prey. The baubles of its tails act as water brakes, allowing it to quickly take off again.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME lives at the bottom of the river and if anything touches its tail, it will deliver a powerful electric shock. After large floods, large groups of POKENAME can be seen washed up on shore.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Filled with a sense of adventure, POKENAME loves to explore new lands with its Trainer. They will often run ahead in search of wild Pokémon to battle or befriend, based entirely on their mood.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME sleeps by curling near the shore and using the heavy ball on its tail as an anchor, preventing it from drifting away. Children in riverside towns are often accompanied by this Pokémon, as its tail can ward off minor currents.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME are only really active when playing with others. Even then, they prefer using their psychic powers to play while they loaf around.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: POKENAME's hydro-resistant fur allows it to dry off easily when exiting water. When it's not swimming, it feasts on berries to its hearts content.
Author: noel5229

Entry: Angered at its skinning, it has evolved to be able to use its own tail as a club to defend itself. If you see one charging towards you, run.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: POKENAME trains by rhythmically punching the surface of ponds, creating ripples that echo across the water. Its gentle demeanor masks a precise and powerful fighting style.
Author: mgfox_66676

Entry: This Pokémon's adorable features make it a popular pet. However, POKENAME unwittingly breaks glass containers with its horn as it frolics in water.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: It wiggles its ears back and forth to store energy. Once it has enough power, it will propel its body with enough force to scale a waterfall.
Author: .izik

Entry: Whenever POKENAME spends time in the water, it creates fire-filled bubbles from the flames stored in its body. The waters of the rivers and lakes where it lives can reach over 1,400 degrees Fahrenheit.
Author: Beatdoof

Entry: The shell on its body makes it hard for POKENAME to properly swim in strong currents. It has resorted to tumbling along the sandy bottoms instead.
Author: CaptainzScourge

Entry: It has the ability to roll its body into a ball and bounce across the water's surface. If it bounces for too long, it will get severe motion sickness.
Author: .izik

Entry: The sticky slime that covers its body smells like mint. There is an energy drink made in Celadon City that uses it as a main ingredient.
Author: .izik

Entry: It spends a great amount of time cleaning mud and dirt off of its body. It has trouble sleeping if even a single ounce is on its fur.
Author: .izik

Entry: Their powerful eyes, sense of hearing, and waterproof feathers allow POKENAME to fly even in extreme downpours at night. Around 15 POKENAME serve under a Honchkrow fusion.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The bubbles along POKENAME's body change color depending on how they attack. The bubbles turn red before POKENAME spray scalding water, black before they spray ink, and white when they finally rest.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME are often found playing in fountains and ponds, blowing colorful bubbles out of its trunk at passersby.
Author: inksans201x

Entry: Known for their superb hearing, POKENAME are capable of detecting the electric impulses of Pokémon on riverbed floors.
Author: nelluc27

Entry: In the wild, POKENAME are highly motivated by self-improvement and can often be found in sparring pairs. When training alone, POKENAME will spend large stretches of time in meditation and self-reflection.
Author: Katie

Entry: In the wild, POKENAME are highly motivated by self-improvement and can often be found in sparring pairs. When training alone, POKENAME will spend large stretches of time in meditation and self-reflection.
Author: Katie

Entry: In the wild, POKENAME are highly motivated by self-improvement and can often be found in sparring pairs. When training alone, POKENAME will spend large stretches of time in meditation and self-reflection.
Author: Katie

Entry: Known to roam beaches at night, POKENAME usually frightens tourists as it enjoys a cool night swim.
Author: SupersonicLoki

Entry: Due to the high amount of air in its body, POKENAME has trouble staying underwater. When a POKENAME sleeps, it slowly rises to the ocean's surface.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME views it as its royal duty to cheer up nearby Pokémon when they are feeling sad. It often does this by performing a silly dance.
Author: regula

Entry: POKENAME functions as a Pokémon multi-tool for explorers. It can be used as a club, a auditory sensor, and an underwater air bubble dispenser.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It cheerfully prances through puddles, kept dry by its fur boots. In battle, it fights in tandem with its tail in a wildly unpredictable dance.
Author: miecreates

Entry: POKENAME's incredible power makes it a Pokémon with few rivals or weaknesses. However, it is merely a friendly creature that is kind to almost everyone, only fighting when absolutely necessary.
Author: Altius

Entry: While its bubbles are frail, they will regenerate right away. When relaxing, it uses its bubbles like a pool float to drift in the water.
Author: typhloquil

Entry: When overburdened with bubbles, it can shed them from it's body. This has been known to trap small Pokémon, and larger specimens can even trap people.
Author: wyattwintersoul

Entry: Despite its cute appearance, POKENAME is an impervious opponent. It joyfully rolls around the field, flattening anything in its path.
Author: togetik

Entry: After being fused, its personality becomes shockingly passive. This is usually fused as a safer way to raise Deino.
Author: BlitzyDragon

Entry: The two heads of POKENAME struggle when it comes to sharing food but they never get aggressive. It's still ideal to provide each head with its own food bowl.
Author: BlitzyDragon

Entry: Its hyperactive and is always found either bouncing the ball on its tail, or flailing its arms. Whenever a Pokémon nearby starts drowning, POKENAME will rush quickly to help.
Author: Markusknight

Entry: Blubber from POKENAME was once used to create lamp oil in times long past. While it burns brightly, it is consumed quickly by a flame.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are bold Pokémon that show a complete lack of fear in the wilderness. They make for excellent traveling companions, warding off dangerous Pokémon while also foraging for food and water for their Trainers.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME is known to partake in playful water games and uses its buoyant tail to effortlessly float on the water's surface.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: Its long antennae are remarkably sensitive, allowing it to detect and identify muffled sounds made by different deep-sea creatures. This compensates for its poor vision, which is exacerbated by the small size of its face.
Author: imademyselfdothis

Entry: POKENAME ride along the waves, creating bubbles and hiding among the foam. It is said that encountering an POKENAME while surfing is a sure sign that love is on the way.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME resides near beaches with volcanic activity. It can spew water from its mouth with temperatures over 210°F.
Author: Thora Daughn

Entry: POKENAME's attentive ears could sense motion in nearby bodies of water. If it senses anyone drowning, it will immediately go to rescue them.
Author: noel5229

Entry: Sinnoh researchers managed to resurrect fossils of their native Hisuian Electrodes after the regional form went extinct, resulting in POKENAME. The petrification process has altered them to be physically hardier than their extinct counterparts.
Author: Katie

Entry: Young Bonsly are allowed to ride in POKENAME's pouch to feel safe and content. Though POKENAME tends to stay perfectly still, anyone approaching the child aggressively will find themselves slapped rather hard and suddenly.
Author: sk372

Entry: Though it prefers to spend time standing as still, POKENAME possesses strong parental instincts towards Bonsly. Those agitating the children find themselves struck hard from behind, yet POKENAME appears to never have moved...
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are seen active and smiling on summer days, drinking from flowers, but will freeze if approached. Come too close, and they release spores.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Rather than remaining rigid like Sudowoodo, POKENAME mimics realistic tree motions such as swaying with the breeze and seasonal color changes. It still has trouble convincing onlookers it is a tree, however.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME love nothing more than slamming into objects. While the large green bulbs on their body might look like greenery, they are in fact orbs of rock-hard muscle, leaving Trainers to call these hot-headed Pokémon 'Cannonballs of the Forest'.
Author: moopse

Entry: This fusion is popular in rural areas, as the body emerges every hour to the second and emits a cooing sound. Occasionally, it also lives in forests.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME is a popular fusion for collectors of luxury furniture. It perfectly complements rather old-fashioned rooms and doesn't need to move.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: This Pokémon is on its way to being the master of disguise. It desires to grow real leaves on its branches.
Author: birchbot

Entry: It has a placid personality, seeking to avoid conflict and indeed most interactions with others outside its species. It spends much time trying to pose in ways that make it look perfectly symmetrical, but fails often.
Author: sk372

Entry: Parks and reserves employ POKENAME as mascots and guides. They stand completely still, but if a person asks directions and then looks away, when they glance back POKENAME's arms will point them to their destination.
Author: sk372

Entry: If you see a POKENAME floating down a river at night, do not make eye contact with it, as it will try to coax you onto its boat to the afterlife.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: The Sudowoodo on top of POKENAME's back is often unable to move. It is sometimes heard crying for help as it serves as protection from the rain.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: The orbs on its antlers are attuned to wind and weather, letting it know when precipitation is imminent so it can seek shelter. Like a Sawsbuck, these orbs change color with the season.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is adamant about keeping its tree aesthetic. It selects the most crooked branches to put on its hat.
Author: birchbot

Entry: The camouflage pattern on POKENAME helps it blend into forests better. It doesn't like the winter because the pattern stays green.
Author: birchbot

Entry: POKENAME hides in tree hollows, its jaws sticking out. Prey mistake the jaws for part of the tree and nest in them, then are met with a sudden demise.
Author: birchbot

Entry: POKENAME is not made of wood, but rock; its core is made of graphite. It likes drawing trees on walls and hides its face when observed.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: This fusion tends to vary wildly in personality. Some protect the weak while others pretend to be trees and try to scare passerby before running away.
Author: OhOk3441

Entry: POKENAME fires off razor sharp leaves at opponents in battle. Its expression rarely changes.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: When a POKENAME is caught in a tricky situation, it will try to charm its enemy. Of course, this Pokémon is a liar, so it flees as soon as possible.
Author: birchbot

Entry: Its coloration allows it to hide well amongst the trees of its home, to better let it hunt prey suddenly and efficiently.  Between its camouflage and high-speed hunting, few have actually seen a wild POKENAME in motion.
Author: sk372

Entry: Instead of pretending to be a tree, it pretends to be a bush. It likes to playfully ambush people just for fun.
Author: birchbot

Entry: POKENAME hides in devestated forests to teach lessons to lumberjacks about deforestation. It absorbs the soul of anyone who tries to cut it down.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME will find a spot isolated from civilization to take root. Legends said a POKENAME stayed in place for 100 years, and grew over 100 feet tall.
Author: typhloquil

Entry: POKENAME dance in groups, cheerfully shaking their branches in sync. However, they will flee in fear if anyone gets too close.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: When you enter a forest and feel a chill up your spine, not all may be what it seems. That tree in the distance may very well be POKENAME.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: When you enter a forest and feel a chill up your spine, not all may be what it seems. That tree in the distance may very well be POKENAME.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: A POKENAME is very slow and often sits still, which unintentionally makes a good bush disguise. Its movements are so sluggish that anything on its back barely notices.
Author: Glacierwing

Entry: The main body has poor eyesight, so POKENAME uses the functional eyes on each green segment of its hands to better survey its surroundings. It goes through a variety of odd poses in order to maximize surveillance.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are very excitable by nature. They enjoy juggling and rolling their orbs back and forth to each other. If a POKENAME trusts a Trainer who is experiencing nightmares, the POKENAME will contain the bad dream within its orb to aid them.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME are very pleasant and kind by nature. They swing their orbs to soothe restless people to sleep. However, this technique seems to be most effective when their targets are standing up, granting them balance and protection as well.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: It covers its body in river plants to keep its body moist. It hides in riverbeds, camouflaging itself amongst the reeds to avoid predators.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME loves to dance in the rain while covered in mud. It likes to energetically spin its powerful pincers, as the raindrops wash over it.
Author: D_Numeritos

Entry: POKENAME sleeps on top of large lilypads. It enjoys making people laugh with its silly facial expressions.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME croak loudly at the same time each day. Wild populations often synchronize their croaks, which helps drive away potential predators.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Their throats glow with electricity when croaking. Forests with POKENAME flocks look and sound beautiful at night.
Author: BlitzyDragon

Entry: POKENAME have a history of gathering into large pods and floating down fast rivers. Some say you can hear “croaks of joy” when you encounter them.
Author: Zeeroooo

Entry: It often hops around on water, avoiding the need to swim. It always seems to be smiling, even when provoked to danger.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: POKENAME is thought to help usher in the rainy season. This kind Pokémon will provide fresh water anyone who needs it.
Author: moopse

Entry: POKENAME must be careful when using its Fire-type attacks. As the attacks are laced with powerful toxins, even the embers or ashes of whatever the fire strikes can pollute the water it calls home.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Because of POKENAME's positive demeanor and bulk, they are commonly found in Trainer Schools playing with children. Their antennae sway when they sense danger.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: POKENAME build hierarchical colonies in lakes made from long dormant calderas. POKENAME takes great pride in its appearance, with the most well-groomed member of a colony leading the others in a deafening choir.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: The POKENAME with the longest and sharpest ears is considered king. It sticks eggs to its back to protect and nourish them until they're ready to hatch.
Author: PotatoForged

Entry: If multiple POKENAME are gathered together, they will begin to sing a beautiful symphony. The curled hair on a POKENAME's head will form a tight spiral when it uses its psychic powers.
Author: bacondlx

Entry: Female POKENAME collect rainwater in their back jaws to keep eggs moist and safe. Males always seem to be playing in the water but are actually guarding the nest, attacking any intruders with a swift, crushing bite.
Author: amiel997

Entry: POKENAME, while lazy, are the kings of their ponds deep in the jungle. It spends its time either sitting or floating in the water and grazing.
Author: tigerinnenumarmer

Entry: POKENAME can only see through the single eye held by its tongue, which it raises to scan its surroundings in eerie silence. Those caught in its gaze report unsettling visions.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME uses its detached eye to scan vast areas, often spotting prey or intruders long before they're aware. It's favoured by watchmen in remote regions, who rely on it as a living security system.
Author: eiskitsune

Entry: POKENAME's large lily pad provides sanctuary for its fellow amphibians. It roams the wetlands, searching for weary creatures to take in.
Author: Thropp

Entry: POKENAME absorbs water from ponds or rain. When the weather is dry, it croaks to attract Poliwhirl and Poliwag to shower them.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: This amphibian Pokémon is known to sing all night in its pond, which is unfortunate for those sleeping nearby.
Author: zerocipher

Entry: A constant stream of clouds spews from its maw. The rain that falls from these clouds help to protect it against the elements.
Author: moopse

Entry: POKENAME uses its bottomless and never-stagnating puddle to glide around instead of walking. Trainers should watch their step when POKENAME moves near them.
Author: jacklemon

Entry: POKENAME lures its prey with a sinister croak before ensnaring them. Once bound, it drags them into the darkness, never to be seen again.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: If you stumble upon a POKENAME in a mysterious pond and give it an item, it looks into your heart.  If your heart is pure, the item is strengthened. If not, the item will be incinerated and lost.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: When frightened, its horn releases a smokescreen and it scurries away. Its abdomen is heavy, so it only walks short distances, making its escape not very successful.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: POKENAME can rarely be seen during rainy weather. It prefers to use its carapace as a wheel instead of walking since its spines allow it to traverse slippery terrain more easily.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The frills on its neck can sense oncoming rain. It rules over the swamps, demanding respect and fear from all nearby Pokémon.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: This happy Pokémon loves to spread positivity. As it cheers, rain falls from the clouds on its body, helping local plant life.
Author: moopse

Entry: It lives near the surface of seclusive swamps. Many light Pokémon rest on the leaf on POKENAME's head. However, the mucus over POKENAME's skin is highly toxic.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Its watery mane keeps the rocks on its neck damp, so algae grows there. This relationship is symbiotic, as the algae provides oxygen underwater.
Author: .realthree

Entry: When this Pokémon hides from the predators in the ponds, the flower on its back floats on the water surface akin to a waterlily. At night, groups of POKENAME gather to sing together; their songs sound like a wind blowing over the reeds.
Author: milchik

Entry: They are elusive yet energetic dancers, as they hide their dancing behind tall reeds like bulrush or phragmites. When they are spotted, they squirt a burst of water onto the onlooker before flipping into the water.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: One head of POKENAME always takes the other head as food. Due to this, the second head is always fighting to not be eaten.
Author: terminatphilippe

Entry: Although seen as intimidating, POKENAME are often very kind at heart, and even begin making best friends with their Trainers and fellow party members.
Author: spencerrdevv

Entry: The lightweight eggs bundle together to avoid being blown away by strong winds. The one that grows leaves upon its head is the de facto leader of the group.
Author: sk372

Entry: When POKENAME enters cold water, its leafy antennae turn brown. Exposure to warm sunlight revives its green hue and boosts its energy.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME band together in giant schools for protection and generally avoid confrontation altogether. They are a preferred snack to Qwilfish.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME is notoriously low on intelligence. Despite that failing, it lives a carefree life.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME is often found accompanying groups of Hoppip floating across the breeze. It helps the Hoppip's journey by flapping its wings to adjust their flight paths.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME weaves delicate, golden silk that carries a faint lemon fragrance. This silk is often used to line its nest, keeping predators at bay with its sharp scent.
Author: .izik

Entry: They normally float between flower fields to spread pollen and drink nectar. When those flower fields get popular, they get sick from food left behind after picnics, such as a Rage Candy Bar or other processed treats.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is blown away by even gentle winds. When the sun is at its brightest, the songs POKENAME sings are are at their loudest.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's wool is soft and light as a feather, letting its leaves act like rotors. When the wind picks up it gently lifts into the sky.
Author: .izik

Entry: The flower atop POKENAME's head spins gently as it glides over fields of dandelions. Its drifting motion spreads pollen wherever it travels.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its body is very attuned to the breeze, small fluctuations letting it know when predators may be around on the hunt. Because of this, POKENAME rarely leaves its burrow on days with little to no wind.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME fly around with the wing-like seed structures on their backs. They can deftly control these structures, reversing and turning with ease while flying at full speed.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME scoops up mud with its long, leaf-like ears and smears it over its body. This keeps it cool during scorching summer days.
Author: .izik

Entry: With almost nonexistent wings, POKENAME flies by being carried some distance by the wind. Groups of POKENAME often congregate near fountains, attracted by the water and the coins tossed within.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is usually found pecking at the grass in open fields, searching for seeds to eat. As it flies, it sheds feather-like leaves that are used by some to sweeten the taste of their tea.
Author: sk372

Entry: They continuously shed an outer shell that is easily swept into the sky. Many flowers grow on the shell, such as magnolia and camellia flowers, which float and scatter when the shell is swept away.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: The leaf mask on POKENAME's face is ice-cold and used as a garnish in frozen desserts. Its chilling touch is said to enhance a berry-based flavor.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME leaps from coral reefs to bask in sunlight as it travels. Its wide, leaf-shaped fins shimmer in the air before diving again.
Author: .izik

Entry: Once a month, POKENAME sheds the leaves on its tail and grows a new set the next day. These leaves are used to brew a tea that has become fairly popular in northern Kanto areas.
Author: sk372

Entry: Though having wings, it does not fly by flapping. Instead, POKENAME controls the air around them as propulsion, allowing it to glide to its destination.  POKENAME are often found leading flocks of Hoppip.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: POKENAME mimics human gestures with its long, leaf-like arms. Children often mistake it for a puppet drifting on the breeze.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's favorite spot to curl up and sleep is in the dirt, just under the hardiest weeds. Although it can fly for short periods of time, it cannot stay aloft for very long. Despite having decent night vision, it is diurnal in nature.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME gives off a Cheri Berry scent from its leaves when calm. It prefers tranquil ponds where it can float undisturbed.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is easily blown away by strong winds, so it uses its large ears to check the wind's speed. It uses its toxic barbs to attach itself to objects to prevent itself from being blown away.
Author: darkweavile428

Entry: The plant on its back allows POKENAME to quickly repair any damage to its armor, making it an extremely resilient fighter.
Author: grassy311

Entry: Its nectar is valuable because it is an ingredient used to produce a vial of Joy Scent. This is only possible during the spring when its body produces an excess of nectar to attract pollinators.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME drifts silently over meadows beneath moonlit skies. When it spots prey, it strikes with a sudden and eerie Shadow Sneak.
Author: .izik

Entry: A highly sought-after Pokémon, as it eternally gives off the smell of a fresh Gracidea. It's often confused with its dangerous, odorless reversed counterpart.
Author: LordKai1

Entry: POKENAME uses its leafy tongue to snatch kelp from the ocean floor. It floats just above the sand, drifting with the tide as it feeds.
Author: .izik

Entry: Due to POKENAME's impressive wingspan and light weight, one flap of its powerful wings generates enough lift to carry it around the world twice over.
Author: grassy311

Entry: The leaves on POKENAME's back are sharp enough to split small stones. It uses them while digging dens and feeds on tree roots it uncovers.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME loves to burrow in iron-rich soil. Not only does it strengthen its armor, it supplies the plant on its back with precious nutrients.
Author: grassy311

Entry: This Pokémon thrives in areas with iron-rich soil. The roots of its plant components help to strengthen the bonds of its armor.
Author: grassy311

Entry: POKENAME are protected like jewelry because its sap is the main ingredient in a vial of Vivid Scent. However, because it only produces sap when injured, environmentalists push to ban the practice.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It produces a delicately sweet pollen that can only be harvested by pollinators. It is one of the reagents to produce a vial of Excite Scent, making the Pokémon and pollen expensive.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are known to drift along fresh summer breezes. Children love to play with POKENAME during the summer months.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its fur smells like sweet, spring grass, which helps keep it in a positive mood. POKENAME's strong legs allow it to leap up to 12 feet in the air.
Author: Mistymagiud

Entry: POKENAME can create gentle breezes and drift around in them. However, strong winds typically overpower them. They are more active during the night, resting during the day.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME's bubble-like coating is easily popped, but splatters a sticky coating of goo when it does. It regenerates this coating instantly and floats away while the bubble-popper is slowed by the goop.
Author: sk372

Entry: It wanders the jungle at night, carrying its yellow mask which looks like it is made of grapefruit. Whether it is because it reminds people of sad memories or of the tangy tartness of grapefruit, the mask makes people cry.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: This Pokémon loves to float on gentle breezes. It can control its direction using its small wings.
Author: grassy311

Entry: The propeller leaves on its head give POKENAME incredible lift. In the summer, you can hear its beautiful song carry on the wind.
Author: grassy311

Entry: Lying flat among meadow grasses, POKENAME waits like a hidden trap. When prey approaches, it lashes out with a sudden Mega Drain.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's claws constantly grow throughout its lifetime and if they grow too long, it will be unable to run properly. Its body is very aerodynamic, allowing it to run through the forest at high speeds.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It looks like any other weed when buried partway beneath the surface. If plucked, POKENAME begins to hop around in anger, spreading harmful spores everywhere.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: As POKENAME floats through marshes, its leaves produce a ghostly sound. Even in sleep, its leaves sway with the wind, as if haunted.
Author: .izik

Entry: Though POKENAME has a tree-like body, it is light enough to be carried off by strong winds. To stay grounded, it drives its roots deep into the soil.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's leafy wings allow it to stay aloft with minimal effort. When it grows tired, it gently lands among tulips and eats their petals.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME rides on warm air currents, lifting it high into the sky. Its leaves are covered in sharp thorns that somehow make its body more aerodynamic.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The fungus on POKENAME is only found growing alongside dandelions. POKENAME has a sweet disposition, but a bitter flavor.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME spins its leaf-like tailfins rapidly to propel itself through water. The motion makes it difficult for predators to catch.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lives in placid waters, as its weak swimming muscles and light body makes it easily swept up by any current. If it leaps out of the water, it may even be carried away by a strong breeze.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME spins its propeller to swim faster. It makes its home in large kelp forests and appears to have a positive effect on the life in its habitat.
Author: EvilGammon

Entry: It pulls off and consumes its own leaves to help soothe its aching head. It's only a curative for POKENAME, however; others consuming its leaves will develop a strong headache instead.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME spends most of its time digging in soft dirt for seeds and roots to chew on. The leaves shed from its tail can be ground up for medicinal powder, but the powder is extremely bitter to taste.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is extremely timid, trying its best to hide itself in bushes and trees. It has telekinetic control over plants and will defend itself using leaves and vines.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Because of its light body, it gets carried along the wind without it even noticing. When properly cooked, its tail apparently tastes like radishes.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Surprisingly, the propeller on POKENAME's back is strong enough to lift them off the ground. However, due to their laziness, they often don't bother.
Author: EvilGammon

Entry: POKENAME runs across fields and steals turnips and lettuce by pulling them out of the ground with its long beak. They are not popular with farmers.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Wild POKENAME devastate entire harvests. However, some farmers manage to tame them and train them to rapidly plow their fields instead.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME's custard-like body is so light it can be carried by the wind. Despite its gooey form, it glides gracefully through the air.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME live in warm waters and feed on undersea plant life. The POKENAME with the most dazzling colors is the leader of its school.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME refuses to leave its shell. Therefore, it cannot move, as it is far too heavy. If the shell is kept out of sunlight, POKENAME will perish.
Author: tuskaninny

Entry: POKENAME has become a complete hermit, choosing to forever live in its shell. It decorates its new home with blooming flowers.
Author: tuskaninny

Entry: They are often seen at night, rather than during the day. Their glowing antennae allow them to attract other POKENAME as they float on air currents.
Author: KitArchen

Entry: It enters an inactive state if the weather is too cold or cloudy. The flowers on POKENAME's head bloom in the sunlight; rarely, the flowers may bloom in different colors.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The nectar in its flowers is exceptionally sweet and flavorful, so it is often harvested and sold as a sugar substitute.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: This Pokémon's flowers burn with a spectral fire. These flames burn bright and tall when POKENAME is happy.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Popular amongst Trainers who have gained a little bit of experience, POKENAME has a mildly confrontational nature that takes some skill to tame but is also a fast-growing Pokémon. When their trust is earned, they become fiercely loyal.
Author: Katie

Entry: This Pokémon is commonly found during the warmer seasons. Its antlers project illusions of flowers to distract and disorient predators.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME only live in warm environments. Hiding in bushes and tall grass, they disguise themselves as a flower to attract prey.
Author: bee4082

Entry: The flower pattern on the inside of the hood of POKENAME is especially good at absorbing sunlight. Whenever the temperature gets too cold, POKENAME burrows to wait until warmer temperatures.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME secretes a sweet nectar from its udders instead of milk. Some believe this nectar has very potent healing properties.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: You can tell how old a POKENAME is by the amount of brown spots on its leaf-like wings. When POKENAME's wings get fully brown, they crumble and flake off until it can no longer fly.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: Those who encounter POKENAME are filled with an eerie sense of foreboding, as if it holds the mysteries of life and death within its ethereal form.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME commonly arise from dolls lost in wild fields. They go on long journeys to reunite with their owner, but they have a bad sense of direction.
Author: totodile.

Entry: This Pokémon thrives in the sunlight. The energy it gets from the sun accelerates its already impressive flying speeds.
Author: grassy311

Entry: It pretends to be the stem of the flower on its head. When it's sure no one is looking, it moves into the sunlight to ensure it remains healthy.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME's dam is covered in yellow flowers as it uses its vines to hold its dam together. After it chews down a tree, it will try to regrow the tree to restore balance to the environment.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's heads still don't cooperate, which often leads to them missing attacks and leaving themselves open. However if they do decide to work together, they are a force to be reckoned with.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Trained POKENAME are known to grow extra bodies when they're well fed and healthy. If a bud grows too big, it'll pop off and continue as its own individual.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: POKENAME's pollen induces vivid hallucinations, which helps it escape from predators. It lives in sunny meadows and hides among the flowers.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME thrives in warm and sunny weather. It flies as high as it can in order to get closer to the sun.
Author: grassy311

Entry: POKENAME loves to bask in the sun. It will fly eastward at the break of dawn to sun itself for as long as possible.
Author: grassy311

Entry: POKENAME's cryptic coloration helps it blend in with the flower-filled fields it calls its home. Those who step on it will be attacked by an explosion of debilitating pollen.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Despite a close resemblance to its more aggressive cousin, Scolipede, POKENAME is known for its gentle and kindhearted nature. It delights in allowing children to ride on its back, leaving a trail of flowers in its wake.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: POKENAME releases a sweet scent from the flower on its neck that keeps it in a positive mood. It can be seen frolicking around flower fields, unintentionally trampling the flowers in its wake.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME appears as soon as the snows begin to melt. The floral pattern found on it has inspired many spring kimonos.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Some POKENAME are active during the daytime, while others are active during the night; it all depends on what time POKENAME's components hatched. Larger POKENAME likely thrive in the morning, while the ones most active at night have stronger toxins.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME spend their days in search of patches of sunlight. Its bright petals are a warning of the toxins POKENAME contains.
Author: elite01

Entry: In the summer, they travel in the direction of the wind, leaping and soaring in great bounds; all the while they spread toxic and foul-smelling spores.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: During the springtime, POKENAME's body becomes covered in brightly colored flowers. Most of these flowers are yellow, but they can sometimes be pink, white, or even blue.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: When POKENAME points the fans on its head against strong winds, it is swept along. In this way, it glides several kilometers to new meadows.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME shows its affection to trusted Trainers by rubbing the petals on its neck against them. The pollen deposited this way has mineral-like qualities, and it's difficult to wash off.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME have a short temper and short range with their fists. However, they can deliver enough force to bend steel.
Author: T.I.A.

Entry: POKENAME takes great pride in its carefully landscaped gardens. It cultivates flower patches and decorative bushes along river banks with sparkling clean water.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: POKENAME craft hovering rafts from nearby fluff to ride warm, southern winds across the sea, flying to foreign lands.
Author: GentleSage

Entry: POKENAME always has a happy expression, like it's nodding 'yes' all the time. Its soft punches aren't very effective against most Pokémon.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME grow thick plant fibers from the horns on their head. They trap prey and berries with the tangled fluff.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: Riding warm winds, POKENAME sails across seas to distant lands. It emits a sweet fragrance, calming even fierce battles.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME makes balls out of the cotton that grows from its body, and whacks them at its enemies. It inspired The Eterna Acrobats tennis team.
Author: Shocktopus

Entry: POKENAME enjoys rolling in lavender fields, coating its fluffy body in fragrant pollen. It floats leisurely over meadows in search of more flowers to graze on.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hovers gently over rose bushes, transferring pollen between flowers as it feeds. Farmers appreciate its efforts, as it helps their crops flourish.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's soft, cotton-like wings let it soar for hours without rest. It rides the evening wind with graceful ease.
Author: .izik

Entry: Beneath its cottony fur, POKENAME's body is incredibly thin. It's so light that a strong breeze can carry it far from its nest.
Author: .izik

Entry: Each of POKENAME's fluffy puffs holds an opposing electrical charge. When it releases the stored energy, it can generate powerful lightning strikes from its head.
Author: .izik

Entry: It spreads its seeds by dancing energetically. Despite this, it is often viewed as a symbol of negativity.
Author: fixthewifi

Entry: While leaping through tulip fields, POKENAME releases fluffy puffs. These help pollinate flowers and brighten the landscape.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hangs onto its tail like a parasol to catch and ride strong winds. It appears weightless as it bounces through its favorite meadows.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME has a frightening appearance, but only eats bark and is incredibly skittish. Its only means of defense is spraying pollen from its head, hands and tail to blind and agitate predators while it runs away.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME sleeps while attached maple branches, gently swaying in the breeze. As it snoozes, it scatters spores to help nearby trees grow.
Author: .izik

Entry: When midair battles occur, POKENAME shakes its head frantically, scattering fluffy fibers into the air. These fibers disrupt an opponent's movement, giving it time to escape.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME runs about in verdant fields, using the fluff on its head and tail to let pollen scatter in the winds. It has been discovered that the blooming flowers from its actions create vast works of art when viewed from above.
Author: sk372

Entry: Despite its large size, POKENAME is a very timid Pokémon that runs at the first sign of trouble. If cornered, it smacks an opponent with the fluff on its tail, spreading pollen to agitate the attacker's vision so POKENAME can escape.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME scatters seeds with every flap of its wings. These seeds help grow new Grass-Types and heal those that have been wounded. These seeds are prophesied to turn wastelands into lush forests.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: POKENAME promotes the growth of nectar-rich flowers with the pollen it shakes from its hands. When they run out, it restocks them by regurgitating lumps of pollen produced from within its rotund belly.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME loves to hide in phones, disguising itself as an emoji. It spreads via text messages and posts on social media.
Author: grassy311

Entry: Sports teams love using POKENAME as cheerleaders. Their joyful and energetic personality rivals even the cutest Fairy-types.
Author: dragonessanimations

Entry: POKENAME wields pom-poms made of Jumpluff's fluff. It aspires to be a passionate cheerleader.
Author: thisisaplaceholder

Entry: POKENAME drifts between tree branches, snapping off dying limbs with surprising precision. It collects these broken branches and delivers them to riverside lodges for use in construction.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can be found bouncing on plains. It uses its strong legs to stay sturdy during windy days.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: POKENAME scatters spores as it rides the wind across the world seasonally. Contact with these can give tiny cuts, so take caution when breathing.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Floating gently over farmlands, POKENAME scatters spores from its puffy poms. The spores induce drowsiness in any Pokémon below, making it easy for POKENAME to evade predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: While flying at high speeds, POKENAME leaves behind a trail of cotton-like debris. The puffs it leaves in its wake float gently for hours.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses solar power to ionize the air around it. This creates its signature balls of light; this, in turn, generates lift.
Author: inquis1

Entry: In dimly lit caves, POKENAME glides effortlessly, releasing electrified webbing onto unsuspecting prey. Its lightweight body allows it to stay airborne with minimal effort.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has an unusual craving for flour and will mimic the shape of keys using hardened fluff. It sneaks into homes at night, breaking into pantries to steal its favorite treat.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is so good at navigating through the air, it can carry its nest on its wings. It will glide through the air for weeks until its chicks hatch.
Author: grassy311

Entry: The lightweight POKENAME flies around in the wind like a plastic bag with its tiny body and ping pong ball appendages.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME shakes its fluffy poms to scatter poisonous cotton near its burrow. The fibers cling to skin and sting on contact.
Author: .izik

Entry: They construct lodges out of fluff and cotton. When these lodges blow away, the POKENAME ride inside them to travel to new lands.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: During thunderstorms, POKENAME allows itself to be swept up by strong winds. The charged air builds up within its poms, allowing it to unleash static shocks if needed.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is very friendly and can get along with just about anyone. It may even grow attached to someone and follow them for as long as it's able.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME is deceptively heavy, as its cotton-puff exterior covers heavy metal body parts. This sometimes causes issues when a happy POKENAME launches from the gear to hug its Trainer.
Author: sk372

Entry: Few people ever see POKENAME, though they live in abundance in forests and fields. The illusions it wears allow it to pass by unnoticeably.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME is a timid Pokémon that hides in cotton fields to avoid the gaze of others. It only emerges at night, when the world is still sleeping, finding comfort in the quiet solitude of the dark.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: This Pokémon glides for long distances using its cotton-puff spores. It can control its altitude using its own body temperature.
Author: grassy311

Entry: POKENAME often flies high in search of food. When it gets tired, cotton-puff spores allow it to float in high altitudes for long periods of time.
Author: grassy311

Entry: The dandelion-like growths on POKENAME's body secrete a potent toxin. Contact can cause painful burns and blistering.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME freeze the spare fluff that they produce to act as armor for their soft bodies. They scatter barrages of crystallized fluff to attack under the cover of blizzards.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME's frenetic dance helps it scatter the fluffy seeds that grow from its wings. These seeds enrich the soil wherever they land.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME drifts through graveyards, placing tufts of cotton atop forgotten graves. The gesture is said to honor restless spirits.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's body is formed from fine blue sand. Dandelions and small wildflowers often sprout from its back after it rains.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite their high density, POKENAME gracefully rides warm winds across the globe. They fire beams of fluffy spores from their heads, spreading their offspring far and wide.
Author: imademyselfdothis

Entry: POKENAME spends its day basking in the sunlight and scattering cotton spores. At night, it burrows deep into the ground to escape predators.
Author: GentleSage

Entry: Once a POKENAME decides on a place to settle, it is impossible to remove. It attracts hordes of Jumplett that are seeking a safe place.
Author: GentleSage

Entry: If a predator nears its peaceful lagoon, POKENAME rapidly shakes its poms to create a distraction. It then flees, leading the threat away from its home.
Author: .izik

Entry: When it sighs, it lifts off the ground and starts to float away, spreading pollen across the fields.
Author: ClawsHDi

Entry: POKENAME is easily irritated and is known to attack Trainers frequently. However, due to having cotton for fists, its punches don't hurt at all.
Author: Sand_Coffin

Entry: POKENAME's fluffy spores have a tangy, lemon-like scent when carried by the wind. It spreads them while flying high above meadows.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can run up to 60 miles per hour, spreading the seeds on its body over all the meadows. Flowers of all kinds grow from it.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can run up to 60 miles per hour, spreading the seeds on its body over all the meadows. Flowers of all kinds grow from it.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can run up to 60 miles per hour, spreading the seeds on its body over all the meadows. Flowers of all kinds grow from it.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: When POKENAME is attacked, it whirls the outgrowths on its head around to block its opponent's view with lots of seeds and then runs away.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME likes to play by juggling cotton puffs on the tip of its nose. In most cases, they will lose balance once the cotton spores make it sneeze.
Author: tuskaninny

Entry: POKENAME drifts lazily along the coastline, plucking seaweed from the shore to snack on. It prefers the softest strands and will discard any tough or bitter ones.
Author: .izik

Entry: The cheese POKENAME grows on its back smells so rancid that no Pokémon want to be anywhere near it. It is, however, quite a delicacy in some regions.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: Occasionally, it makes small teeth marks on an apricorn tree trunk. This tells others of its territory without damaging the tree extensively.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME use their electricity to burn holes in wooden doors or short-circuit electrical locks on metal doors. They mainly go after cheese wheels, especially because they find it convenient and entertaining to roll with them back to their dens.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: While preferring to use its legs in combat, it is not afraid to bite its opponents instead as a cheap tactic. After exercising, its sweat smells a lot like old cheese.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It continuously produces poisonous gases in its body that cause POKENAME to float. It can transmit these poisons via its teeth.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: A swarm of POKENAME can't move, and rely on Raticate to carry them from one place to another. Its singular tooth allows it to nibble on and break tree nuts, and break out from another Pokémon that tries to eat them.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME are anxious Pokémon who chew on their own vines to relieve stress. They also gnaw on anything else they can get their fangs on.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: This Pokémon wreaks havoc everywhere they go. It's such a big problem, scientists are trying to develop countermeasures like airborne mouse traps.
Author: Sottiwotti

Entry: A common household pest, POKENAME chews its way into garbage cans to get to the discarded foodstuffs within. It's poison stinger on its head will cause a minor rash if stung by it.
Author: sk372

Entry: Their whiskers provide an extreme sense of smell, allowing them to locate food in burrows. Their venomous stinger allows them to attack and defeat the burrow's residents.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Despite needing rest to fully evolve, POKENAME prefers to squeal and hiss for several hours, channeling the rage required for it to evolve. Its cries can be heard from up to 5 miles away, making potential predators dizzy in close proximity.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: While it's notorious for blocking busy pathways, POKENAME is ideal for protecting important things from wandering eyes.
Author: Inksans201x

Entry: POKENAME will always eject its drill hands to grow new ones when they get worn out. Unsuspecting Pokémon will try eating these discarded drills, only to find they are still packed with excess poison that can sit in their stomachs for up to a month.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME are extremely curious. Unfortunately, they investigate most things by biting them with their incredibly powerful jaws.
Author: bee4082

Entry: POKENAME work in groups to strip fields of every seed, nut, and edible bud they find. They hoard their provisions in their underground communal nests.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: They are extremely skittish and rarely seen in the wild, as eye contact causes them to retreat. To avoid this, eager Trainers look down at the ground while offering berries during initial encounters.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: With the help of its internal organ, POKENAME can track its predators' sleeping patterns. When the time is right, POKENAME scrounges for food.
Author: Demonic_Garbage

Entry: A common sight in major cities, it thrives in dirtier environments compared to Pidgeotto. Its keen vision enables it to spot prey even in dark alleys.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME have a strange habit of nibbling on small meteorites, despite the damage it does to their teeth. People use POKENAME to determine what rocks are extraterrestrial.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Due to their similarities and numbers, the dominant POKENAME is decided by whose hair is the longest. Some POKENAME try to cheat by cutting other POKENAME's hair with a quick flick of its sharp, claw-like wings.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME drifts along the breeze, looking for tough leaves to nibble on. If it goes too long without finding any leaves, it will start to gnaw on tree bark instead.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its puffs have the same consistency as cotton candy. Despite being pink, they taste like cheddar cheese and regrow quickly.
Author: .izik

Entry: This colony of Rattata is always together, as they function as one Pokémon. The largest Rattata is chosen as the king of the pack.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME are known to join groups of Rattata claiming to be their leader. These groups fight for survival and control.
Author: the_smirker

Entry: POKENAME shapes cheese into crescents, which likely gave rise to the cheese moon myth. Researchers are baffled as to why it exhibits this behavior.
Author: mystora

Entry: There is an old woman in Arborville that uses POKENAME's feathers to create dolls. Due to the down's softness, these toys are popular for toddlers.
Author: .izik

Entry: The average Raticate's hiss is intimidating and ear-piercing, while this Pokémon's cry is neither of those. More often than not, this Pokémon will be forced to go first in a life-and-death situation for the pack.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME scurries about with incredible speed, leaving behind faint trails of energy in its wake. It has an uncanny ability to locate objects of value and can steal them with ease.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: While POKENAME may get into squabbles over where to build their nests, they are highly coordinated and loyal to each other. Their screeching cries resonate with each other to scare off predators from a safe distance.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME are commonly seen stealing cheese from suburban homes. They are devilishly clever and organize heists to steal as much cheese as they can.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is very cheerful. It hides in the trees near bodies of water and glides in the air, looking for trash to eat. They're pests of the most popular tourist beaches.
Author: Markusknight

Entry: POKENAME impulsively bites into anything electrical, from wires to utility poles. Great effort and care is needed to break this habit.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME is adorned with various cheeses. These cheeses are formed from ingredients that POKENAME has swiftly stolen away.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Wild POKENAME are known to employ underlings to do their bidding. They are highly sought after by criminals.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: Wild POKENAME are known to employ underlings to do their bidding. They are highly sought after by criminals.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: Despite its fear of water, it tends to make its den by the side of creeks. If the water level rises, it runs in fear.
Author: .izik

Entry: Groups of POKENAME put on little dance shows to entertain others. They are so beloved that other Pokémon will fiercely defend them from predators.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: The unnerving visage of this Pokémon strikes fear in the hearts of those who gaze upon it. Anyone who dares to look at the crack on its back is left on the brink of death.
Author: bacondlx

Entry: POKENAME's teeth are made of a steel alloy. This makes wearing them down a tedious experience.
Author: Mossybanana

Entry: POKENAME seeks out Rattata colonies so it can bully and beat its way into leadership. Once hierarchy is established, it lazes around while the browbeaten Rattata gather food for it.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are found in dark alleyways where they hunt. They target larger victims the hungrier they are, so are fed to deter attacks on humans.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It cuts objects and victims indiscriminately with its scissor-like incisors, which it sharpens on rocks.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Skittish in nature, POKENAME loves to explore its area. Trainers are advised to keep stimulating toys around if seeking this Pokémon.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME crawls out once night falls in order to steal some food to ensure its survival. It is capable of carrying an entire fridge out of somebody's home.
POKENAME chews on rocks to find Moonstone dust deposits. While the dust is tasty, the rocks chip off part of its fangs, leaving them sharp and jagged.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: It sings lullabies to the moon at night. During the daytime you can hear it humming the same haunting melody.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are nocturnal and notoriously shy. When spotted, they emit a sudden bright light from their bodies and flee.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are nocturnal and notoriously shy. When spotted, they emit a sudden bright light from their bodies and flee.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME is very skittish, and will wave its tail at anything it sees as a threat. This often leads to forest fires.
Author: holgast

Entry: POKENAME echolocates with its high-pitched squeaks, which it uses to find its prey. It then takes them down with its Super Fang attack.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: A wild POKENAME will follow living Rattatas, attempting to warn them of the fate it has suffered. Only the mask can be seen by these Rattatas, causing them to flee in fear.
Author: crumple_2

Entry: POKENAME will act friendly and comfortable around a regular flock of Fletchlings, only to steal their food at the last second. This behavior showcases how it uses its mixed traits to its advantage.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME are extremely stubborn, often getting into needless fights with wild Pokémon. They are known to be difficult to train.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: It produces a unique type of fruit on its head that has similar properties to cheese. The fruit is apparently delicious if you can get past its repugnant smell.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME are obsessive with keeping their coats clean, spending hours every day grooming their fur. Their fur is made up of a rocky fibre and wears down their teeth rapidly.
Author: Katie

Entry: The silk POKENAME produces is highly valued in textile production. Shorts woven from its silk are incredibly comfy and easy to wear, making them the preferred choice of Youngsters.
Author: .izik

Entry: Years ago, a world-famous animation first broke out with a cartoon starring a POKENAME. Today, that character is the mascot for one of the largest animation studios in the world.
Author: .fedoraman & sk372

Entry: Swarms of them infest busy cities in search for food. Some regions have even started offering rewards for capturing enough of them.
Author: clickonflareblitz
