Entry: POKENAME hates anything that comes within its body of water. It doesn't matter if it's food or a full-sized Trainer, it will nibble on it until it's devoured or it flees.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: It sneaks into picnics and tries to steal food, leaving a trail of acid that destroys the belongings of lots of Trainers. Its arrogant attitude has made it gain a whole club of haters.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Groups of POKENAME are said to frequent sewers. Their shell makes it easy to slide through the pipes.
Author: holgast

Entry: Even though it was meant to be like a pest that's hard to get rid of, many Trainers have adopted POKENAME as an ideal house pet. Its soft tail and tiny ears warm the hearts of many, so they don't realize their food gets stolen at night.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME's water cannons change in scent and pressure based on its diet. In the worst-case scenario, a POKENAME's Hydro Pump can blast as hard as a fire hose and smell like sewage.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: Much like the Pure Incense sold in shops, POKENAME utilize their wisps to avoid danger. Their incorporeal form also helps them escape danger by floating away.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: There have been instances of POKENAME causing mass power outages by biting into electrical wires. They do this purely out of spite and malice.
Author: 8xviktor

Entry: Its teeth can easily bite through solid rock. It lives in extensive colonies in abandoned mines.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: Each of its vines end in a flower that mimics a hand. It uses these to drum on its bulb, creating a sound like bubbling water.
Author: holgast

Entry: It uses the hand on its tail to cling to a branch while it waits to evolve. The palm of the hand is extremely adhesive.
Author: .izik

Entry: It grabs petals off of flowers an uneven pattern. It methodically counts them on a tree top after it collects a handful.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has an extremely stretchy tongue that is shaped like a hand. It is able to extend and retract this hand at will.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: This form of POKENAME was specifically bred for domestication. They are commonly found in preschools as playmates for children.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: This breed of POKENAME has a great sense of hearing. It uses its stretchy, tendril-like arms to slap foes from a distance.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: It makes a very aggressive yodeling noise at night. When multiple POKENAME get together, campers will leave the forest.
Author: .izik

Entry: The venom in its stinger can render a human unconscious in seconds. It giggles at its foe as it gets knocked out.
Author: .izik

Entry: It swings the hand on its tail wildly as it eats to deter others from stealing its meal. Each swing has the power to break bones.
Author: .izik

Entry: Whenever it spots a Silver Razz Berry, it becomes completely fixated on it, watching it intently as it moves. This distraction makes it an easy target for a well-placed Pokéball.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It digs out a hole and covers it in branches to create its berry hoard. It will do this multiple times a day during the autumn months.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME loves to wave to people who pass by. When it's tired in flight, it'll give itself a slight massage.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME's arm-like tail is incredibly sticky. It uses it while flying to snatch food away from inattentive Pokémon and Trainers.
Author: @ProjectAlpha22

Entry: With a simple flick of its tail, it has the ability to paralyze, poison, or cause slumber. Once it incapacitates its enemy, it steals their valuables.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME floats over the jungle canopy in search of ripe fruit. When it lands, it softens its fall with its dexterous tail.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: Submerged just below the water's surface, it lives along riverbeds where Persimmon trees grow. It works together with other POKENAME to shake down trees before sharing the fruits with each other.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME uses its large hand to steal objects that are too large or heavy for its beak. A flock can abscond with a TV or other electronics.
Author: holgast

Entry: It distracts its target with one head, while the other attempts to steal their food. The heads never fight, and encourage the other to do mischief.
Author: PokePower

Entry: The head of POKENAME is kind and gentle, but the tail is a mischievous prankster. It often chases its own tail to teach the tricky appendage a lesson.
Author: EvilGammon

Entry: Should it become startled, an POKENAME will burst, flinging wooden spikes into the immediate area. These spikes are sharp enough to pierce metal.
Author: .izik

Entry: The saliva that drips from its mouth has a slight paralytic agent. Pharmacists in Orsay City are using this to create an upgraded Paralyze Heal.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hangs upside-down in trees and uses its tail to stuff berries into its shell for later use. It can do this even while asleep.
Author: holgast

Entry: POKENAME were once utilized by traveling clay merchants to pull their wagons. It can reliably carry 500 pounds without breaking a sweat.
Author: .izik

Entry: Aspiring, self-taught artists, POKENAME paint on rocks and trees in their tropical habitats. When they run out of paint, they travel to local towns and steal paint tubes from art supply stores, but only in reds, greens, and blues.
Author: Jackster

Entry: Despite their hands' lightweight appearance, they are very heavy. Each hand weighs more than an average-sized pickup truck.
Author: .izik

Entry: Each of its many tentacles ends in a primitive yet surprisingly dextrous hand. Its uses them to swing through trees with blinding speed for its size.
Author: holgast

Entry: POKENAME are active and playful. However, if they are tasked with something they don't find amusing, they become listless and lazy.
Author: jreposo

Entry: It is often described as laid-back, stubborn, and obssesed with bananas. There are rumours that an POKENAME Island may exist.
Author: jreposo

Entry: Currently classified as a Shiny form of POKENAME, this is thought by some to be its original form. Its rivalry with Cacdile dates back generations.
Author: jreposo

Entry: POKENAME's vine-swinging hand and blade can make for a swift death in the forest. Thankfully it prefers grabbing and cutting fruits and nuts instead.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It fires sharp needles from the end of its tail. A thin metallic alloy coats its entire body, protecting it from assault.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's toothy grin is terrifying to many. Its teeth are impenetrable. All its feet are equipped to grab like a human.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME use their multiple hands to quickly swing across branches and vines. They steal berries and other items from unsuspecting Pokémon.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: It uses its tail to balance its flight. Should the end of the tail be injured even slightly, it will fly clumsily until it heals.
Author: .izik

Entry: A children's hospital's patients swear that a creepy Aipom waves at them from an open vent at night. Others report losing their vinyl glove balloons.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: POKENAME are not blind, but because of the hair covering their face, they will still end up bumping into everything.
Author: mystora

Entry: Using the adhesive properties of its hands, it climbs the walls of homes. It peeks through windows at night, searching for prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: The hand on its tail flashes rapidly to distract its foe. The light from its tail can be seen from over a mile away.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME use the hands on their tails to secure themselves to walls of caves while they sleep. They work in packs, linking their tails together to gather and transport minerals for food.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Before attacking, the flame on POKENAME's tail takes on a hand-like shape. It burns palm-shaped prints near Apricorn Trees to mark its territory.
Author: .izik

Entry: During thunderstorms, it uses its hands to grab onto trees or other sturdy objects. Once the storm passes, it sleeps for days to refill its stamina.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME seems to have decided that if they didn't have hands, they would grow them instead. They grab high-hanging berries with impish glee.
Author: 22ndsolstice

Entry: POKENAME gnaws into electrical cables near businesses to feed on the current. If threatened, it casts a powerful Electroweb and channels electricity through its paw-like tail to shock predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: Many POKENAME are smarter than humans. There are stories of ancient civilizations using POKENAME for drawing up schematics for inventions.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses the hand on the end of its tongue to reel in prey. Using its large fangs, it skillfully drains the life force of its enemy.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its tail-hand to prevent prey from escaping its grasp. It will then encircle and bite its opponent from behind.
Author: holgast

Entry: Should it spot a lost traveler, it will cheer obnoxiously at them. Because of this habit, some believe that POKENAME love seeing others suffer.
Author: .izik

Entry: The sound of multiple flutes can be heard while an POKENAME floats. The faster it moves, the more intense of a noise can be heard.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses the hand on its tail to swing from branch to branch. As it swings, it lets loose clouds of pollen into the air.
Author: .izik

Entry: The amnesia-inducing effects of Gloom's noxious honey have been neutralized by fusion, making POKENAME's honey theoretically safe to eat - though most say that it tastes terrible.
Author: bee4082

Entry: At dawn and dusk, it hoots and hollers to find its kin. It has an extra lung inside its hand-tail, letting its raucous cry go on for ages.
Author: PokePower

Entry: A group of POKENAME will cling together to form a simulacrum of a large cloud. The structure is then carried effortlessly along the wind.
Author: holgast

Entry: POKENAME clambers down beaches at frightening speed thanks to its many limbs. It has been known to suddenly jump from palm trees.
Author: .realthree

Entry: It attacks its opponents with a flying press, then holds them in place with its tail-hand as it pummels them with punches and kicks.
Author: holgast

Entry: It fakes having stiff limbs, moving in an off-kilter fashion. Sudden bursts of acrobatics make it unpredictable, tripping up foes and stealing food.
Author: PokePower

Entry: Its body continuously produces sand from an unknown source. Glassblowers in Cerulean City utilize this glass in jewelry crafting.
Author: .izik

Entry: The mushrooms on its body resemble hands. When startled, it will release a purple powder that is toxic if inhaled.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME take great pride in building up their body using their singular hand. Their body usually falls apart as they flail to protect themselves.
Author: PokePower

Entry: POKENAME is incredibly popular in circus shows, supplanting Mr. Mime. It can perform many impressive feats of acrobatics and dexterity.
Author: holgast

Entry: Clumps of its mushroom can be used in recipes for Heal Powder. The mushroom itself smells like bananas and hand sanitizer.
Author: .izik

Entry: When sleeping, POKENAME swats the hollow pumpkin-like part of its body with its tail. The eerie, bongo-like sounds echoing through pumpkin patches unsettle travelers.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hypnotically waves its head, paws and tail when dormant. Along with its uncanny stare, this has lead to many considering it unnerving.
Author: holgast

Entry: It dazes other Pokémon with the pattern on its stomach, before stealing soft fruits from them like peaches or nectarines. After finishing its stolen fruit, it scurries away before the dazed Pokémon snaps out of it.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Its mind has the ability to do complex math without much effort. Scientists in Alola utilize it to research wormholes and other phenomena.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its eerie smile and stare is seen as unnerving by humans. Large groups of POKENAME hang together, swaying from trees.
Author: holgast

Entry: It unwillingly has the ability to remotely view anyone making a joke within a 10-mile radius. Should it hear a funny joke it will laugh for hours.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses its hand to grab onto live wires. It consumes large amounts of power in this way, taking out entire substations.
Author: .izik

Entry: The bizarre POKENAME is often mistaken for a form of Unown. Not much is known about where it comes from or how it survives in the wild.
Author: bee4082

Entry: An POKENAME's stick will harden after one day should it be separated from its owner. A shop in Milyfa Town sells these sticks as back scratchers.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its large, tail-like appendage to latch onto unsuspecting people at night. It does not wish to do harm however, merely to frighten.
Author: @ProjectAlpha22

Entry: Due to each head always being at different stages in their life cycles, a single group of POKENAME is virtually immortal. However, since only one of them is ever fully grown at a time, they are not much use in battle.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: In particularly sunny areas, POKENAME's heads can grow to gargantuan sized. However, if they grow too big, they will end up falling off and eventually growing into a new POKENAME.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME often stay close to the surface of water and rarely dive deeper. This is to ensure they are collecting enough sunlight to sustain themselves.
Author: KitArchen

Entry: POKENAME shoots seeds it has collected in its mouth as a defense mechanism. It can swim through dirt as though it were water.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Since Pokémon Fusion has become more commonplace, many natural conservationists have praised POKENAME's natural-born tendency to pollinate all kinds of flora, spreading pollen and seeds wherever it goes.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME will eat anything it can get its hands on. Once it has eaten enough food to match its body weight three times over, it will bury itself in the dirt of a reclusive sunny meadow, and wait to evolve.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: To save energy in order to hasten evolution, POKENAME rarely takes to the air and flies. It huddles together in small groups, eating nuts, berries and pine cones that fall from trees.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME use their punches to make perfect holes for seeds. This efficiency has made POKENAME favored by farmers.
Author: CodeWolfie

Entry: POKENAME are great at identifying weeds and fungi. They fly around farmsteads eliminating any plants that may threaten the farm.
Author: CodeWolfie

Entry: They hide in the bushes when people come nearby since they are often mistaken for berries. After people leave, they harvest different types of berries that help protect them from predators, such as the Occa Berry or Kebia Berry.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME likes to plant itself in rich, fertile lands. Its compact dirt shell allows for it to relocate if the local soil has become unsuitable.
Author: howlingstarr

Entry: POKENAME only needs dew to survive. When the sprout grows large enough, it falls out of this Pokémon's hair and is replaced by a new one.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME cluster in trees on the branches facing toward the sun. They will move around the tree throughout the day, jostling for the highest position to catch the most sunlight.
Author: Katie

Entry: Despite its mischievous personality, some unconventional gardeners swear by using POKENAME as a farmhand due to its unique talents. Seeds sown by this Pokémon appear to sprout much faster than normal.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: POKENAME mainly relies on sunlight and morning dew to sustain itself while it waits to evolve. POKENAME will usually find a smooth pebble and carry it wherever it goes, though it doesn't typically move far to conserve energy.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: This Pokémon frolicks and plays on bright sunny days, but digs a burrow and hides on cloudy days. Sometimes, the sprout on POKENAME's head is visible above the ground.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME constantly tries to keep turning, but its vines continuously get in the way. Only when the sun is at its highest point does POKENAME turn—yet it never stops smiling through the struggle.
Author: misfit0521

Entry: POKENAME digs itself into the ground to hide. If someone accidentally steps on its leaf, it emits a painful flame.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME chews on small plants to gain additional nutrients separate from its photosynthesis. Once it finishes eating, its bud opens up and spreads pollen that will aid plant growth in the area.
Author: sk372

Entry: They can determine weather forecasts, planting dates, and other farming data, which has allowed them to replace the almanac. They determine this information by sinking their roots into the soil to communicate with plant-based Pokémon.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Despite its appearance, POKENAME is a very gentle creature. It has been observed spreading seeds in an effort to preserve forest habitats.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: The wispy wings of POKENAME gather moisture from the air as they fly from field to field. In drier months, the water collected in their wings is showered out as soft rain, helping the seeds of other Grass-types grow to adulthood.
Author: Katie

Entry: Its only effective defense is fire, which it can emit. However, this drains POKENAME of a lot of energy, so it usually avoids combat.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Despite its size, it is very weak. It digs into soft, nutritious fields with its claws and raises its tail to gather energy for evolution.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: If it isn't getting exercise, POKENAME is basking in the sunlight, synthesizing nutrients to get even stronger. It dislikes excessively rainy or snowy days.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: This fusion marks the start of a great combination in the wild. With Geodude arms, POKENAME can move to the best spot for its dew-based diet, and better hide into the ground. If attacked by a Spearow, POKENAME will punch a change of mind into it.
Author: Lutrax

Entry: While Sundude consumes water and light, POKENAME has begun eating rocks and dirt as well in order to harden its outer shell. Most frequently, it eats spots out of hills, which is where it and its brethren will burrow for the night.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME regularly climbs to mountaintops in order to be as close as possible to the sun. This Pokémon also loves rainy days as the water drips through the cracks in its skin. As the plant system within it grows, POKENAME must shed its rocky skin.
Author: Lutrax

Entry: Sharing sunlight as they absorb it means every flower head on POKENAME is always as vibrant and jubilant as the rest. Gifting someone a POKENAME is considered a romantic gesture in some island regions.
Author: sk372

Entry: As POKENAME gets older, its once vibrant petals will start to grow dull no matter how much sun they get. POKENAME tend to be popular gifts amongst elderly communities.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its long tongue is usually used to lap up water, not to fight. After taking in enough water, it will find a wide-open field and bask in the sun. The chubbier the POKENAME, the healthier it is.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The upper part of POKENAME's cocoon absorbs sunlight to fuel and hasten the evolution process. Once complete, its evolution will burst from the cocoon in an eruption of bright sunlight.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME happily grows all kinds of flowers in its bushy foliage. It gives them out to Trainers to make them happy.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME constantly seeks the freshest soil to fill its pouch for the sake of its child's development. Solar energy the parent absorbs will naturally filter to said soil and then be absorbed by its young.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME change color when exposed to lots of sunlight. Some may even burst into flames, but they enjoy this.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: POKENAME absorbs sunlight and fire in equal measure for energy, the mark on its torso glowing as it does so. It can fire flames from this mark, or from the petals circling its face.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME enjoys wide open, sunlit fields to run around in, and maintains a relatively easy disposition among humans. The only time it gets aggressive is when butting heads over a prime spot for absorbing sunlight with a rival POKENAME.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME bears an ancient shell that radiates sunlight. It brings life to barren lands, revitalizing ecosystems with its solar energy.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME spends most of its time basking in the sunlight in large fields. It is hardly ever seen on cloudy days.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME are cheery Pokémon who love to bask in the summer sun. Its nutrient-rich scales can help plants grow when they fall off.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME converts solar power into psychic energy. This causes it pain, making it easily irritated.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME stores excess solar energy from photosynthesis in the flower on its head. It is a very positive Pokémon and seems to be especially cheery on sunny days.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME are often underestimated by Trainers and Pokémon. They use this to their advantage, unleashing attacks while their enemy's guard is down.
Author: dicedragon20

Entry: POKENAME have the ability to fire seeds from their arms like cannons. They fly above farmsteads, firing at anything that may be a threat to the crops.
Author: CodeWolfie

Entry: The main body tries to be serious, while the Sunflora on its back is always smiling and chipper as it absorbs sunlight. Often the Sunflora will prod and poke the body in order to get it to crack a smile, which it rarely does.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME bounds about in sunny groves, smearing sap from one tree to the next to share it with others. It detests using its horn in self-defense, as it messes up the arrangement of leaves surrounding it.
Author: sk372

Entry: They produce a sweet nectar from their face and lick the liquid that drips onto their paws. It is known to chase after sunlight and stops producing nectar at night.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is a very jubilant serpent Pokémon always searching for heat sources, particularly sunlight. When sunlight is not easily available, it will coil around nearby people or Pokémon, embracing them tightly to share in their warmth.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's happy disposition and adorable features have garnered it quite a positive reputation among pet owners. Some regions even hold beauty competitions solely featuring POKENAME.
Author: sk372

Entry: It shoots fennel seeds from its arm cannon by accelerating growth in its microbiome. It absorbs sunlight to produce a batch of seeds before releasing a flurry of them toward its opponent.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME always has a gaping smile on its face. Some people find this smile quite sinister. The pollen it creates can make anyone sneeze.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME hide amongst other Sunflora, slowly draining their energy while they're unaware. Despite this, they are still very friendly to everyone.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME uses the false flower on the back of its head to lure in unsuspecting insect Pokémon near. The flower expels a stunning poison on the victim, leaving them helpless to resist becoming POKENAME's prey.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is always smiling and dancing on sunny days. It lives in meadows and drags itself along by its powerful roots to find good spots to sunbathe.
Author: michaelkai

Entry: Though quite powerful, POKENAME are friendly and docile, spending their days lazing among verdant flowerbeds. Being offered one of their shed petals is considered a sign of a prosperous future in some regions.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME uses its skull as protection for its vital organs. The main body can only be defeated the skull underneath is destroyed.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME always faces toward the sun, using its innate magnetic powers to track the direction of the sun even at night. It makes for an excellent garden companion as it will carry plants with it as it follows the sunlight.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME was loyal to ancient people who shared a love for the sun. The POKENAME continue to guard what remains of their temples.
Author: _testrun_

Entry: While quite charming, It is often prone to mischief. Even when gravely injured, the smile on its face never falters.
Author: Inksans201x

Entry: Even in combat, a POKENAME will always orient itself towards the sun. It can fight opponents in any direction without turning its body.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: It gains its energy from the sunflower on its head. It regularly sheds the nutrient-dense seeds on its tail, which can be roasted into a salty snack.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME disguises itself as a sunflower to blend seamlessly into fields and gardens. If spotted by a predator, it reveals its hidden wings and takes off at incredible speeds.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: During the day, POKENAME gathers sunlight with its leaves and converts it into energy, storing it in the abdomen. When the sun goes down, POKENAME uses this energy to cover large distances with blinding speed and spread its seeds everywhere it flies.
Author: milchik

Entry: The gel that coats its body is amazing at photosynthesis, producing enough energy in an hour to last it two days. Scientists think the gel could be useful in creating high-tech solar panels.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The more sunlight POKENAME absorbs during the day, the brighter its wings glow and the more cheerful its smile gets. With enough sun energy accumulated, this Pokémon can illuminate an entire flower field akin to a small sun.
Author: milchik

Entry: POKENAME is often found in lush fields, basking in the sun. Although docile, POKENAME will viciously attack those who disturb its peace.
Author: Thropp

Entry: The high amounts of sunlight it absorbs during the day allows it to continue to be extremely active during the night as well. A sleeping POKENAME is one that has been dangerously deprived of sunlight.
Author: sk372

Entry: Although POKENAME always emits a small flame from its tail, its body is flammable. It is always careful not to ignite itself when attacking.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: This Pokémon photosynthesizes constantly to produce electrical energy. Stepping on one will release a flood of potent electric spores that can even cause paralysis.
Author: chaos_emblemx

Entry: POKENAME cheerfully strolls around the forest without a care in the world, absorbing sunlight with its flower. However, if you try to wake it while it's sleeping, it will fly into a rampage.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME lies in large flower fields, its tail outstretched in wait for a Pokémon to come by. Once a pollinator lands on a flower, it secures a meal.
Author: kermitcermet#2076

Entry: This duo of Sunflora and Oddish delight in each other's company; POKENAME is never seen without a smile on both faces. They march together beneath the sunlight, singing a happy duet together.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME often take up the role of protector to entire fields of Sunflora. Any intruders will soon fall under a deadly and incurable curse.
Author: Cristata

Entry: Amidst great sunflower fields lie POKENAME, composed of souls of those who tended them long ago. Intruders will face the wrath of the sun.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: POKENAME often take up the role of protector to entire fields of Sunflora. Any intruders will soon fall under a deadly and incurable curse.
Author: Cristata

Entry: POKENAME often take up the role of protector to entire fields of Sunflora. Any intruders will soon fall under a deadly and incurable curse.
Author: Cristata

Entry: POKENAME often take up the role of protector to entire fields of Sunflora. Any intruders will soon fall under a deadly and incurable curse.
Author: Cristata

Entry: Vegetation took over an empty steel shell, resulting in this Pokémon. Mechanical sounds can be heard from it during strong sunlight.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: POKENAME loves to strike poses dramatically with the sun behind it before leaping into battle. The more it is allowed to bask in the sun before a fight, the more bombastic its moves become.
Author: sk372

Entry: Often nicknamed 'Gentle Giant', smaller Pokémon tend to follow POKENAME around for their friendship and protection. Wherever it travels, entire ecosystems and flower fields sprout in its place.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: POKENAME stands rigidly in forests or fields and absorbs sunlight. If an enemy approaches, it launches fire that has been known to light forest fires.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It tries to remain in sunlight for as long as possible. This is because it begins suffering intense headaches the moment it no longer feels sunlight on its skin.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME constantly absorbs solar energy. Once it has collected enough, it can ignite entire firestorms. But it has to be wary of its flammable body.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: During the day, POKENAME climbs to the tops of mountains to absorb sunlight. At night, this Pokémon digs shallow burrows to rest, and while sleeping in said burrows, it appears to casual bystanders as just a simple rock.
Author: Lutrax

Entry: If you happen to be on the peak of a mountain during a sunny afternoon, you could see a myriad of POKENAME enjoying the sunlight; however, be careful when climbing in the evening, as during that time herds of POKENAME may be rolling down carefree.
Author: Lutrax

Entry: POKENAME used to be a popular Pokémon racing breed. However since its speed depended on the sun, it was deemed too unreliable.
Author: CodeWolfie

Entry: This Pokémon lazes by sunny riverbeds, happily swirling its tail in the water and taking in the sunlight. Some have described it as being the pinnacle of blissful ignorance.
Author: sk372

Entry: It runs across the land at high speeds during the day, keeping its heads in the sunlight for as long as possible. Only when the sun is hidden does it finally stop moving and rest, until it detects the next ray of sunshine.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME spends its day planting seeds wherever it can. The most beautiful gardens are said to be around areas where this Pokémon gathers.
Author: noel5229

Entry: POKENAME spends its day planting seeds wherever it can. The most beautiful gardens are said to be around areas where this Pokémon gathers.
Author: noel5229

Entry: It is said that it evolves when it is able to sustain supersonic speeds for long periods of time, which is why it is given unnecessary X Speed boosters.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Each portion of its body flies in a fixed pattern. It coordinates flight patterns each night before it falls asleep.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its keen eyesight and aerial maneuverability to ensure its devastating blows connect with its opponent.
Author: grayslashjay_8566

Entry: Its wings allow it to to escape from danger with ease. Its eyes can detect even the swiftest of movements.
Author: .izik

Entry: With 360-degree vision, those that try to sneak up on POKENAME will find it transforming to defend itself before they even get close. It typically excludes changing its eyes during transformation, so that it may retain its vision as a precaution.
Author: sk372

Entry: Despite its developing body being restrained by its cocoon, POKENAME can still actively avoid danger thanks to its light weight and strong wings. Its wings never stop moving until evolution is finished.
Author: sk372

Entry: It lets out a high-pitched shriek when the sun goes down. The sound is loud enough to cause the water on a pond to ripple.
Author: .izik

Entry: With Yanma's 360-degree vision and Noctowl's 180-degree head rotation and acute night vision, no attack can take it by surprise.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: It can be seen flying in a zigzag pattern all across lakes. The beats of its wings generate a plethora of static electricity, which it uses in battle.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: Too heavy to fly, POKENAME use their wings to charge up static electricity and shoot shock waves as its main form of attack.
Author: T.I.A.

Entry: Quick fliers with superb senses of sight and hearing, POKENAME are experts at stealing food. One need only look away for a moment, and it will have snatched a new meal from them with hardly a sound.
Author: sk372

Entry: It does laps around local landmarks to time itself and improve its speed. It will make a minimum of 50 flights per day.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's goggle-like eyes allow it to see clearly beneath the water's surface. It dives from the sky with precision to catch its prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its wings are powerful, and POKENAME can use them to fly faster than fighter jets. It can supplement its ability to fly with its ability to levitate.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Despite its 360-degree vision, POKENAME possesses a fragile constitution. Still, it maintains composure in the face of danger.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: It constricts its body around prey hard enough to break bones. Should it notice an enemy nearby, it will fly away with the prey still imprisoned.
Author: .izik

Entry: The sound of crackling static can be heard when POKENAME flutters its wings. Catching one can prove difficult, as it moves sporadically and can paralyze others on contact.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The flames within POKENAME's body intensify as it flies. Its glowing body leaves behind a faint trail of heat in the air.
Author: .izik

Entry: The flap of its wings can electrocute other bug Pokémon it flies by. Large groupings of POKENAME create elaborate lightshows at dusk.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: POKENAME flies so fast that time slows down around it. Because of this, POKENAME's lifespan is about 50 percent longer than other Pokémon.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is driven by a strong desire to help others. Though it has great potential, it doesn't know how to tap into this power.
Author: JackytheWannabe

Entry: POKENAME flies fast, but uncertainly. A layer of acid protects its eyes and breaks down visual impairments in no time at all.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME aggressively flap their wings to warn humans of danger. Unfortunately, they're too tiny for Trainers to hear them.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: Living along lakes, POKENAME will buzz around fruiting plants to eat. Their eyes allow them to see approaching threats 360° around them.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME is unable to walk, but is a masterful flyer and swimmer. It spends most of its time in the shallows, hunting small insects and crustaceans, and avoids predators by darting in and out of the water.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: Despite being able to fly in any direction, POKENAME will always be facing north. It likes to fly as fast as it can, knocking out any bird Pokémon in its path.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME lands atop streetlights to absorb electrical energy. Its wings buzz loudly as it drains the current.
Author: .izik

Entry: With their hard skulls and erratic flying, POKENAME can cause severe damage to cities. Even reinforced glass can't withstand a determined POKENAME.
Author: currentlymuffin (w/ help from ohok3441 & ziggaway)

Entry: With 360 degree vision, ultrasonic waves for detection and precision flying capabilities, it is near impossible for prey to avoid POKENAME hunting them, nor for a predator to sneak up on POKENAME.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME has great aerial mobility, able to change directions without turning its body. It will spot its prey from above and then dive towards the ground at supersonic speeds.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: While flying over marshes, POKENAME spits fire to clear its path. The heat from its flames can dry entire patches of swamp grass.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME dances at such a blistering speed that its wings create a buzzing sound as they whizz through the air.
Author: .realthree

Entry: As POKENAME sashays through the tall grass, its many wings vibrate to disguise its footsteps as rushing wind.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME are not that physically strong, but it uses its speed to punch up to 200 times a second. It will try its best to protect weaker Pokémon, but it is not always successful.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME vibrates the many wings in its ruff, producing an ominous buzzing that sounds like an entire swarm of dangerous bug Pokémon.
Author: .realthree

Entry: When POKENAME howls, its wings flap with wild energy. The sound echoes through cliffs and can startle nearby Pokémon.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite having wings, POKENAME floats to move around. However, when it does uses them, it can go at 100 kph.
Author: pokebio

Entry: POKENAME keep wandering in high-traffic areas where they get run over. Fear not, as they don't die, and their body will re-inflate itself in a day.
Author: pokebio

Entry: POKENAME's wings beat rapidly as it channels psychic energy. The vibrations in the air sharpen its focus before it strikes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can run across the ground at high speeds before retreating into its shell and crashing full-force into opponents. After knocking a foe down this way, it always makes sure to pose and adjust its "glasses" in a cool manner.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME prefers to scurry along the ground and engage opponents face-to-face. Its legs are surprisingly powerful despite their small size.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: While it can't fly, the stiff membrane on its back can be used to glide. It uses its visor to lock onto enemy Pokémon from far above.
Author: hushpuppy

Entry: POKENAME swoops at a target from above, smacking it with its leek before retreating to wait for another chance to strike.  As it has weak defenses, these hit-and-run tactics are its best bet for successful hunts.
Author: sk372

Entry: While POKENAME has a shell to defend itself from enemies, it can also flee quickly using its wings, making small waves as it darts across the sea.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME have a bulb on their back that secretes a slimy, toxic film which covers their skin, protecting them from sunlight. Though the film is poisonous in its liquid form, it can be mixed with sugar and boiled to make a sticky, sour candy.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: The antennae on top of a POKENAME's head secrete a liquid that they cover themselves in. This liquid is foul-smelling and designed to repel predators. Unfortunately, most predators don't mind the smell and have led to overhunting.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: Clusters of POKENAME float happily on the surface of shallow marshes. Their bobbing movement resembles drifting seeds, making them easy to overlook.
Author: .izik

Entry: Having lost what it once valued most, POKENAME finds itself without purpose.
Author: Fuade

Entry: POKENAME often hang above bodies of water, undergoing metamorphosis. When threatened they drop into the water, where their outer skin instantly hardens. Whilst they are safe in this state, they cannot grow, so must venture out of the water again.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME flops helplessly from pond to pond, splashing about as it moves. During this time, it uses its horn to deter predators from taking advantage of its struggle.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME often hang above bodies of water, undergoing metamorphosis. When threatened they drop into the water, where their outer skin instantly hardens. Whilst they are safe in this state, they cannot grow, so must venture out of the water again.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: Every POKENAME's wings are unique as they get their colouration from the types of flowers they visit. Their wings need to be kept constantly wet otherwise they will shrivel up and be unable to hold the POKENAME's weight.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME lives in shallow marshes, where it buries itself in mud to stay cool. If it beaches itself while playing, it will flop around helplessly until it manages to submerge again.
Author: .izik

Entry: The gills on a newborn POKENAME are so small they can't breathe underwater, so must forage on land. They are vulnerable at this stage, but when they have grown, they can stay underwater for hours at a time.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME lay dormant at the bottom of small bodies of water. Their gills can absorb the tiniest sustenance suspended in the water. They use so little energy in this state, that other Pokémon assume they are dead.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME is incredibly friendly to humans. It loves playing with children on sunny days, joyfully floating alongside them in pools.
Author: akujules

Entry: POKENAME are very territorial and will dive at anything that gets too near, striking with their stingers. They lay their eggs in the mud near water but seem to forget about them as soon as they are laid.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME build their nests on riverbanks. They attract mates with a distinctive call similar to that of a Pidgey's, except POKENAME simultaneously expel great volumes of water. This causes it to sound more gurgled, followed by a big splash.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME spits a sticky string to reel in prey and drag them into its marsh-side den. Once inside, it submerges them in the mud before making its next catch.
Author: .izik

Entry: Though POKENAME is capable of great aerial speed, it rarely utilizes it. The brutal airflow of flight is painful to handle for its external gills.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME claim whole river systems as their territory and are very protective of them. They fly for hours at a time, keeping an eye on their territory, but have never been found further than a kilometer from a river.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME claim whole river systems as their territory and are very protective of them. They fly for hours at a time, keeping an eye on their territory, but have never been found further than a kilometer from a river.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: The droppings of POKENAME are toxic to other Pokémon but are a wonderful fertilizer for plants. POKENAME's territory is always full of magnificent flora, and sweet, juicy berries.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME swims through shallow ponds, using its long tail to gather up cattails to eat. It builds small floating nests from gathered plants, drifting peacefully on the water's surface.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's lightweight body allows it to hop playfully across the surface of ponds. It enjoys snacking on lily pads as it bounces along.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's body is lighter than water, allowing it to effortlessly float along rivers and streams. It often helps smaller Pokémon cross the river on its lily pad.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The gills on a POKENAME both enable it to breathe underwater, and also to sense subtle changes in the environment. When water currents shift, POKENAME dart away, expecting danger.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: They are rotund and soft as a pillow, as their bodies are made up of mostly water and blubber. They release a low, resounding bellow that sounds like a tuba whenever they awaken each day.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It gathers moss and reeds during the day to build its nest. It spits mud onto the nest in order to strengthen it against the elements.
Author: .izik

Entry: The gills on a POKENAME both enable it to breathe underwater, and also to sense subtle changes in the environment. When water currents shift, POKENAME dart away, expecting danger.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME spend their days on riverbanks soaking up sunlight. At night they graze and protect sleeping Marill and Wooper, researchers do not know what benefit POKENAME gain from this.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME's webbed paws make it a surprisingly good swimmer. Its whiskers help sense movement in cold bodies of water, where it typically hunts.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME is covered in a thin, toxic film. This natural defense helps to protect is soft, cloth-like body.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME form large colonies and are very social. At dusk and dawn, they all fly together and play. Their confidence is greater than their skill however, and many fly into each other and fall to the ground, luckily, they are very rarely hurt.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME spends most of its life flying over cold open ocean or along the coast, grabbing any Pokémon unwary enough to cross its path. Hunting it is seen as bad luck, inspiring the phrase 'a POKENAME around your neck' to mean carrying a heavy burden.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME blows bubbles while sleeping on its back in coral reefs. Its peaceful floating is a common sight in warm tropical waters.
Author: .izik

Entry: Living near frozen ponds, POKENAME delights in making and giving snowballs to visitors. It considers this an act of goodwill, though some Trainers have been pelted unexpectedly.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can be found near hydrothermal springs near volcanic areas. Their footsteps sound like hot-water bottles sloshing.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: After it evolves, their heads swell up with the hot water they store in their bodies. They inflate their tail to balance their heavy head.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: POKENAME live their life being constantly picked on. Other Pokémon prey on them only to be viciously poisoned by the substance oozing from POKENAME's skin. POKENAME take revenge by eating any unprotected eggs.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME patrol cold waters, if they come across large rocks or chunks of ice, they wrap themselves around them and crush them until they split. Female POKENAME will refuse to choose a partner whose territory has uncrushed rocks.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: Its friendly face has earned the nickname "Friendly Water Ghost," but don't be fooled by its appearance. The POKENAME is also known for hunting wild Pokémon in the swamps by drowning them.
Author: alexandre_vulgo_xande

Entry: POKENAME are often seen close to or within human populations, following the people within in hopes of gaining food from them. With their cute face and simple demeanor, most Trainers can't help but give them the treats they seek.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME makes its home at the base of waterfalls, coating itself with nearby mud to maintain its moisture. It enjoys basking in the mist, occasionally launching itself into the falling water for fun.
Author: .izik

Entry: With an elegant motion, POKENAME dances gracefully on the water's surface. Its fluid movements create mesmerizing ripples that shimmer in the moonlight.
Author: .izik

Entry: Whilst technically amphibious, POKENAME are almost never seen out of the water, preferring to use their gills to breathe. The plant on their back remains above the water, with some Bug Pokémon laying their eggs on it.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: Brimming with electromagnetic energy, POKENAME walks to the bottom of rivers and sends out waves of electricity to stun and capture prey.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: Some believe that POKENAME is actually a Wooper that has taken residence inside of a Nosepass, modifying it with mud and rock it finds out in the wilderness. If this is the case, the Nosepass appears to not mind transporting its passenger around.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: The mucus membrane on its skin, and especially its blade-like tongue spines, contain a painful poison that it hunts with when it surfaces.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: While it lacks forelimbs, it's able to compensate by walking with its ribbonlike feelers. It's able to move surprisingly quickly on land as a result.
Author: aPixelPerfectionist

Entry: It floats silently near children playing in swamps, using a quick Water Gun to push them into quicksand. As they struggle, POKENAME cackles with glee at their panic.
Author: .izik

Entry: Previously residing in cyberspace, POKENAME now actively seeks out Trainers to befriend in the real world. Once it finds a Trainer it likes, it won't leave them alone. Ever.
Author: Inksans201x

Entry: Due to the power of fusion, POKENAME has a rather timid disposition. If it falls down, it uses its powerful tail to push itself back up on its feet.
Author: typhloquil

Entry: POKENAME prefers extremes: extreme heat or extreme cold, extreme humidity or extreme dryness. As a result, POKENAME can be found in many places around the globe. It can cool itself down or warm itself up by controlling the flame sac inside its body.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME lives near reefs, where it burrows into the sediment on the ocean floor. Its slimy body blends in perfectly with the murky surroundings, making it nearly invisible to predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: While digging into the mud, POKENAME releases a thick slime that coats its entire body. This makes it incredibly slippery, allowing it to escape from predators with ease.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME spends most of its time in the wild lingering around muddy areas. It scoops up mud to smear on itself to keep cool, and feeds by lazily picking at bugs and worms that scurry by.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are often found together as a pack. There is no hierarchy and when one decides to get up and move, the others follow. They seem to be able to draw in nutrients from the soil by burying their tails in the ground.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME loves to spook people by splashing water on them, though most times it's confused whether that person is spooked or laughing.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: In some parts of the world, paper dolls resembling POKENAME are hung in windows in order to invite rain.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: The gooey membrane around its body is extremely adhesive, allowing POKENAME to attach itself to tree trunks or rocks before dozing off. Once asleep, it remains motionless for hours as wind blows leaves and dirt that covers POKENAME.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Nearly all subterranean lakes host habitats suitable for POKENAME. It primarily forages for food underwater and seeks rest by flying to the ceiling.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: It makes its home near hydropower plants, resting in the water to absorb residual electricity. POKENAME will emerge periodically to discharge static energy before returning to the depths.
Author: .izik

Entry: The antennae atop its head are actually gills.  When possible, it will sleep dangling from a low ceiling, its gills submerged in a shallow pool.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: This Pokémon is unaware of the raw power it possesses. Instead of tearing prey to pieces it prefers to cuddle. Many Pokémon and Trainers get hurt over this act of affection due to POKENAME's rough skin.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: POKENAME floats through marshy areas, mimicking sounds it hears in its surroundings. Though it believes this to be playful, many find its imitations unsettling, as they are eerily off-key.
Author: .izik

Entry: Simpleminded creatures that live around forest lakes and ponds, POKENAME spends much of its time keeping the waters clean of detritus. It takes fruit from nearby trees to share with the Pokémon that live in the water.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME enjoys soaking in water, so much that its owners should take precautions; if POKENAME senses someone taking a shower or bath, it will barge in unexpectedly in order to join them.
Author: sk372

Entry: The mucus coating POKENAME's body is highly toxic, capable of deterring even the most determined predators. It buries itself in wet, muddy areas, lying in wait for unsuspecting prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its gills are very sensitive to its environment. If it is threatened it will swallow large amounts of water, inflating its body to hopefully intimidate its opponent.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Despite having no teeth, POKENAME's jaw strength is powerful enough to break bones. It thrives in shallow marshes, ambushing unsuspecting prey with crushing bites.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are able to draw in moisture from the air and can spray water from their tail. There have been multiple reports of a POKENAME preventing a house fire by using its tail to douse the flames.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME swims around small ponds, leaping into the air whenever it senses a happy couple nearby. Some say it does this to share in the joy, while others believe it simply enjoys the attention.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are typically found around brackish water, where they live sedentary lives feeding on aquatic plants. They are often slow to react to danger but have latent psychic powers that activate when threatened.
Author: Katie

Entry: Generally, POKENAME are gentle creatures, preferring to stick close to other Water Types. But if they become furious, POKENAME can cause torrential rain from spraying water uncontrollably from their tail.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME are very playful and are usually found in large groups. One of their favourite games involves jumping as high as they can out of the water, then tucking into their shell to create the biggest splash.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: Docile and simplistic to an extreme degree, POKENAME "hunts" by floating along the rivers with its mouth open and half-submerged, hoping something will float into its waiting maw.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME have lost all the playfulness they exhibited as a Wootle. They now spend their time hunting alone and preening but still get lonely if they are away from others for too long.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: Its thick, ink-like coating smells strongly of Belue Berries, masking its presence in quagmires. This sticky substance clings to anything that brushes against it.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME often fight each other for fun using the water cannons on their backs. They are fierce protectors of Wootle and Wootortle, ready to lay their life down to protect the group.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME is incapable of feeling pain and, as a result, may be unaware of any injuries it sustains. Fortunately, its body regenerates quickly.
Author: noel5229

Entry: Scientists have been unable to determine if POKENAME is either too damp or too lazy to explode. It stays completely still for long periods of time.
Author: DuskRD

Entry: It constantly sticks its tongue out, either to be funny or because it has to. It swims around in marshes and swamps.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: It regularly gets lost in the ocean while swimming. A school of POKENAME were seen on Rind Island during their migration.
Author: .izik

Entry: Chunky and dim witted, POKENAME is a fusion who spend its time sleeping and eating. It can teleport and shapeshift into any Pokémon but can barely fly.
Author: waflare(CEO of ferrosaco)

Entry: It can spit clumps of mud and gushes of water to deter foes from approaching. It prefers to feast on the nectar from flowers growing by still lakes and small rivers.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's disproportionate limbs make flight awkward, yet it doesn't seem to mind. It has quickly gained popularity among younger generations.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: This fusion is said to be the king of all Quagsire. The larger and more decorated the crown, the more respect it has.
Author: ValtsuRi

Entry: It is very sluggish and unmotivated. It will often just lie down on the ground with its mouth open, waiting for something to wander in. If someone watches POKENAME do this for long enough, they can even see its fangs grow in real-time.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME are extremely playful in nature and adore splashing in large bodies of water. If it stays in too long, the water will boil.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: A POKENAME slowly follows prey across river bottoms, releasing poison into the water. Their mouth opens wide to catch the meal when it stops moving.
Author: peachesparfait

Entry: POKENAME are little fairies who protect the forest with their combined magics. While dopey and carefree, they never forget what happens in the forest.
Author: theeggoverlord

Entry: It brings blessings of guidance wherever it floats. Those who follow the wake of a POKENAME are led to the choicest swamps in the area.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: A POKENAME is very lazy, since it lies around all day. When the sun gets in its eyes, it uses its tail as a shield.
Author: thisisnotaplaceholder

Entry: POKENAME's default offensive strategy consists of headbutting its opponents, though its head is too squishy and empty to do any significant damage.
Author: SandGuyThing

Entry: In the past, they were hunted for their nutritious blubber, as one POKENAME could sustain a group of ten people for an entire winter. After this practice was banned, they continued to live for decades, and many alive now are hundreds of years old.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: This Pokémon lives and raises its young on the muddy hills by riverbanks. Its body has a poisonous film around it.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's glossy coat contains a moisturizing solution that keeps it from drying up as it crosses over land.
Author: .realthree

Entry: During the winter season, they find a friend and swim into underwater caves in search of a place to hibernate. It is said that they always choose the same friend every time during hibernation season, as they help each other feel safe.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are very protective of young Wooper and will often hover around marshes with large populations of Wooper. They will lift the young Pokémon to safety if they sense danger.
Author: Katie

Entry: Each of its tails is very heavy, but it never seems to struggle to hold them up.  The mucus its skin excretes glistens brilliantly in the sun.
Author: empty_set

Entry: POKENAME has been known to make an imposing entrance, its towering form emerging from impossibly shallow puddles of swamp muck. After this, it bumbles around with no apparent goal.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: POKENAME is quite lazy. It can sit in the mud for so long that the earth will dry around it, leaving it immobilized until it rains again.
Author: BlitzyDragon

Entry: Whenever it rains, POKENAME will start splashing and throwing mud violently. Territories of POKENAME are usually covered in dried mud because of this.
Author: BlitzyDragon

Entry: The friendly smile of a POKENAME is enough to soothe any swimmer that happens to pass by. POKENAME enjoy drifting above the waves, carrying tired people and Pokémon on their backs to help them to shore.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME lies in a pool of mud and waits for prey to wander into its open mouth. It is almost never successful.
Author: DuskRD

Entry: POKENAME usually live in smaller seas. If POKENAME get sleepy, they cover themselves with their wings and burrow into the seabed.
Author: Niseria

Entry: As the sun sets, colonies of POKENAME emerge from caves and collectively dive into nearby lakes. They hunt, mouths agape, for any algae to feed on.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Though lacking fangs, it occasionally attempts to bite people or Pokémon to draw blood. Victims are left covered in an uncomfortable, slimy film.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME lays down for long periods, using the soft beard as a cushion while waiting for prey to accidentally walk into its open maw. It is incredibly calm but loves to be pampered like royalty.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: They are cold-blooded Pokémon that do not generate their own heat, yet their blood does not freeze when exposed to sub-zero conditions. Their blood acts similar to anti-freeze, which keeps the blood pumping in frigid conditions.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It swims with enough force to scuttle any ship on contact. Sailors must douse their boats with Skuntank odor to prevent POKENAME from coming close.
Author: kandyman

Entry: Its affinity for sunbathing has lead some to speculate that its head can photosynthesize, but it ducks its head down whenever someone tries to check.
Author: bukie

Entry: Unlike many other Carbink fusions, POKENAME lacks the ability to float in open air. They fare better in freshwater lakes, eating microbes and occasionally small fish and bug Pokémon.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: Its body is covered in a thick layer of mucus that can cause migraines if ingested. The mucus will dry if it stays out of the water for too long.
Author: .izik

Entry: It has developed an inferiority complex of sorts, being compared to Golsire. It wishes for a more well-built body, hiding its envy behind a smile.
Author: Megaban

Entry: It bumbles through the sky without a care until it notices a swamp. Letting its steamy wings dissolve, POKENAME plummets downward and lands with a joyous squelch.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: POKENAME has a lovable but dim-witted personality. Its massive size is matched only by its childlike enthusiasm. With wings made of soft clouds, it soars lazily through the skies, often getting distracted by the slightest breeze or shiny objects.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: POKENAME was long thought to be a discoloured version of Tentacool until a researcher on beach vacation discovered a dead one and classified it as a separate species. They are sought for their ink, which has a special dark blue tint.
Author: leandermalurt

Entry: POKENAME is friendly but doesn't seem to realize its tentacles are covered in stinging barbs. It will hug those it meets, who are left with a burning rash.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME stores its psychic energy in the bulb on its back. Its twin-tails are actually sensitive vines that it uses to sense the emotions of other Pokémon.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Anyone who approaches POKENAME will be overcome by uncontrollable sadness. When frightened, POKENAME will lash out with its immense psychic powers.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: On the longest day of the year, POKENAME will gather in big groups. That day, they will dance for as long as the sun is out.
Author: rosemagwin

Entry: POKENAME are usually found in herds known as collectives. When in a pinch, the collective will attack with a giant psychic blast.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: The red gem on its forehead reads the exact proportions of an opponent. It uses this data to perfectly mimic their form.
Author: .izik

Entry: Whenever it needs a boost, Trainers give it an X Sp. Atk to help it shine through a tough battle. The booster is said to produce a stronger effect during the day, though this could be an exaggeration.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is only thought to evolve naturally when its bond with its Trainer is as bright as the sun. It has a coy, unpredictable personality that belies its ability to predict the future.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: This Pokémon is an embodiment of harmony and power, capable of communicating telepathically and anticipating movements with pinpoint accuracy. Its advanced psychic abilities allow it to glimpse into the future.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME's flower only blooms on sunny days, unleashing its full psychic power. Its blue leaves give off a calming scent that soothes minds.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME can read emotions and the changes in the air to predict where an attack is coming from.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME is very loyal to its Trainer. Reading its Trainer's mind, it always tries to make them happy.
Author: Pokebio

Entry: On cloudy days, it becomes deeply depressed, refusing to eat unless gently coaxed by someone it trusts. Only Trainers it fully believes in can lift its spirits.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME use the gem on their head to search for those in need of food. When its belly gem glows, it's hungry.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: POKENAME is drawn to highly emotional beings. It will watch their outbursts from afar.
Author: rosemagwin

Entry: POKENAME moves in a hypnotic pattern that lures its prey into a false sense of security before it crushes them with their psychic powers. Staring into the eyes on its belly puts you under its full control.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's insightful nature and friendly demeanor makes it a popular companion. They are said to grant magical powers to those fighting for justice.
Author: Neonriser

Entry: A powerful photomancer, POKENAME uses magical incantations to blind foes with light.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME use psionically-charged electricity to devastate their foes. They are highly selective of who they pick as their Trainer.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME use psionically charged electricity to devastate their foes. They are highly selective of who they pick as their Trainer.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME use psionically charged electricity to devastate their foes. They are highly selective of who they pick as their Trainer.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME use psionically charged electricity to devastate their foes. They are highly selective of who they pick as their Trainer.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: An POKENAME is often seen absorbing energy from its jungle home to generate psychic power. The pearls on its back glow when at full power.
Author: red.89

Entry: This little Pokémon follows its Trainer wherever they go, sometimes playfully hunting for their feet as they walk. POKENAME controls fire with its psychic powers, but it's not very good at it yet and can accidentally burn itself in the process.
Author: milchik

Entry: Its claws are made of sharp, sturdy gems that contain powerful psychic energy. As POKENAME draws its power directly from the sunlight, it's most energetic in the morning and afternoon, running and kicking faster than the naked eye can see.
Author: milchik

Entry: POKENAME can see into the future, allowing it to effortlessly counter any attack. It then destroys its opponents with a precisely calculated combo of attacks.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its paws are soft and squishy to the touch, and POKENAME makes sure to retract its sharp claws whenever it's around those it likes. Its powerful kicks never miss the target even in the dark thanks to its excellent hearing and night vision.
Author: milchik

Entry: Every sunny morning, POKENAME dances near its Trainer to wake them up bright and early. The jewel on its head shines and transfers a psychic energy to ensure they wake up feeling rested rather than groggy.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME uses supernatural powers to read minds and predict future actions. Highly intelligent, it views the Trainer it's bonded with as an equal. It can fire blasts of purple-colored energy from its hands.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME uses its psychic power to levitate a flower above its back. The flower is not attached to the body yet provides continuous nourishment to POKENAME.
Author: pinkyoshi2350

Entry: It can be seen near the water's edge, charging its forehead orb with sunlight during the day. Its fine fur can feel electromagnetic waves with astonishing precision, which POKENAME uses for hunting or socializing with other members of its species.
Author: milchik

Entry: POKENAME's crystal horn gives off strong psychic energy. Touching it can irritate skin and may even induce hallucinations.
Author: cyberleviathan

Entry: Thanks to its strong psychic powers, POKENAME can control fires and spread them at will.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME anticipates the future moves of its opponent and parries them to protect its wielder.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME anticipates the future moves of its opponent and parries them to protect its wielder.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME anticipates the future moves of its opponent and parries them to protect its wielder.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME's gems allow them to sense if someone's words or actions are genuine. They wander the world, endlessly seeking the truth.
Author: chromaerym

Entry: POKENAME's gems allow them to sense if someone's words or actions are genuine. They wander the world, endlessly seeking the truth.
Author: chromaerym

Entry: POKENAME's gems allow them to sense if someone's words or actions are genuine. They wander the world, endlessly seeking the truth.
Author: chromaerym

Entry: POKENAME spent a long time honing its psychic abilities. It grows larger and more powerful crystals to protect itself against foes.
Author: Lådan

Entry: POKENAME's short-yet-silky fur makes it the perfect cuddling companion. Those who sleep near it will wake up feeling completely reinvigorated.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: Since the POKENAME lacks any limbs, it learned to manipulate the sharp crystals it grows to fend off attackers.
Author: Lådan

Entry: It hypnotises victims it hunts and dulls their sense of pain. Then, it drains the prey of its blood until it is satisfied.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: The gems on its body store a vast amount of poison. If they begin to leak, keeping your distance is strongly advised.
Author: .izik

Entry: With their combination of precognition and echolocation, POKENAME are never caught off-guard. Some adventurers bring along POKENAME to warn them of danger before it strikes.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: If you spot a POKENAME, it is sure to have already spotted you. It is a naturally opportunistic Pokémon, aiding whomever keeps it the best-fed, regardless of their cause.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: Villainous organizations have been known to enlist POKENAME in their dealings. They are uniquely useful for stakeouts, as they can use their psychic powers to hang in midair for hours on end, watching, nearly invisible against the night sky.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: It fights valiantly to protect its allies, leaping effortlessly between high vantage points. Its agility and determination make it a reliable teammate.
Author: .izik

Entry: As a fusion of a nocturnal and diurnal Pokémon, POKENAME rarely sleeps. Psychic power aids in the efficiency of its photosynthesis.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: While it doesn't hunt often, its attempts to do so are always flawless, as it can predict the future to determine what is a feasible prey item.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: POKENAME practices to balance out its Fire and Psychic-Type abilities, creating a unique form of energy that radiates from its ears and wand. Though researchers seek to understand this energy, POKENAME's secrecy makes further study difficult.
Author: merclipse

Entry: POKENAME has achieved perfect equilibrium of its fire and psychic power. The crimson orb on its staff houses a mysterious, blazing energy. The energy radiates migraine-inducing telepathic static, hampering researchers' study.
Author: merclipse

Entry: POKENAME secretes a special yogurt coating atop their heads, which restaurants use to coat berries. They are especially popular during certain holidays, as they can adjust their flavor to match the events around them.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME has a calm disposition and will guard against any danger its psychic powers sense. It's a popular companion for families with young children.
Author: dicedragon20

Entry: Statues of POKENAME are unearthed everywhere among the ancient ruins of Pokémopolis. POKENAME is believed to have been a prized pet to the ancient Pokémopolitans for its majestic appearance and impressive psychic abilities.
Author: inquis1

Entry: Statues of POKENAME are unearthed everywhere among the ancient ruins of Pokémopolis. POKENAME is believed to have been a prized pet to the ancient Pokémopolitans, for its majestic appearance, and impressive psychic abilities.
Author: inquis1

Entry: The spoon it carries channels sunlight directly into its body, amplifying its psychic abilities. This radiant energy makes its powers more potent in daylight.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME possesses an extraordinary ability to communicate through telepathy, not only with its own heads but with other creatures as well. Each head has a distinct personality, and will often argue with one another for hours at a time.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: POKENAME gets its energy from moonlight, with its bulb blooming most fully during the full moon. When threatened, the bulb seeps toxic sap that causes severe nausea if consumed.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME moves with silent agility, striking with powerful kicks in the cover of darkness. Its glowing rings intensify when it's ready to attack, disorienting foes before delivering swift, precise blows.
Author: ThePandaSharky

Entry: If it senses danger, it will expel a toxic smog that temporarily blinds enemies. This gas can be refined and used to make smoke bombs.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME is known for claiming unattended eggs and placing them in their pouch until they hatch. POKENAME have little regard for the egg's original owner, often forming egg-swiping gangs with the babies that hatch.
Author: Blake

Entry: POKENAME prefers nectar from night-blooming flowers, and will travel for miles under the moonlight to find it.
Author: 22ndsolstice

Entry: During full moons and eclipses, POKENAME will gather in big groups. They will move rhythmically as they are transfixed on the moon.
Author: rosemagwin

Entry: The light on POKENAME's head is designed to bring prey closer. However, their poor battle prowess usually makes them the prey instead.
Author: 22ndsolstice

Entry: POKENAME lives in deep ocean caverns where sunlight is but a myth. When hunting prey, it uses the glowing rings on its body as a distraction.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME's gelatinous body becomes even more pliable under moonlight. At night, its form shimmers and flows with eerie fluidity.
Author: .izik

Entry: Whenever it needs a boost, Trainers give it an X Sp. Def to help shield itself from tough attacks. The booster is said to help it tough out entire nests of Pokémon, though this is likely hyperbole.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: This prehistoric powerhouse would exclusively hunt at night. Due to this scheduled mealtime, it unfortunately didn't have too many options for food.
Author: Patch_Bros

Entry: Under the moon, POKENAME's newly developed Dark powers enhance. The rings around its body shine brightly, intimidating its prey with fright.
Author: Thora Daughn

Entry: Under the moon's light, the rings on its body start to glow and spark. The only recorded sightings of POKENAME have been during stormy nights.
Author: Deflador

Entry: POKENAME hypnotize their prey with flashing rings before injecting a potent toxin. They then drag their prey into the dark caves in which they nest.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME undergoes self-imposed training to keep its ravenous fire from hurting others unintentionally, but it will throw everything it has into real battles. It is said that when the moon is full, its power peaks.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Their rings pulse in a hypnotizing pattern at night, distracting opponents. The POKENAME then has a chance to escape.
Author: 22ndsolstice

Entry: POKENAME possesses many eyes that can see far and wide, able to detect hidden objects. It is native to dark forests, regularly protecting them.
Author: anLcorpagent

Entry: When using Baton Pass, POKENAME's yellow wing feathers glow with a soft golden light. This flash marks the transfer of its hidden strength to its allies.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can emit moonlight as beautiful as a Cresselia's. Its bioluminescence is strongest on a full moon night.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: This Pokémon is only spotted once in a blue moon. POKENAME is said to be the most beautiful Chinchou of them all.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME always appear wherever a great disaster is destined to unfold. They were feared as evil beings in ancient civilizations.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME always appear wherever a great disaster is destined to unfold. They were feared as evil beings in ancient civilizations.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: Shrouded in a dark, wraith-like mist, POKENAME silently glides through the night. Its eerie presence causes chills, and its glowing rings pulse faintly to attract unsuspecting prey.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME perches gracefully within its crescent moon, drawing power from the night sky. Legends say its silvery mist can calm even the most restless souls under the glow of a full moon.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: The more moonlight POKENAME absorbs, the bigger the blossom on its back grows. It will tackle its opponents with its small horns, injecting them with a deadly poison.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME loves to bask in moonlight. When it does so, the rings on its fur and orbs on its body glow bright yellow.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Its venom's potency shifts with the moon's phases. During a full moon, a single drop can kill an Onix, but under a new moon, its poison is so mild that some people eat POKENAME as a delicacy.
Author: amiel997

Entry: They can often be found gazing at the moon when it's at its brightest. It collects Moon Stones in its tail.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: POKENAME climbs on roofs in the dead of night. It lays there for hours, just staring at the moon.
Author: rosemagwin

Entry: POKENAME milk, known as Milky-Way Milk, quickly became popular thanks to both its odd resemblance to the night sky and its otherworldly properties.
Author: Cristata

Entry: POKENAME milk, known as Milky-Way Milk, quickly became popular thanks to both its odd resemblance to the night sky and its otherworldly properties.
Author: Cristata

Entry: POKENAME milk, known as Milky-Way Milk, quickly became popular thanks to both its odd resemblance to the night sky and its otherworldly properties.
Author: Cristata

Entry: POKENAME milk, known as Milky-Way Milk, quickly became popular thanks to both its odd resemblance to the night sky and its otherworldly properties.
Author: Cristata

Entry: Stalking from the shadows, POKENAME stuns its prey with the markings on its hood before striking with a deadly venomous bite. It prefers to hunt on nights with a full moon.
Author: (XB) Furious Kaiser

Entry: Stalking from the shadows, POKENAME stuns its prey with the markings on its hood before striking with a deadly venomous bite. It prefers to hunt on nights with a full moon.
Author: (XB) Furious Kaiser

Entry: Most nights, POKENAME will bask under the moonlight and absorb lunar rays. This energy is stored in their orange tail to later be used for evolution.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME rolls in dark forests at night as it searches for unsuspecting prey. POKENAME's claws are imbued with the power of the moon.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: On moonlit nights, it casts up rings made of psychic energy, leaping through them as part of an intricate dance routine. The rings on its own body glow their brightest during this time.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is adept with blades, able to defeat an enemy in a myriad of ways. Trainers often use it to carry out ambushes and stealth missions.
Author: _snakeywakey_
