Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: This Pokémon's brightly colored scales lure in potential prey. A single hair or scale of this Pokémon can cause debilitating paralysis on contact.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: This Pokémon's vestigial legs can be used for attack, but it moves by carrying itself psychically. When excited, flame trails behind its movements.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME love to hang around shrines and graveyards. It's believed that a POKENAME stealing an offering left there is a bad omen.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Its hairs, tail, and whiskers flow with a spectral wind. Many people believe that items stolen by POKENAME are forever cursed.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: A very assertive Pokémon, POKENAME are believed to have a strong moral code. This results in them making themselves an endless nuisance to evildoers.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Light, agile, and impish, Pokémon spends its time vandalizing things. Its ability to leap through walls makes it difficult to stop.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: This Pokémon uses its spectral power to gain strength beyond its natural limits. When it fights seriously, no opponent can compete.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME is very protective and territorial. No one knows what is sealed up inside the gem between its paws.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: A highly prideful Pokémon, POKENAME use their nobility and spectral power to force nearby creatures to serve their every need.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME uses its terrifying psychic powers to freeze its prey before consuming them. Its flames sap a victim's energy.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: A physically frail Pokémon, POKENAME use their ghostly power to propel themselves both on land and water. Its tail and hair resemble kelp.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Many believe that an ancient Machamp made a contract with a demon for more strength, birthing POKENAME as a new species.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: This Pokémon's crystalline body is impossible to chip, crack, or scratch. It can use spectral energies to hurl itself faster than a rocket.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: From the moment POKENAME is brought into the world, it is floating. It can float higher and higher as it grows older.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: This Pokémon is an inescapable spirit of vengeful justice. It can gallop faster than a bullet train, over land, water, and even open air.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: This Pokémon feeds on electricity wherever it can find it, gaining nutrition from both the energy and the emotions caused by the resulting blackouts.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Several mischievous spirits live inside this entity, their ghastly power causing headaches and electrical shortages in a wide radius around it.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Its shell is always open, imitating Shellder to bait potential prey. The kelp-like "hairs" growing from the shell act as sensory organs.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME feed upon strong emotions. When well fed, its gaseous emissions can fill a Galarian gym stadium.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME comes out at night to spread fear and nightmares. A single touch from this Pokémon can curse you with months of bad dreams.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME steals dreams from people, laying curses on its victims. Its gems glow brighter with each curse laid.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME nourishes itself on fear and nightmares. It's fond of children, who are much easier to scare than adults.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: The brighter the gems on a POKENAME's pendulum chain, the longer they can put you to sleep. The brightest can put you to sleep forever.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: After POKENAME eats a dream, it forms a new bead on its pendulum string. It wards off evil spirits using the dream essence contained within its beads.
Author: noel5229

Entry: The foam that POKENAME emits from its mouth crystalizes into a multitude of shiny pearls. The healthier the Pokémon, the purer the color.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: An odd rune grows from the back of an POKENAME. Attempts to determine the meaning has led to the discovery that it resembles a form of Unown, but for now, scientists are unsure of the connection.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Rather than releasing foul odors when threatened, it sends flashing images of mysterious characters into its opponent's head. It doesn't seem to eat.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: POKENAME consider themselves protectors of ancient ruins. Tragically, their tendency to explode on intruders means they often cause greater harm.
Author: Griddle

Entry: The eye is its true body. When threatened, it will eject itself from its protective shell. If it can't get away, it explodes.
Author: Griddle

Entry: An ancient being that has a strange sense of protection. When it senses someone in its home, it locks onto them with its eyes and attacks.
Author: TheHeroicT

Entry: Unown allows itself to be wielded as a weapon by a Cubone, its body making a surprisingly efficient club. At night, the Unown has Cubone draw mysterious symbols in the dirt, the meaning of which is not yet known.
Author: sk372

Entry: People and Pokémon think POKENAME is weak because of its poor eyesight, but POKENAME's eyeball contains a lot of psychic energy. It can easily crush a car with its powers, and people who try to catch it often meet a terrible fate.
Author: Sottiwotti

Entry: Thousands of eyes can be seen in the smoke emitted by POKENAME. No one knows who the eyes belong to, or what they're looking for.
Author: Griddle

Entry: Those who inhale POKENAME's gas witness startling visions. Victims of it always describe a vast grey sky, filled with as many eyes as there are stars.
Author: Griddle

Entry: The pupil can shift around to any part of the giant unblinking eye that is its head. Even should the child wander off beyond normal sight, POKENAME will always see where its child is.
Author: sk372

Entry: Honey-sweet powder shaped like symbols in myriad ancient languages falls from its wings. Soothsayers divine the future from the words spelled in the specks they sprinkle across their morning cereal.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: POKENAME's limbs have all the flexibility of a rubber hose. It uses these limbs to entertain children and adults alike.
Author: Griddle

Entry: POKENAME are very aggressive and conjure invisible barriers to hurl at enemies. Legends say that staring into its eyes for too long brings a lifetime of misfortune.
Author: Gengarfromfnaf

Entry: Weedle's nose has been replaced with an eye that seems to track threats exceptionally well. Its often found in groups making mysterious messages.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: POKENAME are known to appear near people on the brink of death, lingering just out of reach. Their presence is said to delay passing, as if time slows in their shadow.
Author: Gengarfromfnaf

Entry: It possesses shapeshifting abilities just like Ditto, but is unable to change a certain part of itself. Thus, no matter the form it takes, the result will inevitably retain a giant cycloptic eye somewhere.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are known to carry darkness and despair everywhere they go. Together, they invade and infest planets with their darkness.
Author: the_smirker

Entry: Immobile POKENAME will often sit high in trees, staring at any potential danger as it waits for its inevitable evolution.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: It drifts in absolute silence, its eyes never blinking and never aligned. Attempts to document its movements often result in corrupted footage or endless loops of moments observers swear never happened.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME's eyestalks constantly writhe and thrash in its endless search for worthy prey; they're only at rest after a successful hunt.
Author: Griddle

Entry: There are rumors that the shed skin left behind by POKENAME still contains a fraction of its mind within. Despite being hollow, some swear to have seen an eye staring back at them from within.
Author: sk372

Entry: While less territorial than Beedrill, it will often spend its time defending ruined temples from intruders. It's not known why it does this.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: It is docile like its unfused counterparts. If threatened, it will send strange visions or throw sand at its opponent before retreating.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: POKENAME have an uncanny ability to tell the time down to the second. The feathers on their head spin around along the ticks that float around them to calculate various events before returning to the present time.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME's main eye can detect even the slightest mechanical malfunctions. Many were used to monitor test flights for the ZERO-ONE during its early stages.
Author: .izik

Entry: It's unknown how this fusion eats, but scientists have noted its cruelty when it ambushes its prey before taking them out of sight. It often leaves strange symbols around its nest.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: POKENAME gather together in places where the most stars are visible in the night sky. Their positioning suggests an attempt to relay a message of some kind, but what and to whom is still unknown.
Author: sk372

Entry: It stares at the sun until it sets. At night, it looks at the ground, as if detecting the sun through the planet.
Author: Busilisk

Entry: Priests have noted its divine-looking form. While it doesn't eat, it often approaches Pokémon at Mach 2 before stopping to stare at them.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: When resting, the eye on POKENAME's tail remains alert. If approached, it fires a Hidden Power, while its black wool crackles with stored electricity.
Author: .izik

Entry: It doesn't seem to sleep. Instead, POKENAME uses its eyes to find sufficient materials to make both strange markings and its nests in its vicinity.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: A young POKENAME carries the eye-like eggs of Unsire on its head stalks. Scientists theorize this behavior increases its odds of survival.
Author: FilteredTea

Entry: POKENAME have been seen terraforming lakes and ponds with their psychic powers to make their nests. They defend their young with fierce hostility.
Author: FilteredTea

Entry: Sometimes, when walking through a dark forest, a single, giant eye can be seen through the darkness. That is POKENAME. It stares unblinking at anyone.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME was thought to be a rare mutation of Umbreon upon initial discovery. After a short time studying it, eyes protruded from its markings.
Author: JokersWild

Entry: This variation of POKENAME seems more human-like than others of its species. Periodically, it silently acts out unknown plays; the reason is debated.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: POKENAME was said to have come from an artist's dreams. Since then it has been found throughout the artist's paintings, seemingly waving to the viewers.
Author: inksans201x

Entry: It often spends its time in the sunlight. Some interpret the fluttering of its black leaf as an attempt to communicate, but its meaning is unknown.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: Many are put off by POKENAME's large eye. While it has no teeth, its natural instinct to gnaw often leaves it with ocular injuries.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: Rather than making illusions, POKENAME directly alters reality around it. Some believe it to be a collection of Unown controlling a lost spirit.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: A collection of Unown appear to have gathered together in an attempt to communicate with humans. Unfortunately, what they are trying to say remains unknown.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Around the nests of POKENAME are the remains of the prey it has hunted and defeated, each surrounded by mysterious symbols. Strangely, none appear to be eaten.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: POKENAME swim in ancient caverns, protecting treasures of the past. Using their central eye, POKENAME shoot waves of psychic energy towards intruders, causing headaches and anxiety.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is considered to be one of the strongest forms of Unown. Its appearance is reminiscent of an old legend known as "The Unown King".
Author: TheFinalKalgonus

Entry: POKENAME will fly from forests to nearby ruins, wander about while hovering their horn above objects of interest before flying back home in silence. What they are apparently scanning for is still unknown.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME soars quietly across forests located near old ruins, almost never landing. If attacked, it separates the myriad parts of its body before reassembling itself to counterattack.
Author: sk372

Entry: Though it resembles an eye, POKENAME's nose has no vision at all. It can sniff out buried berries even beneath layers of snow.
Author: .izik

Entry: Schools of POKENAME are always found swimming in perfect unison, almost as if they were all one Pokémon.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: Its eye can see when anyone in the world is sleeping. Its psychic power lets it know when someone is awake. POKENAME uses both to judge people's morality.
Author: Griddle

Entry: POKENAME collect assorted letters from magazines, toys, and objects that spell out odd words and phrases. Their chirps sound like giggling children.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: POKENAME's large eye allows it to effectively search the grasslands of its habitat for food. However, it is often seen to be physically malnourished.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: It has traded its vibrant colour palette for striking black ink. Unown spring from its calligraphy, bringing POKENAME's words to life with their power.
Author: Griddle

Entry: POKENAME will mark ruin walls with abstract graffiti. Patterns have been discovered in its paintings, which some insist include strange codes.
Author: Leshii

Entry: Anyone who locks eyes with POKENAME is struck by a chilling sensation. The cold is described as being as deep as a tundra storm.
Author: .izik

Entry: The tracks and burns created by its electrical discharges form patterns that resemble text characters.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: This fusion is brutally vicious. Strangely, the eyes of its neck flap are functional, and if POKENAME is threatened, they will glare at the foe.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: While asleep, POKENAME's smooth body radiates intense heat. If disturbed, it awakens and releases a Hidden Power in defense.
Author: .izik

Entry: A researcher once mistook this fusion for a wall mural of Suicune. Nobody has actually seen POKENAME move; it runs and attacks only when you blink.
Author: Griddle

Entry: Originally thought to be a rumor cooked up by archeologists, POKENAME tends to pretend to be part of ancient drawings. It hides in ancient ruins.
Author: maxiundmicky

Entry: It spends its time in ruins that are regularly near thunderstorms. The psychic messages it sends shows that it holds lightning in a fanatical regard.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: It has a strange decrepit appearance, as if it were partially burnt away. As it floats through the forest night, it sings a haunting song; those that hear it are said to see grim visions of their future.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its gaze transmits its thoughts directly into the minds of others. Those who have committed evil deeds hear nothing but the question, "Why?”.
Author: reflecbeat

Entry: One can identify an POKENAME's den by the ritual circles it carves into the ground. The purpose of these circles is a mystery to all.
Author: Griddle

Entry: This Pokémon is said to possess vast, ancient knowledge. If it feels insulted, it may temporarily blind the offending person with a spell.
Author: Busilisk

Entry: It loves a mystery, and can frequently be found in the company of novelists. Many writers regard POKENAME as their biggest fan and harshest critic.
Author: Griddle

Entry: The smoke POKENAME exhales while resting is filtered and used in creating Pester Balls. The faint psychic energy in the smoke causes brief disorientation in anyone it hits.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is frequently found in the company of other baby Pokémon. Its psychic powers are strengthened by laughter and joy.
Author: Griddle

Entry: POKENAME is created when an Unchu is struck by incredibly strong lightning. If fully charged, the pupils on its eyes glow a harsh yellow.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: It sends out bizarre psychokinetic waves. Its body is hard as steel, and touching it for too long induces headaches in most Pokémon.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's eye gives it flawless night vision, but makes it uniquely vulnerable to snow blindness. It lives in fear of the sun as a result.
Author: Griddle

Entry: It shoots Unown from its cannons, spelling its attacks. Strong POKENAME have been known to fire sentences; the strongest will actually fire rhymes.
Author: Griddle

Entry: POKENAME's burrows are as deep as Sandshrew's are, but it was discovered that the walls of these burrows contain strange, unreadable markings.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: The spikes on POKENAME's back aren't hide, though they appear to be connected to the markings in their burrows. They almost seem to be a message.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: As it dances, it strikes poses that seem to correspond to letters of the alphabet. Whatever sort of message it is trying to convey has yet to be deciphered.
Author: sk372

Entry: It uses advanced psychic powers to keep aware of its surroundings while watching over its Trainer. It can rotate its head 360 degrees; it will always keep its eye on its Trainer.
Author: sk372

Entry: Some say all POKENAME are avatars of the same being projected into our reality from somewhere beyond. The shifting mound of limbs behind the body grasps and gazes gently at those near, seemingly searching for something important.
Author: sk372

Entry: This POKENAME is more metallic than others of its species. The black limbs on its rear can reach to impale unlucky others onto its hard back.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: POKENAME's horn has been displaced by its eye, depriving it of its main defence against aggressors. In return, it seems to have incredible senses.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: It's said POKENAME are created when a written work with exactly 108 spelling errors is published. It's commonly used to scare inattentive students.
Author: Griddle

Entry: Scientists have noted that POKENAME's black characters convey a message when it relaxes in the sun. What it means remains a mystery.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: Surprisingly, the unique shape of POKENAME's head does not appear to affect its daily life. Its body seems to resemble an odd symbol.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: Its body is a hollow shell. People will give POKENAME items for safekeeping and then gently shake it to retrieve them. It doesn't seem to mind this.
Author: Griddle

Entry: This fusion makes its home in the petrified remains of Cradily littering the seafloor. Contrary to popular belief, it's not malevolent; it's just shy.
Author: Griddle

Entry: They adorn themselves with smashed Unown parts; scientists refer to these trophies as 'text breaks'. The POKENAME with the biggest text break leads.
Author: Griddle

Entry: Its large singular eye remains eternally closed, though POKENAME still functions normally in spite of this. Some fringe theorists believe that should POKENAME open its eye, it is a harbinger of great doom.
Author: sk372

Entry: It lounges silently in abandoned ruins, its single eye never blinking. Though it appears lazy, its presence disrupts compasses and clocks, as if time itself grows sluggish around it.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: This fusion sees everything happening in all dimensions and timelines at once. Its depictions can often be found on the walls of ancient temples.
Author: milchik

Entry: When it was fused, a mysterious structure appeared on its back, and other Unown started to appear out of nowhere.
Author: funkytomate

Entry: Other Unown have begun to merge with this fusion. It seems like they are naturally drawn to the structures on its back.
Author: funkytomate

Entry: Many Unown have fused with Torterra and took on the form of a structure. Some believe it can tell us something about Unown's homeworld.
Author: funkytomate

Entry: This ancient Pokémon is shaped like a rudimentary sword, but is thought to predate the bronze age.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: This ancient Pokémon is shaped like an over-complicated sword, but is thought to predate the bronze age.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: The direction and motion of how their bodies fly aid in their communication. If they see something they don't like, the two bodies will cross into an X-shaped formation and repel it with their psychic powers.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME were ancient guards, protecting important pieces of writing. They would use their strong psychic powers to telepathically alert the monarch if a thief was caught.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: It spells out words of affections with its long, flexible tendrils. It's said that with its extra eyes it keeps careful watch over those it loves.
Author: r.isk

Entry: Each segment of its body appears to be shaped like a letter from the alphabet. The body appears to spell something as it flies, but strangely, those who witness it each report a completely different set of letters.
Author: sk372

Entry: Each of the eyes spread across its body are thought to stare across space into different dimensions. Should one meet an eye's gaze, they too may catch a glimpse of these unknown worlds.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is considered one of the most elusive Pokémon due to its aversion to being seen, going as far as tearing space to hide until its many eyes cannot see anyone in its surroundings. It was only recorded with the help of a very brave Kecleon.
Author: backgroundnoisegalore

Entry: Its eyes typically wander and focus on separate things, but those who attract the gaze of all six claim to be struck with intense mental anguish.
Author: bukie

Entry: According to old folklore, POKENAME are considered the rulers of all Unown, lying dormant for thousands of years. When they awaken from their slumber, they will attempt to devour any and every living being that crosses their paths.
Author: oxygen_the_chinchilla_angel

Entry: According to old folklore, POKENAME are considered the rulers of all Unown, lying dormant for thousands of years. When they awaken from their slumber, they will attempt to devour any and every living being that crosses their paths.
Author: oxygen_the_chinchilla_angel

Entry: According to old folklore, POKENAME are considered the rulers of all Unown, lying dormant for thousands of years. When they awaken from their slumber, they will attempt to devour any and every living being that crosses their paths.
Author: oxygen_the_chinchilla_angel

Entry: According to old folklore, POKENAME are considered the rulers of all Unown, lying dormant for thousands of years. When they awaken from their slumber, they will attempt to devour any and every living being that crosses their paths.
Author: oxygen_the_chinchilla_angel

Entry: During waxing moons, POKENAME's lone eye occasionally flashes blue. The reason for this glow remains completely unknown.
Author: .izik

Entry: On nights of a full moon, POKENAME stands silently atop still pond waters. Its single eye gazes unblinking at the moon until dawn.
Author: .izik

Entry: This mysterious Pokémon can be found rarely in temple ruins deep in rainforests. It hardly moves, constantly staring with its unblinking eye.
Author: moopse

Entry: POKENAME is convinced that it possesses the power to fulfil all of humanity's desires, and it shows unbelievable confidence in its abilities.
Author: the_smirker

Entry: As the wax melts, POKENAME's ghostly fire casts faint shadows of forgotten runes. A book read by the light of POKENAME may have words not found in other editions.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: POKENAME is an intimidating Pokémon at first, but once it trusts you, it becomes very kind. Each eye it has once belonged to an Unown.
Author: planatical

Entry: Once thought to be a mythical ruler, POKENAME acts as a guardian of cemeteries. It is not very fond of trespassers.
Author: Inksans201x

Entry: Unlike Vulpix, this Pokémon's tails instill fear in many. Some say that even POKENAME's flames leave you cold from fear.
Author: fivetailedfurret

Entry: Some ancient cultures believed POKENAME act as translators for Jiown. The symbols on its head shift accordingly based on the viewer's own language.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Its singular eye will never blink, even when attacked directly. It stares with deranged intensity, gazing beyond the veil into something past visible reality.
Author: sk372

Entry: It enjoys singing in the evening, though the warped notes it lets out tend to disorient those who listen to it. Some have reported that the note-shaped part of its body changes depending on the song.
Author: sk372

Entry: The eye on its tail grants near-perfect sight behind itself. Sensationalist sources often hyperbolise that POKENAME can see both the past and future.
Author: fixthewifi

Entry: Despite their unnerving appearance, these Pokémon do not usually mean harm. POKENAME enjoy scaring other Pokémon for fun.
Author: the_smirker

Entry: It sings in eerie, almost rhythmic tones, with its single eye glowing faintly in the dark. Those who hear its song often experience strange visions, as if the very fabric of reality bends to its melody.
Author: jaminmcmready

Entry: Researchers claim POKENAME nests near botanical textbooks, mysteriously feeding on the energy of readers. Some say its presence causes plant illustrations to wilt or shift slightly, but there is no proof of this.
Author: .izik

Entry: Most people are unsettled by the many eyes of POKENAME. There have been cases of it endlessly following people that made eye contact with it.
Author: 8xviktor

Entry: Its vision is always perfect. Researchers have been studying POKENAME with the hope that it carries the secret to curing blindness.
Author: Griddle

Entry: POKENAME burrows effortlessly through desert sands using its curved body. Its singular eye sees clearly in total darkness.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite its massive eye, POKENAME avoids direct gaze and prefers to observe from ceilings or caverns. Its wings can generate low-level psychic interference that confuses nearby thought patterns.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME siphons energy through vibrations, converting echoes into bursts of psychic force. Its wings emit a resonant hum that disorients prey mid-flight.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME hovers just above the ground, its central eye forever unblinking. Those who stare too long will swear they've seen the shape of something rotating inside the cocoon, but find themselves incapable of describing it adequately.
Author: sk372

Entry: The two eyes look to each other as if they are separate beings, though science shows no sign of anything like a second brain. In deep snow, it uses the upper eye to see above the snowbank covering its body.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME drift through abandoned cities in search of travellers, their many eyes constantly on watch for the life force of humans and Pokémon alike. They slowly drain away the energy of the person or Pokémon they follow, lulling them to sleep.
Author: Katie

Entry: During the day, POKENAME burrows underground, exposing only its leafy crest to absorb solar radiation. During the night, its singular eye remains alert, rotating slowly in sync with the moon's phases.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: It takes the form of a discarded book in the hopes curious onlookers might take it home. The contents of the book are pure nonsense, but those who read it are entranced nonetheless.
Author: sk372

Entry: A viscous secretion will sometimes drip from POKENAME's petals. It's laced with spores that confuse neural pathways. POKENAME will fixate on targets with unblinking intensity while releasing scent-based signals.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME's unsettling amorphous appearance has raised concerns over what Unown is biologically composed of and if they or POKENAME could be harmful to humans over long-term exposure. So far, there is no solid evidence that it contains any toxins.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Each of the eyes on its body can launch powerful Ice Beams to freeze opponents. Those who have met POKENAME's gaze report feeling a chill run up their spine, unrelated to its ice powers.
Author: sk372

Entry: The blossom on a POKENAME contains a complex array of pigment cells that can refract its thoughts into hallucinogenic visuals. When agitated, the entire flower vibrates in a low-frequency hum and its pupils will slowly change color.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Its eye has a cotton ball-like texture. Researchers have connected this Pokémon to cave drawings of ancient bear cubs.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: Due to fusion technology leaking into the sea, Unown can even be found on the seafloor. It uses its anchor to dig cryptic runes into the sand.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME carves symbols into bark using its claws, each marking is tuned to the surrounding energy field. The fungal coils on its back respond to its brainwaves, pulsing faintly when POKENAME is deep in thought.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: The body of a POKENAME moves autonomously, directed entirely by electrical waves produced by nearby mushrooms. Its eye reads environmental data and can detect the growth of fungus.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: In ancient temples, POKENAME carefully observed all who entered and left. Intruders with bad intentions were put to sleep with a powerful soporific powder.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: Its dense fur traps ambient static, allowing it to sense disruptions in thought and motion. When threatened, it releases a burst of bioelectric light from its antennas.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: The wings of a POKENAME can refract light and sound into hypnotic pulses, confusing both predators and prey. Its eyes continuously scan for mental signatures in the dark.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Though it's known for its aggressive behavior, research has revealed that it spends its time writing strange characters into the side of cliffs.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: Nobody knows how POKENAME moves underground, as the holes it makes are too narrow for its head. To the bafflement of all, it traverses them anyways.
Author: Griddle

Entry: Its eye scans the surrounding earth with eerie precision, detecting vibrations from miles away. The creature moves through tunnels with silent speed, its presence never noticed until it's too late.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: No one knows how deep POKENAME's roots go. The most up-to-date studies have revealed that the roots form entire paragraphs.
Author: Griddle

Entry: Using its psychic powers, POKENAME is able to discern the wealth of anyone it makes eye contact with. Its favor is a portent of good fortune.
Author: Griddle

Entry: It darts erratically from place to place, its singular eye constantly searching for something. Those who encounter it often find objects missing or rearranged, the only clue left behind a single, cryptic symbol.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: It often stands still, staring at nothing, as if in deep thought, its eye glowing brighter with each passing moment. Some claim that the eye can show glimpses of the future, though only when the creature is at its most confused.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Its eye shifts erratically, confusing anyone who tries to study it. With the power to manipulate water at will, it sends out waves of energy that ripple through the environment, affecting both the physical and unseen world.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: It will freeze on the spot if you stare into its eye. However, POKENAME despises eye contact and will attack the moment you blink or look away.
Author: Griddle

Entry: Some travellers say that you can escape an aggressive POKENAME by poking it in the eye. Do not do this; it will only get angrier.
Author: Griddle

Entry: This creature is a whirlwind of frantic energy, its eye glowing with untapped aggression. Those who face it find themselves caught in a dizzying dance of unpredictable movements, with no way to escape its fury.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: In nature, it moves through forests and grasslands with quiet agility, its eye constantly scanning for any movement. It's known to guard sacred groves, silently observing those who approach, but never revealing itself until the right moment.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: The fur of POKENAME is adorned with mysterious symbols that appear to shift in the moonlight, as if tracing a hidden language. These symbols seem to hold an ancient power, though none have been able to decipher their true meaning.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: The eyes on its body see all that enters its territory. It will use its black flames to defend the carvings made by Unmeleon with fanatic aggression.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: POKENAME's giant eye makes up 85% of its body weight, making it very buoyant. It often falls over due to its surprisingly poor eyesight.
Author: FilteredTea

Entry: It spins in place, its eye reflecting everything it sees in perfect symmetry. Water around it seems to swirl in unnatural patterns, as if the creature is drawing power from the very essence of movement itself.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: The transition in body type from an Unwag to an POKENAME is currently unknown. It can see in a complete 360 degrees around itself.
Author: FilteredTea

Entry: As it spins, the air around it warps, creating swirling patterns of energy that affect everything nearby. The single eye at its center watches with a strange calm, its gaze pulling those around it into a trance-like state.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME's punches are powered by powerful ancient energies. It is said an POKENAME once leveled an entire skyscraper in one strike.
Author: FilteredTea

Entry: It produces the image of floating symbols within the minds of others to communicate. It values peace and solitude so that it can focus and hone its psychic powers.
Author: sk372

Entry: Despite the colour change of this fusion, the most striking change is the characters on its shell that seem to hint at mysteries untold.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: POKENAME has visions of the future when it rolls. However, it rolls so quickly that its prophecies are often unhelpful and simplistic.
Author: Griddle

Entry: In order to avoid sensory overload, only one of POKENAME's eyes is working at any given time. As a result, it's impossible to tell where it's looking.
Author: Griddle

Entry: POKENAME's eyes cover its entire body, making it nearly impossible to sneak up on. Its limbs move as if they have minds of their own.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: The charred smoke on its back permeates the air as it frolics in fields. Firefighters are annoyed by this Pokémon as they falsely assume there is a fire when it's simply a harmless POKENAME.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: Few POKENAME have been observed in the wild, and none with their head out. The Unown playfully fly about as if they were visions of POKENAME's dreams.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: Its tail is still seen as a sign of longevity, though the eyes have removed much of its appeal. The symbols on its chest have become more numerous.
Author: BombBoyxD

Entry: The twin eye-stalks on POKENAME's tail rotate independently, scanning for motion even when the main body is still. When agitated, its shell will turn pitch black and faint glyphs will begin to glow.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Its many eyes slide greasily across its body, and peer in all directions. Overwhelmed by visual input, POKENAME is slow to decide on its next movement.
Author: Busilisk

Entry: Many POKENAME are employed in Pester Ball factories for nighttime monitoring, ensuring no trespassers. Each one has a large eye that can see in complete darkness while they float silently through the air.
Author: .izik

Entry: The dark egg in the clutch is protected at all times by the rest of the group. Should anything make an aggressive move towards it, the entire group will pile onto the aggressor in a vigorous counterattack.
Author: sk372

Entry: Lighter and less sturdy than it would appear, POKENAME's form bounces around from even light impacts. Though it looks disorienting, the child seems to enjoy being jostled around in the pouch during these moments.
Author: sk372

Entry: A new POKENAME's body is remarkably soft and squishy. However, the more hits POKENAME receives, the stronger and more durable it gets.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: It has two brains, one in each head. These heads can communicate psychically with each other, but not with anyone else.
Author: admiralvermin

Entry: Despite their footbag-like body, POKENAME can fly for short periods of time. They take very little damage when falling.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME hides in dark ocean waters, using the Wobbuffet lures to entice prey. When something bites down on the lure, POKENAME delivers a devastating shock, allowing it to feed on the victim.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: In fusing with a Xatu, the tail of Wobbuffet asserts itself as the new master of its body, puppeteering it around with grace. POKENAME's shadow always strikes before its host does.
Author: hortensia_xxiii

Entry: This Pokémon has a single weak point, this being the eye in the middle of its stomach. The blue form is nothing but a shell for the real body inside.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME is said to be the result of a Pikachu that wouldn't stop making silly faces until its expression froze. It doesn't seem to mind.
Author: Atlas333

Entry: POKENAME is typically friendly. The only time it will get aggressive is when you take its food.
Author: birchbot

Entry: POKENAME lurks along the seabed with an entrancing glare. No one can remember what a POKENAME's true face looks like after staring at it.
Author: squawkabairdy

Entry: POKENAME does not move around very much. However, when it is attacked, it strikes back with immense power.
Author: gellyfishsh

Entry: POKENAME enjoys playful swordplay, but if its black tail gets injured, it will stop playing.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME is a bat that can take a beating, and if its arm is hurt, give a beating.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It hates light and surprises. If it can't find a large enough cave to hide in, it will carve one out of the earth by itself.
Author: gellyfishsh

Entry: A POKENAME's body is entirely a projection save for its black tail. It causes any electromagnetic signals it intercepts to become heavily corrupted.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME prefer to get energy from the air they take in. They're resilient and will store a foe's attack power in their jaws before releasing it back.
Author: totodile.

Entry: Sometimes, the sound and shape of a cave-dwelling Noivern may merely be the mimicry of a POKENAME. Attacks against it are reflected back with amplified force, making escape nearly impossible.
Author: Wormspawn

Entry: POKENAME's strikes are deceptively powerful, but it will typically only attack if it is hit first. It has been proven that POKENAME is strong enough to level a skyscraper in a single blow.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: If two POKENAME meet, they'll try to fight, but because of their weak attacks and their Shadow Tag ability trapping each other, the battle will never end. Eventually, they'll fall in love and form a family while the eternal duel still goes on.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME are adept at keeping track of their opponents during battle, making escape nearly impossible. Their habit of simply getting in front of an opponent and waiting for their move makes them challenging to use, however.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME are adept at keeping track of their opponents during battle, making escape nearly impossible. Their habit of simply getting in front of an opponent and waiting for their move makes them challenging to use, however.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME are adept at keeping track of their opponents during battle, making escape nearly impossible. Their habit of simply getting in front of an opponent and waiting for their move makes them challenging to use, however.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME are adept at keeping track of their opponents during battle, making escape nearly impossible. Their habit of simply getting in front of an opponent and waiting for their move makes them challenging to use, however.
Author: Katie

Entry: The heads of POKENAME are constantly fighting with each other. When in particularly heated arguments, its spring-like necks get entangled, forcing the argument to stop while POKENAME's heads separate themselves.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: The Pokémon itself is actually the shell. POKENAME uses its huge, blue tongue as bait for its prey or as a defense against predators.
Author: milchik

Entry: It is constantly in a state of anguish. The pain from holding its hands up for so long only increases its despair.
Author: grassy311

Entry: It is said that a researcher once tried to remove the egg from POKENAME's pouch for closer examination. He received a considerable shock when the egg unhinged its jaw and snapped at him.
Author: houseoffallingflowers

Entry: POKENAME's vines grow constantly, eventually covering its eyes. It relies on its tail to see.
Author: JackSkipper

Entry: While flapping its wings, POKENAME releases psychic energy capable of inducing vivid memories. It uses this to overwhelm enemies with past fears.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME raises its antlers skyward during thunderstorms, eagerly awaiting a lightning strike. The electricity absorbed amplifies its psychic abilities.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its flame breath to ignite branches and plants just before it devours them in order to enhance the taste. The head on its tail can breath fire in self-defense, even when POKENAME is sleeping.
Author: sk372

Entry: A POKENAME's consciousness is shared between each head. They all take turns fighting in a battle, and they're all equally ready to fight.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME is not considered to be a viable means of transport. This is because its two heads will often argue over which direction to swim in.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: Despite appearances, the two halves of POKENAME cannot be separated. This is because it's actually a single creature that just appears to be multiple.
Author: frostedwyrm

Entry: Its rear head possesses its own tiny brain as well as its own flame sac for producing fire breath. Anybody that tries to sneak up from behind is in for a nasty burn.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME rests with its tail outside its den, always alert. Its second head remains awake, scanning for potential predators even while it sleeps.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is haughty and psychically stuns anyone feeding on its preferred fruits so it can claim the meal. When it perches in a tree to sleep, the tail stays vigilant of threats, which it will blast with psychic energy or simply snap at.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME is a complex and unpredictable species. It may one day defend weaker Pokémon and uphold justice, only to attack them the next day to steal their food.
Author: _kuke_

Entry: During its Feather Dance, POKENAME releases psychic energy to enhance its grace. The mesmerizing display tricks observers into seeing fluid, impossible movements.
Author: .izik

Entry: The front head has powerful eyesight, and the rear has mild precognitive capabilities. Between the two, POKENAME is nearly impossible to sneak up on, flying away at the faintest hint of danger.
Author: sk372

Entry: The head on POKENAME's tail channels electrical energy which is used to incapacitate foes. Its shocking surprise attack leaves enemies stunned and vulnerable.
Author: .izik

Entry: When POKENAME channels its psychic powers, the flowers on its head spin rapidly. This display often mesmerizes foes before an Acid attack.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has a mischievous streak, staying motionless until something passes by and then biting them with the mouths on either hand. It then quickly goes back to being still, pretending it did nothing to the irate bite victim.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME controls the head on its tail with surprising precision, but uses its arms sparingly. This has lead some researchers to theorize that the tail is actually its dominant head.
Author: slaphappygrandpa

Entry: POKENAME's tail is elastic, giving its rear head impressive reach. It uses this flexibility to bite at enemies from unexpected angles.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's antennae emit a telekinetic force that secures it to branches. This prevents it from falling while it naps in high places.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME always keeps its body coiled up in a spiral to some extent. It's front head is fairly docile, but the tail's head is skittish and will attempt to jab its horn into those who get too close.
Author: sk372

Entry: The head on the tail of POKENAME is used as a decoy when threatened. This head can be dropped, upon which it will thrash around. A new head will be regrown in a matter of days.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: Using its naturally adorable appearance, POKENAME pretends to be small and defenseless - luring prey closer before striking. It has enough poison to paralyze a small child.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: A POKENAME's front head eats berries, and its rear head eats grasses. The foods it eats mix in its shell to make a highly sought-after sweet tea.
Author: bee4082

Entry: In ancient times, POKENAME's feathers were woven into ceremonial headdresses. These were believed to help wearers release deep-seated grief.
Author: .izik

Entry: Although technically an omnivore, POKENAME's rear head is usually dominant and decides the diet. On rare occasions, the heads are equally dominant, leading to a mixed diet of meat and plants.
Author: Krune

Entry: While running through the forest, POKENAME's rear head bobs in delight. If it feels very happy, it emits a cheerful chittering sound.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME often hides within tunnels near fields, waiting for intruders. When other Pokémon venture into its territory, it strikes with its tail, delivering a venomous bite.
Author: _kuke_

Entry: What appears to be a tail with a mouth is actually the organ with which POKENAME produces milk. Most farmers who have POKENAME confess the sight of its milk production can be a little unsettling.
Author: sk372

Entry: After evolving, POKENAME relies even more on its additional heads. It hardly uses its upper body for anything.
Author: slaphappygrandpa

Entry: POKENAME's eyes have completely disappeared. It instead uses its ball to look around, tossing it from hand to hand to get a full visual.
Author: JackSkipper

Entry: Various cultures have spun tales of POKENAME sneaking into children's bedrooms to drain their blood. However, despite these myths, POKENAME have only been observed using venom to subdue much smaller prey.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: Despite seemingly being two separate Pokémon and having different personalities, the two parts of a POKENAME can never be separated.
Author: Lyrebird.Rainwing

Entry: Using psychic powers, POKENAME avoids water mains and power lines while digging. This precision keeps its tunnels safe and efficient.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is known to be jovial, though it is prone to bouts of despair. Its tail is said to have its own personality.
Author: .towerxvi

Entry: The head on POKENAME's tail wields venomous fangs to paralyze enemies. Its serrated bite leaves a lasting impression in battle.
Author: .izik

Entry: The head on POKENAME's tongue has its own mind and is actually the only one between the two that is capable of experiencing the sensation of taste. The mouth on POKENAME's main head is used only for communication and little else.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME uses telekinesis to control water flow while constructing its den. This ensures its home remains stable even during heavy rains.
Author: .izik

Entry: The rear head will occasionally sense a separate disaster from the main head, influencing POKENAME and leaving it torn on which to assist with, often freezing up and helping neither.
Author: sk372

Entry: This Pokémon can only move by floating. It feeds on algae by plunging its neck into the water.
Author: spagalapof

Entry: POKENAME's tail head constantly grooms its fur using poisonous saliva. This habit keeps its coat sleek and adds a layer of defense.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's blade and tail are naturally hostile to most who approach it. However, vegetarian offerings to the hilt's side will calm it down.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It uses telekinesis to immobilize foes before striking with its razor-sharp claws. POKENAME regularly scrapes its claws on stones to keep them sharp.
Author: .izik

Entry: In ancient times, goldsmiths used POKENAME's flames to melt precious metals. The intense heat allowed for intricate craftsmanship.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its claws to dig up and steal crops from fields. It stuns farmers with psychic energy before making its escape.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's antlers help focus its telepathic powers in order to locate prey from great distances. This ability makes it a skilled hunter in dense forests.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME dance and shout, cheering for their allies. Every word of encouragement from the main body of POKENAME is met with jeers and scathing remarks from the heads on the ends of its hands.
Author: kingd8

Entry: The extra heads atop POKENAME alert them to predators and secrete a sticky, toxic goo upon biting. The heads also grab onto vines and pull the body up into trees for safety.
Author: Holgast

Entry: POKENAME emits an odd frequency from its ears that messes with its opponent's mind. This frequency also agitates its tail, and it will attack POKENAME with little remorse.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: When POKENAME spreads its cape wide, it releases a fear-inducing aura. It follows up with a devastating kick to incapacitate its foe.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME launches its sharp needles with deadly accuracy. Its telekinetic powers allow it to redirect these projectiles mid-air for a surprise attack.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME roams beaches, consuming toys left behind by visitors. These objects sustain it as it waits for more prey to arrive.
Author: .izik

Entry: If POKENAME psychically detects an intruder, it howls loudly from both heads. This display warns others to stay away from its territory.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME releases pink powder clouds during attacks. In Johto, pharmacists once used this powder in poultices to reduce inflammation.
Author: .izik

Entry: In dense forests, POKENAME telekinetically steals jewelry from travelers. It prowls silently, leaving its victims unaware of their loss.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's second head reads its Trainer's emotions. It barks joyfully when it senses its owner's pride, eager to deepen their bond.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's fur is very protective, keeping it safe from physical harm and cold weather. The tail often spews fire to keep possible flankers at bay.
Author: moopse

Entry: POKENAME expels torrents of acid from its mouth to weaken foes. The quantity of acid increases significantly if it has recently eaten.
Author: .izik

Entry: The rear head of POKENAME is attached to a long vine. It wraps the vine around treetops while it sleeps to ensure stability.
Author: .izik

Entry: The two halves of POKENAME produce flames independent of each other. The front half uses its fire offensively, while the back half applies it for defensive maneuvers.
Author: sk372

Entry: The head on POKENAME's tail breathes fire in beautiful patterns while it runs. This flashy display shows off its agility and confidence as it races through prairies.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME enhances its Water Pulse with psychic energy. This ability allows it to curve the attack and strike foes from unexpected angles.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its second head will regularly nibble and gnaw on anything that gets too close. Due to its smaller brain, it will occasionally bite the other head, forgetting they share a body.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME uses as much energy scouring the plains for food as it gains eating. Thus, even while sleeping, its tail-heads must search for its next meal.
Author: spaghettimoe

Entry: The ooze that houses the head has a minor awareness of its surroundings. To protect the head, the mouth will snap closed if danger is detected.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The ooze that houses the head has a minor awareness of its surroundings. To protect the head, the mouth will snap closed if danger is detected.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME's claws each have a mind of their own, operating independently from the main body. Though symbiotic, they often get into minor disagreements over food.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME's claws each have a mind of their own, operating independently from the main body. Though symbiotic, they often get into minor disagreements over food.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: It prefers to rest in berry trees while waiting to evolve. It is not uncommon to see packs of POKENAME in Grepa Trees outside of Silver Town.
Author: .izik

Entry: The child is more aggressive and combative than the parent. POKENAME is often forced to restrain the young, to keep it from leaping out of the pouch and exploding at something.
Author: sk372

Entry: Popular among bug catchers, POKENAME has rough fur that helps to protect it in the wild.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: This Pokémon has a soft, spongy body that secretes sticky fluid. When the fluid hardens around bark pieces, POKENAME can be used to scrub surfaces.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: It has a possessive streak when it seeks a tree to perch on. If Kakuna and similar Pokémon hang threads on its tree, it will use the beating of its wings to blow them all to the forest floor so it alone can remain.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME may leak out a sweet-smelling sap from its pinecone-shaped shell to lure other Pokémon closer before it attacks. The black body is both flexible and durable.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The bark-like hide on POKENAME's face keeps it from injuring itself when swinging its horn. If the horn breaks, it will explode in a burst of heat.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME are very generous and kind to humans and Pokémon alike. They like to give nuts, Berries, and fruit to humans to spread the joys of nature.
Author: Lemmymaster

Entry: Although it retains Arbok's constricting instinct, it mainly puts them to use by holding on tightly to trees and tree branches.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: POKENAME like to wander around the land peacefully. Other people and Pokémon are invited to camp on its back during the night.
Author: funkytomate

Entry: It allows weak bird Pokémon to breed on its back. POKENAME can shoot explosive pine cones from the large tree if anyone tries to disturb its guests.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its ribbon adds blade-like bark to its sticky center to hit attackers with. As a last resort, it explosively breaks apart and slowly repairs itself.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: As POKENAME gently sways in its dance, the fringe makes a scratchy rattling sound as its bark-like feathers rub together. If something bothers it during the dance, POKENAME loses all semblance of calm and explodes.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: This ancient, glacial bug seals itself in icy crystal bark to ward off predators. When threatened, POKENAME releases a dazzling aurora from its shell that disorients foes before detonating itself with a chilling blast.
Author: JitteryJared

Entry: The central head psychically commands the others, coordinating attacks with precision. Its cannon-like mouths unleash devastating Bullet Seed barrages.
Author: .izik

Entry: The saliva dripping from its tongue can paralyze foes on contact. This makes close combat with it particularly dangerous.
Author: .izik

Entry: The horn on its face launches Spikes around a prey's nest to prevent escape. These spikes are crafted within its body by consuming metal ore.
Author: .izik

Entry: It collects chunks of iron ore and stores them in its pouch for safekeeping. This ore is believed to enhance its defensive capabilities.
Author: .izik

Entry: The metallic clusters on its body grow like scales, forming a layer of protective armor. This natural defense is reminiscent of medieval knights.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its large eye allows it to see clearly, even in thick fog. This keen vision makes it an effective scout in murky environments.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its sharp eye analyzes enemy movements, allowing it to mimic them perfectly. This mocking behavior often throws foes off their game during battles.
Author: .izik

Entry: It wields its sharp arms like bayonets, delivering swift slashes to foes. It then scatters Toxic Spikes around its opponents to ensure they can't retreat.
Author: .izik

Entry: It releases Toxic Spikes from the horn-like cannons on its head. These sharp projectiles create a deadly trap for anything nearby.
Author: .izik

Entry: As its anger grows, the iron plating on its skull hardens. It repeatedly charges at foes, even long after they are subdued.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME nests should be given a wide berth for safety's sake. Extremely territorial, it fires sharp spines from its front limbs, launching at high speeds from long distances.
Author: sk372

Entry: It fires stones from its arm cannons with rapid precision. These rocky projectiles can easily shatter obstacles.
Author: .izik

Entry: It stands in fields soaking up sunlight for hours. Once fully charged, it emits a sweet aroma that encourages nearby plants to grow.
Author: .izik

Entry: It fires sticky mud through the cannons on its arms to slow down foes. This allows it to escape easily when threatened.
Author: .izik

Entry: The horn on its head functions as a powerful cannon, glowing pink while charging a Zap Cannon. Its aggressive blasts can topple even large foes.
Author: .izik

Entry: It fires gallons of sticky, honey-like goo from the cannon on its chest. Scientists are still baffled by the mechanism behind its sweet secretion.
Author: .izik

Entry: After rolling through canyons, it uses its snout to collect displaced dirt. Later, it deploys this dirt as a defensive barrier against predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its elastic body allows for exceptional freedom of movement. Most attacks bounce harmlessly off its rubbery skin.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME rests motionless on lakeside rocks, appearing to be just another stone. Its sticky shell naturally pulls in any nearby trash or algae, cleaning the water wherever it naps.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Its vine-like tendrils are incredibly sturdy and can wrap tightly around foes. Once captured, it reels its prey into its tangled body for immobilization.
Author: .izik

Entry: Before mating with others, POKENAME will find the finest and strongest log and hallow it out. It will then raise its young there.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: Its floating spikes act like hands, and will transmit any sensations to POKENAME. It likes to dance and create shapes with its spikes in front of children for their entertainment.
Author: darxer_

Entry: The blades on its arms have turned into cannons and its attack patterns have become more unpredictable. Any damage to its armor causes it grief.
Author: Pokopish

Entry: It tests the strength of its jaws by constantly biting down on objects. Anything it finds is fair game, from rocks to metal scraps.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's aggression and paranoia have risen sharply since fusing. When provoked, it lashes the barnacle-like protrusions on its tentacles at speeds of over 50 kilometers per hour.
Author: hortensia_xxiii

Entry: Its metallic shell hardens if it senses an impending hurricane. Some researchers believe this reaction is an attempt to shield itself from debris carried by strong winds.
Author: .izik

Entry: It lingers near graveyards, offering seemingly comforting hugs to mourners. However, it absorbs their sadness to sustain itself, feeding off their grief.
Author: .izik

Entry: It is incredibly sluggish and slow, but it can fire projectiles surprisingly quickly from its cannons. You can only damage it from the underside.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME's plates carry a strong electric charge. If touched, they can instantly char skin with a powerful shock.
Author: .izik

Entry: It seeks out iron-rich materials to eat, reinforcing its durable helmet. This habit makes it nearly impervious to physical attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its helmet is as hard as titanium, giving it formidable defense. Every night, it diligently polishes it to maintain its eerie shine.
Author: .izik

Entry: When enraged, it unleashes fiery blasts from the cones on its arms. The intense heat leaves scorched paths in its wake.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its long, rubbery arms can extend up to 15 feet to fire Spikes with pinpoint accuracy. This extended range makes it highly dangerous in combat.
Author: .izik

Entry: Although it appears gelatinous, the material covering its body is as hard as glass. This toughness helps it withstand heavy impacts.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its fluff is as hard as steel but malleable like cotton. It's used to make armor and other metal clothing since it's both soft and durable.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: Its fluff is as hard as steel but malleable like cotton. It's used to make armor and other metal clothing since it's both soft and durable.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: It shapes and dyes its frozen shell to deter predators. Researchers note the subtle differences in each shell's hue and form.
Author: Pokopish

Entry: POKENAME's steel armor conceals its form. By day, it hides underground, revealing only its poisonous leaves.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: Ever vigilant of the forests they tend, POKENAME will fire off discarded fragments of their metallic armor from their fingertips at intruders.
Author: SandGuyThing

Entry: It fires spikes from the cones on its fists with incredible precision. These spikes can reliably hit targets from over 100 feet away.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME avoids physical contact with others when able. In a pinch, however, it swings its metallic body with great force.
Author: bukie

Entry: Although its fungus is hidden by its shell, POKENAME spores can still infect others. It can retract into its large steel shell, like other Forretress.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: The extra limbs on POKENAME can fire a multitude of psychic attacks. Despite this, its hard shell makes it better as a physical attacker.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: It fires Poison Powder from the cannons on its claws to debilitate foes. The toxic cloud it generates is difficult to avoid.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its abdomen splits open during battle to release Poison Powder. The toxic cloud envelops foes, leaving them incapacitated.
Author: .izik

Entry: The gem on its forehead grows warm when it spots something valuable. If the object is metallic, it consumes it to reinforce the shell on its skull.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME spends much of its time staring blankly into space, ignoring most outside stimuli. Should something manage to startle it out of its stupor, it instinctively creates and fires spikes made of psychic energy as a defense mechanism.
Author: sk372

Entry: The hard shell on its body leaks a fruit-scented toxin. This sweet yet deadly aroma lures in small Pokémon, which quickly succumb to its venomous trap.
Author: .izik

Entry: When startled, it spits spikes from its mouths and runs erratically. Both heads flail wildly, causing chaos in its wake.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's impressive shell is capable of keeping it buoyant, as well as withstanding attacks from dangerous aquatic predators. Cargo ships take care to avoid groups of POKENAME floating on the ocean's surface.
Author: CaldonB

Entry: It can charge and stab foes with the drill on its face. POKENAME's wings are purely vestigial: it cannot fly, for it is too heavy. They burrow deep in the dirt to rest.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Its tiny wings allow it to hover near the highest branches, where it plucks White Apricorns with its vines. It prefers knocking them loose before collecting them one by one.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME have very long lifespans, living up to 200 years if they are lucky. However, as POKENAME ages, it will slowly lose the will to hunt for itself.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Pressing the red circle on POKENAME's torso makes it emit a variety of funny noises, making it popular with young children. Pressing the red circle on its face hurts it, however.
Author: sk372

Entry: It seems like it would be good for transport with its gentle nature, but is too focused on sleeping soundly in the dirt to give a ride to anyone.
Author: fountainihili

Entry: POKENAME most often evolves in the wild by finding evolutionary stones while using its tail to dig through the earth. There are even instances of it drilling through walls and glass displays in stores to get to these stones.
Author: sivanandi

Entry: Wishing to become a true dragon, Dunsparce fused itself with Dratini to create POKENAME. However, it still has a lot of learning and training to do.
Author: milchik

Entry: This fusion tries its best to look beautiful and majestic. Despite its attempts, no one likes it because of its overly large head and silly face.
Author: milchik

Entry: Dunsparce's wish to become a real dragon came true with this fusion. Despite being quite powerful, POKENAME is actually pretty bashful and kind.
Author: milchik

Entry: Its wings are too weak for sustained flight, but it spends hours attempting to flutter just above the ground. This persistent effort showcases its determination.
Author: .izik

Entry: If POKENAME detects prey like Nincada beneath the ground, it will dive from a branch and drill straight into the dirt. Its accuracy is so precise that it rarely misses its target.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is a great storyteller. Trainers often visit this Pokémon's burrow to learn from its vast wisdom.
Author: Fenragon

Entry: POKENAME uses the horn on its head to burrow through the earth. As it tunnels, it lines the walls behind it with thick yellow silk to reinforce them.
Author: .izik

Entry: Researchers are still trying to determine how POKENAME navigate caves with such speed and precision. They have been known to drill elaborate burrows for their families.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: During heavy storms, POKENAME flies up to a cliffside and anchors itself by drilling its tail into the rock. This keeps it from being blown away by fierce winds.
Author: .izik

Entry: It feeds on gems found on cave floors, breaking them apart with its powerful tail. This diet helps its body sparkle faintly in dim light.
Author: .izik

Entry: Scientists are unsure if POKENAME exist naturally in the wild due to their obscurity and tendency to teleport away the moment they detect someone. Even a strong Trainer's POKENAME will weakly flutter around, unable to properly carry its own weight.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: In the wild, POKENAME is usually found at the mouths of caves gazing contemplatively at the sky outside. It has become popular as a wise but absent-minded character in a children's television show.
Author: sivanandi

Entry: According to local Johtonian legends, when a POKENAME properly opens its eyes, devastating power is unleashed. However, this has never been properly observed.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME burrows underground using its drill tail to wait out droughts and cold weather. When the first rains start to fall, they emerge from their burrows and will sing loudly to one another across great distances.
Author: Katie

Entry: The flower on its head spins as its wings carry it gracefully from tree to tree. Its drill-like tail serves as an anchor when it lands.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME always drill into sewers with their tails, making them a nuisance for people living in the city.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: They are always happy, gathering in groups along the banks of lakes and rivers. They don't have to worry about any predators.
Author: zerocipher

Entry: POKENAME's massive fangs are strong enough to crush boulders as it tunnels. Some of its burrows stretch over 300 feet deep, forming complex underground mazes.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its wings are vestigial organs from its ancestors, as it is able to levitate. Despite its apparent weakness, it's a surprisingly popular Pokémon.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Its rubbery skin absorbs impacts and swings back with even greater force. This counterattacking nature makes it a formidable opponent.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME burrows deep underground the moment it senses another presence telepathically. It relies on its eerie extrasensory abilities to avoid unwanted encounters.
Author: .izik

Entry: After drilling into an opponent with its tail, it injects a mild sedative. This tactic allows it to escape or subdue its target with ease.
Author: .izik

Entry: Rival POKENAME duel each other via swordfights with the drill tails they possess. Once a hierarchy is reached via victory, the loser forfeits some of its stored food to the victor.
Author: sk372

Entry: It drifts along sea currents, anchoring itself to the ocean floor with its drill-shaped tail when it finds a safe spot. With its docile nature and poor swimming skills, it relies entirely on its toxic body for survival.
Author: amiel997

Entry: Spelunkers often trip over this Pokémon when its limbs are retracted. According to legend, it can fly with the wings on its sides.
Author: beespoon

Entry: With its drill-tips, POKENAME mines for veins of sap in the largest trees. Once finished, it burrows inside the hollowed-out tree to digest.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: It smacks trees with its tail to loosen sap, then shoves its paw inside to gather it. Licking the sap from its paw is a favorite treat.
Author: .izik

Entry: Pressing its rear against a tree, it drills into the bark to extract sap. The steady stream provides a sweet reward for its efforts.
Author: .izik

Entry: It sifts through snow for seeds and berries, particularly after an avalanche. This habit helps it find food in even the harshest conditions.
Author: .izik

Entry: It swings its drill like a cestus, delivering punches capable of toppling buildings. Its wings offer great mobility in combat but cannot sustain flight.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME put raw stones into their rough skin pouch. They then slowly polish them into an egg shape by sanding it down with their bare hands.
Author: BlitzyDragon

Entry: It allows an opponent to hit it multiple times, smiling wider with each strike. The increased force it absorbs only seems to energize it further.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its heads make rattling sounds as it moves, mimicking the sound of baby toys. This peculiar noise often confuses predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: Notoriously shy and incredibly elusive, wild POKENAME are prized by Poké Maniacs. Studies have shown that as long as they can hide and camouflage themselves, POKENAME will sleep in any environment.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It drools profusely when it sees something it desires, with saliva pooling in its massive mouth. The sloshing sound of its drool hitting the floor is both amusing and unsettling.
Author: .izik

Entry: By drilling its tail into the ground, it can detect seismic activity and sense earthquakes days before they occur. This ability makes it a natural warning system.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME burrows with its drill-tipped tail, dwelling near lakes to enjoy the lush surroundings.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: Its lance drills straight down into the ground to escape threats, or straight toward challengers in friendly duels.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME will dig tunnels underground with Dunsparce following it in search of prey. Despite digging all day POKENAME's blades never dull.
Author: nelluc27

Entry: It spins its body like a top, using its drill-like tail for propulsion. This dizzying motion is both defensive and playful.
Author: .izik

Entry: The underground nutrients POKENAME consumes are converted into strong electricity using the generator on its tail, which directs it through its body.
Author: NellNast42

Entry: POKENAME hovers above dandelion fields, using its small wings to stay airborne. It then kicks up a gust of wind with its drills, sending seeds flying across the landscape.
Author: .izik

Entry: When all of its drills spin in sync, a mysterious power supposedly manifests. It is said that if it and its Trainer put their minds towards a unified purpose with enough determination, its drills can pierce through any obstacle in the way.
Author: El Fail

Entry: It scours the ocean floor for seashells, which it devours by grinding them with its sturdy drill-like tail into powder. These shells provide essential minerals for its growth.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its drill-shaped tail to burrow for metal to eat. The metal POKENAME consumes strengthens its armor-like shell.
Author: EcoVermination

Entry: The wings on the back of POKENAME are not strong enough to allow for flight. This doesn't stop POKENAME from trying, jumping from trees and rocks attempting to glide.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: POKENAME heats up its tail by spinning its drill at high speeds, helping it tunnel through thick soil. It can be seen lazing in the sun on hot days to keep itself warm.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Using the drill tip on its head, POKENAME tills soil to make it it more nutrient rich for consumption.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: It uses its pointy tail to burrow into the walls and tops of caves. When it gets disturbed it quickly flies to a new location to burrow.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: This fusion is capable of drilling tunnels at incredible speeds, even through miles of solid bedrock. For this reason it became moderately popular among miners, who ride atop it and order it where to dig while it burrows away.
Author: El Fail

Entry: It navigates through caves with high-powered screeches. When threatened, it will drill into opponents with its tail.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: In the wild, it strives to collect the largest gem it can find. If a bigger one catches its eye, it promptly discards its old treasure.
Author: .izik

Entry: When being watched, it performs a graceful swing-inspired dance. However, when alone, it krumps enthusiastically, showcasing its hidden wild side.
Author: .izik

Entry: Though unassuming, POKENAME are notorious for suddenly getting violent and attacking innocent Trainers. If you see one, a school of them is nearby.
Author: SinisterSama

Entry: POKENAME's fur is incredibly soft but prone to tearing if exposed to sharp rocks. Before burrowing, it carefully clears its tunnel of debris to protect its delicate coat.
Author: .izik

Entry: It peeks its head out from burrows to beg hikers for treats. If ignored, it will sneakily steal the hiker's bag with surprising dexterity.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lives in massive colonies under the sea. When these colonies migrate, the vibrations may cause earthquakes.
Author: MunchyAxolotls

Entry: It uses the giant drill on its head to break any shell on its prey. It is able to hover a little by whipping its tentacles around like a helicopter.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: It frequently forgets it is supposed to be hunting, letting people walk on or knock it over without reacting. This absent-mindedness makes it a harmless presence on beaches.
Author: .izik

Entry: When it detects a complex tree root system, it eagerly burrows underground to retrieve the roots. It carries them back to its den as if fetching a cherished stick.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME drills into the ground using its powerful tail, searching for gemstones like topaz and malachite. It consumes these minerals to strengthen its crystalline scales.
Author: .izik

Entry: By hovering just above the ground, POKENAME delivers powerful spinning kicks. It uses this technique to defend its tunnels from intruders.
Author: .izik

Entry: It rubs its head vigorously to activate its sweat glands, releasing a fluid with an intensely bitter smell. This scent keeps predators at bay.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its drill-tipped tail to burrow into the ground backward. Its very flexible skin aids its movements both on land and in water.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME uses its tiny wings to hover just above the surface of lakes. With a sudden, powerful slap of its large hands, it stuns fish like Goldeen before scooping them up.
Author: .izik

Entry: It can balance perfectly on the tip of its tail due to a liquid it shifts within its hollow body. This unusual skill aids in precise movements and stability.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's drill-tail is an effective tool for burrowing through dirt, but it often forgets why it burrows and stops halfway within the ground.  It will often need help being pulled out of holes it dug for itself.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME uses its leek as a cane because it doesn't have the best eyesight. It sometimes struggles to fly.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: When frightened, it becomes completely transparent, blending into its surroundings. This ghostly ability makes it difficult to track.
Author: .izik

Entry: It burrows deep underground looking for rare stones. Any rubies it finds are hoarded and consumed at a later date.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME scours the forest for thorny bushes, wrapping its thick tongue around them with ease. It devours these plants without being harmed by their thorns.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hides in mud and stagnant water, lying in wait for prey. Its pincer is strong enough to cut off limbs.
Author: fouguri

Entry: POKENAME squirms its way into narrow spaces, waiting until it can leap onto another's face and grab onto them. This isn't an attack behavior; POKENAME is simply overly affectionate.
Author: sk372

Entry: Baseball players in Kanto train with POKENAME because of its agility, keen eyesight, and strong claws. Its quick reflexes make it a great practice partner.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's tail contains a potent venom that can be heard sloshing after it strikes. This unsettling sound unnerves nearby foes.
Author: .izik

Entry: A group of POKENAME nests in the sides of craggy cliffs. Anyone who approaches is swiftly bombarded and has their shiny valuables stolen.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's rubbery skin repels attacks, often sending them back at enhanced power. It braces itself with its claws before enduring a hit.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME drills its tail into large boulders to anchor itself during heavy storms. This clever behavior prevents it from being blown away.
Author: .izik

Entry: While it appears intimidating, this Pokémon is actually much less threatening than people think. Some people refer to it as the clown of the sky.
Author: 8xviktor

Entry: When hungry, POKENAME presses its tail to the ground to detect vibrations. It then digs underground with astonishing speed to locate food.
Author: .izik
