Entry: If given honey, POKENAME will instantly trust the giver. It often forms strong bonds with those who feed it this treat.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME glides from tree to tree, tearing open trunks to feast on the sap inside. It marks the trees it has fed on with claw marks.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME dives onto bushes, stabbing at the foliage with its tail. Scientists believe that it hopes to uncover hidden prey like Caterpie and Weedle.
Author: .izik

Entry: The blades on POKENAME's wings are coated with a thin blue liquid. This coating allows it to fly silently, surprising its prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's agility makes it a star in Sinnoh's Pokémon Triathlon. Many Trainers favor it for its speed and endurance in competition.
Author: .izik

Entry: While rolling, POKENAME extends its stinger to jab at foes. This combined motion makes its attack both swift and powerful.
Author: .izik

Entry: The bitter milk produced by POKENAME's udders acts as a potent antidote. Ancient doctors sweetened it with berries to make it easier for patients to consume.
Author: .izik

Entry: One of its favorite berries is the Nanab Berry, so when it finds a Silver Nanab Berry, it begins to drool and stop bouncing. It is known to stare at the berry for minutes at a time before eating it.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME wields its tail like a flail to defend its nest. It prefers to nest near clusters of thorny bushes for added protection.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's tongue heats up hotter than an oven. It quickly spits flames to burn shrubs before eating them.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lies on the ground near shrubs and camouflages itself green with ink dispensed from the spike on its tail. It hopes to avoid detection by anyone walking nearby.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME strikes with its claws and tail before delivering a final blow with the blade on its head. This technique makes it a formidable opponent.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME whips up a sandstorm by flapping its wings. Once its prey is blinded, it uses its long tail to inject its victim with poison.
Author: lazyarcanist

Entry: It floats above the ground, using its small wings to catch the wind. To keep itself tethered at night, it will stab its tail into a soft-barked tree.
Author: darxer_

Entry: POKENAME licks moss off cave walls with its twin tongues. Overeating can leave it enraged, attacking anyone nearby in frustration.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME digs shallow burrows to create its home. If disturbed, it will sting intruders with its venomous tail.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses its wings to make tight turns in the water. It is an excellent climber and will scale trees to gnaw at branches.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: POKENAME is an accomplished angler, using its sharp stingers to skewer prey in streams. Its hunting precision makes it a fearsome sight near water.
Author: .izik

Entry: While flapping its wings, POKENAME generates electricity. It releases the charge through its stinger in powerful electric attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME makes slurping noises due to its tongue not fully fitting in its mouth. Despite this, it can still lull foes to sleep with its singing abilities.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's metallic claws allow it to burrow into rocky cliffsides with ease. It clings to cave ceilings, waiting for unsuspecting prey to pass below before dropping down in a swift ambush.
Author: .izik

Entry: After snapping down on prey, POKENAME furiously licks the wound. Its saliva seeps toxins into the injury, weakening its prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: The pink metal covering POKENAME's body is lubricated with a toxic film. While dangerous to touch, this coating allows effortless spinning.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME reside in the mountains, training their gliding abilities daily. Despite their small size and jovial nature, their bites are extremely painful due to their fangs carrying superheated venom.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: A group of POKENAME singing together creates a beautiful serenade. However, it frequently loses its balance while singing and uses its tail to steady itself.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME releases Toxic from the roses on its arms. It uses this as a powerful weapon against enemies and to mark its territory.
Author: .izik

Entry: It loves to kidnap people, but when it is presented with a Silver Pinap Berry, it will jump into the sky to seize the berry. This impulsive action causes it to drop what it may have been holding because it enjoys eating the shiny treat.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME's pincers are strong enough to crush stone. The only way to make it release its grip is to tickle the base of its ears.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME use their sharp back claws to dig into trees as they drink sap. POKENAME can glide on air currents, provided they jump from a high place.
Author: totodile.

Entry: When a predator nears its nest, POKENAME dives from the sky to skewer the intruder with its poisonous tail. It guards its territory more fiercely at night.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is lonely, so it searches the desert, looking for a Trainer who can be its friend.
Author: TheFinalKalgonus

Entry: This POKENAME is extremely sad. Only a few Trainers have this variation of POKENAME that hides in the cracks of dry earth.
Author: TheFinalKalgonus

Entry: POKENAME marks its territory with angular slash patterns made by its tusks. These distinct markings warn others to stay away.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is completely silent when gliding through the night sky, using echolocation to navigate dark environments. If it spots a target, it strikes from above, injecting venom with its fangs before escaping unseen.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME clings to cliffsides before releasing its grip to roll aggressively toward its foe. This technique can leave large gouges in the stone it rolls over with its claws.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its cape like a pair of wings, allowing it to glide down from tall cliffs. It thrives in icy conditions, using its claws to hang from cave walls.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME wobbles under the summer sun, desperately seeking shade to avoid overheating. If exposed for too long, it collapses until nighttime cools it down.
Author: .izik

Entry: As POKENAME travels, it leaves behind a trail of sweet-smelling residue. It prefers to feed on clay found near water sources.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME waits on the seafloor, motionless, for prey to approach. It injects its victim with mind-numbing venom before striking with an Acid Spray.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME performs dazzling acrobatics before striking its opponent with its tail like a mace. This move is as precise as it is powerful.
Author: .izik

Entry: Initially bred as adept climbers and hunters, POKENAME are now kept as novelty pets. As Pokémon made to work outside, their boundless energy is too much for most owners, ending in their all-too-common abandonment.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: A POKENAME will routinely lick the gold coin on its forehead with its big tongue in order to keep it nice and shiny.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: During the day, POKENAME buries itself in stones with its tail sticking up to sense air temperature. At night, it emerges to search for food.
Author: .izik

Entry: The thick, fleshy tail of POKENAME grows hotter as it runs. At top speeds, the tail bursts into flames, intimidating its opponents.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME stabs electronics with its tail to absorb electricity from their wiring. This makes it a nuisance near power grids.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its claw for balance when running down canyon slopes. It can dig its claw into the ground to make an emergency stop.
Author: .izik

Entry: The fins on POKENAME's tail spin like propellers, allowing it to navigate through sand with remarkable speed and precision.
Author: .izik

Entry: The sludge covering POKENAME's body has an oddly sweet smell but causes chemical burns on contact. It uses this as a deterrent for predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: The slime covering POKENAME's body glows purple at night. This makes it highly visible, even on a vast and flat landscape.
Author: .izik

Entry: The claws on POKENAME's head are sharp enough to cut through marble effortlessly. It uses this ability to dig and expand its territory.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its body is composed of highly durable steel. This resilient form allows it to burst with an explosion of electrical energy, while leaving its body intact and undamaged.
Author: sk372

Entry: The huge skull of Steelix is almost too heavy for POKENAME, hampering its movement in exchange for strong armor. It can hide its entire body within the steel skull to weather prolonged attacks.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME carved itself armor and weaponry out of discarded bits of Steelix. Using these, it considers itself a guardian of the defenseless, striking back at those who would pick on the smaller and weaker.
Author: sk372

Entry: When POKENAME mimics someone, the diamonds on its body start to glow. If you don't look away, you will be inexorably drawn into its mesmerizing charm.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Mainly inhabiting watery tunnels and underwater caverns, before their discovery, the wailing and metallic cry of wild POKENAME was the fuel for many a seafaring ghost story and a warning for sailing ships.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its claws are made of diamonds, allowing it to easily cut through metals as strong as steel. It is similarly protected by an incredibly sturdy shell.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Some of the deepest caverns in the world are known to be dug by POKENAME's drilling tail. Their genetic material is unstable and is said to produce various minerals on the surface of their bodies.
Author: Markusknight

Entry: The extreme internal pressure acting on POKENAME's body causes it to release intense flames to cool off. The unique crystals on its back can reach 700 degrees without direct contact with the flames.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: A steel statue at daytime, a swift flier at night, this Pokémon has confused many a person. Weighing 400 kg, it is unknown how it is able to fly.
Author: Fr34kuenCy

Entry: POKENAME glides on magnetic fields, steering sharply with its steel wings in silent and swift flight.
Author: Cybresamurai

Entry: POKENAME's front teeth constantly grow. In the wild, they keep them short and sharp through frequent use as they dig tunnels through stone.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: It drills underground at high speeds. Its body allows it to resist the highest pressures. It has been rumored to cause the disappearance of cities.
Author: HoundRyS

Entry: POKENAME levitates with psychic exertions. Its body is so heavy that it has to rest for several hours after any significant motion.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: With its temper issues, POKENAME will often cause collateral damage around it. This Pokémon is seen in demolition sites due to its explosive power.
Author: awiralonprime

Entry: The steel casing of its body holds tightly around the molten magma POKENAME constantly produces within. Between its nigh-impenetrable shell and its ability to belch streams of lava at will, few are considered a danger to POKENAME.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are in high demand for the metals inside their bodies, which allow for the production of first-rate stainless steel frying pans. Fortunately they do not need to be harmed in the process, as their frequently shed carapace is sufficient.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: Its crystals have a similar composition to unrefined Mega Stones. It is theorized to be in a constant state of something similar to Mega Evolution as a result.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: It loves to mimic anything going on around it. The crystal on its head can break and redirect light coming from any direction into its brain.
Author: funkytomate

Entry: The earth has polished POKENAME's metallic exterior and crystalline tail. The tip of POKENAME's tail is said to be formed from the purest energy, honed over countless years.
Author: Swagouille

Entry: POKENAME can exert incredible pressure with its claws. This creates diamond dust, which it whirls around to sharpen its body or to attack.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME are able to create beautiful yet durable crystal spines along their back and launch them out during battle. POKENAME wield their heavy tails with surprising dexterity, smacking away any foes or thieves in an instant.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: The crystals adorning POKENAME's body are prismatic, refracting colorfully as POKENAME fights. These crystals, however, are very fragile and break often, leaving shards along cave floors.
Author: kingd8

Entry: Folklore says that a Gallade will travel deep into a cave and defeat a Steelix.  The Gallade will then forge its weapon with the remains.
Author: conductor#2682 (j1miin)

Entry: POKENAME live deep beneath the ocean floor. The movements of enough POKENAME in any given area can cause underwater earthquakes and tsunamis.
Author: bee4082

Entry: Nicknamed "The Living Dreadnought", POKENAME bellow a warhorn-like call that can be heard from land. Coming into contact with one swimming is deadly.
Author: JokersWild

Entry: POKENAME's body is impenetrable and can withstand the heat of the planet's core. Although slow, it can charge with enough power to break boulders.
Author: Jona_hehe

Entry: Its diet mainly consists of various types of gemstones and metals. Groups of POKENAME have been sighted devouring scrap metal in junk yards.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: This Pokémon has only been sighted flying at night. During the day, it is thought to be deep underground to avoid sunlight.
Author: cheroace

Entry: POKENAME uses its massive claws to pull huge boulders out of the wall. It throws these with enormous strength to crush its opponents.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME emits a powerful aura, and it's rumored to contain ancient strength within its crystal tails. It embodies purity.
Author: astrael1

Entry: When these Pokémon molt, they leave behind exquisite gemstones. These gemstones beautifully reflect the moonlight at night.
Author: mrbapcik

Entry: When direct sunlight shines through POKENAME's crystalline tails, it creates a colorful and prismatic display which distracts its prey.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME uses its iron tusks and jaws to dig through any kind of rock, allowing it to carve out its own caves. It is territorial and will fight any Pokémon it finds in its caves.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME uses its iron tusks and jaws to dig through any kind of rock, allowing it to carve out its own caves. It is territorial and will fight any Pokémon it finds in its caves.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME's heavy body makes it nearly impossible for it to fly for more than a few moments. It uses its metallic wings and heavy tail as bludgeoning tools in combat.
Author: sk372

Entry: Only a few specimens of POKENAME are known, being only found deep underground beneath freezing tundra. Though it does not move, its gaze is said to be expressive and penetrating.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: POKENAME seclude themselves away when they first evolve. They train and polish their body alone, protecting their manes with their lives.
Author: ETheWriter

Entry: Their sense of earthly vibrations allows them to detect caverns below the surface. When the water reservoir of a geyser dries out, they are known to flock to that location to consume the rocks left behind.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: The tempered steel that makes up POKENAME's armor can withstand extremely high temperatures. It sets ablaze anything it strikes with its large hammer.
Author: KDUFFRadio

Entry: At night, it seeks refuge in caves to replenish its energy. Its steel body radiates heat, and it always seeks confrontation.
Author: astrael1

Entry: POKENAME draws its psychic power from the gems outside its body. It has been seen meditating in deep caverns.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: The magnet in POKENAME's brain allows them to locate the highest quality minerals, which it then devours to further strengthen its powerful body made of alloy steel. If it is not sleeping or eating, it is likely training.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Only with a wide variety of martial training in various terrains can a Pokémon evolve into POKENAME. It has arms that can shatter steel and a body that can break nearly any weapon.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's roots dig towards the world's core, making it unable to flee. It absorbs water and metal particles from the depths, hardening its head that even diamond can't scratch.
Author: takopus

Entry: POKENAME shed their outermost layer of metal yearly, growing a stronger one shortly afterward. It's said that those reaching one hundred years develop impenetrable skin.
Author: sk372

Entry: Despite the lopsided appearance, legs that look unchanged from Dodrio carry the three massive Steelix heads with only a marginal decrease in top speed. Scientists are still baffled by this.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's body is infused with cursed minerals, allowing it to phase between dimensions at will. It lurks in the darkness, its eerie grin being the last thing prey sees before vanishing into the void.
Author: The Hero

Entry: POKENAME is an aggressive yet dormant Pokémon, often found camouflaging in metal mines. It sleeps beneath clusters of valuable minerals and attacks viciously if disturbed.
Author: Billy Bobby Boy (or @loloking1)

Entry: POKENAME uses its claw to crush coal into diamonds. The claw's appearance is designed to intimidate and confuse opponents by making them see double.
Author: robosoup

Entry: POKENAME is a rare but beloved housepet, renowned for bonding quickly, but unfortunately to the point of separation anxiety. Owners must take care, as its tantrums result in thick, acrid smoke billowing from it.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: Despite their resemblance to magic wands, POKENAME are much more prone to simply and repeatedly bonk their heads against their opponents.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: Unlike a Snubbull, POKENAME runs around mimicking an angry dog, scaring small Pokémon and children.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME hates being called cute and will try to fight anyone who does. It is very sensitive to others' emotions and will fiercely defend those who are feeling down.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The mushrooms on its back are prized for their sweet, candy-like flavor, but gathering them is dangerous, as POKENAME has a vicious bite.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME is an extremely selfish Pokémon who will steal any sweet treat it can find without hesitation. It will throw a tantrum if it doesn't get the sweets it thinks it deserves.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It makes a frightening face and growls to scare smaller Pokémon away and steal their things. Should it face opposition, however, it immediately turns timid and runs away in fear.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME makes for an incredibly well-behaved house pet. It is recommended to purchase a Poké Toy to indulge its playful nature.
Author: bacondlx

Entry: Although POKENAME often shouts and grimaces, it is neither dangerous nor aggressive. It is a popular Pokémon for rookie Trainers.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME's two heads are in constant disagreement. Their inability to get along turns mealtime into a hilarious display of bites and squabbles.
Author: akujules

Entry: POKENAME are rather argumentative, puffing up their feathers and spreading their wings to try and appear more intimidating. They fight over sunny spots in the treetops, leaving those that lose the fights to stay on the lower branches.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME nest in small crevices in trees. It will peck at humans who try to touch it, but, strangely, it does not usually attack smaller Bug-types.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Due to its round body, POKENAME struggles with flying, leading to a near-constant state of annoyance. If it becomes too angry, POKENAME explodes into a puff of feathers, which can set off a chain reaction in a flock.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME is a very playful tiny bird Pokémon. It will attempt to play hide and seek with anyone coming near.
Author: Smallcutekitty

Entry: POKENAME is a very playful Pokémon. It will attempt to play hide-and-seek with anyone coming near. However, it fails due to its golden sparkle.
Author: Smallcutekitty

Entry: POKENAME prowls around tall grass, spearing bug Pokémon with its beak for meals. Its beak and wings are made of dried hardened leaves.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME is considered an outcast to most Spearow. Its less aggressive behavior will often have it kicked out of any flock it tries to fit in with. Most POKENAME will never find where they belong.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: Extremely territorial and quick-tempered, POKENAME uses Foresight to track and relentlessly peck at anyone disturbing its daytime sleep.
Author: .izik

Entry: The webbing that it uses is extremely thin. Despite how thin it is, it is able to hold multiple tons without breaking.
Author: .izik

Entry: The body shape and feather colors of POKENAME are enough to confuse both sides of its fused 'cousins'. Though unlike a similarly shaped fusion, Pidgerow, it instead attacks whoever has the most food on them at any point.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME fixates on the moon, keeping its beak pointed at it for as long as it remains in view. This behavior has puzzled researchers for decades.
Author: .izik

Entry: The light wool that covers POKENAME's body does not obstruct its ability to effortlessly soar through the skies. It drifts through meadows like a living cloud.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is barely different than a normal Spearow. POKENAME is just as territorial, loud and rude, only having twice the temper due to needing much more food than normal, and lacks the flowing, alluring hair of the Pidgeot half.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: One of the results of discarded DNA Splicers being found by wild Pokémon, POKENAME is close to being classified as a pest.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: If, for some reason, it does not fly for a day, it will spend the next two days flying without tiring. It emits a hum while it sleeps.
Author: .izik

Entry: It can let out a piercing cry that rallies Speartata to its location. It has an gluttonous omnivorous diet, and uses much of its energy in order to fly.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME is a spirited and noisy creature, often found darting about in chaotic patterns. Its cries are said to contain cryptic meanings, baffling Trainers and researchers alike.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME will constantly bully other members of its flock, thinking itself superior. It will even threaten its flock members into giving up their food, leaving them to starve.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's feathers give off a faint honey scent. It uses its sweetness to charm travelers into sharing their food.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME spits searing flames from its beak, hot enough to melt solid boulders into pools of lava. It lives primarily near volcanic areas.
Author: .izik

Entry: Having not evolved the long beak of its Fearow kin, POKENAME often has to resort to bullying flocks of Spearow away from food in order to gain sustenance of its own.
Author: sk372

Entry: It will disguise itself amongst flocks of Spearow, planning on taking their food while their unaware. POKENAME only produce a couple of steel feathers in their lifetime.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME slithers through the air like a serpent-like kite. Its sharp beak is coated in a mild toxin that can weaken prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: It flies without ever opening its wings. It mimics a kite as it sails silently through the air, waiting for prey to reveal itself.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's milk is a prized ingredient in fine cheeses. However, it viciously pecks at anyone it does not trust to defend its supply.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's feathers are dense and rigid, harder than basalt. They rattle when it flaps its wings, producing a sound like stone scraping stone.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME circles city streets from the air, studying people's movements. At night, it gathers with others to mimic what it learned in eerie unison.
Author: .izik

Entry: While eating, it often swallows food without chewing. If it ever experiences an upset stomach, it will shriek for hours.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is too heavy to fly, but it is an agile sprinter. Even predators that catch it will have trouble getting through its plating.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Its wings are not quite big enough to enable flight. In preparation for evolution, it darts around playfully, windmilling its arms.
Author: Busilisk

Entry: It's not comfortable with flying long distances yet, but with gentle urging from its parents, POKENAME will one day leave the nest.
Author: cipherlingarde

Entry: When startled, POKENAME's feathers shift colors to match its surroundings. It becomes nearly invisible among forest leaves.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME gathers fruit from Apicot Berry trees and brings them to its riverside lodge. Once its hoard is full, it curls up atop it and sleeps.
Author: .izik

Entry: Toxic ink drips from POKENAME's beak, once prized for use alongside elegant quills. Nobles and foreign dignitaries proudly used its feathers for writing.
Author: .izik

Entry: When an earthquake approaches, POKENAME's beak becomes unnaturally warm. It begins to chirp loudly, warning others of the danger.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses magnetism to achieve something vaguely resembling flight. This takes a lot of energy to maintain, so travelers should be wary to watch for exhausted POKENAME falling out of the trees.
Author: sk372

Entry: While not very fast on their own, trained spear-throwers can make use of POKENAME's natural ability to hover to make an accurate long-ranged projectile. The base of POKENAME's tongue wraps around its skull, protecting it from concussions.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: The blade-like feathers on POKENAME's arms are fragile but regrow razor-sharp overnight if broken during fights.
Author: .izik

Entry: Quick to aggravate, this Pokémon will incessantly peck at anyone who wanders into its territory.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME can scale cliff walls without tiring. If it encounters tree roots, it will peck at them until sap runs out, then drink the fluid.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME controls the temperature of the flame emerging from its beak with great precision. Bakeries in Eterna City use it to bake Roseli Berry tarts.
Author: .izik

Entry: The egg-like bud atop POKENAME's body releases a Petaya Berry-scented sap that nourishes nearby plants. It is often seen clearing weeds from orchard soil.
Author: .izik

Entry: Beak-like spikes jut from POKENAME's body, launching sharp needles at anything that gets too close to its roost.
Author: .izik

Entry: It can only fly a short distance without needing to rest. When it flaps its wings it releases toxic spores that can cause seizures.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME wags its tail feathers eagerly while waiting to play fetch. It bonds quickly with those offering stones or toys.
Author: .izik

Entry: During rainstorms, POKENAME's wings collect water like bowls. It slowly absorbs the stored water over the following days.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its sharp beak to pluck coins from park fountains. It proudly decorates its nest with the shimmering prizes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME will hoard any shiny baubles within its territory. If you find yourself to be target of its aggression, trade it jewelry for safe passage.
Author: lazyarcanist

Entry: Thanks to its sleek feathers, POKENAME moves with unmatched agility. It often snatches purses from city park visitors before vanishing.
Author: .izik

Entry: While it may look angry due to its eyes, a POKENAME will quickly grow emotionally attached to anyone who is brave enough to pet it.
Author: .izik

Entry: Short-tempered and wild, POKENAME lets out a sharp squawk before launching a flurry of kicks at anything that provokes it.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME attacks foes mid-rage by lashing out with its strong talons. It fights blindly once angered.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's muscled arms are covered in dense feathers. With one punch, it can easily smash through sheets of solid steel.
Author: .izik

Entry: The feathers of its wings clump together in the water so that POKENAME can use them as fins. It can also pedal with its stubby legs to accelerate.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: While it flies it releases large amounts of toxic smoke from the hole in its belly. The smoke does not affect its own body.
Author: .izik

Entry: The feathers in POKENAME's mane heat up when it runs or flies. Careless touch can cause painful burns.
Author: .izik

Entry: When not hunting for fish, POKENAME spends much of its free time on secluded shores to preen its feathers to pristine condition. It shows remarkable ability to navigate through even extreme currents.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The new feathers on POKENAME's twin heads are incredibly soft and warm. Winter coats lined with them are prized by tailors across the region.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME leaps high into mangrove treetops from the river in search of food. If it lands in a particularly unlucky cluster of branches, it may find itself unable to get back down.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: POKENAME channels psychic waves through its beak to lull foes into sleep. It then feeds on their dreams while they remain unaware.
Author: .izik

Entry: It transforms into a copy of its foe to catch them off guard. Once the enemy investigates, it delivers a surprise bite.
Author: .izik

Entry: When raised with care, POKENAME is fiercely loyal to it's Trainer, oftentimes willing itself to keep fighting until the very end.
Author: Inksans201x

Entry: If a predator approaches its nest, it bites with a force strong enough to destroy a bank vault door. It is fiercely protective of its territory.
Author: .izik

Entry: It bites nearly everything, offering weak playful nibbles to those it senses are friendly. Its clairvoyance helps it distinguish friend from foe.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its oversized teeth are strong enough to gnaw through wood and stone. It marks its territory by biting trees, leaving distinct grooves as a warning.
Author: .izik

Entry: It rolls across long landscapes and times itself during the journey. Spotting a cactus excites it, as it loves to stop and eat them with eager bites.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its huge mouth is actually so soft and gentle that a POKENAME can keep an egg in it without it being damaged. This goes so far that POKENAME often transport their eggs this way to guard them.
Author: SonTyp

Entry: POKENAME has very heavy fangs that cause its head to tilt to one side if left to grow too much. Therefore, it will file its fangs down on trees.
Author: dragonessanimations

Entry: POKENAME hoards treasure and will bark and bare its fangs viciously to protect it. However, in an actual fight, it is quite cowardly.
Author: gellyfishsh

Entry: POKENAME are commonly used as guards for junkyards and similar establishments. However, their lax personalities mean most are more bark than bite.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: It loves biting metal to test its jaw strength. Using its magnetic nose, it detects nearby unbitten items for further chewing.
Author: .izik

Entry: This is one of the Pokémon with the most-developed jaws. It has a strength that allows it to break almost anything with an single bite.
Author: Pof.Whitebeam

Entry: POKENAME is much cuddlier than its looks might suggest. They are easily startled and, when spooked, it will take off on a fear-fueled rampage.
Author: GenesisParallax

Entry: It bites defensively when provoked, releasing a sticky slime that makes attackers slip away. Its strong jaws can crush small shells found on the beach.
Author: .izik

Entry: It's believed that this Pokémon has sparked legends of a three-headed dog that guards the entrance to the underworld.
Author: naga_sake

Entry: It uses its soft, stretchy fur to disarm opponents before biting unexpectedly. The fur puffs up when it's angry, making it look twice its size to scare off predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: Do not be fooled by its grumpy appearance. It would almost be the perfect Pokémon for children if it didn't have the tendency to bark at strangers coming too close to its owner. Some think POKENAME is, in fact, too approachable.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: It divebombs anything that gets too close to its nest. Trying to scare it off will only make it more aggressive.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: It rolls at high speeds, using its sharp fangs to bite through obstacles in its way. When threatened, it curls into a ball and strikes with powerful spinning attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: Sap drips from POKENAME's massive jaw, releasing a scent reminiscent of Chesto Berries. This aroma attracts Bug-type Pokémon in the area.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses metal chains to bind foes from a distance before delivering an extremely hard bite. Its bite is powerful enough to destroy concrete.
Author: .izik

Entry: It enjoys biting down on hot objects in the desert. If someone gets too close while it gnaws, it will fire out sharp pins to ward them off.
Author: .izik

Entry: Skull-shaped flowers bloom on its body in sunlight. If someone gets too close, it will bite with its strong jaws to protect itself.
Author: .izik

Entry: This fusion lures prey close by shifting its sandy body to mimic a rock. When the target approaches, it bites down hard and drags them into the sand.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its powerful jaws to break logs into pieces to use as basic tools, then plants seeds in the soil it churns. It is often seen reforesting areas damaged by wildfires.
Author: .izik

Entry: They are prone to being poisoned due to their pastry-like bodies, and in extreme cases chefs have developed a special shortbread to help cure them. A single Shalour Sable helps a POKENAME metabolize poison and deal with other ailments.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Despite its fearsome appearance, it is timid and avoids conflict. When cornered, it lashes out with swipes, but only as a last resort.
Author: .izik

Entry: It happily gnaws on its spoon when idle. In battle, it unleashes terrifyingly strong telekinetic blasts, often catching foes off-guard.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME emits a Persim Berry-like scent from its leaves to lure unsuspecting prey. When they draw near, it bites down with crushing force.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's hut is made of incredibly robust obsidian and volcanic rock. With its well-developed lower jaw, it effortlessly crushes any rock.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: With poor eyesight, it nibbles on objects using both heads to identify them. Its bites are gentle but persistent as it explores its surroundings.
Author: .izik

Entry: When cooking a POKENAME, it is important to let the barbs sit in cold water before removing them. This allows the toxins to disperse.
Author: .izik

Entry: It lives inside swamps and marshes but stays low to the ground so as to not get hit by lightning. Without a Wacan Berry, it will spasm every so often until its affliction is cured.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: When threatened, POKENAME balloons to an enormous size, presenting its spines. When relaxed, it is surprisingly docile.
Author: _sadfroggy

Entry: POKENAME fires poisoned needles out of its stingers to heavily weaken prey before it attacks. Their nests are found in deep water and are often close together to form a colony.
Author: EvilGammon

Entry: POKENAME retains water in its body that it heats up to rapidly expand when frightened. When it believes the threat has passed, it releases bubbles through its spikes to return to its normal size.
Author: bacondlx

Entry: POKENAME grows sharp toxic feathers all across its body. Trainers often see POKENAME launching its feathers at Pokémon that get too close.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: It closely observes fellow Flying-type Pokémon to learn how to properly divebomb and catch sea-dwelling Pokémon. Perhaps in thanks to their unnatural psychic powers, a stare from POKENAME can intimidate even the largest of foes.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It knows when prey will come before they even swim near POKENAME. It flies above the sea, knowing the perfect time to swoop down and catch its food.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME are covered in short toxic quills. Trainers that own a POKENAME must handle them with care to avoid getting pricked.
Author: KitArchen

Entry: A sharp sting will hit your body when you are near a wild POKENAME. Because of these harmful interactions, they are considered bad omens by some.
Author: JackSkipper

Entry: It uses the immense water pressure in its body to launch spikes from the hole in its crown at incredible speeds. With its psychic powers guiding each spike, it almost never misses its mark.
Author: amiel997

Entry: Its angular head allows it to cut through the water at blistering speeds.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: The fusion of two Qwilfish appears to have resulted in POKENAME taking on a form resembling an evolved Qwilfish of the past.
Author: pinkyoshi2350

Entry: POKENAME can detach its poisonous quills, hold one in its mouth, and launch it at prey with a jet of water.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: The poison in its spines can also be mixed internally with the ink it spews, letting it infect creatures near or far with its toxin. It's known to have a strong dislike of Malamar, turning aggressive immediately if it spies one.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME keep both toxins and milk in their udders. If a farmer comes up to milk it, they get splatted in the face with poison.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME are nothing short of malicious. They will purposefully affect those they dislike with a horrible stinging feeling.
Author: JackSkipper

Entry: With venomous spines and lightning-fast reflexes, it strikes from the shadows with deadly precision. It poisons its victims before finishing them.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: By filling its body with water, it can survive for long periods of drought and appear more imposing to foes. With its bulky appearance and long, menacing spikes, few Pokémon dare to challenge or prey on it.
Author: amiel997

Entry: POKENAME live amongst coral reefs and use pieces of coral it finds as camouflage. It uses the quills on its shell to inject poison into predators.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Said to be the spirit of a fisherman painfully killed by a Qwilfish's poison, POKENAME hooks and poisons mass amounts of aquatic Pokémon.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME determine which hook is dominant through duels of "Tug of War," seeing which can pull the other further. These duels also prevent their hooks from dulling.
Author: gordogamr

Entry: POKENAME uses the high pressure from its water-filled body to launch rapid punches at its enemies. The spike-like structures covering its body are actually glands that release poisonous spores when it's struck, making it dangerous to attack.
Author: amiel997

Entry: POKENAME exclusively eats plasma. When threatened, it will discharge pure energy to defend itself.
Author: gellyfishsh

Entry: Those expecting soft fluff are unpleasantly surprised by POKENAME's prickly mane, yet it is still shorn by some for use in textiles. It hates this.
Author: bukie

Entry: Those expecting soft fluff are unpleasantly surprised by POKENAME's prickly mane, yet it is still shorn by some for use in textiles. It hates this.
Author: bukie

Entry: POKENAME's fur is similar to barbed wire. Many speculate that there are metal particles in its fur.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME are highly defensive of their territory. They will violently ram into anything that gets too close.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME have soft bodies that are built for buoyancy. If two fight, they'll headbutt one another with extreme force.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: When POKENAME grinds its teeth, it's building up poison behind its spines. It attacks aggressively after doing so, so stay clear.
Author: .realthree

Entry: This form of POKENAME was thought to be extinct. Its aggressive demeanor led to humans attempting to eradicate it.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME have barbs across their body, injecting poison into anything that touches them. They have been seen gathering together in attempts to replicate a Diglett's evolution, but they end up getting stuck together by their barbs.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME has a personality as prickly as its body. Finicky to the extreme, owners must work hard to earn enough of its trust and affection for it to retract its poisonous spines and allow itself to be pet.
Author: sk372

Entry: This rough Pokémon loves fighting. No matter how badly it gets beat, it always gets back up.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: If it is angered, it inflates the two sacs on its head, allowing it to latch onto enemies. It then releases toxins through its spikes.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: It defends its territory by launching the small Qwilfish on its head towards foes. It is unknown if the Qwilfish are bothered by this.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: They are very bad at noticing their surroundings. It is not uncommon to find POKENAME covered in seaweed and barnacles.
Author: .izik

Entry: Though it moves sluggishly, the spiky creature on its tail has its own brain and will inject potent toxins into anything that gets too close. When in danger, POKENAME will try to avoid combat by making a angry face to intimidade the adversary.
Author: amiel997

Entry: Due to its offensive and defensive strength, POKENAME is a bit of a braggart. It taunts foes by rapping its claws against its head or using them to crush thick stones to rubble before their eyes.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME does not move very much because it is preparing for evolution. It possesses wings but is too heavy to fly.
Author: elite01.

Entry: When fleeing a predator, POKENAME cuts down any forest trees in its way using its great scythes.
Author: kingeroyal

Entry: The pincer on POKENAME's back is spacious and soft inside and ill-equipped for any sort of offense. Instead, it can safely store a number of passengers within to keep them warm and safe during its sea travels.
Author: sk372

Entry: It is thought that the coloring and eye-patterns of POKENAME's pincers have evolved to look like the skulls of fallen Pokémon. In battle, POKENAME uses this to intimidate its foes.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: The genes of POKENAME's parent Pokémon are evident in its asymmetrical limbs. When hunting, POKENAME will hold its prey with its pincer, while using its scythe to cut it open.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME stores explosive enzymes in its pincers. When it hunts, it grabs its prey and detonates close-range explosions.
Author: .realthree

Entry: They carry mail between islands and other locations in the Johto region that require heavy use of flying. Bluesky Mail is easily identified by POKENAME due to their sharp eyes, which allow them to snatch the mail they need before rushing off.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME only open their shell when they are attacking or eating. The color of the shell and carapace can vary.
Author: Krune

Entry: A highly versatile Pokémon, POKENAME is able to use its pincers to knock down trees and its horns to destroy boulders.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: POKENAME is a living weapon, nigh unstoppable once it starts moving. However, it's very susceptible to getting stuck on uneven terrain.
Author: Jaycielantern

Entry: POKENAME skims just beneath the surface, using its bladed fins to steer with uncanny grace. Its claws, formed of condensed water, strike with chilling force before dissolving into mist, leaving nothing but ripples behind.
Author: mgfox_66676

Entry: The armor covering POKENAME's upper body contains no iron, but is still remarkably hard. Its stomach is unprotected, however.
Author: Faelocke

Entry: This Pokémon resembles a fighter from a far-off land. A red dust follows POKENAME as it runs, resembling flower petals blowing in the wind.
Author: mercsthorn

Entry: This Pokémon resembles a fighter from a far-off land. A red dust follows POKENAME as it runs, resembling flower petals blowing in the wind.
Author: mercsthorn

Entry: POKENAME's blade is naturally formed out of ultralight insect chitin that is also as hard as steel.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME resides in the planet's lower orbit. Upon re-entry, its metallic body becomes white-hot, so it then rests in the deep ocean to cool down.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME is a very popular Pokémon for performers. It has the ability to create beautiful shapes out of the fire on its hands.
Author: hiimbasil

Entry: The pincers on its tails act as both defense and offense. POKENAME is very skilled with their fire, using its pincers as flamethrowers.
Author: CodeWolfie

Entry: POKENAME lives in dry wastelands and can crack any armor with its strong jaw. It can turn its head 180 degrees.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its ruff is razor-sharp. Its robust body helps POKENAME to endure the scorching sun of wastelands.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME appears to secrete grease from between its carapace plates. Its claws can crush its foes, while any attacker struggles to get a grip on it.
Author: maxiundmicky

Entry: POKENAME's petals serve as a shell to close up while releasing toxic spores to enemies nearby. They always overestimate how long these spores remain active, so they can stay inside for hours after the battle is over.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME's body has adapted to almost look like a fake head to scare away any creatures lurking in the deep sea. It can also be used to grab or bite anything that gets too close.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: With its steel muscles, scythes and pincers, POKENAME is a destructive powerhouse like no other. Contractors have used it regularly to help in deforestation prior to construction efforts.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME can crush and bend steel with its pincers. It crafts pendulums from even the toughest scraps of metal.
Author: noel5229

Entry: POKENAME isn't very mobile. When a Flying-type Pokémon approaches, it simply withdraws into its hard shell.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME resembles a Shuckle using an old forgotten skull as a replacement shell. As it generates berry juice, excess liquid pours from the hollow eye sockets, making it look as if the skull is crying.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is often seen floating about without a care in the world. Some say the toxins got to its brain.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME camouflages itself with mushrooms in lush jungles. It usually stays motionless, occasionally eating berries.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: After evolving, toxins flowing through POKENAME's body seriously damaged it. This Pokémon may eventually get too sick to fight and wilt away.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME grows a variety of berries naturally in its pouch, which it uses to create mixed juices inside its body. These concoctions are effective at combating various illnesses, and POKENAME shares them freely.
Author: sk372

Entry: It contorts its limbs into the shapes of wings that miraculously allow it to fly for short periods. It enjoys coating berries in flower pollen before consuming them.
Author: sk372

Entry: Every POKENAME has a signature juice. It likes to argue with others about whose juice is better.
Author: birchbot

Entry: This variant of POKENAME is more concerned about saving the environment. Sometimes it is mistaken for a broom.
Author: birchbot

Entry: POKENAME are often preyed upon by Pokémon such as Garbodor and Rattata, as it is commonly mistaken for a pretzel.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: When initially observed, POKENAME was thought to be the first sighting of a shell-less Shuckle. Though debunked, it has invited fringe theories about a possible shared lineage.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME squishes berries between its paws and offers the juicy slurry to others as a sign of affection. This makes owning one as a pet a sticky, messy affair for most Trainers.
Author: sk372

Entry: They stumble upon training equipment left by bodybuilders, and one such piece of equipment is the Power Weight. They utilize these weights to gain more momentum to slam into other objects.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME takes advantage of its imposing shape to scare away predators so it can brew its juice in peace. This juice supposedly tastes akin to wine.
Author: Phantom640

Entry: The only thing on this Pokémon's mind is eating honey. When it's not eating honey, it will scavenge ingredients to make its own.
Author: birchbot

Entry: It secretes mucus constantly, which allows it to stay waterproof. It is very friendly around children and will protect them above all else.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: POKENAME uses its bundle to carry berries discarded by Trainers. It tends to leave a trail of berry juice in its wake.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: The rattling noises from POKENAME's tail are toxic Berries being turned into juice. This sweet juice often renders unsuspecting prey unconscious.
Author: zyrobrokenmirror

Entry: POKENAME are excited about evolving. They dream of the wonderful possibilities they could pursue, such as making delicious juice.
Author: birchbot

Entry: It frequently has cravings for Mochi and is drawn to Health Mochi in particular. Since it gains little to no nutritional value from it, Trainers often separate it from the rest of the party before feeding it.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is noted for its ability to produce unique fragrances when given the right Berries. These fragrances are said to have medicinal properties.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME hangs from tree branches using its long, spindly tails. Its limbs produce a sticky secretion that helps it to maintain its grip while also rapidly hardening when exposed directly to air, providing it both mobility and defense.
Author: Katie

Entry: This Pokémon is helpless as it is difficult for it to see. Taking off the shell would make it just as vulnerable.
Author: birchbot

Entry: Finally able to see clearly, POKENAME developed a fascination for nature. It picks Berries mostly because it thinks they look neat.
Author: birchbot

Entry: POKENAME puts a lot of emphasis on its high heels. It went from picking Berries to becoming iconic.
Author: birchbot

Entry: As it collects many berries, POKENAME will share some with less fortunate Pokémon. Greedy Pokémon who try to take more than their fair share are likely to get bitten by POKENAME.
Author: Sprach Zarathustra

Entry: POKENAME hoards Berries in the mouth on its stomach. If a Pokémon tries to steal some of its Berries, it will attack with several hidden tendrils.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME hoards Berries in the mouth on its stomach. If a Pokémon tries to steal some of its Berries, it will attack with several hidden tendrils.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME is omnivorous and beats its food with its spiky shell. It eats what's left, mixing with its bodily fluids to create a sweet and savory juice.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It enjoys the art of making Berry Juice, offering some to anyone it sees. Unlike a regular Shuckle, it uses tools to make juice.
Author: birchbot

Entry: It is able to withstand a point-blank explosion using its sturdy shell. In a pinch, it can consume a Jaboca Berry to coat the opposing Pokémon with a caustic gel after an up-close and personal attack.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: A tangled mess, the bigger the knot inside a POKENAME, the more formidable it is. Its body can crush any berry down into a fine pulp.
Author: pory

Entry: It likes to make slushies. It is commonly seen with vendors on sunny days.
Author: birchbot

Entry: POKENAME loves to help other Pokémon, keeping tons of berries atop its head so they can snack on them. It will even let them hide in the holes in its shell if they are in need of protection.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Many cryptids seem to have been born from this Pokémon due to its peculiar body shape. Its limbs can stretch over 30 feet long and can even be seen walking above the treetops.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is incredibly valuable to farmers due to its ability to till land and fertilize it with the decomposed remnants of the Berries it eats.
Author: Larkus

Entry: As it eats berries, it creates a mixture of berry juices within its shell-like cranium. If a painful migraine flares up, this juice may erupt from the hole on top like a geyser.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME has very strong tentacles hidden in the holes on its head. For some odd reason, it has the ability to get rid of the salt in seawater.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: To accelerate the juice-making process, POKENAME tucks inside itself and rolls down mountainsides to churn the berries inside it. Though effective, much of its juice spills out and stains the paths it rolls down.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its true body is the mold-like mass inside its shell. It preys on Kingler by dissolving their insides with potent digestive juices and taking over the empty shell as its new home.
Author: amiel997

Entry: The sixth egg in the clutch has a particular affinity for finding sweet nectar and sap for the rest to consume. It does this primarily to make sure that the rest don't ever wish to feed of its own sap.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its dark coloration helps POKENAME hide in shady areas of forests. Its powerful tongue lashes out at startling speeds to grapple its prey.
Author: sivanandi

Entry: The horn on its face grows multiple sizes when it attacks. When it gets angry, it can destroy a boulder with ease.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME seeks to consume the sweet sap from forest trees. It won't hesitate to knock over the trees with its charge, just to more easily suck the sap from their bark.
Author: sk372

Entry: It tenderly cares for the precious bulb in its pouch, defending it fiercely with its powerful horn from any who dare to approach.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: POKENAME entangles foes with its long vines, dragging them in close. It finishes the fight with a swift, crushing blow from its horn.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its horn to pry off layers of bark from trees or dig holes in dirt. Once it finds small insects beneath, its many vines reach out and grab the bugs so it can begin eating.
Author: sk372

Entry: It tears deep holes in trees so that its young can crawl inside and feast on the sweet sap within. Any interlopers that venture too close during this time will be tossed aside by POKENAME's powerful horn.
Author: sk372

Entry: Normally a Pokémon with a very mild temperament, POKENAME becomes very greedy and aggressive where food is concerned. If anything tries to pry it from a tree while it feeds, it responds with extreme violence.
Author: sk372

Entry: Despite its hard and bulky exoskeleton, POKENAME can fly surprisingly fast. The loud buzzing of its wings is a signal for its prey to run for their lives.
Author: sivanandi

Entry: With its colossal horns, POKENAME topples even massive trees in a single blow. It quickly devours the sap that spills out, draining the wood dry.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has three horns, with the middle horn being the most impressive one. The horns are made of the same material as its tough exoskeleton.
Author: sivanandi

Entry: POKENAME will embed its horn deep into trees before fully cocooning itself, so that sticky sweet sap trickles onto it. It absorbs the sap into the shell, which helps fuel the evolution process.
Author: sk372

Entry: It uses the horn on its abdomen to cut and dig into trees in order to get to the sap within. Being greedy, it will aggressively flail its horn at anything approaching while it feasts, even other POKENAME.
Author: sk372

Entry: When POKENAME finds sweet sap, it secretes a fluid from its joints to alert others. This cooperative behavior allows groups to share valuable food sources.
Author: lemage22

Entry: POKENAME strikes at foes with its sturdy horn, capable of breaking open tree trunks with ease. It glides through the night sky, ambushing prey with powerful aerial dives.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME live in trees, feeding off of sweet honey and fruits. They have a particularly powerful tail and horn, which can rip through the flesh of even the toughest fruits.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME uses its sturdy horn to dig into soil and bury itself near water sources. It does this to rest and replenish its strength.
Author: .izik

Entry: When its eyes are closed, POKENAME uses its antennae to sense heat and light. It always turns toward the sun during daylight hours to absorb energy.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME buzzes through swampy regions, searching for willow trees rich with sap. It chews into the bark with its maw to drain the sweet liquid inside.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME gather deep in forests to sip sweet sap and nectar. They focus their psychic powers using their horns. Swarms of them warp their woodland realms into surreal dreamscapes, which they protect with freaky phenomena and bizarre illusions.
Author: Alkazamis

Entry: Wild POKENAME gather together in the Tagtree Thicket and drink the sap inside of trees. It can sense danger with its ears.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME's horn grows and changes with the seasons. The sparse leaves it sheds are used in many medicinal remedies, despite their bitter taste.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME breaks apart copper ore deposits with its horn and consumes them to reinforce its metallic shell. When under attack, it braces itself and counters with devastating force.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME carries a powerful spear that can both attack and disarm foes. POKENAME defends its territory valiantly, but it is drawn to sweet treats.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It can retract and extend its limbs from any of the holes in its shell. Predators thinking they can sneak up on it will be surprised when its disappears and then flies out of a completely different section of its body.
Author: sk372

Entry: It will only eat honey unless it is completely starved. If interrupted while eating, it will throw itself into a complete frenzy that would make even a rampaging Ursaring feel mellow in comparison.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It becomes most active late in the spring, when the most honey is produced. After it finishes gorging itself on whatever it can eat, it will focus on raising its young before going back into hibernation.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It spits out venom to daze its opponents before it wraps its tail around opponents with enough force to break rocks. A Grip Claw enhances its grip strength to squeeze water from rocks.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME can often be seen fighting one another to exhaustion in order to increase the durability of their horns.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: POKENAME uses its powerful horn to break apart shale and consumes the fragments for nourishment. It competes with other rock-eating Pokémon for the richest mineral deposits.
Author: .izik

Entry: When a wild Pokémon evolves into POKENAME, it ditches its old strategy of tearing through enemies in a single horned thrust or crushing grip, and instead begins to practice using moves such as Double Hit and Bullet Seed.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME hollows out materials to collect sap it can carry around in its pouch. Though the sap is primarily for its own indulgence, POKENAME will almost always be willing to share if asked.
Author: sk372

Entry: The golden vines laced around its body taste vaguely of honey, but only when POKENAME is well-fed. It uses its powerful body to defend itself against pests wanting to nibble on its sweet vines.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Although POKENAME have wings, they mostly use them to attract mates. They are too heavy to get off the ground.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: POKENAME knocks enemies away with a powerful horn strike before firing a flurry of Energy Balls. Its aggressive tactics make it difficult to approach.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's twirling dance is as lovely to watch as it is effective in battle. With two horn-like appendages on each arm, it can leap and whirl around to take out opponents with grace and ease.
Author: sk372

Entry: It lightly peels away bark from trees to gnaw on the wood and seek out sap to suck. Normally nonviolent, its horn is typically only used to swat or fling nuisances away.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME swings its second mouth like a flail to break apart tree trunks, then eagerly drinks the sap that flows out. If a predator gets too close, the jaws snap shut with crushing force.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME senses hurricanes before they strike and panics, slamming its horn into nearby objects. This act drives others away, unintentionally saving them.
Author: .izik

Entry: Possessing a large, flat back, POKENAME have become perfect places for fights. Usually, this is between angry Heracross and Pinsir.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: Its large horn is good for tearing bark off of trees, but is predominantly used against rival POKENAME. They butt heads and horns equally in disputes over food, territory and mates.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME fells trees with tremendous force to absorb their sweet sap. It will settle for an attacker's life force if disturbed while eating.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME are known as heroes of the forest. They nimbly leap from tree to tree scouting for danger.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME spring into battle with their horns prepared for a duel. They duck and dodge nimbly, horns slashing like swords. They carefully move their entire bodies to balance the weight of their horns, keeping the momentum of battle effortlessly.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME captures prey with thick strands of webbing before striking with its horn. It moves swiftly through trees, leaving electrified silk behind to ward off intruders.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its prized horn to flip over heavily-armored Pokémon. It then uses its powerful jaws to break though the softer underbelly.
Author: GentleSage

Entry: POKENAME prefers to lie dormant for long periods of time. When unsuspecting prey approaches, it shoots out its horn-like appendage.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: A wild POKENAME is naturally blind, so it uses its horn as a dowsing rod to navigate its surroundings. If its horn is even slightly damaged, it loses all sense of direction until it fully heals.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME burrows into the sides of maple trees using its horn, remaining hidden while it drinks the sap. If disturbed, it tunnels deeper into the bark to escape detection.
Author: .izik

Entry: Using its wings for balance, POKENAME performs acrobatic martial arts techniques. Its kicks are so precise and powerful they can shatter marble slabs.
Author: .izik

Entry: While running, POKENAME often underestimates its speed, causing it to slam into obstacles as it cannot stop in time. Whatever it collided with ends up demolished while the Pokémon remains unharmed and continues to race around.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: POKENAME lives in great redwood forests, propelling itself from tree to tree with its wings. It uses its horn to excavate nutritious sap.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME will gather in large groups in the spring. They will compete to see who can throw their opponent the farthest. They can't throw very far due to their small size.
Author: elite01.

Entry: Using the liquid surrounding its body, POKENAME absorbs any honey it finds as food. This can cause it to swell when it obtains too much.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: POKENAME floats effortlessly between trees, cracking bark with its horn. It feeds on the sap within, leaving trails of stripped trunks behind.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME locates large honey sources and then sticks to them, warding off predators with its many spikes.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: Once it sinks its fangs into a tree, it refuses to let go until it's had its fill. If POKENAME is not forcibly removed, it may drain a tree completely of its nutrients and leave it a wilting husk.
Author: sk372

Entry: The many claws near its neck let it attach to trees to better eat the sweet sap from their bark. It is a curious sort, and seems unaware of its size and stature potentially being frightful to smaller creatures.
Author: sk372

Entry: A mischievous creature, POKENAME like to poke humans with its horn before quickly disappearing.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: POKENAME secretes acid from the tip of its horn to bore holes into trees, allowing it to drink the sap inside. Its body emits a faint, sweet scent that attracts other Bug-type Pokémon.
Author: .izik

Entry: A very stubborn Pokémon, POKENAME is usually seen trying to lift objects many times its own weight, oftentimes failing.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: POKENAME has been seen frequently aiding logging companies, using its large horn to help carry large tree trunks. After large storms, POKENAME can be seen trying to clear away debris.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME loves to drink tree nectar. If anything tries to take from a tree it has claimed, POKENAME attacks it viciously with its horn and claws.
Author: ferdirenz

Entry: POKENAME collects sap from nearby pine trees and carries it back to its massive mushroom colonies. The fungi on its back thrive on the rich nutrients, allowing them to grow even larger.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME rests its horn on the ground to sense vibrations of nearby movement. If it detects danger, it flees without hesitation.
Author: .izik

Entry: It idolizes Heracross and great fighters. Even its clumsy imitations of their moves are effective, thanks to the toxic powder it kicks up.
Author: PokePower

Entry: Drawn to trees under streetlamps, POKENAME feeds on their illuminated sap. If disturbed while eating, it retaliates with a burst of Stun Spore.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's powerful horn can rip right through even the toughest of tree roots, making groups of them a danger in forested areas. However, POKENAME is usually careful to not uproot trees, as they love the Honey that tree-dwelling Pokémon can produce.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Using their horns, they work together to dig at incredible speeds. It has the power to smash clean through buried obstacles, such as boulders.
Author: wigglypon

Entry: It bashes its horn against trees to dig and pry its way within to get to the sweet sap within. The taste of the sap helps soothe the pain of the headache it gets from using its horn.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME joust over active volcanoes, duelling with their mighty horns. Their segmented armor is tough as steel and burning hot to the touch.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: When tucked into its shell, the horn sticks out from the front. Small feelers let it sense if predators are near, and it can strike the ground with its horn to propel itself away from danger if needed.
Author: sk372

Entry: A sweet-smelling acid drips from POKENAME's mouth to lure in prey. Once close, it charges with its horn to deliver a brutal strike.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses the leek it carries in combination with other flavorful grasses as a lure. It sets a trap for leaf-loving insects and waits until they get close, then attacks from above with its horn to knock them out.
Author: sk372

Entry: The larger head is adept at sensing opportune places to feed as well as nearby predators, while the smaller head takes care of defending itself with its mighty horn.
Author: sk372

Entry: As a young fusion, a typical POKENAME uses both arms to explore the world. These arms naturally express how a POKENAME feels at any given moment, serving as flexible eyebrows.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME can use their arms to attack, but they can also be used to emulate extra heads while forming the eyebrows on the main head. This expressiveness allows them to communicate clearly while intimidating other Pokémon as needed.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME's internal body heat heats the water it fires from its cannons to scalding temperatures. Using its horns, it can sense oncoming rain.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: It scurries along the bottom of the sea, rarely seen above water. Nobody knows what is inside its shell.
Author: Krune

Entry: POKENAME use their antennae to feel the current in the water, in order to discern their surroundings and sense other Pokémon. The size of the antennae determine the age and gender of a POKENAME.
Author: Krune

Entry: While the smog produced by POKENAME appears similar to ghostly smoke, it's actually stunning powder. Inhaling it can be deadly.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME have a variety of vocalizations they can make that sound like laughter. The horned plating on its head comes in different shapes and sizes.
Author: OhOk3441

Entry: Due to the shape of its horn, POKENAME cannot tunnel through earth as fast as Onix. However, the horn does give it an edge in battle, due to its reach and power. Foes are flicked away effortlessly if they face POKENAME!
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME rises early to collect honey from nearby woods. In the afternoon, it spars with friends and shares honey with them as a post-battle treat.
Author: noel5229

Entry: POKENAME is cold and bitter after the death of its mother. It steals eggs from nests to make others experience the same pain.
Author: welliss

Entry: Wild POKENAME use Smokescreen before ambushing prey, as they can easily see through the smog. Some POKENAME have been known to steal the treasures and precious items of other undersea Pokémon.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME skitters up to enemies to poke them with its little blades. It loves destruction.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Vicious and spiteful, POKENAME will attack one another late in the night. The longer the Pokémon's fur, the more vigilant and less trusting they are.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME are rumored to aviate small planes to make quick getaways after stealing trinkets from Trainers. They enjoy shiny objects and carry a sack full of such items so they can show off their collection.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME seeks out unprotected Pokémon nests and steals their eggs, storing them in its sack-like tail. It has also been known to swipe valuables from unsuspecting hikers.
Author: Kokoria_

Entry: Natural-born underlings, they flock to the strongest individual nearby. They follow orders diligently as long as it causes mischief.
Author: JackytheWannabe

Entry: They seek out the nests of Pokémon and work together to defeat the parents. Once their prey is defeated, they eat both the parents and their eggs.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: A POKENAME freezes its fur to make claws and spikes for climbing trees. It hides under the cover of snow.
Author: Ced Lasso

Entry: POKENAME have sharp claws that allow them to sprint on solid ice. They would make excellent sled Pokémon, but they will not tolerate being harnessed.
Author: Danarchist

Entry: Intelligent and devious, they steal anything they think might be useful: stones to pelt others with, Pokémon Eggs to eat or otherwise keep hostage, and even the nests of other Pokémon.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME is a vain sort, obsessed with jewelry in particular.  Trainers should expect to regularly gift and bribe it with bracelets and necklaces if they ever hope to have POKENAME obey.
Author: sk372

Entry: After waiting in the shadows, POKENAME uses its dexterous, retractable blades to crack open unguarded eggs or rip into vulnerable victims.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME stalks its prey, Pokémon or human, before silently draining as much blood as will allow it to fly. The pink feather becomes more vibrant after an especially nutritious meal, which is a mark of pride for POKENAME.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME adores crime, as it cherishes the dream of helping its Trainer get away from the forces of law. It will take the strongest of wills and purest of hearts to raise this fusion in the ways of justice and goodhearted actions.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME adores crime, as it cherishes the dream of helping its Trainer get away from the forces of law. It will take the strongest of wills and purest of hearts to raise this fusion in the ways of justice and goodhearted actions.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME loafs about, only moving to patiently fish for food with its tail. While it usually has a mischievous expression on its face, POKENAME is far too lazy to act on any schemes formed with its cunning intellect.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME loves to sneak into nests of other creatures to feed on unprotected eggs. It is easily spotted by Flying-type predators due to its colorful feathers, but will fight back viciously with its razor-sharp pincers.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: Due to its sensitive tongue, it enjoys a bland, healthy diet to help get started with its day. It is happy with porridge and a bit of salt, which make them a cheap pet to have around.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME love to raid Combee nests for their honey. They actually use the honey to stick silk and twigs together to make their nests.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: This variant of POKENAME travels inseparably with a rock-hard tree branch, which it uses as a tool to attempt honey-gathering in hard-to-reach areas.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Its green forearms are coated in a very sweet honey. During the summer, Combee will swarm POKENAME, mistaking it for a nectar-producing tree.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: It is thought that POKENAME fall to ground during meteor showers. Its eye twinkles with starlight, even during the day.
Author: missingmilkman

Entry: POKENAME roams the streets of villages and towns in search of sweets. Its favorite place to raid is a confectionery shop.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME is playful, but extreme caution is required as it underestimates its own strength. It can easily bite through metal with its strong jaws.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME live in volcanic caverns and rarely leave alone. When they do, they can harvest any pollen and berries in the area, cooking them with their own body heat. However, they never stray far from their dens for food.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: When POKENAME leaps into the air, it trails honey from its wings. As a result, it is very easy to follow.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME lives high in the mountains amongst alpine forests. Using its keen sense of smell it tracks down hives filled with Honey and will ram into the trees until the hive drops to the forest floor.
Author: Katie

Entry: Preferring to navigate at night when the Bug types that produce Honey are asleep, POKENAME will travel great distances in search of its favourite food. When it finds a tree housing a nest, it uses its immense strength to topple it.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME is always very sleepy. The pillow it sleeps on could send even a raging Primeape into slumber.
Author: Toxicrown

Entry: This Pokémon is extremely shy around people. The easiest way to befriend one is to present it with honey.
Author: Toxicrown

Entry: POKENAME are said to be the spirits of trees cut down before their prime. They hide inside hollow logs until the new moon, when they become extremely active, devouring sweet sap from nearby flora.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are often found in fields near Vespiquen hives. They are always on the hunt for honey, and will not eat anything other than it.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME is a strong fighter and swimmer. When using all of its strength, it can even swim through honey while eating enough for the energy it needs.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: A small child, POKENAME searches for the sweetest honey it can find to nourish itself. The sweeter the honey, the sweeter its leaves turn.
Author: pory

Entry: POKENAME are very friendly to humans and are great helpers in orchards and apiaries. In exchange for help with harvesting, POKENAME asks for portions of honey as payment.
Author: Arcul

Entry: POKENAME can be seen handing out baked goods to anyone it meets. However, even if you refuse to take its treats, POKENAME will regularly show up to your door until you eventually give in.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Some believe POKENAME is the spirit of deceased orphan Teddiursa. It floats through forests, its haunting wail causing Teddiursa to cry and Ursaring to go into grief-stricken rages.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's strong arms let it wield the bone club with great effectiveness in battle, but its preferred use is more mundane: POKENAME enjoys smearing the bone with honey or sweet juices, saving them to lick up later.
Author: sk372

Entry: Trainers should never approach an unattended POKENAME cub, or they risk being relentlessly stalked by its mother for years to come.
Author: kingd8

Entry: Though it looks aggressive, POKENAME takes its antics and attempts to entertain very seriously. Its usual act involves the upper arms arguing with the lower arms during their miming.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is an extremely territorial Pokémon. Fishermen know it as "King of Mountain Lakes", due to it claiming a vast area surrounding the water.
Author: moopse

Entry: Because of POKENAME's appearance and slow-moving nature, it is often mistaken for a large children's toy.
Author: StabbyCat

Entry: The rowan berries that grow on POKENAME's neck are beloved by all bear Pokémon. These Pokémon can be found standing at the edge of swift rivers, grabbing fish Pokémon out of the water with their long necks.
Author: moopse

Entry: POKENAME defends its territory mercilessly. Combined with its incredible physical strength, it is often used as a guard Pokémon.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: More aggressive than the average Teddiursa, POKENAME tend to live more solitary lives fending for themselves. They are protective of Teddiursa however, and won't hesitate to claw viciously at anything that threatens them.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME aggressively leaps up raging rivers to follow its favorite prey, Magikarp.
Author: .realthree

Entry: While very strong, POKENAME tend to only use that strength to knock down Berry trees and eat the Berries. It is surprisingly docile when unprovoked.
Author: therider

Entry: This mellow Pokémon can be found lounging deep in dense forests. Its mass of fur and long arms are useful for both survival and snuggling.
Author: moopse

Entry: POKENAME is rumoured to be an amalgamation composed of scrap robots. However, its true origins are shrouded in mystery.
Author: the_smirker

Entry: They take great pride in their plush, luxurious coats, but will not hesitate to get dirty to protect their young.
Author: Quote.lass

Entry: While they spend most of their time lounging peacefully, POKENAME's bursts of energy are fearsome, capable of reshaping the land. They fiercely guard their territory, drawn especially to areas rich in honey.
Author: helix2b
