Entry: Tales of the one who delivers gifts at the holidays describe POKENAME as his assistants. As the stories go, this Pokémon can sense the auras of children to determine who is naughty or nice.
Author: sk372

Entry: The seeds it carries have now grown into festive snacks which it gives away to smaller Pokémon in the forest. The scent of holly surrounds them.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: POKENAME enjoys the act of giving and sharing, but has no tolerance for greedy individuals and thieves. Anyone trying to take from another in its vicinity will be sent flying with a swing of its full bag of gifts.
Author: sk372

Entry: Urban legend says POKENAME chases down naughty children and Pokémon at night to stuff into its bag, which transports them into the spirit realm. At the end of the night, it empties the entire bag into the maw on its stomach to devour the victims.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME has a feared reputation of appearing in blizzards and kidnapping people. In truth, it rescues lost travelers in snow storms and provides for them until it is safe to continue their journey.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: Nutmeg is its favorite food, and it hoards as much of it as it can find. The spice seems to enhance its already festive nature.
Author: .izik

Entry: Wild POKENAME have been observed using their portable sack to steal various items from children. They are regarded as villains in holiday tales.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: Wild POKENAME have been observed using their portable sack to steal various items from children. They are regarded as villains in holiday tales.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: Wild POKENAME have been observed stealing various items from children. They are regarded as villains in holiday tales.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: It makes its home on icebergs, drifting across frigid seas. These floating islands serve as both a shelter and playground for it.
Author: .izik

Entry: Trainers that don't pay attention to POKENAME will discover that toys tend to disappear around this Pokémon. Experts are not sure if the Pokémon likes to steal to make children cry or if it is a case of kleptomania.
Author: Rockageddon

Entry: It constantly produces snow-like material inside its bubble that leaves it cold to the touch. POKENAME enjoys being held by others in need of cooling down, cooing softly as it shares its temperature.
Author: sk372

Entry: Once a year, POKENAME looks for children nearby to visit and bring gifts. Well-behaved and pure-hearted kids get glistening gems, while naughty children get coal and, in extreme cases, brimstone.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Folklore warns that upsetting this Pokémon may result in an avalanche. The threat ensures it is treated with respect and caution.
Author: .izik

Entry: When it shakes its horns, a pleasant scent of pine sap fills the air. This fragrant aroma calms both allies and opponents alike.
Author: .izik

Entry: It holds out its bag with closed eyes, hoping someone will offer it a gift. If it receives one, it runs away delighted, carrying the present with joy.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its body is composed of the hundreds of toys and gifts that have been thrown away over the years, along with other substances. It will try to clean off the grime of one of the objects in its body and present it to someone who needs cheering up.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The bauble on its horn can hypnotize foes with rhythmic movements. Once mesmerized, enemies are easy to outmaneuver.
Author: .izik

Entry: Commonly known as the Birthday Bird, this Pokémon loves to surprise people and Pokémon with confetti presents. If it spots a party, it will always try to sneak away with a piece of cake.
Author: Rockageddon

Entry: Urban legend says POKENAME will break off the black stones on its body and gift them to naughty children. The message this conveys to them is unclear.
Author: Iaobug

Entry: POKENAME loves its present dearly and will fall into despair if it is damaged or stolen. If you give a grieving POKENAME a new present, however, it will treat you with the same affection as before.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It can spit out an icy mist capable of freezing anything it touches. This frosty breath makes it a formidable opponent in cold environments.
Author: .izik

Entry: It has a curious habit of stealing items from one town only to gift them to another. This behavior leaves both towns confused, yet strangely grateful.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's round, icy body is filled with a cotton-like material that swirls inside like a snow globe when it moves. When it shakes itself, it releases a subtle pumpkin scent into the air.
Author: .izik

Entry: The fiery tip of POKENAME's tail is frozen solid and it leaves snowflake-shaped prints on the ground where it walks. Its beard is made of packed snow.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: Its tail is packed with candy canes, which it throws with precision in battle. These sweet projectiles are both festive and surprisingly effective.
Author: .izik

Entry: Their bundles are actually detachable from their tails, as they use their actual tails for swimming at high speeds. They collect seashells and rocks.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: The tip of its tail is extremely heavy, and it swings it like a maul. This makes it a surprisingly formidable fighter when needed.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME seeks out a stalk sturdy enough to hold its large bundle of food. It travels across the land sharing or trading its food with Trainers and Pokémon.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: Sometimes POKENAME opts to carry a light stick for quicker travel. Even though it packs a light bundle of food, it is still no less generous with what it has and offers food freely to Trainers and Pokémon alike.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: It prefers to make its den within icebergs. Using its beak, it will chip off the ice in large chunks to dig out a home.
Author: .izik

Entry: Chefs prize its horn, which is said to taste like peppermint when properly prepared. This rare ingredient adds a refreshing twist to culinary dishes.
Author: .izik

Entry: The slime coating its body is intensely sweet, so much so that licking it can cause tongue pain. Despite its sweetness, few dare to try it twice.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's blasters shoot out small gifts and confetti for small Pokémon to enjoy. The patterns on its shell depict various festive scenes.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: POKENAME's present is surprisingly durable, able to withstand blows from a sledgehammer with relative ease. It dislikes people trying to unwrap its present, so it tries to hide away during the holidays.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its bag is filled with shiny trinkets it finds and wishes to share. Deep-sea divers hope to run across POKENAME during their dives, as it could potentially gift something very profitable.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is a popular subject of winter photography. However, it is an extremely dangerous Pokémon, and several photographers are injured every year.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME is a sociable Pokémon that stomps leisurely across the seabed, sheltering small Water Pokémon in its head outgrowths.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME is a sociable Pokémon that stomps leisurely across the seabed, sheltering small Water Pokémon in its head outgrowths.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: At night, POKENAME sleeps by clinging tightly to coral using its tail. Marine researchers often deploy POKENAME near reefs as POKENAME can naturally filter toxins and sediments from the water.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME are reluctant to engage in battle and much more likely to sit and endure hits rather than dish them out. They have a fondness for treasure.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: POKENAME possess a very genteel nature. They scoff at Pokémon battles and showcase their talents elsewhere, such as in hospitality and entertainment.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: POKENAME swim as schools of hundreds. They use the algae growing on their head to glide over the sea by rotating them at high speed.
Author: Ayner

Entry: Despite their brutish bravado, POKENAME are rather loath to do battle. However, they will try their best if belly rubs are promised afterwards.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: Despite their brutish bravado, POKENAME are rather loath to do battle. However, they will try their best if belly rubs are promised afterwards.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: The small, curious POKENAME lives half of its life in water and half on land. It feeds on aquatic vegetation and may blow bubbles when it's well-fed.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: POKENAME's body is home to an assortment of small, aquatic Pokémon. When it grows in size, it will learn to feed off the power of its inhabitants.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: Powered by an aquatic ecosystem within its body, POKENAME tears through the waves at a wicked pace. Its wings cut like blades; remorseless and fierce.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: Commonly found off the Alolan coast, POKENAME surf with other POKENAME and Mantine for sport. The one who performs the most tricks on the waters is deemed the leader of their squadron.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: By changing the leaves on their tails, POKENAME adjust their speed when swimming. POKENAME are very friendly to passing Trainers, frequently offering them help across the seas.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: POKENAME love to jump in puddles after a rainy day. Each one sports a unique dorsal fin pattern.
Author: Weirdtux

Entry: Witnessing a POKENAME leap from the water is said to be a once-in-a-lifetime occurrence that signifies good luck for one month.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Despite having the ability to walk on land, POKENAME usually stay in the water for most of their lives. They burrow under the sandy seafloor to hide from potential predators, and even allow smaller Pokémon such as Remoraid to hide underneath them.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It is not uncommon for POKENAME's dorsal fin to be confused with Sharpedo's from a distance when it breaks over the water's surface. Despite that, POKENAME is friendly and will curiously swim up to nearby ships.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME prefers to hunt in the water as opposed to sand-swimming Garchomp. Cutting through the strongest currents, it can swim at break-neck speeds.
Author: chiari_queen

Entry: POKENAME's body consists mostly of cartilage and soft tissue, with few bones. For most of history, its fossils were mistakenly attributed to Lapras.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME is a very fast swimmer despite its bulk. It travels onto shore to lays its eggs and will guard the nest with its life.
Author: snescontroller

Entry: Groups of POKENAME were used during the ZERO-ONE's aquatic testing phases. They are valued for their strength and their mother-like care for anything struggling to swim.
Author: .izik

Entry: It swims through the deep ocean gracefully. Many Pokémon ride in its mouth for protection and safety.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: This Pokémon dreams of one day becoming a stalwart and heroic protector of the ocean. It dons a stylish cape to better embody this ideal.
Author: regula

Entry: Like Manitar, POKENAME's stomach is host to a plethora of aquatic Pokémon. This ecosystem sustains itself and breaks down the food that POKENAME eats.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: Like Manitar, POKENAME's stomach is host to a plethora of aquatic Pokémon. This ecosystem sustains itself and breaks down the food that POKENAME eats.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: POKENAME accumulate electricity in their shells before releasing strings of shocking bubbles. Sometimes, they discharge the energy through their fins to skim across the ocean's surface.
Author: imademyselfdothis

Entry: POKENAME covers itself in slime to be able to glide across the ocean surface. It is able to bounce itself back into the ocean if beached.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: POKENAME allows schools of Remoraid to cling to its chain as they transport them across the ocean. However, this makes them favored targets for larger predators.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's body is made of rock, unlike Aron, who boasts a thick coat of steel armor. Because of this, POKENAME doesn't rust when it dives underwater.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: Small, aquatic Pokémon live within the cracks of POKENAME's shell. Eventually, it will capitalise on this symbiotic relationship to gain power.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: POKENAME float by popular beaches like buoys, warding tourists away from deep water. They're famous for their warbling singing voices and smooth skin.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: POKENAME float by popular beaches like buoys, warding tourists away from deep water. They're famous for their warbling singing voices and smooth skin.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: This Oddish fusion can be found in the ocean. Species of Remoraid like to seek shelter from predators in its leaves.
Author: Uncookie

Entry: POKENAME can glide out of the water for short distances to catch prey. They are also known to play with swimmers and latch onto boats for long rides.
Author: totodile.

Entry: When POKENAME sees a smaller friend in danger, it will shield them from harm by putting them in its bubble.
Author: Uncookie

Entry: POKENAME are usually passive and caring, using their bubbles to shield friends. However, if necessary, it will use its bubbles to trap or stun foes.
Author: Uncookie

Entry: Often spotted within coastline swamps, this unusual Pokémon resembles a flat-capped mushroom and feeds on rotten plants. Its gaze is soulless.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: POKENAME tries to keep itself underground and away from the sun, as its skin dries out easily, causing it to weaken. Schools of POKENAME will congregate on rainy days and seemingly surf through the mud together for sport.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: The mouths on its “head-antennae” constantly spout out water to make the ground it burrows through as muddy as possible. Doing this helps the Remoraid that accompany it to swim through the muddy water.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: Wild POKENAME can be seen soaring above snowy trees with a flurry of snowflakes behind them. Rarely are they seen carrying their young.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: POKENAME communicates with members of its family by blinking its lights. Scientists have found that each POKENAME has its own name.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: After much effort and patience from both parties, linguists have decoded how POKENAME use their lights to communicate. It turns out that many wish to join humans in games of water polo.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: This unique fusion has combined four species at once. A Remoraid and Shellder have fused to feed off of POKENAME's excess energy while they drive off pests POKENAME can't see coming in an example of mutualism.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Rounded by the flow of freshwater currents, the body of POKENAME shines in the summer sun, attracting small aquatic Pokémon to make their homes there.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: POKENAME can be found in tropical seas, slithering amongst the coral reefs. Entire schools of Remoraid will swim alongside it, hoping for food scraps.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME cares very deeply for its adopted Remoraid. The Remoraid sometimes hypnotize other Pokémon by accident when playing with its pendulum.
Author: noel5229

Entry: The metal alloy in POKENAME's wings is strengthened as it consumes tree roots. Its metal feathers were harvested and used in constructing the prototype of the ZERO-ONE.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME scavenges up a Skarmory skull for defense and some shed metal feathers for offense. It scrapes its feather blade against the skull to make a screeching noise that disorients predators.
Author: sk372

Entry: It trains its fists by destroying abandoned buildings. When one POKENAME challenges another, their metallic strikes won't stop until one is down.
Author: MisterShaokahn

Entry: It protects its egg with its life, despite the fact that the egg is nearly unbreakable. Despite having wings, it cannot fly.
Author: Krune

Entry: POKENAME can be found in forests in snowy areas of any region. Their swordsmanship is enough to overwhelm a Gallade and their poison is quite potent.
Author: Patch_Bros

Entry: POKENAME soars through the skies in constant search of a battle, targeting the weaker opponents. With its powerful jaws, it tears its victims apart.
Author: astrael1

Entry: POKENAME tries to lure in its prey by letting out a serene smell. It then lures it to a cave to feed it to its young.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: Should an intruder approach POKENAME's territory, it will raise its arms and emit a cry of intimidation. Whether or not the intruder flees, POKENAME won't do anything else after its display.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is often seen gliding on warm updrafts high in the sky. When it spots prey, it plummets to the ground feet-first, trapping it between its talons.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: It sleeps on the sides of cliffs. A biodegradable substance somewhat similar to mercury leaks from its tail when it hunts. When two POKENAME fight, their cries reverberate throughout the area.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Their short wings are not well developed for flying. They communicate by scraping their steel feathers together in different patterns.
Author: rhysanthemum

Entry: POKENAME sheds its steel shell once or twice in its lifetime. Other creatures will often repurpose its leftover molts as armor.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME like to hang around post offices and act as loyal guards. Their blades also act as box cutters for hard-to-open boxes.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: Its body is made of a lightweight yet durable metal. When rolling at high speeds, it uses its winglike ears to control its trajectory.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Despite its size, POKENAME have murderous intent and can be quite violent. Be very careful if you meet it in the wild.
Author: Krune

Entry: As it is very young, POKENAME does not know how to be paternal and throws its stone at others who annoy it.
Author: Krune

Entry: According to all laws of aviation, there is no way that POKENAME can take flight. Its wings are too small to get its thick metal body off the ground.
Author: its_cher_bicth

Entry: By flapping its steel wings fast enough, POKENAME creates a high-pitched screech that stuns and disorients prey. At top speed, POKENAME creates sonic booms that can shatter glass as it flies past.
Author: sk372

Entry: The earliest recorded cases of POKENAME date back to the Kalos War. The metal plating along its body was made so it could be ridden into battle.
Author: Patch_Bros

Entry: Its wing blades are so sharp that it fells trees as it flies. The jungles POKENAME live in never grow beyond a certain height as a result.
Author: dragonessanimations

Entry: POKENAME are masters of graceful combat, effortlessly dancing through the air with high-flying kicks. They seem to enjoy sharpening and polishing their steely feathers when not fighting.
Author: kingd8

Entry: POKENAME's fan of steel feather blades can fly like a bird. Its fallen feathers are easily made into knives.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME only respect the most skilled of Trainers. Records show they fought alongside humans in wars long passed.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: They say these Krookodile fusions have turned over a new leaf, working as security for many businesses. No rule-breaking escapes their gaze.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: POKENAME uses its razor-sharp wings to swiftly maneuver around its foes, dealing precise slashes in the process. It has yet to master long-term flight, however.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: Each gear has a specific purpose. One gear controls the legs, and the other slices foes with its single wing.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: POKENAME is a dead Skarmory possessed by a Yamask. It can't fly, which is why you can hear POKENAME coming from a distance by the metal scraping against the floor.
Author: Sottiwotti

Entry: POKENAME threatens travelers with its sharp steel feather. If they don't carry gems with them, they just leave disappointed without stealing anything.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME fights even when its metallic pectoral fins and teeth become damaged since both grow back. It will chew through sunken ships because the ingested metals speed up this regeneration.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME specializes in close-quarter combat, grappling with its powerful arms, slashing with its sharp wings, and pecking with its beak. It trains deep in the mountains.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Though POKENAME is hard to notice, being so small, it poses a danger to casual hikers. When it runs by in a flash, it uses the blades in its ears to score a long slash in one's legs.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME's body consists of a durable, waterproof metal that never rusts. Because of this, they have been nearly hunted to extinction.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME calms down by punching metal plates. If its fists aren't enough, it will tear them apart thanks to its sharp beak.
Author: fouguri

Entry: Fusion has caused POKENAME to trade its brawn for incredibly impressive fencing skills. Despite its prowess, it does not seem to enjoy this change.
Author: Patch_Bros

Entry: Its sharp body makes it impossible to ride without being cut. It was commonly used as a heraldic symbol during the Middle Ages.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME is mentioned in many Galarian tales, having armor tough as diamond. Its stalk can stab through some of the hardest rock.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: POKENAME lurks in the depths of freshwater lakes, hunting for prey using the powerful harpoon cannons within its shell. It has little to fear from predators, its steely hide making it highly resistant to attacks.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME's body is made up of lightweight steel that allows it to fly with ease. It polishes its metal body as diligently as it polishes its pendulum.
Author: noel5229

Entry: With its long legs, POKENAME kicks down tree limbs heavy with White Apricorns. It then roasts them with its flames before eating.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME decides hierarchy in the pack through rigorous sparring matches. The rare POKENAME that attempts dirty tactics on another will be cast out, no matter if it was victorious or not.
Author: sk372

Entry: Despite its cute demeanor, POKENAME has a very potently venomous bite, which is feared in the areas in which POKENAME lives. It barks when threatened, giving humans a warning to run before it bites.
Author: Krune

Entry: Old science records show that POKENAME was once thought to be a regional variant of Eevee until it was disproved. The skull-like marking on its head shifts color based on elemental affinity, hinting the evolution it may undertake.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME communicates with its pack via subtle changes in the scent created by its leaf. Pollen spread by the leaf is used as an ingredient in some spicy Johto dishes.
Author: sk372

Entry: They collect the bones of deceased Pokémon and people. The quality of their collection influences the respect they get in their flock.
Author: Sottiwotti

Entry: POKENAME are rambunctious little troublemakers inhabiting urban areas. They swipe discarded bones from meals, and use them as heavy clubs to hit and annoy bigger creatures before running off with a barking cackle.
Author: sk372

Entry: Wherever POKENAME swims, the surrounding water begins to boil. Its body radiates intense heat even when completely submerged.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME sets fires near unsuspecting people to cause panic. In the chaos, it swoops down and steals their valuables.
Author: .izik

Entry: Young POKENAME prove themselves by working together to take down a formidable foe. They then adorn their backs with the spoils of victory.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: While POKENAME can communicate by grouping together and communicating either with symbols or telepathically, they prefer to communicate with howls. Each pack of POKENAME has a unique set of howls over the next. There is about 300 POKENAME in a pack.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: While POKENAME can communicate by grouping together and communicating either with symbols or telepathically, they prefer to communicate with howls. Each pack of POKENAME has a unique set of howls over the next. There is about 300 POKENAME in a pack.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME roam the savannas, searching for others of their kind to ally with. The head on their rump is usually deceased from starvation, but when alive, they are noticeably happier and less solitary.
Author: Krune

Entry: When upset, POKENAME throws tantrums and seeks affection while pretending it doesn't want it. Its fur grows hot when it gets angry.
Author: .izik

Entry: After blizzards, POKENAME digs out nests for others using its heated claws. It melts ice with each slash, creating a den for others to survive in.
Author: .izik

Entry: While POKENAME typically stick together in large packs, some can be seen splitting from the pack to befriend travelers. They speak in rough chirps.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: Only one head is able to use fire attacks at a time, but this fire is vastly hotter than anything even a Houndoom is capable of producing.
Author: ItsBrewsky

Entry: POKENAME trains together in packs, swapping sparring partners often. Pack members hope for differing evolution, as it will allow a better variety in training partners when the time comes.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are rambunctious and rebellious by nature. Though they function in a pack, the hierarchy shifts constantly as they regularly battle amongst each other for dominance and standing.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME mimics any passersby with eerie precision. The hat-like fur on its head is dangerously hot to the touch.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hunts in small packs in arid desert areas. The pack lies in wait until prey draws near, then takes turns crashing into it from different sides with their curled-up bodies until their target is knocked out.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are notoriously contrarian and enjoy being as inconvenient as possible. Their toxin causes a burning sensation that can last for weeks.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: If you are having a string of bad luck, a POKENAME may have cursed you. This Pokémon has a strong sense of justice and will bring misfortune to those it deems evil.
Author: Sajochi

Entry: Should POKENAME feel endangered, it will shriek and flare up the fire on its tail, alerting the rest of the pack. The whole group will fling small fireballs at the foe until the danger has passed.
Author: sk372

Entry: After launching a barrage of flames from its horn, POKENAME lets out a fierce howl. The sound echoes for miles across rugged terrain.
Author: .izik

Entry: Images of POKENAME appear often in depictions of medieval times. It's said that it was the partner of choice to knights who became corrupt, breaking or forsaking their oaths.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's bladed arms glow red-hot during battle. Each strike delivers searing cuts that leave a lingering burn.
Author: .izik

Entry: To surprise their enemies, packs of POKENAME coordinate to cause massive landslides. Its bonelike armor never stops growing.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: It still plays tricks on others, but it is now more chaotic than ever. It does not differentiate between friend and foe and is said to cause mayhem everywhere it goes.
Author: Salt

Entry: POKENAME sleeps curled up with its many tails wrapped tightly around its body. If startled awake, it will bark continuously for up to ten minutes before settling down.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME approaches children and acts like a puppy to try to get adopted. When alone, it gets depressed.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME communicate with each other using a variety of cries in order to corner their prey. A long-lived POKENAME will have fur that shines like obsidian.
Author: Krune

Entry: POKENAME can create small blue aura flames on their body and even breathe out small aura fireballs. The pack trains together to hone auras, flaring at each other to determine which is stronger and decide the hierarchy.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME sleeps up to 20 hours a day. When it yawns, it sometimes accidentally emits hot flames, so caution is advised when approaching it.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME nests near power substations and fiercely defends its territory. Trespassers are met with a blast of intense fire.
Author: .izik

Entry: This POKENAME has evolved to be more integrated with humans. It likes herding Mareep and other creatures common in husbandry. It is often kept as just a pet.
Author: Krune

Entry: It can be seen sabotaging bands of Pokémon. It seems that seeing the chaos unfold makes it laugh uncontrollably. It is very mischievous and loves to play tricks on others.
Author: Salt

Entry: When sleeping, POKENAME folds its wings over its face, leaving only its ears exposed. It occasionally lets out soft barks in its sleep, reacting to sounds only it can hear.
Author: .izik

Entry: The fur surrounding a POKENAME is great at insulating its body heat. The brighter the eye on the top skull glows, the more aggressive and ferocious. POKENAME are loyal to Trainers who properly care for them.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: Though it has an impish appearance, POKENAME is rather friendly and docile. It often shows up in media as a comically-inept henchman to villainous characters.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME performs a rhythmic dance before releasing pillars of fire from its wings. Its movements dazzle and intimidate all at once.
Author: .izik

Entry: On cold days, POKENAME's swirling dance radiates an intense heat. The air around it warms further with each elegant step.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has been described as having a pungent sulfuric scent, intensified by its tendency to live in small groups. It likes to burn garbage with fire breath before consuming it.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's spines are as dense as bone and offer powerful protection. It basks silently in the desert sun for hours without moving.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME burns bushes with its flames and consumes the ashes. This strange habit keeps the leafy parts of its body vibrant and healthy.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME give off a flammable powder that they ignite when agitated or hunting. These Pokémon eat both the meat and bones of their prey.
Author: totodile.

Entry: Game Corners have put out warnings to patrons about POKENAME packs, as they have learned to loiter in wait for exiting customers so they can harass them and try to steal their shiny coins.
Author: sk372

Entry: Due to the headaches they suffer from, their coordination as a pack has suffered, their hunting methods disorganized. The one whose headaches create the strongest psychic pulse is considered the leader.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME prefer to fight in packs to gang up on their prey. Each POKENAME is loyal through thick and thin. They can smell fear, enjoying this aroma as they decide which targets to strike.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME sprays scalding water from its mouth with surprising force. Its skull emblem glows faintly when it prepares to attack.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's body is formed from chunks of coal. It ignites pieces of itself and hurls them at enemies with explosive force.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are popular for being loyal and adorable pets, though they are considered difficult to train. This is not because of any behavioral problems, but that taught tricks will be forgotten within a week.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME congregates in small groups around lit lampposts at night. It communicates by rubbing its magnets against each other, producing small bursts of electricity.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME travels in packs that howl in unison as they breach shorelines. The sound can be heard from miles away.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its goop-like body burns hot and emits a rancid aroma. People throw it bones leftover from meals to appease it and make it leave, but it takes this as a sign of friendship and lingers longer because of it.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME devours fire and bad dreams. It's said that those who light a candle by their window will have their nightmares eaten by this Pokémon.
Author: noel5229

Entry: POKENAME barely move while waiting to evolve. If POKENAME is disturbed, it will bark with a sound that can give humans nightmares.
Author: Krune

Entry: Having finally emerged from its cocoon, POKENAME find packs of other POKENAME and hunt prey together. They hunt and scavenge everything ranging from small insects, other bug-Pokémon, and even honey.
Author: Krune

Entry: POKENAME is a playful Pokémon that treats any battle as a game. It can do anything it wants, which leads other Pokémon to fear and avoid it.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: Roaming in herds led by an alpha, they scour the land in search of vast pastures. The grasslands they feed on are left scorched and barren, with nothing ever growing back.
Author: amiel997

Entry: If you hear an eerie howl in the dead of night, it may be a POKENAME looking for food. When frightened, it will attempt to flee while belching hot flames and thick smog before transforming into another Pokémon.
Author: Sajochi

Entry: POKENAME is considered quite dangerous despite its cute and friendly appearance. Its small body cannot properly contain the toxins that cause lingering burns, so an errant touch could have excruciating results.
Author: sk372

Entry: The pain from POKENAME's psychic attacks can only be cured by another POKENAME. However, they will only cure a Trainer that they trust.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: POKENAME absorbs flames into the skull on its back to fuel its own fire. Scream-like sounds emanate from it when it does this.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: This Pokémon's haunting cries strike fear in even the most bravehearted people and Pokémon.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME packs typically do not search for food on their own. Instead, they find a smaller Pokémon and bully it with their horns until it leads them to food.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: It's body is made of magma stained by dark toxins. If a POKENAME's molten body burns you, the pain will never go away.
Author: asyoko

Entry: Most POKENAME seen in the wild are the leaders of their pack. They carry heated rocks to aid their young as well as travelers lost in the cold.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: POKENAME creates so much fire within its body, it cannot fully contain it. It shoots flames from its arms hot enough to melt a mountain in minutes.
Author: sk372

Entry: Black, horned, and slender, with membranous wings, POKENAME glide down from the mountains each night in search of travellers to abduct. They are said to carry people away on nightmarish voyages to other worlds.
Author: Quantum Elephant

Entry: POKENAME excels at digging, burying victims until only bones remain. It then unearths them to play with their skeletal remains.
Author: D_Numeritos

Entry: This Pokémon resembles a sorcerer from a story. POKENAME has a unique ability to control glass, sculpting the material through the intense heat it produces. No one knows what causes this Pokémon's left arm to appear withered and sickly.
Author: mercsthorn

Entry: POKENAME are a favourite Pokémon of army veterans and are often on the frontlines of war, their vicious blades giving them the edge over other Pokémon. They have trouble adapting to life away from constant battling.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME can be vicious when hunting smaller prey. The quills are tough as iron and burning to the touch when glowing, so avoid touching them.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: Legends say these Pokémon guard the gates to the spirit world. When the wind passes through their teeth, they make sounds like someone whimpering in pain.
Author: Wormspawn

Entry: POKENAME is primitive, but it has incredible powers. However, it spends most of its time lazing around or hitting rocks with its bones for no reason.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Fragmented records of a being similar to POKENAME have been discovered in ancient ruins. They illustrate a deity that drags away the wicked with 1000 summoned arms to burn the evil in their souls to ash with cleansing flame.
Author: sk372

Entry: Unlike Torterra, POKENAME does not take care of the life that grows on it. It scavenges abandoned cities in search of more preferable ornamentation.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: Despite its looks, POKENAME are mischievous tricksters who enjoy setting objects aflame to scare anyone it can. The items it ignites are unharmed but will have a lingering smell of sulfur on them for a few days.
Author: Sajochi

Entry: POKENAME is believed to be a sword possessed by an evil spirit. Trainers who have held POKENAME reported seeing hallucinations and hearing whispers.
Author: w1ndowsxp

Entry: POKENAME summons large clouds of volcanic ash to conceal itself in battle. When it gets especially angry, the bony parts of its body will glow red hot.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It is said that the arrival of POKENAME is a sign of chaos. Its fire is said to be capable of burning entire forests. This Pokémon is usually associated with evil and destruction.
Author: Salt

Entry: POKENAME's adorable appearance has inspired many occult clubs around it. For some reason, it seems overjoyed about that.
Author: dyo_jonah

Entry: The sight of a POKENAME is considered an omen of death, as it only seems to appear shortly before a person passes on. People believe this Pokémon consumes the souls of the departed, and sends wicked souls to the underworld.
Author: Sajochi

Entry: It weaves nests out of bones for its offspring. It is often seen burning trees to mark its territory.
Author: mrbapcik

Entry: Folklore speaks of POKENAME as the gatekeeper of the underworld, opening the way for the souls of the departed and locking the gates behind them. Their bodies are always burning hot, as if they had been left in an oven.
Author: Knilk

Entry: Legend says that POKENAME guards the gate to the underworld. Despite its fearsome appearance, it is known to spare those who show it kindness.
Author: Atlas333

Entry: This majestic yet menacing Pokémon commands both fire and shadow with its multiple tails. Its piercing red eyes and elegant movements make POKENAME a captivating yet dangerous presence in the wild.
Author: segmoph

Entry: An unsettling, almost supernatural sound is emitted when a POKENAME spins its gears. The minigear can move freely from the body, but must return before daybreak or else it may perish.
Author: Sajochi

Entry: It floats aimlessly around graveyards and places where wars have been fought. Its necklace rattles with a chilling sound that sends shivers down one's spine.
Author: Krune

Entry: Despite the apparently short legs, POKENAME can scuttle quickly when escaping danger or looking for food. They may be hard to tame initially, but they can be quite loyal to Trainers who properly care for them all the same.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: Despite the apparently short legs, POKENAME can scuttle quickly when escaping danger or looking for food. They may be hard to tame initially, but they can be quite loyal to Trainers who properly care for them all the same.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME loves to play by biting anything and anyone. It is recommended to keep a Poké Doll around for POKENAME to play with, as this Pokémon's bite will cause a stinging pain for a few days.
Author: Sajochi

Entry: Though POKENAME are not much more than grave-robbing nuisances in the modern day, legends tell of a gargantuan POKENAME forming from millions of bones and wreaking havoc on the world long ago.
Author: octolinggrimm

Entry: Though POKENAME are not much more than grave-robbing nuisances in the modern day, legends tell of a gargantuan POKENAME forming from millions of bones and wreaking havoc on the world long ago.
Author: octolinggrimm

Entry: It takes a lot of time to train a POKENAME to behave. It's difficult to find its faults because it only acts aggressively towards strangers.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The smoke that billows from POKENAME's back is scalding hot. It lets out a chilling howl the moment it locks eyes with its prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: The spores POKENAME scatters everywhere cause unbearably painful burns in the throat when inhaled. This pain will never completely fade.
Author: Fenragon

Entry: POKENAME emerges from the ground with three fiery heads, each capable of unleashing scorching flames. Its howls are said to predict volcanic eruptions in its habitat.
Author: segmoph

Entry: The water that POKENAME attacks with leaves a lasting burning sensation. POKENAME is regarded as a menace due to its looks, despite its kind heart.
Author: .realthree

Entry: In some legends, it is said that these Pokémon lurk in the underworld, burning evil souls. When they wander, the smell of sulphur follows.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: In the past, a POKENAME's howl in the night would be enough to cause a panic. A village it attacked would no longer exist by the time the sun rose.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: POKENAME aims above all else to torment humans with its psychic prowess. As one of its conjured spoons bends, so too bends the mind of an unwitting victim.
Author: NellNast42

Entry: Ancient prophecies describe four POKENAME riding at the end of the world. As such, these Pokémon bring fear wherever they go.
Author: NellNast42

Entry: The tar-like substance that comprises its body is horrifically acidic and deadly. The bones seen within POKENAME's body are all that remains of prey it has engulfed and consumed.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME coil their tails on their back while they hop across the forest. If they're startled or approaching prey, they will rapidly extend their tails to propel themselves forward.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: It possesses a flicking tongue, yet none have seen for sure if it actually has a mouth.  When threatened, it will rattle its tail, producing electric sparks.
Author: sk372

Entry: A clutch of POKENAME eggs can all communicate to each other telepathically from inside their shells. One hatchling acts as a sentry to watch for danger.
Author: serversizeme

Entry: It shakes and rattles the tail in its hand as an intimidation tactic against predators.  Those that are not dissuaded by the act will find it is still an effective weapon in POKENAME's hands.
Author: sk372

Entry: The pincers on POKENAME's head are composed of numerous loose scales. When threatened, it rapidly vibrates its muscles, creating a low rattling sound.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Its amorphous body allows it to squeeze into small gaps. Its venom isn't deadly, but bite victims have described feeling like their bones had turned to jelly.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME slithers in a linear fashion, eating any food it finds to grow longer. It dies if it touches its own tail.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: It covers its jaws with a venomous mucus that can knock out a Snorlax. Swamps with high populations of POKENAME are often closed off from novice Trainers.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: POKENAME can lie still and stalk its prey from under the water for hours. Once prey gets caught in its jaws, they rarely escape.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: Though effective at quickly and quietly attacking prey from above, POKENAME is most vulnerable after a successful hunt. Its wings are not strong enough to lift both itself and its latest meal.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's mimic an Ekans to intimidate would-be predators. While its bite is venomous, they venom is not strong enough to have noticeable side effects.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: While flying in search of prey, it emits a hissing sound that intimidates smaller creatures. Its sensitive tongue can detect the presence of nearby targets.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its jaw can unhinge, allowing it to swallow objects nearly as large as its own body. This adaptation helps it consume meals far larger than expected.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its nest is lined with yellow wool, providing both camouflage and insulation. This cozy hideout keeps its eggs safe and warm.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its light body allows it to drift effortlessly through meadows. This floating motion often confuses predators trying to track it.
Author: .izik

Entry: As it walks through nettles, it sheds its rough skin to maintain its agility. This process leaves a trail of discarded scales.
Author: .izik

Entry: It flies low over swampy areas, scanning for small prey to ambush. It flies fast enough to disappear in the blink of an eye, making it a highly skilled predator.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME startles foes by spraying venom and flashing its patterned rings. It moves nearly silently and strikes without warning.
Author: 22ndsolstice

Entry: Flying silently through the night sky, it shoots venomous needles from its mouth to snipe prey. This precision attack leaves no chance for escape.
Author: .izik

Entry: It gnaws holes in doors to sneak into homes and raid pantries for food. Its sharp teeth make short work of even the toughest barriers.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME slithers silently, often coiled around ancient ruins. Its body pulses faintly, almost as if it is channeling an unseen force tied to the mysteries of the past.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: It fluffs up its ears and raises itself onto the back of its to appear larger, intimidating foes before striking with its sharp fangs. If the first bite isn't enough, it will latch on and refuse to let go until its poison is fully injected.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME struggles to fly or keep an upright posture due to its excessively long body. It is still highly venomous and should not be approached.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: Large wings and strong muscles allow its peculiar body shape to fly. It will often raid the nests of bird Pokémon to swallow their eggs whole.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: When an imbalance of cells that are ready for evolution occurs, an Ekans may find itself with a second head. The second head, primed for evolution, slowly becomes the dominant thinker of the body, leading to the first head consuming scraps of a meal.
Author: PixlHoopa

Entry: It can shoot globs of acid from its nose to deter predators or soften food. It is advised not to eat food soften by a POKENAME, as they have trouble altering the toxicity of their acid for different tasks.
Author: .izik

Entry: It totters around carrying the large rattle on its tail with it. When under threat, the rattle's sound can ward off otherwise vicious predators.
Author: Baneful Bunker

Entry: Though its claws carry potent poisons, they are mostly used for digging. In battle POKENAME prefer to coil up and rattle their tail to discourage attackers.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: POKENAME use their tongue-like appendages on their heads to sense changes in the air currents, helping them locate prey. Their tail-tips are used to ward off attackers, producing a sound that scares even the toughest creatures.
Author: Krune

Entry: It latches onto its prey with a powerful bite and unloads large amounts of venom. It refuses to let go until the prey stops moving.
Author: .izik

Entry: It steals eggs from other nests, placing them in its own to raise as its own offspring. This unusual behavior ensures it always has young to protect.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's scales are made of steel. In ancient times, the shed skin was used as an armor sleeve.
Author: Mossybanana

Entry: Legends say a mere glance from POKENAME can turn living things into stone. All of the Ekans on its head are sentient.
Author: Mr. Person (Prinplup enjoyer)

Entry: This Pokémon uses photosynthesis to convert light energy into deadly toxins. Although friendly to humans, it uses great jaw strength to gnaw on prey.
Author: akujules

Entry: The spines on its ears are highly venomous, injecting a toxin that causes prolonged paralysis. This defense makes it a formidable foe.
Author: .izik

Entry: A potent poison bubbles at the tip of its blade. This poison severely irritates the skin on contact due to its unusually high arsenic content.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: It rattles its tail loudly while eating, a behavior it also exhibits when hungry. This noise warns others to stay away from its meal.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its extra heads contain no brain, but they work as extra mouths that POKENAME can launch to reach food its body can't.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: The flame on its head slowly melts the wax of its body, which is mixed with noxious substances. This produces toxic, barely noticeable vapors.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Although its right arm is also conscious, scientists agree that POKENAME's head is controlling the whole body.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The rattles on its tails shake rapidly as it gathers heat to shoot out flames. As more of its tails vibrate faster, the flames grow more intense and elaborate.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME prefer damp grassy places to live. As they have an unsettling stare and move around swiftly and unexpectedly, they tend to not be very popular among young children. For self-defense, they secrete a powerful poison from their fangs.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Most POKENAME leave fighting to older members of its pack. If cornered, it will suddenly emit a bright light from its tail to blind the perceived predator.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The true body hides within a hollow, yet sturdy false body that it controls at will. It lashes out at close opponents, striking out from the eye or mouth holes to poison a foe before retreating back within its defensive shell.
Author: sk372

Entry: It snakes its way through the hollowed gears as they turn, seemingly deriving energy from them. Should the serpent be separated from them, it becomes listless and almost immobile.
Author: sk372

Entry: This fusion, which combines Zorua with Ekans, was originally proposed as a possible means of better pest control. Unfortunately Meowth continued to be widely more popular, relegating this fusion to a much smaller following.
Author: El Fail

Entry: POKENAME's main body stands back as its snake-like ear rapidly strikes its opponent. It has a wicked side-eye stare.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME sink their venomous fangs into prey and enemies alike, but flee at the sight of sudden loud noises.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Primarily to survive, these Pokémon lead an underground lifestyle. POKENAME already display uncontrollable temperaments in their early days.
Author: mrbapcik

Entry: Primarily to survive, these Pokémon lead an underground lifestyle. POKENAME already display uncontrollable temperaments in their early days.
Author: mrbapcik

Entry: It wiggles the tail on its head like a rattle to scare off predators. The sound is unnerving and can be heard from 30 feet away.
Author: .izik

Entry: It clamps onto its enemy tightly, injecting up to a liter of venom. This attack leaves its prey immobilized and vulnerable.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME tend to hide themselves in scrub brush. If they are discovered, they will use their tiny legs to attempt an escape.
Author: KitArchen

Entry: Cunning ambush predators, POKENAME lies buried under desert sands before launching itself at unsuspecting prey. It does this using its tail, which it can rapidly uncoil to propel itself violently upward.
Author: joeofthealps

Entry: Its poison is stored in sails on its head, and it flows into its tongue when needed. The poison gives a chilling effect that can freeze skin, so its poison is often used for making both Antidotes and Burn Heals.
Author: Krune

Entry: POKENAME have many eyes on its body to help it stay alerted to predators.  Its sail is poisonous to the touch.
Author: Krune

Entry: The gems on its body are made of crystallized venom.  These jewels are sought after by collectors, but remain highly toxic.
Author: Krune

Entry: POKENAME is a skittish sort, darting away at the first sign of trouble and finding somewhere to hide. It leaves a faint trail of poisonous ooze in its wake.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's antennae always point toward the brightest visible light source. It will rattle its tail loudly when trying to obtain the newly found light before others of its kind.
Author: .izik

Entry: It sneaks into shops at night, using its acidic spit to dissolve locks and steal coins from registers. Its cleverness makes it a notorious thief.
Author: .izik

Entry: It lines its nest with scraps of paper money stolen from untended purses. This luxurious habit reflects its cunning and opportunistic nature.
Author: .izik

Entry: The fur on its body is laced with a poisonous substance that can cause sleeplessness and vomiting upon contact. This makes it dangerous to handle.
Author: .izik

Entry: It clamps its prey tightly with its strong hands while delivering venomous bites. Despite its unfocused appearance, it can deliver decisive strikes in an instant.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its elongated, flexible body allows it to snake through Pokémon burrows with ease. Its favorite prey is Nidoran.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: When it hears music, the spiral on its belly begins to rotate. A dancing POKENAME sways rhythmically, mimicking a metronome in motion.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses its paralyzing gaze and hypnotic patterns to entrance both its predators and its prey. It is helpless against foes it cannot mesmerize.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME's body is covered in muscle, allowing it to constrict its prey hard enough to crush bone. Pairs of POKENAME can be seen wrestling with their tails to test their strength.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its tail sways back and forth as it gracefully swims through calm waters. This motion helps it maintain balance and speed.
Author: .izik

Entry: The venom inside its body reacts chemically to produce electricity, powering the magnets on its sides. This electric charge enhances its hunting capabilities.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lures in prey by shaking its plant stalk, waiting until the last possible moment to strike with its venom.
Author: Terastrial

Entry: Its nose contains tiny venomous fangs that function like a mouth. These fangs deliver a potent toxin when it strikes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is often found crafting pendulums, as it loves to work with its hands. Its jovial nature keeps it from being dangerous, despite its venom.
Author: noel5229

Entry: The father is responsible for nurturing its young. It will harvest Dragon Scales for Horsea to evolve with in the future.
Author: nin10dogmod

Entry: POKENAME coils its tail around driftwood to sleep. When it wakes, ocean currents have often carried it far from where it began.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are loved by Trainers living in swampy or marshy areas, as they are able to easily traverse the watery landscapes. With their keen senses, POKENAME alert their Trainers about nearby activity by lifting a paw and pointing with their snout.
Author: moopse

Entry: The shell on its back has grown too heavy to move. It uses its mass of tendrils to grab other Pokémon, before using its mouth to subdue them.
Author: Toxicrown

Entry: POKENAME feeds on metal deposits deep in the ocean. If a group of POKENAME are in a feeding frenzy, the force will create massive whirlpools, disrupting the local fisherman and Pokémon.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: When threatened, POKENAME inflates to four times its size. It then spits foul-smelling ink to drive away predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: Boasting an extremely accurate and powerful cannon, POKENAME have been deployed across several regions to combat Pokémon poaching.
Author: gottkroprinziii

Entry: POKENAME rules the depths with serene grace and latent might. Blending strength and regal elegance, its sovereign presence rules the underwater realm.
Author: soinetwa

Entry: POKENAME can be found from the seafloor to the surface. It spins to create vortexes which swallow ships so it can absorb the life force of passengers.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME uses its spiral body to churn the waters around it enough to create large whirlpools. However, these Pokémon just sit on the ocean floor waiting for their whirlpools to bring them their prey.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME lurks at the bottom of its oasis home, waiting for thirsty travelers to draw near. It sneaks up on its prey before attacking from below.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME leaps from the ocean to spray pinpoint-accurate water jets from its snout at flying prey. It is popular with Trainers for competitions requiring agility and sharpshooting.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: Lurking among coral reefs, POKENAME waits for prey to drift near. It spits toxic ink to paralyze victims before devouring them.
Author: .izik

Entry: The ink POKENAME spits is used in wedding makeup across coastal regions. Some believe it brings lasting joy to those who wear it.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME stare at the world with unblinking eyes. POKENAME are able to see very far and can launch an inky bomb of sludge across the length of a harbor.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is often featured in beautiful works of art, where it's portrayed pulling the golden chariots of water deities.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME lives lazily on the seafloor. Whenever POKENAME spots prey from below, it creates a whirlpool to drag the prey into its mouth. However, it will often forget what it was doing and space out, giving the prey a chance to escape.
Author: darkweavile428

Entry: POKENAME wander the icy waters in search of patches of ice to turn into their hunting grounds. Their black ink has a unique scent that marks the territory of each POKENAME.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It flaps its ears to generate electricity stored within its body.  It releases bolts of lightning from its trunk in self-defense. Occasionally sparks fly out when it trumpets normally.
Author: sk372

Entry: It spends most of its days sleeping or foraging for food. POKENAME's mild demeanor makes it popular among children, although parents warn them to not approach it due to its claws.
Author: Krune

Entry: When it cannot sneak up on or flee from an approaching Pokémon, POKENAME will repeatedly slam its head and upper body into the ground in an attempt to intimidate the Pokémon to make it steer clear.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are adored for their cute appearance, but are banned in many places as pets. Their massive size combined with their strength and overly-playful nature is too prone to accidental destruction.
Author: sk372

Entry: They enjoy all sorts of apples, and their stubby bodies will headbutt trees to knock the fruits down. When they pass by a Fancy Apple stand, they will refuse to leave until they get a bite.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME can detect underground vibrations in the snowy mountains they call home and can predict avalanches before they occur. They dedicate their lives to rescuing explorers who are in the path using their super speed and strength.
Author: odditylad

Entry: Despite not feeling the effects of the cold temperatures some POKENAME still develop a dense fur coat. It is not known whether they have an evolutionary advantage however these variants are more comfortable to ride.
Author: odditylad

Entry: It carries the sapling in its trunk wherever it goes. If the sapling is lost, it will drop whatever it's doing to find a new one.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Despite having blades for hands POKENAME is kind and gentle. It practices mindfulness and meditation to ensure it never loses its temper and hurts another Pokémon or Trainer.
Author: odditylad

Entry: To show its affection for its Trainer, a POKENAME will blast glitter into the air using its trunk.
Author: ClawsHDi

Entry: POKENAME has a very long lifespan, but most of its life is spent slumbering underground. When they emerge, they trumpet loudly to each other.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: It flies through its cavernous home by flapping its ears rapidly. The process is rather exhausting, so POKENAME prefers to move around via hitching rides on large stone Pokémon in the wild, or perched on its Trainer.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are stumps possessed by the spirits of artists. Their wooden trunks produce haunting sounds that they use to scare painters looking for a quiet place to work. POKENAME then decorate themselves and their forest with any dropped supplies.
Author: odditylad

Entry: POKENAME stores large amounts of sand inside their bodies and will shoot it out of its trunk if it feels threatened. Due to their short legs, it tends to hop around instead of walking.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Despite its insectoid appearance, POKENAME is completely mammalian. Its body heat allows the elephant ear fungus to grow on it.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME uses its strong trunk as a shovel to dig through the dirt with ease. When threatened, it can launch dirt at potential foes with alarming force.
Author: odditylad

Entry: POKENAME is seen as more friendly than most Mankey fusions due to its playful nature, but care must be taken: not playing with it enough will send it into a destructive tantrum.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's large head and wobbly legs make it a very clumsy Pokémon while it's young. It often sends itself and others tumbling over accidentally.
Author: lazyarcanist

Entry: The second head provides POKENAME with a playmate to help keep it from being lonely. The two heads often trumpet in tandem while playing, and many even develop their own "secret handshakes" with their trunks.
Author: sk372

Entry: It has a playful nature and responds quickly to cues, making it popular with performers and Trainers alike. It needs to periodically roll in the mud or dive in water to cool down, as it will refuse to do anything if it's too hot.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME spends most of its day using the move Rollout. In its periods of rest, it spins its pendulum like a yo-yo to entertain itself.
Author: noel5229

Entry: Its tusks are as sharp as a Skarmory's talons. Due to the large skull on its head, it cannot see very well.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: It rolls over hard stone surfaces to polish the rock coating its body. This rolling motion helps it maintain a smooth, durable exterior.
Author: .izik

Entry: Mr. Mime's ability to create invisible objects remains within POKENAME. Interestingly, it likes to create human objects not otherwise found in nature, such as vehicles. This Pokémon is popular among a certain group of bikers.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME is able to terraform the land to its liking using its trunk and fire. If you ever find an odd volcanic area, you're probably near one's den.
Author: Phantom640

Entry: POKENAME skillfully plucks Blue Apricorns from trees using its trunk. Eating these fruits keeps its thick fur sleek and healthy, allowing it to endure harsh environments.
Author: .izik

Entry: The tire-like ends of its limbs cannot function as wheels, but they insulate it from electric attacks. This rubbery property makes it resistant to shocks.
Author: .izik

Entry: It attacks by curling up its trunk and launching itself through the air at a target. Its broad, wing-like ears can help it to fly even faster.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME will hang off of stalactites and sleep for days. If it is awakened, it will glare menacingly at its foe before attacking.
Author: .izik

Entry: Using its claws, it carefully cuts food into smaller pieces before eating. This meticulous approach makes it a surprisingly refined eater.
Author: .izik

Entry: The material covering its body resembles grey ivory, naturally growing to protect it. This tough exterior adds durability to its already robust frame.
Author: .izik

Entry: When underfed, it stomps and trumpets through its trunk in a show of anger. This loud display is enough to shake the ground around it.
Author: .izik

Entry: This armored beast charges with the momentum of a freight train and the precision of a surgical strike. Once POKENAME locks onto prey, it will not stop until the target is flattened or sliced to pieces.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: It performs intricate tricks while rolling down canyons, using its claws for balance. This agility allows it to navigate steep terrain with ease.
Author: .izik

Entry: Military academies train soldiers alongside POKENAME, as their keen eyes and sturdy physique make them great candidates for specialized operations. Their fearless disposition and strong sense of pride inspire troops during training.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Its rubbery ears allow it to hear distant sounds with impressive clarity. This heightened sense helps it detect potential threats before they arrive.
Author: .izik

Entry: The circle on its stomach is unique to each individual, showing subtle differences. Some circles display microscopic variations that set each apart.
Author: .izik

Entry: It performs somersaults midair before diving sharply toward its prey. This acrobatic maneuver allows it to strike from unexpected angles.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its large, fleshy ears allow it to glide for short periods, catching air currents as it moves. This gives it brief moments of flight when needed.
Author: .izik

Entry: It can curl its long serpentine body into a tight, tire-like coil. POKENAME will then roll either away or directly into foes at top speeds. A mother POKENAME is particularly territorial and dangerous.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It often loses balance and tumbles when rolling, but it always tries again. Its resilience and determination are evident in every attempt.
Author: .izik

Entry: A bizarre example of mimicry, POKENAME's hood patterns resemble automotive warning symbols. The exact symbol changes according to its physical health.
Author: CapWolfBane

Entry: It sucks up tiny stones into its trunk and consumes them as a source of minerals. This steady diet strengthens its rocky exterior.
Author: .izik

Entry: It suctions onto cave ceilings with its trunk and rocks back and forth while sleeping. This pendulum-like motion calms it as it rests.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses its trunk to make dents in ice, marking its territory to warn others. This icy signal keeps rivals at bay.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME train soldiers alongside military instructors, their expertise and experience command respect from both people and other Pokémon. They apply a lot of pressure during drills, and their strict yet caring nature is perfect for the role.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME's striking appearance has made it a favourite among children. Toy makers often model action figures after it, capturing its dynamic stance.
Author: eiskitsune

Entry: By collecting air in its cape, it can catch updrafts to glide over long distances. This technique allows it to travel far with minimal effort.
Author: .izik

Entry: While rolling, it extends its sharp claws, turning itself into a spinning weapon. This defensive maneuver makes it difficult for foes to approach.
Author: .izik

Entry: The position of POKENAME's trunk conveys its emotions, the trunk rising with its level of anger. In combat, it stuns opponents with its mental powers before grappling and crushing them with its trunk.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME repeatedly leap forward while curling their treads in front of them, creating a loop that propels them forward. When they arrive at their destination, they slam their treads down, using their tusks to hook them in place.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: With an extremely sturdy hide and spikes across its body, POKENAME was a powerhouse among the ancient world. A single POKENAME could defend a herd of smaller Pokémon from throngs of would-be predators.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME stealthily hunt those who have hunted Donphan, often appearing in the middle of the night. Their tusks are the only corporeal part, making them as deadly as their threatened kin.
Author: leandermalurt

Entry: With no eyes to see, it relies entirely on touch to navigate its surroundings. Its hands float independently, reaching out to sense everything around it.
Author: .izik

Entry: No two POKENAME have the same mane. The brighter their mane is, the stronger they are.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: The fur around its neck crackles with electric energy as it rolls into a tire shape, charging itself up. This electrifying spin intensifies its power.
Author: .izik

Entry: Legends speak of how POKENAME's very steps would reshape the ground. The discovery of deep, craterous, fossilized footprints has lent modern credence to these ancient tales.
Author: eiskitsune

Entry: When rolling at top speed, POKENAME's body can pass through stone with ease. During this literally incorporeal period, it becomes incredibly difficult to strike.
Author: .izik

Entry: The trunk-like appendage extending from its mouth is highly elastic, able to stretch up to 50 feet. Despite its reach, the trunk remains soft to the touch.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its tusks are extremely sensitive to environmental changes, detecting storms like tornados in advance. This sensitivity helps it stay safe from severe weather.
Author: .izik

Entry: It emits a loud trumpet noise as it slashes at its foes. This sound can be intimidating and signals its readiness to fight.
Author: .izik

Entry: Balancing on its trunk, it dances gracefully under full moonlight. This nocturnal performance is a mesmerizing sight in the wilderness.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME rolls through its habitat with unstoppable force. It is rumored to be able to roll through entire buildings.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: Its strong nose can knock down trees, allowing it easy access to fruit. This method not only provides food but also clears paths through dense forests.
Author: .izik

Entry: It spins clockwise, showering sparks around its body before delivering a powerful strike. This fiery spin intimidates opponents and scorches anything in its path.
Author: .izik

Entry: Perching atop buildings, it waits until it spots prey, then rolls vertically down the structure in pursuit. This surprising tactic allows it to ambush effectively.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are regularly found on roads and are run over quite often. The deeper the tire marks on its body, the older the POKENAME tends to be.
Author: chromaerym

Entry: It performs a dazzling samba, kicking up gravel in rhythmic patterns. This dance, especially common when it is feeling down, lifts its spirits.
Author: .izik

Entry: As it rolls, it leaks an acidic red liquid that corrodes the ground beneath it. This trail often deters any would-be pursuers.
Author: .izik

Entry: It secretes a slick mucus as it moves, which is commonly used in haircare products around Johto. This goo adds shine and strength to hair, making it highly sought after.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its body feels soft to the touch but hardens during combat. Its limbs are incredibly strong, capable of lifting objects as heavy as a bus.
Author: .izik

Entry: Due to its lack of a mouth, it consumes food and drink exclusively through its trunk. This adaptation keeps it nourished and hydrated in its own unique way.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses its trunk as an extra limb in combat, executing moves that would astonish professional wrestlers. This skill makes it a fierce and unpredictable fighter.
Author: .izik

Entry: While rolling, it shoots needles from its body in all directions. This spinning assault leaves its foes with little chance to escape unharmed.
Author: .izik

Entry: It can fire needles from its trunk with precision, pinning down prey from a distance. These powerful needles make it a skilled hunter in the wild.
Author: .izik

Entry: The sand covering its body is as sharp as broken glass, deterring any who might touch it. This rough exterior serves as a powerful defense.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite its odd shape, POKENAME charges through coral tunnels with unexpected speed. It uses its tough head to clear debris and make safe paths for schools of smaller Water-types.
Author: mgfox_66676

Entry: Using its strong tusks, it loosens gems embedded in cave walls with remarkable ease. It collects these treasures and hides them in secret spots.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses psychic power to increase its rolling speed and can even roll over water with telekinesis. This ability makes it both agile and surprising to opponents.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its trunk filters out toxins, helping it breathe near volcanic smoke. This adaptation lets it roam freely around toxic areas others avoid.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has particularly strong neck and abdominal muscles, which give it both flexibility and strength. POKENAME tend to live together in small groups.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It spits a corrosive crimson acid from its trunk to defend itself. This acidic spray can dissolve obstacles and deter foes.
Author: .izik

Entry: It enjoys rolling through rocky landscapes, exploring and finding new, optimal paths. This exploration helps it memorize routes through even the roughest terrain.
Author: .izik

Entry: This motorcycle-like Pokémon rears and trumpets before taking off. When exhausted, POKENAME emits dark smoke and a stench of burnt rubber.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: It absorbs water through the tip of its tail, allowing it to stay hydrated while it sleeps by creeks. This slow, steady intake keeps it comfortable in warm climates.
Author: .izik

Entry: It sheds its tusks once per year during the winter. The tusks themselves can be ground up and used as an anti-fungal.
Author: .izik

Entry: Using its trunks, it sucks up massive quantities of water from local streams. It uses this moisture to stay cool from the hot sun.
Author: .izik

Entry: It curls its body into a perfect circle and rolls up mountains, reaching speeds of up to 200 mph. This powerful motion lets it ascend even the steepest slopes.
Author: .izik

Entry: This fusion between two different Porygon versions resembles what is seen during evolution. It always seems uncomfortable, constantly asking to be scratched and massaged.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: A cybernetic marvel infused with psychic might, POKENAME processes data at unfathomable speeds. It embodies the future of artificial intelligence.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME is a Porygon2 program installed into a polymeric robotic body. Its holographic flames can be just as hot as real fire.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: Crafted through advanced technology, it conjures fiery eruptions, reducing all to ash with its digital might.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME is constantly angry, no matter the day. Though it can not fly, it flings itself using vines like a slingshot.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: An advanced synthetic life form possessed by a mischievous spirit, POKENAME can rapidly learn how it can best cause trouble for a victim.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: The Porygon-Z on its tail enjoys bugging the Pokémon it lives on. Just its presence makes this Pokémon's psychic abilities unstable and unpredictable.
Author: Zeeroooo

Entry: POKENAME is a sentient digital being that made its home in a shell. POKENAME's shell can withstand many hard hits from strong Pokémon.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME is a sentient digital being that made its home in a shell. POKENAME's shell can withstand many hard hits from strong Pokémon.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: They were given an upgrade to improve the speed of electronic mail delivery. They chirp in 8-bit tones when they deliver mail to Trainers.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: POKENAME are becoming increasingly favored by digital artists thanks to their versatility on computers across many creative projects.
Author: NexusShenanigans

Entry: The symbol on this Pokémon's stomach represents how much electricity it has eaten. When it gets full, it will transfer the electricity into nearby devices, which fills it with artificial intelligence.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: POKENAME moves by slithering in perfect 90 degree angles. A foreign tech company uses the pattern on its hood as their logo.
Author: HummusIsHome

Entry: POKENAME was created as a new form of Porygon2 using the data of a Pikachu that was placed into the Pokémon Storage System. However, it quickly duplicated itself and is now overabundant.
Author: bee4082

Entry: Due to a programming error, POKENAME has gotten into the advertising market. However, all of its products are shabby and broken at best.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: As it can eat and later dispose of almost any material, POKENAME is particularly used in cleaning up areas that were damaged due to the side effects of fused Pokémon. When it travels through the internet, it can concoct its own cleanup plans, too.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The first version of this Pokémon was the result of using an antivirus on a Porygon-Z. It has the powers of Porygon-Z with the emotions of a Porygon2.
Author: ValtsuRi

Entry: Thanks to the fusion, Porygon takes on the shape intended as its final form. Its much more stable behavior feels incredibly relieving to those who have trained the original Porygon-Z.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME's headset allows it to simulate battles without sustaining any injuries. Gaining combat experience makes these simulations increasingly accurate; therefore, it actively seeks out stronger opponents in hopes of refining its databases.
Author: bollocksmen

Entry: POKENAME moves with an unnatural, gliding motion, as if ignoring the laws of physics. It flickers between reality and cyberspace, making it nearly impossible to track.
Author: The Hero

Entry: POKENAME was designed to explore the acid seas of distant planets. However, the researchers have no way to get it there.
Author: .realthree

Entry: This upgraded version of POKENAME can control individual pieces of its body with pinpoint accuracy. It uses this ability in various ways, such as disassembling mid-battle to dodge an attack or separating its arms to fly after its target.
Author: Phantom640

Entry: Similar to Klefki, POKENAME is known to steal people's USB sticks and put them on its keychain for safekeeping.
Author: oatmeal42

Entry: It has an obedient personality. No matter what angle it is viewed at, the flame on POKENAME's tail seems to completely cover what is behind it and cloak it in a pink and black pattern that sometimes appears in graphic design tools.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME consumes inorganic material to live. It prefers to float in pools to drink the chlorine there.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Evolution has blessed POKENAME with a sleeker look and higher intelligence. However, it's become completely paranoid and constantly on high alert.
Author: 8xviktor

Entry: It has been upgraded to increase its data compression capabilities to astounding levels. Critics have argued that it is so densely packed that retrieving any one piece of information is effectively impossible.
Author: imademyselfdothis

Entry: POKENAME's digital body allows it to pop out of any surface at any angle. No one is sure why these holes take the form of an air vent though.
Author: ServerSizeMe

Entry: POKENAME's digital body allows it to pop out of any surface at any angle. No one is sure why these holes take the form of an air vent.
Author: ServerSizeMe

Entry: Known as "The Ball of Metal," POKENAME is known for its round shape and hefty legs. When startled, it curls up and rolls in circles at great speeds.
Author: theactualcontentyouwantreal
