Entry: It is known for forming dubious gangs of particularly devious Pokémon. While it sends its stooges on raids, POKENAME always stays in the background.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It is known for forming dubious gangs of particularly devious Pokémon. While it sends its stooges on raids, POKENAME always stays in the background.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME performs impressive displays of illusions, pantomiming, and other fantastic powers in dim lighting in front of any audience foolish enough to be engrossed. During this time, Murmime are stealing any loose valuables the audience might have.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME performs impressive displays of illusions, pantomiming, and other fantastic powers in dim lighting in front of any audience foolish enough to be engrossed. During this time, Murmime are stealing any loose valuables the audience might have.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME amuses flocks of Murkrow with shadow play techniques. They sometimes miss the mark, adding a touch of whimsy to its nightly performances.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME are very deceptive and manipulative Pokémon. They often use their psychic abilities to trick Trainers and Pokémon into doing their bidding.
Author: chrisryusaki

Entry: This Pokémon is sought out for its beautiful feathers, causing it to become distant from humans. If one manages to find POKENAME, it will attack without hesitation to protect itself.
Author: gtrwya

Entry: POKENAME is commonly found in the lower ranks of Pokémon gangs. Even though they are found in gangs, they can't stand hurting others.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Its small size belies a very ruthless and cutthroat demeanor. It strong-arms its way to becoming a leader of Murkrow gangs, arranging coordinated heists and forcing its peons to forfeit a fraction of their ill-gotten gains to it.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its deep, haunting cry is said to call restless spirits. Its vacant, distant stare is said to look into the afterlife.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: These suave Pokémon will steal feathers to build out their coat and hat. The larger the coat, the more power they have over their pack.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME will attack its Murbird goons if they fail to gather enough shiny objects. They distribute their stolen food to their young.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: POKENAME is a menacing figure cloaked in dark feathers and surrounded by flickering flames. This fierce Pokémon commands the night, using its powerful wings to unleash fiery gusts that scorch foes and intimidate rivals.
Author: ThePandaSharky

Entry: POKENAME's impressive antlers act as a roost for the murder of Murkrow that it's in charge of. POKENAME are used as a symbol of wisdom in authority.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME bullies all other Pokémon it deems lesser than itself. It can often be seen poking smaller Pokémon with the horn on its head to annoy them.
Author: typhloquil

Entry: POKENAME's eerie chirps mimic ancient incantations and chants. Prolonged exposure has been known to cause migraines and dizziness in listeners.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME from the eastern coasts grow red feather tufts along their long tails. These feathers molt when the creature is under heavy stress.
Author: .izik

Entry: Enticing and cruel, the POKENAME will be seen on dark nights, crying. Any fool who dares try to comfort it will be swallowed by the night.
Author: greatrobotmaster

Entry: Any towns where POKENAME is spotted are advised to keep all doors and windows shut, lest this Pokémon steal anything that glimmers and shines.
Author: hypernovahusky

Entry: POKENAME forms gangs of disparate Pokémon to help claim territory for itself, enforcing the boundaries of the territory with displays of strength. When forced to fight for itself, POKENAME is wily and formidable, using underhanded strategies to win.
Author: Katie

Entry: On nights said to be cursed, POKENAME leads an army of Muredge to curse an entire town. They slowly consume their life force and eventually move onto the next.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It's said that when a POKENAME looks at someone, it judges their soul. They usually are pacifistic, but become highly aggressive when threatened.
Author: ElioNagashi#0173

Entry: POKENAME doesn't often take matters into its own hands, but rather leaves its companions or subordinates to do the job, while cheering or insulting them depending on their efforts. If it gets into a fight, it'll behave as a dangerous and cruel beast.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME crafts disguises from dark feathers gathered off forest floors. It emits a distorted chirping sound as it wanders through the woods.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME discharges powerful bursts of electricity from the hat-shaped feathers atop its head. The sparks grow brighter as night falls.
Author: .izik

Entry: A POKENAME does its best to appear cute and approachable to lure humans closer. This is, however, just a devious scheme to gain food, shelter and attentive care for little return.  Once domesticated, this Pokémon becomes lazy and stubborn.
Author: SonTyp

Entry: It loves watching other Pokémon battle each other, as it excitedly tweets to encourage its friends. Many Trainers agree that with POKENAME by your side, even a Slowpoke duel becomes a thrilling spectacle to watch.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: As it evolves, POKENAME becomes very mean towards teammates favored by its Trainer for their beauty, rather than strength and effort. It will do anything to steer the team back on course, even stepping down when feeling unable to keep up.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME is extremely agressive towards everyone, even inside its own clan. It slacks off most of the time, letting its mob do its malicious bidding.
Author: galactak

Entry: Its ears act as acoustic mirrors, granting it incredible hearing and the ability to project back sound waves of its own. It uses this ability to avoid obstacles at night and rally others of its own species.
Author: flickeredflame

Entry: POKENAME are leaders of massive flocks of Noibat and Murkrow, ruling the skies at night. During the day, however, these flocks retreat to caves to hide.
Author: flickeredflame

Entry: POKENAME has the unique ability to turn anything it consumes into a material similar to cotton stuffing. The stuffing is resistant to physical impacts, so POKENAME will eat as much as possible to make its body more durable.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME grows small crystals on its body made out of Fools' Gold. It will often trick lesser-minded Pokémon into working for it for a share of its "gold".
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Despite possessing the ability to materialize diamonds out of thin air, most of the jewels in POKENAME's collection are stolen. Its "gang" of Carbinks obey its every order, lest they find themselves frozen eternally in tough crystal.
Author: bollocksmen

Entry: The "cane" POKENAME holds is actually part of its body, and inseperable from its hand.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: POKENAME's heads operate as a scale, weighing the karma of creatures and delivering a verdict. It resides in dark forests.
Author: anLcorpagent

Entry: This Pokémon appears wherever its lamp senses a disease. If it finds its patient, it already knows how to treat them.
Author: zerocipher

Entry: POKENAME acts as the charismatic, hypnotic leader of a large, troublesome group of Pokémon. It has been known to take hostages to get what it wants.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: This Pokémon appears wherever its lamp senses a disease. If it finds its patient, it already knows how to treat them.
Author: zerocipher

Entry: POKENAME secretes excess fluid out of its wings and tear ducts, which scatters to the ground. It is said to be both mildly sweet and salty.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME swings on one foot, changing direction every second, never losing its balance. It makes clicking noises as it does so.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Once a POKENAME finds a suitable place to perch, it can remain perfectly motionless for hundreds of hours at a time.
Author: itsmebrewsky

Entry: The green webbing clumped on its back resembles leaves. It can loose these orbs of silk in multiple directions, catching an opponent with ease.
Author: .izik

Entry: Due to its heavy rock-like body, it cannot fly for long periods of time. If caught in the rain, a thin film of mud will cover its stony outer layer.
Author: .izik

Entry: When it is deep in a cave and there is no light, the spheres on its head emit a dim green glow. This light pulsates with its heartbeat.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME sheds tiny stone splinters from its bark-like exterior as it moves. These sharp fragments often discourage predators, ensuring it remains undisturbed in its habitat.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME clings to cliffsides, using its small size to hide from predators. It is known to carve out crevices where it can rest safely away from the reach of larger Pokémon.
Author: .izik

Entry: Flocks of POKENAME perch along the rooftops of libraries and nearby buildings, pretending to be stone sculptures. Despite their bright coloring, they often fool predators like Talonflame.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME collect tons of sweet fruit and bring them back to their den to eat. However, if they are approached by a wild Pokémon, they will drop what they are holding except one or two pieces of fruit and try to imitate a tree, standing still.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's rocky body is coated in a thin layer of charcoal dust, which it uses to stay warm in colder environments. When threatened, it releases small puffs of soot to create cover and escape.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME thrives in the tundra, where it burrows beneath snowdrifts to avoid the cold. It stores warmth in its rocky frame, allowing it to remain active even in freezing temperatures.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME enjoys arranging begonias around its nest, using the flowers to mark its territory. It takes great care in maintaining these displays, often rearranging petals to suit its mood.
Author: .izik

Entry: When it gets upset it will unleash waves of psychic energy. It channels its power through its stone antlers.
Author: .izik

Entry: In battle, wild POKENAME often stay still, trying to mimic what they have learned from their parents. They are not yet skilled at channeling energy back at the foe, however.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: In dense jungles, POKENAME mimics plants to avoid danger. It will stay motionless for hours if it sees a predator.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon prefers solitude, disguising itself as greenery in swampy terrain. It remains motionless for days to avoid detection.
Author: leonian1586

Entry: Its body is as hard as marble. During the evenings it digs at the base of bushes to consume the nutritious roots.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME seeks out rock gardens and stands motionless, mimicking a statue. At night, it gnaws on the surrounding rocks to keep its teeth sharp.
Author: .izik

Entry: The spike on its head secretes a potent acid. It uses this corrosive liquid to make holes in cavern walls and create its nest.
Author: .izik

Entry: Researchers have yet to confirm whether POKENAME was wood that petrified after it was carved or always stone, but they agree that it is possessed.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME wanders through canyons, gathering small stones to decorate its body. Its playful nature often leads to surprise encounters with travelers exploring the winding paths.
Author: .izik

Entry: A POKENAME will shed sorrowful tears, but they are rarely genuine. It is usually either deceiving people or putting on a show.
Author: birchbot

Entry: It reminisces about its babyhood. It sometimes cries because of the nostalgic memories.
Author: birchbot

Entry: Charming and mild mannered, POKENAME seek out lavish mansions to call home. It quietly feeds on the life force of its housemates.
Author: .towerxvi

Entry: It lounges on mountaintops for long periods to absorb the sun's heat. It will channel this warmth into its fire-based attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME thrives in rocky mountains, where it absorbs minerals to harden its body. It camouflages itself among boulders, remaining motionless until disturbed.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME often gets mistaken for driftwood since it is often seen lazily drifting down rivers. It rarely ever expresses any sort of emotion.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: Some POKENAME like to sleep inside of terracotta pots. Some say that it makes them feel safe; others believe that it improves their growth.
Author: birchbot

Entry: POKENAME is a very frightened Pokémon. It takes time and dedication to get a POKENAME to trust someone.
Author: birchbot

Entry: POKENAME's saliva contains minerals that strengthen its body, making it resilient against harsh weather. It frequently licks its own body, ensuring that it remains tough and durable.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite looking like branches, the limbs coming off of its body act as antennae. The limbs can sense heat and predict weather patterns in its immediate area.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME silently follows those feeling down, using some of its ghostly gaseous form to cause them to cry. It does this not out of malice, but to try and give the person a measure of catharsis and relief through the crying.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME feeds on rich ore deposits, slowly incorporating these minerals into its rocky exterior. Over time, its body becomes a dense, glittering structure that reflects the materials it consumes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME stand perfectly still, channeling their psychic powers through their orbs to prevent passing people or Pokémon from noticing them. They only move late at night, storing people's dreams in their orbs to feast on later.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME sits still in dry environments with a clear mind. It befriends Pokémon that mistake it for plant life and soothes them with its incense.
Author: noel5229

Entry: The plants that grow on POKENAME's back float just like helium balloons. POKENAME loves to gives them out to children.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME will often steal one of their Trainer's Pokéballs and hide it among 3 to 7 fakes, depending on its mood. It expects the Trainer to guess the real one—though the joke turns dangerous, as the fakes explode when opened.
Author: dzygomer

Entry: POKENAME is very shy. However, it loves to make what little friends it does have happy. It uses its vines to do dances for its friends.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME likes to jump out of its box without warning to scare other Pokémon or its Trainer. Before you can reprimand it, it disappears again.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME traps foes inside invisible walls, then transforms into their Trainer. It uses the confusion to escape unnoticed.
Author: .izik

Entry: While sleeping, POKENAME releases a sweet Occa Berry scent from the pom on its head. The aroma calms others nearby.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can mimic the cries of several kinds of bird Pokémon. It screeches like a Fearow or Dodrio to scare away predators.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME is a lively Pokémon that is very trusting. This makes POKENAME a popular partner for beginner Trainers.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: This Pokémon has nothing but mischief on its mind. As it never remains serious, it has driven many a Trainer to livid with rage.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME delivers jokes with excellent comedic timing. They are so funny that they can make other Pokémon faint from laughter.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME frequently loses control of its psychic powers. It unintentionally erects invisible walls nearby when startled or excited.
Author: .izik

Entry: During full moon nights, POKENAME showcases the movements it copied during the day. It performs for friends in secret gatherings.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME habitually sings the same song over and over. The first piece of music it hears is what it repeats until it evolves.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME mimics the facial expressions of Trainers and Pokémon it goes up against to confuse them. If that doesn't work, it quickly runs away.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: Because of its incredible intuition, POKENAME has the ability to predict the actions of others. It preemptively mimics these actions, confusing and perplexing its foes, sometimes making them believe that they are the ones actually copying POKENAME.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME erects psychic walls around its nest to guard it. If intruders get too close, it strikes with a furious barrage of pecks.
Author: .izik

Entry: The puppets on the claws of POKENAME are often used in an intimidation tactic. Researchers are still not entirely sure that the psychic energy POKENAME emits hasn't given them consciousness.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: POKENAME hides in its incredibly robust box and plays music so that it can prank approaching people and then disappear again.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Often used by children's entertainers, POKENAME has lost the heat of other Slugma fusions. Instead, it has a warm, candy floss feel.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: The long hair of POKENAME is incredibly dense, making it impossible for this Pokémon to see. Because of this, POKENAME are often found bumping into their environment.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: POKENAME loves showing off its juggling abilities. While it seems skilled in martial arts, it mostly mimics other Pokémon's fighting styles.
Author: mahrtist

Entry: POKENAME is nocturnal and does most of its hunting at night. This is due to its slightly fluorescent frill pattern, and due to the fact that it struggles to keep excitement from its true face.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: This fusion is extremely bouncy, as if it were made of bubblegum and springs. It loves to play hopscotch with children and Pokémon alike.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME has mastered its juggling abilities and can use its psychic and magnetic abilities to keep the balls it has floating indefinitely. On occasion, Trainers have seen wild POKENAME practicing juggling routines.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: If it senses a cave-in while digging, POKENAME creates an invisible wall above its immediate area. This allows its kin time to escape safely.
Author: .izik

Entry: Thanks to its friendly appearance, POKENAME are often found in daycares performing for young children and Pokémon alike.
Author: Inksans201x

Entry: POKENAME are described as embodiments of tragedy in the performing arts, never failing to convey the dark and heart-wrenching scenes of their portrayals. They have high standards when accepting roles, only taking lead parts that peak their interest.
Author: merclipse

Entry: POKENAME are described as embodiments of comedy in the performing arts, never failing to make the audience laugh with their wholehearted efforts. They mostly aren't fussy about what roles they're cast in, but they prefer to avoid satirical comedies.
Author: merclipse

Entry: POKENAME are described as embodiments of comedy in the performing arts, never failing to make the audience laugh with their wholehearted efforts. They mostly aren't fussy about what roles they're cast in, but they prefer to avoid satirical comedies.
Author: merclipse

Entry: POKENAME studies humans near busy streets to imitate them. If caught, it will try to bite the intruder with toxic fangs before fleeing.
Author: .izik

Entry: Hiding in jack-in-the-boxes, POKENAME loves playing pranks on unsuspecting people. It seems to pity captured Pokémon, but it itself is lonely.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: Its head is so heavy that it often trips and falls over. Bald comedians sometimes dress as POKENAME while performing, and hilarity often ensues.
Author: antomelon

Entry: POKENAME is naturally quite small, but it has the ability to inflate to an enormous size, mimicking the form of a blimp. It prefers being in the sea, but appears content when being carried into the sky on strong winds.
Author: EvilGammon

Entry: POKENAME uses its powerful ears to find targets to mime. Once it hears you, it is nearly impossible to avoid being mimicked.
Author: astral_1447

Entry: This sword is as effective a cutter as a standard sword. If its blade ever pops, POKENAME uses to expelling air to fly away and regenerate elsewhere.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: The more successive bounces it achieves, the more powerful the blade and the more excited the POKENAME becomes. It happily lets kids play with it.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME traps its opponent within invisible walls before using Fire Spin. This prevents the flames from spreading uncontrollably.
Author: .izik

Entry: Unlike other Zwelious fusions, POKENAME's two heads mostly co-operate with each other and love to perform together. They work in tandem to juggle different objects with their psychic abilities.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME acts overly friendly to all who it meets. It loves to entertain children despite both kids and adults alike often being terrified of it.
Author: HummusIsHome

Entry: The hat on POKENAME's head wobbles when it walks. The white sphere at the tip acts as a microphone to help POKENAME mimic songs it hears.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME's poison is not deadly, only slightly sickening. However, it does cause intense hallucinations.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME do their best to mimic others, despite their lack of appendages. It's best to encourage this behavior, as when POKENAME get upset they can't help but release toxic spores.
Author: @enemyphase

Entry: POKENAME's voice changes based on its environment and the observations it makes. It has a foul habit of imitating the cries of a Pokémon's worst enemy to scare them into leaving their food behind.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: The confetti that comes off of POKENAME's wings are often often used at birthday parties. POKENAME is popular among entertainers as a result of this.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: POKENAME can distribute pollen enriched with psychic powers via the protrusions on its back armor. These impair the brain function of those affected.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME are popular choices for Pokémon Contests. Once it's showtime, they launch from their patient, alert pose into a bewildering series of acrobatic tricks.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME protects itself with a flexible back armor. It is very elastic and can repel physical attacks like rubber.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME prepare circus treats such as large lollipops or cotton candy. They are known to give couples and children plenty of treats, and hope people leave happy and full of memories.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: This mime has a highly aggressive disposition. Trainers should be careful training it, as it is likely to lash out with no warning.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: With only limited control of its psychic power, POKENAME rely heavily on mimicking its parents, lest it unknowingly release fatal levels of venom.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: An artificially-created variant of POKENAME, this Pokémon is prominently featured in many horror flicks as a trivial jump scare.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME's newly awakened third eye gives it strong psychic powers. It uses this power to assist its juggling.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: POKENAME distracts its opponents with tricks before delivering a swift strike. Its nose lets out a honking noise wherever it goes.
Author: blue_mythic

Entry: POKENAME dips its tail in water and wags it around like it is trying to mime a fish swimming. When something bites its tail, it will let out a reactionary honk sound after about 5 seconds.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: A very silly Pokémon, it enjoys mimicking the actions of others but does it so slowly that it often forgets what it is trying to do mid-routine. When it forgets, it will try to copy something else, usually achieving the same result.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME uses both its psychic energy and the magnetic field from its magnets to keep its juggling balls in the air. However, these powers can be quite weak, especially in younger POKENAME, so it often will drop balls.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: Upon its evolution, the extra magnetic power that POKENAME gets from its multiple heads allows for more control over its juggling. It isn't uncommon to see POKENAME floating miscellaneous metallic items around itself.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: Its life goal was to be a world-renowned performer at the circus. Unfortunately, its sharp horn has burst this dream.
Author: volvonovic

Entry: POKENAME loves to spread joy through performance. It will dance for those who are sad until they feel better.
Author: noel5229

Entry: On POKENAME's back holds a bulb containing an egg-shaped stone. When POKENAME likes a person enough, it opens up said bulb and lets them take the stone.
Author: lemage22

Entry: POKENAME wraps injured people and Pokémon in sticky silk drawn from its mouth. The thread holds healing properties that help wounds close faster.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon was discovered on April Fool's day. It tends to prank other baby Pokémon in order to cheer them up during hard times.
Author: barthandelus_real

Entry: POKENAME crawls along the tree branches, leaving behind the egg-like tip of its tail and growing new ones in its wake. These tail-tips are a healthy snack for growing young Bug-type Pokémon.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are often found amongst other species of Water-type Pokémon. They school around the nurseries of other species, taking care of the eggs left behind and carrying them to safety in case of predator attacks.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME is pacifistic in nature, and lacks major defenses. If a predator draws near, it attempts to offer the detachable orb on its tail instead, which sates most appetites for a day.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME has a habit of collecting stones and making nests out of them to sleep in. It's said that the type and shape of the stones hints what its future evolution will be.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME gives off pleasant, calming scents to help its beloved egg grow. It also uses these scents to pacify those who try to steal its egg.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME frequently mistake round stones for eggs; their food of choice. Thankfully, their fangs and jaws are very sturdy and suffer no consequences.
Author: Cristata

Entry: POKENAME frequently mistake round stones for eggs; their food of choice. Thankfully, their fangs and jaws are very sturdy and suffer no consequences.
Author: Cristata

Entry: Very early in life, POKENAME practices carrying a Magost Berry, as their round shape helps them mimic the shape of an egg. This period of time lasts approximately one year, after which it grows big enough to hold an egg properly.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It charges the stone it carries with small amounts of electricity before rubbing the stone against weary people and Pokémon. This electric massage helps to soothe and stimulate sore muscles.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME loves to mimic Chansey and Jigglypuff by playing pretend: it will give perfectly healthy Pokémon smooth, egg-like stones to 'heal' them, and will sing lullabies to help them rest. It does, however, possess a genuinely relaxing aroma.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME loves to mimic Chansey and Jigglypuff by playing pretend: it will give perfectly healthy Pokémon smooth, egg-like stones to 'heal' them, and will sing lullabies to help them rest. It does, however, possess a genuinely relaxing aroma.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME gathers up small white stones and places them together in small nests. Though normally docile, it will staunchly protect these nests, biting and scratching those coming too close.
Author: sk372

Entry: They are very energetic and mischievous Pokémon. They like to throw eggs at anything and everyone, which is why they are banned from many places.
Author: Sottiwotti

Entry: POKENAME uses the small stones it carries to practice taking care of actual plant seeds in the future. It will even bury them in fresh soil with plenty of sunlight and water provided, even singing to the stones to promote their growth.
Author: sk372

Entry: When it flies, the rapid flapping of its wings emits a low-frequency hum. It has a calming, soothing effect on those nearby, helping to relieve tension in mind and body.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME uses its antennae to sense the emotions of other Pokémon, becoming highly sensitive to even the slightest negative feelings. When overwhelmed, it lets out a loud screech, often startling other baby Pokémon in nearby nurseries.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: Old enough to sense emotion, but not strong enough to influence it with its power, it does its best to improve lives with its insuppressible cheer.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: It gathers egg-shaped stones and carries them away to create makeshift nests. These nests are always in the vicinity of ruins, suggesting a significance to their placement.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME stores egg-shaped stones inside holes dug into trees. The reasoning for doing this is twofold: practice for safeguarding actual eggs in the future, and to lick and clean tasty sap off the stones.
Author: sk372

Entry: This young POKENAME carries egg-like stones on its back, which are said to assist the Pokémon with capturing more sunlight and provide more warmth for its survival. These stones are also a key source of energy during cold nights.
Author: lemage22

Entry: It plants shiny stones in the ground and patiently waits for them to sprout. Though nothing ever grows, it beams with pride at each new one it buries.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME stashes away small, white objects it finds in a hidden hoard. It guards it by shooing away invaders with its ribbon.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It loves pretending to be other Pokémon to be able to take care of their eggs as well as their babies. It will usually hide its eggs as rocks. It gives them to those it deems pure.
Author: Salt

Entry: POKENAME can imbue some of its gentle aura into the stone it carries. When shared with others, those gifted the stone will feel more calm and peaceful while carrying it.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME loves physical touch. When its fur is stroked, little sparks fly out of its tail.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME spends all its time next to eggs, which are made from rocks turned into illusions that resemble white eggs. It loves to hang around Chansey to learn from them. However, if it loses its rocks, it will start worrying.
Author: Salt

Entry: POKENAME drifts through fields in search of rocks to plant seeds around. It tends to the rock in the center of the garden as if it were a patient in need of help, practicing with the medicinal herbs that it grows.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME greatly enjoys resting in the nests of different Pokémon, but its spikes are prone to harm eggs and butts alike.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: POKENAME dances and cheers to support its teammates, often preferring it to actually being in battle. After grueling matches, it rushes to its friends' side to deliver a light electric massage with its pom-poms.
Author: sk372

Entry: It is friendly and gets along with almost any Pokémon. It is entirely selfless and will placate aggressors with songs and gifts.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's egg is actually a large white boulder, which it will use to bludgeon its opponents. Outside of combat, POKENAME will do anything to keep its boulder as clean as possible.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME can be found feeding on plankton in calm, shallow waters. Lovers who walk on the beachside often compare its feeding habits to soft kisses.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: POKENAME's eggs are packed with high amounts of protein. It will give out its eggs to weaker Pokémon to encourage them to become the best version of themselves.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It becomes very emotionally attached to the egg-shaped stone it carries. It cannot retreat into its shell while holding it, so it often gets hurt protecting its precious cargo.
Author: sk372

Entry: This Pokémon is playful and mischievous, often using static electricity to zap unsuspecting Trainers. Its bulb stores energy, which it uses to power its pranks and playful antics.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME produce a type of citrus that has an electrifying and bitter taste. It is a popular ingredient in sour candies.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: It electrifies the bone club it carries to enhance its effectiveness in battle. POKENAME can even tether it to itself via sustained lightning and control its midair trajectory to ensure it hits the target.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME uses its springy limbs to climb high trees, where it sits and waits for lightning to strike its tail. Some theorize it is trying to protect the forests.
Author: darxer_

Entry: POKENAME draws lightning from thunderstorms to give its egg an energizing effect when eaten. Its eggs are very popular amongst sprinters and marathon runners.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It slices through foes with its three tails as it runs. It uses its horns to fire off lightning bolts.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: When not transformed, POKENAME maintains a Raichu-like shape, seemingly viewing it as the ideal form for itself. Under close observation, one can see electricity arcing within its gelatinous body.
Author: sk372

Entry: It appears to simply be a very large Raichu at first glance. If its feet don't give away that it's part Snorlax, its appetite will.
Author: Faelocke

Entry: POKENAME's behavior isn't aggressive even when it has stored a lot of electricity in its pouches due to being part Snorlax. If its pouches are low on electricity, POKENAME will feel tired and might fall asleep to regather electricity.
Author: mbavenger64

Entry: This kindhearted Pokémon has been known to guide ships during storms, using its body to absorb lighting strikes as it flies.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: Its stingers are known to pack a punch of 11,000 volts when used to attack. When captured, many use rubber caps to prevent shocking.
Author: SupersonicLoki

Entry: POKENAME stretches its tail upwards during thunderstorms to obtain energy. Sometimes they are also observed feeding in power plants.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME has mastered its control over electricity. The electricity POKENAME generates between its tails can be sent out in disruptive currents.
Author: CodeWolfie

Entry: With charged wings, POKENAME can fly long distances with little energy expenditure. If it is attacked, it flaps its wings wildly.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME enjoys flying through nearly any conditions, but it dislikes the extreme cold. It loves flying through the skies after a thunderstorm.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME is proud of its magnificent hair feathers. If anyone tries to touch it against its will, it punishes them with painful electric shocks.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME is proud of its magnificent hair feathers. If anyone tries to touch it against its will, it punishes them with painful electric shocks.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME enjoys flying through nearly any conditions, but dislikes extreme cold. It especially loves flying through the skies after a thunderstorm.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME enjoys flying through nearly any conditions, but dislikes extreme cold. It especially loves flying through the skies after a thunderstorm.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It plants its tail into the base of wilting plants and shocks them back to life. The plants it revives this way often take on a zigzag pattern.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: This Pokémon's electrified vines are employed in construction to lift and manipulate metal beams. Its calming hum helps workers stay focused in high-stress environments.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Its tail attracts strange signals from the environment, causing it to spark violently when overloaded. These sparks leave marks that look like fragments of a forgotten writing.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME is incredibly energetic and excitable. It will often weave around Trainers feet while on walks, with electricity sparking off its tail.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: They have a very festive nature that they take very seriously. POKENAME give out gifts to other Pokémon, but will shock anyone being naughty.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: A Yellow Scarf allows POKENAME to stand out against the crowd as their tough and gritty personalities surface. They are also known to hold Thunder Stones with them to bring out their boldness.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is a very rare, docile creature. Legends say that it once guarded both sky and sea and caused major storms to those who threatened the ecosystem. POKENAME is almost never seen in the wild, so catching one is seen as good luck.
Author: zoro_the_zoura

Entry: This playful Pokémon weaves through shadows, crackling with electric energy and mischief. With a flick of its tail, it conjures ghostly illusions to confuse opponents, striking with surprising speed and agility.
Author: ThePandaSharky

Entry: Researchers theorize this form may be one Raichu took naturally in a distant past of Kanto history. It has yet to be determined why Raichu can no longer naturally take this form.
Author: sk372

Entry: Having journeyed here from Alola on cargo ships, POKENAME is an invasive species that is known to electrocute attackers or predators. Other than that, it's mostly passive.
Author: aberry8286

Entry: POKENAME charges itself with electricity on the surface, then leaps into the air and crashes into the ground, tail first, to dig itself in.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: When POKENAME energizes its spikes and tail, curls up and shoots off, it can even shatter entire houses and rock formations when it hits them.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME concentrates electricity into its blade-like elbows, refining its strikes while ensuring no stray bolts harm its allies. Should this power become unstable, its chivalrous nature gives way to fierce aggression.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: POKENAME concentrates electricity into its blade-like elbows, refining its strikes while ensuring no stray bolts harm its allies. Should this power become unstable, its chivalrous nature gives way to fierce aggression.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: When POKENAME energizes its spikes and tail, curls up and shoots off, it can even shatter entire houses and rock formations when it hits them.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: When POKENAME energizes its spikes and tail, curls up and shoots off, it can even shatter entire houses and rock formations when it hits them.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: When POKENAME energizes its spikes and tail, curls up and shoots off, it can even shatter entire houses and rock formations when it hits them.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME retains Lucario's ability to read auras. If it senses bad intentions from a person, it will not hesitate to Thunderpunch them in the face.
Author: gellyfishsh

Entry: The flower on its back hums with stored electricity, often used to jump-start dead generators in rural areas. Its well-meaning nature is offset by its clumsiness, as it frequently zaps itself while trying to assist.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME's blade vibrates and it panics at the slightest sound. It prefers solitude, but when cornered, its vibrations enhance its damage.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME has a tail that resembles the head of a glaive and can cut through thin layers of steel. When it needs an extra boost, it pumps its tail full of electricity to give it an edge in combat.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It communicates with other POKENAME by connecting their lighting-shaped ribbons and sending shocks between them.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: A result of two different evolution stones, POKENAME are spotted only on rare occasions. It burrows its caves into mountains, filling it with surges of electrical energy. This also provides shelter for smaller electric and ground Pokémon.
Author: ThePandaSharky

Entry: POKENAME is capable of running 3 million volts through its veins, which is 30 times stronger than a Raichu's body can emit. Scientists believe this is due to Groudon's ability of maintaining immense power.
Author: @over9001

Entry: Their cheek pouches store static electricity that builds up in their fluffy fur. Too much of it can make them clingy and needy.
Author: Faelocke

Entry: POKENAME likes to dance gracefully in grassy fields. When multiple POKENAME dance together, their tails glow brightly with electricity.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: Despite their cute appearance, Trainers are advised against creating POKENAME as their thunderous buzz of a cry can cause hearing damage.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: Because of its appearance, POKENAME is often mistaken for a grounded nimbus cloud. Travelers have been known to be shocked by it.
Author: SupersonicLoki

Entry: POKENAME swims through the desert sand while hunting. Once it finds its prey, it discharges 100,000 volts, causing most Pokémon to faint instantly.
Author: bunkachunka

Entry: POKENAME's modified tails lets it sense electrical patterns. They also sense what they touch, discharge extra electricity, and grab and hold things.
Author: totodile.

Entry: A house inhabited by multiple POKENAME will frequently suffer from power outages due to their heavy consumption of electricity. If it stores too much, the lightbulbs on its arms will shatter, causing uncontrollable fires.
Author: thatdanguy23

Entry: When it dives at prey, its tail stiffens and straightens out. Spectators lucky enough to view this phenomenon describe it as a living thunderbolt.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Inside the head of its disguise is a powerful electric bulb. If the bulb is exposed, it will shock anyone nearby until covered again.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: Carrying through life with a playful personality, you may find a POKENAME goofing around with lampposts and power lines.
Author: SupersonicLoki

Entry: POKENAME is able to store over 10,000 volts of electricity in its body, making it prone to static electricity. It also loves to hug kind Trainers.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME uses its tail as a lightning rod to absorb electricity. It then flings itself at opponents to violently electrocute them.
Author: gamertag1001.

Entry: It will grab any prey it lays eyes on. Once captured, POKENAME sends a small electric current through its talons to keep its meal from moving.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME's sharp fangs are charged with electricity, shocking its prey until they become paralyzed. Despite its electrical power, POKENAME is very friendly and loves to playfully nuzzle its Trainer.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Wild POKENAME protect their Thunder Stones. If someone tries to steal them, they go berserk. They hit wild Pikachu with the Stones to force evolution.
Author: DonutsBG

Entry: Its two tails act as the perfect lightning rods during a thunderstorm. This way, it can safely carry up to 3 people at an incredible speed, until finding proper shelter.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: One should not get deceived by the fact that it doesn't smell bad. Its body releases high amounts of mercury, lead, and battery sulfate, highly toxic to the environment.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: The bulbs on POKENAME's head store the electrical energy it uses for its attacks. It secretes a poison that closely resembles battery acid.
Author: knilk

Entry: When POKENAME has too much stored electricity, it will scatter electrically charged pollen. This pollen can be used to power large machinery.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: It absorbs sunlight with its petals to recharge energy. It often dances in the breeze, releasing gentle sparks that mesmerize onlookers.
Author: dammaskk

Entry: Bearing a resemblance to Golem's Alolan counterpart, POKENAME is less aggressive by comparison, but contains far greater stores of electricity. An angered POKENAME could carve chunks out of a mountain with its lightning bolts.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its mane and tail are made of a hot plasma that on contact, will cause nasty burns all over the victim's body. Its internal electricity allows for POKENAME to run up to 80 mph.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME builds up internal stores of electricity as it races across the land. When it finally stops, it releases the stored-up energy in a powerful burst, creating vicious electric storms all around it.
Author: sk372

Entry: By charging its pendulum with static, it can use it as a makeshift compass to find the closest source of electricity, which it feeds on.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: POKENAME subsists off of berries that fall from trees. Unfortunately, its heads have different tastes, and will often move in conflicting directions.
Author: hortensia_xxiii

Entry: Its horn has its own sense of 'smell'. POKENAME uses this horn like a dowsing rod to track down food, and unhinges its jaw to gulp the meal down.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME is always cheerful and gets joy out of making people and Pokémon happy. POKENAME are made of a slimy substance.
Author: kingnekogamingvt

Entry: Their appetite is enormous, as their bodies require a diet twice their body weight to maintain a healthy size. Cheaply made doughnuts help fill them up with calories.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME was initially thought to be cannibalistic in early scientific reports, until further research revealed that it simply devours its own shed skin immediately after molting.
Author: sk372

Entry: Their absentminded flying causes them to catch onto kites as they glide past. They are known to rest atop cliffs and ask for help when this happens, unable to untangle themselves.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME often gets food caught in its hair. The excess food falls out as it moves along, causing scavengers to follow behind it.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME has a habit of sneaking into towns and raiding candy shops, storing its loot inside its oversized beak. Trainers often find mysterious candy wrappers in its nest as evidence of its mischief.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: Both mouths are just as hungry as each other. The bigger one usually gets the scraps.
Author: birchbot

Entry: POKENAME eats and eats, but it is never satisfied. Scientists believe there is something akin to a black hole in its stomach, for POKENAME never creates any kind of biological byproduct. Oddly, it doesn't appear to actually need to eat to survive.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The cheesy liquid secreting from POKENAME is a very well-seasoned condiment. It is used in many dishes, such as mac and cheese, pizza, and mozzarella sticks.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: POKENAME ravages homes, farms, restaurants, and warehouses for their food. It absorbs food particles through its spoon and forked blade.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME are so indolent as to be almost immobile for 90 percent of their life. They lay around in clearings or near civilization, opening their mouth at passersby in the hopes of food being shared with them.
Author: sk372

Entry: It has little care in the world, eating all it wants and going about its way. The component that evolves first determines its path later in life.
Author: miecreates

Entry: POKENAME is a glutton by nature. It enjoys stuffing its mouth with rocks and minerals. However, small Pokémon sometimes fall victim to its episodes.
Author: 8xviktor

Entry: Despite being able to survive with little food, POKENAME will consume anything it can find. If someone tries to take its food, it will bash them with its thorny arms.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's blanket-like body occasionally houses other Pokémon in exchange for berries or silk. It uses that silk to create its decorations.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME tends to avoid moving. If it needs to, it'll drag itself to a new location or catch a ride on another Pokémon.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: While typically hidden, POKENAME does have back legs. The blanket-like segment of its body is attached to its back like a cape.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: The mushroom inhabiting POKENAME grows to appear as and taste like delicious food to help the spores spread to other organisms.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The mushroom inhabiting POKENAME grows to appear as and taste like delicious food to help the spores spread to other organisms.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The mushroom inhabiting POKENAME grows to appear as and taste like delicious food to help the spores spread to other organisms.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Be careful when you're on a picnic, as a POKENAME might just pop out of the ground to steal your food. They have very quick reflexes, popping in and out of the ground within a single second.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME swings from tree to tree with surprising agility. It will attack anyone that refuses to give it food.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Its massive appetite is due in part to the calories needed to maintain its strict training regimen. Eating and training are so intertwined it will often be seen with a full mouth even while exercising.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is rarely seen at the surface, its voracious appetite leading it to eat its way through the ground in search of minerals. The tunnels left behind in its wake are often used by hopeful prospectors hunting for rare metals.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME floats in acidic waters so if a thunderstorm hits, it can easily absorb the electricity from them. They are also common around power plants.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It picks up fish bones to use as headgear and a club for defense. On moonlit nights, it can sometimes be seen drawing the outline of a Mantine in the sand, then curling up and resting in the center.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME flutters around beaches, preferring to feed from flowers that grow nearer to seawater. It likes to play with beach-goers by tickling them with its antennae.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME loves helping rear young children, using charades as a way to turn learning things like numbers and shapes into a game. Upon a right answer, POKENAME claps and embraces the child to reward their efforts.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's dance is a bouncy, playful movement taking place on the seashore. It's said if a large enough group dance together, the seas will be smooth and calm for days afterward.
Author: sk372

Entry: Each POKENAME has a unique pattern in its hair. When it swims to the surface, nearby people in boats can observe this pattern.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME grabs onto surfboards with its strong suckers to ride the waves. However, it often causes surfers to lose balance and wipe out.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME adores soaring over the ocean during sunset. The sun's golden light glimmers off its sleek body as it rides the waves.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME spends most of its time underwater, but breaches out onto land to occasionally share eggs it creates with humans and other Pokémon. The eggs are especially effective for combating seasickness.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are very playful Pokémon and love to jump in and out of the water to surprise tourists. They are very popular in aquariums and marine parks as kid-friendly attractions.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's ambulatory nature allows it to wade onto land for food, shoveling large amounts of sand into its mouth to eat the tiny creatures within.
Author: chiari_queen

Entry: Zipping through the water, POKENAME move in groups called squads. Sailors often regard these Pokémon as pests due to their tendency to race boats.
Author: chiari_queen

Entry: POKENAME is a common sight within water parks. Its swimming skills and friendly, gentle nature, particularly with children, make it an excellent lifeguard as well as mascot.
Author: sk372

Entry: It is extremely friendly and sociable, especially with seafaring humans. It seems unaware that its large size makes it a danger to its smaller playmates.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: This mischievous Pokémon entertains itself by playfully firing bubbles at unsuspecting beach-goers out of its cannon-like arms.
Author: regula

Entry: POKENAME's large body floats just inches above the sea's surface. It travels at sunrise, appearing like a drifting island.
Author: .izik

Entry: A POKENAME uses its melodic voice to control the ocean currents that flow between its antennae. It can use these currents to move much faster.
Author: MrPeach774

Entry: POKENAME playfully glide out of the waters of their rivers and coast on the air for a time . Curious by nature, they will approach others to play.
Author: totodile.

Entry: It spends its days drifting along wind and ocean currents. It clings to flagpoles and coral so that it doesn't fly into danger when it's asleep.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: Many small fish Pokémon hide in the fronds of POKENAME. This creates a symbiotic relationship, where POKENAME provides safety in exchange for the fertilizer created by these other Pokémon.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: Schools of POKENAME spin in the air like helicopters over the sea. Together, they unleash toxins to devour massive prey like Wailord.
Author: .izik

Entry: Extremely friendly, POKENAME is often sought for petting zoos because it is so social and enjoys splashing in the mud with children.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME glides sideways over the ocean waves, leaving a sparkling trail of heart-shaped bubbles in its wake. Many painters use this Pokémon as inspiration for their art.
Author: .izik

Entry: Although POKENAME's stingers contain large amounts of venom, it is so friendly that it will rarely harm humans. Some POKENAME will even try and come ashore to play with people, even though it quickly dries out on land.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: POKENAME floats through the ocean in small families using their sticky tentacles to collect plankton before licking them clean. Adolescents enjoy playing games, often found chasing each other around.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: A POKENAME covets golden coins to the point of occasionally leaving its regular frigid territory to hunt for wild Meowth. Its beak and claws aren't the only danger to humans, as it often attacks with its razor sharp wing feathers.
Author: SonTyp

Entry: POKENAME is a solitary hunter inhabiting colder regions. It lures parent Pokémon away from their nests before using the distraction to quickly snatch and eat the unguarded eggs.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME leaves scratches on trees with delicious berries. Any Pokémon who steals POKENAME's berries will be surrounded by their pack and consumed.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: POKENAME with the longest and biggest tusks lead their hunting parties. They bring down prey by rolling and slamming into them.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: The leader of a pack of Snearogues, POKENAME is never seen without its gang. It barks orders all day, and initiates fights with rival gangs.
Author: JackytheWannabe

Entry: POKENAME are both incredibly mischievous and incredibly social, forming tight-knit packs. Each of its limbs can be deadly.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are both incredibly mischievous and incredibly social, forming tight-knit packs. Each of its limbs can be deadly.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It can only discharge excess electricity through its claws. Because of this, POKENAME gets progressively more vicious the longer it hunts.
Author: mimigaagua

Entry: POKENAME only targets foes at night. While this mischievous Pokémon possesses sharp fighting instincts, it tends to only go for weaker enemies.
Author: ThePandaSharky

Entry: Despite their regal appearance, POKENAME are quite brutal. They prefer to bask in the sun and let their Weavbas entourage fight, but they will still use their sharp, clawed fins to shred in defiance.
Author: scrapsorra

Entry: POKENAME is the perfect Pokémon to run away from a large group of Trainers, such as cops or grunts. They can detect every single one of them in a large radius to trace the best escape route. The presence of Fairy-types seems to blur their senses.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Often seen in factories with illegal working conditions, POKENAME's magnetic field is used to trap toxic gas wastes from these factories, then filter it with its internal filtering system. The clear, dewy air it creates is often turned into cologne.
Author: Beatdoof

Entry: POKENAME's mouth exposes its inner core, a very sensitive area. If messed with, it could possibly explode with a yield of 10,000 gigatons. As such, very few evolve their Magnezing further to this form.
Author: silvertotodile

Entry: Using electricity manipulated via its antennae, it can control magnets in battle.  A pair of drone-like entities follow it at all times, aiding in battle as well as scouting for good feeding spots.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME generates such strong magnetic force that it can use them to create barriers. It can also climb effortlessly along metal objects.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME generates such strong magnetic force that it can use them to create barriers. It can also climb effortlessly along metal objects.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME's massive eye doesn't actually have great vision. However, it uses electromagnetic waves like echolocation, so it gets by just fine.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Utilizing magnetic energy, POKENAME can release powerful electrified plasma. They prefer high places, where the sunlight is strongest.
Author: zespud

Entry: POKENAME uses a mixture of magnetism, electricity and extendable claws to disorient and capture targets. Once seized, it simply observes them closely before releasing them; its motivations for doing so are still unknown.
Author: sk372

Entry: It emits croaking, buzzing calls that vary widely in tone and frequency. Carrying far across the water bodies POKENAME lives by, the calls contain a wealth of information that other POKENAME decode, allowing them to coordinate against threats.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: The body is only used to eat and drink, and the brain and all of the other functionality is within the shell atop this Pokémon's head. POKENAME has intense electromagnetic powers.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Radios become unusable when POKENAME draws near. The electromagnetic waves it sends out cannot be defined on the spectrum as we know it.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME have been seen clumping together to amplify their strength. Researchers believe these clumps to be the origin of modern sentence structures.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME was created by Silph Co. as a flying surveillance drone. They are very popular with companies as an effective surveillance measure.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: This Pokémon lures Skarmory by mimicking their shape. It channels magnetic waves through their metal bodies to fly.
Author: squawkabairdy

Entry: A powerful supercomputer built by an ancient civilization long ago. Some say it has the power to grant wishes, as well as bend space and time at will.
Author: hypernovahusky

Entry: A powerful supercomputer built by an ancient civilization long ago. Some say it has the power to grant wishes, as well as bend space and time at will.
Author: hypernovahusky

Entry: After years of failure trying to improve Magnezone, a scientist had the idea to simply fuse two Magnezone together. The resulting Pokémon has the strange ability to mobilize a swarm of Magnemite and Magneton to its own ends, which remain unknown.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME's electromagnets are strong enough to destroy skyscrapers. Trainers should be careful not to carry any electronic devices near a POKENAME.
Author: kingd8

Entry: In battle, POKENAME can devastate foes with powerful strikes and searing beams of energy. However, its energy consumption is so vast that it needs to recharge after every action.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME uses the magnets in its body as a compass, helping it steer in different directions. It charges these magnets to help pull it as it swims, allowing it to glide effortlessly against the tides.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Once considered as an alternative to power plants, a POKENAME can generate power for an entire city with the perpetual motion of its gears. However, as city planners learned, the immense magnetic field it generates disrupts most electronics.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: It enjoys wrapping its wire-like feelers around its owner's arms. However, this usually ends up electrocuting the Trainer.
Author: gellyfishsh

Entry: POKENAME's body emits an incredibly strong magnetic field. Legends say this field is strong enough to warp space itself.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Thanks to its head-mounted antenna, POKENAME can pinpoint the smallest temperature changes over several kilometers. For this reason, it is often used in covert military operations.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME docks its magnets to its antenna to discharge powerful electricity in all directions. It is often used as a security precaution for important buildings, as it can scan its surroundings for many meters with its eye.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its eye can shoot lasers to attack or heat its hollow interior. Its well-insulated body acts as a blast furnace that can reach several thousand degrees. POKENAME can fire this destructive heat via its magnets.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME protect various power plants across the world. They are engineered to be cunning, brilliant, and loyal.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: Herds of POKENAME are commonly spotted near factories or garbage dumps, consuming any scrap metal they find. Its main flower acts as a means of communication, sending signals to other POKENAME.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: POKENAME steals metal items from people, seeking quality items to enhance its mechanical body. It has no intention of returning anything it takes.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: POKENAME's very existence is a threat to power grids. If one ends up in the wrong place, it could shut down an entire region in an instant.
Author: cipherlingarde

Entry: POKENAME's body is comprised of various pieces of scrap metal held together by a strong magnetic field. It will use this field to imbue the metal with an electric charge that will produce a nasty shock on contact.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME was created to appeal to children, but it doesn't know the strength of its own hugs. For some reason, its insides are filled with steel wool.
Author: robosoup

Entry: The tentacles of this Pokémon are made of an extremely durable metal and are protected by a constant stream of electricity emitted from its antenna. There are incidents of this Pokémon accidentally electrocuting and hospitalizing their Trainers.
Author: VoidDx01

Entry: It relies on a Stretchy Spring to make quick exits out of a battle. If it is locked into battle, it could mean that a part of the spring mechanism is jammed.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME floats around in space, emitting strange electromagnetic signals from its body. Scientists believe POKENAME could be used as a natural satellite.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The rocky shell around the center of POKENAME is formed of ore, held there by an electromagnetic field. The ore can be shot as a projectile in combat.
Author: therider

Entry: If an excess of Magnemite gather while trying to form Magneton, they may accidentally collapse into one body. With all of their brains combined into one, POKENAME is far more efficient and focused than it was previously.
Author: .fedoraman & wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: In the rare event of several Magnemite conjoining and evolving at once, this Pokémon can evolve. Its true eyes orbit around it, scanning the environment for information.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME shoots its magnetic slime at opponents. The slime is nearly impossible to get off, and leaves them unable to get away from POKENAME.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It stores excess energy within its shell during periods of inactivity, emitting a faint glow. It will defensively hide in its shell when threatened.
Author: lynkinator

Entry: POKENAME are found among beaches and shores, searching for anything metallic. Most POKENAME tend to accidentally wander into large cities because of the abundance of factories, causing a ruckus everytime they do so.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: It is slightly more mobile due to its reduced weight and size. Its saliva now contains a paralyzing effect, shocking anything that touches its tongue.
Author: Cascadeguy

Entry: When fully unfurled, POKENAME's tongue is long enough to wrap around a minivan multiple times. It uses this to capture multiple prey at once, reeling them in with impressive dexterity.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its many tongues act as extra limbs, leaving it constantly thirsty and desensitized to taste. It will greedily lap up entire lakes to stay hydrated.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: It flies quickly through caves and licks the ground with its long tongue to pick up as much food as possible. It spits out stones and similar items.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME lick their Trainers all the time. Instead of it being cute, like with Lillipup, it just seems creepy.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME uses its long tongue to pluck Nanab Berries from high branches, favoring their sweet flavor. Consuming them causes its wool to take on a soft pink hue, which intensifies as it eats more.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME channels electricity through its saliva, creating tiny sparks that crackle along its tongue. It uses this ability to shock fruit from trees before eagerly lapping them up.
Author: .izik

Entry: At night, POKENAME wraps its tongue around pine branches to anchor itself. This prevents it from being blown away by strong winds.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its sticky tongue to anchor itself to birch trees during strong windstorms. It enjoys swaying in the breeze, inhaling airborne spores as a snack.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has an exceptional sense of taste, navigating the oceans by sensing the differences in water chemistry that tell it if there's food or a predator around. Their saliva has a toxic element, letting them defend themselves with their tongues.
Author: Katie

Entry: Given enough time, its saliva can dissolve almost any material. Trainers with a POKENAME must keep an eye out for it furtively licking their electronic devices, hoping to get at the tasty data inside.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: The slick saliva coating POKENAME's tongue allows it to slither in a serpentine-like fashion. This saliva is highly toxic, paralyzing prey before it coils around them for an easy meal.
Author: .izik

Entry: This fusion's appearance is influenced by the two Lickilicky's strong desires for sweet foods. It is often found raiding confectionary shops.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: It uses its saliva to immobilize its prey before slurping their blood with its front tongue. Its wings are actually the tongues that are on its back.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: POKENAME has one of the most distinguished taste of all beings. If a Trainer creates a dish which pleases its tongue, they will be blessed in having every dish taste spectacular.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: Its tongue blade deals damage not through cutting, but the corrosive saliva it produces. It also wraps around opponents and numbs their skin.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It bounces on its powerful tongue which can coil up like a spring. It's said a POKENAME ascends to a higher form when it can launch itself into orbit.
Author: GenesisParallax

Entry: Despite POKENAME's bright colors and simplistic face, the teeth-based nightmares it causes are haunting. The secondary mouth houses an endless void.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME licks cave walls to leave behind a charged, conductive saliva that spreads electrical pulses. If it senses movement nearby, it electrifies the webbing it has laid out between the saliva to act as an alarm system.
Author: .izik

Entry: When two POKENAME fight, they use their immensely long tongues as whips, moving the tips at supersonic speeds. Their formidable-looking tusks are used to cut down trees rather than for fighting, letting them access food high in the branches.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME's wings are very sensitive to every aspect of their surroundings The powder it spreads causes severe itching and rashes.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Despite their unpleasant appearance, POKENAME are known to be the partners of food connoisseurs due to their very sensitive sense of taste.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its horns are very tough and rubbery. Many companies use POKENAME's armor for products like bouncy balls, slingshots, and erasers.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME's oily saliva allows its own gears to move with incredible efficiency. By licking machinery, it prevents rust buildup, making it surprisingly useful in mechanical repairs.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME tastes the jelly around it to help it think. The flavor changes depending on its mood.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME's tongue is too large to fit in its body. It buries itself in dirt to keep it from drying out.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME uses its tusks to dig into Bug-type Pokémon colonies, feeding on the honey within with its long sticky tongue. It usually can't stay long at any colony as its hide is soft, leaving it vulnerable to retaliation from the angry bugs.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME uses its powerful tusks to fight with rivals, its long tongue used to try and grapple the tusks of its opponents and prevent a counter-attack. Fights between the Pokémon are often messy as a result.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME is an absolute glutton that eats anything that even comes close. Rumor has it that it is even responsible for the disappearance of hikers.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Since POKENAME's introduction to the wild, it has become a common pest. It will often grab travellers' legs with its tongue, making them fall over.
Author: ForbiddenBread

Entry: POKENAME uses its flexible tongue to regularly clean out its ears. It may be gross, but its hearing is always on point.
Author: dudeasaur

Entry: POKENAME uses its massive tongue to reach into insect nests to eat the honey inside. However, it sometimes gets its tongue stuck in the nests and will flail around violently to get it off.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME love to lick whatever they find as a show of affection. They seem to be able to track anything just by tasting its surroundings.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's tongue is extremely hot, so it uses it while in combat. Instead of using its ability to see into the future to gain an upper hand in battle, it uses it to find where the best foods are.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME is incredibly loyal and dutiful, but needs to be fed regularly. If it goes hungry, POKENAME can make a big mess with its strong tongue.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME may appear harmless and simple, but it can easily grasp and devour things and creatures several meters in size with its tongue. For this reason, some organizations use it as a guard.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Using its tongue as a counterweight, POKENAME can lift as much as eighty-nine chili dog carts. Beware, though, as it has an "all the cart" appetite.
Author: cyprexx

Entry: POKENAME work alongside mead breweries to produce high-quality mead, which they taste to ensure consistency. They are known to celebrate successful batches by drinking alongside brewers.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Mead brewers cultivate POKENAME colonies to help them determine whether batches are too bitter. POKENAME are known to prefer mead over honey, unlike other plant species.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME feeds by using its extraordinarily long tongue as a lure at the water's edge, waiting for unsuspecting Pokémon to bite it so it can reel the food in. Unfortunately, it has incredibly slow reaction times and often lets its food get away.
Author: Katie

Entry: It laps up the toxic film it leaves on the ground and its foes. This Pokémon will eat anything; the stench of POKENAME changes based on what it eats.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME digs into soft sand to rest, leaving only its tongue visible. The meat in its claws has a noticeably salty flavor.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: Fusion has awakened the strength of Mega Beedrill within POKENAME and incorporated the monstrous power and durability of Rhyperior. While its armor plating is considerably heavy, under the right conditions, no opponent can defeat it.
Author: Walter Teigan

Entry: POKENAME swarms can be found in canyons and cliffs, drilling rocks with their long horns to extract minerals. Easily agitated, they will attack any nearby creature regardless of size.
Author: milchik

Entry: POKENAME like to catapult little Georaid at their targets, but the Georaid are of the opinion that it should be throwing little Rhyraid instead.
Author: funktytomate

Entry: POKENAME digs winding tunnels with its large drill-like horn. These tunnels allow for ambushes on unsuspecting targets and lead back to its den.
Author: EvilGammon

Entry: This fusion stores up to 20,000 volts within its body. POKENAME then uses this electricity to power up the drills on the ends of its tails.
Author: milchik

Entry: The fire energy stored in its body can be released through the palms of its hands. POKENAME can launch hot explosive rocks at its foes thanks to it.
Author: milchik

Entry: POKENAME can withstand any sword and is able to drill through diamond, let alone any shield or armor.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It sharpens its drill to prepare for combat with a fellow POKENAME. In a real confrontation, however, the POKENAME with a smaller drill will usually flee.
Author: Busilisk

Entry: It can use its tendrils to lift huge boulders and crack them like eggs. Even solid bedrock cannot withstand sustained drilling from its mighty horn.
Author: wigglypon

Entry: POKENAME latch onto the tops of caverns with its drill tendrils to prey upon unaware Rock types. It can easily crack through a Golem's hard carapace.
Author: ServerSizeMe

Entry: POKENAME marks its territory by drilling large tunnels. Anything and anyone that falls into these tunnels become its prey.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: Its body feels rubbery to the touch, but will become hard in response to physical trauma or if it gets detached from its core. The sole existence of this fusion causes earthquakes and heavy sunshine, for it awakens the anger of Groudon.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: The drills POKENAME have are produced from the minerals they consume. Those with a strictly gemstone diet can develop crystal drills.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: The gems and stones adorning its body are highly valued. Unfortunately for sellers, POKENAME will never give up its hoard.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME are useful for construction thanks to their drills. Uncontrolled POKENAME have been known to damage towns by tunneling under them.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME often gathers at construction sites, acting as a wrecking ball for demolitions. Its stone armor resembles personal protective equipment, reflecting its dedication to safety.
Author: merclipse

Entry: This fusion is often used for demolition work. However, there have been reports of workers disappearing without a trace once POKENAME was on site.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME's vines are terrifyingly powerful. However, they are not as easy to regrow as Tangela's, so POKENAME will attack anyone who grows too close.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: With a tough rocky shell and two layers of durable vines, the core of POKENAME is well protected against physical attacks. However, this makes it difficult for POKENAME to eat, so it must dissolve food externally before absorbing nutrients.
Author: Alumed

Entry: POKENAME wanders swamps and thick brush, desperately thrashing around. It always seems to be trying and failing to free itself from its own tentacles.
Author: puppetmaster64

Entry: It can extend its wing-shaped vines over many meters. In this way, POKENAME can glide many hundreds of kilometers with little effort.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: This Pokémon's body contains many more vines than it seems. No matter how many are cut, burned, or frozen off, there's always more covering it.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: While most vines on a POKENAME are soft and flexible, the horn vine is as tough as granite. The softer vines can restrict and ensnare opponents while the horn strikes them.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: This Pokémon is a predator in its native jungle environment and thrives in sunlight. To hunt, it first stalks its prey for hours, until at an opportune moment it hurls the vines on its head with such force that they can cut through almost anything.
Author: SonTyp

Entry: POKENAME's vine blade functions both as a whip and a snare. It easily regenerates and can grow more than 100 feet long.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It digs holes in forests to shelter from the elements. When something small enough inspects the hole, it grabs it with its tentacles and consumes it.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: The vines growing off of POKENAME'S body are bitter and unsuitable to eat. Legends state it will snatch away arsonists and devour them. POKENAME, however, actually gets energy by leeching water and nutrients off the roots of other plants.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The vines growing off of POKENAME'S body are bitter and unsuitable to eat. Legends state it will snatch away arsonists and devour them. POKENAME, however, actually gets energy by leeching water and nutrients off the roots of other plants.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are formed of a loose connection of vines and roots that burrow into and hollow out boulders. They bind these boulders together to form a basic frame with which to move and to protect their vulnerable vines.
Author: Katie

Entry: Its steel shell houses an ever-growing mass of vines. The toughness of its body and regenerative capabilities of these vines make it nearly impossible to defeat.
Author: bacondlx

Entry: Though a Pokémon with a docile demeanor, it whips foes with its strong vines. POKENAME is also a herbivore.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: People who are allergic to poison ivy should avoid touching this Pokémon, as they produce similar toxins. They rely on these toxins to deter herbivores in the wild.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Spreading vines have overgrown and taken over the original body of POKENAME. The hollow shell serves as a shelter for the vines.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME's body is made of long stinging tentacles that are painful to touch. These Pokémon are shelter for fish Pokémon that can endure its sting.
Author: Mistymagius
