Entry: POKENAME is popular with young women due to its affectionate nature, warm body, and bright colors. When it evolves, its fighting style changes dramatically depending on who raised it and how they raised it.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME dislikes staying still, no matter the environment, and they especially love the outdoors. Incredibly intelligent, they will light small fires to keep themselves warm on chilly nights.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Its metallic armor heats up whenever it gets excited, reaching a maximum temperature of over 500 degrees Fahrenheit. Because of this, it lives in badlands without plant matter that it could accidentally ignite.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: The fire it makes is blazingly hot. POKENAME has trouble expelling it with enough speed, however, so it will wrap opponents in its coils before torching them with a concentrated blast.
Author: Glacierwing

Entry: POKENAME loves to eat eggs and will raid other Pokémon's nests to steal them. However, it only likes cooked eggs, so it will roast them with its fire breath before consumption.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The excessive energy from fusion has burned off most of its feathers. However, its three remaining feathers now burn as hot as an industrial blowtorch.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME are affectionate and curious, their warm personalities making them ideal companions in cold climates. The heat radiating from their small bodies helps ward off the chill, bringing comfort to those around them.
Author: Katie

Entry: What looks like an egg is really a rock POKENAME carries within its water-filled blossom for unknown reasons. If you replace the rock with an egg, it's hard boiled within seconds.
Author: SonTyp

Entry: The shell on its back is actually the one it hatched from, melted onto its back from the heat of its warm belly. POKENAME emits enough heat to make most things it touches melt. It uses this molten material to strengthen its shell.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME cheekily taunts anyone it deems weaker than itself. With that said, it doesn't hesitate to take on stronger foes, too.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Its club may look like delicious roast meat, but it is actually a tough lump of rust. It tempts gluttonous Pokémon with the prospect of a free meal, then knocks them out cold.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME appears in people's dreams on hot summer nights. Witnesses cannot agree as to whether it acts as a villain or a hero in their dreams.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME relies on its tail as a substitute for its lack of arms. After achieving victory in battle, POKENAME will slap its Trainer's hand with its tail in celebration.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: It becomes inactive during winter, preferring to stay buried in the dirt. The heat and energy POKENAME provides to nearby plants makes sure they can unexpectedly flourish even in the cold.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKEMAME is commonly kept on farms because it persistently attacks predators that approach the barnyard. However, its aggressive demeanor often leads it to be a nuisance to the farmers.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME protects its back with hard spines that have a weak poison. If it senses danger, it curls up and rolls down the dunes.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME keeps its young in its pouch to protect it from the harsh desert sun. It will only let them leave the pouch once their spines have fully grown.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It digs itself underwater caves to sleep in, and tunnels to travel between lakes searching for food or mates. This is thought to cause earthquakes.
Author: fishaccoon

Entry: POKENAME swims through sand as if it were water, ambushing prey with no warning. Its claws are strong enough to cut even the toughest of armors.
Author: Eye Of Cthulhu

Entry: POKENAME is known for its tendency to relentlessly hunt Diglett. It flies above areas full of them and fires its spines into the ground, listening to the sound waves bounce off nearby objects as a form of echolocation when searching for a meal.
Author: tax evasion

Entry: POKENAME lies in wait until its prey swim by. Then, it skewers them with the spines at the end of its tails.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: The flower and its leaves on its back are hard and protect POKENAME. They allow it to secrete debilitating toxins, which it uses to poison attackers.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its claws resonate a low hum when digging through the ground. The frequency attracts wild Pokémon, though no one knows if it is a signal or a natural side effect of its burrowing.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: During warmer weather, its tail gets cold and becomes covered in ice. This helps it regulate its body temperature.
Author: .izik

Entry: If a POKENAME becomes too cold, the head on its tail warms up. This causes any ice on the tail to instantly melt.
Author: .izik

Entry: It lives in rocky badlands, using its speed and claws to drive away potential threats. Even a wild Tyrantrum will avoid a POKENAME's territory.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME show off their immense strength by carrying boulders over five times its weight. Their punches have enough force to level a skyscraper.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: This Pokémon's nickname is "Bloodlust Incarnate". This is a misleading nickname however since it is very docile and only been seen eating honey.
Author: elwafflejr

Entry: POKENAME is one of very few Ursaring species to not hibernate. While interesting, this unfortunately makes it vulnerable to fur hunters.
Author: Patch_Bros

Entry: It spends nearly every waking hour sunbathing. It conserves its energy for taking down prey, which it slashes with its spines as it rushes past.
Author: PokePower

Entry: POKENAME can channel a strong electrical current through the spikes on its back. If someone gets too close, it turns its back on them and shoots its spikes.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME forms clay balls with a high water-content so it can electrify, then propel them at opponents using its tail as a makeshift bat.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its quills are so sharp they can pierce through solid concrete and are capable of shredding even the toughest materials. Ancient cultures once used these spines to craft ceremonial weapons, believing they held a protective power.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: This Pokémon stirs up sandstorms with its psychic powers to guard itself from harsh sunlight. It walks across unstable dunes without sinking an inch.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: The vegetation on its back is hard. It provides POKENAME with sufficient nutrients even when there is little rain and can also secrete strong poison.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It was once thought to be an alien parasite that fell to earth in prehistoric times.  Legend says it has the power to control time, but this has never been observed.
Author: bostroms

Entry: Researchers disagree on whether POKENAME haunting desert temples once belonged to the temple's guards or its robbers.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: When wielded by a Trainer, POKENAME can create slashes of sand with sharpness akin to its blades. However, using such a technique drains the Trainer's stamina and even some of their lifeforce.
Author: lemage22

Entry: When threatened, this Pokémon will curl into a ball and lash out with its ribbons. It can dig up to 10 kilometers deep in a single day and night.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: In the wild, POKENAME will curl into a ball and roll down sand dunes, attempting to crush prey. Its shovel-like claws contain a debilitating venom.
Author: kingd8

Entry: This Pokémon specializes in head to tail combat, in which it slashes enemies with its sharp claws and whacks them with its spiky tail. POKENAME is also a very efficient tunneler and can dig at rapid speeds.
Its claws are strong enough to dig through rock. It will often walk across large bodies of water to find food.
Author: b_megamaths

Entry: POKENAME in the wild are usually found bickering with each other. If one gets mad, it tries to start a sandstorm to make the other one mad too.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: Sometimes POKENAME will roll up palm trees using its spikes and camouflages itself as a coconut. When a nearby Pokémon headbutts the tree, it comes crashing down as part of an ambush.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: Its long claws can cut through sturdy stone in a single swipe. It will dig for hours without tiring to seek soft soil for nourishment.
Author: .izik

Entry: A Pokémon that loves to dig through loose soil and sand, POKENAME are often used by construction crews to clear building sites prior to work starting. They enjoy the work but have to be watched closely in case they dig too much ground out.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME spends much of its time meditating quietly near desert oases. If it senses the approach of someone potentially dangerous, it uses psychic powers to cause hallucinations that distract them and lure them away.
Author: sk372

Entry: The thick spines on its back extend during cold weather to insulate it from the low temperature. During the summer, the spines will regrow entirely.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its neck is quite long; the head can extend up to 3 feet to reach food. When a POKENAME sleeps, it will retract its head completely into the opening.
Author: .izik

Entry: It emits a loud buzzing noise while levitating through the air. However, it is unable to levitate higher than 10 feet.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME curls up into a ball to defend itself, pointing its spikes outwards. Being pricked by one can put any attacker to sleep.
Author: noel5229

Entry: POKENAME is frustrated to no end by its lack of legs and inability to kick. It instead relies on the flames and explosions it produces in combat.
Author: Cascadeguy

Entry: POKENAME's blazing claws and icy ferocity make it a fearsome adversary, capable of outmaneuvering and overpowering foes with ease.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: While POKENAME typically stick together with their families in the wild, each one of them has a burning desire to stand out and compete. They love to show off; POKENAME that are caught by Trainers are wonderful performers that draw in crowds.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME moves across the battlefield with the utmost elegance, leaving scorched ground wherever it plants its feet. It's said that the style of POKENAME's movements mirrors its Trainers' emotions.
Author: craigprime

Entry: POKENAME likes to soak after a long day of foraging. It breathes fire into the water to create an impromptu hot spring for relaxation. Many mistake its back to be covered in autumn-tinged leaves, but it is actually POKENAME's plumage.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: To regulate heat and blood flow, POKENAME vigorously shakes its tail.  Excess body heat is transferred into flares that spew out from the sac on its head.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: POKENAME flies high above its enemies, firing extremely hot blasts of fire. As its name suggests, it loves to fight.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: At nighttime, POKENAME runs off to fields and mountains, spending its time adapting its kicking mastery in the body of an Oddish. The removal of its arms will not deter it at all.
Author: Cascadeguy

Entry: Sometimes during the fusion process, POKENAME keeps Combusken's arms instead of removing them. It would much rather continue mastering its kicking skills, though.
Author: Cascadeguy

Entry: Fusing Blaziken's blaze with Hitmonchan's punch, POKENAME unleashes devastating fiery kicks alongside fast bone-crunching punches.
Author: Sheogorath

Entry: This Pokémon resembles a fighter from a far-off land. Its punches can shatter concrete pillars in an instant. It has a short temper and is quick to battle.
Author: mercsthorn

Entry: This Pokémon resembles a fighter from a far-off land. Its punches can shatter concrete pillars in an instant. It has a short temper and is quick to battle.
Author: mercsthorn

Entry: POKENAME roams landfills and mostly eats plastic. Its digestive tract runs through each head and ends in the tiny one, which expels fumes and flames produced from the digestion process.
Author: jacklemon

Entry: POKENAME incubates its eggs in its pouch, its high body heat speeding up the hatching process. Once the babies are old enough, they will aid in their mother's fiery attacks.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Upon evolution, POKENAME are said to subconsciously master a special fighting style that uses hard-hitting attacks and swift yet graceful movements to defeat a foe. They are often compared to video game characters as a result.
Author: chaos_emblemx

Entry: A skillful climber that can scale any kind of terrain, even slippery and unstable cliffs near frozen waterfalls. As a carnivore, it relies primarily on hunting for prey, as well as gathering unprotected Pokémon Eggs, all in order to sustain itself.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: To train, POKENAME use mountains as punching bags before cooling off in the ocean. Their armor releasing heat have been mistaken for deep-sea vents.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: It has only been found in the wild near the tops of inactive volcanoes that are now covered in ice and snow. When it battles, its body temperature raises dramatically, melting their nearby habitat.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: A roving calamity, POKENAME's roar of thunder and flame can be heard from kilometers away. As it leaps from tree to tree, forest fires ignite in its wake.
Author: Scapz

Entry: Conscious of its superior strength and endurance, POKENAME happily approaches any who dare to challenge it.
Author: togetik

Entry: POKENAME is fiercely protective over the eggs within the nest atop its massive shell. Its legs are powerful enough to cause earthquakes that can topple 30-story buildings.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME is a blazing sword and shield, forged from its own fiery spirit. Its kicks scorch, while fiery slashes leave both burns and gashes.
Author: Sheogorath

Entry: Metal arms fused with searing blades, POKENAME dances a fiery war dance. Its kicks scorch, while razor-sharp swipes leave opponents sliced and singed.
Author: Sheogorath

Entry: During the ancient periods of Kanto, POKENAME taught martial arts to monks.  If a POKENAME reaches a zen-like state while fighting, its blazing kicks burn blue.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: POKENAME believe themselves to be unequivocally the strongest Pokémon in any competition, and they will fight as though there is no chance of them losing. This can make them obstinate and difficult to control, willing to fight anything.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME believe themselves to be unequivocally the strongest Pokémon in any competition, and they will fight as though there is no chance of them losing. This can make them obstinate and difficult to control, willing to fight anything.
Author: Katie

Entry: They create warm nests high within cold mountain ranges, where their domain's ambient heat lures in unsuspecting prey seeking warmth. Shortly after being caught within its webs, POKENAME will devour their new lightly-charred snack.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME lives high in the mountains where it trains its fire breathing. Its caves can be identified by molten rock that makes up their walls. This Pokémon is often depicted in fairytales as a monster that steals princesses into its lair.
Author: milchik

Entry: This Pokémon's fiery scales scatter over land as it flies. If you see several small burnt patches of grass, you know a POKENAME is nearby.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Its feathers are very fire retardant, so it's common to see POKENAME-feather pillows and POKENAME-feather comforters for sale in stores.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Four fiery fists unleash a blazing fury. POKENAME's martial arts scorch with each blow, its inferno burning as bright as its fighting spirit.
Author: Sheogorath

Entry: POKENAME often spends time meditating at the edge of active volcanoes, where it absorbs the heat into its pendulum.
Author: Fenragon

Entry: POKENAME transforms by reforming its mostly liquid body. It likes to reside in muddy ponds, and will disguise itself as mounds of dirt.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: This Pokémon is an apex predator. It can hunt on land, in the sky, and it can dive at high speeds due to the unique composition of its feathers.
Author: Sottiwotti

Entry: It hops around rice fields, letting loose a sweet nectar from its flower that flows into the water. Rice from these fields is used in the creation of delectable jelly doughnuts across Kanto.
Author: .izik

Entry: It plays in the mud and spits water at anyone who interrupts it. POKENAME's laughter echoes across its marsh during the evening hours.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME buries itself in the mud at the bottom of rivers. It uses its hairs to sense changes in the water and find prey.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Despite its size, POKENAME is strong enough to lift boulders with its claws. It grasps foes with its tail, and then hits them with a fierce Water Gun.
Author: beespoon

Entry: POKENAME rests near forest lakes with only its crest exposed. It coats itself in layers of mud which, once dried, harden its shell.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME can be found in hot springs. They like to wrap themselves around wounds to help them heal.
Author: ElioNagashi#0173

Entry: An adept swimmer, POKENAME's sleek body can cut through water at nearly 35 mph. It mainly feasts on aquatic vegetation native to lakes.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME is often seen hiding around warm mud. It shoots embers to hunt prey and then uses water to extinguish the flames before eating.
Author: Markusknight

Entry: POKENAME can only be found in large lakes, lazily floating on the water's surface. It quite enjoys visitors, playfully splashing them with water if they enter its lake.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: As it is much smaller than Wailord, POKENAME can be used much more reasonably in naval navigation. The fin on top of its head turns left and right above water, and it can spray water from its blowhole as a signal.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It lives in dark, muddy soil in swamps and around riverbeds. It's adept at both swimming and digging, so it doesn't mind when its burrows get flooded.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME loves to play with smaller Water-type Pokémon. Sadly, some of those smaller Pokémon don't survive because of POKENAME's weight.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: The slimy film on its body smells like a bog. It hovers over water sources while it sleeps, letting loose a psychic aura that makes those nearby feel happy.
Author: .izik

Entry: First found in sunken ruins off the Hoenn coast, POKENAME congregate in long-lost cities drowned by the ocean. Researchers debate if they served in these cities during their prime or arrived after their destruction.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME strikes fear in the heart of those who see them, even though they only want to help them find a way out of swamps at night.
Author: ElioNagashi#0173

Entry: POKENAME hangs around swampy areas, hiding amongst the mud. It will swallow as much water as it can to allow it to float while swimming.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The shores of shallow streams are spotted with the burrows of POKENAME. It prevents floods by digging deep holes to drain the overflowing water.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: In combat, POKENAME will fire globs of thick mud from its mouth at its opponents. It absorbs water through its roots to keep its body moist while not underwater.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME live near riverbanks, covering themselves in mud to keep their skin moist. Their finned tail helps them swim, even though they can't swim very fast.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Legends say POKENAME uses its trunk to blow hypnotic bubbles that lull its targets into a deep sleep. What happens afterward remains a mystery, as no one who has fallen victim to its spell has ever been seen again.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: POKENAME loves to splash around in shallow bodies of water. It is often found at pools, where it helps others stay safe using its flotation ring.
Author: noel5229

Entry: It keeps its skin smooth and shiny by bathing itself in mud. The feelers on its head are used to tell both the type and condition of the mud.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: If startled, POKENAME slaps its six tailfins against the mud. The slurry it splashes this way is often dangerously hot.
Author: .realthree

Entry: It can bounce on land for a short time, traveling from one mud puddle to another. It moves through murky waters with surprising speed.
Author: snescontroller

Entry: When POKENAME buries itself in the mud, all that sticks out are its fins. It uses these fins to sense disturbances in the undergrowth around it.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Though a master of the sea, POKENAME is occasionally seen resting on land or flying through the air.
Author: dragonzzilla

Entry: POKENAME is both an adept swimmer and an amazing flier. It is often used for search missions all over the world because of its versatility.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: Its fiery spirit boils the water within its body, increasing the force of its strikes. If it can't close the gap between it and its opponent, it will spray jets of boiling water from its wrists as a long-ranged attack.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The majority of POKENAME's shell consists of water. Docile by nature, smaller Pokémon have been found to safely inhabit it.
Author: PixlHoopa

Entry: POKENAME are expert swimmers due to their strong arms and fins. Its combat style seems to be a mix of flowing strikes and crashing impacts.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME struggles to swim as the mud coating its body disperses in water. To compensate, it uses psychic energy to propel itself at high speeds. The mud on its arms is rich, making it fertile soil that attracts Grass-type Pokémon seeking nutrition.
Author: Xyloldi

Entry: POKENAME can walk on either all fours or bipedally. It has overwhelming strength and could easily level a forest if it wanted to. For some reason, it resembles a creature found in an old publication that was written off as a hoax.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's fins contain its two actual brains, which occasionally swell under stress. The so-called "third brain" on the bottom is just extra moist skin with no real function. It often lounges around swamps to calm itself and relieve the pressure.
Author: Xyloldi

Entry: The water held at the end of POKENAME's tail is always sullied by minerals from the local soil. When battling, the heating elements on its arms and legs glow with internal fire.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Its dense body sinks quickly underwater, allowing it to walk along river beds. It can easily swim back to the surface through sheer muscle strength.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: It uses its giant hands to throw massive spheres of scalding water at foes. It is recommended to not anger it, unless you want to get burnt.
Author: homelessrager

Entry: A POKENAME's vines are used in the production of Stable Mulch. When the vines are trimmed, the tips become a darker green before growing again.
Author: .izik

Entry: Said to bring good luck to anyone who sees it, POKENAME is a rare sight on the surface. It lives in the deep ocean, using its psychic powers to swim instead of its fins.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is a powerful empath who struggles to control their power. When it detects feelings of strong rage or passion, their flaming tail bursts into a raging inferno.
Author: EvilGammon

Entry: POKENAME is a timid but kindhearted denizen of the forest. Should it sense sadness in the heart of another being, it spins webs in the shape of cute or funny imagery to try and lighten their mood.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are often seen clumsily tripping into things. While this does not hurt them, POKENAME still find it annoying.
Author: Weirdtux

Entry: It always seems to be happy and curious. If it senses negative emotions nearby, it quickly finds a place to hide.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: The horn on its head senses thoughts and emotions. If it senses a hostile thought from within a certain radius around it, it explodes in self-defense before teleporting away.
Author: Celio_0230

Entry: POKENAME is a cheeky, playful Pokémon that often plays tricks on people. Despite its size, its bites are quite deadly and its grip is hard to escape.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME can taste the emotions of surrounding Pokémon by feebly licking the air. If it tastes an emotion it likes, it bounces about with glee.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: It is highly attuned to human emotions. If it senses any hostility, POKENAME uses its clawed toes to climb to high places and hide until the tension fades.
Author: larky_

Entry: Even though it can teleport, it prefers to flee from enemies by leaping through the treetops. The horns on its head make it highly aware of danger.
Author: larky_

Entry: While they lack the confidence, these charming Pokémon are said to have the sweetest smile of any fusion. They only smile for Trainers they trust.
Author: Quote.lass

Entry: In the wild, POKENAME, despite being blind, are quite resilient. Stories have been passed around of one particularly tough POKENAME being hit by multiple Psyshock, yet surviving relatively unscathed.
Author: retrodox

Entry: POKENAME senses hostility with its guard and goes out of its way to avoid conflict. It even avoids being used offensively by people it trusts.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME has a high sensitivity to surrounding emotions. If it senses panic, someone must throw it into the ocean as quickly as possible to calm it.
Author: theradrad

Entry: Its aura-reading abilities can identify even the tiniest hints of negative emotion. Its attempts to telepathically share these experiences are often mistaken for psychic attacks.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME's psychic abilities manifest through its connection to aura. Due to its small body, it has difficulty controlling these powers.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME are very popular. Many people consider them an ideal Pokémon to raise around a family for their soft coat and ability to recognize emotions.
Author: BlitzyDragon

Entry: POKENAME navigates by projecting out psychic waves into its environment. It senses the returning signals with a trio of sensitive structures on its head. It can differentiate between living things by feeling their thoughts, letting it avoid danger.
Author: Katie

Entry: Groups of POKENAME can be found on frozen lakes, hitting ice chunks to each other. Despite being amateurs at the moment, POKENAME desire to become expert hockey players someday.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: If POKENAME senses the fear of one lost in the forest, it floats its way towards them to be by their side. It comforts them with soft cries and gently leads them back out of the forest.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its coin-shaped horn is infamously known to scramble data storage and measuring devices around it. Many dex entries had to be rewritten due to incorrect measurements caused by it, such as Magcargo's body temperature.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME are affectionate pets who love curling up with their owners on the couch while they watch TV. Unfortunately, they interfere with the signals that remotes produce, making it impossible to change the channel or volume while they're nearby.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: It despises anger, due to its empathy causing physical pain when it experiences said emotion. It will only approach those it sees as calm.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: The organ on POKENAME's head is capable of sensing the emotions of those nearby. If its Trainer is ever upset or angry at somebody, it will not hesitate to suplex the offender.
Author: craigprime

Entry: POKENAME are commonly found residing on dangerous hiking trails. With their strength and empathic abilities, they are known to find and rescue injured hikers.
Author: TheTapeMaster

Entry: POKENAME enjoys dancing along to music, but its simple mind leaves it unable to follow a beat for long. Many have seen a small group of POKENAME dancing to the same song, each with completely different dance moves.
Author: sk372

Entry: They are known to share eggs with each other, as each egg has a unique feeling. However, when they pick up a Lucky Egg, they are known to hide the egg so they can hog all the time with it.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is very sensitive to the world around it and uses the appendages on its head to sense potential danger. Trainers are often impressed by its thoughtfulness when it brings them gifts.
Author: darxer_

Entry: POKENAME enjoys prancing around open fields and cavorting amongst the flowers peacefully. Interrupting these moments of calm indulgence is a quick way to wind up on the receiving end of its horns.
Author: sk372

Entry: It enjoys entertaining others with interpretive dance routines that involve shapeshifting into various other Pokémon. No matter the sequence, the dance ends with a flourish done in the shape of a Kirlia.
Author: sk372

Entry: They were once a living thesaurus, as their linguistic knowledge rivaled that of university professors. They once served as scribes to nobility because of such knowledge, and helped pen important correspondences between nobles.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME dances while flying, spinning through the sky. With a flick of its mind, it plucks Apricorns from trees mid-flight.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME spins and prances about when in high spirits. This twirling generates electricity within its body, so sparks and small crackles of electricity emanate from it as it dances.
Author: sk372

Entry: It can be found dancing around in the woods gracefully. It is actually trying to clear its mind as it worries about its future.
Author: birchbot

Entry: POKENAME twirls joyfully in puddles, drawing in moisture through its skin. Onlookers feel an urge to cheer as it dances due to its psychic influence.
Author: .izik

Entry: In the warmth of afternoon sun, POKENAME twirls gracefully. It uses telekinesis to assist its flowing, radiant dances.
Author: .izik

Entry: When happy, POKENAME will begin to dance around those close to it. It clacks its teeth together to keep rhythm, which also helps to keep its teeth ground down.
Author: sk372

Entry: Ancient peoples' recorded interactions with this Pokémon tell of POKENAME showing them images that accurately resemble modern human civilization.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Despite having a shell harder than steel, POKENAME dances fluidly. If it stumbles, it uses psychic power to steady its movements.
Author: .izik

Entry: Using psychic energy, POKENAME plucks berries and stores them in its shell. As they ferment, it shares the sweet juice with others of its kind.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME slams its horn into pine trees to drink sap. The sweet taste increases its psychic power for hours afterward.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME acts like a big sister to smaller Pokémon, often teasing and toying with them. It scares people away, but draws them back in with its gaze.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: It dances in front of people, performing twirls and small hops to entertain, as well as request food offerings for its entertainment efforts. It becomes quite petulant if nobody feeds it after its dance.
Author: sk372

Entry: A POKENAME is accompanied by an odd clone of itself wherever it goes. Despite its somewhat cheerful look, the clone itself is hostile.
Author: aregularbigjoke

Entry: POKENAME is happiest when living near trees. In the wild, it can often be seen climbing to the highest branches and dancing among the leaves.
Author: larky_

Entry: It moves its body in rhythmic ways, each dance coinciding with an attempted warning of upcoming disaster. Due to misinterpretation, many areas think these dances are meant to bring about the calamities instead.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's blade can cut open dimensional tears to see into the future. It fights better when its wielder is in higher spirits.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: While dancing, POKENAME releases glittering spores into the air. If it senses disapproval, it may lash out with a punch mid-spin.
Author: .izik

Entry: Many years ago, POKENAME was often gifted to new parents. The fabric of its body is said to be softer than Whimsicott cotton.
Author: inksans201x

Entry: POKENAME's eyesight is extremely poor, but it compensates with strong psychic abilities that helps it sense its surroundings.
Author: .izik

Entry: It has the ability to hijack a foe's mind and make them see visions of a horrible future. As POKENAME darts around the battlefield, the foe starts to lose touch with reality. Only when they are in despair does POKENAME attack.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME is only fully awake for about fifteen minutes per day. The rest of the time, it moves through psychic control, pretending to be alert.
Author: .izik

Entry: Swarms of POKENAME gather around damaged wires. If they sense electricians approaching, they vanish in a sudden psychic blink.
Author: .izik

Entry: As it rolls, POKENAME emits a psychic aura that urges others to chase it. Even strong Pokémon sometimes feel compelled to race alongside it.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon is extremely weak. Instead of running, it tries to uses its hair-like cloth to protect itself from attacks, usually unsuccessfully.
Author: mystora

Entry: The shedding from POKENAME's wings has healing properties, so it is harvested and used as bedding for sick Pokémon. It can sit on people's heads to relieve headaches.
Author: darxer_

Entry: The psychic power of POKENAME is amplified by its two brains-one in its head and one in its back. Its feelers can sense the emotions of those nearby.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: When hugged, POKENAME's soft body triggers a psychic wave of bliss. The joy vanishes the moment the hug ends, leaving many dazed.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are great babysitters for young girls, often teaching them how to be more lady-like. Despite this, POKENAME is about as mature as a 13-year-old girl.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME lure prey by projecting images of safety and warmth with their psychic powers, tricking targets into approaching. Once close enough, they strike with toxic stingers, revealing the ruse too late for their victims.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME leap over opponents, scattering debilitating spores from above. They perform intricate dances.
Author: totodile.

Entry: This fusion has the ability to manipulate random selections such as RNG machines, casino roulettes, and card dealings in truco and poker. Casinos are quickly working on banning POKENAME from entering establishments.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Using its sensory organ, POKENAME records its Trainer's mood swings to calculate the best moment to ask for food. Also, depending on whether this fusion feels happy or sad, WiFi and Bluetooth signals near it may get stronger or weaker.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME relentlessly pushes itself in physical and mental training. Some say the reason it works so hard is to protect either itself or its Trainer from a future that it foresees.
Author: craigprime

Entry: POKENAME dances through jungle canopies, releasing a green pollen. Those nearby may fall into deep despair after breathing it in.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its latent psychic power to manipulate the laws of magnetism. It hasn't mastered this ability just yet, and tends to fry electronics around it.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: POKENAME will hypnotize passersby almost immediately upon spotting them, but not out of any sense of malice. It simply craves partners in its twirling dance, and hypnosis better allows others to follow its rhythm properly.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its psychic center of gravity lets it settle upright no matter how dizzy it grows from rolling about. Its explosions dazzle the mind.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: To POKENAME, its Trainer is its family and as important as its own child. It will dote on them, spoil them, and even try to carry them in its pouch.
Author: sk372

Entry: With careful steps and graceful arms, it choreographs invisible defenses around those it trusts. In performances, it can mimic entire stories through illusion and subtle telepathy.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: It uses its blades for hunting, but also for defending boats that pass through its territory. Many ships have been saved from rampaging Pokémon due to POKENAME's intervention.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its appetite grows when it is fused, motivating it to eat several hundreds of pounds of food each day. This food fuels its unmatched psychic powers.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: With four eyes and the lower half of a spider, POKENAME is a frightful sight to many. Though it tries to be helpful, many are scared away by it.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: A master architect. Once it finds a suitable area, it spins its webbing to build a remarkably efficient network of bridges, nests, and complex traps.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: It's been dubbed a "spider queen" by those who have travelled through its woods. It uses webs to patch up wounds and build homes for smaller Pokémon.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: It's been dubbed a "spider queen" by those who have travelled through its woods. It uses webs to patch up wounds and build homes for smaller Pokémon.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: It's been dubbed a "spider queen" by those who have travelled through its woods. It uses webs to patch up wounds and build homes for smaller Pokémon.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: Its scarf will always wave, regardless of the breeze. It takes a long time to forge a strong bond with POKENAME, but when Trainers do, their life is said to have good fortune.
Author: darxer_

Entry: Many believe POKENAME to be a spirit of death, its visage split between the alien beauty and terrifying reality of the idea.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: It spins like a top at incredible speeds. Its psychic abilities amplify the rotation, creating a dazzling yet disorienting display.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME will embrace anyone it feels compassion toward with its tentacles. Many find it hard to escape its suction-cupped grasp.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: Many fear POKENAME for its hypnotic powers and deadly bite. It longs for companionship, but tragically it ends up turning its companions to stone.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: Many fear POKENAME for its hypnotic powers and deadly bite. It longs for companionship, but tragically it ends up turning its companions to stone.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: A POKENAME's potent neurotoxin can create powerful illusions in the mind of a target. It prefers to disarm an enemy with illusions of scared children.
Author: naga_sake

Entry: They struggle with self-confidence due to their public perception and otherwise bulky body. When a Trainer gives them a Petaya Berry, they gain a moment of clarity which helps them gain the self-confidence needed to push to victory.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It uses psychic powers in conjunction with an innate connection to lightning to sense those lost within raging thunderstorms across the world. It teleports to their side instantly in order to take them to safety.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is the embodiment of magma and passion. Its bright glowing flames shine like rainbows and consume all that they touch.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: Legends speak of ships about to meet extreme storms, before the oceans stilled suddenly, allowing safe passage. Above the ships, POKENAME could be seen, calming the sea with its psychic powers to protect the humans aboard.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its piercing screech renders foes unable to move. It then delivers a venom that locks up their joints and leaves them with cold, pale skin.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: POKENAME were once believed to be Gorgons before fusion was commonplace. Old legends claimed that POKENAME's gaze could turn creatures to stone.
Author: Hypersonic06

Entry: POKENAME is as elegant as it is dangerous. Its hypnotic, stony gaze has transformed countless souls into statues, which it displays in its abode.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME is as elegant as it is dangerous. Its hypnotic, stony gaze has transformed countless souls into statues, which it displays in its abode.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME is as elegant as it is dangerous. Its hypnotic, stony gaze has transformed countless souls into statues, which it displays in its abode.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME is as elegant as it is dangerous. Its hypnotic, stony gaze has transformed countless souls into statues, which it displays in its abode.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME is as elegant as it is dangerous. Its hypnotic, stony gaze has transformed countless souls into statues, which it displays in its abode.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME is as elegant as it is dangerous. Its hypnotic, stony gaze has transformed countless souls into statues, which it displays in its abode.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: Able to perfectly control the voltage from its twin tails, many hospitals employ POKENAME to help with defibrillation. Highly intelligent and compassionate, it always knows precisely the right amount of intensity to apply.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME appears on unprotected websites, luring people into clicking on it. If they do, POKENAME will release harmful viruses into their computer.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: A prodigy in both physical and mental combat, POKENAME seeks out rigorous training to hone its skills. This can make it a challenge to train for many.
Author: Phantom640

Entry: Its peerless swordsmanship and undying loyalty make it a force to be reckoned with. It will fearlessly stand against any foe if it means protecting those it loves.
Author: cheroace

Entry: POKENAME moves swiftly and gracefully in battle. It dances as one with its weapon with complete mastery, spinning it around as to defend itself. When the bladed ends of the weapon glow in a bright pink hue, they can cut through almost anything.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Since sightings of POKENAME are so rare, it was once hailed as a deity. The sigils that surround it have no biometric signature.
Author: JokersWild

Entry: POKENAME have powerful psychic abilities. They use them to float and to teleport away from threats rather than battle.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: It uses its four brains and hearts to foresee danger. If its Trainer is threatened, it will protect them with all its might.
Author: LemGambino

Entry: Reports exist of POKENAME appearing in abandoned industrial complexes. Despite being linked to multiple disappearances, it is apparently gentle.
Author: seaslux

Entry: POKENAME propels itself forward with psychic force as it charges. It is capable of ramming with the force of a truck and the speed of a car.
Author: cipherlingarde

Entry: POKENAME is protective of companions, but still lazy at heart. Most Trainers must contend with it using psychic powers to keep them close so POKENAME need not move much to keep them safe.
Author: sk372

Entry: Suspended by psychic energy, it lures lost souls with spectral hands, beckoning them into its ethereal embrace.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME has been revered as a deity of love and compassion for centuries. It's said it created all that is good in the universe with its 1,000 arms.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME uses its psychic senses to see into the future, and if it sees its wielder is in danger, will slice open a black hole in their defense.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME makes psychic illusions to hide itself from humans. If it becomes close to its Trainer, it will do everything its power to protect them.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is generally level-headed and composed, fully capable of controlling its power. Should its focus be broken, it will rampage violently.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: It is said that, were humanity to face disaster from beyond the stars, POKENAME will descend from on high to protect it, repelling the invaders with powerful black holes fueled by its very life force.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is worshipped as the deity of time, loyalty, and compassion. It will go so far as to rewrite history to protect the ones it loves most.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME has the ability to banish ill-meaning creatures into a black hole, never to be seen again. Thankfully, it seems to be very even-keel: even in anger, it will never use this ability prematurely.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Its eye is capable of cowing even the bravest warrior, its aura of dread overwhelming. Only those who bear it can witness its rather gentle nature.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: POKENAME often subdues its foes by creating a powerful toxin infused with psychic power. Symptoms often include migraines and sluggish movement.
Author: phantom640

Entry: POKENAME floats high above its Trainer, scouting the distances with its strong eyesight and psychic powers. Should it sense anything dangerous ahead, it will quickly descend to its Trainer and lift them away to safety.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's hair lets it monitor the surrounding psychic energy to detect danger. Because of this, it's very sensitive about keeping its hair clean.
Author: Phantom640

Entry: POKENAME has a tendency to wrap people and things its fond of in webs to keep them close and safe. However, it will let them go if they sense they wish to be freed, even if it saddens POKENAME.
Author: Hello_I_Exist

Entry: POKENAME seeks out Ralts to protect them from harm. It then takes them to a safe place with plenty of shelter and food.
Author: zic

Entry: POKENAME uses a cute and gentle appearance to endear itself to humans so it may protect them. It's said that as a defensive last resort, it will suck attackers into a black hole nestled beneath its cloth.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is said to be able to see your deepest wish with the eye on its stomach. If your wish is pure, it will be granted, but if your wish is wicked, it will trap you in crystal forever.
Author: bee4082

Entry: Some may ridicule POKENAME, but it is proud of both its appearance and its long-honed, immense prowess.
Author: togetik

Entry: POKENAME is feared due to its frightening appearance and sharp horns. Those who learn to love POKENAME will receive a powerful companion for life.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: Fossil records indicate POKENAME lived in close proximity to humanity's ancient ancestors. Some speculate it guarded them from predators, and that humanity might not exist if not for its efforts.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME was once a human of noble descent. Trapped in a snowstorm one day, it awoke in the form of POKENAME. Its white kimono indicates its nobility.
Author: tr3bles

Entry: POKENAME was once a Gardevoir who gave its life for its Trainer in a blizzard. It seeks and approaches female travelers, only to scare them away.
Author: tr3bles

Entry: POKENAME was once a Gardevoir who gave its life for its Trainer in a blizzard. It seeks and approaches male travelers, only to scare them away.
Author: tr3bles

Entry: When fused, POKENAME's latent instincts are unlocked to make an cunning and brutal hunter. Even if it unfuses, the Gardevoir won't stop biting things.
Author: seaslux

Entry: It gathers acorns from the forest floor, which it uses to focus its telekinetic powers. Without these, its abilities become erratic and less controlled.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME adjusts the sensitivity of its empathic horn to assess the feelings of entire cities. It helps improving the mood of the people using its ears to broadcast high amplitude ultrasounds that contain subliminal messages.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME lures victims in with the its charms. It then disorients them by unleashing concentrated psychic noise from its mouth.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: Overwhelmed by fungus, this Gardevoir has become nothing more than a tool, psionically drawing in others to become hosts for the fungus to spread.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: POKENAME prefers not to fight, but will hold nothing back if those it cares about are threatened. Even at risk of its own life, it will embrace its allies to fully shield them from a cataclysmic threat.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: The powder falling from its scales was prized in ancient times. When refined, it served as a powerful and reliable sleep aid.
Author: .izik

Entry: Nonconfrontational by nature, POKENAME prefers hiding in water and pretending to be a simple lily pad. However, if it spies cruel behavior occurring, it blasts the perpetrator with powerful psychic energy while remaining hidden.
Author: sk372

Entry: Each head of POKENAME has a completely different personality. The medium sized head absolutely hates the largest head.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Appearing harmless, POKENAME is anything but, manipulating human brainwaves to induce feelings of endearment so that it gets taken in. Before too long, they will find themselves bereft of their valuables at the hands of this little cat burglar.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: It has been discovered that near this fusion, cryptography-based pins and passwords may become weaker and easier to breach. However, for this to happen, POKENAME must be taken near the server to be hacked, which by today's standards is impossible.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME uses its psychic powers to increase the weight it lifts when training. When in a pinch, POKENAME will decrease the force of gravity on itself to become exponentially faster.
Author: Rotcivosk

Entry: POKENAME are well known for their striking pink flames and elegant beauty. They are a rare sight, dashing through forests like like fairies or ghosts.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME enjoys collecting human gadgets, gizmos, and thingamabobs. It wishes to have legs so it can explore the human world.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: It bears a striking resemblance to Primarina from Alola. It enjoys basking on glaciers and caring for small fish Pokémon.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: A POKENAME's brain is capsuled within a singularity, resembling a miniature black hole. It subconsciously uses its psychic powers to lessen its gravitational pull, preventing itself from creating an event horizon.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME is a master of both the art of combat and etiquette. With a single swift strike, its scythes cleave through any obstacle.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: It wields its large, flat feathers like sharpened hatchets during combat. Each strike is both precise and devastating.
Author: .izik

Entry: When Unown come together to deliver a message, the presence of a POKENAME in the group is a sign denoting the need for protection.
Author: .realthree

Entry: This POKENAME takes the form of letters belonging to an ancient language. It is often found staring across the sea.
Author: .realthree

Entry: If surrounded by angry humans or Pokémon, it will sense the hostility telepathically. Overwhelmed, it may explode in a psychic burst as a defense mechanism.
Author: .izik

Entry: It's selfless nature often leads POKENAME into dangerous situations when those weaker than it are in trouble.
Author: inksans201x

Entry: It is usually found within mountainous regions. It can easily evade predators due to their psychic powers and speed.
Author: Patch

Entry: Its arms are extremely hydrodynamic, allowing it to create whirlpools and swim at high speeds with little effort.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME sees glimpses of the future, allowing it to predict and counter attacks with flawless precision. Its graceful flight masks a fierce combat style honed through generations of aerial duels.
Author: eiskitsune

Entry: Its wild nature tamed by an overwhelming desire for justice, POKENAME is a gallant hero that has a bad habit of striking heroic poses mid-battle.
Author: Leshii

Entry: POKENAME shares a connection to another region's local phenomenon. It uses its strong elbow-blades and psychic power to protect the innocent.
Author: Scigaming

Entry: POKENAME appears to assist the vulnerable by protecting them with its diamond-tough shield. This formidable defense makes it overconfident and reckless, leading it to valiantly sacrifice itself in battle protecting its partners.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME assists the vulnerable by protecting them with its diamond-tough shield. This formidable defense makes it overconfident and reckless, leading it to valiantly sacrifice itself in battle protecting its partners.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: This Pokémon is fat, lazy, and often appears completely indifferent to its surroundings. However, when it decides to act, it becomes a devastating force of pure and raw strength.
Author: Starexpizz

Entry: A legend states that POKENAME has the wisdom of a king, the fortitude of a knight, and the power to rule over others. It is a courteous Pokémon that makes sure to greet and bow to opponents before attacking gracefully and overwhelmingly.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: An expert fighter able to read its opponent's thoughts, POKENAME protects its opponent and those in need with predictive haste.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Despite its rotund body, it surprises foes with incredible speed when launching an attack. Its swiftness makes it a difficult target to counter.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME pilots a mech suit it built from salvaged metal, showcasing its extraordinary intelligence. Using its tentacles to operate the controls, it constantly upgrades its creation, making every POKENAME's mech unique.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: It strives to protect the forest it calls home using its sharp blades. It will mercilessly cut down anyone trying to bring harm to the wildlife.
Author: cheroace

Entry: It uses its large wings to disperse a psychedelic powder into the air. The substance manipulates the minds of foes, leaving them disoriented and vulnerable.
Author: .izik

Entry: Trainers report that when POKENAME meditates under moonlight, the water around it becomes perfectly still. If even a single ripple breaks the surface, it vanishes into the trees without a sound.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: If you're being accosted on the street at night, you can rest assured that a POKENAME will come to your aid. They aren't selfless though; if you fail to pay them for their time, you won't be as lucky next time.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME is quite powerful, but never uses its full potential. It is lazy and enjoys long naps, but can become dangerous when pushed into a corner.
Author: Sand_Coffin

Entry: POKENAME inhabits a shell in the shape of a boxer. It uses lightning-fast flurries of punches before freezing mid-motion to rest, even in mid-air.
Author: EggSaladologist

Entry: It trained and fought endlessly until its body simply couldn't take any more. Though normally motionless, it can still fight opponents with swift and precise movements, as if its spirit still guides the body to grow ever stronger.
Author: sk372

Entry: It appears to stand completely motionless, but wise Trainers know to give POKENAME a wide berth. Agitators will find themselves beset with cuts coming from seemingly nowhere, as POKENAME stares blankly in their direction...
Author: sk372

Entry: Known as the 'Reaper of the Forest", POKENAME follow bug Pokémon around that are near the end of their life. It is unknown what happens when they pass in the presence of POKENAME.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: POKENAME's body is very fragile, so it will possess others by latching onto their heads. However, victims of POKENAME have no recollection of anything while they were possessed.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Occasionally after a massive thunderstorm, you can find POKENAME floating near the storm's center. Though it is completely immobile, its body contains enough electricity to power an entire region.
Author: darkweavile428

Entry: POKENAME makes its home near hollowed and abandoned former nests of other insect Pokémon. Some believe it guards the spirits of those who perished defending those hives from predators.
Author: sk372

Entry: Many believe POKENAME to be a zombie. It uses this rumor to its advantage, feeding off the terror it creates by its presence.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: It doesn't move. It doesn't blink. It doesn't eat. There doesn't appear to be anything inside the impenetrable shell except a floating pair of eyelids. If it couldn't use powerful moves, one could be forgiven in thinking it wasn't even a Pokémon.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME silently glide during the night, looking for lost Trainers to slowly drain their energy until they can no longer stand. Pairs of Chingling follow POKENAME to protect them from danger.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME appears to be nothing more than a husk with a liquified Ninjask leaking from it. The Ninjask, however, is alive and is the real Pokémon!
Author: shining_joot

Entry: POKENAME walks silently through dim forests, ignoring all other life. Its empty shell never tires, never eats, and never blinks, yet its path always leads somewhere.
Author: mgfox_66676

Entry: It's said that POKENAME formed when a Trainer abandoned their underperforming Pikachu in a forest, and it became possessed by a mysterious force.
Author: Patch_Bros

Entry: POKENAME can revert entropy to zero, for it invokes lost joules/kelvin to cast attacks. This power means the potential of an infinite energy source, but no POKENAME has ever cooperated to this purpose.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: It is believed that this is the original form of Shedinja. Some speculate that this creature has angelic powers.
Author: zerocipher

Entry: The hole is endlessly deep and perfectly black. It was once said to have been created by an ancient civilization to try and peer into the afterlife.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: POKENAME wanders the world endlessly, liberating corrupted spirits. It possesses a profound sense of justice and otherworldly physical prowess.
Author: lynkinator

Entry: Despite its size, POKENAME remains mostly motionless throughout the course of its life. Anything that enters the hole on its back is never seen again.
Author: bee4082

Entry: Should one hear the ominous hum of a POKENAME hovering above, they must avoid looking up at all costs. Those who gaze into its hollow underside will be sucked into the abyss within, never to be seen again.
Author: sk372

Entry: Certain ancient records state the sight of POKENAME is a harbinger of the end of existence. The stories say all life will one day be pulled into its hollow shell and used as fuel to reincarnate the universe anew.
Author: sk372

Entry: Shedinja congregate near POKENAME, some venturing in and out of its seemingly hollow shell. Some believe those that Shedinja entering POKENAME's body are storing the spirits they've stolen within its confines.
Author: sk372

Entry: The blades of a POKENAME are sharp enough to cut through anything. However, they are exceptionally brittle, making them hard to use.
Author: b_megamaths

Entry: POKENAME acts as a grim reaper for souls, guiding those who have died and finding those who have yet to perish.
Author: mors_martii

Entry: POKENAME, resembling a hollow, soulless shell of a ruthless warrior, never shows mercy, nor any emotions at all. It's said to be driven by a single goal - to fill its emptiness with a soul of a worthy opponent defeated in battle.
Author: milchik

Entry: If you were to look into the hole in POKENAME's neck, you would be subjected to horrific, never-ending nightmares. It is believed that the souls of those who fall victim to this will never be able to rest.
Author: Shikuren

Entry: POKENAME floats through wastelands, sapping energy from everything around it to fuel itself. Its body is completely hollow and full of electricity.
Author: HummusIsHome

Entry: POKENAME moves swiftly, kicks hard and releases spores from its hollow insides. Some superstitious researchers believe that each spore can steal your soul if you look at them for too long in the microscope.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME have failed to fully pull free of their chrysalises as they become adults. The animated spirits that would normally produce a Shedinja instead bond with POKENAME, trapping it in increasing layers of failed sheds.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME appears to be incapable of vocalization, but it shows considerable kindness by channeling the power of the moon into its allies.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: This Pokémon guides lost travelers during the night, by the light of the moon.
Author: naga_sake

Entry: On lunar eclipses, groups of POKENAME will assemble in a circle while waving their wands towards the sky, as if performing a ritual of some sort.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: Neither head takes the lead, allowing them to move with perfect synchronization. Those who look upon POKENAME feel as though they grieve the loss of a beloved partner they never met.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: POKENAME is a rare form of Nincada which died in the middle of removing its shell. Peering into the crack on its back is said to steal one's spirit.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: The mysterious POKENAME seems to appear wherever strife and hardship are prevalent. It is believed that it seeks out sources of suffering with the intention of fighting, regardless of the cause.
Author: craigprime

Entry: The flame on its tail is rumored to be the last embers of the hollow body's soul. Superstitions say dousing the flame will cause it to suck out the soul of the perpetrator to replenish the fire anew.
Author: sk372

Entry: No matter how much POKENAME searches, it never finds the perfect match for the gem it has lost. Its claws erode as it digs desperately.
Author: paisleylxl

Entry: It glides along the ground silently to approach its prey, only standing itself up in order to fall upon an incapacitated target. Anything that enters the inky void under its body is never seen again.
Author: craigprime

Entry: Many Trainers claim to feel eyes staring out from the inky abyss of POKENAME's hollowed out body. However, upon closer examination there is nothing inside. No one alive knows how it moves or walks.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME were said to be born from lost dolls as they desperately search for the children that lost them. However, they do not want revenge, they just want to be reunited with their owners.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Groups of POKENAME often roam shipwrecks, challenging all who dare to approach. Its grey algae, able to sense the slightest vibrations in the water, serves as both a warning system and a guide through the depths.
Author: matpal6

Entry: Nobody has ever seen what is within POKENAME's shelter. Those who attempt to pry or break it open get pulled in, never to be seen again.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: Legend says POKENAME was once a guide who used songs to send spirits off to the afterlife. Now, it feeds off the souls of those who hear its song.
Author: Hexx_Vixtar

Entry: All POKENAME's gems have been mined away, leaving only a hollow body. The gem that crowned its head now forever hovers in pieces, frozen in the moment of extraction.
Author: Wormspawn

Entry: POKENAME moves in sudden and unexpected motions, contorting its body in ways that would be impossible if it had bones and flesh. The shuriken floating above it defends POKENAME without any visible physical guidance from it.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It appears hollow and immobile, but faint psychic waves can be sensed from within. Those that stare too long into the hole in its back will develop a crippling migraine.
Author: sk372

Entry: Legends say that POKENAME is a manifestation of the fighting spirit of a Pokémon. Proving which Pokémon has been difficult, though.
Author: Dusknoir64

Entry: The leek carried by POKENAME is imbued with ghostly energy. Upon contact, it temporarily deadens the nerves wherever it hits.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: Only one of its beaks moves, and only one of its two hearts actually beats. The second head remains eerily still.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME appears to be the molted shell of a Krabby. It sprays water from its eyes as a distraction, and then it scuttles away.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: It is almost completely blind, relying on its ears to sense its surroundings. If it detects an enemy, it will warn the other seeds of the danger.
Author: .izik

Entry: When threatened, POKENAME will spray a poisonous ink from its spines that is incredibly hard to wash off. It lives near the seafloor, burying itself in the sand while it sleeps.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: A POKENAME will avoid grazing in muddy areas to keep its hooves clean. The hooves themselves can be used create a nutritious powder.
Author: .izik

Entry: The toxic liquid spewing out its back cannot be maintained for long. This poison is superheated and evaporates to gas within seconds.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: While it rarely sleeps, it does rest still for some time to conserve energy. As a result, sometimes other Pokémon overlook it. This can lead to a nasty shock if POKENAME is accidentally stumbled upon: their body is covered in poisonous barbs!
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Female POKENAME require a lot of socialization to be satisfied. This is usually no problem in the wild, but if one is accidentally left behind by its colony, it will fall into a deep depression and completely forget to take care of itself.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are very timid, always on high alert with their toxic barbs raised. While their teeth aren't venomous, they are sharper than any of the barbs along their bodies, ensuring they can finish their meal quickly before scurrying away.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Its faintly glowing body appears during twilight, drawing attention to the runic markings on its horn. Researchers have yet to understand their purpose.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Rarely, a female Nidoran retains its juvenile traits when it evolves. The factors that cause this to occur remain unknown.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME's seemingly tortured form is rumored to have once been a Nidoran, forged into a living sword by a deranged swordsmith who hated the species.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: A POKENAME will use its sharp blades to cut into trees and stones. Each POKENAME has a unique symbol that they prefer to carve.
Author: .izik

Entry: If attacked by a predator, POKENAME will latch its ribbons onto its attacker and slam them into the poisonous barbs on its body.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: These pompous Pokémon are very fond of themselves and will prick anyone who insinuates otherwise with their poisonous thorns. However, once they find a mate, they will be endlessly devoted to them.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's body is covered in hundreds of tiny needles that will inject a potent poison. The needles break off easily while in combat, which can be lethal if they are inhaled.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Girls often find POKENAME in forests, and it quickly bonds with them. They are protective of their keeper, never revealing their true form to them.
Author: HoundRyS

Entry: A bossy Pokémon that takes it upon itself to teach younger Pokémon to sing better, even if they have no desire to sing in the first place. If ignored, they inflate to double their size in anger.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Its spikes are extremely sharp. Legends state that blacksmiths from long ago would melt their spikes down to create blades.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME attacks by charging recklessly, its powerful strikes made even more lethal by its poison-tipped horn.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: It roams actively at night, foraging Berries with its sharp front teeth. It protects itself during the day by secreting poison through its leaves.
Author: synaesthesis

Entry: The more spots there are on POKENAME's body, the more dangerous its poison is. It is a self-conscious Pokémon and will not show itself if it has too many spots.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME are constantly fussing over their hygiene and appearance, routinely cleaning their silvery fur. If anyone threatens the coin on their foreheads, they will stiffen their whiskers and lace them with poison.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME is always paranoid, fleeing in terror at the slightest sense of danger. Its skin is covered in a poisonous film as a defense mechanism.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Only one of POKENAME's six heads is real, while the others are illusions created with its innate psychic energy. These false heads shift colors to match the environment, making it nearly impossible to tell them apart.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite being quite common, it can be very difficult to find POKENAME in the wild. Between their lack of movement and ability to camouflage perfectly with their environment, Trainers walk past hundreds of POKENAME daily.
Author: RaginCajunNacho

Entry: POKENAME never seems to consciously change color. Instead, the impact from charging into something jolts its brain, causing it to take on the coloration of whatever it collided with until it hits another target.
Author: sk372

Entry: The eggs it creates come in a variety of colors. Each color signifies a different ailment the egg is specially made for treating, such as fatigue, nausea, insomnia, and so forth.
Author: sk372

Entry: Because it's still learning, the baby POKENAME often forgets about its own camouflage when its parent blends into its surroundings, leading to the awkward appearance of "floating" POKENAME young.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME has several false eyes along its wings and antenna. When threatened, the rest of its body will change into the color of its background, leaving the illusion of floating eyes behind.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: POKENAME is an ambush predator, camouflaging into its surroundings before swiftly dispatching its prey with the large blades on each arm.
Author: King_Creepsta

Entry: POKENAME clings to tree trunks, perfectly camouflaged. It ambushes prey like Caterpie with sudden, crushing force.
Author: .izik

Entry: A wild POKENAME is almost impossible to spot. Often times, they hide up in the trees then camouflage away from predators like Talonflame.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME's body constantly shifts between different hues, mimicking the colors of all of its known evolutions. Researchers believe it may possess a unique, unpredictable evolutionary potential.
Author: .izik

Entry: A slick oil coats POKENAME's fur, letting it blend into shrubs and bushes. When frightened, it vanishes in plain sight.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's feathers shift to match its terrain when it senses a dark future. This instinctive camouflage helps it vanish instantly.
Author: .izik

Entry: When danger is near, POKENAME's feathers shift wildly in color. The flashes reflect panic from visions of its uncertain future.
Author: .izik

Entry: The wool on POKENAME's body changes hue with its surroundings. If disturbed while resting, it lashes out with a sudden flurry of tongue slaps.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME fancies itself the life of any social gathering, attempting to wow others with displays of color changing and its self-taught style of dancing. Most find its desperation to look cool rather off-putting.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME floats above meadows, shifting color to match the sky. From below, it becomes nearly invisible as it drifts.
Author: .izik

Entry: Although it does indeed still possess psychic powers, POKENAME is not as knowledgeable as Slowking. Instead, POKENAME often preaches emotional and mental well-being to its friends and visitors, especially the concept of patience.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It can change its color and float high above its surroundings, using its prehensile tail or whip-like tongue to capture prey.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: The two halves of POKENAME each have their own brains. Both are able to shift the color of their fur to blend into the environment, but since they have trouble seeing each other, they more often than not change into conflicting patterns by accident.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME's ability to camouflage extends even underground, where its scales take on the texture of the soil around it. It tunnels through the earth unseen, leaving only faint, color-shifting trails.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME glides silently to tree tops at night. Its sweat lets it shift colors, allowing it to diguise itself as rough bark until dawn.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's feathers change with its environment and the weather. Its tongue lashes out to trap prey when it swoops low.
Author: .izik

Entry: Instead of changing color, POKENAME will go limp when it senses danger, acting like a plushie.  They play the role so well that often children mistake them as actual stuffed toys and take them home.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: In snowy regions, POKENAME's skin turns pale white. It nestles in snow dunes, watching silently for movement.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME effortlessly adapts to any environment. Its adaptability and speed makes it a formidable predator in both land and sea.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: Despite its small size, POKENAME uses its long trunk to reach leaves and fruits at great heights. POKENAME shares these snacks with smaller Pokémon and is known as a friend to all.
Author: odditylad

Entry: POKENAME shifts the hues of its body in accordance with the seasons. In some regions, its color changes are used to help prepare for changing weather and crop planting.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its four serpentine tongues emerge through holes in its abdomen. Being licked by an inquisitive POKENAME is a universally distressing and unpleasant experience.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: The muscles that allow POKENAME to fire stones from its palms are actually connected to its tongue, so if POKENAME is about to fire, it sucks in its tongue. This also means POKENAME cannot fire stones and stretch out its tongue at the same time.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME catches its prey from a distance with its tongue-like tendrils. The extreme cold of its body makes them stick like glue.
Author: tuneless.towa

Entry: In the wild, POKENAME appear as ghostly dresses floating in the wild. Its full body is constantly concealed with its camouflage abilities.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME changes its color to match the sand it's lying on, waiting for its prey to get close enough. Sometimes, it gets so much in character that it forgets everything and spends weeks thinking it's made of sand.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Mimicking its environment, it blends seamlessly with its surroundings. Isolation triggers unease in this adaptable creature.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME camouflages itself with its surroundings, sneaking up on unsuspecting prey. It's very popular as a trap for Rattata.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: POKENAME assume various poses to blend into their environment. When the time is right, they rush at targets with their head to deal colossal damage.
Author: gurguro

Entry: It makes its nest in an unsubtle place: directly next to large bushes of Berries, where it hoards and eats nearly all of them, leaving only a few so that they can regrow into new plants. When it is not eating, it lazes about, often sleeping.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's body shifts colors uncontrollably when it senses an incoming hurricane. Some believe its erratic patterns form warnings for those who can decipher them.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's blade extends to slice its opponent. Its head's color adjusts to its surroundings or mood.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: A reactive poison coats POKENAME's skin, altering color to match the nearby environment. Even its scent adjusts to remain hidden.
Author: .izik

Entry: The blades on POKENAME's arms turn crimson before it attacks. Its blades are sharp enough to pierce solid stone.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME fur has color-shifting and electric properties that it uses in battles. Not many are left since it's frequently hunted for its unique fur.
Author: TheFinalKalgonus

Entry: It shifts hues to blend seamlessly into its environment. Its petals exude a toxic perfume, warding off intruders.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: Though POKENAME are adept at camouflage, they can often remain unseen simply by moving faster than can be detected by the naked eye.
Author: imademyselfdothis

Entry: POKENAME is able to adapt itself to different electronic signatures, altering its own frequencies to allow it to exist within electrical equipment without disrupting it. Some Trainers don't even realize their Pokédex is playing host to a POKENAME.
Author: Katie

Entry: Blending into coral reefs, POKENAME waits motionless. It snatches passing prey like Goldeen with its long, sticky tongue.
Author: .izik

Entry: After stealing keys, POKENAME alters their colors with its unique physiology to make them harder to retrieve. Yanking its tongue forces the keys to return to their original color.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME shifts its body color to match its surroundings. If spotted, it instantly burrows into the dirt and vanishes from sight.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's tail, tongue, claws, and powerful body all assist in allowing this Pokémon to quickly traverse through the jungle.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The metallic sheen of POKENAME's body changes color depending on the minerals in its surroundings. Cave explorers use its shifting hues to locate rare gemstones.
Author: .izik

Entry: While buried in sand, POKENAME mimics its color perfectly. When flying prey passes overhead, it lashes out with its tongue to drag them down.
Author: .izik

Entry: As the gears turn, POKENAME fires out extendable tongues to catch insects to consume.  Should the two tongues collide when extended, sparks will fly from the impact point and POKENAME will be disoriented for a time.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME can vanish into its surroundings while projecting adorable illusions to distract foes. It loves mimicking Trainers and Pokémon alike, giggling invisibly when its pranks leave everyone confused.
Author: JitteryJared

Entry: POKENAME is considered a relatively easy pet to care for, with a simple diet and disposition. In addition, the flame on its tail changes color based on its mood, making it easy to tell when it is content or not.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME uses its rubbery, stretchy body and its color-changing abilities to entertain sick Pokémon. When threatened, it can inflate to nearly triple its normal size while flashing threatening displays.
Author: just_a_few_thousand_crows

Entry: POKENAME's iron shell changes colors to match the rusted metal and stone of abandoned ruins. It clings to walls motionless for days, waiting to ambush unsuspecting prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's tusks are as sharp as steel and change color based on its mood. If it is startled, its entire body turns jet black, allowing it to blend into the shadows.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hides among cave stones, blending in seamlessly. Its saliva carries a mild toxin that causes confusion in prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: At night, POKENAME are the most dangerous predators. Their camouflage ability is so advanced they can mimic the pattern of a chain-linked fence.
Author: Trietceratops Horridus
