Entry: POKENAME is an ambush predator that camouflages itself in blizzards, making itself nearly invisible to the prey. Despite popular beliefs about it hunting down people lost in snowstorms, POKENAME's main target is actually small Bug-type Pokémon.
Author: milchik

Entry: As it dances, POKENAME's wings shimmer with shifting colors. Its emotions dictate both the dance style and hues it displays.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME happily sells items it finds to travelers. It will relentlessly pursue anyone who dares to steal its wares.
Author: tadbolmont

Entry: It can perfectly disguise itself as over 70,000 different species of tree. It's theorized to be an ambush predator, but all attempts to observe it while feeding have failed.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME is a trickster in combat, using camouflage to disappear on the battlefield. It deceives foes by tapping them from one side with its prehensile tongue before striking from the other side with a bombastic aerial attack.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME attempts to blend into its surroundings to try and secretly agitate the many noisy beach-goers it deals with, but fails each time, as it can oddly never seem to properly match the color of sand.
Author: sk372

Entry: It is capable of changing the color of its body at will. However, the glimmering gems that peek through its skin are so mesmerizing that it struggles to successfully disguise itself.
Author: imademyselfdothis

Entry: POKENAME's fur changes to match nearby shrubs. If threatened, it whips out its tongue to strike before fleeing into the brush.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME changes the colors and patterns on its wings to ward off predators. If you stare at its wings for too long, your vision may become distorted.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: One can tell how well a POKENAME is feeling just by looking: should it begin to suffer headaches, it loses control of its camouflage ability and begins to shift through all manner of colors and patterns until the pain subsides.
Author: sk372

Entry: Sometimes POKENAME will forget that its tail is used for fishing and instead dip its extendable tongue in the water. This often leads to the ridiculous sight of an alarmed POKENAME attempting to sling a Magikarp or Shellder off its tongue.
Author: sk372

Entry: Kecleon's DNA has seeped inside the Pokémon upon POKENAME's tail. When POKENAME changes color, the shelled being does, too. POKENAME is slow-moving and prefers to solely rely on camouflage to avoid combat altogether.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The magnetic pull of POKENAME's "ears" keeps its also-magnetic tongue perfectly centered when extended. If the tongue begins drifting to a side, it's a sign POKENAME is becoming ill.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are able to change the color of their heads at will, even to two different colors if they so wish. Their bodies automatically change to the mixed color of the two heads, but their stripes will always remain red.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME use the pink stripes along their body to help blend in with coral reefs. They camouflage into the sand, using their tails to redirect and grasp things at a moment's notice.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Odd rock formations with fairly simple compositions have been reported to shift during investigations. These formations have recently been discovered to be POKENAME, using the colors and textures of rocks to hide their stripes.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME's metal-plated exterior protects its less durable body from attacks. However, these plates aren't the strongest and will chip and crack as it burrows.
Author: EvilGammon

Entry: Blending in with the background, it eats the bad dreams of people and Pokémon. If you had a bad dream but forgot what it was, POKENAME has eaten it.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: Instead of rolling to travel around, POKENAME tends to levitate for short periods of time and spins around, surveying its surroundings with its single eye. POKENAME has been shown to be remarkably intelligent.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: This fusion resembles a Great Ball, but it lacks any corresponding functionality. Theorists use POKENAME as evidence to support a link between Voltorb and the creation of the Poké Ball.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The tiny claws at POKENAME's underside allow it some mobility, and its shell is metallic and sturdy for great defense. Should it still find itself cornered, it can use mental waves to call nearby bug Pokémon to assist it.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's iron skin does not rust, despite it primarily living in water. Once shed, the metallic skin is coveted for these inert properties.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME's near-perfect imitation of Feraligatr, in which it hides its true face in its jaws, serves as a deterrent, as it doesn't actively hunt prey.
Author: barthandelus_real

Entry: POKENAME precisely scans its surroundings from the night sky. Its steel body and keen intellect make it an adept hunter under the cover of darkness.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME buzzes with its wings to generate magnetic force. The louder the noise, the more powerful the magnetism.
Author: leonian1586

Entry: POKENAME can journey from the moon and back countless times without a break. It provides humans valuable information on how moonstones are created.
Author: Rkmaster25367

Entry: Highly sensitive to magnetic forces, POKENAME can detect their homes from miles away. Sailors have raised POKENAME on docks for generations, allowing them to act as compasses on their voyages.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME perpetually swim in circles, creating a small whirlpool that drags in prey. Exhausted from trying to escape, the prey inevitably end up in POKENAME's waiting mouth.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: This Pokémon's cells are magnetic and amorphous. Its ferrous body can change shape at will, though it struggles to move when around powerful magnets.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME has a fully-developed brain trapped in its iron body. Every cell is growing stronger, working as one so this Pokémon can be powerful.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME lifts its tail during thunderstorms, attracting lightning to strike and recharge its internal stores. At max capacity, the electricity constantly arcs between its ears.
Author: sk372

Entry: Scientists attempted to artificially create a Metang by fusing two Beldum with DNA Splicers. The experiment was a resounding failure.
Author: Faelocke

Entry: An extra Beldum was fused with Metang in an attempt to make it stronger. However, an imperfection in the fusion process made it weaker overall.
Author: Faelocke

Entry: Due to an error in the fusion process, the five brains of this fusion are out of sync. It is much weaker than a regular Metagross as a result.
Author: Faelocke

Entry: This Pokémon now rams prey with its iron body since it does not have a mouth. Fortunately, POKENAME's clumsiness no longer causes itself harm.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME hunt in companies and communicate with magnetic pulses. They attack primarily by magnetically pulling opponents onto their blades.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Even though it can't see its surroundings very well, this Pokémon is very mobile. Its iron armor protects its body when smashing into objects.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME live in scrapyards, making their nests out of large scrap piles. Groups of them can be seen with their jaws perpetually open to keep a lookout for potential intruders.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: This Pokémon headbutts everything around it with its iron head. POKENAME is still working on levitating with its magnetic capabilities, however.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: The shinier and smoother the surface of a POKENAME, the healthier. POKENAME are popular in futuristic areas due to their durable metal bodies and clean mechanical looks. They can connect to electrical grids for energy in high-density areas.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME's flame is hot enough to melt even the strongest metals. It was first seen around Saffron City.
Author: Ayutac

Entry: POKENAME is not blind like many Zubat variants; its single eye is hidden in its mouth. When hunting, it flies in front of its prey and blinds them with a flash of light from its eye before using its fangs to drain blood.
Author: sk372

Entry: This Pokémon has tusks made from claw-like hooks. It regularly sharpens these tusks, helping them transmit its magnetic communications more precisely.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: It can see infrared light with the lens on its chest. Detectives in Unova use this ability to track criminals with great precision.
Author: .izik

Entry: When searching for prey, it will shine a red spotlight from its eye. When it sees a victim, the light will flash rapidly to disorient the target.
Author: .izik

Entry: The cotton-like substance that comes out of its body moves like wings. While it cannot fly at high speeds, it can stay airborne for days at a time.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite being made of metal, POKENAME is incredibly vulnerable. All of its energy is focused on using its magnetic powers to hold its body together.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME communicate with each other by slamming their tails against their own hollow bodies to create metallic ringing along their scales. The central scales on their foreheads act as a sensor to read these sounds over great distances.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: It has sharper claws than Belmander, but they are lacking in strength. What it is missing in offense, though, it makes up in defense.
Author: Ayutac

Entry: Its eye can see for miles with little effort. Search and rescue units utilize POKENAME for locating survivors of disasters.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon consists of three Beldum held together with magnetism. When metallic objects are pulled toward the dirt, there's a POKENAME underground.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME uses a magnetic force that repels Earth's magnetism, and it can manipulate that force to empower its punches and kicks.
Author: cipherlingarde

Entry: Buoyed by magnetic forces, POKENAME drifts with tentacles outstretched near the surface of the ocean. Upon constricting prey, it plunges suddenly into the depths.
Author: Busilisk

Entry: POKENAME scour the ocean floor looking for oil deposits. Although docile, they are dangerous when provoked, often alerting a swarm.
Author: cyprexx

Entry: POKENAME scour the ocean collecting scrap metal and debris. They have avoidant natures, but often mistake other Pokémon for debris.
Author: cyprexx

Entry: A POKENAME's eye is more powerful than any lens produced by science. Occult practitioners use POKENAME to spy across vast distances.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: Controversy arose when it was discovered an astronomer used POKENAME to glimpse visions of distant planets. Every world seen by POKENAME was a dark and twisted nightmare.
Author: ozydamians

Entry: To behold the eye of POKENAME renders all but the strongest of wills catatonic. Mystics claim that it can see every aspect of what it turns its gaze to, past, present, and future.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: POKENAME is a large Pokémon with a serpentine body crafted from a tough, metallic material. It can burrow deep into the ground, using its strength to launch surprise attacks on unsuspecting foes.
Author: ThePandaSharky

Entry: POKENAME carries Beldum around in a hollow slot in its torso, protecting it from harm. POKENAME seeks out others of its kind so its Beldum can meet another and merge into Metang.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's superior intellect prevents them from losing control to anger. They hover over oceans, scanning for prey that meets their high standards.
Author: garret95

Entry: It's incredibly top-heavy, so it has trouble staying upright. POKENAME shoots sparks at other Electric-type Pokémon to prove its bravery.
Author: leonian1586

Entry: POKENAME have such big and heavy heads that they constantly lose their balance mid-flight and crash to the ground. They don't seem to mind.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: This Pokémon's free-flowing magnetic body can fly through the air at rapid speeds. It can use psychic power to assimilate metal into itself.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME uses its gigantic claws to cling to the roofs of caves, 'walking' across the ceiling to traverse in the dark. When it needs to, it can clumsily fly through manipulation of magnetic fields.
Author: Katie

Entry: This Pokémon's body grew incredibly hard and developed another brain. However, POKENAME can barely move, and yearns even more for power and freedom.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: While the two POKENAME's bodies were successfully fused, their brains have not linked up. As a result, this is far weaker than a "true" Metagross.
Author: Faelocke

Entry: The extra claws aid this fusion in hunting its prey, but tend to be unwieldy in battle. This is due to an imbalance in their linked brains.
Author: Faelocke

Entry: POKENAME are incredibly rare and elusive Pokémon, possessing both the strength to effortlessly punch through metal walls and the intelligence to understand human speech. It only grows more intelligent with evolution.
Author: bee4082

Entry: With its intense flame and powerful arms, it can break through any barricade. It is rumored Silph Co. is trying to give it wings to make it truly unstoppable.
Author: Ayutac

Entry: Silph Co.'s secret project can now fly, but in exchange for that, it lost some of its heat and strength. Silph Co. is working on an improvement.
Author: Ayutac

Entry: POKENAME are often seen in packs around drilling Metacool or paired with Belcool. They are very territorial and armed with lasers and claws.
Author: cyprexx

Entry: POKENAME are hostile to other Pokémon and swarm defensively around their hulking Metacruel as it drills for oil. Beware their armaments!
Author: cyprexx

Entry: POKENAME runs at incredible speeds without fear of accidents as its metal hide is highly durable. It enjoys chasing down speedy prey with high mineral content to feed on, with the rare Aerodactyl being its favorite.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: It hosts four brains within its body, which uses up a lot of energy over the course of a day. When it needs to think hard, this Pokémon rolls into power plants, absorbing electricity to supercharge their brains.
Author: Celio_0230

Entry: Able to repel even the sharpest fangs via powerful magnetism, it's impossible for foes to bite POKENAME's shiny metal through the shield of its force.
Author: cipherlingarde

Entry: POKENAME's four brains give it a perfect memory, letting it transform into anything it's seen before. These brains are the only solid part of its body.
Author: bee4082

Entry: It uses water propulsion to fire its arms with the velocity of a tank shell. When an arm is destroyed, POKENAME searches for a Beldum to replace it.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: POKENAME's floating arms store excess electricity and shoot it out in small shocks. They can plug into any outlet, and they can be used as a charger.
Author: germs2128

Entry: POKENAME's steel shell is near impervious, protecting its evolving body within. Its massive four claws will rend apart anything that attempts to disturb its evolution process.
Author: sk372

Entry: With unmatched speed, strength and intelligence, POKENAME was an amphibious apex predator of prehistory. Fossil records indicate even hunting Tyrantrum as prey was not uncommon.
Author: sk372

Entry: It spreads an incredibly dangerous plague with its mechanically augmented stingers. It is unclear whether or not this Pokémon has a will of its own.
Author: PepperThePirate

Entry: Research has been done on POKENAME that suggests they do not have souls. The validity and implications of these results are often brought up in scientific discussions.
Author: ImaginaryNeon

Entry: POKENAME can think faster than a supercomputer. It uses this intellect, and its magnetically charged body, to precisely sabotage electrical systems.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Its powerful paws and jaws crush hard rock formations. They are highly territorial Pokémon.
Author: mrbapcik

Entry: A terribly strong metal body, four hyper-intelligent brains, and overwhelming power make POKENAME a living catastrophe. Beware its brains and brawn!
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME are advanced technomancers, able to bend any mechanical device to its will. It will even possess other machines to cause as much havoc as possible.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME have an iron-clad body that contains a furnace that burns as hot as the surface of the sun. They can launch controlled blasts of this intense heat from their arms.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME have an iron-clad body that contains a furnace that burns as hot as the surface of the sun. They can launch controlled blasts of this intense heat from their arms.
Author: Katie

Entry: Though cumbersome in flight due to its weight, POKENAME is a surprisingly adept glider. It lives near cliffsides and high peaks, using those to launch itself and use its bulk to barrel into other Pokémon or Trainers.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME is as intelligent as it is cruel. Using its four spectral arms, it pummels its opponents violently, even after its victim has fainted.
Author: 8xviktor

Entry: This variant of POKENAME bears striking resemblance to an iron warlord from a certain video game. It is beloved in the region of Paldea.
Author: 8xviktor

Entry: POKENAME expels pollen-like nanomachines to help analyze its surroundings. This process allows it to mentally visualize a 3D map of the battlefield.
Author: LordKai1

Entry: With its high intelligence, it can quickly ascertain the weakest spot on anything it spies. This makes it easily capable of incapacitating foes or shattering structures with a single calculated strike of its metallic skull.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's clawed wings leave bright red trails as it flies high in the sky. These trails have given this Pokémon its nickname, the Crimson Comet.
Author: Nyaarys

Entry: The energy rushing out to keep it aloft could power a small town. It rockets through the air, slamming itself into prey like a comet.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: POKENAME can move its metal claws as if they were attached to its body. It can lift objects that are over three times its weight.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME's ears are used for sensing magnetic waves. This allows them to find their usual prey, Magnemite and Nosepass, more efficiently.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: POKENAME can use its four metallic arms to punch faster than a bullet train. Do not make eye contact with it as it will see you as a challenge.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Incomparable intelligence has not soothed POKENAME's grudge. It makes elaborate plans to get back at the ones who originally wronged it.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: Because POKENAME's body is so weak, it uses metal appendages to skitter around. It prefers to live in solitude and will launch itself at any intruders.
Author: darxer_

Entry: As the fusion of two very intelligent Pokémon, POKENAME is unrivaled in intelligence. However, it has to constantly use its psychic powers to prevent its gel from damaging the metal legs supporting it.
Author: VoidDx01

Entry: What appear to be claws on each limb are actually additional fangs, capable of biting and absorbing blood. As long as even one of POKENAME's points punctures a foe, it can feast on them.
Author: sk372

Entry: All jewelry stores worth their salt employ POKENAME to keep up with the competitive market. Due to their meticulous nature, however, an unfortunate Carbink finds its way onto an appraiser's table far too often.
Author: backgroundnoisegalore/.fedoraman/Merc

Entry: POKENAME can use its connective chains to swing its metal legs with a lot of momentum, which greatly increases their penetrating power.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME is a mechanical marvel used for disaster relief, particularly in identifying missing people. Mineralized water is its main fuel.
Author: dyo_jonah

Entry: Vibrant and helpful, POKENAME stands out for its overprotective nature towards human children. It is considered to be wise and loyal.
Author: Spooky Scary Kunoichi

Entry: Silph Co.'s secret machine of war. When on the frontlines, this Pokémon is nearly unstoppable.
Author: TheHeroicT

Entry: This fusion has a great capacity to fulfill highly complex tasks, performing attacks with great range and accuracy. This quality gave birth to the phrase "There should be no POKENAMEs in a gentleman's bout" among duelists back in the day.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Rumored to be extra-terrestrial, POKENAME drill for oil across the ocean floor. When disturbed, oil spills from their site, harming the ecosystem.
Author: cyprexx

Entry: POKENAME is thought to be from space, a gargantuan invader here for oil. They arrive on beaches with huge invading forces of Metcool and Metcruel.
Author: cyprexx

Entry: POKENAME can be found around abandoned natural dams, feeding off the rotted wood. The gases it produces are highly flammable, leading some enterprising Trainers to try and harvest the gas as fuel to sell.
Author: Katie

Entry: When dirty, a POKENAME rolls in a small pond or puddle to get clean. If the vines on its body dry out, they will fall off in clumps.
Author: .izik

Entry: Any wooden contraptions found in the forest are actually built by a POKENAME. It is seen monologuing to a Blastfetch'd about its tragic past.
Author: aregularbigjoke

Entry: This fusion awakened a dormant gene in POKENAME. It uses its axes to cut down trees to build dams for dozens of Bidoof families.
Author: catsoup02

Entry: POKENAME has perfected its ability to procure wood for its dams. If it is attacked, it can use its hatchets as dangerous weapons.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It canvasses the forest floor, eating any branches it can find. When threatened it will clumsily defend itself with its small horn, making it a favorite target for predators.
Author: King Mordork

Entry: POKENAME becomes fascinated with its own reflection in still water, trying to mimic every movement it sees. It often confuses other Pokémon by perfectly copying their behaviors as well.
Author: .izik

Entry: Found at the base of trees, POKENAME latch on to the roots to draw nutrients while it pupates. If too many POKENAME latch on to the same tree, it will die, causing them to starve.
Author: King Mordork

Entry: Once a suitable location is found, groups of POKENAME set to work felling the nearby trees to build their misshapen nest. Seemingly random clearings in the woods are among telltale warning signs that a POKENAME colony is nearby.
Author: King Mordork

Entry: POKENAME lines its lodge with soft algae for comfort. It sheds fur from its long tail, layering it over the moss to keep warm.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME rocks its body back and forth like a metronome at night. At midnight, it suddenly gnaws down every limb from a nearby tree for reasons unknown.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME constructs its nest from twigs gnawed off trees. If an enemy gets too close, it puts them to sleep with Hypnosis before carrying them away with its claws.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME prefers fields full of tulips, weaving the flowers into makeshift nests. It gathers petals for comfort, creating cozy places to rest beneath the colorful blooms.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME gathers orchids in its fists while flying, using them to line its lodge. This habit fills its home with a pleasant aroma.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME secretes a sticky adhesive, which it uses to strengthen its dams and hold together nests. This natural glue makes its structures sturdy, withstanding even harsh weather.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME weaves water-resistant webbing between logs in its dam to reinforce the structure. At night, it lays silk traps near the water's edge to capture unwary prey like Squirtle.
Author: .izik

Entry: It can flap its wings at high enough speeds to create blades of wind. These air currents are used to chop up trees for its den.
Author: .izik

Entry: While it chews on wood, the static in its fur grows due to the movement. Contact with its body while it eats can cause a mild electrical burn.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME floats along riverbeds in search of ideal dam-building locations. It plants flower seeds nearby to mark its territory.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME gnaws off branches above passing travelers to startle them. If they drop anything in surprise, it quickly steals the item and dashes into the woods.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME make their homes by the river's edge. During the autumn months, it will gnaw large holes in rocks for shelter.
Author: .izik

Entry: It gnaws absently on its own hair, keeping its ever growing teeth and locks at bay.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: It sees through both pairs of eyes simultaneously. Because of this, young POKENAME can get motion sickness by just walking.
Author: .izik

Entry: Large clusters of POKENAME will live in a single tree. Should one be disturbed, it can set off a chain of small explosions.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's keen eyesight allows it to spot Apricorn Trees from over 200 feet away. It swoops down, snatches Apricorns with its sharp teeth, and flies them back to its nest.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is an expert at cutting down all sorts of trees. Its arms, strangely, resemble chainsaws. It's rumored to be able to cut entire forests down.
Author: catsoup02

Entry: POKENAME can use its chainsaw arms as useful tools and dangerous weapons. They are popular partner Pokémon for lumberjacks.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It can chop cleanly through tree trunks in a single strike. When it sleeps in the wild, it likes to rest its head on a gnawed-on log.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME pretends to be friendly to those who approach its den. If someone gets too close, it bites them with its fangs before snatching one of their belongings and fleeing.
Author: .izik

Entry: The bubbling mud on POKENAME's body burns hotter than an industrial furnace. It enjoys gnawing on burnt trees near volcanoes, consuming the ash as part of its diet.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite its tiny neck, a POKENAME can swallow an apricorn whole. It can survive on one apricorn for an entire week.
Author: .izik

Entry: Even when there are few trees in an area, it always finds a way to craft a dam out of what is available. After a day of construction, it sorts out sticks to give to its cohorts for helping out.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME uses its strong sense of smell to detect predators before starting construction on a dam. If it senses danger, it rolls away at high speed to escape.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME leaves stains wherever it goes, dragging its tail through paint and mud. Each mark it creates seems intentional, almost as if it is trying to tell a story through art.
Author: .izik

Entry: The spikes on the heads of POKENAME are adapted to carving wood for constructing dens. Logs left behind by POKENAME are often collected and sold for high prices due to their interesting grooves.
Author: just_a_few_thousand_crows

Entry: POKENAME enjoys splashing in shallow creeks, using the flowing water to cool off during hot days. It builds small dams nearby, turning parts of the creek into peaceful pools.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its powerful tails to strip bark from trees with surprising dexterity. It enjoys stacking logs in strange patterns, which researchers believe may be a form of play.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME creates motionless copies of itself with mud near its lodge at night to confuse predators. If it begins to rain, it quickly retreats inside for shelter.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME watches travelers near its den and mimics their mannerisms with excitement. As a thank-you for the entertainment, it offers them bundles of freshly gathered twigs.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME carries mint leaves in its fur, spreading a refreshing scent wherever it goes. Other Pokémon seek its company, drawing calm and clarity from the aroma.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME drips a foul-smelling venom from its horn around its lodge to deter predators. If the warning is ignored, it attacks with a ferocious Super Fang.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME may appear quite intimidating and omnipotent, but despite its legendary looks, it is still just two Bidoof.
Author: mirby

Entry: Many consider POKENAME to be the true god of Pokémon, more powerful than Arceus itself. Its strength is simply unmatched.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: Forests with large populations of POKENAME have large open glades within them, the trees that would have grown in the glade having been rammed down by them. The fallen trees are pulled together to make shelters from the weather.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME floats near cemeteries by riverbanks, silently observing the area. It bites off limbs from flowering trees to decorate graves.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME builds lodges across the river from others of its kind, engaging in a friendly rivalry. This competition drives them to constantly improve their surroundings.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME always knows the direction and distance of the nearest tree. It dutifully gnaws on trees and plants to prevent overgrowth.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME obsessively carves wood and stone. It aggressively defends anything it has marked.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME diligently pounds wood and stone to make its nest. It also pounds the ground to scare off invaders, and pounds aquatic Pokémon as their predator.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME can be easily irritated if it spots other Pokémon desecrating its forest. However, they seem happy to help any struggling Bidoof colonies.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME is said to gnaw at space that has been distorted. It is said to create dams in space to close up Ultra Wormholes.
Author: theradrad

Entry: Its resilient teeth are its pride and joy. POKENAME gnaws up boulders and steel beams and licks up the shavings to keep its teeth in top condition.
Author: theradrad

Entry: POKENAME slaps mud onto logs to reinforce its lodge. Once its home is complete, it plants flowers on the roof as a finishing touch.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME collects parsley to line its den, using the herb's scent to ward off pests. Its resourcefulness makes it a helpful companion in any environment.
Author: .izik

Entry: It has a habit of spacing out from time to time. When it does, its flame slowly dims, and if not snapped out of the trance, it will burn out entirely.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: POKENAME makes its home near posies, enjoying their fragrant scent. If disturbed while basking in the sunlight, it attempts to bite intruders or swat them with its log-like arms.
Author: .izik

Entry: These Pokémon are thought to have been created by an ancient civilization, with the intent of being as simple and normal as possible.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME nests among tall sunflowers, using the plants as both shelter and food. Its bright demeanor matches the cheery flowers, making it a beloved sight for passing Trainers.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME spits tiny flames to loosen tree limbs, then uses them to build its nest. If intruders approach, it flaps its wings to whip up strong winds as a warning.
Author: .izik

Entry: It will steal lumber from unoccupied construction sites to build its den. Its teeth are as hard as diamonds and can cut through solid steel.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is extremely well suited for gliding through water swiftly. Its powerful teeth can shred through steel and prey alike.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME chews through trees in the morning, then possesses the stumps before sleeping. Why it prefers stumps over whole trees remains a mystery to researchers.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's fur retains moisture, keeping it cool during hot days. It enjoys resting near rivers, where the dampness in its coat helps regulate its body temperature.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME have a thick fur coat that retains warmth during the winter. During the summer, they shed more than a quarter of their weight in fur, as the weather conditions are otherwise too hot for them.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: The fungus growing on the body of POKENAME is remarkably high in lignin. This gives it a very wooden texture. In order to fuel the growth of these fungi, POKENAME will seek out tree bark as its primary food source.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME senses when its Trainer is sad and chews off a tree branch to offer as a toy. It wags its stubby tail and requests a game of fetch to cheer them up.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is commonly used as a mascot for various wildlife preserves. Its comically placid face is beloved by children.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME plants pumpkin patches around its lodge to mark its territory. At night, it curls up and sleeps among the pumpkins.
Author: .izik

Entry: There are reports of POKENAME swarming around towns and gnawing at streetlights. Once it severs the base of the pole, it will fly the entire post back to its nest.
Author: .izik

Entry: Rumors of floating tree stumps were debunked when it rolls onto the shore to dry off. It is so convincing as a tree stump that Flying-type Pokémon rest on its back to preen its wings.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME aggressively defends its lodge, knocking out intruders with a powerful Low Kick. It then hurls them into a nearby river to be carried downstream.
Author: .izik

Entry: It punches trees to test its strength. Once the tree falls, it will use its sharp fangs to consume it over the course of days.
Author: .izik

Entry: A wild POKENAME likes to live in the woods by mud. Whenever It senses danger it flaps their wings to warn any threats nearby.
Author: krsgaming

Entry: A Pokémon that was formed by the spirits of six eggs. The spirits are bound to their cracked shells.
Author: fuzzythelion

Entry: POKENAME are native to the Alola region, often roaming around popular graveyards. If you eat one of its fruits, you will find yourself ill soon after.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: POKENAME uses the bones of its predecessors to call upon their spiritual aid in battle, though it's against their will.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME release an aroma similar to Full Incense, a heavy and dense concoction of chemicals that makes people lethargic. Their collective consciousness is formed from the noxious vapors produced by factory workers.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME appears to have taken on a more greasy and narcissistic persona. Despite its failings, it can cook a mean pizza for those it deems friends.
Author: LordKai1

Entry: When unsuspecting Trainers get too close to the Odd Keystone, POKENAME emerges, trapping them with invisible barriers. Supposedly the last thing they hear is a dark, haunting laugh as their soul becomes absorbed.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: POKENAME was formed by 108 spirits. While it can transform into anything, it prefers the shape of its former loved ones.
Author: dzygomer

Entry: POKENAME inhabits chunks of Fire Stones while resting, leaping out in a blaze of flames if disturbed. Many Trainers have unknowingly picked up an inhabited stone, only to be attacked.
Author: .izik

Entry: A Pokémon commonly spotted hiding in marine crevices. It patiently waits for the opportune moment to ambush its prey.
Author: Karma

Entry: POKENAME tends to zip around in twisted, confusing patterns when excited. Capturing its keystone will keep it from wreaking havoc.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: It appears on gloomy nights, standing rigidly like a doll and watching its victim until it throws out its amorphous hands and abducts it for all time.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It appears on gloomy nights, standing rigidly like a doll and watching its victim until it throws out its amorphous hands and abducts it for all time.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME appears in alleyways at night. It constantly juggles its glowing balls, which it uses to hypnotize its victims before abducting them.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME possesses a tome inscribed with an unknown language. Each tome was once an ordinary book, warped by its haunting presence.
Author: .izik

Entry: If you see POKENAME in the forest, do not follow it. When followed, it will send you into the past, with no way to get back to the present.
Author: pokechampkevin

Entry: Possessed by Spiritomb, POKENAME acts erratically, desperately trying to keep Spiritomb's evil at bay. As its mind breaks, cracks form on its body.
Author: giggity._.

Entry: POKENAME's cries bring happiness to those who seek wisdom, but torment those who seek power. It was sealed in an old book by an unknown spell.
Author: dzygomer

Entry: POKENAME is the result of a powerful Mismagius sealed into a book. Those who hold the book are said to be vexed by voices.
Author: awiralonprime

Entry: POKENAME is a ghostly entity bound to a discarded bonsai vase. Its purpose shrouded in mystery, it wanders endlessly searching for its original owner.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: Born from the ruins of a failed society, POKENAME haunts the factories that enslaved its ancestors.
Author: Thropp

Entry: Having broken free from its keystone confinement, POKENAME has learned to use the rocks trapping it as weapons instead. It launches ghostly volleys of stone towards its enemies.
Author: coridiant

Entry: POKENAME uses its swirling body to lure in unsuspecting humans and Pokémon. Once enthralled, POKENAME will wrap its vines around its prey and drain their energy.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: A Pokémon made up of 108 viruses and malware programs. Releasing it could destroy the entire internet and everything connected to it.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: A mad scientist fused these two Pokémon, thinking he could permanently seal Spiritomb into the digital world. It didn't work as planned.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: Be careful if you buy a statue of a Torchic. Some instances contain a POKENAME, which will break through the fragile exterior to attack you with the imprisoned spirits of Pokémon that have been consumed by humans.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME's nature is spiteful and petty. It uses its psychic powers to tear apart relationships, supping on the misery they cause while it cackles.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: A wild POKENAME harvests the souls of Ghost-types in hopes of breaking free of the Odd Keystone embedded in its chest. If it bonds with a strong Trainer, some theorize it will begin to feed off of their life force as well.
Author: Cinnamoone_Redfield

Entry: Possibly due to the evil spirits they are fused with, POKENAME frequently attempt to go on quests for vengeance. They are ruthless while doing so.
Author: frostedwyrm

Entry: This form of POKENAME remains shackled to its keystone. It will attempt to warn others of danger but make no effort to hide its ghastly appearance.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: This variant of POKENAME has broken free of its keystone. It delights in the misfortune of others and keeps to the shadows when danger arrives.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Sounds of many different voices can be heard weeping from behind POKENAME's skull-shaped mask. Rumors say that if one ever understands the words they whisper, they will be cursed for life.
Author: .izik

Entry: It's said that in the deepest depths of the afterlife's seas, POKENAME resides. Each one is an afterlife unto itself, carrying the souls of thousands.
Author: captainmodeus

Entry: POKENAME embraces its power over illusions fully, forsaking its body into nothing but a husk that tethers it to reality. It feeds off the fear of all beings for a purpose researchers are too frightened to find out.
Author: merclipse

Entry: When exhausted, the ghostly mass of POKENAME shrinks to a fraction of its size. Small embers escape its mouth as it snores, flickering like candlelight in the darkness.
Author: .izik

Entry: The ghostly portion of POKENAME's body can pass through solid matter effortlessly. When angered, it releases an overwhelming Overheat attack that scorches everything nearby.
Author: .izik

Entry: The lost soul of music. Any song that has never been written or released is embodied in this Pokémon. It sings solemnly at night.
Author: TheHeroicT

Entry: At night, POKENAME floats through abandoned manors, letting out haunting howls. Each wail sounds like hundreds of voices crying out at once.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME disguises itself as stalactites in order to better hide itself from predators. A cave may hold hundreds of POKENAME at a time, each of them detecting subtle movements in their environment.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: There are 108 evil spirits trapped in its shield. In order to be free one day, the spirits must successfully keep the wielder safe from attacks.
Author: creeps_jr

Entry: The 108 souls of Spiritomb have taken over the body of a Sableye to form POKENAME. In order to keep its keystone safe, it has formed a protective gem-like cover around it.
Author: CrazyNaturekitty

Entry: POKENAME is comprised of 108 spirits of people who perished while lost in the mountains. In its den lies the frozen corpses of the spirits' original owners.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: As POKENAME dances it summons forth its hatred and malice it had in another life. No one knows why this Pokémon was chained to the keystone.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is a dangerous Pokémon sealed within an icy prison. With howling and writhing, it impatiently awaits its release.
Author: .realthree

Entry: One hundred and eight spirits entered a titan of steel to create this fused Pokémon. Its impenetrable body gives it unforeseen powers.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The spirits of 108 people given form, POKENAME roams looking to be put to rest. Due to its otherworldly steel construction, it's unable to find it.
Author: pory

Entry: POKENAME is known to make its home near ancient ruins or dark forests. Anyone POKENAME catches near its home will have their spirit stolen from them.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: What looks like a castle is in fact a crypt, a grave inside for each of those that make up its existence. More empty graves wait, eager to be filled.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: Playful and carefree to the end, POKENAME can often be found chasing ghostly wisps through the graveyards they haunt.
Author: Cristata

Entry: Playful and carefree to the end, POKENAME can often be found chasing ghostly wisps through the graveyards they haunt.
Author: Cristata

Entry: POKENAME incessantly hums an elegy-like music that captivates everyone around it. It also emits a soporific miasma from its censer.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME incessantly hums an elegy-like music that captivates everyone around it. It also emits a soporific miasma from its censer.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME appears at places of death, burning incense to offer safe passage for the departed souls. Anyone who hears this Pokémon's dirges feels an intense melancholy and a desire to see their loved ones.
Author: mineskyva

Entry: It emits hypnotizing incense from the censer on its staff, which it uses for fighting. Anyone who falls asleep through the miasma never awakens again.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It emits hypnotizing incense from the censer on its staff, which it uses for fighting. Anyone who falls asleep through the miasma never awakens again.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME is thought to be the spirits of an old island civilization that worshiped Torkoal, their souls joining together in idols carved in its shape. It resides in volcanic areas, warning travelers away from perilous conditions.
Author: sk372

Entry: If too many spirits are sealed within a buried keystone, they break free and erupt from the earth as one. Each head despises the others, and so they endlessly strain against each other at the surface, never escaping.
Author: @imademyselfdothis

Entry: A Pokémon formed by the spirits of Fighting-type Trainers who refuse to move on. They continue to fight in the shape of their idol, Machamp.
Author: dzygomer

Entry: It adores the fleetingly rare Strib Berries that grow in Hoenn; no other Berry will do. It wiggles about in ecstasy when it gets a hold of one.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: It is said to be a statue of a Squirtle inhabited by multiple malicious spirits. They will shoot water at unsuspecting Trainers and Pokémon alike.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: POKENAME absorbs the spirits of Pokémon it defeats in battles. It will often cause as much mayhem as possible before it is defeated.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: It has gathered hundreds of souls to empower itself. It will ravage entire ecosystems in the pursuit of more power.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: They rely on noxious fumes to scare people away from their homes, as their spiritual abilities are weaker. They are known to steal ritualistic objects such as a Spell Tag, which they corrupt and turn to their will.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: While asleep, POKENAME will astral project to watch for approaching foes. It remains fully aware of its surroundings even in deep slumber, ensuring it is never caught off guard.
Author: .izik

Entry: Channels mystical energy through its vines to sense foes, striking with precision. Its bulb-like growth blooms under moonlight, releasing spores that calm or poison, depending on its mood.
Author: segmoph

Entry: Found in ancient ruins, POKENAME's bones glow with infused aura. Trainers admire its fierce loyalty and strength in physical and aura-based combat.
Author: Sheogorath

Entry: Maritime workers consider POKENAME invaluable in times of disasters at sea, especially during the night. With its ability to sense aura, it can locate those in need of rescue more effectively than the naked eye.
Author: sk372

Entry: With a powerful fighting spirit, POKENAME will only copy opponents it deems worthy enough, fighting in its normal form until then. Its transformed state retains a faint flickering aura emanating around it.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME uses its mastery of aura and electricity to subdue its opponents. This Pokémon is quick on its feet and is able to move faster than the human eye can follow.
Author: Jona_hehe

Entry: POKENAME can sense the auras of everything, even while it is sleeping. POKENAME assists hungry Pokémon by aura-sensing people who prepare delicious food.
Author: mbavenger64

Entry: Despite being limbless, POKENAME have the ability to create new appendages from pure aura, which they use to great effect.
Author: norskdaedalus

Entry: POKENAME is ever vigilant, always keeping an eye on its surroundings. While the main head is devoted to training, the rear head only wants to run.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: This Pokémon's body is as strong as steel due to intensive meditation. It can fire aura blasts from its hands during combat.
Author: creeps_jr

Entry: This Pokémon retains electricity within the fur on its back. POKENAME later releases this by charging itself up for a brief period of time. During this time, any and all attacks will cause a devastating shock to it.
Author: omegacyclops

Entry: POKENAME are capable of shooting highly concentrated blasts of raw energy. They are known as very loyal companions.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME's aura-reading abilities act like thermal vision. It can tell friend from foe even in the thickest winter storms.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME moves extremely fast when it curls into a ball. When rolling around at the speed of sound, POKENAME uses its aura to sense its surroundings so that it doesn't accidentally run into anything.
Author: darkweavile428

Entry: Lucaking are often seen meditating, waiting for a worthy Trainer. It often doesn't fight, however, because of its laziness.
Author: thatonepunkstr

Entry: The fire that POKENAME emanates burns the life essence of whatever it touches. It's a master of many fighting styles.
Author: HoundRyS

Entry: It stood guard over many tombs in ancient times. Nowadays, POKENAME is often seen as a motif in movies to hint at the time period it was popular in.
Author: ferdirenz

Entry: POKENAME are spirits bound to held items. They influence their wielder's mind and control them in exchange of granting them power.
Author: Spooky Scary Kunoichi

Entry: POKENAME does whatever it takes to defend its territory and protect its loved ones, even if it puts itself in harm's way. When using its aura abilities, its body glows black, as if surrounded by smog.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's illusory powers are so effective it can even perfectly recreate the aura of others as well as their form. It's said the goal of every POKENAME is to master 1000 auras.
Author: sk372

Entry: The cotton that POKENAME carries makes a comfortable pillow. However, if one with impure intent tries to touch it, they will be burned.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The webs POKENAME spins carry some of its aura-detecting nature within. Those that are pure of aura can touch the threads and feel no shock or stickiness, but evil hearts will be jolted and stuck nigh-instantaneously.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME patrols dark caverns, using its aura-sensing capabilities to detect intruders. If it sense no evil it ignores the target, but shows no mercy in repelling those with detestable auras from its home.
Author: sk372

Entry: Despite being hot enough to melt steel, the flames which POKENAME's aura are made of will never harm individuals with righteous hearts.
Author: norskdaedalus

Entry: The two heads have powerful connection with one another, allowing them to combo their attacks together. During the night, one head will keep training while the other sleeps.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME channel auras through the golden masks they carry. They tend to become protective of their Trainers and will be especially unforgiving to thieves.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: Although tiny and light, their fearlessness and honor cannot be overstated. They often enter fights that they have no chance of winning.
Author: Xephyr

Entry: POKENAME are incredibly friendly by nature. They bring happiness in the form of gifts and hugs when visiting peaceful places. Occasionally, their friendly disposition is mistaken for weakness when, in reality, they are very capable combatants.
Author: Gloomymort

Entry: POKENAME's sails help it detect and project auras and emotions. When it must fight, it freezes opponents and then slaps them with its whip-like tail.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: A POKENAME loyally protects its Trainer against all danger, which it senses using aura. This ability lets it guard against threats even while asleep.
Author: .realthree

Entry: A POKENAME loyally protects its Trainer against all danger, which it senses using aura. This one has a rare coloration.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME seems like a normal mushroom, but when its prey approaches, it shows its martial skills and attacks.
Author: Prof.Whitebeam

Entry: Its sensitivity is so keen that it can sense the aura of creatures from very far away. It can launch enormous shurikens of pure, concentrated energy.
Author: garret95

Entry: Loyal to its Trainer, it can sense their wellbeing even at long distance. Once it's learned the smell of an aura, it never forgets it.
Author: HoundRyS

Entry: POKENAME have rarely been spotted in groups. They resemble a fearsome foe from a popular children's game series.
Author: Moginar

Entry: Enhanced aura control allows POKENAME to move its limbs with much greater dexterity and speed. Its flames are as powerful as its fists.
Author: HoundRyS

Entry: If POKENAME senses an evil aura, it immediately unleashes devastating psychic blasts. It gives no warning before striking.
Author: .izik

Entry: A fusion of Lucario and Machamp, POKENAME wields both aura powers and immense strength. It trains diligently in mountainous regions.
Author: Sheogorath

Entry: POKENAME stores up aura in the core of its rocky body. It can cause powerful earthquakes by channeling the aura into the ground.
Author: _aphoric

Entry: This is one of the very few cases of two Mega Evolutions from one Trainer. Due to the massive energy usage, POKENAME is in immense pain.
Author: Patch_Bros

Entry: POKENAME uses its mastery of aura to flare up a powerful blaze of spiritual energy around it, shaping it into whatever fearsome monstrosity it thinks would most frighten its opponent senseless.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's pendulum is formed from its own aura manipulation, ensuring that it never loses its method of hypnotizing foes. It prefers to hypnotize those with evil auras in order to forcibly change their ways.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME carves winding tunnels underground, where it molts to release its overflowing life energy. Dirt taken from POKENAME tunnels is often used as fertilizer.
Author: slaphappygrandpa

Entry: POKENAME explore underwater caves in search of food and shelter, using their bioluminescence to guide them deeper and deeper into the depths.
Author: Cristata

Entry: POKENAME explore underwater caves in search of food and shelter, using their bioluminescence to guide them deeper and deeper into the depths.
Author: Cristata

Entry: POKENAME usually sleep all day, but anyone who disturbs their slumber will be chased until they tire out. Their slimy surface is rumored to taste like jam.
Author: Krune

Entry: POKENAME's eyes are coated with a special mucus that protects them from sandstorms. This adaptation allows it to traverse harsh deserts with ease.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon nests in intricate cave networks. It uses psychic brain waves to lure prey to dead ends, where it corners them.
Author: slaphappygrandpappy

Entry: It ruthlessly nips ankles, car tires, and pets. With its tough shell protecting it from most retaliation, a single POKENAME can terrorize an entire village. Ice-type Pokémon are often the only thing that can convince it to move on.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: Its jaws are powerful enough to snap an iron bar in two. Training it to not bite or to be less aggressive is an impossible task.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: This Pokémon is constantly energized. POKENAME will bite and gnaw on anything in its path, even if it's a living being.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Despite its fearsome jaws, POKENAME has a playful nature and enjoys surfacing to startle boaters. It often eats broken fishing lures and tangled line as a source of food, luckily fishing hooks aren't able to penetrate its thick stomach lining.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME tunnels through sand at astonishing speeds, reaching 80 mph in mere seconds. Its rapid movements leave behind spiraling sand trails.
Author: .izik

Entry: Waddling about on land, POKENAME are able to glide through the ground as if it was water. They constantly train to get faster, hoping they will be able fly some day.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME usually sleep all day but will chase anyone who disturbs their rest until they tire out. Their slimy surface is rumored to taste like jam.
Author: Krune

Entry: POKENAME possesses a very sharp blade on its head with which it fights other POKENAME in order to determine an alpha early on. Wildly swinging its head around makes it dizzy most of the time.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: A small group of POKENAME were discovered guarding an ancient shrine in Johto. They continue to protect the bell inside with unwavering dedication.
Author: .izik

Entry: To create its den, POKENAME burrows into massive stalactites with precision. It ensures the structure remains stable to avoid collapse.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME soars through clouds with its dorsal fin jutting out. Its menacing silhouette through nimbuses often frightens smaller Pokémon.
Author: .izik

Entry: The mucus trail left by POKENAME slowly dissolves organic materials. It uses this to weaken plants before feeding on them.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's powerful jaws can crush marble with ease. It lives in mountain caves, chewing on stone to train its bite strength.
Author: .izik

Entry: When POKENAME detect vibrations, they emerge en masse to nip at the target. Thankfully, their tiny teeth can be blocked by a sturdy pair of boots.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME effortlessly tunnels through pumpkin fields, devouring the roots beneath. Farmers often consider it a troublesome pest.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can often be found burrowed into cave walls, dangling its tail above the surface as a lure for prey. Occasionally, however, its less-than-intelligent mind may cause it to lunge at its own tail.
Author: Arcul

Entry: This Pokémon dwells in deep caves or tunnels. Despite its fierce appearance, it's timid and avoids Trainers, but if approached, it shakes its tail to channel draconic energy for a powerful attack.
Author: _kuke_

Entry: It has a peculiar knack for sensing those who are in pain or sick. Rather than helping, it seems to take amusement in their misery, laughing loudly.
Author: .izik

Entry: When it spots a clear sky, it raises the orbs on its tail in an attempt to summon storms. The resulting weather is said to be unpredictable and wild.
Author: .izik

Entry: It takes enormous bites out of metal objects, wreaking havoc at construction sites. Workers often return to find their vehicles and materials mangled overnight.
Author: .izik

Entry: It slithers through dark caves, fiercely biting at anyone who disturbs its solitude. Many Pokémon avoid its domain, knowing its aggressive nature.
Author: .izik

Entry: It swiftly glides around icy clifftops, using the terrain to ambush unsuspecting prey. Its claws are sharp enough to carve paths through thick ice.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its sensitive nose can detect a person's intentions. If it senses malice, it will dash away to avoid conflict.
Author: .izik

Entry: A group of POKENAME were recently discovered guarding undocumented tombs. They attempt to unleash a powerful Dragon Claw on anyone who approaches.
Author: .izik

Entry: Living in dark tunnels, it roars with both heads simultaneously to create a terrifying echo. The reverberations are enough to drive most intruders away.
Author: .izik

Entry: It consumes cobalt-rich minerals to enhance the strength of its armor-like scales. Its metallic body gleams brighter after every feast.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME have developed a helmet-like plating at the top of their heads to protect themselves. They burrow into the ground, then launch into the air at high speeds, trying to fly as best as they can.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Occasionally, fragments of its protective shell fall off. These pieces are highly valued and are used to create potent healing poultices.
Author: .izik

Entry: Often found resting, this predator will chase down anyone who disturbs its slumber. Its gel is said to taste like bitter jam, making it a rare curiosity among researchers.
Author: Krune

Entry: It drags its tusks across the walls of mining tunnels, leaving deep grooves to mark its territory. This behavior is often a warning sign for miners working in the area.
Author: .izik

Entry: It enjoys making its home in rocky quarries, where it shrieks at the walls to create echoes. This pastime often unnerves anyone nearby.
Author: .izik

Entry: Even with their small stature, POKENAME are very hostile. Their toxic spikes cause itchy infections.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: The viscous fluid that seeps from its scales is prized for crafting soothing cough drops. However, the collection process requires great care.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME loves jewels and hoards them compulsively. Luckily for Trainers' wallets, it can't tell the difference between real gems and plastic gems.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME belts out punk rock melodies while rocking its head to the beat, causing its razor-sharp hair to whip about. If someone tries to touch its hair, it will quickly turn away, slashing anyone that got too close.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: A POKENAME moves faster the more moonlight it receives. On a clear night with a full moon, it can run at Mach 1.
Author: Race9000

Entry: POKENAME is a ground-shaking force with jagged fins and armored hide. Its thunderous footsteps and razor-sharp tusks make it a fearsome sight.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME is a merciless predator, tunneling underground at Mach speeds to catch its prey. If its bite force isn't enough to take care of them, its venomous bite will surely finish the job.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It suddenly lunges into its foes, striking them with its powerful body and claws. It injects them with copious electricity and draconic energy.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It dresses as a remarkable Sinnoh Trainer to leave an imposing presence among other dragon-type Pokémon. It is considered a symbol of strength.
Author: nasho1908

Entry: It dresses as a remarkable Sinnoh Trainer to leave an imposing presence among other dragon-type Pokémon. It is considered a symbol of strength.
Author: nasho1908

Entry: When calm, this Pokémon uses great skill in the art of battle. However, when enraged, POKENAME will attack ruthlessly and unpredictably.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: A Pokémon known for its fighting prowess. It hunts Pokémon of a similar size to it for a challenge.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Despite its rotund body, POKENAME is capable of flying at sonic speeds. However, it prefers to scuttle around caves using its wing-like claws.
Author: gellyfishsh

Entry: Unlike Mawile, POKENAME is much less deceptive, confidently hunting for prey many times its own size. Its jaws can crush even the toughest of metals.
Author: BerriVine

Entry: POKENAME spins through battlefields at jet speed. Its wind gusts can fell trees and its blade can fell a group of armored men in one swing.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME spins through battlefields at jet speed. Its wind gusts can fell trees and its blade can fell a group of armored men in one swing.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Its thin, rigid scales, combined with its sharp blades, makes POKENAME a being whose entire body is a weapon.
Author: MisterShaokahn

Entry: POKENAME can be found in the mountains, dueling each other for dominance. It is fast enough to turn a boulder into sand in two seconds.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: Its body passively absorbs and discharges electricity, even while asleep. It uses this stored energy to detect prey and move at lightning-fast speeds.
Author: LemGambino

Entry: POKENAME is commonly seen challenging aircraft to races, which it often wins. On the rare occasion it loses, POKENAME will break out into a fit of rage, burning everything in sight.
Author: astral_1447

Entry: When it gets excited, it bites everything it sees. For this reason, POKENAME should not be trained by fledgling Trainers, despite its loyalty.
Author: Fenragon

Entry: An artificial Pokémon designed after a dragon, POKENAME stands above the rest with its powerful cannon and AI-assisted fighting skill.
Author: Spooky Scary Kunoichi

Entry: This Pokémon is very social and often makes groups with other species. Overhunting has caused POKENAME to be near extinct.
Author: Yoshimon

Entry: It resembles a certain Pokémon champion. It's unknown if this was so more people would like it, or if it was to serve as a way to scare off Trainers.
Author: JackytheWannabe

Entry: POKENAME are encased in a red slime said to taste like strawberry jam. Only Trainers who befriend them can safely harvest it, as POKENAME are highly aggressive.
Author: Krune

Entry: POKENAME's scales have the peculiar quality of being extremely fine in one direction, reducing drag both in and out of the water. However, each scale has microscopic barbs that make it painful to stroke it the other way.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's scales have the peculiar quality of being extremely fine in one direction, reducing drag both in and out of the water. However, each scale has microscopic barbs that make it painful to stroke it the other way.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are quick, dirty fighters that stagger enemies with kicks before finishing them with sharp talons. They are very competitive and hate losing.
Author: Yoshimon

Entry: While it offers to carry small Pokémon on its back like Lotad, it simply travels way too fast and far too rough for other Pokémon to actually hold on for very long. Sometimes, POKENAME can be found in desert oases.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It sinks beneath the ground without shifting a stone wherever a shadow is. Its toothy maw gapes open wide, then swallows its victim whole with supernatural speed.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: Although the rest of its body has matured, its seed remains as it is. Scientists believe the seed will remain dormant for the entirety of its life.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: While dazzling flowers that require sunlight to live grow on POKENAME's back, POKENAME is still weak and vulnerable to attacks from Flying-type Pokémon. As a result, they are often protected by other Butterfree or Venusaur.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: When it is close to evolving, POKENAME's cocoon-like body begins cracking as a giant flower starts to bloom from the new hole. However, this is when POKENAME is most vulnerable to life-threatening injuries.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The gases it expels have become tropical scented, but still remain pungent. People describe the aroma as being like rotten pineapples and papayas.
Author: Xephyr

Entry: When its plants are in full bloom, POKENAME's vines coil up and turn a bright green. It can unleash powerful whips with them and they even grow back with just an hour of sunlight.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: Despite seeking only other POKENAME, it avoids humans and all other Pokémon entirely. It sprays an ultra-dense cloud of pollen to defend itself.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: Its entire dress is a single petal from the flower crown on its head. It talks to plants, giving them commands.
Author: HoundRyS

Entry: The rich nutrients possessed within POKENAME's body makes it the perfect snack for Pidgeotto. When flopping around on land, it can sometimes defend itself with a powerful Solar Beam.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: A POKENAME's flower contains highly toxic poison. Every drastic motion that a POKENAME makes causes poison to spill out, as they often have trouble holding up the large flower on their own.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: A Pokémon typically found in tropical regions, POKENAME is known as the herald of the monsoon season. They are normally sighted ahead of or during torrential downpours and floods, and as a result, they have a reputation for violence and destruction.
Author: Katie

Entry: A Pokémon typically found in tropical regions, POKENAME is known as the herald of the monsoon season. They are normally sighted ahead of or during torrential downpours and floods, and as a result, they have a reputation for violence and destruction.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME was utilized in early 3D games to propagate grass textures. Unfortunately, an error in its coding made it spread viruses too.
Author: Rkmaster25367

Entry: Fossil records show that POKENAME were apex predators when they were alive, expertly hunting through the lush rainforest where it lives. Its thick tail allows it to swing from trees to increase its speed.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Despite POKENAME's glyph-like appearance, it isn't related to Unown. It behaves irrationally and likes round shapes.
Author: ValtsuRi

Entry: POKENAME resembles a mathematical constant. It behaves irrationally and likes round shapes.
Author: ValtsuRi

Entry: POKENAME resembles a mathematical constant. It behaves irrationally and likes round shapes.
Author: ValtsuRi

Entry: It is unknown why the blazing fire on POKENAME's backs never ignites the leaves on their heads. It's long been wondered if POKENAME's genetics could hold the key to developing more fire-resistant crops.
Author: houseoffallingflowers

Entry: It gathers sunlight as as floats on the surface of ponds, converting it into electricity. It releases Stun Spores from its antennae before attacking.
Author: AriaMelisma

Entry: POKENAME live in small groups in swamps and muddy tropical areas. The leader among them wears a crown of fruit shells.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME live in small groups in swamps and muddy tropical areas. The leader among them wears a crown of fruit shells.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME live in small groups in swamps and muddy tropical areas. The leader among them wears a crown of fruit shells.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Plenty of moonlight creates bigger and more vibrant flowers for this species. The scent changes as the moon waxes and wanes.
Author: deelee2020

Entry: Its flower has grown a lot sooner than expected. The weight of the flower crushes it, as it is not strong enough to carry it yet.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: This Pokémon is often seen resting on the sides of trees or brick walls. To remove these Pokémon from their spots, it is recommended to use a crowbar.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Once believed to have existed only in prehistory, POKENAME dominate the marshlands in swathes. Urban legend warns that inhaling the spore-thick air around one will leave you permanently mute.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: Its leaves are covered with a waxy substance, giving them a shiny appearance. Groups of POKENAME form flocks led by those with the shiniest wings.
Author: Busilisk

Entry: It is known to defend forests and caves that it claims. It can sneak up on trespassers by digging in the ground to disguise as a mossy rock.
Author: homelessrager

Entry: POKENAME have developed stronger muscles in order to better navigate on the ground. They lure prey in with the flowers on their tails before striking.
Author: Raza

Entry: The nutrients in the mud POKENAME plays in have enlarged its cheek flowers. Because of this, its hind legs have stiffened further to support its head.
Author: Shocktopus

Entry: POKENAME spend most of their lives submerged in deep mud, waiting for unsuspecting Pokémon to draw too close. The symbiotic plants on their backs allow them to photosynthesize when no food is available.
Author: kingd8

Entry: POKENAME are commonly found deep in the forests, sleeping as they bask in the sunlight to gather energy. When disturbed, they will attack and subdue their assailant before teleporting to a new location.
Author: King Mordork

Entry: The flower it holds absorbs sunlight. The solar energy it gathers can be expended to create small black holes to protect its Trainer.
Author: Kieth Stoutcinder

Entry: It camouflages itself in vines to remain hidden in jungle environments, where it waits patiently. Unsuspecting prey is torn apart by its four clawed limbs.
Author: Busilisk

Entry: POKENAME are very adept and proficient hunters in lush environments. The vegetation growing on this Pokémon's back allows it to camouflage among greenery and surprise their prey.
Author: ackshewally

Entry: Fusion energy has fused POKENAME with its dormant DNA. The tree on its back is now fully rooted in POKENAME's nervous system.
Author: Zoroark73

Entry: Although POKENAME are usually carnivores, they can be seen snacking on berries every so often. Their sharp teeth can chomp through the toughest of skins.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: Many POKENAME alive today were first born in the time of fossil Pokémon. They guard their hidden caves with extreme power.
Author: VeteranAdventurer

Entry: POKENAME's ultimate move is absorbing enough sunlight through its blade to release and smite its opponent with the power of the sun.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: This legendary scepter, said to have belonged to a wizard, can command plants and with enough absorbed sunlight, release a blast of solar energy.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: The huge flower on its back emits a soothing aroma when it absorbs sunlight. It has a rigid body and can shatter huge boulders with ease using its iron horns.
Author: Hamperius

Entry: The flower on its tail emits a sweet smell that is used to draw in its prey. It then causes vines to erupt from the ground, entangling its chosen meal.
Author: flickeredflame

Entry: The floral parasol of POKENAME acts both as a source of nutrients when conducting photosynthesis and as a way to gather water during rain.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME can feel every organism and motion in its forest. It does so by feeling the vibrations of the roots within the wilderness.
POKENAME flies above the clouds, gathering sunlight with the flower on its head. If it is forced to descend from the skies, it devastates opposition with an intense Solar Beam.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME emits large amounts of pollen from its tail that allow plants to flourish. Areas where POKENAME reside are blanketed in gorgeous flora.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME grow so many plants that not even they are fully aware of all the possible combinations they can make with their spores. They release spores with every blow, testing out their concoctions on their opponents.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: The being seen inside the outer layer of a POKENAME is not independent of the jelly-like substance that coats it. The crown atop its head is actually a catalyst for the being to be mind-controlled by the potent substance that coats it.
Author: chaos_emblemx

Entry: POKENAME are crafty Pokémon that hate humans and often attack them. Most people think POKENAME are evil, but they just want to protect nature.
Author: zakafraka

Entry: POKENAME weaves traps made of vines and electrified webbing to ward against potential threats. Its lair is characterized by arcing thunder and an eerie silence.
Author: EvilGammon

Entry: As it warms itself and absorbs sunlight, its flame releases a pleasant fragrance. The fragrance becalms those engaged in battle.
Author: aPixelPerfectionist

Entry: POKENAME is a shy Pokémon that relies on sunlight to keep its flower alive. When night falls, it becomes dormant, sustaining its flower with the dim light from its flame.
Author: ImaginaryNeon

Entry: POKENAME guards overgrown ruins. Its mighty stature strike fear into the hearts of all who dare to trespass in its domain.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME flies high into the sky to better absorb the sun's rays. On days where the sunlight isn't as strong, it feeds on bird Pokémon instead.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: POKENAME uses the sun-enriched vines from its tail to spark wildfires in dying forests, scattering fresh seeds among the ashes. It is worshipped as a spirit of rebirth in some tropical regions.
Author: brainiax

Entry: If overexcited, the plant on the end of its tail will combust. It is best to let this fire rage, as POKENAME will sulk if forbidden from burning.
Author: kandyman

Entry: The more meat it consumes, the more succulent its flower becomes. The rotten scent of its many intense battles mixes with the sweet aroma of its bloom.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: If a human dares to embrace POKENAME, it will plant a cursed bulb upon their back. With every selfish thought, the bulb will grow, and when it blossoms, a writhing thicket will erupt from where its host once stood.
Author: seaslux

Entry: POKENAME lives in dense, tropical forests, where its unwithering blooms go unnoticed. Beware its deadly pollen.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME uses its wings, which are made from a fungus-like material, to fly at high speeds. It uses the spores it spreads in a form of echolocation.
Author: Canada

Entry: This Pokémon takes delicate care of the flower on its back. Despite the foul stench, a POKENAME trusting someone enough to let them smell the flower is said to bring great fortune their way.
Author: squawkabairdy

Entry: POKENAME shields its body with massive flower petals. It fancies itself king of the swamp, and demands tribute from other Pokémon.
Author: RoboSoup

Entry: POKENAME uses its flowers, which emit a sweet scent, to attract prey. After it has finished draining its prey, POKENAME uses the remaining bones to fertilize its flowers.
Author: Mistycloud

Entry: Long ago, it migrated deep underground and endured pressures so intense that it fused with a protective coating of rock. When it returned to the surface, it could grow larger than before.
Author: imademyselfdothis

Entry: Though friendly, POKENAME are unaware of the amount of pollen released as they flutter their wings. Their pollen can cause intense allergic reactions.
Author: TheKRT

Entry: Wild POKENAME spend most of their time asleep in sunlit glades. Be careful not to wake one, or it will start a forest fire with its temper tantrum.
Author: kandyman

Entry: POKENAME is fiercely loyal and guards various Pokémon herds in tropical climates. When it wants to take a nap, it influences nearby plants to grow into a particularly comfortable bed, where it curls up and reenergizes its flower.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME is fiercely loyal and guards various Pokémon herds in tropical climates. When it wants to take a nap, it influences nearby plants to grow into a particularly comfortable bed, where it curls up and reenergizes its flower.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME is fiercely loyal and guards various Pokémon herds in tropical climates. When it wants to take a nap, it influences nearby plants to grow into a particularly comfortable bed, where it curls up and reenergizes its flower.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: Most often seen hibernating, its lethargic movement belies its short fuse. Its destructive power when angered could set a whole rainforest ablaze.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME live in small groups in tropical forests. They are constantly on the lookout for particularly water-rich fruits.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME live in small groups in tropical forests. They are constantly on the lookout for particularly water-rich fruits.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It lives in groups in tropical areas, with the leader wearing a crown of fruit shells. It easily smashes enemies that threaten its group into pulp.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It lives in groups in tropical areas, with the leader wearing a crown of fruit shells. It easily smashes enemies that threaten its group into pulp.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It is said POKENAME travels to farms across its homeland, using its immense psychic energy to make crops grow and flowers blossom.
Author: Cipher

Entry: POKENAME typically migrate to tropical areas, where they can easily absorb solar energy. Despite their immense strength, POKENAME tend to be more easygoing and enjoy leisurely activities alongside humans.
Author: wickedwiccan

Entry: It lays in ponds to filter out toxins from the water. It drinks the liquid through its skin then sprays the clean water from the flower on its back.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's long, leafy tail tastes better the longer the Pokémon has lived. It sunbathes in tropical areas to promote photosynthesis.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME are stalwart and cunning, holding a tree stalk in their wings. POKENAME are protective of their Trainer and other Pokémon they care about, and more than willing to jump in harm's way.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Its flora grows healthier and stronger during the rain. When the sun comes back up, it fires powerful Solar Beams that tear through thick steel.
Author: Soup1900
