Entry: Using its flower pendulum, POKENAME can cultivate seeds in even the most depleted soil. It is revered among Grass-type Pokémon for its regal strength.
Author: noel5229

Entry: This Pokémon's coastal ancestors migrated inland through tropical rivers. They extend their pungent pincers above the water's surface to lure hungry Bug-type Pokémon close before suddenly dragging the distracted prey under.
Author: imademyselfdothis

Entry: POKENAME live in herds, each taking turns to look after their young while the others go hunting. If one of them is attacked, they will produce a strongly scented chemical that alerts the rest of the herd.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: As it is unable to lay eggs, POKENAME often steals them from other Pokémon. If the egg in its pouch breaks or hatches, POKENAME will stop at nothing to find another one.
Author: pinkyoshi2350

Entry: It prefers to eat green vines and moss. However, if it spots an Oran Berry, it will dash for it with a ravenous look in its eyes.
Author: .izik

Entry: When POKENAME are threatened, their tail shines, releasing electromagnetic waves. This causes intense migraines in the aggressor as well as anyone in its proximity.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: It hates flying when it is raining. Should even a slight drizzle begin, it will hide under a tree until the storm subsides.
Author: .izik

Entry: The flower on its back has a sweet smell. However, if someone tries to pick that flower, they will be assaulted by POKENAME's hidden toxic barbs.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: The paler POKENAME's fur is, the more powerful its venom is. It's a very timid Pokémon, usually hiding away in grungy alleyways and sewers.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its ears twitch to form jagged shapes when it senses danger nearby. The shapes resemble carvings found in ancient ruins, but their meaning remains unknown.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: When it wants to sleep, it burrows most of its body into the ground. If someone steps on a POKENAME, it will panic and explode.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME seems to have traits from both genders of Nidoran. POKENAME's own preference determines whether it wants to be seen as male or female.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME nests in rocky cliffs by the sea. It dives into the ocean and hunts fish Pokémon, only returning to scale the stones once it has consumed up enough to equal half its body weight.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME often keeps to itself, but when it feels threatened it pierces and releases its barbs into its aggressor.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Known to be gentle around friends, POKENAME can emit ultrasonic cries that can paralyze enemies. It can retract the poison barbs on its back.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: It swings across trees with its ribbons, which are lined with tiny poisonous barbs. It also uses these ribbons to neutralize prey.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME love any attention that can get and will even flirt with other Pokémon just for the attention. Its claws are venomous and can cause fainting in small Pokémon.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It grows shadowy poison barbs which it retracts as to not hurt its owner. When threatened, it touches its foe with a ghostly hand, poisoning them.
Author: HoundRyS

Entry: Female POKENAME are generally solitary, becoming intensely territorial among other female Pokémon. They use their venomous tusks to intimidate competing females in order to secure a mate.
Author: EmpathNaga

Entry: POKENAME burrows underground during the day, its ears sensitive to approaching danger even at rest. It bites and claws at foes when provoked.
Author: synaesthesis

Entry: The flowers that produce the nectar POKENAME eats make it mildly poisonous. As it dances, it raises and retracts spines under its feathers to add a subtle flair.
Author: bacondlx

Entry: When POKENAME is angered, its needle-like hairs become sharp enough to inject its poison in small doses. However, it is completely harmless while it is docile.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: There are millions of scales on each of its wings. These scales can be used in small amounts with water to create a powerful Repel.
Author: .izik

Entry: It is extremely stubborn, refusing to lose even a single logic based game. If it sees its opponent is winning it will attempt to wipe their memory.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has a calm and caring nature. It trains endlessly in order to protect its friends and family.
Author: lazyarcanist

Entry: Its body is extremely light and agile. While navigating through a forest, it jumps from tree to tree, utilizing its ears to glide slightly.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its giant jaws have migrated to its back. They are capable of spitting seeds or biting foes.
Author: Mossybanana

Entry: Its monstrous mouths move it along the ground and defend the egg from danger. However, it can easily be picked up by the tuft of hair on top.
Author: holgast

Entry: POKENAME collects the bones of its consumed prey to hunt with as weapons or pick its teeth.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: With steel jaws camouflaged as fists, it never backs down from a challenge.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: It doesn't speak because its large mouth is its true body, which hides inside the host. If you let down your guard, it will emerge to eat you.
Author: holgast

Entry: It spies on tiny Pokémon, pretending to be a regular plant. Its jaws can hold even the most powerful of Pokémon at bay.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: Its baby hides in its pouch, which is a false mouth. It sleeps on its stomach like a Skeledirge to protect its child at night.
Author: holgast

Entry: POKENAME tricks unsuspecting prey to look at its beautiful wings. When they are most vulnerable, they chomp down on them.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: This fusion was first documented by a Trainer who assumed they found an aquatic Mawile. They were rewarded for the discovery with a prosthetic hand.
Author: captainmodeus

Entry: Though they all share the same body, each of its many mouths has its own appetite. As such, it is always hungry, and always searching for the next meal to shove into its starving maws.
Author: sk372

Entry: They present themselves to unaware households, acting hungry and cutely asking for food. POKENAME's tail will stretch looking for the source of the food, and its jaws will have no struggle to swallow it all before teleporting.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: They present themselves to unaware households, acting hungry and cutely asking for food. POKENAME's tail will stretch looking for the source of the food, and its jaws will have no struggle to swallow it all before teleporting.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: The small helpless-looking lure on the tip of its forehead appendage is its actual body, with which POKENAME attracts prey and swallows it with its modified antenna that resembles a toothy fish.
Author: milchik

Entry: POKENAME lurks deep in the ocean and makes its home in dark crevices where its lure produces the only light around. Prey Pokémon often mistake its lure for young Chinchou; POKENAME takes advantage of this and strikes at its unsuspecting target.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME lurks deep in the ocean and makes its home in dark crevices where its lure produces the only light around. Prey Pokémon often mistake its lure for young Chinchou; POKENAME takes advantage of this and strikes at its unsuspecting target.
Author: Katie

Entry: A normally peaceful bird-like Pokémon. However, when provoked, unleashes the might of the massive jaws hiding within its stomach.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: POKENAME is known for its cuteness, and is very affectionate. However, it is extremely dangerous to touch, as its flowers and dress both contain hidden rows of razor-sharp teeth.
Author: VibrationJaveline

Entry: Whenever it's underwater, its tail floats on the surface with its jaw open, allowing POKENAME to breathe without emerging. It also uses its tail to protect its offspring by gently carrying the eggs or newly-hatched babies inside the jaw.
Author: milchik

Entry: A wild POKENAME is very meek unless it is cornered. POKENAME fights by wildly swinging its tail, which is embedded with pointed teeth.
Author: Mossybanana

Entry: POKENAME, in order to meditate on its deep thoughts, can shut its shell tightly around its head to shut out external stimuli. In this state, the orb glows and telekinetically tosses aside anything that comes too close.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME has sprouted leaves due to its growth. If POKENAME cannot bite an opponent, then it will reach out with Vine Whip.
Author: Mossybanana

Entry: A POKENAME is very bold in its pursuit of food, often taking things directly off of someone's plate.
Author: Mossybanana

Entry: The giant jaws on a POKENAME are metal horns that grow large enough to protect the whole body. When not resting in their horn shells, POKENAME dig to find tasty minerals and fungi underground.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME love to raid the homes of naughty children and eat all of their presents. They will even play tricks on the children without their parents noticing.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME distracts prey with its decoy face and then bites at them. Its teeth are weaker than Mawbok's and can't penetrate a Rock-type Pokémon's skin.
Author: thenezhar

Entry: POKENAME is a vicious Pokémon that can chomp through steel and concrete. Its large mouth is quite heavy and hinders its capability to move quickly.
Author: thenezhar

Entry: POKENAME get very little use out of their small, beady eyes. They feed instead by feeling around with their long tongues, quickly yanking anything they find back into their waiting maws.
Author: houseoffallingflowers

Entry: Its huge jaws can easily bite through steel girders. It is given spare steel from construction sites, lest it eat entire cities worth of metal.
Author: holgast

Entry: Because of its rust-like skin, POKENAME sometimes pretends to be a statue. When another Pokémon gets too close, it chomps down viciously.
Author: JokersWild

Entry: POKENAME will often soothe their prey with an aroma before consuming them, as they cannot outrun them.
Author: Mossybanana

Entry: The vicious jaws on POKENAME's back devour anything and everything in sight. This leaves POKENAME constantly stuffed and lazy, though.
Author: NellNast42

Entry: POKENAME drifts slowly through the water with its huge, mostly open mouth. It can even swallow Pokémon up to two meters in size in one piece.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME's head calls out to treasure hunters to pick up the sword. Once in range, its jaws chomp down on the poor adventurer.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME's huge jaws appear ribbonlike when closed. While closed, they can undulate to mesmerize prey while releasing a sensation of complacency.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: Its twin jaws are ears that transformed. It lures predatory Pokémon to chase it into its burrow, where they realize too late that they are the prey.
Author: wigglypon

Entry: In the forest, POKENAME stays as still as a tree stump, patiently waiting for small Pokémon to approach before eating them whole.
Author: KLGB76

Entry: POKENAME savagely hunts by soaring across the ceilings of caves. The mouths on its tail have a ravenous, insatiable appetite.
Author: NellNast42

Entry: The mouth on the back of its head shuts slowly but with incredible force. It is said to be able to tear huge holes in ship hulls with ease.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The mouth on the back of its head shuts slowly but with incredible force. It is said to be able to tear huge holes in ship hulls with ease.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Despite being considered ugly and scary by most because of its huge, jaw-like neck cone, POKENAME is actually a very friendly Pokémon. The neck cone is inoffensive and only serves as protection from the predators.
Author: KLGB76

Entry: No one quite knows how POKENAME wound up the way it did. It is, however, known that a hug will often result in a visit to the hospital.
Author: Mossybanana

Entry: The poison that drips from POKENAME's teeth attracts small Pokémon. It will hide in flower beds to lure in its prey.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's body is composed of clay and metal. If part of its body breaks, it repairs the area by consuming material with its massive jaws.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: It's often found in lakes, hiding its maw under the sand. It uses its glowing tail to attract smaller Pokémon, then attacks when they are vulnerable.
Author: RadiationV2

Entry: Utilizing an ability to change its shape into that of a scythe, POKENAME uses its eerie power to exorcise and absorb evil souls to gain greater power.
Author: yourfriendlycap

Entry: With their madness kept in check thanks to their bond with a trusted Mawile, POKENAME take the form of a scythe in battle. They eat the souls of evil Pokémon, gaining strength after every battle until they can rival the Grim Reaper.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME are able to condense the gems along their body into scythe-like blades. While they are capable of fully transforming into a scythe, they only do so when there is a trusted Mawile nearby to wield them.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME disguises itself as a bag of garbage by wrapping its arms around itself—eating garbage left out when nobody is looking.
Author: bigblue

Entry: POKENAME's hair-like mouths munch on garbage and spew out foul-smelling fumes. Their teeth are coated in bad bacteria, causing its bite to be toxic.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME has developed a unique ability to ride its second head. This is for the best, as the second head often moves of its own volition without thought or planning.
Author: Atlas333

Entry: POKENAME is a mostly docile Pokémon who will only bite if it feels threatened. However, its powerful jaws can chomp down with enough force to snap a thick tree trunk in half.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It hunts by releasing toxic spores into the air around it before ambushing its prey and swallowing it whole. Its appetite is insatiable.
Author: admiralvermin

Entry: The yellow gems produced by its body are highly valuable and are believed to bring good fortune to its holders. To stop greedy miners, POKENAME will drop from cave ceilings and bite the miners' heads, but most escape with only minor injuries.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: No one entirely knows why POKENAME vents smoke-laden gasses directly through the pores on its stomach. Some scientists have theorized that if Pokémon Fusion was better perfected, its belly could open up and act as a second maw.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: No one is sure why POKENAME is capable of flight. Yet it flies around on its back-mounted jaws, which it uses to chase prey relentlessly.
Author: Mossybanana

Entry: Its massive maw is accompanied by immense physical strength. Highly aggressive, it sees everything as impure compared to its own perfect power.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: POKENAME float either near the water's surface or at the seafloor through use of specialized air pockets inside of its body. When a small Pokémon approaches what seems to be an odd stone or plant, they are devoured by the maw on POKENAME's back.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Its shell has become a set of jaws. POKENAME will use it to not only block attacks, but also bite down viciously on opponents that get too close.
Author: Mossybanana

Entry: Its three beaks are hard as steel. It is incredibly agile and quickly outruns any challenger.
Author: togetik

Entry: POKENAME's gigantic jaws are a fearsome sight to behold. As an ambush predator, it lurks in the depths and strikes at its prey when least expected.
Author: tuskaninny

Entry: POKENAME has hardly changed over 100 million years. It floats in the water and effortlessly catches drifting food with its large mouth.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME's shell-maw is very sturdy, and will withstand many attacks. Its body, however, is quite frail.
Author: Mossybanana

Entry: If someone sees a purple, eerie glare from the darkness, it's probably a POKENAME watching them. Little is known about it, but rumors speculate that POKENAME can rip through space and appear out of thin air.
Author: darxer_

Entry: It buries itself in stone, leaving only a single part of its tail exposed above ground. When something touches this stone, POKENAME leaps from its tunnel and devours the unfortunate victim before diving back underground.
Author: sk372

Entry: Tentacles protrude from a small portion of POKENAME's hard shell. Small insects that float within range will be snatched and pulled inside to be consumed as fuel to speed up its evolution.
Author: sk372

Entry: Many are older than the oldest sequoia tree, as their ancient shells provide them with a reliable defense. Their suction cups give them the courage needed to endure frightening roars that would scare other creatures.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME lives in dark caves and lurks in crevices to wait for its prey. It shoots thin and strong threads to pull them in.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME uses its sticky tentacles to latch onto larger Pokémon who will carry it along. It weighs so little, the larger Pokémon often don't even notice.
Author: leonian1586

Entry: POKENAME lives in murky waters and moves around using its tentacles like a ship's propeller. Its body is hard and tough, not dissimilar to coral.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The blossom on its head works like a propeller. Sometimes large groups of POKENAME emerge from the water and fly many hundreds of meters.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can emit strong air currents via its flowers, which enables it to either change direction in the water immediately or blow enemies away.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME uses its tentacles to amplify its psychic powers. If it's concentrating, its tentacles will begin to sway.
Author: Elite01

Entry: POKENAME runs around quickly and grabs prey with the tentacles on its head. It uses its claws as weapons or tools for dismemberment.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME are amphibious, and spend equal amounts of time underwater and on land. They cling to rocks when sleepy, often having favorite rest spots.
Author: skinstealers

Entry: Some believe that today's Mantyke descended from POKENAME. It uses echolocation to navigate through murky waters.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME uses its appendages to charge energy for its attacks, but it's unclear if POKENAME understands this process.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME is formed when the spirits of 108 ancient Pokémon congregate into one fossil. It is envious of the Pokémon that are alive in the modern era.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: It is carrying an entire ecosystem on its back. Many Pokémon that are not allowed entry into this region are finding refuge here.
Author: funkytomate

Entry: POKENAME disguises its tentacle as a sword to attract treasure-hunting prey. When they come within range, it snatches them and eats them whole.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: The mysterious flames that surround a POKENAME's body emit very little light despite burning at high temperatures. It is theorized that POKENAME dim their flames on purpose to hide their true bodies.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Despite taking the visage of the very embodiment of vigour, POKENAME have been observed staying completely still for months at a time. Should a curious critter approach POKENAME it will pounce on them with a sudden burst of power.
Author: wilmervr

Entry: POKENAME has hidden tendrils in the round part of its arm. Its body may look frail, but it is actually rock hard.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME drifts idly throughout the sea. Its tentacles let out spores to incapacitate prey.
Author: squawkabairdy

Entry: POKENAME tend to enjoy dark, damp environments. They can disguise themselves with fungi and plant matter, getting energy from them passively.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: It scuttles around the forest floors, licking at Tiny Mushrooms. Most are eaten right away, but those it particularly enjoys the taste of are attached to its back, carried to its home to be savored later.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME moves silently across barren ground, siphoning moisture and minerals through its tendrils. Humans collect the minerals that form in its shell to craft rare high-precision alloys.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Pokémon always seen together in a pair, sharing an obviously strong bond. The younger appears more energetic and naive, and is protected by the more aggressive and introverted older one.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME secures itself to a surface by manipulating the magnetic charge in its screw, allowing it to focus on snagging prey with its tentacles. In the modern world, it has spread across many regions by magnetizing to boats.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME evolved to intimidate even the most fearless of predators with its eyespots. The false grin is actually an array of feathery bristles that it uses to catch and shock plankton.
Author: @imademyselfdothis

Entry: After fusing, POKENAME's biology changed dramatically. The tentacles on its head absorb its prey once they are trapped within the vestigial mouth.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: A POKENAME pretends to be a wild Snorlax, lazing around. When its prey gets close, its real body snatches them.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME will hide itself in concealed terrain, such as murky water or bushes, before suddenly swooping out to scoop up prey into its mouth.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: At high tide, it roots itself under the rip current and devours any Pokémon dragged out to sea. At low tide, it emerges to hunt within rocky shoals.
Author: missingmilkman

Entry: POKENAME shoots silken threads to catch unwary prey. With its incredibly strong legs, it can crush them effortlessly.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It can live both in water and on land. In the water it rotates its tentacles like a ship's propeller, and in the air it uses them as a rotor.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME sticks itself onto rock formations with suction and catches things floating by with its tentacles. It releases anything that is not edible.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME hides in coral reefs and snaps at prey that gets too close. It can also rotate its tentacles like a fan to create powerful whirlpools.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME is famously slimy, and moves very slowly. The tentacles on its head can rapidly snatch prey, however, which are then digested in its slime.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME can harden or flex its claws to use them as weapons or climbing tools. It is occasionally seen using its claws to flit up mountains.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its body is composed of a scalding fluid protected against seawater by a thick membrane. It releases some of this liquid through its tentacles to dissolve prey.
Author: imademyselfdothis

Entry: POKENAME sneak around ocean ruins and caves, looking for their next meal. They catch their prey by constricting them in their coils and squeezing.
Author: skinstealers

Entry: POKENAME lurks beneath the shores of beaches. When hunting, it chants unsettlingly, binding prey with its tentacle hair and sapping their life force.
Author: awiralonprime

Entry: Ancient writings prove that several mountain folks worshipped POKENAME as an irascible deity. One surviving name is 'Wrath of the Mountain Ridge'.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The feet of POKENAME are vestigial; it now uses its sticky appendages to move itself. It is said that once this Pokémon grabs something, nothing can unstick it if POKENAME doesn't want it removed.
Author: Ayner

Entry: As an ambush predator, POKENAME will hang from thick branches using its sticky tendrils. The residue it leaves behind will grow moss on the branches.
Author: dragonessanimations

Entry: If it is dried out, it will curl up into a ball until returned to the water. Washed up POKENAME are often mistaken for beach toys.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: Its diet consists mostly of coral and plant life on the sea floor. It will sometimes eat seashells and barnacles if no plant life is available.
Author: .izik

Entry: This prehistoric Pokémon is said to have lived in tropical waters, using its fans to hypnotize prey and scare off enemies.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It disguises itself as a prehistoric sea creature and sneaks into museums, hoping to endear itself to archaeologists. However, its distinctive odor keeps it from making any friends.
Author: imademyselfdothis

Entry: POKENAME run through laundromats, gathering socks from dryers for use in their costumes. They often throw red socks into white washing machine cylces to make the socks the pink color they desire.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: This Pokémon adapted its tentacles to detect movement and subtle changes in the water around it. These appendages do increase POKENAME's drag, though.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME flutter elegantly above the sea floor by oscillating their long arms. They drift down on top of their prey, trapping their victims before dissolving them for a liquid meal.
Author: imademyselfdothis

Entry: Despite being quite slow, it is hard to escape a POKENAME due to its immense strength and stretchy tentacles. It hunts in coral reefs, smashing the coral with its arms before grabbing any Pokémon hiding away.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME lives in ever-stormy plateaus. With a range of vision of nearly 360º, it is an unparalleled hunter.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME lies in wait beneath dunes along the shore, its ears twitching with every subtle movement. When motion is detected, it lunges with a flash so fast and violent it leaves vitrified glass in its trail.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME uses its claws to grip undersea cliffsides and eat kelp. If disturbed while eating, it unleashes a Mud Shot to escape.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME scuttles across the seafloor, chewing on rotten plant life. Its hard shell protects it from anchors dropped by passing ships.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME stomps around on its small legs. Its legs are easy to snap because of their size. Its stingers are not poisonous, just painful.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME is thought to be a missing link between Anorith and Dunsparce. Its large eyes suggest that it had yet to evolve to an underground lifestyle.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME's dress contains eight wings that it uses to swim through the ocean. It's been seen rescuing divers that have swum too deep.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME chews through trees and rocks with equal efficiency to build the dams it calls home. If a tree falls on its hardened back it doesn't even notice.
Author: gerbopotato

Entry: Long thought extinct, paleontologists were stunned to discover POKENAME still living in small colonies on the ocean floor. With their slow and gentle habits, they can support tiny but thriving ancient ecosystems on their backs.
Author: gerbopotato

Entry: This sword has dismissed its warrior spirit to connect with the one inside a 100,000,000-year-old Claw Fossil, remembering its ancient techniques.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It's said POKENAME fur was a consistent source of silk in ancient times. Its mane is silky smooth and was yearned for back then.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: This prehistoric Pokémon used to stalk beaches, scanning the shore for prey. Once prey was spotted, it would swoop in and snatch it with its claws.
Author: zerocipher

Entry: Playful POKENAME congregate in ancient calderas, sunning themselves and practicing their fire. They click their flint-like claws together and fan the flames with the wings on their heads.
Author: gerbopotato

Entry: The feathery plumage hides gills that allow POKENAME to function underneath the water as well as on land. Due to its mass, it doesn't swim well, instead walking along the ocean floor and digging for food.
Author: sk372

Entry: The fusion process has recombined POKENAME's fuzzy exterior into rocklike armor. It uses this exterior as camouflage as much as defense, sneaking to ambush tinier prey along rocky riverbanks.
Author: gerbopotato

Entry: POKENAME's body is composed mostly of the crude oil that came from ancient decomposed Anorith. It is often found near offshore rigs.
Author: ferdirenz

Entry: Resembling a robot or drone-like creature, it rolls around on a scaly wheel and can shoot boiling or freezing water from its arm-cannons.
Author: spencerrdevv

Entry: POKENAME crawls along the ocean floor. When it sees prey, it shakes its tail to kick up sand. If this happens often and viciously enough, it can create whirlpools.
Author: Holgast

Entry: Paleontologists recently found a cluster of POKENAME fossils near Mulberry City. The fossils show that they flocked together in large numbers.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon is impossible to constrict or restrain. Its body is covered entirely in hard armor permanently slick with slime that POKENAME secretes.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME can thrive in the harshest aquatic locations along strong tides and storms. Armor protects the body, which can suction to any wet surface.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: Fossils of POKENAME are found in Galar, fossil researchers there resurrecting the fossil Pokémon from fragmentary remains. In life, POKENAME anchor themselves to the sea floor and lash out at passing Pokémon to try and catch them as food.
Author: Katie

Entry: Fossils of POKENAME are found in Galar, fossil researchers there resurrecting the fossil Pokémon from fragmentary remains. In life, POKENAME anchor themselves to the sea floor and lash out at passing Pokémon to try and catch them as food.
Author: Katie

Entry: A land-dwelling Pokémon that can support small organisms on its back. It enjoys a small drizzle, but hides during downpours. POKENAME has virtually no physical weak point: even in areas where it cannot see, it is well protected by its armored scales.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: A land-dwelling Pokémon that can support small organisms on its back. It enjoys a small drizzle, but hides during downpours. POKENAME has virtually no physical weak point: even in areas where it cannot see, it is well protected by its armored scales.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Despite its ruthless nature, it will protect anyone being attacked. It is said that this is because it has been treated well by people.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: It swims through the sand at high speeds, ambushing any small Pokémon. The eyes on its wings are for intimidation.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: POKENAME's skin is covered with armor plates. This allows it to move even faster through the water, and protects it from harm when ramming objects.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME were ancient herbivores that had few enemies. Its layered armour prevented many hard hitting attacks, but it is theorized a strong fighting type Pokémon rendered it extinct.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: The large claws on its paws allow for an easy hunt. The hard shells on POKENAME's back protect it from any surprise attacks while it's resting.
Author: CaptainzScourge

Entry: POKENAME swim deep under water, using the red glow from their claws to lure in prey before they strike. POKENAME are highly attuned to their surroundings, detecting any motion in their environment through the feathers along their bodies.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME smashes its skull on hard surfaces in emotional agony when thinking of its late mother.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME use their hard heads to crack open and slurp down shellfish and mollusks. If challenged by another POKENAME, they will butt heads until one concedes.
Author: Holgast

Entry: While POKENAME usually has a mild personality, it becomes ferocious and stubborn when it comes to food. It lives deep in the jungle.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's skull is made of a very tough gemstone. Its ghostly energy is stored within.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME headbutts palm trees to make coconuts fall and catches them with its horns. Young POKENAME turn this into a game, tossing fruit with their trunks and catching it mid-air.
Author: leandermalurt

Entry: POKENAME use their heads to knock down obstacles. POKENAME must headbutt and dig their way out of the caves they hatched in to meet their parents.
Author: totodile.

Entry: Some POKENAME have different horn placements depending on where they live. Some POKENAME horns shed in winter and regrow in spring.
Author: totodile.

Entry: To catch its prey, POKENAME headbutts the prey with mighty force, then chomps down with its head appendage while they are stunned.
Author: typhloquil

Entry: It breaks walls inside caves to create paths, making exploration easier. This behavior often transforms complex cave systems into navigable trails.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME used to live on the seafloor, rolling around and crushing hard shells of Pokémon like Kabuto to eat. Scientists theorize that POKENAME's weight caused them to struggle to reach the surface to breathe, leading to their initial extinction.
Author: milchik

Entry: The hard plating on POKENAME's head produces a sharp clanging that varies in pitch depending on how it was struck. It headbutts things and uses the tone created to help it tune its singing.
Author: sk372

Entry: The stones that fall off its body were once used in ancient times to craft armor. These relics remain highly sought-after by collectors and historians.
Author: .izik

Entry: Be careful exploring caves where POKENAME reside, because of their thick skulls, they have little regard for their surroundings. If they don't smash into you directly, there is a chance of them causing stalactites to fall.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Legends speak of an underground tomb near Pewter City where groups of this Pokémon stand as guardians. Their watchful presence ensures no intruders enter these halls.
Author: .izik

Entry: It snacks on stalagmites, wearing down the formations over time. The mineral-rich diet also makes its headbutts even more powerful.
Author: .izik

Entry: It prefers foods high in iron, which help strengthen its already robust skull. This diet gives it an edge in headbutt battles.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME slams its rock-hard skull into clusters of amethyst, shattering them into tiny shards. It eagerly devours the crushed gemstones, strengthening its sturdy body.
Author: .izik

Entry: Lacking senses of self-preservation, POKENAME charges at anything to see if its dense skull can damage it. While charging, it pulls up the loose skin to not trip, which absorbs much of the impact.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: It watches over playgrounds, intervening when it spots bullies. Its protective nature has earned it the trust of children.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its skull is so thick that no thought can possibly penetrate it. It likes to laze about near the riverside and will stubbornly headbutt anyone that tries to move it.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: It cracks open boulders to eat the crystals hidden inside. These minerals give it the energy it needs to maintain its strength.
Author: .izik

Entry: While it hunts for food, it seeks any nests of Flying-type Pokémon. When it finds one, it rams into it at full force, destroying the nest.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: When POKENAME see an intruder in their territory they will fly above it and drop head-first into the target. Because they frequently miss, their territory can be easily identified thanks to the large number of craters.
Author: Alumed

Entry: POKENAME are capable of flying at supersonic speeds, racing across the skies. They have extremely hard heads and use these to battle with one another, a collision between two POKENAME sounds like a thunderclap.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME are capable of flying at supersonic speeds, racing across the skies. They have extremely hard heads and use these to battle with one another, a collision between two POKENAME sounds like a thunderclap.
Author: Katie

Entry: Due to their rather unique profile, they fail to imitate much of anything. When their disguise inevitably fails, they resort to violently headbutting instead.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: It enjoys swimming in river rapids. Its hard head protects it when it inevitably rams into rocks or rafts.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: It swims at high speeds, feasting on Magikarp and other aquatic prey. Despite its hard skull, its body is very squishy.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: A POKENAME's brain is so small that it is unaware of its own strength. It will often not even notice the destruction it has wrought with its headbutts.
Author: bacondlx

Entry: A fastidious Pokémon, POKENAME can throw punches that can shatter brick walls while taking great care of its personal appearance.
Author: cipherlingarde

Entry: Its cranium is so sturdy that it's thought to be completely invulnerable. Once, a misfired cannon shot struck a nearby POKENAME; the cannonball shattered on impact, and POKENAME neither flinched nor noticed.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its body is made up of many small magnets. Every morning, it shakes violently to loosen debris that have accumulated on its base.
Author: .izik

Entry: During ancient times, POKENAME would attract prey with a sweet aroma, then bash it with its skull, which is as hard as iron.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: The spikes around its skull are what make POKENAME's headbutts devastatingly brutal. Its limber form allows for quick turns if necessary.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME flies at extremely high speeds, ramming into anything in its path. Its rocky carapace protects its body from these high-speed impacts.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME charges into its foes, the keys jingling along with it. This tackle is more effective than one might first believe.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: In other regions, POKENAME forms packs to tackle Passimian down and steal their Berries.
Author: malxire

Entry: This Pokémon has extremely strong wings. It bashes it thick, rocky head against trees to knock out Berries or bug Pokémon.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: It has rough hooves and an armored trunk that protect it when sliding down hills. Younger POKENAME may need an Assault Vest to further cushion them from harm.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: A well-organized group of POKENAME can take on enemies much larger than their individual size. They congregate primarily in rocky plateaus.
Author: ferdirenz

Entry: Pokémon Fusion has not perfectly adapted Lopunny and Shieldon together: while the ears grant powerful defense and the legs bring surprising nimbleness, it often combines into POKENAME falling flat on its face mid-battle.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The hide on its face is covered in small grooves which filter the soil that it pushes. Those who follow it may find rare gems it has left behind.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME uses its psychic abilities to shield itself from attacks. The shape of this shield almost looks like a prehistoric Pokémon.
Author: Atlas333

Entry: POKENAME swims through sand as if it were water. It is quite temperamental and gets angry at anyone or anything that stands in its path.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: When two POKENAME meet, they will fly to each other and slam their heads together in a display of dominance. This sound is often mistaken for thunder.
Author: Fenragon

Entry: It charges through marshlands to create large divots in the mud. This allows waterways to expand more easily.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME travels quickly across the land defending the weak, stopping bullies mid-strike with its sturdy skull. It gives the perpetrators one chance to back away and avoid conflict, acting mercilessly to those who don't heed the warning.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its enormous, shield-shaped skull can withstand mortar fire. Unfortunately, this also makes it top-heavy, and only the elite can stand at full height.
Author: rihse

Entry: POKENAME's iron tail is too heavy for it to swing. It must slowly push it to travel.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME's shield repels any direct attack, while its armored body burns to touch. It has a righteous and enduring spirit.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's muscles are as tough as steel, allowing it to carry its two-ton shield effortlessly. They are valiant warriors who protect innocent Pokémon from threats over ten times their size.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME are not typically used in battle due to their desire not to harm others, instead choosing to protect. Many POKENAME are recruited by notable figures as bodyguards, as their presence alone prevents threats from even attempting an attack.
Author: retrodox

Entry: It is unknown whether the shield attached to the hair of this Pokémon is extremely lightweight, or if POKENAME is extremely strong. Whatever the case, its bite can reduce solid stone to gravel and is sturdy enough to deflect many crushing blows.
Author: EvilGammon

Entry: Between a heavily-armored, spiked head, its large, heavy tail, and its thick, muscled legs, this Pokémon is clearly fast, destructive, and dangerous.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: A POKENAME's shell always resembles a medieval castle of its home region. In some cases, they are the only surviving evidence of the castle's design.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Ancient civilizations based castles and sacrificial temples on POKENAME. This Pokémon always faces exactly north, eerily like certain famous pyramids.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: A POKENAME's only weak spot is its stomach. The rest of its body is heavily armored.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Its mushrooms are made of a metallic alloy that is both tough and stretchy. Its punches are strong enough to pulverize a tanker hull.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its armored hide deflects all incoming strikes, making frontal attacks futile. Its imposing presence is often enough to deter would-be adversaries.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: It is found traversing the dry steppes of the world, where large expanses of the ground are covered by grass. Its slow body does not cause issues when it can take all the time in the world on the steppes.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME's highly ornate head, back, and tail seem cumbersome and impractical. However, they actually provide protection and are used for courting.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME's thick armor and sharp iron claws allow it to pulverize any passing ships. It will often make its home in sunken ships and will fiercely fight other POKENAME for the larger ship.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is an aggressive fusion that lives in small groups and often attacks small towns. It uses its hard shield and axe to fight its enemies.
Author: TheFinalKalgonus

Entry: POKENAME is an aggressive fusion that lives in small groups and often attacks small towns. It uses its hard shield and axe to fight its enemies.
Author: TheFinalKalgonus

Entry: POKENAME spends much of its time sleeping inside trees. It only wakes up to devour every leaf on the tree in a feeding frenzy, then goes straight back to its constant hibernation.
Author: sk372

Entry: Because the joey spends most of its time sleeping and requires little food, POKENAME is a rather lax parent. It is one of the few Kangaskhan fusions that allows others to hold its young for extended periods.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME takes its time consuming the nectar of entire fields of flowers. It violently punts anything that comes too close while it is eating; even much larger Pokémon can be sent flying by its kick.
Author: sk372

Entry: While usually docile, there was a report of a scientist that tried to wake up and move a POKENAME from where it made its bed. This is no longer done.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Tiny and lazy, POKENAME only needs to feed once a week, loafing the rest of its time away. Even yawning is treated like a strenuous activity for POKENAME.
Author: sk372

Entry: This fusion doesn't move and hovers, still, in one place because of how lazy it is. Some people say that it's so lazy that it appears to be dead.
Author: milchik

Entry: POKENAME can be found hanging motionless on the trunks of fruit trees. There's a great force hiding within its seemingly hollow shell that can only be unleashed if POKENAME is heavily disturbed or just very hungry.
Author: milchik

Entry: Though it spends most of its time lazing about, POKENAME uses its ability to camouflage into any surroundings to ambush prey or steal from nests. If it gets in trouble, it can use its incredible strength to defend itself.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME stores berries in its false mouth so it can lengthen the time between hunts for food. Occasionally, it may injure itself trying to store too much at once in this effort to be lazy.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's oversized head is 90% bone, which makes it harder than steel. Since its skull is so thick, its brain is very tiny.
Author: JokersWild

Entry: It rarely moves, so an ecosystem of small Pokémon flourishes on its back. This suits POKENAME just fine, as it can feed on leftover bits of their meals that fall from above, letting it remain sedentary longer.
Author: sk372

Entry: It knows precisely where to strike to cause maximum damage. Fearing it, many Trainers dare not speak its name.
Author: weedspagon_real

Entry: It uses its lack of arms as an excuse to laze about. POKENAME will move to different locations, both on the surface and underwater, but only to try more exotic ways of lazing around.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Legends say it sleeps somewhere far above the clouds, and that should humanity's follies wake it from its slumber, it will descend with great fury and put all of humanity to rest.
Author: sk372

Entry: While powerful enough to move continents, it never takes battling seriously. Trainers of POKENAME often unfuse it out of frustration after a week.
Author: Faelocke

Entry: POKENAME enlists help from Drifloon in order to fly, as it's too heavy to float on its own power. It commands them to carry it to areas rich in fruit, so it can drop down and gorge itself.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's singing is quite cacophonous, as it doesn't bother to practice and hone its skill. Listeners often feign sleep to make it stop more quickly; the resulting indignant wrath is still less painful than its song.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is usually content to float placidly in water, ignoring most of its surroundings. Should something agitate it, however, it will fly into a thrashing rage potent enough to give a Gyarados pause.
Author: sk372

Entry: Many falsely assume the two Pokémon work in tandem to trap unfortunate victims, but in reality the Slaking is trying to save any creature Palossand tries to sneakily capture and hide within itself.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its wings have atrophied from lack of use and even the fire on its tail hardly smolders when it deigns to move around. If angered, however, POKENAME's fire will erupt into a blazing inferno used to immolate the target of its ire.
Author: sk372

Entry: The physical prowess of POKENAME is unmatched. However, its strength has made it sedentary and arrogant.
Author: Griddle

Entry: If two POKENAME meet, they'll battle until either one or both of them collapse from exhaustion. This is how they form bonds.
Author: dragonzzilla

Entry: POKENAME uses extremely flashy moves to defeat opponents. It is deceptively lazy, as its power is truly effortless.
Author: cyprexx

Entry: At any given moment, at least one of POKENAME's heads is sleeping. This is inconvenient as it means the other heads have to drag it around.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: It uses alluring dances to hypnotize foes. It controls poison and spreads it through the air.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: A truly rare sighting; POKENAME has enough poison in it's horn to fell even the largest of Wailords!
Author: SupersonicLoki

Entry: The massive arm at the end of its body carves intricate symbols into rock or soil. These markings seem to serve as territorial warnings, though some suspect they hold deeper meanings tied to ancient knowledge.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME dig through the ground, creating huge tunnels. Some are found to reach a depth of over six-tenths of a mile underground.
Author: Krune

Entry: POKENAME wields its tail like a whip. It has been recorded piercing through 4 feet of concrete.
Author: winchbeef

Entry: POKENAME lazes around for most of the day. Its thick hide protects it from any real damage. Despite doing almost nothing all day, it thinks itself superior to everyone.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME seeks other Nidoran-related fusions in order to fight for and protect them diligently as family.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Highly defensive of its young, POKENAME's back barbs bristle and ooze poison if it senses anyone or anything straying too close.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Packs of POKENAME patrol storm-tossed badlands with their young. They absorb the ambient ozone in the air and use it to help replenish the venom they spend on hunting.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Extremely protective of those it cares about, this Pokémon will stake its life to ensure the safety of its young and Trainer.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: This Pokémon is known for its robust scales and impactful punches. POKENAME's nails grow at a rapid rate on its hands and feet. It uses them to inject its target with poison by piercing them.
Known for its powerful kicks, this Pokémon can be heard throughout the night leaping through the forests.
Author: SupersonicLoki

Entry: It communicates only with its owner, being very secretive. It keeps its form hidden in its scaly body, and attacks by extending shadowy needles.
Author: HoundRyS

Entry: There is only one female POKENAME in each colony of Nidopuff, where it acts as their leader. They can inflate their bodies to many times their normal size. When they exhale, poison gas is emitted from their orifices.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME viciously attacks any perceived threat to its offspring. When it leaves its nest to hunt, it rubs its young with its mane which has a low-level toxin that wards off predators.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME performs dances for people that it likes. This dances spreads mind-controlling poison through the air to lure the person to its home.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Though small in stature, POKENAME can send foes flying with harsh tackles from its horn. Its leaves can absorb moonlight to regain energy at night.
Author: synaesthesis

Entry: POKENAME is very protective of its young and will show no mercy to anything that threatens them. When agitated, its skin secretes a deadly poison that makes it volatile in combat.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: A single dictionary is unable to encompass the lexical complexity of their language, which is used to educate their children on how to survive in the world. The nuances of their cries and grunts remain a topic of study for linguists.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is ready for anything. Its punch has been known to be fatal to smaller creatures.
Author: SupersonicLoki

Entry: This Pokémon is only known to flinch when it pulls a muscle. It seeks out and challenges other Machoke fusions.
Author: SupersonicLoki

Entry: POKENAME practices a variety of fighting styles that prepare it to take on all kinds of foes. If a POKENAME grabs ahold of an enemy while in combat, it will inject a powerful toxin into them.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: A toxic positivity personality at any gym; strong Trainers seek POKENAME out when they want to push their limits as a Trainer and as a human.
Author: SupersonicLoki

Entry: The combination of Nidoqueen's tough scales and Golem's boulder-like body allow POKENAME to shrug off most attacks. It does occasionally have to shed its skin, which leaves it vulnerable, but it always grows back stronger than ever.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: POKENAME makes its home in forests that are near sources of high pollution. An increasing presence is a sure sign of coming ecological damage.
Author: VeteranAdventureHobo

Entry: POKENAME live on mountains. When they sense disaster, they panic and tirelessly charge to warn anyone nearby, running over anything in their way.
Author: totodile.

Entry: Some POKENAME have different styles of plating and shorter faces. POKENAME can become enraged if their warnings go unheeded.
Author: totodile.

Entry: If it senses a disaster, it will begin frantically giving out its eggs to help. Despite its kindness, many still believe POKENAME caused the disaster.
Author: fountainihili

Entry: When POKENAME sits motionless at the bottom of the water, its fur waving with the current disguises it as seagrass.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The shimmery scales shed from Pokémon's wings can be made into life-saving medicine for certain rare illnesses with no other known cures.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME thrives around power plants. It uses its horn like a lighting rod to prevent storms from destroying power lines.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME live in dormant volcanoes. Seeing them elsewhere means a nearby mountain will erupt soon.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME are born with two horns, but one inevitably breaks off as it battles other POKENAME. Some collect the broken horns to use as luck charms.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME's horn is very sensitive to its environment. It is said that the type of natural disaster POKENAME witnesses will influence its evolution.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: Building trust with an POKENAME takes quite a bit of time, as it is naturally a very solitary Pokémon. It is quite serious and hates being startled.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: Where it surfaces from the ocean, a great tsunami will soon arrive. POKENAME will then stand stalwart on the beach, shielding others from the waves.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: When it senses an impending disaster, it flies around the area, releasing a bone-chilling scream. Though many believe that it is cursing the land, POKENAME is actually warning people of the danger ahead.
Author: amiel997

Entry: The pollen POKENAME spreads from its leaf smells like basil and accelerates plant growth. If it senses an approaching flood, it encourages trees to grow rapidly to absorb the excess water.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's fur is extremely valuable, but it is said that anyone who cuts it off of an POKENAME will suffer one hundred years of bad luck.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME, now blessed with the speed afforded to it by its powerful wings, travels great distances to warn people of coming danger.
Author: Sejha

Entry: POKENAME's large horns help them tune their psychic abilities. They're highly revered in certain cultures thanks to their pitch-perfect Future Sight.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: Should it sense someone with terrible luck, it will fly in circles over their home to release any bad omens. It prefers to fly in a clockwise motion.
Author: .izik

Entry: It is believed that POKENAME can sense when someone's death is near. When it perches on a rooftop and sings its eerie song, someone in the household will die exactly three days later.
Author: amiel997

Entry: POKENAME disguises itself as a tree while waiting for its instincts to confirm an upcoming disaster. If it senses danger, it shakes violently to warn nearby Pokémon.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is very friendly. Children like to use the symbol on its head as a spinner to play fortune-telling games.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME floats lazily in rivers, unaffected by the chaotic world around it. However, if it detects an approaching flood, it will let out a deep bellow to alert nearby Pokémon.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has the power to predict disasters when its forked tail quivers. However, it will only share its knowledge with a Trainer it deems worthy.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: POKENAME's flower has begun to bloom in the presence of high pollution. It can slow the poisoning of the environment, but can't stop it alone.
Author: VeteranAdventurer

Entry: It watches people in the city from the tops of buildings. When it foresees a cheese-related disaster, it jumps into action.
Author: .izik

Entry: If POKENAME senses an incoming hurricane, it channels psychic energy through its rear head to gently urge Pokémon and people away. If they do not listen, it forces them back with powerful psychic waves.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME appear where earthquakes destroyed towns. Despite superstitions, this is simply because the tremors woke them from their underground slumber.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: This mischievous Pokémon tempts Trainers with dangerous dares. Only the most courageous know that POKENAME's presence guarantees their safety.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: A flock of POKENAME is considered a bad omen across multiple cultures around the world, but singular POKENAME actually make for great pets.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: The berry juice POKENAME makes in its shell causes terrifying visions of doom and calamity that can make even the bravest Trainers cower in fear.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME often appear on compromised trees to eat their soft wood and sap. Arborists often use them to predict if a tree is about to fall or break.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME are prized for their beautiful feathers and fur. However, they make terrible pets, as they will destroy everything their owner holds dear.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME reside deep below the icy tundra, where it is comfortably cold and dry. They are a rare sight in the wild, as they were once hunted to near extinction.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: The honey-like scent from POKENAME's fur becomes incredibly strong before a violent storm. The aroma lures smaller Pokémon into its den, providing them shelter and safety.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME patrol their territory to ensure that nothing has gone awry. If something is amiss, they let out eerie howls to alert the rest of their pack.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: This Pokémon lives a lonely and solitary life. While it has been observed approaching packs of Houndoom in the wild, POKENAME is always rejected.
Author: rihse

Entry: Its nose can somehow smell earthquakes before they occur. It will bury its head in the dirt if it senses danger.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's thick fur keeps it warm as it rolls through snowy mountains during brutal winters. If it detects a severe blizzard approaching, it trumpets a warning from its trunk.
Author: .izik

Entry: Looking at POKENAME's horns causes visions of terrible disasters. Some believe those are omens, while others think it's POKENAME's defense mechanism.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME's long tongue darts out during poor weather to detect scent changes that indicate severe storms. If it senses an impending disaster, it lets out a piercing screech as a warning.
Author: .izik

Entry: According to legend, just the flap of its wings caused destruction. To prevent further disasters, it lives a solitary life in a pitch-black cave.
Author: Thora Daughn

Entry: POKENAME wanders around the world, sensing the flow of calamity with its horn. It always lets tragedies happen, just to travel back in time and see how exactly they can be avoided.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Some say that if you are cursed by an POKENAME, you are destined to meet your end no matter how hard you try to avoid it. They can be seen wandering around cities recently hit by natural disasters.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It is believed that an POKENAME is the last thing someone will see before passing away.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: If POKENAME senses an upcoming tornado, it screeches loudly while flinging sand erratically. This chaotic display serves as a warning to those nearby to seek shelter.
Author: .izik

Entry: Known as "The Fist of Ill Omen", an POKENAME wins fights by knowing its opponent's moves before they ever make them. If it knows it cannot win, it will recklessly attempt to take its foe down with it.
Author: MileySakiko

Entry: It is said that an POKENAME that's well taken care of can alter the future to one where its Trainer lives a happy and prosperous life.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: With its capability to sense disasters enhanced, POKENAME now strives to both warn those of danger, but take matters into its own claws to protect lives. Its scythe grows sharper the more lives it vows to defend, making it incredibly deadly.
Author: merclipse

Entry: POKENAME use their color-changing fur to communicate with humans. Scientists have yet to fully decipher this intricate language.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME is a nocturnal hunter that feasts on forest-dwelling Pokémon. Rather than navigating through the forest, it uses its razor-sharp appendages to slice down the trees.
Author: Patch

Entry: POKENAME is often found at the edges of ecological disaster zones, warning away trespassers and absorbing the pollution within to heal the area.
Author: VeteranAdventurer

Entry: The teeth of an POKENAME are about as sharp as a high-grade kitchen knife. Poachers frequently harvest these teeth to sell for a moderate price.
Author: .izik

Entry: Ancient tomes claim that peering between POKENAME's fingers allows one to see future disasters. However, this has been proven untrue on multiple occasions, though some still believe in the legend.
Author: .izik

Entry: Many POKENAME will gather in an area where a natural disaster is soon to occur, ready to take the spirts of all who do not survive to the afterlife.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: Through its many eyes, POKENAME sees the disasters that plague the past, present, future, and even other dimensions.
Author: alierael

Entry: POKENAME mostly wanders rugged mountains. A cut from this scythe is said to curse the victim with approaching disaster.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME mostly wanders rugged mountains. A cut from this scythe is said to curse the victim with approaching disaster.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: The two blades of POKENAME are said to represent good and bad luck. The first one that strikes seals its enemy's fate for the rest of its life.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: This valiant fusion is said to help and protect those upon whom a disastrous fate will fall. It is unknown whether or not it is effective.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME are said to be agents of fate, as they work together in small groups to prevent small-scale disasters, or cause them to come about.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME's piercing eyes can see through heavy storm clouds to detect brewing disasters. If it senses imminent danger, it howls into the sky, sending warning sparks through the air.
Author: .izik

Entry: The mushrooms of POKENAME can be turned into potions that grant their drinker powerful future sight. Sadly, the premonitions are always horrifying.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME floats quietly in empty storm shelters. If it senses an incoming tornado, it knocks nearby Pokémon unconscious and drags them into the shelter to save them.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are said to be manifestations of karma, usually appearing after the fall of evil empires or corporations. If it finds someone who committed an evil act, it will drag them away with its ghostly tendrils.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME can sense disasters, and actively warns people of them. It enjoys witnessing the aftermath of those who don't listen.
Author: CodeWolfie

Entry: It lays in the desert during the night to absorb nutrients from the moon's light. After the sun rises, it covers its body in a layer of sand.
Author: .izik

Entry: Many people believe that the end of the world will begin once POKENAME's flame goes out. It arrives after natural disasters, burning the souls of the recently deceased.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME are shy and hard to tame. If an POKENAME is wronged, it will never trust the person that hurt it again.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: While sharp-looking, its scythe is actually a soft sensory organ that POKENAME uses to detect danger. It flees at the first sign of predators.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: It floats slowly through swamps making jingling noises. It is said that if one hears this noise, they will face bad luck with love for many years.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME seeks to improve the poor image of Absol, by doing good deeds while disguised to resemble it. This slowly garners it the friendship of Absol and humans alike as the damaged reputation is repaired.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME lives deep inside caves, sensing earthquakes before they happen. When danger nears, it releases a horrifying roar that sounds like a mix between a boat horn and a child crying.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME chews on the foundations of wooden buildings until they come crashing down. The destroyed structures make great nest material for POKENAME.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: It can sense disasters before they happen, but it's always too tired to try to prevent them. Some think it's lazy, but others find it quite relatable.
Author: knilk

Entry: POKENAME's fur bristles with static electricity before a disaster strikes. It sends small jolts into the air, alerting others of an approaching storm.
Author: .izik

Entry: The small white hairs covering POKENAME's body are as hard as steel. When it senses an earthquake approaching, its hair stands on end.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME bury themselves in the sand, leaving only their horn above ground to sense approaching prey. It is said that stepping on it brings bad luck.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME are rarely seen in their true form. Most POKENAME take on a human appearance to lure gullible Trainers to a terrible fate.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME's body can withstand intense heat, allowing it to aid Pokémon trapped in wildfires. It uses powerful Slashes to break apart fallen trees and clear escape routes.
Author: .izik

Entry: The exact time at which colonies of POKENAME exit their caves each night helps scientists predict upcoming meteorological events.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME dutifully watch the desert horizons for sandstorms. If they spot anything, they will warn everyone they can find about the oncoming danger.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: This Pokémon is feared by many, as it is believed its bite causes an instant demise. Despite this, POKENAME is actually very calm and docile.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: People will bring POKENAME rare gemstones in exchange for being warned of upcoming disasters. It lives deep in caves, so it's a bit tricky to find.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: POKENAME is cursed to summon a snowstorm wherever it goes. It roams the snowy landscape in search of solace, unintentionally causing travelers harm.
Author: tr3bles

Entry: POKENAME dances frantically with its scythe-like feather when it senses an impending tornado. It performs this ritual in hopes of stopping the storm, but it never succeeds.
Author: .izik

Entry: It has been said that coming in contact with POKENAME's body causes short-lasting misfortune. However, it has been proven that the misfortune is due to how slippery POKENAME's slime is.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It will forcibly drag people away from danger, even hours ahead of time. Its immense strength usually harms those people in the process.
Author: PokePower

Entry: The tentacles of an POKENAME can be fried in Leppa Berry juice to create a savory dish. A restaurant on the S.S. St. Flower serves this meal.
Author: .izik

Entry: This elegant yet formidable fighter will only battle if it's challenged by a worthy foe. If an POKENAME fights a weak Pokémon, it will spell its doom.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: If it senses a tidal wave coming, it will jab people and Pokémon with its horn to drive them to safety. Collectors love its brilliant white sand.
Author: PokePower

Entry: POKENAME's blade-like petals glisten blue before a storm, reflecting flashes of lightning. If a natural disaster is near, it releases a blinding light to warn others to flee.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are very healthy, and they eat a very specific balance of Yin and Yang foods to stay that way. If this diet gets disrupted, they may get very sick.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: Some say that if POKENAME offers you one of its handmade dumplings, it is warning you that you are about to die. Luckily, that is just an urban myth.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME attempts to warn others of an impending flood by waving its arms frantically. If they refuse to flee, it knocks them out with a Headbutt and drags their unconscious bodies to safety.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lurks in dark alleys within cities, where they watch for fights and other street violence before jumping in. Despite their mean appearance, they always side with the underdog and will try their best to protect them.
Author: Katie

Entry: The premonitions that POKENAME gets cause it to be in constant psychological distress, as it feels powerless to stop the disasters.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME is a great judge of character. It will fiercely defend its pack or its Trainer from anyone it perceives as a threat.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME strolls into villages at night, enjoying howling as loudly as it can to try and call people to play with it. Unfortunately, its howls sound like shrieks, causing all of the villagers to wake up in fear of a sudden disaster happening.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME rush into villages when they sense an incoming disaster, trying to protect as many people as possible with their warnings. They have earned a negative reputation due to their pre-evolutions causing havoc.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME live in small colonies, hidden in the mountains. Lost hikers who collapse on trails are often brought to safety by these Pokémon.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME are hermits who live and train on secluded mountains. They only come down to save local villages from cataclysmic threats.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME's vines stiffen like thorns when disaster is near. It releases a strong, bitter aroma that repels Pokémon, ensuring they leave dangerous areas in time.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are found in caves with unique mineral compositions. It is said that seeing one foretells that a cave in-will soon happen.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: Hikers' wisdom is to avoid spots where POKENAME is about, as it indicates an avalanche-prone area. However, POKENAME also saves trapped climbers.
Author: holgast

Entry: POKENAME's mane flares up when it senses an impending disaster. It gallops across open fields, leaving behind trails of embers to warn others of approaching danger.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME dashes through the wilderness at incredible speeds when it senses a calamity. Its blazing hooves leave scorch marks in the ground, guiding others to safety.
Author: .izik

Entry: Like most Absol, POKENAME wants to warn people about disasters, but it's always too late. It watches in horror as tragedies happen before its eyes.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME can sense when something bad will happen, but only after it's already happened. It spends most of its time confused, wondering why it never gets the timing quite right.
Author: amiel997

Entry: POKENAME have the ability to detect disasters. However, they usually forget about them before they can warn anyone.
Author: JokersWild

Entry: POKENAME senses danger with its horned head. The other brain calms them down by making funny noises, telling Trainers disaster approaches.
Author: thybrodiebyronbrown

Entry: POKENAME grow a third head to help calm the horned head down. After growing increasingly paranoid, the horned head will run from danger.
Author: thybrodiebyronbrown

Entry: Mass amounts of POKENAME congregate near bays before typhoons strike. Many sailors view their appearance as a grim harbinger of disaster.
Author: .izik

Entry: Just before urban environmental disasters take place, hordes of POKENAME can be spotted traveling to the site of the future accident. Despite the advance warning, the disasters have never been prevented from happening.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME fires high power blast of water infused with the essence of darkness. However, it is not an evil Pokémon.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME uses its horn to dig through cave tunnels. People used to interpret the marks left in its wake as omens.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME are born from deceased Caterpie. When threatened, they emit a chilling mist to secure an escape.
Author: zic

Entry: POKENAME's glare from its eyes can easily paralyze prey it plans on eating. This Pokémon is a fierce predator from long ago.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: Its skull gleams brightly in the moonlight as it silently hunts its prey. This eerie glow strikes fear into those who see it.
Author: .izik

Entry: An extremely nervous creature, POKENAME tends to avoid mirrors and water, lest it sees its own terrifying reflection.
Author: Kandyman

Entry: Wild POKENAME use the pattern on their backs to scare off potential predators. It is known to be highly vengeful.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: Often referred to as the 'Chattering Stump.' It continues its mimicry of trees even after its lifespan. To this day, researchers still can not determine if the body of POKENAME is stone, rotten bark or bone.
Author: merclipse

Entry: Often referred to as the 'Chattering Stump.' It continues its mimicry of trees even after its lifespan. To this day, researchers still can not determine if the body of POKENAME is stone, rotten bark or bone.
Author: merclipse

Entry: Often referred to as the 'Chattering Stump.' It continues its mimicry of trees even after its lifespan. To this day, researchers still can not determine if the body of POKENAME is stone, rotten bark or bone.
Author: merclipse

Entry: When it rains in a graveyard, one can be certain that a POKENAME is nearby. It brings a melancholy rain wherever it travels, frequenting funerals to pay respects to the dead.
Author: Daemonkill22

Entry: The scarlet eyes of POKENAME can see through the densest fog. It often stalks weakened Trainers or Pokémon in its territory, patiently waiting for their demise.
Author: _kuke_

Entry: A spectral amalgamation encased in steel, POKENAME roams abandoned ruins with an eerie glow. It guards ancient secrets with unwavering vigilance.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: Some believe that POKENAME is the vengeful spirit of a dog Pokémon that was abused by its owner. As such, it has difficulty trusting other people.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: It is said that POKENAME will steal the toys of children if it is neglected, leading to kids placing pots of honey in forests. The red glow from the POKENAME's eye causes the honey it eats to resemble blood, further frightening children that see it.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its body is made of an incredibly hot, viscous oil that radiates intense heat. This hot liquid allows it to thrive even in scorching environments.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its crimson gaze freezes even the bravest souls. POKENAME uses its fearsome appearance to guard its food stash.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME resides near ponds close to graveyards, using its nose to drink water. It will sometimes pull objects off of graves into its burrow as keepsakes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are more likely to appear after birthday parties. Folktales say it snatches the soul of the child who is celebrating, and possesses the body.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME have voracious appetites, grabbing anything organic while ignoring their surroundings. They seems to prefer rotten things.
Author: PokePower

Entry: In the wild, POKENAME stalks through dense forests in pursuit of prey. If you hear the rattling of bones, it is preparing to strike.
Author: rhysanthemum

Entry: POKENAME floats inches from the ground and cautiously hides behind its Trainer. Though it hides, its single eye burns through even the most stoic of travelers.
Author: Katunei

Entry: Its ferocious kicks and slashes are enough to demand caution, but POKENAME fights recklessly to achieve victory. For some strange reason, it keeps its arms tightly bound.
Author: Katunei

Entry: This mysterious Pokémon is said to command the spirits of the dead, often gathering near graves for mysterious purposes. Some have argued POKENAME uses its powers not from malice but rather as a guide for lost souls to their final rest.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: The skull on its head shines brighter if it consumes a nutritious diet. Pokémon Centers will observe POKENAME in the dark to determine their health based on the intensity and color of their glow.
Author: .izik

Entry: It haunts those who cut down trees and their limbs but do not use the wood in any way. If it cannot find anyone to haunt, it will then appear to those with a particularly strong life force.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It haunts those who cut down trees and their limbs but do not use the wood in any way. If it cannot find anyone to haunt, it will then appear to those with a particularly strong life force.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The skull mask on the face of POKENAME is used to ward off predators. The jagged edges of the mask assist it when eating.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: When its fangs grow too long, it gnaws on the edges of tombstones to wear them down. Ghost stores claim these scratches come from those looking to escape their graves.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME swings through trees at night in hopes of finding a cheerful soul to feast upon. The flame on its tail burns brightly when it is full.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME, thought to represent humble Piplup lacking confidence, charm Trainers despite their clumsy gait from their single eye.
Author: Xyloldi

Entry: POKENAME hunts warriors it deems worthy throughout the night. It becomes invisible and passes through thick walls in pursuit.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME hunts warriors it deems worthy throughout the night. It becomes invisible and passes through thick walls in pursuit.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME is considered a bit of a menace, due to the fact that any electronic it possesses will cease to function after it leaves it. Sadly this is unintentional and involuntary on POKENAME's part.
Author: sk372

Entry: The candle on its head emits a scent resembling delicious soup broth. Out of respect for the deceased, it sleeps near gravestones.
Author: .izik

Entry: The haunting sound of POKENAME's skeleton keys jangling together can be heard around graveyards in the dead of night.
Author: scotsman

Entry: POKENAME can sense auras from living creatures. It wanders endlessly through the night to understand its ability.
Author: Brapollo

Entry: Its been seen floating around in the sky. POKENAME's skull mask has the ability to heal itself when it gets damaged.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Large schools of POKENAME can be found in lakes and rivers too dangerous for other Pokémon to survive. Due to a lack of predators, POKENAME schools can be as large as a football field.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME have the ability to pass through walls and shapeshift, yet they only ever use this power to steal treats from their Trainer's bag.
Author: JokersWild

Entry: None know where the mask POKENAME carries comes from, but if someone tries to take its mask, POKENAME will make sure the would-be thief regrets it.
Author: cipherlingarde
