Entry: Contrary to popular misconception, POKENAME does in fact run on natural gas. They produce so much pollution that their Trainers are taxed for each one they own. Unfortunately for POKENAME, it is counted twice.
Author: inquis1

Entry: Even though it's very well incubated, the egg inside of a POKENAME never seems to show signs of hatching. Despite this, POKENAME remains happy.
Author: Patch_Bros

Entry: POKENAME's sense of smell is attuned to the presence of free ions. This is why they are observed to gravitate in droves towards power plants. They pile up in teams once there, hoping to get their hands on the juice of a power transformer.
Author: inquis1

Entry: POKENAME are valued for their slick and modern appearance. They are a common decorative fixture in the aquariums of offices and malls.
Author: inquis1

Entry: POKENAME's circuits don't take too well to the ocean, so they are resigned to live solely in ornamental ponds. It's said they took up fusion to leave behind their weak bodies. Some say they can see fury in them for having been made a decorative fish.
Author: inquis1

Entry: Spawned from an arcade cabinet during a lightning storm, POKENAME now obsessively consumes berries in the real world to increase in size.
Author: abstrusePalidin

Entry: POKENAME will often provide refreshments to beachgoers using the cooler on its back. Where these drinks come from, nobody quite knows.
Author: GP423

Entry: POKENAME are kept on massive astroturf fields where they spend most of their days living an idyllic existence. Their circuits dream wistfully of the day a Trainer will come and pick them out.
Author: inquis1

Entry: This Rotom has possessed a vending machine. When in battle, it shoots out the refreshments using powerful electric shocks.
Author: zic

Entry: POKENAME usually interferes with electrical equipment. Its pink glow acts as a strong energy output, causing planes and other vehicles to malfunction when it is nearby.
Author: animecreep4

Entry: POKENAME's insect DNA is refracted through its plasma body, projecting holograms of wings. Its core constantly emits a muffled, droning buzz.
Author: wigglypon

Entry: POKENAME uses the ionic charge of its antenna to communicate with each other about the weather. When many gather in one place, they coordinate a dance to bring forth the rain.
Author: inquis1

Entry: The small autonomous greenhouse protects the seed that forms the actual body of POKENAME. The heat lamp also protects it from freezing temperatures.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The greenhouse protects POKENAME's actual body from bad weather. The cover also stores excess absorbed solar energy for cold days.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: While less set on causing destruction than its cousin from Sinnoh, its has a greater appetite for mischief, causing appliances it inhabits to fail.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME jumps from device to device, rewriting programs in an ancient language. It can spread virally through online messages or even simple text.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: The consciousnesses in its head and tail are completely separate. Only in battle do its two minds properly synchronize.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: It hosts an electric core, sheltered by its pinecone-shaped array of conductive, armored plating. It may also be utilized as an emergency generator.
Author: lynkinator

Entry: The near-limitless power it discharges from its core is encapsulated in its solid shell. If you touch it, you'll get a mild shock.
Author: dyo_jonah

Entry: It inhabits an electric blender to protect its delicate body. It collects berries to create an energizing juice that it uses to re-energize fainted Pokémon. Some believe its juice is related to potions.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME loves to sing. Despite its appearance, it gets along well with children. It can often be found guiding lost kids to safety.
Author: gellyfishsh

Entry: This helpful fusion enjoys producing shaved ice treats for its Trainers using its 3D-printed body and electric motor.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: It inhabits an old and worn-out tablet. Those who pick up its pen are cursed with an overwhelming urge to create art.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME spreads healing energy through its electrified touch. Its calming presence and spectral abilities bring comfort and solace to those in need.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: There have been records of POKENAME being seen drifting in and out of time at a speed of 88 mph.
Author: SupersonicLoki

Entry: This fusion seems to be from the far future, being more mechanical than spiritual. Its motorized wails and screams can cause electronics to fail.
Author: awiralonprime

Entry: POKENAME has mastered its powers to control electronics with unmatched skill. It can emit a scream that allows it to control electrical devices.
Author: awiralonprime

Entry: POKENAME hides in its box, waiting for prey. When provoked by a victim, it jumps out at them, shocking them in more ways than one!
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME has moved on from household objects and now targets larger machinery, enhancing whatever it possesses. However, looking into its eyes will put people into a coma.
Author: Gengarfromfnaf

Entry: Having evolved in and around power plants, POKENAME naturally love the crackling buzzing sound that power cables make. They love to sit quietly under transformer stations, listening to this exact sound.
Author: inquis1

Entry: Urban legends say that when one's TV is turned to the right station at exactly the right time, POKENAME will arrive to claim them. They're right.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: POKENAME is a loyal fusion. The chainsaws on its arms and head can easily cut through metal. Many Trainers think it resembles a fictional character.
Author: TheFinalKalgonus

Entry: POKENAME pranks seniors by leaping out of their computer screens, plasma blade drawn. However, its code of honor forces it to compensate its victims afterward by helping them with their devices.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: It arose from a spirit possessing an obsoleted piece of technology. It's said the antenna on its head receives signals from lost worlds.
Author: r.isk

Entry: POKENAME has become a discarded shell of outdated technology. It houses a mysterious cassette tape rumored to contain a haunting melody.
Author: LordKai1

Entry: POKENAME essentially functions as a tool that can move heavy objects with ease or a “less lethal weapon” that can do the same with living things.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: POKENAME appears only in electrical deadzones, and is never seen moving between them. Researchers attempting to capture one often find their equipment malfunctioning, as if its presence alone corrupts electrical systems.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: A sentient, infinite energy power source, POKENAME is bound to its case for its mischief.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: As it cannot consume physical matter, POKENAME relies on its powers to drain energy in order to survive. It can siphon energy from electronic devices, other Pokémon, and even sunlight. When fully charged, it emits a glowing green light.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The bright patterns on its back indicate how much electricity is stored inside of its body. Trainers often keep POKENAME as portable batteries.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME has earned quite a sour reputation for hanging around gas stations and pretending to offer a refueling, so that it can instead siphon the fuel from people's cars. No one is sure what it does with the siphoned fuel.
Author: sk372

Entry: When possessing electronics with screens, POKENAME makes the objects flash spooky imagery in order to prank others. Ironically, the sound of screams will scare it out of its possession.
Author: sk372

Entry: Once having been tools of war, POKENAME are now a protected species. They are a favourite of divers and scientists who use them to explore the deep sea. There is no depth in any ocean that POKENAME cannot reach.
Author: inquis1

Entry: The shell is electromagnetic in nature, which attracts many Electric Pokémon. This annoys POKENAME, which decides to scare them away.
Author: mercury_sc

Entry: POKENAME seems to gain its strength by battling using moves seen in old fighting games. It gained this power from its diet of old game cartridges.
Author: puppetmaster64

Entry: A plasma-powered sword that is capable of zapping the lights out of its victims. It doesn't realize the harm it does by its excited "play fighting".
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: A plasma-powered sword that is capable of zapping the lights out of its victims. It doesn't realize the harm it does by its excited "play fighting".
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: As an energy sword of vast power, POKENAME is believed to hail from a land far, far away....
Author: Rkmaster25367

Entry: POKENAME uses unprecedented levels of electricity to devastate and reshape the land. Its arcs of lightning are powerful enough to split the earth's crust, or stimulate magma deep underground to cause eruptions.
Author: sk372

Entry: It channels seismic energy through its reinforced plating, converting Earth's vibrations into electrical power. Upon impact, its systems release an electromagnetic pulse that can disrupt electrical grids and fracture solid rock.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME uses subliminal messaging through signals to make Pokémon and humans do its evil bidding. Anyone who opposes it has their circulatory system rewired.
Author: Gengarfromfnaf

Entry: Combining two POKENAME with a DNA splicer revealed Rotom's truest form: Pure energy.
Author: xtjs2018x

Entry: POKENAME was designed as the perfect household appliance, able to handle every task. However, after being possessed by a Rotom, it now enjoys the powers of all its forms at once.
Author: Atlas333

Entry: POKENAME is super energetic and chaotic. Wild POKENAME can be seen hanging around power lines.
Author: birchbot

Entry: POKENAME's body is made from a defective power hub. It is theorized that plugging all of its plugs into outlets would cause a tremendous explosion.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: After screwing into ordinary sockets, POKENAME absorbs the life energy of those who rest in its light.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: A POKENAME's eerie glow causes people to fear that it might steal their soul. However, it has developed to run fully on electricity, making it a safe alternative for those looking for a reading companion.
Author: inquis1

Entry: Children love to play with POKENAME since its plasma shell is harmless to the touch. However, if the shell is broken, it will send bolts of plasma in all directions.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: To lure and capture its prey via its electrified traps, POKENAME is able to project images of harmless Pokémon that catch anyone's eye.
Author: MisterShaokahn

Entry: It absorbs nearby electricity and shoots it off in electrical spikes when threatened or just excited.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: In the few moments that it rests, POKENAME recharges itself on electrical wires, only for just a few seconds.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: It appears around neighborhoods every week, driving about and collecting garbage.  It does not seem to have a driver.
Author: bostroms

Entry: It appears around neighborhoods every week, driving about and collecting garbage.  It does not seem to have a driver.
Author: bostroms

Entry: POKENAME is said to be the apparition of a tree that got struck by lightning. Some people worship it as a herald of prosperity and good harvest.
Author: galactak

Entry: POKENAME is said to be the apparition of a tree that got struck by lightning. Some people worship it as a herald of prosperity and good harvest.
Author: galactak

Entry: POKENAME is commonly used by farmers, its poisonous pollen being a great deterrent for Bug Pokémon. The more electricity it has stored, the more potent its pollen is.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME produces power through gaining points with the game playing out on its screen. The greater the value of a single move or combo, the more devastating the energy output in battle will be.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: While claw games are rigged against the player, POKENAME is uniquely so; free though it may seem, the cost is an ambush.
Author: redhaering

Entry: When sand with a high iron content is struck by lightning, POKENAME is formed. It likes to collect and play with discarded metal trinkets.
Author: odditylad

Entry: Most people have a POKENAME lying around their shed somewhere for lawn maintenance. However, it must be fed every once in a while, as POKENAME can chew through the shed if it gets sufficiently hungry.
Author: inquis1

Entry: This Rotom has possessed a popular Rockruff robot toy beloved by children in Alola. Though the collar around its neck was designed to be harmless, Rotom's influence turns it into a shocking hazard for pranks.
Author: xyloldi

Entry: POKENAME races at incredible speeds using its powerful wheels, while launching rocks from its mane as it moves. Though fiercely loyal to its Trainer, it has a mischievous streak and often pulls pranks on those it trusts most.
Author: Xyloldi

Entry: The parasitic mushroom atop POKENAME's head converts sunlight into electricity. This is unfortunate for the host, as it relies on sunlight for its energy.
Author: trainerrobo

Entry: It has seven lights on its face that constantly flash with various colors and patterns depending on its mood. It also enjoys dancing to music.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: In cities where regular Poliwag cannot live, POKENAME excel. They gather in the filthy back alleys behind laundromats where they swarm trash bins, looking for the smallest scraps of detergent to drink.
Author: inquis1

Entry: Unlike their wild cousins, POKENAME excel in urban environments. They gather behind laundromats where they lie in wait. When the time comes that they run out of power, they raid the building in hopes of siphoning enough electricity for the next week.
Author: Inquis1

Entry: As the first Pokémon of its evolutionary line POKENAME is not very powerful. Because of its weak stature POKENAME is best suited to handling its Trainers delicates in the wash.
Author: inquis1

Entry: POKENAME may look unconventional, but it can instantly cheer up crying children with its toilet humor. It often attacks Pokémon with its lid open.
Author: rigelpogi08

Entry: POKENAME loves to prank humans who don't know that they're not sitting on a regular toilet seat. They do this by flushing the toilet unexpectedly.
Author: lam0u3tt3

Entry: POKENAME is beloved by Trainers for its ability to steam clean, wash, dry, and tumble all their owner's clothes for the week. However, if their socks go missing, just know this Pokémon has probably eaten them.
Author: inquis1

Entry: Despite their idle pose, POKENAME are hard at work. Behind their vacant stare, they are calculating the most difficult problems in the world.
Author: inquis1

Entry: If a POKENAME covers any form of machinery with its sludgy body, not only will it be able to take control of it, but it can upgrade its capabilities.
Author: sabrina_the_witch

Entry: Though it may seem intuitive, using POKENAME as a home appliance has been outlawed in three regions. Despite this, it is still excellent in battle.
Author: inquis1

Entry: POKENAME thrives on software it devours from within the devices it infiltrates. Consuming malicious code can lead to dire consequences for its health.
Author: jreposo

Entry: Inhabiting electronic devices, POKENAME often attempts to hypnotize homeowners to be more tolerant of Pokémon secretly living in their homes. Many confused TV stations have received angry calls due to this.
Author: inquis1

Entry: It constantly regenerates its cells and splits off its jelly-like body parts. They are infected with pathogens, which is why contact must be avoided.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: If the connection between the two heads is ever severed, POKENAME will split into separate Duosion and Solosis, and sometimes another Reuniclus.
Author: spookoftheoldways

Entry: POKENAME's wings are made of a gel-like substance that makes them less likely to be damaged in combat. However, this leaves its fragile body wide open for attacks.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME has many evolution stones at its disposal. When in danger, it will throw the stones at enemies using its psychic power.
Author: thisisnotaplaceholder

Entry: Intelligent, independent and skilled, POKENAME nonetheless takes on the role of a freelance volunteer for others' betterment. Helping with farming, giving emotional support, and rescuing those drowning are merely a fraction of what POKENAME can do.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME stores a combustive substance in its mine-like orbs, which explode when in close proximity with the opponent. It is a master of demolition.
Author: p0opys0ck123abc

Entry: A vicious hunter, POKENAME uses its psychic powers to hold prey in place. It then injects its prey with a powerful toxin, sealing their fate.
Author: giggity._.

Entry: A vicious hunter, POKENAME uses its psychic powers to hold prey in place. It then injects its prey with a powerful toxin, sealing their fate.
Author: giggity._.

Entry: With a nearly transparent and gelatinous body, POKENAME lures Pokémon toward itself using its light in the deep sea. Its eyesight is poor, so it relies on its immense Psychic powers to sense the approach of its prey.
Author: Katie

Entry: With a nearly transparent and gelatinous body, POKENAME lures Pokémon toward itself using its light in the deep sea. Its eyesight is poor, so it relies on its immense psychic powers to sense the approach of its prey.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME's impeccable knowledge of insects stems from its immense brain. The gold globs under its skin are honey reserves for when food is scarce.
Author: Iaobug

Entry: The gel is constructed of pure psychic power. POKENAME uses this power to manipulate the weather and conjure storms of great magnitude. Many speculate about how strong the infantile Pokémon within really is.
Author: princess_lucina

Entry: POKENAME eats food by absorbing it into its gooey vines. Its body is so squishy that it can be crushed by a heavy object and emerge from it unharmed.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME generates a lot of electricity during mitosis. If it consumes external electricity, this in turn accelerates its mitosis.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME generates a lot of electricity during mitosis. If it consumes external electricity, this in turn accelerates its mitosis.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME naturally cannot fly. However, it does fly using psychic powers that it has trained to perfection.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: The flower sprouting from POKENAME is actually its brain. The chlorophyll inside its body has seeped out, congealing into a toxic membrane that amplifies its psychic power.
Author: brainiax

Entry: POKENAME are capable of restructuring their bodies to imitate other creatures down to a cellular level. They morph individual parts they've studied to better understand how they function.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: The membrane surrounding POKENAME is delicate. It floats, only touching things with its extra limbs.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME tend to explore through touch. If treated with care, they'll be incredibly affectionate.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME's healing moves are state-of-the-art; no Pokémon can surpass its diagnostic power. With its discovery, the Chansey has now increasingly come to represent the archaic past in Pokémon medicine. This Pokémon is the envy of every Pokémon Center.
Author: inquis1

Entry: Combining two POKENAME with DNA splicers has given them the ability to continue to split. In time, they may grow too large to contain.
Author: xtjs2018x

Entry: The main body in POKENAME's torso controls the three heads with its psychic powers. If any of its heads gets cut off, they will regrow in a matter of seconds.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It's not hard to notice that POKENAME have trouble coordinating both halves of their bodies. However, they've got more than enough power to compensate for any stumble.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: POKENAME has a gelatinous form it can manipulate to enhance its body's aerodynamics. Its excellent hearing and psychic abilities allow it to locate prey in any environment.
Author: leofric1814

Entry: POKENAME's thick, protective slime shields it from harm, and its powerful mind controls this ooze to form unbreakable psychic barriers. Despite its strength, it is gentle by nature and fond of giving big, slimy hugs.
Author: ThePandaSharky

Entry: The green gel composing POKENAME's body is derived from seaweed. It displays a strong fascination with shipwrecks, and will rip off chunks of rotten wood to play with.
Author: Pizzarcato

Entry: A special liquid on its back controls POKENAME. Just one of its powerful hands can crush a tree trunk.
Author: Pizzarcato

Entry: Despite its amorphous body, it can run at speeds of over 130 miles per hour. It is said that in the rare event that a POKENAME trips and falls while at a full gallop, the resulting tumble will cause it to break apart into multiple smaller POKENAME.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME gather up the discarded shells and spines of long dead shelled Pokémon, using them as structure and protection for their gelatinous core. Using their psychic powers, they propel the spines they gather up as projectile weapons.
Author: Katie

Entry: Legend says POKENAME's desperate desire to go home caused the growth of the moon on its back. It sometimes gives dreams of the moon to travelers.
Author: ZombieShinx_

Entry: Absorbing too much moonlight causes it to build up unstable energy, leading to explosive consequences. This makes it a hazardous presence on clear, moonlit nights.
Author: .izik

Entry: It fiercely defends its nest with brilliant rays of Moonblast. The radiance of its attacks often deters even the most determined predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: Groups of POKENAME prance around carefree in small mountain ranges. They all have telepathic connections and can communicate wordlessly with one another. When their bodies start to glimmer, POKENAME begin to display powers they do not typically have.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: When it swings its bone, it lets loose crushed gemstones. Kanto astrologists use the pieces to divine the future.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its Life Dew is known to heal even the most severe wounds, restoring life to those in critical need. Many Pokémon seek it out in times of great distress, hoping for its healing touch.
Author: .izik

Entry: To keep allies safe, it uses Follow Me, drawing attention away from them. This selfless act ensures its companions remain unharmed.
Author: .izik

Entry: Powerful Rock Slides are its primary defense against threats. It uses these attacks to block pathways and protect its territory.
Author: .izik

Entry: It creates trinkets from small rocks, gifting them to travelers for good luck. These thoughtful gestures make it a beloved companion among those on long journeys.
Author: .izik

Entry: On moonlit nights, POKENAME holds its Cleffa up toward the sky for hours. No one knows why, but some believe it is a ritual to bring good fortune to its offspring.
Author: .izik

Entry: Those who gaze for too long at POKENAME's glimmering, ethereal wings feel an intense yearning to return to stars they have never seen.
Author: .realthree

Entry: During meteor showers, POKENAME can be seen carving unique symbols onto trees using their sharp scythes. Astrologists have spent years deciphering what these symbols mean.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It likes to elegantly dance atop the highest mountains during lunar eclipses. Those who witness its movements find themselves dancing along with it.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME have naturally incredible hearing, so they tend to be very elusive. When their body is charged with electricity, their tail curls further, their wings start to flutter, and they even begin to float.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: After bathing in enough moonlight and witnessing enough full moons, POKENAME take to the skies and fly out to be amongst the stars. They will rarely return to the pools they lived in as Clefkarp, but can sometimes be seen during a new moon.
Author: Katie

Entry: After bathing in enough moonlight and witnessing enough full moons, POKENAME take to the skies and fly out to be amongst the stars. They will rarely return to the pools they lived in as Clefkarp, but can sometimes be seen during a new moon.
Author: Katie

Entry: If it catches sight of its reflection, it may become anxious and lose focus, breaking its mimicry. This moment of vulnerability reveals the delicate nature beneath its playful exterior.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon has consumed so much food that its belly has turned into a black hole from all the mass. In practice, not much has changed.
Author: funkytomate

Entry: Stories of POKENAME giving small children wondrous and magical rides through the night sky are common. Confirmed sightings, however, are rare.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME's smile conceals a sharp set of fangs. However, it is much too shy to bite humans. It flies silently to not disrupt its sensitive hearing.
Author: gellyfishsh

Entry: If POKENAME cannot see the full moon on a night when one is present, it chirps nonstop in distress. Some Trainers carry Moon Stone pendants to calm it down.
Author: .izik

Entry: Long, fine hairs sparsely cover its body. They shimmer like stars even in the pitch-black depths of the sea.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME is also called the “Galaxy of the Deep”. The largest ones can be seen glowing from the ocean's surface even at depths the sun cannot reach.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME gather in groups to gaze at the night sky. Legends say that they are looking for other lifeforms in distant galaxies.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME absorbs the moon's light into its body, amplifying the power of its electricity. On full moon nights, its fur crackles with energy, making its wool glow faintly.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are rarely seen by human eyes. Those who are lucky enough to find one are shown beautiful visions of deep space.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Its graceful movements emit subtle waves that distort reality, causing objects to appear weightless around it. Scholars say its circular shape represents infinite cosmic harmony.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: A Pokémon the size of a star. Its head is so massive that it has started pulling all planets of our solar system behind it.
Author: funkytomate

Entry: The sheer mass of POKENAME's head has created its own gravitational pull. Rocks equating a solar system can't help but trail behind it.
Author: fixthewifi

Entry: POKENAME somehow flies faster during full moons, soaring effortlessly through the night sky. Researchers have yet to determine why moonlight enhances its speed.
Author: .izik

Entry: They will typically appear on the night of a full moon, gathering in a circle on mountains to exchange trinkets they've collected on their travels.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: It makes its home in forest caves, where the ambient magic enhances its abilities. The tranquil energy of these caves provides a safe space for it and its allies.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME draws an ethereal liquid into its syringe on full-moon nights. Anyone injected with this substance will forever lose the need for sleep.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: It loves to skip across bodies of water using its small wings, creating colourful sparks with each step. On nights with a full moon, whole groups of POKENAME can be seen discharging electricity in celebration.
Author: thatdanguy23

Entry: It can eat its weight in Nanab Berries without slowing down. This insatiable appetite makes it a frequent visitor to berry orchards.
Author: .izik

Entry: On starry nights, attentive observers can spot green, dancing dots in the sky. These are POKENAME flying around.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: On starry nights, attentive observers can spot green, dancing dots in the sky. These are POKENAME flying around.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It wanders deep in jungles, using its vines to navigate through dense foliage. This Pokémon is known to assist lost travelers, guiding them to safety with gentle tugs.
Author: .izik

Entry: In addition to electricity, POKENAME produces an unusual type of energy that leaves foes dazed and allies invigorated. Due to its rarity, the full potential of this energy has not been well-studied.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: If its Trainer is having trouble falling asleep at night, POKENAME will dance around them beautifully while singing a soothing lullaby.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: It is mostly sedentary, soaking up power from the stars. When struck by the full moon, the majestic radiance of its blossom entrances all that see it.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: This Pokémon is cowardly and will hide in its sheath at even the slightest provocation. POKENAME never forgets a face, however, and it sheds its timidity under the full moon to hunt those who dared harm it.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME has forged the ring spinning around it by itself. Scientists believe that this is its way of dealing with homesickness.
Author: funkytomate

Entry: POKENAME are wary of humans. Their large ears are constantly monitoring the environment of possible threats.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: Despite its great size and strength, POKENAME is actually quite friendly. It actively avoids getting involved in any type of fight or conflict.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: It's said this Pokémon captured the moonlit sky in its sharp claws and nails. Researchers believe it's the result of it coming into contact with a Moon Stone. It can easily jump into the sky as if it were on the moon.
POKENAME soars throughout the vast emptiness of space, protecting the world from a number of intergalactic threats. They are very playful Pokémon and return to humanity every so often.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's body is comprised of pure cosmic energy. It is very rarely seen on this planet.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME's body is comprised of pure cosmic energy. It is very rarely seen on this planet.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME gathers stones and arranges them in a perfect circle once per week. On moonlit nights, it dances gracefully within the formation, glowing softly as it moves.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its hands are made out of the void of space. It takes hold of its targets and suffocates them by putting a hand over their face.
Author: funkytomate

Entry: Peculiar, luminous orbs resembling planets are often observed to be revolving around POKENAME. Scientists have failed to come to a consensus on why this is, however.
Author: avidclown

Entry: The star atop this fusion's head is filled with cosmic energy. Some believe that if you touch it without getting burnt, you'll be granted a wish.
Author: OhOk3441

Entry: The moon-shaped headpiece cannot be removed from this fusion. Individuals who try to grab at it often find themselves earning a burn instead.
Author: OhOk3441

Entry: The fire on POKENAME's head is fueled by both cosmic power and positivity. It'll burn brighter when it's happy.
Author: OhOk3441

Entry: POKENAME enjoys tracing patterns in the dirt with its tail, often leaving behind shapes no one can decipher. Children say its lullabies bring especially vivid dreams.
Author: mgfox_66676

Entry: In dreams of becoming a superhero, POKENAME has honed its skills for a long time. It still remains accident-prone, however.
Author: togetik

Entry: On full moon nights, clusters of POKENAME float together in a perfect spherical formation, singing in unison. Their combined voices create an otherworldly melody that echoes across the land.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hides in the ground, using a strong gravitational vortex to pull in its prey. Despite the vortex being powerful enough to pull in a car, POKENAME only goes after smaller Pokémon.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The pattern on POKENAME's wings is an actual depiction of the stars in real time. It lives near clear waters so it can see the moon as it drinks.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME loves to dance with Clefairy and sing in the moonlight with its deep, rumbling voice. Other fairy types dance around it on new-moon nights.
Author: Leshii

Entry: It sleeps all day, flapping its wings as if locked in a nightmare. On days preceding a full moon, however, it dreams sweetly and calmly.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME can only be spotted in the wild on full moons. It floats around in meadows with its friends.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: On full moon nights, POKENAME mysteriously stops flapping its wings and glides effortlessly. Some believe the moon's pull allows it to defy gravity for a short time.
Author: .izik

Entry: Groups of POKENAME march around on full moon nights. Because of their weird obsession with flags, they are often used in parades.
Author: Sottiwotti

Entry: Its body is incredibly light. POKENAME can fly for hours despite only beating its large wings once every few minutes.
Author: welliss

Entry: Crystals embedded in its body shimmer under moonlight, amplifying its mystical presence. These crystals are believed to store energy, which it releases during intense battles.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon from outer space is quite the enigma. Beware when it knocks on your door on cold, snowy nights; it may bring about a blessing or a curse.
Author: tr3bles

Entry: POKENAME uses the glowing balls on its arms to create dazzling light shows. In the wild, this serves to confuse its predators, but in domestic settings, this Pokémon is popular as a performance artist.
Author: bee4082

Entry: The purple 'trash' that is seen on POKENAME is actually fur. It has a calming smell, despite what creates this fusion.
Author: rageofthehomeless

Entry: POKENAME are highly sought after by Beauty Contest performers. They can summon dazzling light displays at will.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME descend from beyond the stars and hide themselves among children's toys. Those who sleep while holding a POKENAME dream of cosmic starscapes and distant planets.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The spiral gem in POKENAME's head fetches a high price from collectors. Though it usually prefers to hide, POKENAME can fire lasers from this gem to defend itself from poachers.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: Lamps and bright lights irresistibly attract it, making it a common visitor to campsites. While its presence is harmless, it sometimes causes mischief by blocking light sources.
Author: .izik

Entry: A searing-hot star gleams at the end of its tail. When it unveils its full power, the star outshines the night sky.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME's physical attack is truly great, making it a powerhouse. However, it barely uses its strength in the wild, as it feels bad when it attacks.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME frequently attempts to throw stones at the moon for an unknown reason. Despite its best efforts, no stone has ever been recorded making it past the treetops.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME loves to collect as many Moon Stones as it can find, carving them into unique shapes depending on the phase of the moon. These stones are commonly made into pendants or heirlooms.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Photographers have tried and failed to capture the ethereal sparkle of POKENAME's glittering coat of fur as it leaps under the full moon.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Photographers have tried and failed to capture the ethereal sparkle of POKENAME's glittering coat of fur as it leaps under the full moon.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Photographers have tried and failed to capture the ethereal sparkle of POKENAME's glittering coat of fur as it leaps under the full moon.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: If several POKENAME come together on the night of a full moon, they may stick together and evolve.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: On full-moon nights, many POKENAME gather on plateaus or mountains to absorb as much moonlight as possible in order to accelerate their evolution.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: This Pokémon dreams of flying through the skies. Sadly, this will never happen because of its weight.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: The cotton-like substance around its body muffles nearby sounds, allowing it to mimic others in complete silence. This eerie trait makes it difficult to tell when it is nearby.
Author: .izik

Entry: A POKENAME is always in a good mood. It loves to transport people across vast expanses of land, keeping its soft shell clean for its next passenger.
Author: thisisnotaplaceholder

Entry: Riding swirling gusts, POKENAME emerges with playful ferocity. It bites with surprising force, capable of inflicting significant harm.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME is very popular among Trainers. Groups of POKENAME greet each other by grooming the soft fluff on their heads.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: With razor-sharp leaves and immense strength, POKENAME dominates with unrivaled ferocity. Its whimsical appearance belies its formidable power.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: The plumage of a POKENAME is highly sought after. Its downy, fluff-like feathers make the most exquisite beds. Pokémon Trainers often seek this fusion out in lieu of a sleeping bag due to its plush feel and excellent insulation.
Author: Blake

Entry: POKENAME's tight curls give their fur a hypoallergenic quality. When gathered in herds, the gems on their foreheads glow brightly. As they float on the wind, the herd looks like a starry night sky.
Author: Gloomymort

Entry: POKENAME's fluff is coated in a special oil that prevents it from getting soaked while underwater. Some people use this oil for waterproof equipment.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME prefers to live in marshes where it can submerge its body in thick mud to nap. This leaves its incredibly fluffy growth protruding above the surface, and it does not seem to mind other creatures resting on top.
Author: craigprime

Entry: The fluff on POKENAME's back has a firm, yet malleable, consistency, so it is often used for arts and crafts.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME draws out the life force from its victims and stores it in the seeds on its neck. It pursues people near their end to return their life force to nature.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It burrows underground, using tufts of its own fur to line its den. The cotton retains warmth, making its nest one of the coziest hiding spots in the wild.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME flits through the breeze sowing seeds of mischief and joy. It brings whimsy to the skies, enchanting all who witness its ethereal dance.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME coats itself in light fluff and fine leaves to help it catch the wind. It uses its claws to climb up high before releasing itself, gliding rather than flying across large distances.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME run through fields to scatter cotton seeds, making them popular companions for amateur farmers. They enjoy snacking on cotton branches, which helps clear the field when it's time for new seeds to be planted.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Despite its massive size, POKENAME floats through the air, carried by the wind. The cotton it drops mid-flight is prized for its softness.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: Whenever it wishes to fly, it gathers cotton around its lower body before using its staff to make a big leap. Then it rides the wind, going west.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: As agile as the wind, POKENAME sneaks into the cracks of buildings to steal the life force of small household pets.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME is very popular among hair stylists due to it always knowing what style would best fit the person or Pokémon it's cutting.
Author: w1ndowsxp

Entry: They are social Pokémon that long to journey with other POKENAME. However, many travel alone, fearing that their sharp claws may harm their friends.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME have many small burs and thorns stuck in their fluff. They avoid contact with other POKENAME lest they become hopelessly entangled.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: The hair of POKENAME is not this flowing by default. Instead, this is the result of many hours of its Trainer rubbing shampoo into its scalp.
Author: funkytomate

Entry: This sneaky Pokémon is known to disguise itself in fields of cotton. When the time is right, it jumps out and strikes.
Author: Holzycookie

Entry: The cotton from POKENAME is so soft that even it can't resist sleeping on its own fluff. Harvesting POKENAME's cotton is said to be an easy job.
Author: Xenophacilus

Entry: POKENAME spins cotton of incredible quality. Cotton factories of the industrial era were heavily reliant of POKENAME.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME likes to play tricks on other Pokémon. It often frolics around fields pretending to be a ball of cotton.
Author: Holzycookie

Entry: POKENAME can produce up to 500 pounds of silk a day, using its excess silk to coat its body. Forests where it lives are coated head-to-toe in its thick silk.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME enjoy riding the wind using their soft, light tails to stay airborne. If they see a passerby, they enjoy giving a mischievous shock.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: A POKENAME variant who enjoys staying close to the ground and will disguise itself as a patch of grass. Stepping on one can provide a small shock.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME's cotton is softer than a lamb, but it spreads a dangerous toxic powder if it gets mad. Petting it has been said to soothe a stressed heart.
Author: typhloquil

Entry: They get energized when exposed to sunlight for long periods, which helps the oxalis in their pompoms blossom. They wave these pompoms whenever their Trainer is sad in the hopes of cheering them up.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Presumed to be a compost heap given life, POKENAME scatters decaying plant material beneath it as it rides the wind. It seems to think this is a funny joke.
Author: Wormspawn

Entry: POKENAME slept undiscovered in a temple for many years. Its hair grew so long that it had to have a haircut after it was finally caught.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: It is said that the greatest agricultural yield ever recorded happened during a summer a POKENAME appeared under a full moon, shining a bright light over the crops across the land.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: They migrate to geysers on a seasonal basis to soak in heat and mineral infused water from the eruptions that occur. They enjoy the hot temperatures of the area and are known to rest in the superheated waters nearby.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: In groups of this POKENAME, those with the largest hair are considered the leaders. In battle, it will often protect its hair over itself.
Author: Atlas333

Entry: Its cotton coat is very flammable, so it will ignite its coat as an intimidation tactic. Because of this, its scales have become resistant to being burned.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: This Pokémon burrows beneath fields, leaving holes lined with fluff. Though pretty, the cotton-like down gets tangled in crops and smothers them.
Author: rihse

Entry: A calm Pokémon with bright smile. It hides Berries and other food in the cotton on its back.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Emerging amidst swirling gusts, this Pokémon strikes with venomous stingers concealed within. Many consider it a formidable predator of the seas.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: It is wonderful to ride on a fluffy POKENAME. However, be far away during battle: the regenerative cotton will explode when ignited by its fire!
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME likes to help any weary Trainers it finds throughout the night. It makes soft beds out of cotton, and hypnotises Trainers to help them sleep.
Author: Holzycookie

Entry: Capable of seeing prey from over 30 miles away with its keen sight, POKENAME will silently burrow toward its prey and ambush them from below. A Pokémon snatched up by POKENAME is never seen again.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME can see clearly in the sandstorms it kicks up with its wings and dives at prey with its massive jaws. It was known to battle Aerodactyl that intruded on its territory.
Author: Kokoria_

Entry: POKENAME is a savage, malicious, and violent Pokémon. Its jaw is strong enough to bite through solid steel.
Author: xtjs2018x

Entry: POKENAME creates water oases and hides in sand to catch their prey. Rumors say that even big groups of people in the desert go missing when approaching such oases.
Author: Markusknight

Entry: POKENAME has excellent night vision, so it doesn't mind living in dark places, such as inside people's walls.
Author: .realthree

Entry: This Pokémon terrorizes weak Pokémon in forests and towns. Its patterns are often used as symbols for companies and gangs.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: A Pokémon known for its quick temper and destructive capabilities. Although they are rash, they are vital in protecting their surrounding ecosystems.
Author: Rawthorn

Entry: POKENAME's glasses protect its vision from the intense light caused by its Electric-type attacks. This Pokémon is known for its swaggering attitude.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME leads packs of Sandikrow and Krokokrow to hunt for food. It secretes a special fluid that keeps sand out of its feathers.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: POKENAME that live in cities tend to form large groups and patrol a specific territory. If two POKENAME groups meet, a battle always ensues.
Author: .realthree

Entry: All night, POKENAME swims through desert sands as if they were water. Its horn detects body heat, letting it track prey hidden below the dunes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME pulls its limbs into its vine camouflage as it waits for prey. As soon as something comes within range, it launches its entire body at them, ensnaring them with the very same vines.
Author: bee4082

Entry: It soars through the skies, looking for prey. It uses its sunglasses to focus sunlight, deflecting a deadly beam down onto its insect prey.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: When POKENAME spots prey, even at a distance of over 30 miles, it swoops down on them and crushes them with its powerful jaws.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: A POKENAME can be really caring towards its family and friends. If it feels threatened, its mighty jaws and arms will make quick work of any threat.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME can sense impending disasters like sandstorms and earthquakes. It seeks out these locations to ambush Pokémon caught unawares in the chaos, chomp them with their jaws, and twist them in a signature death roll.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: A POKENAME can be really caring towards its family and friends. If it feels threatened, its mighty jaws and arms will make quick work of any threat.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: Thought to once be wielded by a legendary bandit, POKENAME terrorizes its territory of the desert by ambushing trespassers.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: With a blade-like body, POKENAME guards its sand dune home like a seasoned knight. It performs sweeping slashes with elegant precision.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME put on a tough act and command baby Pokémon to do what they say. However, it will resort to fleeing if the parents come to protect the young.
Author: Dusknoir64

Entry: Golden sands swirl like flames within POKENAME's translucent body. At night, it glows faintly, luring wanderers through the desert.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is said to be extremely tenacious. No matter the enemy or odds, if it challenges something, it can overcome it.
Author: Blazerxz

Entry: It uses its high intelligence to construct devious plans in order to steal objects it desires. It may also use its smarts to foil the plans of other POKENAME that try to steal from it.
Author: doublehockeystickscomics

Entry: POKENAME swims near desert oases, biting at travelers with its enormous jaw. Its presence alone often keeps others far from the water.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME grabs prey with jagged claws and delivers a devastating Crunch. It regularly prefers to attack from beneath shifting sands.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hides deep within frozen caves at sunrise. If approached, it bares its claws and uses Scary Face to drive intruders out.
Author: .izik

Entry: Bone-like wings let POKENAME glide through desert nights. It emits thunderous booms from its ears to disorient foes mid-flight.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME soars through the skies singing in a rumbling baritone until it dive-bombs prey into the desert sands or mountainous soil. After eating its meal, POKENAME must spend hours preening to clean its cloud-like wings of dirt.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: Almost all POKENAME have flirtatious personalities, appearing to charm Pokémon of every species. However, they will always stay loyal to their mate, even if it doesn't seem that way.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: This Pokémon is known as the scourge of the desert. POKENAME hunts for prey regardless of whether it's hungry or not.
Author: scapz

Entry: Due to their lack of agility, POKENAME hunt by burying themselves in sand and using their water cannons to create geysers under their prey.
Author: iamJocheena

Entry: POKENAME  can not only handle intense desert heat and drought, but also spread it with intense solar energy. They resemble an ancient sun deity revered by several ancient civilizations.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: It hides under the sand, waiting for someone to pass by. If disturbed, it will burst from the ground and snap its jaws loudly.
Author: Busilisk

Entry: This little mummy Pokémon always balances on its golden ball. The ball is filled with gunpowder and can easily explode.
Author: zerocipher

Entry: POKENAME is the incarnation of a particularly lavish pharaoh from times long past. If it catches grave robbers, it curses them for all eternity.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME will often place itself next to coffins or altars. Hiding within its egg-shaped shell, it poses as an urn and enjoys scaring mourners.
Author: rihse

Entry: Incredibly defensive of its mask, POKENAME will grab at anyone who dares touch it. The weight of its headpiece makes it incapable of sustained flight.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME often choose to nest near graveyards and assume guard over the deceased residents. These cemeteries are amongst the safest in the world.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: It guards the resting place of ancient kings. Tomb raiders who enter this Pokémon's territory are eternally cursed to see it in their nightmares.
Author: awiralonprime

Entry: POKENAME haunts pyramids and other ancient burial sites in an attempt to eat the golden burial treasures. This is why it is hated by archaeologists.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: A once inanimate statue now haunted by a cursed scroll. It is said that anyone who deciphers the hieroglyphs will fall deathly ill.
Author: ninjakraken

Entry: A lonesome spirit that mourns its death. It is supposedly the pet of a long-forgotten pharaoh.
Author: TheHeroicT

Entry: It has been written that POKENAME has dominion over the dead. It can deduce whether one has a pure or sullied heart with its unusual abilities. Those who are deemed impure and near the end of their lives are attacked.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: A vicious creature that punishes grave robbers by dragging them into a tomb to lay for eternity. It's found inside ancient pyramids.
Author: TheHeroicT

Entry: Although there is no scientific evidence to support it, there are numerous researchers that believe the mask on POKENAME's stomach resembles the faces of humanity's earliest ancestors. Those who touch a POKENAME see flashes of an ancient landscape.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are ancient security devices that were used in burial sites to keep grave robbers trapped forever. Whether they have a soul is unknown.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Scientists believe that POKENAME was brought to life through dark rituals. It protects the urns of particularly powerful ancient pharaohs.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME disguises as a gold-plated crook to catch would-be grave robbers. It hooks them by the neck and drains them of their life force.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: A cruel pharaoh's spirit possessed its old body, creating POKENAME. It utilizes shadow illusions in combat to confuse and conquer.
Author: Yoshimon

Entry: Myths state this Pokémon is the spirit of a long dead dragon that has returned through possessing its treasures from its lifetime.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME tempt unsuspecting tomb raiders into its domain with illusions of their desires.  Once enticed, POKENAME uses its ghostly limbs to squeeze the life force out of them.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: Supposedly, it's an ancient security drone created by paranoid pharaohs. It emits high pitched frequencies when it spots an intruder before attacking.
Author: TheHeroicT

Entry: POKENAME guards ancient ruins, diligently defending them from would-be robbers. Their bites curse foes with a sense of fear.
Author: Eye Of Cthulhu

Entry: A long-deceased defender of ancient waterways, POKENAME buries itself in the riverbed and waits for polluters. Its bite inflicts a deadly curse.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME resides in mountain tombs, protecting them from grave robbers. Should it encounter one, it will consume their soul and mummify their body.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME live as dancers for exceptionally rich citizens. When fed gold nuggets, their dance will become mesmerizing.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME's body is made of solid gold that is easily damaged. It'll lay a powerful curse on those who harm it or steal from it.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME judge the souls of those who have died. If they are pure, then they are guided to the afterlife. If they are corrupt, the souls become sand.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: Found in deserts, it is believed it contains the soul of a ruler from ancient times. It commands certain Pokémon to build its body.
Author: HoundRyS

Entry: Some say that POKENAME contains remnants of the spirit of a Lycanroc that was worshipped as a deity in ancient times.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: Archeologists discovered POKENAME in an ancient tomb many years ago. Under the blazing sun it appears to only be a clay sculpture, but during cool desert nights it's said that spirits can be found circled around it performing a long forgotten ritual.
Author: Kianjp2008

Entry: POKENAME ambushes and poisons grave robbers. It rewards behaving Trainers with riches. Some of these riches are worth millions.
Author: planatical

Entry: POKENAME is an evil spirit that has been encased in a man-made shell. POKENAME despises humans for trapping it.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: The tongue extending from its mouth is made of tightly entwined silk. This sticky appendage helps it cling to surfaces and capture prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: It drills into solar panels and weaves webbing inside to absorb electricity. This behavior has caused issues at solar farms near mountain ranges.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its body is cloaked in translucent silk, and each vine is coated with nearly invisible webbing. These webs are both sticky and surprisingly strong.
Author: .izik

Entry: A tailor in Brussel Town designs elegant hats with its silk. These hats are popular during spring festivals for their lightweight feel.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its bright coloring is a warning to potential aggressors. If provoked, POKENAME can fly circles around its foes while using its surprisingly strong arms to strike.
Author: sivanandi

Entry: It loves turning into a power cord and plugging itself into an outlet, resulting in it consuming a lot of electricity. Trainers caring for POKENAME are advised to baby-proof their outlets to prevent this from happening.
Author: pokebio

Entry: A shop in Luxuria Town specializes in bug nets crafted from its web. These nets are popular for their durability and fine mesh.
Author: .izik

Entry: It digs up power lines to chew on the insulation. This habit often causes electrical surges in rural areas.
Author: .izik

Entry: A weaver in Emeragrove Town creates socks from its silk. The socks are celebrated for their unique ability to repel static electricity.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its silk is laid over flowerbeds to suppress weed growth. Gardeners in small towns rely on it to protect their plants.
Author: .izik

Entry: The cotton-like tufts from POKENAME carry a faint static charge. These fibers cling to surfaces, aiding it in creating complex webs.
Author: .izik

Entry: The tip of its horn has tiny, wall-crawling legs. It suspends itself from ceilings before ambushing prey with an expertly aimed web.
Author: .izik

Entry: It carries its young in the pouch on its belly. If there is nothing in its pouch, it will adopt and carry any Pokémon or Egg that will fit.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: It flings webbing from its tail to ensnare foes. Once trapped, it shocks them with a powerful jolt of electricity.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its glowing eyes allow it to see perfectly in the dark, making nighttime raids on farm plots easy. It can strip an entire field of crops overnight.
Author: .izik

Entry: It hurls sticky balls of webbing at foes to ensnare them. Once immobilized, the prey is left vulnerable to its electric attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lives in the tallest trees it can find. It connects itself to said trees and absorbs the nutrients that the tree takes up.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: To fight, POKENAME will rapidly circle around a foe, spinning electrified thread around them. When the foe is unable to move, POKENAME attacks them viciously with punches and kicks.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: A tailor in Nimbasa Town crafts hair ties using its silk. The ties are praised for their durability and soft texture.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is the perfect symbiosis. The living part catches prey with electric webs, while the banished part provides strong, forbidden energy.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It uses its sturdy body to assist with electrical work in hurricane-prone areas. Its silk helps stabilize power lines and prevent outages.
Author: .izik

Entry: A seamstress in Vertress City makes raincoats with its silk, infused with its venom. The coats are waterproof and surprisingly resistant to damage.
Author: .izik

Entry: Shops in Camelia Town use its silk to create durable skirts. The material is highly sought after for its strength and flexibility.
Author: .izik

Entry: It scales lit street signs along highways to absorb electricity. These nocturnal climbs often disrupt nearby lighting systems.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has a venomous bite, but it isn't dangerous unless you have an allergy. It taunts spider Pokémon by plucking at their webs with its feelers.
Author: wigglypon

Entry: It spends the entire day in place charging itself up with electricity. At night, it goes on a rampage with its swarm, feeding on any unlucky prey.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: A weaver in Astilbe Town uses its silk to craft protective vests. These vests are prized by miners for their durability and comfort.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can attach itself to other living creatures or electrical devices to suck out all their energy within a very short time. It then jumps to a new host to repeat the process.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME like to nest in temples, where they are well received because they generate light at night and catch other Bug Pokémon. Some even believe that they keep evil spirits away with their radiant light.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It stands as a sentinel near shipping docks, throwing its web to secure drifting debris. Sailors trust it to keep waterways clear and safe.
Author: .izik

Entry: It weaves its web onto a ring so it can carry it around as it moves. It can catch bugs in the air with its web, using it like a net.
Author: greystorm101

Entry: Researchers have infrequently observed Pokémon climbing into the web created by POKENAME to sleep. These papers are often accompanied by a warning.
Author: fixthewifi

Entry: It spits webs onto foes using its beak, immobilizing them. It then unleashes a powerful Ember to roast its prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: The friction of its wings generates enough energy to create shocking webs. Its body becomes hot enough to engulf anyone who touches it in flames.
Author: cheroace

Entry: The legs on its head are used to weave silk into intricate patterns. These patterns are often admired for their artistic beauty.
Author: .izik

Entry: The electricity filling POKENAME's body makes it unable to sit still for long. Its webs always end up messy due to its short attention-span.
Author: fouguri

Entry: Its electric web keeps gears in power plants running smoothly. Engineers rely on its high conductivity and lightweight consistency.
Author: .izik

Entry: It will attach itself to other Pokémon to gather electricity. Once charged, it ambitiously tries to snare its ride with webs, often unsuccessfully.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Electricians incorporate its silk into power lines for tall buildings. The material's incredible strength ensures long-lasting stability.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME carries a giant crystal that holds a strong magnetic charge like those found in Unova. It uses this gem as a battery to unleash its electric powers.
Author: Atlas333

Entry: Having grown beyond its icy shell, a POKENAME is reborn as an unnerving creature. Most are unable to stand its sight for long.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: POKENAME collects prey that it especially likes as trophies in its den, wrapped in electric threads. In folk tales, it's also called "The Collector".
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It's said to manipulate ghostly forces with its many eyes. Researchers have discarded electromagnetism as the explanation for its floating.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: POKENAME lies in wait for prey to stumble into its electrified webs. It is perceptive, and hears exactly when it must swoop down and finish the job.
Author: NellNast42

Entry: It fires large globs of webbing coated in Stun Spore at foes. This tactic paralyzes prey, allowing it to capture them with ease.
Author: .izik

Entry: It spreads its sticky silk across the water's surface to reel in floating ship debris. It will eat debris regardless of what it is.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are fiercely protective of those they consider family. Using their tails, they spin electrically charged webs to slow foes or create shocking barriers around those they guard.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: It spits webs at lightposts to climb closer to the light source. After reaching the top, it rubs its snout against the bulb, absorbing its heat and energy.
Author: .izik

Entry: A merchant in Daybreak Town crafts scarves from its silk. The scarves are known for their soft texture and ability to retain warmth.
Author: .izik

Entry: Though it appears stone-like, its exterior is composed of tightly woven silk. This silk is remarkably resilient against physical attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: It channels its electric power through its pendulum. The charged pendulum emits a faint glow, entrancing nearby foes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME stores electrical energy in the fur on its arms. In combat, it will clamp onto its opponents with its powerful pincers, then shock them with over 15,000 volts of electricity.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: When transforming into an enemy, the vines on its body pulsate rhythmically. This motion redirects nutrients and fluids to aid in its transformation.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME sticks to the ceiling of damp caves, absorbing nutrients. It drops on water types, wrapping its arms around them to drain water for food.
Author: thybrodiebyronbrown

Entry: Its wings are immeasurably strong as they are able to keep POKENAME airborne despite its metal exterior. The barbs hanging from its stomach can extend to club opponents below it.
Author: EvilGammon

Entry: POKENAME hunts by latching onto prey with the three prehensile claws on its tail. Once it gets a grip, it then uses its tail to savagely impale its victim on the sharp spines on its back.
Author: .onionpug

Entry: The thorn on the top of its head holds the most nutrients. When ground up, it is used in the creation of X Attack and X Accuracy supplements.
Author: .izik

Entry: The metal tips of its tail-like vines pulsate with magnetic energy. When disturbed, it releases a powerful Thunder Shock to deter threats.
Author: .izik

Entry: The ends of POKENAME's tails are closed buds. In spring, they bloom into beautiful yellow flowers.
Author: OhOk3441

Entry: POKENAME can inflate its body outwards, allowing its thorn-like protrusions to form a shield. Thanks to this, it is incredibly risky to attack.
Author: p0opys0ck123abc

Entry: The metallic object attached to its vine resembles a spinning top. It coordinates its attacks with the top's movements, using the momentum to enhance its strikes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its mace-like tail to ferociously crush foes. It follows up a blow from its tail with furious slashing until the foe stops moving.
Author: HummusIsHome

Entry: POKENAME sinks its five spiked feelers into cave walls to absorb nutrients. When threatened, it lashes them to defend itself. If exhausted or badly injured, it emerges outside to bask in sunlight, healing through photosynthesis as it sleeps.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: The long, tail-like vine protruding from its rear can be wielded like a whip to dispatch foes. Its precision and power make it a fearsome weapon.
Author: .izik

Entry: If trespassers enter its territory, it transforms into their likeness. While they are confused, it attacks with a flurry of barbed spikes, forcing them to flee.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lives in gloomy caves, attached to the ceiling. If a careless visitor enters its territory, it suddenly drops down and abducts them.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The tips of its vine-like legs are magnetized, allowing it to attach to metallic surfaces. This adaptation gives it an advantage in industrial environments.
Author: .izik

Entry: If startled, a POKENAME will wrap its vines around its foe and torch them with its flaming limbs. Its steel shell was once used to make cookware.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: It sleeps near jungle ruins, defending the tombs of ancient rulers. Its vinelike arms can extend up to 40 feet, delivering devastating punches to intruders.
Author: .izik

Entry: While resting, it extends its vines to nearby tree limbs, hanging high above the forest floor. If disturbed, it unleashes a Fire Spin to trap its foe before escaping.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME pulls itself taut in a Y shape and waits. When it sees prey, it launches itself headfirst and bites down with enough force to break bone.
Author: darxer_

Entry: Sailors hate wild POKENAME, and for good reason. Bringing a ship within its territory nearly guarantees a damaged or even broken hull.
Author: sivanandi

Entry: Using the metal it gathers and its own spines, POKENAME creates a giant spiked wheel. It uses said wheel to fight from afar or block attacks.
Author: Hexx_Vixtar

Entry: When POKENAME grinds its teeth, it fires steel spikes from its body. POKENAME uses its psychic powers to control the spikes' trajectory.
Author: darkweavile428

Entry: POKENAME possess a steel shell that leaves them nearly impervious to harm. The weight of the shell makes their movements cumbersome, but tendrils that sprout from their back help them to navigate even the roughest terrain.
Author: Katie

Entry: The plant-like maces it wields are adorned with platinum spikes. Using its telekinetic powers, it throws and redirects them with incredible accuracy.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon uses its many spiky tendrils to clamber across walls, floors, and ceilings. When it's in the right place, it strikes.
Author: HoundRyS

Entry: The thorny bush growing from its neck produces sweet and nutritious berries. Pastry chefs in Snowpoint City use these berries to craft exquisite tarts.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME resides in dark areas, hiding away in corners to avoid contact with others. The only exception is lost children, who find themselves guided to safety by the light of POKENAME's candle.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME roam around old gravesites, licking everything in the area, from gravestones to nearby trees, and even the dirt it walks on. If someone is licked by their waxy tongue, the victim will feel deeply and unnaturally unsettled, even its Trainer.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Whenever POKENAME gets emotional, it erupts into an inferno. Witnessing the explosion is said to be soul-altering. POKENAME is an endangered species.
Author: King_Creepsta

Entry: It flits through forests, lighting the path for lost hikers. This is not an act of kindness, as POKENAME lure hikers into their nests.
Author: kandyman

Entry: Because of the perpetual flame in its stomach, POKENAME are always hungry. They can eat for days on end and still feel like they're starving.
Author: BlitzyDragon

Entry: POKENAME lures its prey with flickering flames. Its eerie glow and insatiable hunger make it a feared predator in murky waters.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: While the flame on a POKENAME's head serves as a channel for draining vital energy, inexperienced POKENAME tend to emit it instead.
Author: tuneless.towa

Entry: POKENAME sleep during the day to gather sunlight to fuel their psychic flames. Staring at the flame for too long will put you under its control.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Many Trainers use it to light up dark caves instead of Litwick, as POKENAME can light up larger spaces. It guides lost Houndour to safety.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: As its body is made of wax, it can squeeze through any crack. The flame that blazes on its tail is said to bring disaster to anyone who touches it.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME instinctually seek out a master to train with. The position is unenviable, as they are known to be demanding, capricious students with little control over the fire on their bodies.
Author: dylonk25

Entry: When it spins rapidly, its limbs fling hot melted wax that singe targets. Those burned by the wax are said to be marked by POKENAME, so that it can find them and drain their life force no matter where they go.
Author: sk372

Entry: The purple flames that POKENAME emits are supposedly impossible to extinguish, and burn until there is nothing left of the ignited object.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Guiding with its eerie light, POKENAME saps life from its unsuspecting followers. It wanders mountains, luring challengers with its sinister flame.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME form within long-abandoned power plants, drawing energy from derelict machines and engines. Engineers decommissioning these facilities often report eerie blue lights deep in the dark corridors and halls.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME has a flickering purple flame atop its head that lights up whenever its happy and in a playful mood. It can ignite small sparks and flames, using its fire to spread its cheerful spirit.
Author: ThePandaSharky

Entry: Lit with everlasting flames, POKENAME leads stray humans and Pokémon to their doom. It leaves waxy trails behind as it goes.
Author: _sadfroggy

Entry: POKENAME are given to modern-day nobles to serve as servants. These Pokémon play with other Ghost-type Pokémon when they aren't working!
Author: skleegamer

Entry: POKENAME is sensitive to living beings. Their energy causes it to slowly melt. For this reason, it scares others away from its home using magnetic fields.
Author: Salt

Entry: Now that it has a second brain, it starts pursuing life force. However, this makes its flame burn much brighter, slowing it down considerably. It can detect life force from 60 miles away.
Author: Salt

Entry: POKENAME are generally stuck to the ground due to their melted body. They attract their prey using the light on their head, which they now control using their psyche.
Author: Salt

Entry: During evolution, the heat from its candle is contained. This allows its waxy body to solidify.
Author: jpeggio

Entry: Its fiery jaw has a mind of its own and will chomp at anything to consume its victims' souls. Despite this, the main body is oddly friendly and wanders toward Trainers it likes.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It is said that eating food cooked over a POKENAME's flame will cause you to have vivid dreams of ancient, prehistoric oceans.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Despite its appearance, the wax of POKENAME is quite durable. When angry, its flames will burn twice as fast, so it must replenish the wax frequently.
Author: darxer_

Entry: The ghostly energy surrounding POKENAME is actually a thin electrical field that is prickly to the touch. When alarmed, its large eyes will brighten like flashlights.
Author: darxer_

Entry: This Pokémon has been known to change the shape of its hat, as the wax is warm enough to be malleable. The shape won't stay for long though - heat from the flame will melt it back to its drooped shape.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: POKENAME happily clutches its gathered keys, but its waxy limbs cannot hold them for long, eventually dripping to the ground. It panics and scrambles to pick them back up to calm itself, starting the cycle anew.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's wax tends to melt extremely fast, resulting in its eyes being covered up. It'll rub its face against nearby surfaces to then scrape it off.
Author: typhloquil

Entry: A highly intelligent Pokémon, POKENAME uses the lore surrounding Latios to entice curious Pokémon and humans to approach. It then keeps them close by displaying a docile nature, but all the while, its eerie purple flame saps their life force.
Author: Arcul

Entry: The heat from its body causes the newly formed wax to melt. Due to this, it is constantly in immense agony.
Author: Display name: .jpg   Username: jpeggio

Entry: POKENAME lies in wait for prey to fall into its maw. It then snaps its jaws shut and cooks its prey with flames fueled by the victim's own life force.
Author: nvisionluminous

Entry: POKENAME are playful, almost childlike Pokémon that help guide those who lost their lives at sea to the afterlife. Their purple scales shine at night.
Author: Yoshimon

Entry: POKENAME can be found floating eerily motionless in abandoned factories, dripping wax onto the floor. Somehow, it never completely melts away.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: This Pokémon drifts gently through the air, drawn to negative feelings. Its flame grows larger and brighter the stronger the surrounding emotions are.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME floats eerily in old abandoned mansions, a melted wax core within flickering flames. Should it meet a trainer, the flames will mold the wax into a facsimile of the human's face, twisted in an expression of fear.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME appears to be fossilized remains reanimated by haunted candle wax. With every breath it flares up a flickering flame from its nose; the larger the flame the more aggressive its current mood.
Author: sk372

Entry: A friendly creature of the night, POKENAME has trouble finding homes due to the stench it emanates being akin to burning refuse. It mostly finds company in small insects drawn to its flames and its odor.
Author: sk372

Entry: Using the flames on its head, it lures unsuspecting prey in whilst draining its energy. Once a victim is weak enough, it swallows them whole.
Author: hypernovaHusky

Entry: It guides Pokémon though the ocean, draining their life force all the while. When the Pokémon passes away, POKENAME consumes their corpse.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: The putrid smell POKENAME emits is worsened by the fire atop its head. It is aware of this and will extinguish its flame until needed in battle.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME flies in the skies singing a harmonious melody. Its song draws other Pokémon in, and it absorbs the life force out of them.
Author: Deciduowl

Entry: Bug-type Pokémon lured by the flames on POKENAME's antennae are trapped in the trail of melted wax it leaves behind. POKENAME returns later to feed on their life force.
Author: PotatoForged

Entry: As it travels, it leaves a trail of wax which soon hardens. Those who walk on the trail have their vitality slowly drained by the POKENAME up ahead.
Author: wigglypon

Entry: Its skin secretes a waxy substance, which it can fling in globs to immobilize prey. POKENAME then drains the life force of its helpless victim.
Author: wigglypon

Entry: Litwick's ghostly flame caused the mysterious energy coursing through Regice to ignite upon fusion, leaving POKENAME constantly melting.
Author: Phantom640

Entry: According to folklore, POKENAME was formed when the last flicker of a candle was imbued with a wandering spirit. Its waxy body can reshape itself to mimic various candle designs, making it nearly indistinguishable from ordinary objects.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: When they're bout to die, POKENAME will be seen melting wax all over lawns, streets, and gardens. They do this as their wax acts as seeds to grow new POKENAME.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: Despite its body being made of wax, it is incredibly strong. The wax hardens as it trains through exercise, operating eerily similar to muscle tissue.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: This Pokémon is notoriously difficult to pin down due to the wax that makes up its body. Once POKENAME has pinned a foe into submission, it absorbs their mass into its wax body, allowing the wick on its head to burn brighter and longer.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME's waxy body slowly melts off over its lifetime. You can determine a POKENAME's age from how skinny it is.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME is said to appear to those grieving a recent loss, offering a comforting yet unsettling presence. Some believe the Pokémon guides lost souls, while others fear it leads them into the depths of their sorrow.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: A glowing, molten wax ethereally floats within the translucent horns of POKENAME. Urban legend says that whoever sees the lights of a POKENAME on a cold night will soon die.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: When happy, POKENAME's tail glows with intense light. Its mane dances like fire but remains cool to the touch.
Author: .izik

Entry: As it gathers the energy to evolve from a pupa, it begins glowing from within. Groves of dozens of glowing POKENAME are an eerie sight at night.
Author: sporkwizard

Entry: If one wanders too close to their nest, groups of POKENAME will use their enchanting lights to lure the hapless traveler deep into the woods instead.
Author: sporkwizard

Entry: Contrary to superstition that it appears when someone is about to die, POKENAME is carefree and mostly harmless. Found in marshlands, it lounges, keeping a watchful eye over the evening antics of younger Pokémon.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: Mysterious flames burn from within the nearly flat faces of POKENAME, creating a glow beneath them as light reflects off their caps. They float around ancient caves, illuminating runes of civilizations lost to time.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME hangs from cave ceilings by hidden threads. As it dreams, the flame within pulses rapidly, casting strange shadows.
Author: .izik
