Entry: It constantly creates purple flames in its body. These cause a pale light, which POKENAME can radiate evenly using the lampshade on its head.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME are highly skilled necromancers, capable of bending life and death energy to their will. It is said that befriending one can grant eternal life.
Author: KLGB76

Entry: POKENAME lingers around the feeble, wicking away their spirits as they pass on. It uses them to fuel the fire in its belly.
Author: _sadfroggy

Entry: POKENAME burns with a fierce glow, a spectral candle in its head that can illuminate a wide area. Known for its fighting instincts, it charges at foes with blazing ghostly attacks, igniting the battlefield in its wake.
Author: ThePandaSharky

Entry: This Pokémon floats around, collecting energy from living beings. They are attracted to other POKENAME due to their strong magnetic powers.
Author: Salt

Entry: Some have claimed to have seen POKENAME appear to their loved ones the night before they passed. However, this is purely superstition.
Author: jpeggio

Entry: POKENAME leaps through treetops with fiery agility. It roasts Nanab Berries over its tail before eating them mid-jump.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME appears at the sites of concluded battles to collect the spirits of fallen soldiers. They shine brilliantly during wartime.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Several POKENAME will form a trail to lead lost travellers further into the desert. They then wait for the victim to pass on to absorb their spirit.
Author: DuskRD

Entry: POKENAME's wingbeats kick up heat hazes that cause weary travelers to faint. It then feeds on their spirits to further fuel its flames.
Author: nvisionluminous

Entry: POKENAME prefers dark rooms, where it floats motionlessly in the shadows slowly rotating. People who stumble upon it are often frightened, as all they see are its glowing eyes staring back at them in the dark.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: The flame inside POKENAME burns hotter as it sleeps, causing the goo encasing it to bubble and shimmer with heat.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME dangles from pine trees in deep forests, its purple flame flickering. Travelers often mistake them for ghost lights.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's tusks burn with violet flame, which it uses to carve symbols into trees. These glowing marks warn others of its territory.
Author: .izik

Entry: It appears to those who get lost at night, beckoning them to follow it to the afterlife. POKENAME will take them there by force if they decline.
Author: HummusIsHome

Entry: This Pokémon has a grisly attraction to humans about to pass away. It stalks lost hikers to freeze and absorb the souls of its poor victims.
Author: tr3bles

Entry: POKENAME consumes airborne pollutants to fuel its fiery attacks. If the flames become too hot, however, POKENAME's glass body will start to melt, causing it to become deformed and misshapen.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Lampent's iron body made for the perfect casing for POKENAME upon fusion, allowing it to control the ghostly flame inside it without melting. However, its full power still remains untapped.
Author: Phantom640

Entry: Its body glows with a light that attracts large swarms of nocturnal insects. Those that approach have their vitality rapidly drained by the POKENAME.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Curiously this Pokémon only eats things that have already been burnt to a crisp. They will hide in ovens to feast on the burnt remains of food inside.
Author: Rockageddon

Entry: The plating on POKENAME's head is used as a ram. In addition, the purple flame on its back warms POKENAME up and allows it to attack with heat.
Author: Shado_.w

Entry: A POKENAME is able to cut through anything with its searing flames. Only the body is left behind, as it even cleaves the spirit.
Author: Symile

Entry: It mirrors the reflections it sees, becoming an eerie mimic of its surroundings. This strange duplication often confuses even the most observant Pokémon.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its ghostly flames are fueled by the ashes of the bodies its electrocuted. It uses the remaining spirit to generate its terrifying electricity.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: The flame it produces refracts brilliantly off its stained-glass-like wings. It's said the sight can entice anyone to follow it, even to their doom.
Author: sporkwizard

Entry: POKENAME consumes the spirits of evil people, sparing those who are pure of heart. Seeing one is said to be a sign of bad luck.
Author: bee4082

Entry: POKENAME is often mistaken for an ornament due to its small size, and it is said to bring misfortune to any home it inhabits, though no one knows why.
Author: pokebio

Entry: POKENAME rush by their foes with their freezing flames trailing behind them, creating an inferno that completely surrounds their target in a few seconds. Anyone caught in these mystical flames will be slowly frozen until their spirit is stolen away.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME carries a candelabra with up to 9 candles on it. It's said that people who guess which candle will last the longest may receive a gift.
Author: Jaycielantern

Entry: When POKENAME howls, it remembers deceased Pokémon. Its flames burn brighter in places with more wandering spirits.
Author: mrbapcik

Entry: Its sturdy glass shell restrains the full force of its fury. If it were to shatter, POKENAME could raze entire towns clean.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME's venom can cause a burning sensation all over the bite area. Doctors have been looking into finding an antivenom since POKENAME's discovery.
Author: JesterSqueak

Entry: Its transparent upper body glows purple when POKENAME emits its spirit flames. Anyone hit by them is cursed and doomed to death.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: At night, it saves lost souls, lighting their way home with a gentle flame. Its warmth offers comfort and protection to those it encounters.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME form in the ruins of homes that have been abandoned due to fire damage. They harbour a deep resentment and anger at humans, blaming them all for the destruction of what had once been their homes.
Author: Katie

Entry: It sparks with lightning, discharging electrical bolts alongside bursts of flame. The combination of fire and electricity makes it an unpredictable opponent.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME enchants its target with the dance of its icy flames, to ambush its prey with the rest of the group. POKENAME feeds on the spirit of its prey, leaving only the frozen body behind.
Author: yuma5054

Entry: It devours malachite, storing the minerals to fuel its glowing flame. The green stones seem to enhance its fire, making it burn with an unusual intensity.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is a fierce fighter cloaked in spectral flames. Its intense love for battle drives it to unleash scorching ghostly attacks on its opponents. The flame of a POKENAME is bright enough to fully illuminate a dark room.
Author: ThePandaSharky

Entry: POKENAME is known to inhabit decrepit and abandoned castles. It specifically prefers the ballrooms, where it will dance somberly for days by itself.
Author: captainmodeus

Entry: Their flames keep them afloat while they focus their vision on prey. POKENAME are said to hold souls in their eyeball until they combine with another POKENAME.
Author: Salt

Entry: POKENAME absorbs spirits through its arms to use as energy for psychic powers. It is said that their flames change colors to reflect their energy levels. It hurls objects around at rapid speeds using its psychokinesis.
Author: Salt

Entry: Their glass heads are used to burn spirits that POKENAME captures with fire. They use their psychic powers to appear as chandeliers to catch their prey unaware and use them to fuel their flames.
Author: Salt

Entry: Those that write their names on POKENAME's papers are said to have their souls taken away.
Author: Inksans201x

Entry: Contact with a POKENAME's fiery locks is said to not only burn one's body, but also scar one's spirit. It can sense when a being has done so before.
Author: fixthewifi

Entry: POKENAME are often seen lurking around hospitals. In many cases, this is followed with someone passing away.
Author: jpeggio

Entry: It sits motionless for hours at a time, waiting for prey to be attracted by its flame. When a victim gets close, its jaws snap shut around them.
Author: wigglypon

Entry: POKENAME is a brawler of great renown in its habitat. It vows to always be there for its tribe in times of need. Few can match the strength it has.
Author: the_smirker

Entry: POKENAME's flame creates illusory images unique to each of its victims, such as the face of a deceased loved one, before it consumes their spirit.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME is thought to be the reaper of long-lived kings who have otherwise cheated death. Duels with this Pokémon mark the end of many tales.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME commands groups of Litiard to drain the life energy from its prey. POKENAME then burns the prey's sprit, leaving the body behind.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: Despite the unbreakable glass of its paws, it always walks silently. After a battle is over, POKENAME will settle down and pray for the fate of its defeated opponents.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: It radiates intense heat, leaving burns on anything that comes too close. Even metal melts under its fiery aura, making it a dangerous guardian of its territory.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME feeds on the wanderers who lose themselves in the desert. Its wings, burning with the souls of the lost, shriek horrifically as it flies.
Author: nvisionluminous

Entry: POKENAME is revered in the arts for its elegant beauty. Its colorful scale patterns inspire the stained-glass windows of churches.
Author: NellNast42

Entry: POKENAME draws its strength and beauty from the gratitude of the souls taken to the afterlife by it. Its head, transparent and squishy as its tail, gains a darker tone and a harder texture like its body when it's time to battle.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME draws its strength and beauty from the gratitude of the souls taken to the afterlife by it. Its head, transparent and squishy as its tail, gains a darker tone and a harder texture like its body when it's time to battle.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: It is said that exposure to POKENAME's flames will cause one to experience visions of the afterlife. These are just its illusions, however.
Author: NellNast42

Entry: The mask it wears conceals its intentions. By waving its fiery feelers, it casts will-o-wisps which pass through foes' bodies and scorch their souls.
Author: wigglypon

Entry: Those within its vicinity are drawn towards it. Once its prey is close, POKENAME will siphon away its memories and emotions to be burnt as fuel.
Author: .crystallization

Entry: It drains the opponent's will to fight while in combat, fueling its own fire. At the height of a battle, its flames become uncontrollable and can be felt from a distance.
Author: bacondlx

Entry: A noble's flower garden burned down when his chandelier fell. The noble's sorrow caused the birth of POKENAME, who now protects flowers from fire.
Author: Shiina Valkyria (W)

Entry: POKENAME is often found in haunted castle gardens. It usually stays still, but it will mercilessly attack those who tamper with the garden's plants.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: These Pokémon dance in groups of four when midnight strikes. It is rumored that it dances with the wisps of its previous lives.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: POKENAME form in the ruins of homes that have been abandoned due to fire damage. They harbour a deep resentment and anger at humans, blaming them all for the destruction of what had once been their homes.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME absorbs and stores static electricity from the air around it. It is able to produce an intensely bright light when at full capacity.
Author: trainerrobo

Entry: Its flames glisten like molten glass, reflecting light in mesmerizing patterns. This shimmering glow attracts prey into its deadly trap.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME resides in ghost towns it created. Hospitals and Pokémon Centers have special procedures for dealing with POKENAME.
Author: CodeWolfie

Entry: Its flame burns with a spicy scent, which grows stronger with every flicker. This unusual aroma wards off enemies, though some Pokémon find it strangely enticing.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its flame sometimes burns dimly as it ages, flickering weakly like an old lantern. Despite its faint light, it patrols tirelessly, watching over abandoned ruins.
Author: .izik

Entry: On clear nights, POKENAME soars through the sky, casting an eerie purple glow. Rumors say that if you stare directly into its flames, it will slowly burn your soul away.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME are known for schooling in small groups in the depths of the sea. They use their glowing ability to draw in small prey, but this also attracts predators.
Author: JesterSqueak

Entry: POKENAME waits outside of hospitals for spirits to pass. Sometimes POKENAME will sap the hospital's power to speed up the process.
Author: CodeWolfie

Entry: When POKENAME's fiery tusks lunge into a foe, both the spirit and body is harmed. POKENAME competes with others of its kind for food and territory.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It flies swiftly through the night, leaving trails of flickering lights in its wake. These lights disorient prey, making it easier to capture them.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME haunts the darkest corners with flickering flames and glowing gems. Its eerie gaze leaves those who encounter it trembling in the darkness.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: It makes its home in mountain caves, where it illuminates the dark passages with dim violet flames. These caves stay eerily quiet, as few dare approach it.
Author: .izik

Entry: Fables say this Pokémon's flame freeze-burns the spirit. Some say that if you feel a chilling sensation in the heat, that is most likely a POKENAME taking your soul.
Author: tr3bles

Entry: If you suddenly feel warmth amid a blizzard and see a figure with a light, do not approach it! It is a POKENAME, and it will steal your soul.
Author: tr3bles

Entry: POKENAME haunt abandoned mansions disguised as chandeliers. Unlucky visitors who fall into their traps have their bodies frozen and their souls burnt.
Author: tr3bles

Entry: When a soul meets misshapen chandeliers, they unite and form a POKENAME. Anything it burns with its torch will smell like musk for three weeks.
Author: gurguro

Entry: During thunderstorms, it rides on violent winds, glowing brighter with every flash of lightning. It thrives in the chaos, feeding off the storm's energy.
Author: .izik

Entry: It drifts through night skies, illuminating the clouds with a haunting glow. Many believe it watches over travelers, guiding them through the dark.
Author: .izik

Entry: Now with its full power unlocked, POKENAME can focus the ethereal flame inside it using its crystalline body to unleash devastating attacks that chill the body and soul to their very core.
Author: Phantom640

Entry: It appears suddenly at night, charging lone Trainers at a full sprint. It is said that if it tackles you, you will be dragged into the netherworld.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Wild POKENAME are usually found in the remains of a sunken cruise ship. It is known to put curses on any boats it spots.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: Rumors have circulated of a mysterious phantom ship sailing late at night. It's believed that POKENAME creates this illusion to lure unsuspecting sailors to their watery grave.
Author: BigNasty717

Entry: The fire-like substance that appears on POKENAME is actually water, not fire. It is believed to be held in shape by spectral energy.
Author: frostedwyrm

Entry: POKENAME refines its deadly toxin using intense heat, creating a rare ingredient used in perfumes. Some believe wearing this scent makes them lucky.
Author: .izik

Entry: It's flames turn have become a purpleish green due to large amounts of copper sulfate in its genetic makeup.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: POKENAME is said to be inhabited by countless spirits living inside its body, each tied to a different room inside its structure. Its windows flicker with ghostly lights, and faint whispers can be heard if you listen closely.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: POKENAME's yowls echo through the halls of abandoned mansions. Its flames grow brighter as it approaches a Pokémon it is hunting.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: This Pokémon invades dreams, casting eerie lights that mesmerize sleepers. Those touched by its glow often experience vivid, otherworldly visions.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can recall the knowledge it had in both life and afterlife. It has been spotted at funerals where it absorbs the knowledge of a person's life, and leaves a candle at graves it deems especially interesting.
Author: Getsu

Entry: Its body is encased in thick glass, magnifying the glow of its inner flame. This glassy armor reflects light in dazzling patterns, making it both beautiful and dangerous to approach.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can control how poisonous its gas is at will. Its black arms are also made of poisonous gas, just not the same kind of gas as the rest.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Firefighters revere this Pokémon for its ability to extinguish dangerous blazes. Its flames are said to burn in reverse, absorbing heat instead of spreading it.
Author: .izik

Entry: Glaring an ominous stare, POKENAME is adamant about bringing a dignified death to its defeated opponents. However, after POKENAME leaves with that weight on its soul, the victim always survives, somehow.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME dances with swift twirls and rapid darting movements, moving with surprising speed for its size. The blades around its neck are used as a defence mechanism, cutting through almost anything they come into contact with.
Author: Katie

Entry: Despite their appearance, POKENAME are actually very docile and incredibly kind to strangers.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: POKENAME loves playing executioner. It creates dolls out of clay and decapitates them with its axe, but cries and gets sensitive when it really has to hurt someone.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: It uses its natural blades to clip branches and scrape bark from tree trunks, exposing prey underneath. Despite its fearsome appearance, it has a gentle and easygoing temperament.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME is eager to challenge tough-looking opponents to a brawl. It has yet to meet a shield or armor it could not break in one slash.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME is eager to challenge tough-looking opponents to a brawl. It has yet to meet a shield or armor it could not break in one slash.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It constantly sharpens its blades whenever not fighting. In the past, one POKENAME split an entire mountain with a single swing of its body.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: It is said POKENAME guard castles claimed by powerful dragons. Its three, large axes prove an impenetrable obstacle to even the most nimble invaders.
Author: seaslux

Entry: Despite its prehistoric appearance, POKENAME is still very much alive today. It uses its speed and tail to effortlessly cut through forests and prey.
Author: Patch_Bros

Entry: POKENAME hides in old ruins full of treasure. It quietly spins up as its victim approaches, then launches the bladed unit straight at them.
Author: seaslux

Entry: Beware old dungeons and fortresses where POKENAME makes its home. It hangs above narrow pathways and lets its axe swing below to ward off intruders.
Author: seaslux

Entry: POKENAME are usually found deep within caves, protecting large amounts of Axepede larvae.  They can be highly aggressive if threatened.
Author: CutiePierate

Entry: Legends say that POKENAME once commanded entire armies of Pokémon, forcing them to fight for its amusement. It has been seen slashing entire mountains to nothing but rubble.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its fists can break boulders, and the blades on its arms can cut trees down in one swing. Trying to dodge one will cause you to get hit by the other.
Author: gronkissimo

Entry: The blades on its axe come from a rival POKENAME it defeated in ritual combat. This weapon is immensely heavy, preventing others from wielding it.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: When the Shellder bites down on POKENAME's tail, it will thrash around in pain. Its swinging tail can swing with enough force to cleave a telephone pole cleanly in half.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: There are several documented incidents of POKENAME using its sharp axes to tear large parts off the hulls of ships maneuvering through shallow waters.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME are thought to be the last remnants of a civilization lost to time. They wander across the world, longing to find even a trace of their kin's history.
Author: sk372

Entry: It is assumed POKENAME were created by an ancient civilization to serve as caretakers for the sick. It creates egg-shaped medicinal capsules from within its body that are thought to combat any disease.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME was thought to be an ancient civilization's attempt at making guardians able to transform to face any attacker. The eons have degraded its physical form and transformation capabilities.
Author: sk372

Entry: Some say that ancient civilizations created POKENAME to stop raiders. They were designed to only attack if they saw an incoming threat.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME heavy frame trudges silently across rocky beaches, leaving deep prints in the sand. It gathers shoreline trash into the pot on its head, later carrying the load to nearby villages where it gently deposits the waste.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME rests in rivers near ancient tombs, its presence keeping intruders at bay. The cool waters it inhabits are said to enhance one's vitality.
Author: .izik

Entry: It is said that one can see glimpses of their future through the partly-sealed gash on its head. If one is sighted, crowds will gather in droves.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Believed to have been created by an ancient civilization, many researchers are studying POKENAME in hopes of peering into the distant past.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: The runestone on POKENAME's back has an influence on the plant life around it. If the stone is ever damaged, POKENAME will wrap its vines around it to allow it to heal.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME rotates its massive body clockwise while burrowing through the ground. It occasionally disrupts subway tunnels by mistake, causing major delays.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is speculated to be a species of long-lost automaton used by ancient people as vigilant guards for the king they serve.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: In ancient times, POKENAME delivered milk to young children by flying over their heads and spraying milk.
Author: theradrad

Entry: It is said many POKENAME have been incubating the egg in their body for a thousand years. It has never shown any signs of hatching.
Author: Patch

Entry: When distressed, the cracked portion of POKENAME's body glows a bright yellow. Legends warn that staring into this glow curses one's family with terrible luck.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its tail as a weapon, whipping it at foes to unleash powerful bolts of lightning. The electricity is strong enough to scorch the ground.
Author: .izik

Entry: Ancient urns frequently depict POKENAME in various acrobatic poses. Despite its solid frame, it can leap at high speeds, striking foes with swift Ice-type attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is frequently employed in freight yards to move massive canisters. Their strength and efficiency make them invaluable in heavy-duty operations.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's control over auras allows it to completely harness its internal energy. Urban legends say that its punches can exceed mach speed.
Author: _freh

Entry: When trespassers approach the temples it protects, POKENAME summons enormous sandstorms. These storms obscure the sacred grounds, making them nearly impossible to find.
Author: .izik

Entry: Songs are sung that claim these Pokémon are ancient relics from beyond the stars. Always gathering a collection of odd artifacts, these Pokémon share their knowledge and gifts with people in ways known only to them.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME have been found outside the gates and castles of ancient cities. They are assumed to have been designed as intelligent sentries.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME have been found outside the gates and castles of ancient cities. They are assumed to have been designed as intelligent sentries.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME was first discovered the ruins of an ancient civilization. Despite this, its sword and shield still glows with a mysterious energy.
Author: Blazerxz

Entry: Even though POKENAME was created millennia ago, POKENAME is made of technology much more advanced than modern day weaponry.
Author: w1ndowsxp

Entry: POKENAME is thought to have been created by an ancient warrior culture. The myriad blades on its body can be detached to be used as handheld weapons or projectiles.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its large size renders POKENAME slow to attack, but it will hit with devastating strength if it can land a blow. It's rumored that the Pokémon is just a suit of armor, and the real POKENAME is locked away inside.
Author: princess_lucina

Entry: POKENAME lives up in the mountains and will help people who get lost when climbing. In older times, people would race to see whose POKENAME could climb Mt. Moon the fastest.
Author: maximus10k

Entry: POKENAME disguises itself as an explorer to lure unsuspecting intruders into traps. Once their guard is down, it launches a surprise Shadow Ball attack.
Author: .izik

Entry: Researchers believe that POKENAME was created thousands of years ago to protect sacred sites. Its body is filled with sprayable acid.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It's theorized that POKENAME were built millennia ago by a long lost civilization, both as guardian protectors and as tributes to their deity.
Author: Cristata

Entry: It's theorized that POKENAME were built millennia ago by a long lost civilization, both as guardian protectors and as tributes to their deity.
Author: Cristata

Entry: POKENAME is known to move at high speeds when no one sees it. It is known to search for its creator restlessly.
Author: zerocipher

Entry: It weaves intricate webs in the halls of catacombs, capturing any who wander too far. The sticky traps ensure the sanctity of the tomb remains intact.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses its massive fists to gently comb through leaves, checking their health. If it senses sickness, it injects nutrients into the soil to rejuvenate nearby plants.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is regarded as a collectible because of its intricate design. In spite of many rich humans' hopes this Pokémon is horrible at boiling tea. Those who try often suffer burns, as the water immediately evaporates upon being poured into it.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: Bursts of superheated air constantly leak from this Pokémon's body. It has dangerously little control over its own destructive power.
Author: SonicDestroyer12

Entry: Blasts of flames erupt from POKENAME's large palms during battle. These fiery bursts can incinerate entire fields, leaving behind scorched dirt.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME stamps the ground with its massive feet to flatten rugged terrain. It creates paths through canyons, often aiding lost travelers in the process.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can often be found guarding ancient ruins and tombs. They patrol in groups of three, tirelessly ensuring no intruders disturb the sanctity of the area.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME often leaps off high cliffs, activating its jet-like boosters to soar through the air. This behavior is thought to be part of its battle training.
Author: .izik

Entry: The runes on POKENAME's wings help their heavy body levitate. They avoid battling to protect their vulnerable core.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME uses its razor-sharp tusks to fend off intruders near temples it guards. Its blades are so strong they can cleave a pickup truck clean in two.
Author: .izik

Entry: While gliding through the night sky, it ignites fiery jets from its back to propel itself faster. This spectacle is both beautiful and intimidating to those who witness it.
Author: .izik

Entry: An ancient automaton sculpted after a mythical insect, POKENAME struggles to contain the power of sand concealed inside its unstable chest cavity.
Author: NellNast42

Entry: The thin sand inside POKENAME's body is prized by glassmakers. It's often harvested to create intricate chandeliers and other delicate glassworks.
Author: .izik

Entry: Biologists are stumped about how and why the wheel POKENAME is attached to is constantly spinning. Attempts to introduce it to the Klink line have resulted in the poor Steel-types receiving a whirling Dynamic Punch to the face.
Author: sivanandi

Entry: POKENAME roams the ocean depths and surfaces only during storms, drawn to ships in distress. Using the jets on its back, it propels itself through crashing waves, reaching stranded vessels faster than any lifeboat.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Some think POKENAME is a Primeape that transformed itself in order to grow stronger. It will keep fighting even if it crumbles to dust in the process.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: It is thought that POKENAME may possess perfect memory of the lost civilization it supposedly originated from. If so, none so far have chosen to communicate the secrets of these ancient histories.
Author: sk372

Entry: An ancient mechanism allows it to fly several meters into the air. Some archaeologists believe that POKENAME was used as an elevator by its creators.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME has enormous strength. However, it is not aggressive in any way and is almost apathetic, so this strength is rarely used.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME has enormous strength. However, it is not aggressive in any way and is almost apathetic, so this strength is rarely used.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The huge boulders that cover POKENAME provide it with excellent protection. At the same time, the added weight makes every move difficult.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME makes its homes among the deserts, constantly and diligently refilling its cracked, leaking body with sand. It's presumed that should its body be fully emptied, it would cease functioning.
Author: sk372

Entry: Should anyone discover its temple, a POKENAME hypnotizes them to erase the memory of its location. Legends say only records written before being hypnotized reveal the temple's secrets.
Author: .izik

Entry: As it floats, it creates small will-o'-the-wisps from its pores. It enjoys manipulating these floating fires into different shapes and patterns to entertain itself and others.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME uses its fan to blow gusts of hot flames at its opponents. Certain cultures have taken a liking to POKENAME and will create outfits mimicking its style.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The smell of the leaf causes many to bring to mind a crackling campfire in the forest. POKENAME will sunbathe at every opportunity.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: POKENAME are a curious sort, often helping Trainers ignite campfires with their flame breath. Once lit, it will chirp and sing a tune that matches the crackle and flicker of the fire.
Author: sk372

Entry: The webs that it spits out are acidic in nature. In the mornings it will look for burnt out campfires and devour the ashes.
Author: .izik

Entry: It has the ability to freely control fire. To look more intimidating, POKEMON makes a trail of fire follow behind it in the sky. As a result, some Bird Keepers confuse it for the legendary Moltres.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Generally shy and skittish, if backed into a corner, POKENAME will fling hot sparks from the tips of its three tails in defense, singeing its would-be attacker before escaping.
Author: sk372

Entry: The locks on its head multiply as it grows older. It can emit will-o-wisps from its hairs and the gems around its neck for self defense.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Its fluffy tail constantly shifts into intricate patterns, resembling arcane symbols. It is said to communicate in riddles of fire, revealing fragments of the past.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME's six tails all have a mind of their own, but they all get along most of the time. When attacked, the tails spew hot embers in every direction.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME produces a pink fire to brings happiness and luck to those who look upon it. It's said that this fusion's Trainer will live for a century.
Author: fouguri

Entry: During harsh winters, POKENAME assists humans by clearing snowy driveways and pathways with its warm, heated paws. Its incredibly soft fur is loved by all fashion-conscious Trainers.
Author: barbienina

Entry: Only the most skilled Trainers can properly train POKENAME. It has an incredibly fiery temper, but if one manages to tame it they are rewarded with a loyal companion.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: POKENAME shoots out will-o-wisps from their mouth. This fire's chemical makeup can melt even heat-resistant material.
Author: deelee2020

Entry: The older a POKENAME grows, the longer its tails will be. It's said that waiting to evolve will cause it to become a stronger than if it evolves at its first opportunity.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: It trains both to better control its fire powers and its physical strength.  Through this training it has begun to master the art of striking with flaming fists and feet.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's cute appearance made it a popular pet choice when it was first discovered. However, a moody disposition coupled with its powers of fire and electricity has soured its reputation in that regard.
Author: sk372

Entry: It gets rid of excess heat by igniting the trio of fluffs on its head before launching the flames upward. Sometimes it makes small pyrotechnic shows for its friends using this ability.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are gentle-natured. They are able to sense the feelings of others by their tails, making them great comfort Pokémon.
Author: zic

Entry: POKENAME inhabit shrines, where they perform tasks to maintain their sacred ground. When threatened, they use their mask to channel powerful flames.
Author: zic

Entry: POKENAME inhabit shrines, where they perform tasks to maintain their sacred ground. When threatened, they use their mask to channel powerful flames.
Author: zic

Entry: POKENAME has a kindhearted demeanor. It uses its flames to create a soothing warmth, easing the pain and discomfort of those it cares for.
Author: zic

Entry: It is rumored that a shrine maiden became POKENAME through a mystical transformation. It now guides others, ensuring that they remain pure.
Author: zic

Entry: POKENAME's blade emits flames which it can control. New tails grow with its experience in battle.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: When POKENAME is born, it only has one tail, but as it ages, its tails split into more. It can use each of its tails as an additional limb.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: Traits of its evolution have begun to spring up in POKENAME, creating more tails and granting it more power. It has a composed and regal demeanor, even as it burns away opponents in battle.
Author: sk372

Entry: This lonely Pokémon creates will-o'-wisps to lure children to its side. It delights in being a plaything for any who approach.
Author: lemage22

Entry: POKENAME has been endowed with amazing potential through fusion. Its fire is so hot, it causes hallucinations through prolonged exposure.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME has been endowed with amazing potential through fusion. Its fire is so hot, it causes hallucinations through prolonged exposure.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME's scales are warm to the touch, but they burn quite easily, causing them to turn an ugly brown. Its six tail-like fins help it swim quickly.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME are incredibly skittish. Only their tails, which are identical to that of a Vulpix, are seen briefly before disappearing into the undergrowth. This has led to much speculation about their population number.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME are particularly abundant during warm, humid seasons. High emotions tend to make them float upwards as their temper runs hot.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: Cotton from this Pokémon keeps the wearer warmer than other kinds. As such, POKENAME is highly sought after by fashion designers.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: POKENAME have up to eight tails, their bulbous bodies unable to handle more than eight. They are a status symbol due to the high costs of grooming, as maintenance takes up to 2 hours per tail.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It tends to care for other Pokémon during the winter, keeping them warm with its toasty fur. It can rub its paws together to generate high amounts of heat that it mainly uses in combat.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME generates heat in its fluffy, curled tail and vents the excess through its ears. If it receives lots of love from its Trainer, the tail becomes more tightly curled, allowing for stronger heat generation.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME's tails give off heat. If the heat grows too strong, even their fur can be burned off. POKENAME is rather fast for its small size.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: By heating up its body, POKENAME creates floating bubbles that it uses for defense. When popped, the bubbles spray their super-heated sludgy contents, stunning foes with burns and the putrid stench.
Author: sk372

Entry: Despite their squishy bodies, most POKENAME have tough pincers. Their sticky innard-hands are dextrous on land and in water.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: Its sharp stingers are actually calcified waste that formed from its digestive tract. Due to the stomach acids that make them, the stingers are quite poisonous.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: POKENAME's internal organs are shaped like a net, which it uses to capture prey. However, it has to spend a long time chewing its prey, which leaves its delicate organs exposed.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It generates electricity in its stomach and channels it through the hands on its head. It electrocutes enemies by grabbing hold of them.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME spits out its internal organs in different shapes to add to its psychic prowess. Its real eyes sit on its torso, never blinking.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Light enough to be carried by the wind, POKENAME rapidly rotate their innards to help steer themselves on the breeze. They rest in sunlit lakes to gather nutrients from photosynthesis.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME doesn't normally have arms or pincers. Instead, what appears to be them are actually its internal organs that are being shaped as arms.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME covers its body in its own internal organs to deter physical contact, as well as to give itself a coat that keeps it moist for days.
Author: floweredbread

Entry: This Pokémon remains buried under sand until disturbed, then erupts in a burst of ink and arms. It constructs intricate underwater nests from discarded cans, wire, and plastic rings, using them as both camouflage and a statement of territory.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME ejects its innards out of its rear for some strange reason. They always give great gifts, but no one knows where they come from.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: POKENAME grab foes with their extendable tails then generate electricity from their spines. They grab rocks along the shoreline and send electricity through their tails to shatter them, gathering the rubble for a snack.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: A POKENAME uses its own guts to sit on, as it doesn't like standing. If a POKENAME isn't using its guts to sit, it's using it to catch Pokémon to eat.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME uses its internal organs to grab wild Berries and food, as well as to regurgitate the eaten food to eat once more.
Author: floweronbread

Entry: From the sea's embrace, it ejects its organs to ensnare foes. It's considered a symbol of the ocean's wrath and verdant life.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME wander along shores with their claws shifting through the sand in search of leftover shells. If they find any that could hold Pearls, they will rapidly extend their insides to puncture through and hopefully grab the Pearl inside.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME use their fins and horns to protect their faces and break through rocks while they swim. If they need to fight long distances, they extend their insides and release a torrent of water out to spray away obstacles or foes.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME is a hollow shell after having expelled all of its organs to defend from attack. It is believed that stepping on the spines of a POKENAME will cause it to steal one's soul.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: This Pokémon's soul and body are two separate beings. The soul of this Pokémon isn't malicious, just misunderstood.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: It finds all manner of shiny objects in caves and subterranean rivers and brings it back to its nest. It will do anything to protect its hoard of treasure, including ejecting its internal organs onto would-be thieves.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The underside of a POKENAME's shell is made of a similar  membrane to the insides of its body. While it may not be as rigid or sturdy as the main part of the shell, it can be inflated to deflect any incoming attacks.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Godlike power allows it to unleash devastating attacks at those who strike it first. However, it offers its hand to those it deems worthy.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: POKENAME spits out its blade as its main form of attack, piercing prey. It can stick to walls to do so hidden in plain sight.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME wiggles through the sky with its serpentine body, flailing its arms playfully. It unleashes powerful energy blasts while using its giant arms for upclose attacks. It hides amongst clouds, preparing to devour flying prey.
Author: ThePandaSharky

Entry: Those who touch POKENAME's sticky body report experiencing time in slow motion for up to half of a real-time hour.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Its body produces a natural stimulant that causes it to raise its speed to levels that rival modern machinery. A single boost to its defenses through a Ganlon Berry or otherwise makes it a formidable foe.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME latches onto tree branches with its internal organs. POKENAME don't fight each other for dominance. Instead they play rock, paper, scissors.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Emitting an ethereal light through the murky depths of the sea, POKENAME slowly sway back and forth to act as a lure. Any prey that falls for this trap will be grabbed and taken into the main body, acting as fuel for their flames.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Despite appearances, the arms of POKENAME are squishy appendages that hide tremendous strength. They use them to catch marine fish Pokémon and fight.
Author: Ayner

Entry: POKENAME wraps its old guts around its body to keep itself warm and survive long falls. It sheds them when it evolves.
Author: Neonriser

Entry: Its head is a battery of powerful muscles designed to eject its inner organs with great force. It's capable of bringing down a Fearow many times its size without moving its body.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME expels its organs as a tail to speedily chase down prey. The rest of the time, POKENAME floats motionless through the ocean.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: If its arms get damaged, it can regrow them within the hour. Its thorns contain a mildly toxic poison that is known to cause nausea and severe headaches.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME prefer fine sand right on the edge of tropical seas. Their soft bodies can blend in quite sneakily in rare black sand beaches, only having their shovel-like organs poke out when needed.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME prefer fine sand right on the edge of tropical seas. Their soft bodies can blend in quite sneakily in rare black sand beaches, only having their shovel-like organs poke out when needed.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: The mushrooms on this Pokémon's back can be shot out and retracted like weapons, remaining attached to the main body via POKENAME's ropelike internal organs.
Author: bee4082

Entry: POKENAME encase themselves with their fluffy innards to hide themselves in the sea foam of rushing waves. If they accidentally ride a wave too far, they dive deep underwater to try and find a new current.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Constantly suffering from headaches, POKENAME extend their innards out of their mouths to try and lighten the load. Unfortunately, if they extend their innards too far, it'll prompt a new headache near immediately.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: A belligerent Pokémon prone to picking fights, POKENAME move too slowly to chase down opponents that disengage. When struck, they rebound blows with their surprisingly pliable bodies.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME spews its organs out of its body as a mass of tentacles to ensnare food. It quickly retracts the organs to protect them while flashing the orbs on its bell as a warning.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: It catches prey by casting its innards into the water and waiting for a bite. It can expel its guts both from its mouth and the tip of its tail.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME repeatedly extend and retract their rubbery insides to pummel their opponents. Outside of battle, they will entertain themselves by bouncing their innards against their foreheads.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME can eject its internal organs from its cannons at upwards of 160 feet per second. Its organs are so elastic that this does not hurt it whatsoever.
Author: VibrationJaveline

Entry: POKENAME can create a small invisible strongbox, almost unbreakable by any tool and extremely complicated to solve and breach. Its popularity among museum keepers is on the rise.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME lives primarily in urban waterways where it can find new keys to attach to its barbels. It drags its keys in the sediment to kick up silt and discover long buried metals.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: People often accuse POKENAME of stealing their keys, but it only uses its malleable body to mimic their shapes. Unfortunately, it gets the finer details wrong, so none of its imitations work as substitutes for the missing keys.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are constantly collecting keys. Most aim to collect a full spectrum of eight colors.
Author: 22ndsolstice

Entry: It loves collecting shiny things, especially lost keys. It coats these collected objects in an odd film to help preserve them. When POKENAME is excited, the organ that appears to be a windup key starts to spin.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's beak resembles a changing key. It peers into the past to study old locks, mimicking lost keys with perfect accuracy.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hovers gently near warehouses. The keys on its head jingle faintly in the breeze, alerting others to its presence.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME fly through cities and grab stray keys with their long tails, whisking them away before their owners even realize they're missing. Their tails jingle as they trail behind them, the whimsical noise giving away their location as they flee.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME is extremely loyal to its Trainer, especially if its Trainer gives it a key for them to keep. POKENAME enhances its psychic powers through the metal ions in keys which allows it to predict oncoming attacks.
Author: loverbesm

Entry: POKENAME lurks in alleyways behind shops. When owners lock up, it swoops down to steal their keys as treasured trophies.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME rummages through hardware store dumpsters, eating faulty keys. If it finds one it likes, it proudly hangs it from its tail.
Author: .izik

Entry: With wings shaped like jagged keys, POKENAME strikes prey in quick, darting bursts. Its metallic slashes leave deep cuts.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's body glows white-hot at all times. Its head-mounted keys burn hot enough to melt through titanium in mere seconds.
Author: .izik

Entry: A strange and enigmatic being, POKENAME appears in rarely-documented Kalosian folklore. In these tales, it is said that each of its keys opens a doorway to different levels of the underworld.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's key-like appendages grant it exceptional traction. It can roll straight up vertical cliff walls with ease.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has greater control over electricity because of its key-shaped tail; POKENAME can channel plasma-like thunder to cleave its enemies asunder.
Author: ThunderJimmy#3944

Entry: POKENAME has greater control over electricity because of its key-shaped tail; POKENAME can channel plasma-like thunder to cleave its enemies asunder.
Author: ThunderJimmy#3944

Entry: Once something is caught by its magnets, it's near-impossible to dislodge. Trainers with a POKENAME in their party are advised to avoid wearing metal.
Author: sporkwizard

Entry: POKENAME attacks with slow yet powerful strikes. It has a strong sense of justice and protects those close to it as if they were family.
Author: mirby

Entry: POKENAME are staffed by prison wardens due to their mystical ability to release or seal any lock they touch with their keys. If a warden ever threatens to throw away the key, it is because they have a POKENAME on standby.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Superstitions say that the keys on the horn of POKENAME open a door that will cause the end of the world. While most agree that this is nonsense, the origin or purpose of these keys remains a mystery.
Author: sivanandi

Entry: POKENAME superheats its key before swinging it as a weapon. It fiercely defends its home by striking intruders with searing blows.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME morphs its blade into a key to break into buildings and back into a blade to claim the life force of its dwellers.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME is the subject of an ancient myth, in which a POKENAME could give its chosen wielder nigh-godly power. These rumours are yet to be proven.
Author: yourfriendlycap

Entry: POKENAME's key-shaped blades are razor sharp. It can easily slice through solid iron without dulling its edge.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is known to form deep connections with its Trainer and their friends. In dire situations, POKENAME can use those bonds to empower it further.
Author: mirby

Entry: The key atop POKENAME's head glows at night. It stands on fences near farms, illuminating the dark and warding off thieves.
Author: .izik

Entry: Before unleashing a fiery attack, POKENAME's keys begin to glow as a measure of the heat it will use. Few have lived to witness the moment all of them glow at once.
Author: .izik

Entry: Unlike the Pokémon it's disguised as, POKENAME lacks discernment and collects any and all keys. Inserting a key into into its cloth angers it greatly.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: The perfect protector for precious keys - as long as you don't want them back! An obscure Kalosian fairy tale tells of a hero who tricked a brutish POKENAME into guarding the key to its own shackles.
Author: Wormspawn

Entry: POKENAME's sharp, key-like antennae can cut through soil with ease. It tunnels underground to bury or retrieve hidden trinkets.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can reshape its key-like arms to unlock almost any lock. It stores stolen padlocks at its creek-side lodge as treasured prizes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's tail key spins rapidly when it's ready to strike. The faster it spins, the more powerful the coming electric blast.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME consumes metal to grow new key-like protrusions across its body. These keys rattle constantly as it moves.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is attracted to old vaults and forgotten safes, believed to be the guardian of lost secrets. Locksmiths have begun to use POKENAME in their work, hoping it will unlock safes thought to be unpickable.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Introverted by nature, POKENAME often holds its flame-tipped tail close, seeking comfort in the warmth it provides. Trainers have found the sound of jingling keys can also help soothe its nerves.
Author: sk372

Entry: The key on its head can open any door, a quality POKENAME uses often. Nobody has been able to figure out what key fits into the hole on its snout.
Author: totodile.

Entry: POKENAME are skilled lockpicks, and are thus valued partner Pokémon of locksmiths and thieves, alike. It only lets go of its favorite key if it finds one it likes more.
Author: bee4082

Entry: While flying, POKENAME clashes its keys together to create piercing sounds. These high-pitched noises disorient nearby foes and prey alike.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are a common sight around cliffs. Due to being unable to judge distances, they fall off cliffs more often than they land attacks.
Author: bucklin

Entry: POKENAME are a common sight around cliffs. Due to being unable to judge distances, they fall off cliffs more often than they land attacks.
Author: bucklin

Entry: POKENAME are a common sight around cliffs. Due to being unable to judge distances, they fall off cliffs more often than they land attacks.
Author: bucklin

Entry: POKENAME are a common sight around cliffs. Due to being unable to judge distances, they fall off cliffs more often than they land attacks.
Author: bucklin

Entry: POKENAME are a common sight around cliffs. Due to being unable to judge distances, they fall off cliffs more often than they land attacks.
Author: bucklin

Entry: The diet of POKENAME is primarily composed of diverse metal alloys. They roam around junkyards, floating in search of keys, their favorite snack.
Author: Ayner

Entry: POKENAME love collecting unusual keys and become possessive of the locks they open. If a lock is changed, they destroy it with extreme prejudice.
Author: A-z

Entry: These Pokémon like to collect lost keys and store them in their wings. They proudly present their collection to Pokémon or humans they are close to.
Author: Mr. Person (Prinplup enjoyer)

Entry: If you lose one of your keys, there's a chance a wild POKENAME has stolen it without you noticing. They sometimes duel Honchkrow over these items.
Author: Mr. Person (Prinplup enjoyer)

Entry: POKENAME gnaw at scrap metal, creating keys that help them infiltrate reserves or restaurants to steal fish for their next meal. They slip their tentacles into locks to determine the exact shapes the keys need to be.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME are very altruistic and heroic, frequently doing favors for people in metropolitan areas. Folktales suggest that the keys they gather were given to them by people they've helped in the past, claiming them to be the key to their success.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Legends say pressing POKENAME to your admirer's chest will “unlock” their hidden feelings. This has never been proven to work.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME seem to be more musically inclined than the average fusion. They are often very timid, but will pop up to play their notes.
Author: _testrun_

Entry: Incredibly efficient at keeping keys, though prefers big ones. If someone attempts to take one without permission, POKENAME will attempt to strike them into the stratosphere.
Author: thereversedguy

Entry: POKENAME collects any key it can find, but it only keeps its favorites; the others are abandoned. A single key on a boat is enough to make it attack.
Author: dzygomer

Entry: The only thing more annoying than a key-stealing Klefki is a crafty POKENAME. When it enters a room, any keys sitting out are instantly magnetized to it.
Author: sporkwizard

Entry: It collects keys by pulling them in with its powerful magnets. Sometimes it also draws in loose change and jewelry, but it doesn't care about those.
Author: sporkwizard

Entry: If threatened, POKENAME will scrape its key-like appendages together to make an annoying metal noise to deter predators. If the foe persists, it uses those same limbs in battle to cut and bludgeon its opponent.
Author: sk372

Entry: When approaching POKENAME, be wary of its reaction: clapping with its front flippers signifies a friendly and playful mood, but the clacking of the keys on its tail is a sign of wariness and aggression.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME searches garbage dumps and city alleys for discarded keys to add to its collection. It eats the keys it doesn't find worth keeping, building energy for evolution.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME searches garbage dumps and city alleys for discarded keys to add to its collection. It eats the keys it doesn't find worth keeping, building energy for evolution.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: Not content with only keys, POKENAME collects any trash it finds interesting and builds it into body parts it can manipulate. Its body is so corrosive that POKENAME must continually search to replace this treasure trove.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: Each segment of POKENAME's body will be a different color depending on the individual, due to the different amounts of minerals one POKENAME might eat over the other. It is generally friendly and gently interacts with miners and their equipment.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME will defend its Trainer ferociously, but this sometimes leads to misunderstandings where it will threaten a friend.
Author: WeirdTux

Entry: POKENAME's feathers are able to cool down the air around, allowing it to survive in hot climates. However, the feathers will start to catch ablaze when POKENAME is angry.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME will guard the Fletchling living on its back with its life. When the Fletchling leaves the nest, POKENAME will seek out a new one.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: POKENAME houses many injured Fletchling until they're fully healed. It will go to great lengths to protect its patients.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME hides in the trees, waiting for prey so it can strike. However, it can't easily catch the prey, as the steel armor slows it down.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: Despite being an unparalleled hunter, POKENAME has a noble spirit. It loathes those who prey on the weak and has been seen defending young Pokémon from predators.
Author: Honestly_Vitali

Entry: POKENAME weave webs made of extremely flammable silk. Upon catching something, they ignite the webs and cook their prey in seconds.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Despite its wings being located on its head, POKENAME soars with the utmost elegance. This phenomenon is still being studied.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: POKENAME continually vents sulfuric fumes from its flower. Because its petals flap and release embers as it walks, it is considered a major wildfire hazard.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: It can set trees ablaze just by flapping its wings. Many Hawlucha look up to it as a mentor because of its size and striking resemblance.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: In trying to disguise as a Voltorb by haunting a Trainer's discarded ball, POKENAME instead became an even better Poké Ball mimic.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: The Pokémon inside has unlocked the full potential of its shell, bursting at the seams to ambush the next unsuspecting Trainer looking to loot it.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: POKENAME is thought to be the spirit of a dead plant. Rotten roots shift just beneath its ghostly rag.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: These plushies were originally purchased to be used as chew toys, but after years of chewing, the dolls have begun to bite back!
Author: puppetmaster64

Entry: POKENAME gathers leaves and flowers to hide it's true appearance. When it is alone, it leaves it's costume and dances.
Author: asyoko

Entry: POKENAME holds onto its dead flower, which allows it to drift in the wind. If it were to let go, it would become a lifeless stuffed toy.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME floats around at night, using its feather-light stuffing like a sail. The stuffing includes fiberglass, so is dangerous to inhale.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It is very protective of its stuffing and hates when anything touches it. Poachers who try to steal its stuffing will be cursed to have an itchy sensation over their body for the rest of their life.
Author: typhloquil

Entry: POKENAME sets up decoy facsimiles of itself to confuse those it wishes to ambush. As its target stumbles to avoid the fakes scattered around, the real one sneaks up and swipes any shiny valuables it can.
Author: sk372

Entry: The wooden figure it clutches is rumored to speak with the voices of the dead. Those who dare look under its rag are said to hear their own terrified voices echoing back.
Author: amiel997

Entry: It loves to play with others, but often scares people and Pokémon away. If spotted, it is recommended to give a POKENAME positive attention.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Unfortunately, POKENAME's cloth has torn due to fusion. As a result, it hides in its shell out of embarrassment.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME hides itself as the tail while it gathers assorted party supplies to appear as a festive Delibird. It will attack if you touch its "bag".
Author: pankiwi

Entry: It runs up to dogs and dog-like Pokémon, wanting to play amongst them, but is often rejected. It can be heard wailing sadly at night.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME bears a smiling hood pattern to befriend human and Pokémon alike. It's often confused when it doesn't work.
Author: Atlas333

Entry: Stories say Mimikyu wear Pikachu disguises to attempt to make friends. These stories have gotten so popular that nowadays, we often see the opposite.
Author: Faelocke

Entry: POKENAME disguises itself as a handmade marionette of Mismagius. It will happily perform for delighted audiences, but will curse anyone who tries to look at its true form inside the puppet.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME disguises itself as a handmade marionette of Mismagius. It will happily perform for delighted audiences, but will curse anyone who tries to look at its true form inside the puppet.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: On occasion, POKENAME may find itself gathering a flock of loyal Murkrow following it. The confused POKENAME then spends much of its time returning the stolen goods the Murkrow give to it as offerings.
Author: sk372

Entry: It flies as if blown by a breeze, even when the air is still. If another kite's string touches its string, that kite will never fly again.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: This Pokémon may appear to fly, but in reality, it hides underground, holding a decoy by a string. When something tugs on the decoy, it reels its prey in!
Author: Shocktopus1717

Entry: POKENAME uses a rusty forklift to mimic the shape of a Mamoswine. Though it shows a clear proficiency in handling it, it is not forklift certified.
Author: SandGuyThing

Entry: A hollowed-out Babiri Berry serves as its helmet. It obsessively hoards red-tinted leaves and spicy mints to replace its imitation horns as they wilt.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME is said to be a lost doll possessed by the strings that carry it. This Pokémon will sorrowfully dance where no one can see it.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Regarded as a dangerous spirit by many, POKENAME wears a tattered cloak that shows signs of a violent encounter. Its haunting appearance enhances its psychic abilities, enabling it to create illusions that ward off threats and protect its allies.
Author: ThePandaSharky

Entry: These creatures can be found roaming the seafloor, pretending to be Lileep. It chooses this specific Pokémon due to it being a rare kind of fossil.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: POKENAME are found in museums mimicking dinosaur skeletons. They do this to get admiration from young children fascinated by dinosaurs.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its disguise is barely enough to fool other Pokémon, but that's good enough for POKENAME.
Author: weedspagon_real

Entry: POKENAME just wants to be loved. It creates a costume out of fabric scraps to cover the injuries it has received by those who fear it as a harbinger of disaster.
Author: Wormspawn and sk372

Entry: POKENAME disguises itself as the Mythical Pokémon Arceus. It uses this disguise to trick Trainers into worshiping it because it is lonely.
Author: captainshyguy

Entry: POKENAME pitifully whacks passersby with its draped stick. At first seeming to be unharmed, they eventually pass out, their life force sucked away.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME may attempt to integrate into society, masquerading as a human. Those who befriend this Pokémon may never be seen again.
Author: lynkinator

Entry: In rare instances, Mimikyu are known to select a Poké Doll as a substitute for their worn fabric, giving rise to this peculiar phenomenon.
Author: xyloldi

Entry: When its body is damaged, it uses parts from old plushies to fix itself. It seems to find enjoyment in tearing toys apart.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: If a ghostly figure offers you jello, do not accept. Should you partake, the POKENAME will curse you to become a jello mold yourself.
Author: Tad

Entry: From every single sighting of POKENAME, it is found enacting a weird ritual. When interrupted, it will get aggressive and hunt you down.
Author: Gengarfromfnaf

Entry: POKENAME are formed after being abandoned by Trainers in old mansions. Filled with spite and hatred, POKENAME will chase down any living being resembling a Pikachu to absorb its spirit, leaving only a body behind.
Author: KLGB76

Entry: POKENAME goes around dark alleyways and offers passersby its custom-made keys...for a price. The price is to be its friend and play with it for an hour per key.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME scours streets and pathways looking for lost keys. After finding one, it will somehow produce several copies, trading them with both the original owner and potential burglars. It jealously hoards the original keys.
Author: Alumed

Entry: It's said that POKENAME once had a Trainer who abandoned it for a Pikachu. Sometimes at night you can hear its cries.
Author: gun2._

Entry: POKENAME uses the scraps of wrecked planes in an attempt to fly without scaring anyone. However, it struggles to stay in the air long due to how terribly the pieces were put together.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME rips dead trees from their roots to dam rivers with. When it hears running water, it lets out a ghastly screech.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: The powerful energy it emanates scares away Pokémon and Trainer alike. To block this aura, it covers itself with a drab costume.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME uses household products to maintain its disguise, desperately trying to patch any holes or tears to keep its true body hidden.
Author: giggity._.

Entry: POKENAME disguises itself amongst balloons hoping to be chosen by a child, a moment that would bring it insurmountable joy. It is incredibly light, so a breeze will pull it out of their hand, leaving POKENAME weeping upon the wind.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: Left behind by a growing child, POKENAME keeps the company of other plush toys in the dark. It craves a hug, but its grasp is painfully strong.
Author: Leshii

Entry: POKENAME craves new friends, but isn't satisfied waiting in a toy shop. It stalks the dark streets, its wicked claw reaching for inattentive children.
Author: Leshii

Entry: POKENAME was found deep in a Safari Zone and earned a small cult following. Some parks feature it on signs teaching campers basic fire safety.
Author: Leshii

Entry: POKENAME constructs a castle to live in out of cardboard. As a result, it ends up befriending many interested children.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME uses Double Team to surround its prey. It strikes with a powerful X-Scissor, overwhelming its foe with ghastly precision.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME feeds by smoking insects and Bug-type Pokémon with its poisonous gas en masse. Removing its rag can be instantly fatal.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: A Mimikyu that feasts on a Diglett carcass will merge with it and become a POKENAME.  It then sneaks into labours of Diglett to pick them off one by one.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: Jealous of the affection shown to Persians and other feline Pokémon, POKENAME has formed a disguise for itself to try and achieve that same love. The materials it chooses for its disguise tend to be flimsy, scaring people away when it breaks.
Author: Katie

Entry: This POKENAME is rolling a die for its game. It never takes actual battles nearly as seriously.
Author: squawkabairdy

Entry: In spite of not needing a true physical form, POKENAME has major self-image issues. It greatly compensates with stuffing.
Author: cyprexx

Entry: POKENAME can be found in cities and towns near bodies of water. It constantly begs for water since it is unable to produce its own.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: Inspired by Trainers' love for squishy plushies, POKENAME has gathered as much soft scrap material as possible to make itself extremely squishy and huggable. Despite their loving nature, they are armed and will defend themselves when attacked.
Author: moopse

Entry: POKENAME absorbs solar energy on sunny days. It is said its gem can reach temperatures close to the Sun's.
Author: Gencky

Entry: Its cells end up igniting while changing during the morphing process, so POKENAME's transformations always emerge engulfed in flames before it snuffs out the fire.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME can spread polygonal scales that load supposedly insulting messages directly into the brains of those who touch them. Humans can't understand them, but Pokémon often lose control with burning anger.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: It has an evil aura which it uses to find universal truths of the world. If you ask it a question it will always know the answer, but instead of answering truthfully, it will give you the answer that will cause the most chaos in the world.
Author: xxrizahawkeyefanxx

Entry: The dorsal crest on POKENAME's back can split into two massive wings. This, paired with its excellent swimming and running abilities, makes it a terrain-based powerhouse.
Author: Patch

Entry: POKENAME channel their psionic energy through the staff they carry. They have been observed leading tribes of bug Pokémon deep within forest biomes.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: When nights get cold, POKENAME can be used as a great source of warmth.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: POKENAME's thick armor traps its own body heat, which it then disperses through its wings. The ambient air temperature around POKENAME is about 150 degrees.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Volcarona's wings have now turned into tough spikes made of the same material as Heracross's shell. POKENAME can still fly when needed but prefers to use its tough horn to deter enemies.
Author: CrazyNaturekitty

Entry: Although it can fly and climb, it prefers to burn down trees for food. It does this to cook any Berries that fall from these trees.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: Legends tell of a POKENAME that kept some explorers warm with the magma rocks it carries. When their wings spread out, it resembles a festive star.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: It deters predators with dazzling waves of flame. Since POKENAME is not a Fire-type Pokémon, theories have emerged that its flames are enhanced with holograms for greater intimidation value.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: It runs through the land at the speed of lightning, leaving blazing scales scattered in a haze behind it.
Author: togetik

Entry: POKENAME buries itself in the ground so it can grow. If its body is harmed during this process, POKENAME has to restart.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME is said to be an anomaly created by a failed attempt at time travel. It was witness to the moment when life first appeared on the planet.
Author: GenesisParallax

Entry: POKENAME was unearthed deep beneath ancient ruins, its body developing mechanisms that resemble advanced technology. Scientists suspect subterranean electromagnetic fields shaped its unique morphology.
Author: eiskitsune

Entry: POKENAME uses its cables to siphon energy from large power sources, which it stores as a static charge in its thick fur. Because it tends to drain energy to the point of causing blackouts, it is considered a sign of impending disaster.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: Despite its warm blood and colossal size, many scientists still consider POKENAME part of the bug family. What looks like hair is actually fuzz similar to that of a moth.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: POKENAME's sleek, metallic shell is a mysterious combination of organic tissue and adaptive metal, constantly shifting in response to threats. Its wings move independently, reacting with uncanny precision to its environment.
Author: eiskitsune

Entry: POKENAME is a devastating combatant, however its joy is said to lie with agriculture. It roams colder regions and helps the people by maintaining the crops with special scales on its body, providing the crops with little pseudo-suns to grow under.
Author: backgroundnoisegalore

Entry: The intensity of POKENAME's graceful dance movements gradually escalates until it emits a buzzing sound. The focus required to perform the dance heightens its mystical powers. If interrupted before finishing, POKENAME will throw a tantrum.
Author: leandermalurt

Entry: In battle, it buffets foes with unbearable heat and constant mental pressure. Yet to those it trusts, they are as gentle as a sunbeam.
Author: koishikomeiji.

Entry: It spreads tiny scales from its wings across the battlefield as it leaps and flies about. At any given point, it can make these scattered scales erupt into flames of aura to help control the battlefield.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME herds make a circle around their young and weak when they spread their orange fins to absorb sunlight for energy. When confronted by a threat, they bellow and shake their flashy frills in a warding display.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME herds make a circle around their young and weak when they spread their orange fins to absorb sunlight for energy. When confronted by a threat, they bellow and shake their flashy frills in a warding display.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: When POKENAME was found in a temple three thousand years ago, it was revered as a medium for lost explorers. Research suggests it stored their souls in the fiery orb it wields, described as a second sun.
Author: red.89

Entry: POKENAME floats through both water and air. It carries pollen from all species of plants everywhere it floats, creating beautiful new ecosystems.
Author: Shiina Valkyria (W)

Entry: It is said in ancient tablets that existence was nothing more than a cold and desolate template until POKENAME flapped its wings and scattered its scales, bringing flame and the concept of heat to all corners of the world, and with it, life.
Author: backgroundnoisegalore

Entry: Myths say that when this Pokémon lowers itself into our reality, its wings will be bright enough to be seen from every point in existence.
Author: backgroundnoisegalore

Entry: The feather coat of a POKENAME is as hard as the toughest alloys. It can manipulate the feathers' and its surroundings' heat to attack.
Author: T.I.A.

Entry: Ancient peoples referred to POKENAME as “the rage of the sun" in weapon form. It scatters scales from its guard to light a sea of fire.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME is also referred to as "Sun's Ray" in legend. The heat of its blade can light a sea of fire and remove oxygen from the surrounding air.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Lightning surges through its fine fur while its wings radiate waves of heat. Wild POKENAME were thought to be harbingers of summer thunderstorms.
Author: Therider

Entry: POKENAME can't stand having their scales get dry. When they do, it heats itself up amongst vegetation to absorb its moisture.
Author: Layth

Entry: The flames produced by POKENAME have the quirk of consuming things much faster than normal fire. It seems as if the flow of time for those flames is accelerated.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: The runes on its body change color depending on the heat of its inner flame. Its burning punches are said to be as hot as a star's core.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Unbelievable heat smolders within POKENAME's body while it waits for evolution. Touching one without suitable gloves could result in a nasty burn.
Author: bee4082

Entry: POKENAME can't fly and instead uses its wings to scatter spores whenever it senses danger. These spores cause a severe allergic reaction upon contact, making the damaged area look like a high-degree burn.
Author: milchik

Entry: One can easily track a POKENAME in the night by the trail of glimmering embers it leaves behind as it travels. It can be seen feasting on ashes after forest fires.
Author: bee4082

Entry: POKENAME lives in volcanic areas. Its heatproof fluff allows it to scatter a temporarily blinding powder to evade enemies.
Author: totodile.

Entry: At sunrise, POKENAME roar loud enough to startle all other wildlife in the area. They wander the wastelands from dawn to dusk, constantly on the hunt for gems that they hope will capture the light of the sun, even at night.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME roosts atop jungle canopies or volcanic peaks during the day, absorbing sunlight with its wings. It echolocates prey at night, expending the solar energy in a blinding flash when it catches its prey for an easy meal.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME roosts atop jungle canopies or volcanic peaks during the day, absorbing sunlight with its wings. It echolocates prey at night, expending the solar energy in a blinding flash when it catches its prey for an easy meal.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: The acid that POKENAME can secrete undergoes a chemical reaction with the oxygen in the air and becomes scorching hot.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME is too heavy to be carried by its wings for long periods, but they're not entirely useless. When flapped, they spread sticky scales that inflict severe burns on this Pokémon's enemies.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME glows faintly under the sunlight, using its fiery crest to intimidate foes. It's said to appear during solar eclipses, silently watching from the shadows with piercing blue eyes.
Author: eiskitsune

Entry: POKENAME can light up each of its scales by focusing heat onto them. It performs mesmerizing displays to distract foes before incinerating them.
Author: VaporVenator

Entry: It contains an amount of heat that is said by some to be able to melt entire planets. It keeps its overwhelming power in check using psychic energy.
Author: cheroace

Entry: POKENAME makes its home on volcanic mountains, typically near the summit. It's strongest move involves tucking inward and igniting its whole body, turning it into a rolling boulder of flames.
Author: sk372

Entry: When POKENAME clamp their soft shells shut, the surrounding air grows brutally cold. When they open themselves fully, a searing heat is released with a cloud of scorching scales.
Author: imademyselfdothis
