Entry: Its playful nature makes it a favorite among divers, often approaching them curiously. It emits joyful squeaks while gliding just beneath the waves.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is a clumsy but ambitious creature. It often trips and falls while walking on land.
Author: NeonRiser

Entry: POKENAME is found near dams made by other Bidoof and Bibarel, where it bathes in the sun and enjoys the fruits of the other Pokémon's labour. In return, POKENAME uses its body to temporarily block any leaks in the dam.
Author: TheScribe

Entry: POKENAME spends its days rolling around the shore, using its inflated body as a giant cushion to bounce off rocks. Its massive size often causes unintended chaos, sending waves crashing and startling local wildlife with its clumsy antics.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Despite its size, POKENAME only harvests the life force of schools of small fish. It enjoys splash-offs with beach goers.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Though it smacks the life force out of small schools of fish, POKENAME also enjoys splashing water at beach-goers and being hit like a beach ball.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It likes to play fight with its stretchy arms. When POKENAME drinks a lot of water, its tail inflates to the size of a beach ball, being just as bouncy as one.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME spend most of their time resting on the ocean floor by using their spiny appendages to latch onto rocks for stability. POKENAME have become a notorious pest to fishermen, often attaching to boats and stealing catches.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: It can absorb over a ton of compost in a day. When its stomach is near to bursting it belches out a massive spray of spores.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME lives inside a bubble that provides it water to breathe with. When the bubble pops, POKENAME suffocates.
Author: barry63_madrel

Entry: POKENAME blow jets of water to scare nearby Pokémon. When threatened, they can leap even higher, showing true fear to any who witness this rage.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME hunt in small groups. It is very cowardly on its own and roams the ocean until it finds a new group if it loses its old one.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME hunt in small groups. It is very cowardly on its own and roams the ocean until it finds a new group if it loses its old one.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME collects air through its nostrils, which it stores in its body. When it sees prey, it expels it for additional acceleration.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME will release diluted, poisonous water from its blowhole when threatened or when it gets too excited. It often latches onto the bottoms of boats and uses its powerful jets to blast away any dangerous Pokémon that approach.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME need very little water to survive, but will swell larger to hold any excess water within their bodies. Once a year, a flower will bloom atop its head. Smaller POKENAME tend to have the prettiest and most fragrant flowers.
Author: darkweavile428

Entry: This buoyant Pokémon has no concept of personal space, and excitedly crashes any boat party it sees.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Its vibrant blue scales shine brilliantly under the sun as it floats near coral reefs. If disturbed, it unleashes powerful psychic waves to scare away threats.
Author: .izik

Entry: When two POKENAME play together, their heart-shaped fins create elegant water patterns. Many believe seeing them leap together is a sign of everlasting love.
Author: .izik

Entry: It playfully races against fast swimmers, using jets of water to propel itself forward. Trainers believe swimming alongside it enhances endurance.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is a fun-loving Pokémon that enjoys relaxing on the beach. Its favorite means of relaxation is trying to fight other wild Pokémon.
Author: UsagiNezumi

Entry: The brain of a POKENAME is slowly being eaten away as the Tentacool provides too much of a suction effect. The Wailmer spends all its life in pain.
Author: watermelonchild

Entry: POKENAME is often seen drifting in shallow waters, with its tentacles twitching in unexplained patterns. Researchers have been unable to determine its purpose, but its presence seems to cause strange disruptions in local marine ecosystems.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME often waddles onto land by using its small fins to support its bulk as it shuffles through city streets. While harmless, it often causes minor chaos by blocking roads and sneaking into markets in search of food.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME wears the skull of a deceased Electric-type Pokémon of great power so it may grow as strong as its parents. Although its head is too large for the bone, it serves its purpose by boosting POKENAME's morale.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: They are most active just after rainy days, when bug Pokémon scurry out of their dens. While wild POKENAME have an aggressive disposition, properly trained POKENAME are quite friendly.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It relies on its parents and siblings to avoid being picked off by buzzard-like predators, as it has few methods of self-defense. One such method requires inhaling lots of air before exhaling all at once to fly away.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME's tail lights up to communicate with partners in the dark. At night, a flock of POKENAME resembles the stars in the sky!
Author: alliveir

Entry: They float on the winds to move around. If they encounter a thunderstorm, their bodies glow with electricity.
Author: 22ndsolstice

Entry: This Pokémon has a love for Honey. It can be found by hives of Combee, using the light emitting from its tail to distract them while it eats its fill.
Author: curvingapollo

Entry: POKENAME travel in groups of three to four for safety when moving about in the woods. If one of them becomes separated from the others at night, they light up with a flare of electricity to make themselves more visible and reunite with their friends.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME's thick fur shines when it eats. It uses its tail to send jolts of electricity through the nearby ground to immobilize small prey.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: It creates paintings under UV lights with the solar charged paint from the tip of its tail. POKENAME shocks those who mock its art.
Author: LuluDracon

Entry: POKENAME prowls the forest with feline grace. Its agile movements and powerful strikes make it a formidable hunter in the dense foliage.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: Rumors claim that POKENAME are the souls of Shinx that never got to live past a very young age. The halo-like item above its head supports that theory, but there is no scientific study that confirms this.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: Despite its look, POKENAME's tail is stiff and made of steel. Its tail is notorious for accidentally breaking nearby objects when POKENAME gets excited.
Author: retrodox

Entry: This Pokémon fights with a steel blade which it infuses with electricity. It is incredibly adept at parrying every attack that is thrown its way before retaliating with a single decisive strike.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: POKENAME is known as 'Thunder Cloud' by some for being as soft as a cloud and the constant static it emits. Its fluffy coat requires daily brushing, often leaving its Trainer's hair to be just as fluffy as a result.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: POKENAME makes for a horrible pet. While it may seem cute with its gigantic forehead, many pet owners forget about its equally big bite. Countless pieces of furniture fall victim to its dreaded “biting fit” that even reinforced steel fails to stop.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: POKENAME glow as they float aimlessly through the night, providing light to anyone they pass by. Sometimes, children who sneak out of the house at night will hold onto a POKENAME to use as a lantern, though these children don't always return home.
Author: darkweavile428

Entry: POKENAME is the perfect partner for any rookie Trainer starting their journey. It has a strong bond to its Trainer and will always be by their side.
Author: funkytomate

Entry: Whenever it is in the presence of a pack of carnivores, it jabs the nearest predator before flicking its tail to dash away. Whether being chased through the jungle or not, POKENAME continuously zips around in search of food or safety.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: A tenacious hunter, POKENAME can paralyze its prey in multiple different ways. They have been known to challenge Pokémon much larger than themselves.
Author: leonian1586

Entry: All POKENAME have a form of synesthesia that makes them able to see sounds. Because of that, they have a greater understanding of sound and music.
Author: Voxary

Entry: POKENAME is skittish and shy, sending spores out at any creature who comes too close. It has multiple methods of paralyzing its foes. It seems to have lost the confidence it had when it was small.
Author: leonian1586

Entry: It swims with its tail above water so as not to electrocute other aquatic Pokémon. Unfortunately, this acts as a perfect lightning rod during storms.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME bury themselves in the ocean floor with their claws poking above the water. They blind their prey with bright flashes from their claws before dragging them below the sand.
Author: floopussoupus

Entry: Their only means of communication deep undersea are the sparks from their antennae. The POKENAME will sometimes lose control, shocking anyone nearby.
Author: currentlymuffin

Entry: The eyes on POKENAME's pattern flash every time they use an Electric attack. Their mane puffs up with the static as well, making POKENAME look even more fearsome.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: Drawn to magnetic materials, it loves to bat at Nosepass like it was a ball of yarn. Its sharp claws pulse with potent electricity.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME's softer head is often mistaken for Shieldon's more sought-after, harder head. While in wild grass, both have their heads poking out, but you can differentiate them by the spike on POKENAME's.
Author: retrodox

Entry: Its blades glow when it uses its electric powers. It can touch blades with other POKENAME to combine their electricity into a more powerful attack.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: POKENAME channel electric shocks through their steel armor, which is made from discarded Aron shells. If a particularly large or well-armored Aron is sighted, POKENAME will form packs to hunt it for its shell.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: The yellow stripes on its arms glow with electricity and will scorch pawmarks into trees to mark its territory. While hunting, it will run on all fours to increase its speed.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME that find their way into the wild are formidable predators, using their electrical, webbed claws to swim at incredible speeds and hunt aquatic prey with ease.
Author: bigblue

Entry: As POKENAME ages, its fur darkens and grows longer, trading off swimming speed for protection. As it grows stronger, it prefers hunting prey on land to avoid electrocuting itself.
Author: bigblue

Entry: POKENAME meticulously maintains its fur and zaps anyone who ruins it. Recent fashion trends in the region have been influenced by its appearance.
Author: noel5229

Entry: Many people who see its shape mistake it for that of a regular Voltorb, but it's in fact just a Jigglypuff seen from above.
Author: nasho1908

Entry: Every morning, POKENAME can be found practicing their singing. Weak or unenthusiastic singers risk being kicked out of the group.
Author: Busilisk

Entry: POKENAME sings slow, plaintive songs into the microphone it carries. Those that fall asleep to the song dream of happy times with family.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME releases psychoactive fumes that cause a state similar to drunkenness. The sound it produces when releasing them is also pretty mesmerizing to hear.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: If POKENAME finds a sleeping Pokémon in the wild, it gently places them in its pouch. It then hums a soft melody to ensure they rest peacefully.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's haunting, melodic cry echoes through the deep, luring creatures ever closer until its tentacles strike without mercy. Fossils of POKENAME have been discovered embedded in ancient seafloor mudstone, surrounded by the remains of its prey.
Author: eiskitsune

Entry: Hikers often run into POKENAME during high-altitude expeditions, the snake-like Pokémon being highly curious and unafraid of humans. When hungry, POKENAME will actively seek out people and sing them to sleep, stealing food from their backpacks.
Author: Katie

Entry: The songs that POKENAME sing are soothing to both people and Pokémon. So soothing, in fact, that those who hear it fall into a near-endless slumber.
Author: chiari_queen

Entry: The songs that POKENAME sing are soothing to both people and Pokémon. So soothing, in fact, that those who hear it fall into a near-endless slumber.
Author: chiari_queen

Entry: POKENAME hunts near watering holes and uses its lullabies, which sound more like soft soothing growls than actual singing, to put its prey asleep. Its lung capacity allows it to sing or hide underwater for hours without the need to breathe.
Author: milchik

Entry: POKENAME's preferred method of attack involves latching onto its opponent's face with its powerful jaws and letting out an ear-piercing shriek. It exhibits violent and overtly confrontational behavior, so rigorous training is almost always required.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's preferred method of attack involves latching onto its opponent's face with its powerful jaws and letting out an ear-piercing shriek. It exhibits violent and overtly confrontational behavior, so rigorous training is almost always required.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are known to perch themselves on tree branches and survey the area below. They often scare children due to their large and watchful eyes.
Author: Adam941

Entry: Groups of wild POKENAME are known to be gentle and friendly. Their song is so potent that they are known to put themselves to sleep.
Author: robbery_666

Entry: Flocks of POKENAME sing all throughout the night, slowly lulling anyone who hears them to sleep. They cheerfully sway to the melody as they sing.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: As they enter Pokémon contests, Trainers may give them a Pink Scarf for good luck. They flaunt their shells to emphasize their rotund form, and the scarf helps give them a rounder, cuter look.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME pecks at trees with hollow points to determine which will grant it the best reverb. Once it finds a suitable hole to hop into, it sings short songs and enjoys the echo it gains.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its leaves can come in a few different colors. It uses them to float around in the wind. It sings happily as it drifts, relaxing those who hear it.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: POKENAME's wings buzz in different tones depending on how they steer or travel during flight. Groups of POKENAME gather together to fly in complex routines to perform whimsical melodies together.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Its body is filled with air. It uses its fangs to clamp down on surfaces to avoid floating away while sleeping.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon uses hypnotic illusions to lure threats to sleep. Because of this, it's a perfect partner for those who suffer from insomnia.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: Carvings of POKENAME can be seen on the walls of ancient ruins. They form the notes to a lullaby that can make you sleepy just by looking at it.
Author: ServerSizeMe

Entry: Multiple POKENAME will line up in a pattern that mimics musical notation. Anyone who tries to decipher what the song is will drift into a deep sleep.
Author: serversizeme

Entry: POKENAME's body can withstand immense pressure due to being full of air most of the time. Because of this, its ability to counterattack is limited, as even a small hit sends it flying.
Author: EvilGammon

Entry: After putting a foe to sleep, POKENAME uses its strong claws to grab them tightly. It prefers to strike from above, dropping in silently after its lullaby takes effect.
Author: .izik

Entry: After eating honey, POKENAME's voice becomes wildly off-key. Despite this, it continues to sing with great enthusiasm.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME sings at the entrance of tunnels to lull the inhabitants inside to sleep. It then uses its long beak to reach in and pluck out unsuspecting prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: The milk POKENAME produces has potent sleep-inducing properties. Strangely, even touching the milk without drinking it can cause sudden drowsiness.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME take great pride in having the most stylish and well-maintained curls. They are often seen absentmindedly staring into a lake while trimming them. Though exposed to predators while doing this, their brute strength keeps them safe.
Author: leandermalurt

Entry: POKENAME makes its burrows amongst tree roots, using the extra structure of the roots to reinforce its underground home. At night, they often come to the mouth of their burrows and sing out to one another to communicate.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME adores repeating music it hears with a variety of boops and beeps. It likes to insert itself into different mediums to continue singing.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: Colonies of POKENAME communicate with others across their mountain homes by singing in harmony. Each colony has a unique chorus, and experienced hikers can use these songs to navigate when lost.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME will only ever inhabit dusty old gramophones which makes them hard to track down. Their singing can be blissful or disturbing.
Author: Baneful Bunker

Entry: With a rubbery body and naturally playful attitude, POKENAME often puts itself into dangerous situations trying to befriend much more powerful Pokémon. Even those it does get close to don't often stick around as it's prone to biting.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME wards away rivals from its caves with loud songs that can be heard for several miles. Their songs are unpleasant and atonal, meaning many other Pokémon also keep away from them.
Author: Katie

Entry: The harmonies produced when POKENAME sing have a mesmerizing quality. Unwary Trainers may find themselves waking up in the wilderness with their backpacks raided for berries.
Author: Katie

Entry: Unlike many other Jigglypuff fusions, POKENAME wants others to fall asleep during its concert performance. It gets angry and violent towards anyone still awake when it finishes singing.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME lives in abandoned houses to be all alone. Sometimes, groups of POKENAME can be seen doing some sort of ritual.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME lives in abandoned houses to be all alone. Sometimes, groups of POKENAME can be seen doing some sort of ritual.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME is many people's worst nightmare. It behaves similarly to a Jigglypuff, but it instead puts its targets into sleep paralysis with its song.
Author: Kermeros

Entry: POKENAME's gentle cry can be heard from miles away. Anyone who hears its cry feels a sense of serenity and relaxation.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The garden on its back is said to be able to even calm down the most angry Primeape. Many Pokémon like to gather around it to sing.
Author: funkytomate

Entry: POKENAME vibrates its blade which hums a beautiful lullaby. When its opponent falls asleep, it finishes the job.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME loves to lure lost sailors to its lair with its beautiful singing. Many old maritime tales were told by those who claimed to have seen it.
Author: thisisnotaplaceholder

Entry: POKENAME is popular amongst daycare workers due to its soothing singing voice and ability to calm fussy toddlers with its ribbons.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: On full moon nights, POKENAME sings directly to the moon. When five or more gather, their combined voices are said to evoke deep sorrow in anyone who hears them.
Author: .izik

Entry: Commonly found in cities, these Pokémon love attention and showing off, singing and dancing happily. They pay close attention to the latest trends.
Author: Cristata

Entry: Commonly found in cities, these Pokémon love attention and showing off, singing and dancing happily. They pay close attention to the latest trends.
Author: Cristata

Entry: At night, it stares into the sky before beginning to sing. It will do this until morning, and will not remember doing so afterwards.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: POKENAME catches other Pokémon's attention with its beautiful eyes, then uses its melodic voice to lull them to sleep. Next, POKENAME weaves a cocoon of electrically charged web around its prey and devours them.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: POKENAME flutters from tree to tree with its small wings, singing a gentle tune. It pauses only to nibble on freshly budding leaves.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can inflate its hollow tail with gas, which allows it to leap to great heights. Its voice has a distinct melodic quality that lulls listeners to peaceful sleep when it sings. It will use this chance to steal food from its victims.
Author: El Fail

Entry: POKENAME sings atop volcanic plateaus, its voice carrying over the fiery landscape. The glow of lava below gives its performances an almost hypnotic allure.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is known to be melancholic and enjoys laying on the ground, doing nothing. It makes chilling music that's very popular for Halloween.
Author: galactak

Entry: POKENAME often sings as a form of sonar to detect obstacles. They may also sing to put predators asleep.
Author: Phrotonz

Entry: POKENAME's tiny body makes it difficult to locate before its entrancing voice sends listeners to sleep. It then snuggles up to them and absorbs static electricity for its own use.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: POKENAME waddles through grasslands, doing nothing in particular besides absorbing sunlight. If it stores up enough sunlight, it can fire beams of solar energy from its single eye.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME often gets mistaken for a cute plush doll. If it gets picked up by unsuspecting children, it flails its arms incredibly violently until put down.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: This Pokémon loves to battle. However, it is notorious for its showmanship. POKENAME will always sing a "walk-up" song to hype itself up before entering a battle.
Author: mbo1064.

Entry: POKENAME's singing voice is so comforting that Trainers and Pokémon alike sleep soundly when they listen to it. POKENAME also relaxes when it sings, its flame calming it, feeling like a warm campfire.
Author: sockedpuppetart

Entry: POKENAME is very playful and hyperactive. Once it gets going, it bounces around the room for minutes without stopping thanks to its flexible body.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its meowing has an incredibly soporific effect, which is why it is particularly popular with people with sleep problems.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME has a musical melody spiraling around its stomach. Those that replicate this melody find it to be an incredibly effective lullaby.
Author: gronkissimo

Entry: When faced with an opponent stronger than itself, it will swallow extra air to make its muscles look bigger. However, it tends to overinflate itself, causing it immense pain.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME whistles a delightful tune said to help plants grow. It can often be found in the middle of daisy fields, singing softly as flowers sway around it.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is extremely affectionate and cuddly, which makes it a popular pet. When it feels comfortable, it hums gently to itself.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME accompanies its soporific singing with a rhythmic dragging of its tail. It protects its flexible body with a hard shell.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME's soft body crackles with electricity while it floats near power plants. When it sings, tiny sparks escape its mouth and fall to the ground.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME digs large tunnels all through its cavernous homes to make for better acoustics for its music. Its song echoes through every chamber of the cave, putting every other creature to sleep so it may roam freely.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's body is covered in a tungsten shell, allowing it to roll across rough landscapes with ease. If interrupted while traveling, it unleashes a powerful Electro Ball.
Author: .izik

Entry: It wears the shed armor of its mother as a hand-me-down, the last thing it has to remember her by.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: This Pokémon dislikes gamblers immensely. A foolish Trainer once suggested playing a game of chance using the markings on POKENAME's body as score.
Author: fixthewifi

Entry: It relies solely on curious Trainers to roll it in order to get around. Rarely, ones with seven- or eight-spotted sides have been seen.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME's heavy armor prevents it from floating, so it spends most of its time lying in wait on the water's floor for an unsuspecting Pokémon to swim above. It can remain submerged for up to 24 hours.
Author: GamblingDie

Entry: POKENAME leads a sedentary lifestyle, resting along the shoreline for long periods. If disturbed while sleeping, it flies into a rage and attacks anything in sight. It no longer spends much time in the water.
Author: GamblingDie

Entry: Scientists recently spotted clusters of POKENAME drifting through space. For some reason, they do not require food once they leave the atmosphere.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME pecks at mining equipment with its metal beak, occasionally consuming small pieces. Afterward, it sometimes experiences visions from the most recent user's life.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME acts as a living lightning rod to protect vital buildings from the dangers of storms. Be careful about contact with this Pokémon, as its metal plates are very conductive.
Author: EvilGammon

Entry: Its body is made of very light but resistant steel. POKENAME can regularly secrete oil from its tail, allowing it to swim on the surface of the water.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its body is made of very light but resistant steel. POKENAME can regularly secrete oil from its tail, allowing it to swim on the surface of the water.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can't swim, instead walking along lake beds for food. Its heavy body helps it spin its tail at high speed like a hammer thrower.
Author: PokePower

Entry: Its body is robust, able to float due to the light weight of its armor and the oil in its tail. It can expel water through the holes to move around.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its body is robust, able to float due to the light weight of its armor and the oil in its tail. It can expel water through the holes to move around.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME frequently cities with high traffic and often stand on the side of roads for long periods of time. This causes quite a lot of confusion, and can lead to accidents.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME quickly take over any cave they can live in. Their small bodies allow them to live in all kinds of nooks and crannies.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: POKENAME's hand-like tail is harder than iron. It smashes it into cliff walls to knock loose chunks of marble, which it eagerly consumes after grinding it up with a powerful Metal Claw.
Author: .izik

Entry: It chews its way through any tough material. Serious infrastructure damage has been caused due to wild POKENAME.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are often mistaken for screws due to their tendency to drill inside of metals and then stay dormant for long periods of time.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: POKENAME uses its silvered claws to smash cave walls and knock loose Hard Stones. It collects these rocks to decorate its underground den.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its steel exoskeleton is extremely hard to penetrate. POKENAME eats rocks to makes its exoskeleton even harder.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: It prefers to keep its body as cold as possible. During the winter months it sleeps in frozen caverns, keeping its internal temperature low.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME flicks out its blue tongue in deep caves to smell for Blue Shards. Upon finding some, it rams its head into the wall until the shards break loose.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME acts as a sort of big sibling to young Aron or Phanpy in the wild. Quick on its feet and with a sturdy iron coating, it can easily take on Pokémon that would otherwise trouble the others.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME produces milk rich in iron, often used in vitamin supplements. It generates more milk than usual during the spring months.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME stands tall with pride, even when looked down upon. When it evolves into Aggitar, it spares those who haven't wronged it.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME typically gather in packs, moving as one. They go from scrap metal to scrap metal, quickly devouring them.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: The fluid it secretes from its eyes is highly acidic. This helps to dissolve metals for easier consumption.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: POKENAME slams its metal head into the ground to startle prey like Diglett. When they surface, it finishes them off with a powerful Bulldoze.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has small, hooked claws on its fingers and toes, allowing it to easily scale rocky surfaces. It is able to detect magnetic fields with its tail, which it uses to navigate the deep cave systems it lives in.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is very durable, despite its tiny, delicate appearance. They either sing alone or with other Pokémon with a high-pitched voice.
Author: Neonriser

Entry: The metal coating POKENAME's body is covered in a thin layer of clear poison. Contact with this toxin can cause violent seizures if not washed off quickly.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME tastes cave walls with its long tongue to analyze their composition. It can mimic the texture and color of any stone it licks, blending in seamlessly.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its metallic body makes it more resistant, but at the same time, it makes it much slower. This forces it to hunt other Pokémon as slow as itself. In addition, its body acts as a shell that contains its energy for its next evolution.
Author: zamcross_official

Entry: When POKENAME is not hungry, it will store metals in its larger jaws for later consumption.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: It violently slams its head into trees and other stationary objects to test its strength. Some say it keeps a count of how many foes it knocks over.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its extremely hard exoskeleton leaves it nearly impervious to direct damage. In order to keep it strong, it constantly searches for more metal.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: Before a hurricane, POKENAME's metal shell glows with a bright blue hue. During this time, it runs through villages hoping someone will notice the warning and spread the word.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite living in deep dark caves, POKENAME tries its absolute hardest to keep the sapling on its back alive. Due to only growing on metallic elements for nutrients, the branches are as tough as iron nails.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's large metallic ears can detect even the faintest noise from over 100 feet away. If it senses a predator, it quickly retreats to its burrow.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME drills into rocky outcrops in search of Moon Stone shards. Eating these shards seems to strengthen its vitality and defensive capabilities.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME carves intricate labyrinths in stone using its bladed limbs. It performs an intense Swords Dance while balancing on its heels to prepare for battle.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is known to be very quiet. Everything it breathes on becomes room temperature.
Author: Neonriser

Entry: POKENAME consumes metals to incorporate into its steel body to keep it fresh. It then bathes in moonlight, producing a mysterious sheen.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: Its heavy, sturdy body means that it cannot jump very far on its own power. It digs through and consumes soft soil for nutrients that keep its shell strong and resilient.
Author: sk372

Entry: The blue metal star-shaped tip of POKENAME's tail crackles with static. It uses this tail to track underground power lines and mineral-rich veins.
Author: .izik

Entry: A melancholic song echoes softly from the holes on POKENAME's body. The sound can cause dizziness and fainting in the elderly if heard for too long.
Author: .izik

Entry: Upon fusion, POKENAME's face plating has become twice as wide and twice as thick. It can only be found in deep underground caverns where the pressure is too strong for most other lifeforms.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME digs pits and hides inside, waiting for prey like Spearow or Ekans. When one passes by, it leaps out, snapping its iron jaws and dragging the target underground.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is often used in construction. When metal parts are to be scrapped, an POKENAME is happy to eat them by grinding them between its gear teeth.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME can manipulate its reflections from its mirror-like armor to show false imagery, confusing its adversaries. Its blue fur glows brightly during the night.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The color of the flame on POKENAME's tail depends on in diet, feeding on many different types of metal. It lives in volcanic caves, the high temperature and pressure reinforcing its metal armor.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The metal coating POKENAME's body becomes extremely hot when using Fire-type moves like Ember. When exhausted, it consumes coal to refuel its flame.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its heavy weight makes flying difficult, so it climbs and sticks to walls using the iron spikes on the inside of its wings. They also help make for effective slaps against enemies in self-defense.
Author: sk372

Entry: The tusks of POKENAME are razor sharp, which is why they are often hunted. Their tusks are used to make knives and other sharp objects.
Author: Sottiwotti

Entry: The circle on its chest is actually an eye. It is thought that this Pokémon was supposed to act as a surveillance robot for its master long ago.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: POKENAME rarely leave their caves. Any instance that they do is purely for scavenging for the metal they feed on.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: POKENAME often make their home near junkyards due to their iron-based diet. After feeding, they leave behind remnants of a dangerous venom.
Author: garret95

Entry: Wild POKENAME dwell in deep underwater caverns, savagely attacking any creature it encounters no matter the size.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: Wild POKENAME dwell in deep underwater caverns, savagely attacking any creature it encounters no matter the size.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: It slams its head into cave walls to create loud noises. It uses these tumults as a form of echolocation to determine its surroundings.
Author: .izik

Entry: As POKENAME lives, the metal it consumes accumulates in its body, and the holes in its steely armor gradually grow shut.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The desert sands blow right through POKENAME's empty body. A strange whistling sound can be heard if the wind blows through it at the right angle.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME are very friendly, but they rarely see people due to living in caves. This has caused them to resort to pretending rocks are their friends.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: POKENAME are very friendly, but they rarely see people due to living in caves. This has caused them to resort to pretending rocks are their friends.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: POKENAME has a surprisingly resilient body. Musicians have found that interpreting the pattern on its hair and head as sheet music produces a familiar tune.
Author: ImaginaryNeon

Entry: POKENAME's outer layer is made of a steel-like metal that strengthens as it consumes gems. Sapphires seem to make its shell harder than any other gemstone.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's body appears fluffy but is covered in metallic purple strands as strong as rebar. These metal fibers provide exceptional protection against attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME fashion durable masks out of iron to protect themselves as they practice their headbutts. Eventually their headbutts will become strong enough to flatten metal even without the help of their masks.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME sneaks into homes to steal gold jewelry, which it consumes. This diet strengthens the golden mask-like plating on its face.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's silver whiskers can detect temperature changes with remarkable precision. If it senses a storm approaching, it gathers its allies in a cave for shelter.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its powerful muscles to break through hard stone, looking for raw metals to eat. Its fur is made of tiny metal shards sharp enough to pierce through thick clothing.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME fights by rolling its round, metallic body like a ball across the ground. If it misses even a single strike, it flies into a blind rage and attacks indiscriminately.
Author: .izik

Entry: A single kick from an POKENAME can halt a moving train. The alloy that covers its body grows like skin and falls off if it gets damaged.
Author: .izik

Entry: The steel plating covering POKENAME's body delivers a painful shock to anyone who touches it. When tired, it rests on traffic lights to recharge.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME defends its nest, ramming into anything that gets too close. It remains unfazed even if it flies off a cliff in the process.
Author: PokePower

Entry: POKENAME clangs its tuning fork against itself to create large soundwaves. It uses this technique to ward off predators.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME's beaks are coated with a gold-like metal. It pecks cave walls to dislodge Light Clay, which it then devours with delight.
Author: .izik

Entry: It pants lightly when exerted, a small tongue barely visible as a sign of tiredness. The metal shell around its head makes the sound echo and come out as a baritone heaving noise that tends to inadvertently scare smaller Pokémon.
Author: sk372

Entry: The gas surrounding its body is highly corrosive, eroding any metal it touches. It has been responsible for the collapse of some buildings.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: POKENAME are able to change the density of their bodies between being as sturdy as steel or as light as helium. They collide with steel structures and phase into any cracks they create to eat away at the metal from inside.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME are typically found in scrapyards, feasting on the various metals. However, the sound of their burrowing and eating is disruptive.
Author: Incognito1234

Entry: POKENAME practices metallurgy and gem creation deep inside caves. It gives its most pristine diamonds as gifts to its closest friends.
Author: noel5229

Entry: POKENAME wields its morningstar with incredible speed and power. One blow is said to be strong enough to damage even the sturdy defenses of an Armaldo.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: Colonies of POKENAME live in caverns where food is scarce, so largely subsist on Aggsey's eggs. They often fight amongst themselves over food.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME will fiercely protect anyone it considers a friend. Despite its small stature, it is deceptively heavy due to its armour.
Author: DuskRD

Entry: The helm atop POKENAME's head is forged from a lead-like alloy. When the orbs on its tail glow blue, a massive thunderstorm soon follows.
Author: .izik

Entry: The silk POKENAME spins is stronger than any man-made cable. These Pokémon can often be found lurking in construction sites.
Author: rihse

Entry: At night, it seeks out the highest point it can find and watches the moon until dawn. If it encounters another POKENAME during this process, the two will butt heads until the weaker one is driven away.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: It is incredibly territorial and will fight off both people and Pokémon that approach what it has deemed its home. When it battles, it exudes effort and is willing to use any part of its body as a bludgeoning tool.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's segmented body grows denser the deeper it digs. It consumes raw ore as it tunnels through mountainous terrain.
Author: .izik

Entry: As their armored bodies can resist all but the fiercest blows, wild POKENAME will settle territorial disputes by locking their relatively fragile antlers in a struggle until one yields or its antlers break. This process can take several hours.
Author: Alumed

Entry: POKENAME's iron body hardens as it rests. It hops between copper deposits while sleeping, slowly building strength for evolution.
Author: .izik

Entry: Covered in dense cobalt plating, POKENAME hovers using psychic force. It rarely touches the ground, even while mining.
Author: .izik

Entry: A hollow aluminum alloy encases POKENAME's body. It captures rushing air while leaping, allowing for brief glides between cliffs.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME tears into ore veins with sharp metal claws, breaking stone with ease. It can feed on the same deposit for months without moving.
Author: .izik

Entry: These durable Pokémon have been seen living and working together to guard select mountain ranges from trespassers. Observation indicates they communicate through a complex combination of fist-bumps and headbutts.
Author: sk372

Entry: Their tails resemble a morningstar or flail, which they use to slam into opponents in battle. Each tail is able to act independently to smash rocks or other obstacles in quick succession.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME's two heads are made of dense iron. While sleeping in its cave, the two heads unintentionally alternate snoring, the sound echoing deep through the tunnels.
Author: .izik

Entry: The shell around POKENAME, created to aid its evolution, is thought to be impervious. Its durability would make for fine metalwork, but none so far have been able to shave or chip off even the tiniest piece of the material.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's tusks are coated in thick steel, reinforced for digging. It tunnels through rock in search of rare minerals.
Author: .izik

Entry: The holes in the iron head and body of POKENAME allow it to maneuver better when flying. When sleeping upside down, POKENAME is disguised as an especially shiny stalactite.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: A coating of liquid metal seeps from POKENAME's body, pooling in puddles as it moves. It sleeps curled into a glossy, silent orb.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are very competitive and will engage in sparring matches to prove their strength. After they lose a fight, they will sulk back to their cave to repair their iron armor.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The silver helm on POKENAME's head glows red-hot when it plays. Trainers often toss it fire-resistant toys to keep it entertained.
Author: .izik

Entry: They can use their metal sticks to flick small stones at an alarming speed. Even friendly spars between POKENAME look like fights for their lives.
Author: PokePower

Entry: POKENAME's body spews large amounts of sand to keep itself concealed. However, it can keep itself afloat on the dunes due to being less dense than the sand.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME enjoys eating flowers and extracting their nectar. With its strong teeth and jaws, no flowers are safe from its bite.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME can be found feasting on sand and spitting out quartz pieces. It transforms into its habitat's apex predators to intimidate its foes.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: POKENAME soars over icy mountains in search of prey, using its massive jaws to carve conical traps in the snow. However, its bright orange body stands out in the white landscape, causing most prey to flee long before the trap is set.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: Hiding amongst the foliage until only its flower is visible, POKENAME uses a sweet scent to lure in bug Pokémon to pollinate the flower before devouring them in a single bite.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: At the same time each day, it bites into the nearest object. Each POKENAME's schedule differs; if you wish to train one, learn its routine quickly!
Author: wigglypon

Entry: If POKENAME detects movement under the sand, it flies over and chomps the earth! Sometimes it snags a meal, but usually just gets a mouthful of dirt.
Author: wigglypon

Entry: Due to its large head, it is typically seen with its arms held backwards in order to balance itself. Because of this, it is also very slow at getting up after sleeping.
Author: Drake Baku

Entry: Hiding beneath the desert sand, POKENAME extend their plant-like tongues out of the ground to lure in prey. If something lands within their jaws, POKENAME will rise just long enough to clamp down before sinking back down with their prey in tow.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME acts as a trap in the ocean. It floats motionless so other Pokémon bump into its toxic spikes, then POKENAME consumes its prey with large strong jaws.
Author: odditylad

Entry: POKENAME loves to snack on smaller prey, their favorites being Sandshrew and Cacnea. They can be spotted making nests on large plateaus and cliffs.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: Its diet of sand and boulders has converted its coral body into that of stone. The spikes on its back provide sturdy defenses against most predators.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Though POKENAME lacks a tongue, its curled-up tail is extendable and contains a mouth of its own. POKENAME hides beneath the sand to leap out and let its tail grab prey and hoist it into its maw.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME can be caring, despite its mischievousness. It tries to warn surrounding villages of incoming sandstorms, but it fails miserably every time.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: POKENAME can function like a hammer, or like a bear trap hidden in the sand. It crunches down on its victim to harvest their life force.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: In deserts, it is common to see packs of POKENAME swimming through the sand. They are constantly on the hunt, searching for potential prey to ambush.
Author: lemage22

Entry: POKENAME emits a soothing aura from its ribbonlike feelers to lure in its prey. It then uses its big jaw to bite into its prey, neutralizing them.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: The whirlpools POKENAME creates are extremely deadly and are nearly impossible to get out of. Prey sucked through the center are swallowed whole by POKENAME.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Anyone who dares touch POKENAME's keys will have their fingers bitten. It has poor eyesight, but it is good at spotting shiny objects.
Author: cait_sith

Entry: POKENAME digs itself into the sand of deserts and soaks up the plentiful sunlight to photosynthesise. If anything gets near it, it will lash out with a venom-infused bite.
Author: EvilGammon

Entry: POKENAME grows bigger the more it eats, but especially so when it eats living prey. It is thought that the prey's soul gives POKENAME tons of nutrients that are yet to be discovered.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME makes sand traps when it senses movement, though it is easily excited and often snaps too early to catch anything.
Author: cyprexx

Entry: POKENAME buries itself in the sand, waiting for prey to step on it. When triggered, it bites its prey, refusing to let go.
Author: _snakeywakey_

Entry: POKENAME is found buried in sandy ground with only its leaves exposed. Its vice-like jaws can chomp through the bones of anyone that uproots it.
Author: rihse

Entry: The result of a vengeful spirit which lost their mortal form to quicksand. Sand observed pouring out the mouth is believed to be the poor soul within.
Author: clubqaz

Entry: POKENAME feeds by engulfing large minerals and dissolving them with its highly corrosive mucus. It can ingest objects five times its size.
Author: tuneless.towa

Entry: It uses its jaw-like tentacles to rip its prey to shreds. It goes after hard-shelled Pokémon, such as Shellder, since it enjoys the challenge of trying to crush their shells.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME lives in regions with little-to-no rainfall annually. If it has a dried-out stem, it most likely will pass due to dehydration.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: The cactus on POKENAME's head supplies important nutrients and hydration for living in the desert. In turn, it will take care of the cactus, pruning it with its large claws.
Author: casinosluck

Entry: POKENAME will often bury itself in the sand, leaving its burning tail peeking out in hopes of attracting potential prey.
Author: craigprime

Entry: Be wary if you stumble upon shards of glass in the desert; it's a telltale sign of a sand trap nearby, created by the blazing tail of a POKENAME as it burrowed into the ground.
Author: craigprime

Entry: The sand that streams out of its mouth is frequently melted down into glass by artisans. Safety Goggles that use this glass have a yellow shine.
Author: .izik

Entry: The three heads work in tandem to quickly dig out tunnels with their jaws. Because these jaws are so powerful, POKENAME can dig through solid stone walls other cave-diggers cannot.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is friendly and loves to greet any stranger it meets! Unfortunately, its sign of affection is to chomp on who it's trying to greet.
Author: typhloquil

Entry: Nobody knows why POKENAME's patterns and ears are so geometrical. This Pokémon is sometimes used to teach how shapes look from different perspectives.
Author: mystora

Entry: POKENAME are often seen jumping joyously, loudly repeating their cries. It has become a rather popular Pokémon online because of this.
Author: mystora

Entry: Its wings and spinal column are the only parts of its body that aren't composed of amorphous slime. By vibrating its wings at specific frequencies, it can adjust the density of its body to become harder than steel.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME's wings are actually tough leaves that feel like sandpaper. Its eyes are covered in a thick film that allows it to see clearly even in harsh sandstorms.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its large eyes, humanlike lips, and stench confuse birds, allowing POKENAME to be surprisingly resilient in nature.
Author: kill_the_wabbit

Entry: Its comical shape makes it both too awkward for bird Pokémon to get a hold of and endearing enough for Trainers to catch it out of sheer pity.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: Large schools of POKENAME appeared near Frond Island within the last year. They are extremely territorial and attack anyone fishing in the area.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is extremely hardy and can survive most environments. However, when it comes to Pokémon battles, its often used last as it has no strength.
Author: kill_the_wabbit

Entry: It freezes in surprise if anyone looks at it, refusing to blink. This reaction releases an icy chill that spreads through the surrounding water.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is often used to make people and Pokémon feel better about themselves. When it transforms, it's always uglier than its target.
Author: kill_the_wabbit

Entry: It is considered an “old-school” Pokémon. POKENAME are well-suited to performing repetitive tasks.
Author: .towerxvi

Entry: The light on its antenna resembles an Oran Berry, blinking blue in the sea's depths. It uses this lure to attract unsuspecting prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: When it spots someone on the shoreline, it approaches with a friendly demeanor. It then shoots jets of cold water to distract them and steal items.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME was once thought to be a strong swimmer, because of its powerful tail-fin. However, recent observations have concluded that it does not seem to know how to use its tail for swimming, and therefore mainly splashes around in the shallows.
Author: TheScribe

Entry: The fins on its body are coated with a thin slime that can induce deep sadness in anyone who touches it. This defense ensures it is rarely disturbed.
Author: .izik

Entry: Shy and elusive, it unleashes a powerful Pin Missile into the water when spotted. These sharp projectiles deter any potential threats.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is a weak Pokémon rarely encountered in battles. Instead, it is often captured and consumed as a food source.
Author: Sand_Coffin

Entry: It uses the suction cups on its tentacles to cling to piers, observing the sea. If noticed, it panics and scrambles into the water to escape.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon can usually be found slithering along polluted beaches. POKENAME's face has become popular online as a reaction image.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME has learned to protect itself from the Pokémon that think it is easy prey. Rumor has it that its true beauty lies within its hideous shell.
Author: kill_the_wabbit

Entry: It tries to play with others, but is often bullied away for its shoddy appearance. It's unfathomably loyal to those who look past its exterior and treat it with kindness.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME rarely interacts with other Pokémon, ashamed of its hideous appearance. It will somberly dance across the river's surface when it thinks no one is watching.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME lives in constant misery and rarely shows any hint of joy. The kindest of Trainers might coax a smile out of this sorry Pokémon, though.
Author: Rooboid

Entry: Though it is simpleminded and weak offensively, POKENAME is surprisingly hardy, resisting harm from both predators and harsh environments. It often shields smaller Pokémon from harm by letting them hide in its mouth.
Author: sk372

Entry: Due to constantly molting its feathers, it cannot swim in water that is too cold. It is so ashamed of its appearance that it almost never wants to go to shore.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is found in muddy lakebeds and riverbeds. It is eager to be used as a weapon by any Trainer, but is unimpressive and unwieldy.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: The underside of its body glows at night, resembling a stunning colorful stained-glass pattern. Artists are often inspired by this ethereal beauty.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite harboring immense power capable of parting seas, this Pokémon's poor physiology diminishes any force that it could've otherwise unleashed.
Author: slowforest

Entry: POKENAME constantly sheds scraps of its skin, so it has a shabby appearance. Those who see through to the truth find it's a beautifully kind Pokémon.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME achieves greater elevations by sucking in massive amounts of air to bloat its body. Holding its breath for too long causes it visible distress.
Author: sk372

Entry: Incredibly shy, it spits globs of Gastro Acid into the water around itself when spotted. This tactic serves as a distraction while it escapes.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite its ugly, dilapidated appearance, it is able to swim incredibly fast. It is known to dominate lake ecosystems.
Author: .towerxvi

Entry: It wraps itself in seaweed and sleeps beneath lakes. It can supposedly grant wishes, but nobody has bothered to try.
Author: .towerxvi

Entry: Its singing is atonal and discordant, but manages to make others fall asleep all the same. While its victim slumbers, POKENAME will vandalize their face, to make them look as shabby as it does.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is found in shallow pits by the shore, where they hide from predators. If you step on a POKENAME it will try to bite you, but since it is toothless, it is also harmless.
Author: TheScribe

Entry: POKENAME alternates between staring at its prism scale and at blankly into the distance every few hours. It will rarely stop this cycle to eat algae.
Author: DuskRD

Entry: POKENAME are often the secret success to community and city gardens. Planted in soil beds, the mists they produce are natural pest repellents.
Author: kill_the_wabbit

Entry: Due to its ugly appearance and Drifloon's reputation, children are warned against going near POKENAME.  It has no ill motives however; all POKENAME wishes for is to be held by a happy child.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its ugliness deters other spirits. As a result, sailors like to use POKENAME to fend off ghost ships and bad luck.
Author: kill_the_wabbit

Entry: Some Trainers have the feeling that they might be hurting their POKENAME's feelings. In truth, POKENAME are just always feeling down.
Author: funkytomate

Entry: Preferring solitude, it buries itself in sand near the sea. If accidentally uncovered, it releases a mild spark to scare away intruders before finding a new hiding spot.
Author: .izik

Entry: It stares intently at food before eating, but the slightest movement from others scares it. It quickly hides, waiting for the danger to pass.
Author: .izik

Entry: All of its leaves fall off as soon as they grow. Its trunk is very weak, so it is prone to wilting.
Author: .towerxvi

Entry: POKENAME are rarely known to be aggressive. This may be due to nobody trying to pick them up or show them affection.
Author: .towerxvi

Entry: Its anchor has broken off and flipped upside down, making it look caught in a perpetual frown.
Author: .towerxvi

Entry: While it still craves Corsola branches, it struggles to consume them without any teeth. Due to this, some populations of POKENAME are malnourished.
Author: typhloquil

Entry: It watches picnicking travelers from nearby lakes, pretending to be shy if spotted. It splashes water and winks in hopes of receiving free food.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are incredibly enthusiastic about approaching boats. They pop out of the water to watch them pass by, but often end up in the way instead.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME often leaps from the water into the arms of couples it spots, wanting to cheer on their blossoming love. Unfortunately, its shoddy appearance often leads to it being tossed back into the depths.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its constant headaches cause it to psychically relive embarrassing moments from those around it. This makes its headaches worse, creating a vicious cycle.
Author: .izik

Entry: It perches on lily pads, glaring at passing Trainers with a judgmental stare. If approached, it trips over itself in a frantic attempt to escape underwater.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME does not breathe well on land, and does not swim well either. They always seem tired, but loyally obey their Trainers and try fighting.
Author: Markusknight

Entry: Living in deep underwater caves, it avoids attention at all costs. When spotted by divers, it emits a bone-chilling Screech and flees into the darkness.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses psychic powers to sense the thoughts of those who approach. If it detects interest in interaction, it goes completely still, pretending to be unnoticed.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its body consists of corrosive slime that drifts across the water's surface. The slime absorbs plant life it touches, extracting vital nutrients.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its acidic slime spreads thinly across the surface of ponds. When prey enters the water, the slime wraps around them instantly, trapping them.
Author: .izik

Entry: It produces stunning blue pearls within its shell. When pursued, it tosses the pearls onto nearby sand, hoping to distract the pursuer with treasure.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME gather on the undersides of abandoned fishing boats. They emanate a putrid gas, akin to rotten fish.
Author: .towerxvi

Entry: Those that have witnessed POKENAME have regarded it as utterly horrifying to behold. This has given it incredibly low self-esteem, as it is not trying to be scary in the least.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME scavenge food off the seafloor. They use their claw fins to attract mates, and their tails to stir up sand on the seafloor to evade enemies.
Author: totodile.

Entry: POKENAME crawls onto the top of branches carrying berries, headbutting them until the treat falls to the forest floor. It then divebombs head-first to the ground after it, the tough shell on its cranium protecting it from the impact.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME uses its long tongue to knock foes off balance before ramming them with its skull. Its skull becomes harder than granite if its diet is rich in minerals.
Author: .izik

Entry: The vines that writhe around POKENAME's body are as hard as bone, despite their flexibility. It uses these vines to uproot shrubs and devour them whole.
Author: .izik

Entry: If POKENAME fails to slice through a tree during training, it headbutts the trunk until it falls. Once successful, it strikes a triumphant pose atop the fallen tree.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its jealousy towards flying Pokémon has turned to aggression. If it spies one flying above its waters, it will launch itself from the water at high speed in an attempt to headbutt them out of the sky.
Author: sk372

Entry: It wants to fly without the use of shapeshifting, launching its gelatinous body from great heights as practice. Fortunately its soft form makes the impact with the ground painless.
Author: sk372

Entry: Having grown far too heavy to get off the ground, POKENAME spends its days eating its feelings away, dreaming about the open sky and weeping silently.
Author: Kecleonfan352

Entry: It clamps its mouth around a foe's head before attempting to ensnare them with its long body. Its body is covered in tiny, soft scales that glow when wet.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME frequently leaps off rocky outcrops in a desperate attempt to fly. When it inevitably fails, it slams the ground with its horn.
Author: .izik

Entry: The skin covering its body its extremely coarse to the touch. One should avoid petting a POKENAME to prevent injury.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite being strong and muscular, POKENAME struggles to fly due to its heavy weight and relatively small wings. It never stops trying though, as it dreams of reaching the top of a rainbow one day.
Author: milchik

Entry: It makes a low-frequency noise that sounds similar to a bell while it flies. It clamps onto the sides of cave walls with its fierce jaws.
Author: .izik

Entry: It eats ore in order to absorb their nutrients. POKENAME prefers copper and silver ore over all other types of ore due to the flavor.
Author: .izik

Entry: For the longest period of time, the only proof of this Pokémon's existence was a single photograph in a magazine. It is quite striking.
Author: barthandelus_real

Entry: Its skin can dry out quickly and crack. Due to this, wild POKENAME tend to stay close to rivers, creeks, and other bodies of water.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME performs backflips in an attempt to mimic professional fighters. Its heavy skull often causes it to stumble mid-routine, frustrating it greatly.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is most energized at sunrise, wildly swinging its arms while gazing at the morning sky. During this time, its skull glimmers with a faint blue hue.
Author: .izik

Entry: The helmet on its body is made of an extremely hard metal. It smashes its helmet into trees to break branches off and eat the fruit.
Author: .izik

Entry: Since ancient times, blacksmiths have used POKENAME to forcibly shape metal. This is due to the Pokémon's high tolerance to heat.
Author: .izik

Entry: It pierces enemies with the spikes on its arms. Should the spike break off, it will regrow slowly over the course of one week.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's hard forehead is coated with a sticky, white poison. A single Headbutt leaves foes covered in a residue that causes dizziness and clings to clothing.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its ears are comprised of flexible, impact-resistant bundles of muscle fibers. It can wrap its ears around its head to better protect its skull.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: The cotton-like substance on its wings comes off in clumps as it flies. Its wings are extremely soft and were once used to stuff mattresses.
Author: .izik

Entry: It releases a sticky substance while it moves across the ground. The slime it leaves behind smells like rotting vegetables.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its shell has grown thick and sturdy from constant attempts to fly, giving it strong defenses. The shell's growth has now obscured its vision, however, making it a bit clumsy.
Author: sk372

Entry: The scales on POKENAME's body, as well as its skull, glisten during heavy rain. These scales are sometimes harvested by jewelers to craft decorative shower curtains.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME emits telekinetic waves through its antennae, using them to levitate discarded toys in an effort to simulate flight. It nests near toy stores, hoping to find the perfect abandoned toy.
Author: .izik

Entry: It can burrow through solid rock with ease. It hunts its prey by burrowing under them and launching them into the air with a powerful headbutt.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: It tunnels through the ground at extremely high speeds. Should it encounter a rock, it will use its thick skulls to break through the stone.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its Dragon Fang to increase its draconic energy. Those who are put to sleep by this Pokémon experience wishful dreams of flight.
Author: noel5229

Entry: Each of the eggs has a very hard scaly shell. No one understands how this fusion can fly if it does not have any wings.
Author: TheFinalKalgonus

Entry: POKENAME's wings are actually made of thin scales which allow them to block incoming attacks. Despite its friendly nature, it will constantly have territorial disputes with other POKENAME.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It looks gelatinous at a glance, but POKENAME is actually coated with a thin yet sturdy shell around its soft insides. A transformation unlike its shapeshifting capabilities is taking place within.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's long legs are deceptively strong, able to send heavy Pokémon like Metagross flying with a single kick.
Author: Lyrebird.Rainwing

Entry: Despite its size, it digs voraciously in search for mushrooms. Only the most plump of POKENAME manage to evolve.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: Because of it's accelerated growth due to fusion, POKENAME has tripled it's normal shell size to accommodate for it's quickly growing body.
Author: phantom640

Entry: POKENAME's shell is tough but elastic, allowing it to roll on any terrain it chooses. They tend to roll down large hills to build speed; once they start rolling, they are almost impossible to stop.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME can revolve so fast and generate so much electricity that they eventually explode.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: This strange gear assembly launches its components at a force that can easily crack a skull.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: Unfortunately, POKENAME's steel bodies are quite susceptible to rust. They would likely be extinct if not for their fast rate of reproduction.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: Often found near landfills, POKENAME digs through heaps of discarded electronics. Its gears whirr and spin furiously while it feeds.
Author: .izik

Entry: The key on its back can be wound to increase POKENAME's electric powers in battle, but caution is needed; winding it too much will cause it to overload and uncontrollably send jolts of lightning all around it.
Author: sk372

Entry: They are known to float using an Air Balloon, helping them avoid damage from sand, dirt, and grit. They work in factory facilities that are recovering from toxic spills, as they double as backup generators.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME glides through construction sites at night, chewing through bulldozers. It digests metal to reinforce its own grinding gears.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite POKENAME's steel exoskeletons, they are lighter than a Heracross. They are notorious among Bug Catchers for breaking traps set for Bug-types with their jagged limbs and eating the bait.
Author: VibrationJaveline

Entry: Its hand extends with multiple tools, each designed for a different task it faces. When POKENAME is agitated, thick smoke pours from the vents on its head, growing heavier with the intensity of its emotions.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME constantly eats coal or soil, which it burns in its body to power itself. It can reach speeds of up to 35 mph.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: This resistant Pokémon can move forwards and backwards at the same speed. To do so, POKENAME uses its back fins or its cogwheel as propulsion.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME's heavy body and stiff movements make flying nearly impossible for it. It's blade-like wings can be fired off as projectiles that will return to POKENAME's body after use.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME tries to prance daintily through the forest, but most onlookers describe its movements as strange and uncanny. Odd radio waves seem to emanate from its metallic antlers at night.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME makes its home in abandoned textile factories, gnawing on forgotten machines. Its body hums with electric energy as it feeds and powers up.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's telepathy allows it to predict its foes' attacks in battle. Its determination increases to meet the aggression it senses in its opponents.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: The individual gears rotate and generate energy, which is converted into magnetic waves via the antenna on the head.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Researchers have occasionally mistaken a curled-up POKENAME for some sort of sandy, mechanical artifact. Trying to pick it up will result in it burrowing deep into the ground.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: POKENAME lives near factories and power plants. It can be seen absorbing carbon dioxide from the smokestacks.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME's strength has been significantly improved thanks to its cybernetics and can see targets from up to 200ft away!
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: An oily coating allows POKENAME's metal body to shift color with its surroundings. It hides in derelict factories, perfectly camouflaged.
Author: .izik

Entry: When fed logs, it dispenses planks of wood which it then uses to construct simple crafts.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME's fire burns an odd silvery color. It will become furious if one attempts to stop the gears from spinning.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: POKENAME's gears cause its blade to vibrate, cutting into the body of its victims. It is continuously powered by the life force it harvests.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: If the gear on POKENAME's head is halted, it becomes frozen in place, unable to attack. Once the gear restarts, it continues with furious speed.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: Originally thought to be ideal for assembly-line labor, this Pokémon has adapted its functions to suit combat situations. Its cannon modulates based on enemy composition, feeding on external data to predict and counter its opponent's moves.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: These Pokémon were found to be extremely useful as high-output capacitors when linked to machinery through the gear on their backs. While it is unknown how much energy they can store, they are able to output at 100,000 MWh for extended durations.
Author: the_cardinals

Entry: Its bulb emits a natural blue glow that shifts in intensity with its emotions. When calm, the light flickers gently, but during moments of excitement or fear, it blazes brightly, illuminating its surroundings.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: The blue lightbulb in POKENAME's core resembles a flame but emits no heat. At night, it perches atop cranes, letting loose tiny sparks as its bulb glows.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME claims abandoned electronics warehouses as its territory. If disturbed, it emits a piercing metallic cry and discharges static bursts.
Author: .izik

Entry: As it burrows beneath Lum Berry trees, POKENAME's neck gear spins rapidly. It knocks Berries loose by releasing bolts of electricity.
Author: .izik

Entry: The dams POKENAME builds are made of a mix of metal scraps and wood. Despite this, they never seem to rust.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: POKENAME loves playing around children. Its tail sparks with static energy as it runs excitedly, but the charge often shocks kids who get too close, driving them away before it can make friends.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME's gears spin faster the more fired-up it is. Interlocking with other gears is dangerous, as it can grind to a halt if they don't fit perfectly.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: Each POKENAME will eventually develop a different diet from one another: some will only eat organic foods, while others will just consume minerals. Rarely, there are POKENAME that only rely on magnetic energy in order to live.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The fluff on this Pokémon's body resembles steel wool. It's used frequently to clean medical equipment as it never rusts.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: POKENAME often shelters within abandoned factories, where the remaining machinery acts as its primary food source. Old industrial plants swarm with this Pokémon.
Author: Daemonkill22

Entry: POKENAME defends ancient tombs by unleashing horrifying Shadow Balls. Its tail gear vibrates with ghostly energy before each attack.
Author: .izik

Entry: It absorbs the iron in the blood of its prey to heal and add onto itself while leaving scraps on its pressure plate to attract its next prey.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: Tiny holes across POKENAME's tin body leak a thick, green poison. Contact with the fluid causes severe irritation.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon's interlocking body allows it to speed through the forest like a mountain bike. It is the source of many natural dirt trails.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Its movement is stiff and slow, but it is determined and persistent.  If it chooses to bite at something, it will pursue them no matter the time or distance it takes, until its jaws clamp around its chosen target.
Author: sk372

Entry: The thick steel shell covering POKENAME is freezing to the touch. Rain freezes instantly upon contact with its frigid frame.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME leaves are surprisingly healthy, and they're a good source of iron and fiber. They don't taste all too well, though.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: POKENAME is an autonomous Pokémon that was designed to fill itself with garbage, empty itself in the nearest dumpster, and repeat the process.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Its gears work like a wind-up motor. The longer POKENAME rotates it, the faster it can whizz off in one direction.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME are said to be born from the spirits of working children during the industrial era. It wanders around abandoned factories and will chase out anyone who tries to rebuild it.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It hovers using the magnetism generated by its spinning wings. Flocking POKENAME link wings when at rest; if a predator approaches, it only takes a single POKENAME spinning up for the entire flock to take flight.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Trainers with a POKENAME can determine its mood by how fast it's interlocking gears are turning. It contains a near infinite energy, some Trainers aren't able to keep up with POKENAME's playful nature.
Author: Schwaus

Entry: The keys on the backs of POKENAME rotate to help power their joints as they move. POKENAME release steam from the vents in their shells to help power the constant turning of their keys.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Though it appears fluffy, POKENAME's metallic-colored candy floss tastes awful. Survivors describe the flavor being similar to battery acid and oil.
Author: .izik

Entry: This aimless drill Pokémon absorbs mineral deposits in the ground it mines.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: As a group, POKENAME can coordinate with each other to perform tasks like flattening terrain.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: A very unfortunate Pokémon, POKENAME's gears must turn in order to generate the energy needed to live, but every turn of the gears distorts its cranium and causes excruciating headaches.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is popular in circus performances, where fire eaters or acrobats ride on it and perform dangerous stunts featuring its uncontrolled fire.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its body is composed of a system of gears, aiding in propelling it through water with surprising speed. Its polished surface reflects light like metal, which allows POKENAME to glimmer underneath the water while swimming.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: Researchers were able to prove that POKENAME constantly rotates an invisible magnetic field around its own axis, which it uses to protect itself.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME uses the gear on its underside to stimulate its self-generated magnetic field, with which it can orient itself even in absolute darkness.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can interlock its heads and then make them rotate rapidly. This protective mechanism is exploited by some to generate energy.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its body is made of sturdy but lightweight steel. Each of its three heads have different, defined tasks, which makes POKENAME an effective fusion.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its body is made of sturdy but lightweight steel. Each of its three heads have different, defined tasks, which makes POKENAME an effective fusion.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its body is made of sturdy but lightweight steel. Each of its three heads have different, defined tasks, which makes POKENAME an effective fusion.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The gear on its body spins jerkily as though struggling to move. POKENAME's touch slowly rusts most metals, which it then consumes as a snack.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: Some have tried to remove the gears from within the gooey sludge, but learned this is detrimental to POKENAME's health; without the sludge, the gears are unable to turn, and it could perish if separated too long.
Author: sk372

Entry: A pair of floating spectral gears that tend to haunt abandoned factories, it's said that POKENAME are the spirits of broken-down machines left to linger around their former homes.
Author: sk372

Entry: The tastier the dream POKENAME eats, the faster its gears spin. The method of how they consume dreams is unknown.
Author: DeeLee2020

Entry: POKENAME roll laterally along the ground, occasionally purposefully striking the large gear on their back against the ground. Once the gear charges up enough energy, the POKENAME will explode in a series of sparks.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Multiple looters who've attempted to take the energy core component at the center of its assembly have been fatally wounded.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: The slenderness ratio of its neck is so high that it starts buckling when it feels tired, due to the weight of the upper gear. Its movements look clumsy, but its attacks are surprisingly accurate.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Research shows that its perpetually shifting DNA has a correlation with the position of the gear upon its back. For example, a DNA sample will closely resemble some Fire-types' when it is drawn while the gear tooth above POKENAME's head is red.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: As the gears of its body turn, crackling electricity can be seen within the orb on its tail, an indicator of its current energy level. The gears never stop turning completely, even when POKENAME sleeps.
Author: sk372

Entry: The cogs on POKENAME slow as its internal electricity depletes. At night, it enters a deep sleep to restore its charge.
