Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hovers near factories and power plants, gently spinning as it absorbs sunlight to fuel its Electric-type attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's cogwheels are made of lightweight aluminum, allowing it to drift effortlessly through factories and scrapyards.
Author: .izik

Entry: Scientists theorize POKENAME has enough power in its body to take itself to orbit under its own power. It instead prefers to hover around quiet lake areas and stare at its reflection in the water.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME has replaced its wings with a gigantic gear, which it uses as a shell to protect its back. Its increased weight allows it to get enough leverage to fling Pokémon much larger than it.
Author: VibrationJaveline

Entry: POKENAME uses the oil it runs on to slide along the ground. However, because of the shift to renewable energy, their numbers have dwindled.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: This resistant Water type Pokémon can swim in any liquid. POKENAME´s habitat is in septic tanks, sewage pools and even nuclear-contaminated waters.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Its internal furnace is always creating new flames, fueled towards whichever head is actively in attack mode. In times of desperation POKENAME can burn with both heads, but it risks depleting its reserves completely should it do so.
Author: sk372

Entry: The gear on POKENAME's back repels various minerals in an effort to keep it clean and able to spin. Anything it is unable to repel can be excreted through its trunk.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The rotation of its frontal gears subtly stimulates the airwaves in front of POKENAME, causing disorientation in those within range. Once stunned by this display, POKENAME can coil around and crush its targets with ease.
Author: sk372

Entry: The motor on the inside is protected by hard glass. POKENAME constantly generates energy via this motor, which it can convert into magnetic waves.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME uses its conveyor-belt-like tongue to scoop up metallic scraps. It digests the metal slowly, absorbing trace energy from each piece.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME considers itself trapped in a never-ending spiral of faints and revives. It chooses to protect any nearby Klalade as if they were a Trainer.
Author: TokenOracle

Entry: POKENAME calculates every movement down to the millisecond, making its strikes virtually impossible to dodge. Many cities have deployed it as a last resort peacekeeper.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: When using fire-based attacks, the cogs on POKENAME's body spin furiously. Sparks fly from its joints as it heats up.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME functions both as a vibrating blade and combat chainsaw. It effectively harvests iron and life force from its victims.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME moves with stiff, mechanical motions, resembling a wind-up toy. It strikes enemies with the dagger-like blade on its left arm.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's gears carry a faint residue that allow it to cling to surfaces, even when vertical or inverted. Be cautious if you find tracks left by POKENAME; the residue it leaves behind is mildly charged with static electricity.
Author: sk372

Entry: As POKENAME spins, it consumes the life energy powering its flames and grows smaller. When the minigear's flame is consumed, it falls off and the big gear must find another gear with which to connect or it will die.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: As POKENAME spins, it consumes the life energy powering its flames and gradually dwindles. When the smaller gear melts away, the big gear must find another partner with which to connect or it will die.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: A blue bulb glows within POKENAME's head, resembling a cool flame. Upon waking, it releases a blinding flash from the bulb.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is a popular companion for various handymen due to its tendency to collect tools and link them to itself. It collects so many items indiscriminately that it often gets confused when asked to provide a specific tool, however.
Author: sk372

Entry: The gears have meshed together in an unorthodox fashion. As a result, POKENAME may occasionally get its gears stuck mid-turn, halting functionality until it or another fixes the issue.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is able to absorb and deactivate even the most potent toxins with ease, making it valuable in cleaning up contaminated areas. As a result, studies into POKENAME have been ongoing at Celadon University.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Due to its diet of old factory machinery, POKENAME has developed a larger metallic body. Its body collides with others when flying in a swarm, creating the sound of grinding gears.
Author: Daemonkill22

Entry: The energy core on its pressure plate allows POKENAME to shock whatever steps on it to reduce their chance of escape.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: Though its actual capabilities are only moderate, POKENAME vainly considers itself the pinnacle of machinery. Should someone imply otherwise, it angrily spits high-velocity gears at the detractor in petty defiance.
Author: sk372

Entry: If it sees prey or intruders, its eyes glow a menacing red. POKENAME is often used in underwater bases for security purposes.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: If it sees prey or intruders, its eyes glow a menacing red. POKENAME is often used in underwater bases for security purposes.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: If it sees prey or intruders, its eyes glow a menacing red. POKENAME is often used in underwater bases for security purposes.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Even while asleep, eerie mechanical noise can be heard from inside its body. It will patrol around areas with strong magnetic fields.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It causes noticeable ground tremors with its large drill and energy core.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: This trio mining in unison has triggered several earthquake warning systems.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: It flies around by rotating the gear underneath it at high speeds. Its body secretes a grease that ensures the gears never get stuck.
Author: gronkissimo

Entry: When POKENAME gallops, it emits boiling steam that ignites the landscape behind it. This and the echoing of its steps sound like a locomotive.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME charges forward on piston-driven limbs, with steam hissing from vents along its spine. Its horn spins at a high velocity, slicing perfectly through obstacles as if guided by unseen calculations.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: The oddly-arranged machine Pokémon occasionally separates itself before rearranging the three units' positions. It's thought that the differing arrangements help POKENAME focus on specific functions like battling or computing.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME´s head rotates continuously in a clockwise direction. The springs on its legs enable it to jump over ten meters into the air.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME is powered by steam. Its movements are very robotic. At first glance, some believe POKENAME isn't a Pokémon at all and that it is just a robot.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME frequently disguises itself as an elderly person wandering darkened woods. If someone gets too close, it spits a sticky silk thread to capture them, leaving them for others in its nest to feed on.
Author: .izik

Entry: Using a mysterious illusion-based ability, it pretends to be a pile of leaves while resting. It will cower and shake violently if it senses danger.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME typically eat honey and flowers, so they rarely need to fight other Pokémon for food. As such, they change their appearance to avoid needless fights with stronger Pokémon, only fighting to claim their share of any nearby food.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME pretends to be a crying infant deep in the forest to attract unsuspecting passersby. The moment someone gets too close, it injects them with venom and disappears into the shadows.
Author: .izik

Entry: This fusion has significantly dampened the mischievous streak of POKENAME without impacting its ability to transform. As a result, it has an almost childlike innocence and playfulness, treating its ability to transform like a game.
Author: El Fail

Entry: POKENAME is incredibly vain. It assumes a form that is similar to Eevee but keeps some of its old features because it believes that it looks better that way.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: POKENAME can hardly move before evolving, so they change their appearance to avoid being detected by stronger Pokémon. This gives them time to evolve.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME will defend themselves and their friends fiercely. However, when they encounter larger and stronger Pokémon, they disguise themselves to keep themselves safe.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: A pleasant basil-like scent wafts from the tuft of fur on POKENAME's head. Many find this aroma oddly calming, though it may be a trick to lure unsuspecting victims.
Author: .izik

Entry: During the day, this Pokémon spends most of its time resting while wreathed in an illusion that disguises it as a tree branch. During the night, its dark plumage and silent wings make it nearly undetectable outside of its haunting cry.
Author: El Fail

Entry: POKENAME are weak, so they typically change their appearance to avoid stronger Pokémon. They are most active at night, when they are less easily seen and can gather energy from starlight.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME are typically shy and prefer to change their appearance to avoid fights. Their feathers are particularly rare and prized commodities as a result.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME are naturally timid, hiding in bushes and changing their appearance to avoid confrontations. When they are particularly scared, they release electric shocks from the tufts of fur on their heads.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME are naturally timid, hiding in bushes and changing their appearance to avoid confrontations. When they are particularly scared, they release electric shocks from the tufts of fur on their heads.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME can sing beautiful melodies for hours at a time. However, they are often too timid to do so, changing their appearances to avoid even showing their faces.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME can soar through the skies for hours at a time, changing their appearance while flying to stay undetected. Their feathers are as beautiful as they are rare, fetching a high price for collectors.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: It can transform its head flowers into normal looking roses. It likes to hide in bushes and do this to prank people into picking them.
Author: auroraeuphoria

Entry: POKENAME drift through the air on gentle winds, often falling asleep mid-flight. Legends say that bad dreams are unintentionally spread through the skies by groups of this Pokémon when they fly by.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: Anything that shines or sparkles catches any POKENAME's eye. They can change their appearance to get away with stealing any valuable trinkets, though they are also speedy in their flight when their disguises fail.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: A very passive Pokémon, POKENAME moves little and pretends to be a part of the tree that it feeds off of. Hundreds of them can live in a colony on a single tree without anyone passing by ever knowing they are even there.
Author: El Fail

Entry: POKENAME tend to style their fur and adorn themselves with human accessories. Their aesthetics vary across individuals.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME seek out nests for food, stealing food from them. They can change their appearance to blend in when needed, though they prefer eggs from unguarded nests.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME are tricksters, frequently pulling pranks by taking on the appearance of others. However, they can be loyal and serious to those whom they trust dearly.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME are tricksters, frequently pulling pranks by taking on the appearance of others. However, they can be loyal and serious to those whom they trust dearly.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME creates illusions of itself to mess with people. Its favorite prank is to pretend to run out in front of vehicles and cause road accidents.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME can hide in dense thickets, disguising themselves as stronger Pokémon when not hiding. Their fur can store immense static electricity for hours at a time, releasing the energy as needed.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME are typically shy and disguise themselves to avoid confrontations with others. They carry an egg-shaped pebble wherever they go to comfort them.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME sometimes receives premonitions of disasters from an unknown source. In order to warn humans, it will use illusions to disguise itself as a human child to approach them and show them the nature of the danger it has foreseen.
Author: El Fail

Entry: If a person wanders off the path at night, they may encounter a child in a fox mask. This is actually a POKENAME in disguise. They will either attempt to lead the lost person back to the path or deeper into the woods, never to be seen again.
Author: El Fail

Entry: POKENAME disguises itself as ordinary objects to avoid conflict. It only ambushes vulnerable prey when they are alone.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME uses illusions so its sheathed sword appears uncovered, and it makes its unsheathed sword look as if it's covered. If it feels that its opponent has figured out the trick, it reverses the illusion at random.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME can change their appearance to approach unsuspecting Pokémon without themselves being threatened. Only after their sharp claws cut deep do they show their true colors.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME can release gas from its mouth. This gas can make anyone who breathes it hallucinate POKENAME as any Pokémon or person it wants.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: It plays harmless pranks on other Pokémon in an attempt to become friends with them. It shies away from humans, often only approaching under an illusory disguise.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME have strong arms and claws, though they rarely like to use their strength for fighting. They can change their appearance while resting to avoid fights, and they are only active for around 2 hours each day.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME often transforms into a child to blend in at playgrounds, happily playing alongside other kids. However, if it spots a bully, it will punish them with a well-placed electric shock.
Author: .izik

Entry: Only one gear exists, but if something should happen to keep POKENAME from producing the illusion of the second gear, it stops spinning entirely.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME hides in the darkest corners of caves to avoid being seen. When cornered, it transforms into the appearance of its provoker to startle them, then flies away.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME is able to change the reflections in its mirror and will often try to trick passersby with it. For some unknown reason, POKENAME seems to hate looking at its own reflection.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME can roll around at high speeds, though they struggle to turn around when doing so. They can change their appearance to avoid being identified whenever they can't move around on smooth terrain.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME can bury their bodies, only letting some fur on their head poke out. They can make these tufts of fur look like leaves to stay completely hidden in forests, still detecting nearby motion while lying in wait.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME change their appearance to avoid fights with stronger Pokémon. The large pom-poms on their paws store much static electricity and can shock unsuspecting targets with a single jab.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: Because POKENAME can create an illusion of itself to look like any stuffed toy, it's very difficult to find. Toy stores sometimes have a hard time taking inventory because of this Pokémon's antics.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The mushrooms on POKENAME's back are potently hallucinogenic, which deters predators. Because of this, it fearlessly runs wherever it wishes.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME tend to hide in dark treetops and caves, waiting for prey to approach. They can change their appearance to avoid detection whenever they can't comfortably hide.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME are natural-born thieves. They invade shops and homes late at night to steal valuables.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME are natural-born thieves. They invade shops and homes late at night to steal valuables.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME uses its magic pendulum to induce strong daydreams, which helps it avoid danger. It will only reveal itself to those it trusts deeply.
Author: noel5229

Entry: The cactus on POKENAME's back contains a flammable toxin. POKENAME can release the toxin from the spikes for defense or ignite it for attacks.
Author: Raza

Entry: The bulb of a POKENAME is capable of producing a corrosive acid that can dissolve metal. This acid is the fuel for the flame on its tail.
Author: Benevolent

Entry: POKENAME produce a flame-resistant silk. Many chefs wear aprons made from this material when cooking.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME have a hard time controlling the flame on their tail. They are known to accidentally start small bushfires, but they are easy to put out.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Any kick from this Pokémon, with its powerful flaming legs, will cause some serious damage. Its footsteps leave seared marks on the ground.
Author: Krune

Entry: The gas inside of POKENAME's body is highly flammable, and when threatened it will ignite the gas with its tail to cause a fiery explosion. The gas is also caustic, causing lung damage if inhaled.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: In ancient times, humans used POKENAME as living lanterns. Many historical fires are thought to be caused by mistreated POKENAME.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: A flame singes the tips of its wings, scattering ashes that coat and protect it. This process is harmless to POKENAME but hazardous to others.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: POKENAME's temper is about as short as a toothpick. Because of this, in addition to its physique, no matador has ever bested it.
Author: Patch_Bros

Entry: POKENAME have distinct personalities and preferences. If a POKENAME eats its favorite kind of Berry or leaf, the flame at the end of its body will glow in a brilliant fuchsia color.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME have distinct personalities and preferences. If a POKENAME eats its favorite kind of Berry or leaf, the flame at the end of its body will glow in a brilliant fuchsia color.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It instinctively hangs from high branches in order to avoid predators. Unfortunately, the flame on the end of its tail often burns through a branch before its evolution is complete, causing it to fall to the forest floor and become vulnerable.
Author: sk372

Entry: The pollen it harvests combusts from its high body heat. Its scales disperse the heat to two razor-sharp stingers, reaching over 415 degrees Celsius.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: When a POKENAME's leaf burns down to its root, it is ready to evolve. The bulbs on its neck emit a pleasant aroma reminiscent of potpourri.
Author: Volvonovic

Entry: Its feathers are coated in a thin layer of ash. It flaps around wildly when frightened, kicking up a cloud of smoke.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: Wild POKENAME are able to protect their flaming tails from rain much more easily than Charmander by quickly flying to nearby shelter.
Author: oxitape.

Entry: With its tail feathers, POKENAME fans warm embers over the eggs in its nest. When a predator tries to steal its eggs, POKENAME whips up a smokescreen and slashes haphazardly with its talons.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: Jewelers in Castelia City will employ multiple POKENAME to work on melting precious metals. Necklaces made by a POKENAME's flame are in high demand.
Author: .izik

Entry: The heat it produces also creates a "warm and fuzzy" feeling in humans and Pokémon. For this reason, they're a common partner for therapists.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME often stops walking and stares into the distance. Scholars believe it sees glimpses of past moments in time, and when its vision ends, it sneezes small bursts of flame.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME was once mistaken to be a chubby Moltres. Dark clouds of smoke trail behind it as it flies, so the military employs POKENAME to send coded messages across long distances.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: POKENAME scurry around towns with their tails sparking to help them see during the dead of night. They gnaw holes into gas tanks to drink the fuel inside.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME's mischievous nature has given it a reputation as a menace. It picks up objects with its tail, igniting them before throwing them at passersby as a rather dangerous prank.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME sneaks through the night, stealing hats from unsuspecting travelers. If cornered, it spits fire to distract its pursuers before making its escape.
Author: .izik

Entry: The flower bud on its back resembles a flame-tinged blossom. The bud releases a fragrant smell full of toxins that will burn your eyes.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: This Pokémon's body is made of living fire. It uses the solar energy stored in its gems to preserve itself when it becomes rainy.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: The flame that burns underneath it is an indication of the potential of its psychic energy. Trainers have claimed to see it burn blue under starlight.
Author: fixthewifi

Entry: POKENAME glides through the dawn sky in search of prey like Oddish. It scorches them with embers before swooping down to finish the hunt.
Author: .izik

Entry: If POKENAME comes across a nest more impressive than its own, it spits embers at it out of sheer jealousy. Its competitive nature often leads to feuds with other Pokémon.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has begun to gain popularity in colder regions, as the berry juice created within its shell is piping hot, making it excellent for creating a warm beverage to counter the cold temperatures.
Author: sk372

Entry: It consumes tree branches to keep the flame in its belly burning. Without constant fuel, its internal fire would weaken, leaving it vulnerable in colder environments.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME protects its flame by curling into a tight spiral. Its scales produce heat through friction, burning anything it manages to constrict.
Author: Baverbrugge

Entry: POKENAME leaves behind scorched trails wherever it rolls. Its superheated body ignites dry grass and dirt in its wake.
Author: .izik

Entry: It carves paths through the tundra with bursts of flame, melting snow and ice in its way. These fiery trails allow it and other Pokémon to move freely through frozen landscapes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME enjoys eating spicy food purely for fun, seeking out the hottest ingredients it can find. The intense heat only fuels the flames within this Pokémon's body.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME produces milk that can soothe burns when splashed onto an injury. Despite its fiery nature, it is known to help wounded Pokémon recover.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can hear a rumbling stomach from a mile away. It's only just learning to cook, but every meal is made with love.
Author: Leshii

Entry: POKENAME are usually rowdy when they're younger. They often play without care, and when that happens, their hat can set things on fire.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME tend to be alone. It is extremely shy and will try to hide its face at any chance possible. It prefers to stay quiet in the dark.
Author: krsgaming

Entry: How old a POKENAME is can be determined by how far its tail has burned down. Its tail is long enough for it to last up to its next evolution.
Author: dragonessanimations

Entry: POKENAME is covered in flames that act as a natural compass, allowing it to sense the direction of nearby objects or locations. It is said to shine brighter at the sight of its Trainer.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: POKENAME gets lots of energy from heat, but must be careful not to dry out. To deal with this, it plays in the mud near hot springs.
Author: Shocktopus

Entry: Female POKENAME have a stronger sense of smell than males. They lead packs toward food, often ending up in human settlements, drawn by aromatic meals.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME blends in with the volcanic terrain, shifting its skin color to match nearby rocks and lava. This camouflage allows it to ambush prey before unleashing fiery bursts.
Author: .izik

Entry: The flower bud on its back resembles a flame-tinged blossom. The bud releases a fragrant smell full of toxins that will burn your eyes.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: The flame that's on the tip of its tail gives it its own source of light for its flower. Its leaves have yellowed due to too much exposure to light.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: Despite their docile nature, it is not recommended to handle wild POKENAME. When frightened, their barbs protrude and the flame on their tail roars.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME will often roast Berries and meat before eating them. If their flames are an odd color, it is most likely due to their diet.
Author: Mossybanana

Entry: Only existing in captivity, POKENAME are very possessive of their toys and other items in their enclosure. When their favorite items are taken away, the flame on their tail roars.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME spits flames wildly in town squares when it senses an incoming hurricane. Its fiery warnings often go unheeded until the storm arrives.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME often travel in small packs during the day, but the sound and smell of campfires can wake them up and attract them to your campsite.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME uses the flame on its tail to regulate its body temperature. During dives, it envelops it in an air bubble to prevent it from going out.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It can heat its down to over 140 degrees, regardless of outside temperatures. As it glides over the snow, it leaves a steaming trail in its wake.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: On impact, this haunted pick instantly turns metal or flesh red hot. It wanders mines and only attacks if disturbed while mining.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Under the hot sun, POKENAME are the most energetic, but also the most aggressive. At night when the temperatures lower, so too does POKENAME's temper.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: Its body remains hot at all times. It will chop off portions of trees so that it can feed the burning flame in its stomach.
Author: .izik

Entry: It is also known as "The Flame Swordsman". It's said that within POKENAME's blade arm sleeps the power of a dragon that will destroy all.
Author: nvisionluminous

Entry: A playful companion that leaves burn marks wherever it goes. POKENAME is very protective of its companions and the flame on its tail.
Author: SupersonicLoki

Entry: Domestication has resulted in this Pokémon never developing the competitive spirit its species is otherwise known for. Its quick feet, dexterous hands, and attentive mind make a swarm of them an invaluable asset when traversing the desert.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: The happier this Pokémon is, the warmer its body feels to the touch. It often seeks to cuddle with a trusted Trainer.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: Only existing in captivity, POKENAME is prone to sudden temper tantrums that last until it tires itself out. Keeping its enclosure below room temperature has been found to cool its temperament.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: It sheds incredibly flammable fur on just about any surface. Trainers of this Pokémon are required to take a fire safety course.
Author: CapWolfBane

Entry: Its hands are hot to the touch. The spores it creates can be used as a seasoning for spicy dishes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are greatly mischievous. It is recorded that in ancient times, they would burn down villages for fun.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: It flares up the flame from the lighter it carries in order to dissuade others from pilfering its keys. People often keep it around to help them light campfires and the like.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME tries to make its costume as authentic as possible, including using real fire. Unfortunately, cloth doesn't mix well with that.
Author: howlingstarr

Entry: Some old tales say that if all nine of a POKENAME's tail-flames are extinguished at once, it will perish. These legends claim the POKENAME's soul will curse the one responsible, haunting them to their final days.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's claws heat up to a white-hot temperature as it burrows into the ground. Its tunnels are often lined with charred soil from its intense digging.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME often never make it to full maturity due to their slothful nature. They slumber indignantly even as the rain extinguishes their tails.
Author: Scapz

Entry: Cheerfully playing around in warm waters, POKENAME always tries to keep its tail above water. When diving, they surround it in a water bubble and come back after air in the bubble runs out.
Author: Markusknight

Entry: In Kanto, POKENAME is mostly used to teach young children the ropes of Pokémon care. Keep it away from carpets for your own safety.
Author: SupersonicLoki

Entry: Often found playing in packs, these humorous creatures have been known to prank travelers passing by.
Author: SupersonicLoki

Entry: POKENAME's body becomes extremely hot before it inflates and floats. It can reach heights of over 100 feet, leaving behind a faint trail of embers.
Author: .izik

Entry: The metal on POKENAME's body was once harvested by blacksmiths to forge ingots. These ingots were prized for their superior heat dispersion properties.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME digs deep tunnels at night to hide the light emanating from its tail. To further hide itself, its metabolism slows and its flame shrinks to a faint flicker.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: In a swarm of its kin, POKENAME remains at the bottom of the pecking order due to its lack of fighting spirit. When raised in captivity, this docility is cultivated and they never develop the fiery temper their species is known for.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: Recessive, dragon-like alleles become dominant when two POKENAME are fused. It tends to have a fierce nature, and its tail is difficult to extinguish.
Author: AtomicDiamond

Entry: By using its flames, POKENAME melts sand to create dens made of glass. These shimmering dens serve as both glittering shelters for this Pokémon and also befuddling traps for unsuspecting prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: Though its wings are strong, it struggles to stay aloft for long, often tumbling in bursts of flame. It clings to rocky ceilings to rest, leaving scorch marks in perfect circles.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME often struggles to eat, as the flaming mask on its tail turns much of the food it scavenges into ash instead. If it does eat, the flame burns intensely and displays a medley of bright colors.
Author: crumple_2

Entry: Mischievous in nature, POKENAME love to play pranks on other Pokémon, usually by startling them. If it does not eat enough jewels, the fire on its tail will grow dim and weak.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME frequently becomes confused about whether to breathe flames or snow, often switching between the two. This unpredictable nature makes it difficult for opponents to anticipate this Pokémon's attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: Pokémon researchers have observed POKENAME moving across their glacial homes in huddled groups of four or more. The current theory is that they do so to protect their flames from abrupt gusts of wind or blizzards, letting them stay warm as a group.
Author: Katie

Entry: The flower of flame that burns atop POKENAME's head isn't very hot. However, the large stem in the middle can project flaming-hot noxious toxins.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME leaps effortlessly from cliffsides, spinning mid-air while spitting flames. These fiery displays are meant to impress others and assert dominance.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its spines radiate heat, scorching anything that touches them. These fiery spines make it difficult for predators to approach without getting burned.
Author: .izik

Entry: Wild POKENAME are hard to come across, but when seen in the wild, they are always roughhousing with one another. As Trainer-kept Pokémon, POKENAME are quite friendly and fiercely loyal to their owners.
Author: itsthenewisaiah

Entry: Its flames have now become ultra hot. No amount of water can put out the flame on its tail.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: It has taken on a darker appearance, and flames come out of its mouth. Kalos experts claim it has similarities with Mega Charizard X.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: It is a pretty calm Pokémon and won't viciously attack unless absolutely necessary. It becomes slightly afraid when facing tough opponents.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: Though large in size and boisterous in ego, its battling capabilities are middling at best. Its vanity simmers as it nears evolution.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: Its fiery spirit makes it train constantly to hone its muscles. As it grows in strength, the flame on its tail burns more intensely.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its appearance of being engulfed in fire is its natural state, the flames on its body providing a potent deterrent to predators. Dousing the flame will not harm it, but will leave it weak and defenseless.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME can temporarily extinguish the flame on its tail to swim. To find a POKENAME, look for streams with unusually warm water.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME often forgets the flame on its tail is a part of itself. Running from its own tail or accidentally burning itself with it are common occurrences.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME will tuck themselves into their shell, using the flame from their tail to stay warm as they sleep. Attempting to disturb a sleeping POKENAME will cause them to release fire from the holes in their shell.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: With its tail aflame, it channels psychic power. Once serene, now it battles with fiery determination.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME thrives near lava pools, absorbing intense heat into its body. The hotter it becomes, the stronger and more erratic its Thundershock attack grows.
Author: .izik

Entry: While usually not visible, it has tiny arms beneath its orange feathers. At night you can identify POKENAME running through the fields by their glow.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has small orange feathers that litter the landscape as it runs. These feathers stay surprisingly cool regardless of how hot its body gets.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME frequently eats floating ice chunks to cool its intensely hot body. Without this, it risks overheating and becoming sluggish.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME expels flames from the cannons on its shell. It can shoot small fireballs that travel for a distance of 10 feet before they explode.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: POKENAME shoots steam from its cannons. However, the steam doesn't burn much, and at most it'll sting for a while.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: When threatened, POKENAME fires large bursts of flames at its attacker. If it keeps its shell closed for too long, the shell will become hot enough to boil the surrounding water.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Friendly by nature, POKENAME often approaches travelers resting inside caves and offers them its large body for both warmth and protection. It even offers its tail-flame to use for cooking food, as long as it gets a small share.
Author: sk372

Entry: Each of POKENAME's claws can produce short bursts of flame. It uses these flames to cook captured prey and for territorial disputes.
Author: sk372

Entry: If others fall asleep while it is singing, POKENAME grows furious. In its frustration, it may self-destruct, blasting everything around it with a powerful explosion.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME takes care of young Pokémon, singing them to sleep when they are scared. Its soft, fluffy body provides comfort to those seeking warmth.
Author: .izik

Entry: Due to its luxurious look, it's often employed as a singer and dancer, but no reviews exist of its performance. It's popular among insomniacs.
Author: HoundRyS

Entry: POKENAME have a love for metal music, thrashing their heads around while screaming at the top of their lungs. Groups of POKENAME will even create entire concerts out in the middle of the forest.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is a popular companion for budding artists and artisans, letting others mold its malleable body into a shape before it transforms into the object proper, allowing the artist to see how accurate their molding was.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is known for being extremely playful and friendly. It can jump to a height of over 7 feet.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME love nothing more than to be pillows for people to sleep against. It's said there is no more pleasant a sleep than one experienced while being cradled by a POKENAME.
Author: sk372

Entry: Despite its might, POKENAME is far from malevolent. It is a kind and cheeky Pokémon, often nabbing an unguarded hat from a passersby to play with.
Author: chiari_queen

Entry: POKENAME enjoys resting in the grass or sand and sunbathing for long periods of time. It will also rest like this while awaiting a loving head pat.
Author: chiari_queen

Entry: POKENAME enjoys resting in the grass or sand and sunbathing for long periods of time. It will also rest like this while awaiting a loving head pat.
Author: chiari_queen

Entry: Despite its might, POKENAME is far from malevolent. It is a kind and cheeky Pokémon, often nabbing an unguarded hat from a passersby to play with.
Author: chiari_queen

Entry: Beloved for its soft body and luxurious fur, POKENAME has been seen draped around the necks of famous stars at high-profile events. Due to this, owning a POKENAME is seen as something of a status symbol.
Author: sk372

Entry: During full moons, it mimics human speech to lure people out of their homes at night. Those who venture out are never seen again.
Author: .izik

Entry: Should someone attempt to walk away mid-performance, POKENAME will pin them down with psychic energy. It refuses to let an audience leave until the song is finished.
Author: .izik

Entry: Some stores in Kanto have made confections based on POKENAME to try to compete with the vaunted Casteliacone, to little success.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: It tries to be intimidating, but its pincers are too soft and squishy to hurt opponents that much. This frustrates POKENAME to no end.
Author: fountainihili

Entry: POKENAME charms foes with its jovial demeanor before striking with unexpected force. It is both a beloved companion and a formidable guardian.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME sings while soaring over meadows, hoping to invigorate grazing Pokémon with its melody. However, its soothing voice inevitably lulls them into an unintended slumber.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME trumpets a cheerful tune from its trunk that can soothe even the most furious Pokémon. Unfortunately, it often puts its own allies to sleep in the process.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME drive off predators by staring. If its unblinking, unflinching expression isn't enough, a sudden ear-piercing screech does the job.
Author: PokePower

Entry: POKENAME's wide eyes and huge ears allow it to detect danger from all angles. It is surprisingly light-weight for its large size.
Author: ServerSizeMe

Entry: POKENAME is highly protective of eggs and young Pokémon. It can inflate itself to the size of an elephant to ward off attackers.
Author: serversizeme

Entry: This strong Pokémon‘s body is hard as granite. Missing physical affection, it covers itself in pillows and soft fabrics to appear more huggable.
Author: SonTyp

Entry: POKENAME can sometimes be seen lovingly chasing Pokémon like Lucaslash. It wields a giant red and yellow hammer as a weapon.
Author: hypernovahusky

Entry: POKENAME can sometimes be seen lovingly accompanying Pokémon like Lucaslash. It wields a giant red and yellow hammer as a weapon.
Author: hypernovahusky

Entry: The back head loves to sing, even though its singing is so bad not even the main head can stand it. Due to the constant singing, the main head's hearing gets worse as it gets older.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Despite being jovial, childish, and often naive, POKENAME are also fiercely protective of that which they hold dear, primarily, their favorite snacks.
Author: Cristata

Entry: A peaceful Pokémon. The fruit that POKENAME collects attracts a variety of Pokémon, particularly Flying type Pokémon.
Author: Gayschlatt

Entry: Despite being jovial, childish, and often naive, POKENAME are also fiercely protective of that which they hold dear, primarily, their favorite snacks.
Author: Cristata

Entry: Despite being jovial, childish, and often naive, POKENAME are also fiercely protective of that which they hold dear, primarily, their favorite snacks.
Author: Cristata

Entry: POKENAME typically dwell high in the mountains, maintaining large territories across the peaks of their homes. They signal to Wigglyking and rival POKENAME with loud, echoing songs.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME can calm people and Pokémon just by brushing them with their ribbon's soft fur. It can also inflate their blade to a ridiculous size.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Its shimmering scales reflect light like precious jewels. Gentle and graceful, it cradles its young in a watery embrace.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: Its incredible singing voice has the power to enthrall listeners, which allows it to amass giant crowds of loyal fans that will do anything for it. Its rage when a performance is disrupted can put even the most disgruntled diva to shame.
Author: El Fail

Entry: Its rich, fluffy fur feels so good to touch that people find it difficult not to touch it. Cuddling POKENAME is used to help insomnia patients.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: By inhaling deeply, POKENAME can inflate itself enough to gently float through the air. When it deflates, it creates soothing sounds or devastating screeches, depending on its mood.
Author: SonTyp

Entry: POKENAME's fine, fluffy fur is wonderfully soft. However, since POKENAME can spin strands of the fur into an electrically charged web within moments, few ever get to touch it.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: In the wild, one head will stay awake while the other sleeps. However. in the company of a trusted Trainer, both heads will sleep peacefully.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: This Pokémon possesses luxurious fur and a soothingly hypnotic voice. Its appealing appearance allows it to lure in large audiences, which gives it the attention it craves and more food to steal.
Author: El Fail

Entry: POKENAME clings to humans and other Pokémon to absorb static electricity. Since its fur is luxuriously soft, many dream of being chosen by a POKENAME.
Author: lordjoostmeister

Entry: With its large mouth and elastic body, POKENAME can puff up before releasing extremely loud song-like cries. It's believed it may rival Exploud in reaching dangerously extreme decibel levels.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are often found in Gym battles at the Ballonlea gym. They know numerous tricks and like to show off.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: POKENAME uses music and light to communicate emotions & thought. There is evidence that each color of light conveys a different emotion, but the theory has never been proven.
Author: giggity._.

Entry: POKENAME uses music and light to communicate emotions & thought. There is evidence that each color of light conveys a different emotion, but the theory has never been proven.
Author: giggity._.

Entry: This generous Pokémon loves sharing the perfect apples that grow on its back. New apples quickly grow back after the old ones are picked.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Its vocal cords are fully operational. If you hear a baby crying while exploring a cave, think twice before following the sound.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's fur is extremely soft and can make anyone feel happy just by touching it. If it finds someone feeling down, it has a tendency to nuzzle them until they feel better.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its meowing sounds are unique. This is because each POKENAME has its own pitch, height and tone length, which can vary greatly in some cases.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can puff up each of its body parts to many times their normal size. It is a popular circus attraction and especially popular with children.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME makes for a favorable companion, especially for frequently stressed individuals. Touching its fur has been shown to have therapeutic effects.
Author: vaporvenator

Entry: Wielding two microphones, it sings a different kind of song into either depending on its mood. In battle, it sings into both to cause powerful sound waves from the harsh feedback.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's inflatable body gives it the ability to appear as large and muscular as it wants. Those not intimidated by the display will find it does nothing to enhance its actual middling level of physical strength.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is a mythical creature that few people, if any, have ever seen. Its mane is said to have the taste and texture of cotton candy.
Author: thisisnotaplaceholder

Entry: All three of POKENAME's heads sing a melancholic lullaby, harmonizing in eerie unison. Those who hear it are quickly lulled into a deep, dreamless sleep.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME shows affection by putting someone in its mouth, which can be misunderstood as devouring. Seemingly, nothing can end its pain and suffering.
Author: musicsheep.

Entry: Its innate ability to blast streams of water also allows POKENAME to gargle water if its throat is ever sore.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME often accompanies nurses at hospitals. After lulling patients to sleep, it sings a healing song that can cure any ailment.
Author: noel5229

Entry: POKENAME often accompanies nurses at hospitals. After lulling patients to sleep, it sings a healing song that can cure any ailment.
Author: noel5229

Entry: Its innate ability to blast streams of water also allows POKENAME to gargle water if its throat is ever sore.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME is often used by underground DJs, as their loud boomboxes go beyond any legal decibel limit. They can generate volumes of up to 180 dB.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME is often used by underground DJs, as their loud boomboxes go beyond any legal decibel limit. They can generate volumes of up to 180 dB.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It spits an odd assortment of seeds on any empty soil it finds. The seeds are from an unknown source and can become many different plants.
Author: .izik

Entry: The dust from its antennae is used in salves for burns. Its smell resembles a combination of Belue Berries and White Apricorns.
Author: .izik

Entry: As POKENAME prepare for metamorphosis, they close their buds and harden their shells. Just before they emerge, they open their buds again to absorb energy for the last push.
Author: Holgast

Entry: POKENAME gets frustrated when something covers it from the sunlight. If it is another plant, it flies up and cuts it, to later see if the leaves can be used as a seam or a blanket to lie more comfortably.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME are easy prey for wild bird Pokémon. They are lucky to survive long enough for evolution.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME are easy prey for wild bird Pokémon. They are lucky to survive long enough for evolution.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: The plant life on its body has a sleek coating to prevent it from burning. Newborn POKENAME do not have this coating, however, leading to accidents.
Author: typhloquil

Entry: In the morning, POKENAME flies to the tree tops to bask in the sun. After that, POKENAME peck each other to try to eat each other's seeds.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME slinks through the underbrush in search of roots and nuts. The seeds it brings to its burrow often turn into trees before they're eaten.
Author: kiwikelly

Entry: POKENAME thrives near wetlands, where it absorbs nutrients from the watercress growing around it. At night, it hoots softly while spreading its pollen to strengthen nearby plant life.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's small and light body helps them to fly. Unfortunately, they struggle to control their flight path.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME's bud will only open when its overcome with joy, releasing a sweet scent that also makes others happy. During the springtime, groups of POKENAME can be seen happily bouncing around flower fields.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: The stem beneath POKENAME's bud is surprisingly strong, resembling the durability of bamboo. This Pokémon grows in clusters, supporting other Pokémon that build nests within its leaves.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME thrives in sunlit meadows, where it absorbs energy from flowers. It flits between blossoms, spreading cheer with its gentle movements.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's seeds resemble tiny cashews, packed with energy-rich nutrients. Wild Pokémon often seek them out, but its tough outer shell makes them difficult to crack open.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's movements are accompanied by a soft rattle, warning others of its approach. This sound, though faint, helps it maintain its personal space among wild Pokémon.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME still loves sunlight, but the closer it gets to evolving, the harder it is to photosynthesize. Sometimes, it catches berries inside its claw and spends days digesting them.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: POKENAME rolls to where the sun is brightest. Touching its coating of spores elicits a burning feeling similar to poison oak.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME's petals exude a cooling eucalyptus aroma that soothes those nearby. It sways gracefully in the wind, releasing calming spores into the air.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME create vines to connect their horns together, completing the circuit in their bodies and encasing themselves in electricity. They grow sprouts from their bodies to extend the range of their electricity during battle.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME's leaves release a faint smoky scent, resembling burning charcoal. When threatened, it emits embers from its petals to deter attackers.
Author: .izik

Entry: One can usually find POKENAME at an oasis in the desert, where it will sit, content, soaking in the water for as long as it can.
Author: roxie5228

Entry: The sap seeping from POKENAME's stem has a milky, toxic consistency similar to milkweed. Herbivores that attempt to eat it experience numbness in their mouths.
Author: .izik

Entry: It prefers damp soil and spends hours gnawing bark from flowering trees, staining its fur with pollen. Some forest paths are lined with their half-finished dams and sprouting footprints.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME has a preferred habitat of humid jungles. It constantly emits a scent similar to incense. Despite liking damp environments, it dislikes the rain and will take shelter even when it drizzles.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It has an innate urge to water whatever plant it sees. It will even ignore its Trainer to run off to water flowers. When it forms an unbreakable bond, the bud at the top of its head starts to bloom.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME hang underneath tree branches using their twin vines, illuminating the area with their glowing bodies. Their bodies are hot to the touch due to the amount of energy needed to keep them glowing.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is extremely shy and hides in shady undergrowth or under flower fields. If it were braver, it could develop more quickly, as it needs sunlight to thrive.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Nearing the vibrant tags on its head instills an eerie sense of dread. It's believed that your wish will come true if you can manage to steal one.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: When exposed to an abundance of water and sunlight, POKENAME will continuously grow in size until evolution.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: POKENAME can be found leeching off tree trunks via a sharp siphon on its back, with the organic matter of the bark fueling small boilers within POKENAME. Scientists still debate the biological purpose of POKENAME's ceaseless turning.
Author: Dylonk25

Entry: POKENAME releases spores that induce sneezing in anything nearby. These spores drift harmlessly through the air, acting as both a defense mechanism and a playful prank.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lets loose small bolts of electricity into the water to sterilize it. After this, it dips its body into the water to absorb it and grow.
Author: .izik

Entry: It absorbs metals and minerals from nearby soil, incorporating them into its skin and spines. It becomes heavier and slower as winter approaches, eventually going dormant once it becomes too heavy to move.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME releases a warm, floral scent that soothes nearby Pokémon. This fragrance intensifies as it moves, making it a beacon of tranquility in blooming fields.
Author: .izik

Entry: It prefers to eat leaves that have fallen off of maple trees. The darker brown the leaf is, the more desirable it is to a POKENAME.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's leaves are coated in a fine, frost-like dust that smells faintly of fir trees. It thrives in cold environments, where its icy sap protects it from freezing.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME emits an unsettling presence despite its delicate appearance. It sways rhythmically, leaving others unsure whether to be entranced or unnerved.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME produces a distinct aroma that lingers long after it passes by. This scent attracts other Pokémon, though not all are pleased by its pungency.
Author: .izik

Entry: It seeks out yellow flowers due to its affinity for gold. Due to this, its den is usually filled with sunflowers, dandelions and daffodils.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is very sensitive to temperature. When winter comes, it dives beneath the surface of a lake until it can enjoy the summer sun again.
Author: gellyfishsh

Entry: POKENAME train their bodies relentlessly. Their dreams are to become like the champions they idolize so much.
Author: Mister J

Entry: POKENAME, after winning several fights, become rising stars among fighting tournaments. Buchop look up to them at this stage.
Author: Mister J

Entry: When they are submerged below the surface in the reeds, their tails stick up against bundles of lemongrass. This occasionally leads gatherers to sever their tail without meaning to do so.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME stores electricity in its small buds, which it uses to defend itself. It latches onto power cords in order to absorb energy.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME uses the aroma of their incense to calm other Pokémon. Once this is done, they open their bud and absorb their positive emotions with it.
Author: Ayner

Entry: Various bouquets of flowers, from red roses to violet mallow, are collected together around the central core of a POKENAME. It avoids bug-infested areas of the forest, as they produce a naturally sweet scent.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: If bested in battle, POKENAME must gift a petal from their non-dominant hand as a sign of respect. They are only considered elders once their hand is visible through the petals.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: POKENAME lures its enemies into a trap with its roses and slashes them with its scythes. It flies at high speed and leaves a trail of fragrance that disappears in a blink after a few moments.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: It distracts enemies by scattering pollen from its wings. The wings of POKENAME who are raised by kind Trainers are more vibrant and aromatic.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME's rose hides a toxic spike. Many novice gardeners are sent to the emergency room by this Pokémon.
Author: Atlas333

Entry: POKENAME's body is wrapped in thick vines that help it camouflage from predators. Despite being covered in thorns, they are not very sharp and are safe to touch.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's white roses are symbols of love and nobility and are commonly owned by elite Trainers. They go out of their way to defend weaker Pokémon, especially ones of the opposite gender.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's second head has taken the form of a beautiful flower. This flower gets most of the attention and the main head often feels ignored.
Author: Atlas333

Entry: Underneath the rose buds hide POKENAME's poisonous claws. They can frequently be seen jumping from tree branches, ambushing prey by stabbing them with their toxic thorns.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: This snooty Pokémon secretly seeks out the affection of a devoted Trainer. It gifts flower petals to those who feed it delicious berries.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: Sassy by nature, it will try to intimidate any aggressor by flaunting its rose-pincers.  If that fails, it'll fire thorns from them at high speeds.
Author: leeto64

Entry: The leaves on its body are extremely tough and act as protective armor in battle. Male POKENAME frequently engage in combat to woo the females with the prettiest plumage.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its leaf-like wings are as sharp as steel, able to slice through trees with ease. Despite this, POKENAME is very friendly and allows other Pokémon to pollinate the flowers on its feet.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: This Pokémon practices graceful darts and twirls, all in an effort to improve its abilities to dodge and ambush. It longs for the day it evolves.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: A popular Pokémon during the spring season. POKENAME playfully dance around flower fields, emitting a scent that makes Trainers uncontrollably happy.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME are favored by stage magicians. It can pop out through any object and audience members are amazed.
Author: .ssunday.

Entry: When in danger, the flowers on its arms spread their petals and the flame on its tail radiates intensely all in order to make it seem more threatening. In addition, its normally pleasant scent turns sour and strong.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME reside in oases and hide amongst the foliage. Its flowers release a pleasant and relaxing aroma when it is healthy.
Author: estrellafruit

Entry: The roses that form its tail emit a tantalizing scent. But watch out! If anyone gets too close to them, POKENAME can emit devastating flames from the flowers!
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: The flowers that form its tail are heat-resistant. In these, it converts solar energy into hot fire to protect itself. Although POKENAME is not harmless to handle, it is very popular with many Trainers.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: These lazy Pokémon can be seen lounging around large forests, slowly gnawing on flowers. The flower on POKENAME's neck releases a relaxing scent that smells like a mixture of roses and pinewood.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME can detect the emotions of anything that touches the pollen it scatters, even from miles away.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME can detect the emotions of anything that touches the pollen it scatters, even from miles away.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The flowers that form its tail are heat-resistant. In these, it converts solar energy into hot fire to protect itself. Although POKENAME is not harmless to handle, it is very popular with many Trainers.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME can have different appearances based on location and favorite flower. Some theorize this Pokémon reproduces by putting spores in old gears.
Author: totodile.

Entry: When POKENAME is happy, the buds on its ears release a pleasant scent often used in perfumes. Its fur coat hides sharp thorns that make it unpleasant to hug.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Groups of these Pokémon can be seen attached to trees and bushes, slowly spinning to produce energy. When threatened, they concentrate this energy in their rose buds to unleash a powerful laser.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: As POKENAME drifts along the breeze, it drops colorful flower petals. People often collect these petals, believing that gathering enough brings eternal love.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: As POKENAME flies, its wings spread a strong pollen that helps flowers grow. People with allergies should stay away from areas where large groups of POKENAME can be found.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: If you don't take good care of your garden, it may become infested with POKENAME. Its "eyes" mimic flowers in order to lure in potential prey.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME is always stationary to avoid damaging the delicate flowers on its body. Its horns are laced with a strong poison that can be deadly when touched.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Groups of POKENAME can be seen sleeping on sunny days to draw energy from the sun. The healthier POKENAME is, the sweeter the scent from its flowers becomes.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It is said that lost spirits take root within malevolent Roselia until they grow into POKENAME. These creatures scare people lost in the woods, seeking revenge for the destruction of nature.
Author: Altius

Entry: Lovers will opt to buy a POKENAME instead of a Small Bouquet for dates, as a Pokémon lasts much longer. Some people say that gardeners can tell how well a relationship is based on how healthy their POKENAME is.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME's weak wings make it almost impossible for it to fly. When threatened, it will frantically flap its wings, spreading the irritating pollen from its flowers.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Inflated by constant praise and astounding win streaks, POKENAME boast incredible egos. At the height of their fame, they believe they're untouchable.
Author: Mister J

Entry: The larger the thorns on POKENAME's head, the more powerful its poison it produces. Groups of POKENAME can be seen in flower gardens, feeding on small bug Pokémon.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is a thing of beauty and can be seen playfully galloping around flower fields. The flames on its body curiously cannot burn other plant life.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is quite the charmer. It uses its good looks to amuse allies and unsettle enemies.
Author: Atlas333

Entry: The air inside its body smells faintly of moldy basil. This odd aroma lingers for up to 3 hours wherever it drifts.
Author: .izik

Entry: It propels itself through the air using gas collected from decomposing garbage. If it bursts, the gas finds a new balloon and POKENAME is reborn.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: Just like Drifloon, POKENAME likes to take children away. It carries them to kids-eat-free restaurants to trick them into giving it free food.
Author: Llamawiz34

Entry: POKENAME floats lazily above rivers, scanning for prey like Caterpie. Once it spots one, it wraps its thread-like limbs around it and drags it away to its nest.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME sneaks into the nests of other Pokémon, curling up next to their eggs while they sleep. Its warm, rubbery body helps the eggs mature faster.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME expels a thick mist as it drifts over brooks, blending into the fog. If it senses danger, it releases powerful jets of water to push threats away.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its tail fills with gas, allowing it to float up to 300 feet above the ground. This altitude gives it a wide view of its surroundings.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its rubbery form bounces through mountainous areas as it travels. This unique motion helps it cover rough terrain with ease.
Author: .izik

Entry: If a POKENAME appears near a community, children are quickly ushered inside due to its dangerous cords. A single tug on these cords can cause a massive explosion, and as a result, POKENAME often reside in and around ghost towns.
Author: FaeFlame

Entry: POKENAME floats near the windows of children at night, making scary faces to startle them. It listens carefully, searching for the softest cry before attempting to steal the child away.
Author: .izik

Entry: They hunt for lost souls in coordinated packs. To keep tabs on each other, they let out spectral howls that only they can hear.
Author: ariamelisma

Entry: Its howls filled with profound melancholy can be heard in the hour before dawn. Those who do hear it find themselves deeply moved.
Author: ariamelisma

Entry: Unlike Drifloon that are known for stealing children away, POKENAME make great companions. POKENAME can often be found floating around carnivals in groups and playing with families.
Author: odditylad

Entry: Sometimes POKENAME take on the colouring of a Phanpy instead of a Drifloon. It is not known why, however, these variants tend to be even more popular with kids.
Author: odditylad

Entry: POKENAME sprouts balloon-like objects from its back to float over cliffs. These balloons are insulated from its electric discharges, and it can generate up to four at a time, adjusting their number based on how far it needs to travel.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are hollow bodies, only filled with helium. They will float around the world until death, when they will slowly decompose.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: POKENAME's hollow body fills with toxic gas when it senses danger. It is light enough to use this gas to float over vast distances, avoiding conflict whenever possible.
Author: .izik

Entry: The sandbag holding POKENAME keeps it from floating for long periods of time. This causes POKENAME frustration.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: Its body slowly petrifies, making it progressively heavier and only able to fly by expending a great deal of energy.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Poisonous gas seeps from POKENAME's rubbery body through its ears. It controls its movement midair by releasing small bursts of this gas in different directions.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's form makes it a treasure for children, which it takes advantage of to kidnap them. It fights back like a real sword when caught.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME's form makes it a treasure for children, which it takes advantage of to kidnap them. It fights back like a real sword when caught.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: The heat POKENAME expels from its rubbery body is hot enough to melt silver. In ancient times, artisans used it to help craft delicate jewelry.
Author: .izik

Entry: They are known to live in abandoned archery ranges, and their elastic skin cannot be penetrated by an arrow from a crossbow. They taunt people to shoot them, as they find the sensation pleasant.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Rumor has it that POKENAME holds the souls of a lost family. The two heads are the parents' spirits, while the lower body holds the childrens'.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: There was once a case where a wild POKENAME suddenly came out of nowhere and snatched up a child, only to return them an hour later. According to the child, POKENAME showed them their palace in the clouds. No such habitat for POKENAME has been found.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: This floaty Pokémon uses its whisker-like antennae as arms, stopping itself from blowing away in strong winds.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: As it gracefully floats through the sky, the gears spin increasingly fast. The resulting noise is a cacophonous mess that can kill small bird Pokémon.
Author: kandyman

Entry: POKENAME's ears have turned ghostly, and the once-brutal strikes it delivers have softened considerably. Instead, it uses the cloud-like wisps to deliver subtle doses of stinging energy.
Author: Glacierwing

Entry: POKENAME's gaseous body is filled with a yellow powder that helps it stay aloft. It floats high above the ground, searching for fresh water sources to sustain its kind.
Author: .izik

Entry: Name fly through the night sky in huge flocks. If attacked, the flock will surround the assailant and carry them off, never to be seen again.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: While floating through the sky, it releases small bolts of lightning. These shocks deter predators and make it an electric spectacle.
Author: .izik

Entry: It fiercely guards ancient tombs and monoliths from scavengers. Any who dare approach are met with its unyielding defense.
Author: .izik

Entry: It hangs from the ceilings in caves, letting a string down that looks like an Escape Rope. If a traveler grabs one of its strings by accident, POKENAME will pull them up and drain their vitality.
Author: bacondlx

Entry: POKENAME's rubbery body is packed with tiny seeds. As it glides through grassy fields, it scatters them freely, causing entire meadows to sprout overnight.
Author: .izik

Entry: When POKENAME raises its balloons to cheer, it's really trying to catch a breeze for traveling. Its heart-shaped weights don't hold it in place well.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME are curious, friendly, and often harmless. Despite this, there are many grisly urban legends surrounding its true origins.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: It appears sluggish when it lets itself be carried by the wind. However, by inflating its head and wings, it can rise into the air and disappear surprisingly quickly.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Lying on beaches, it absorbs sunlight to warm the air inside its body. When predators approach, it puffs up to appear larger and more intimidating.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME live in colonies of vast sizes, and once they have claimed an area it is nearly impossible to get them to leave. Using the orbs on their back they float short distances bringing food back to the colony with ease.
Author: FaeFlame

Entry: When inflated, its antennae become incredibly hot to the touch. This heat acts as both a warning and a defense mechanism.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has rubbery, pants-like skin from the waist down, which it uses to hide itself during lightning storms. It can float safely above the ground, shielded from the electrifying bolts.
Author: .izik

Entry: While floating through city streets, POKENAME uses its long, thread-like limbs to steal wallets from travelers. It lines its nest with these stolen items, seemingly hoarding them as trophies.
Author: .izik

Entry: The humid gas that seeps from POKENAME's body is hotter than a furnace. It uses this intense heat to keep its den warm, even in the coldest environments.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's gas-filled body allows it to float on the surface of ponds. It uses its string-like tail to grab at objects hidden beneath the water's surface.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME floats above lush fields, scattering seeds as it drifts. The fast-growing weeds it produces can overrun entire ecosystems within weeks.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite resembling an ordinary green balloon, its sword-like leek is incredibly hard and dangerous. It uses this weapon with surprising skill.
Author: .izik

Entry: The air escaping from its nose induces drowsiness, often used in dental offices to calm patients. Its sleepy scent makes it a curious helper.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME spins silk with a faint carrot-like scent, attracting herbivorous Pokémon. It lines its burrow with the soft strands, creating a warm and fragrant nest.
Author: .izik

Entry: The leaves atop POKENAME protect the contents of its basket-like head. Only trusted Trainers are allowed to remove the painted eggs it carries.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME's powerful legs allow it to hop great distances, even while its outer shell hardens. It often leaps into tree branches to avoid predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's fluffy tail contains a hidden venomous barb, which it uses only when threatened. It whimpers frequently, lulling foes into a false sense of security.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME eats large amounts of carrots to strengthen its developing shell. The tougher its shell becomes, the more confidently it faces predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: The red eggs that POKENAME drops are said to symbolize new life. Because of that, they're eaten at many festive celebrations.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME builds its nest near cauliflower fields, hiding within the pale stalks. Farmers often find it peacefully resting among the plants at dawn.
Author: .izik

Entry: The fluff surrounding POKENAME's lower half acts as a sound-dampener, allowing it to move about unheard. It is much less skilled at staying unseen.
Author: strawbearycandy

Entry: POKENAME roams fields in search of food, hopping from patch to patch. Its fluffy coat stores static electricity, which it discharges when startled.
Author: .izik

Entry: The leaves on its head release a strong aroma while it floats. The smell is reminiscent of carrot cake and cloves.
Author: .izik

Entry: It escapes danger by extending its ears to launch into treetops, then swinging away on branches with its tail. In the rare event that it needs to fight, its ears pack a stronger punch than any of its hands.
Author: bacondlx

Entry: When POKENAME senses danger, it perks up its ears. It searches wide areas for food.
Author: The_Fireplace

Entry: POKENAME takes a defensive stance whenever it senses danger, raising its ears to appear larger. It has an imposing presence, though it is often timid in nature.
Author: .izik

Entry: Very skittish and easily startled, POKENAME is not easy to befriend. They tend to only trust one person at a time.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: With a combination of thick wool and a sturdy shell, POKENAME have powerful defenses They prefer eating cottonweeds and cattail plants.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: POKENAME nests in the hollow of an old oak, using fallen leaves to line its home. It always knows its way back, no matter how far it wanders.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is extremely difficult to get along with. It will release any frustrations it harbors on the nearby environment, leveling them back to a barren, earthen state. Scientists are unsure of the reason behind the carrot-shaped designs on its body.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The only way to calm an enraged POKENAME is to pet it. If a Trainer stops petting it before it calms down, POKENAME will wrap its arms around them and suffocate them as an everlasting hug.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: When an envious Mimikyu fused with Buneary, it created POKENAME. If POKENAME does not receive affection, it will replace the cotton on its ears.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME sheds delicate tufts of fur as it hops, leaving fuzzy trails behind. The tufts are said to bring luck to those who collect them.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hides among beech trees, using the forest canopy as a natural shield. Its light and bouncy movements make it difficult to track.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME spreads dandelion seeds as it hops, leaving trails of fluffy spores in its wake. These seeds drift gently through the air, carried far and wide by the breeze.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME thrives in marshy areas, hopping between patches of mud and water. It generates faint electrical pulses, which help it detect movement in the murky environment.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hides gems in its thick fur. It also has a strange affinity for plush toys. Scientists say its third ear is caused by a genetic mutation.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: In addition to the striking speed at which POKENAME can flee from predators, each of its cotton-like tufts can lash out with a dizzying punch. Their fur makes the softest pillows.
Author: Wormspawn

Entry: POKENAME is naturally aggressive, disagreeable, and single-minded, and rampages if it doesn't get exactly what it wants. If it feels even remotely upset, it will take its anger out on its Trainer; when it properly appreciates them, it evolves.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are affectionate by nature. They try their best to befriend Trainers despite their uncanny appearance.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: People have found POKENAME's hollow face to be frightening. Recently, a fictional story about a haunted POKENAME became infamous online.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME's fur is full of nearly microscopic ice crystals, keeping their temperature low. Hot weather makes them sluggish.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME grows small flowers along its ears, which it uses to attract friendly Pokémon. These blossoms release a sweet scent, spreading joy wherever it hops.
Author: .izik

Entry: It makes its home in patches of wild carrots. During sunrise, it will make a chirp reminiscent of a doorbell.
Author: .izik

Entry: Children often mistake POKENAME for a plush toy. It seems to enjoy the attention it gets this way.
Author: pokebio

Entry: The petals of the flowers on its body are filled with tiny barbed thorns. Should a petal touch bare skin, it will require a physician to be safely removed.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's movements are fluid, letting it weave effortlessly through desert landscapes. It uses this agility to outmaneuver predators and dodge obstacles with ease.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME adorns itself with seaweed to blend in along the shore. It buries small treasures in the sand, guarding them fiercely from curious Pokémon.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME makes for an excellent companion; it has a playful nature and is extremely loyal. Its soft fur is actually made of very thin rock crystals that are spun out into fibres.
Author: Katie

Entry: In times of hungry desperation, POKENAME will eat the carrots growing in its mane, though it prefers to eat Stantler.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME is said to have the cutest and most beautiful voice in the world. Unfortunately, its shy nature prevents it from properly singing.
Author: Hexx_Vixtar

Entry: Curling and uncurling its ears lets it create a different pitch of sound when it expels smoke from its nostrils. POKENAME will "sing" to others using this ability when it feels content.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME looks sweet, but it has a vindictive streak. Its strong back legs increase the slashing power of its hidden claws when it takes its revenge.
Author: .realthree

Entry: If POKENAME does not eat carrots regularly, it develops intense headaches. It is often seen rubbing its temples when deprived of its favorite food.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME leaps between birch trees with great agility, using branches to propel itself forward. It prefers solitude, though it will defend its territory with fierce energy.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is said to bring nightmares to those it encounters while sleeping. It prefers to remain hidden, stirring up trouble only when it feels threatened.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's body contains compounds that can reduce fevers in both Pokémon and humans. It hops around forests in search of herbs, always ready to prepare a remedy.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME travels by rolling, then launching itself using its powerful ears. For this reason, hikers must be cautious around steep hills and cliffs.
Author: lazyarcanist

Entry: Should it be startled, POKENAME will shed portions of its fluff. The fluff itself has a mild adhesive and sticks to most surfaces.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's shells protect their soft bodies. Their excess fur tangles up persistent foes.
Author: ohok3441
