Entry: POKENAME rubs against people and other Pokémon to generate static electricity. If someone it dislikes tries to grab its strings, it expels all the static at once to give them a large shock.
Author: bacondlx

Entry: POKENAME scatters spores around telephone poles. The mix of spores and static makes the area unsafe for flying Pokémon.
Author: .izik

Entry: During thunderstorms, POKENAME floats high into the sky. Its fuzzy body crackles with static as it soars through the clouds.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME aggressively flies at targets, aiming to feast on blood. The amount of blood it consumes to be full is so minuscule, people regard it as harmless aside from the slight pinch of its bite.
Author: sk372

Entry: Floating gently through ruins, POKENAME spins webs in strange patterns. The webbing is extremely sticky and is able to hold debris for months.
Author: .izik

Entry: After absorbing energy from a crystal from Chargestone Cave, POKENAME has grown to enormous sizes. It still carries around this crystal, though.
Author: NellNast42

Entry: The Joltik enhances the symbiotic POKENAME's energy with its electricity. The POKENAME seeks out energy sources to absorb on its never-ending journey.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME traps prey such as Cacnea in sticky silk before blasting them with fire. It often leaves behind scorched webs and charred husks.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is often found latched onto and draining electrical devices of their energy. It is considered a nuisance, especially in urban areas, so generators have been set up to act as feeding zones.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME injects venom into prey, then traps them with a charged Electro Web. It prefers to strike quickly and from above.
Author: .izik

Entry: While spinning at high speed, POKENAME builds static across its shell. It releases the charge with a sudden, buzzing pop.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are timid by nature, hiding within mobile nests which they make out of silk and snow.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: POKENAME have grown too big for their nests, but since the outer layer has frozen solid, they've had to adapt to their accidental shells.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: Its fluffy fur protects it from the cold. Despite its innocent appearance, POKENAME is a dangerous hunter.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Exposure to a Dawn Stone had some strange effects on this Pokémon. It's believed it can float thanks to electromagnetism.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: Timid by nature, POKENAME hides underground and hopes the weak electric charge in its leaves will dissuade others from bothering it. If plucked from the dirt regardless, it cries tiny sparks from its eyes.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME drifts aimlessly through graveyards, sparking with flickers of static. Its eerie flashes light up tombstones late at night.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is said to be a helpful light, guiding lost children through the forest. Some say it does this to ensure no one else suffers the same fate it once did.
Author: cassimari

Entry: POKENAME builds nests in cedar trees and absorbs nearby lightning during storms. Some believe it protects the forest this way.
Author: .izik

Entry: The flower bulbs on POKENAME's head store sunlight each morning. As it rests, the energy inside slowly builds into electrical charge.
Author: .izik

Entry: It builds up static electricity by brushing its wings against its furry body. It can unleash its built-up charge in a powerful Thunder Wave by directing the electrical discharge with its ears.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: POKENAME's wings crackle with static as it flies through storm clouds. Its cottony down can store lightning for hours.
Author: .izik

Entry: The soft cotton in POKENAME's body rubs together, creating static. It stores the charge in its fur until needed in battle.
Author: .izik

Entry: Smaller Pokémon weave webs within POKENAME and use it as shelter. Its multitude of eyes are always aware of its surroundings, and watch over its inhabitants closely.
Author: darxer_

Entry: POKENAME creates small sparks of electricity consistently. This energy comes from the organs in its mouth, which look closely like rocks found in Unova.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: POKENAME typically leech off of large machines or Electric-types, storing energy in the mushroom-like nodes. These nodes act like batteries, providing energy in times of need.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME generates static electricity in its fur when excited. Its playful nature makes it a beloved pet, but owners must be careful when petting it or they may get an unexpected shock.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: Well-trained POKENAME are among the most loyal companions a Trainer can have. However, disobedient ones often ignore orders and steal electricity from outlets or household devices for their own amusement.
Author: h0bojoe

Entry: POKENAME swarms gather near wind turbines, feeding off the ambient charge. When spotted, they scatter in every direction.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME absorbs sunlight through its fur, converting it into electricity. It shocks anything that wanders too close.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME live together in small groups when they are young, sharing electricity sources amongst one another. As they grow older, they grow more independent. Rarely, they may even fight off their own family to protect their electric-laden territory.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The static in their fur lets POKENAME sense the presence of others nearby. Their agility and small size make them a challenging target to catch.
Author: garret95

Entry: POKENAME's fur reeks of rotting Pumpkin Berries. When threatened, it unleashes a powerful electric blast from its body.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hovers near light poles in city parks at night. It siphons off electricity, leaving the lamps to flicker mysteriously.
Author: .izik

Entry: The silk spun from POKENAME's body carries a light electric charge. Its fur smells strongly of Pumpkin Berries in autumn.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME delivers powerful headbutts charged with electricity. It uses them to drive off anything that nears its den.
Author: .izik

Entry: It hoards shiny objects it finds, charging them with static electricity to keep thieves from stealing its collection. If it takes something from you, only careful negotiation will earn your item back without being shocked.
Author: sk372

Entry: Before unleashing electricity, POKENAME digs its tiny roots into the ground. This helps it stay grounded and boosts its attack.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME floats quietly through city streets at night. It draws electricity from traffic lights and power boxes to stay energized.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME raises its stick toward the sky during lightning storms. Some say it draws in thunderbolts to store for later use.
Author: .izik

Entry: The webs that POKENAME creates are incredibly sticky and rather viscous. The layer of goop-like film around the threads helps conduct electricity, letting it more easily shock prey into submission.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME haunts households in order to steal its nourishment from the victims within. It feasts on static electricity, so it's harmless to the residents aside from faint static noises and one's hair standing on end at times.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME puts large swaths of targets to sleep so it can more easily take static electricity from their bodies to feast on. The victims being fed on often report dreaming of spiders, lightning, or some combination thereof.
Author: sk372

Entry: When it rests, vines grow from one of its six egg-like portions, connecting to the others. These vines transfer nutrients between the segments.
Author: .izik

Entry: When in danger, it curls up and extends the thorns around its body. During lightning storms, the thorn on its nose extends to absorb electricity from lightning strikes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME seeks out small baby Pokémon in need of protection, usually Happiny. It uses its durable iron skin and pointy barbs to make sure no harm comes to their adopted kin.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: Occasionally a Chansey who loses its egg stumbles upon a lonely Ferroseed and adopts it, forgoing producing more eggs. After a while the two form an inseparable bond and become POKENAME.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: If anyone approaches its young, it flings thousands of tiny needles from its tail. These projectiles create a painful and effective deterrent.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses its sharp blades to cut moss off cave walls to eat. This simple diet sustains it in harsh underground environments.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its eyes can move independently, scanning its surroundings with ease. It can rotate a full 360 degrees on its metallic foot.
Author: .izik

Entry: It swings its tail like a maul, delivering devastating blows. With a single hit, it can topple a cedar tree effortlessly.
Author: .izik

Entry: Though it prefers to remain motionless at all times, POKENAME can defend itself by throwing the spiked orbs on its hands akin to shuriken. The thrown orbs grow back in a few hours.
Author: sk372

Entry: The thorns on its head extend into vines that pierce tree limbs, allowing it to reel itself up. It often sleeps peacefully nestled in the branches.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its goggle-like eyes glow gold as it accelerates in flight. In a straight line, it can reach speeds over 100 mph with ease.
Author: .izik

Entry: While flying, it divebombs anyone who approaches its nest. The helmet-like portion of its head is strong enough to smash boulders.
Author: .izik

Entry: The gems embedded in POKENAME's metallic body emit a strange, eerie power that lets it float. It lurks in abandoned factories, absorbing residual energy to sustain itself.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME will use its spikes to embed itself onto a tree, sapping nutrients from it. When in danger, POKENAME will self-destruct, which results in its spikes being flung out from its explosion, potentially hurting any nearby Pokémon or Trainers.
Author: sharkboiowen

Entry: POKENAME scatters dozens of thorns onto the ground from the skies to defend itself.  If it overworks itself, it will retreat to its nest and rest for a long period of time.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The green portion of its horn is covered in microscopic barbs. These barbs stick painfully into prey after it throws them with immense force.
Author: .izik

Entry: The gold bands around its arms and torso help it focus its strength. With this enhancement, it can punch through solid steel.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME likes to carry a seed around, hoping to find a nice spot to plant it. However, if it's not careful, its iron barbs sometimes skewer the seed it is trying to take care of.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: The spiky leaves that grow from POKENAME backsides protect their tail bulb from attacks. If the bulb is damaged too gravely, POKENAME may be unable to evolve.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME are quite territorial. They use their spiky bodies and sharp tails to defend their home.
Author: Lemmymaster

Entry: If startled, POKENAME's metallic body suddenly emits intense heat, making it dangerous to touch. It has been known to set dry grass ablaze in moments of panic.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its body is hollow and made of pure silver, covered in microscopic carvings. These markings appear to tell the story of its past life.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME live in harsh environments, typically found in arid deserts. They live in tight-knit groups and are highly territorial, their spiky and iron-rich hides letting them fend off rivals without much fear of reprisal.
Author: Katie

Entry: The tin-like material covering its body changes color to reflect its mood. It can mimic cool colors more effectively when calm and relaxed.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME subdues its enemies using its thorn-covered whip, halting all means of escape. When threatened, it is able to release a barrage of iron spikes from its tail.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: The spikes on its back ooze a green toxin, making its attacks particularly dangerous. It somersaults before striking to rake its spines across its foe.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME fires off spikes in addition to bludgeoning its victims. It excels against armored opponents and absorbs their metal.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: The spike on its forehead rotates like a drill, piercing through even the hardest materials. It can effortlessly bore through slate during combat.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its outer carapace is made of a thin but durable metal. While vulnerable to heat, it provides effective protection against physical attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is encased in thorny metal armor that covers its interior. Some folk tales suspect a vengeful spirit lies beneath the armor.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Though it resembles a flame, the green portion on its head is the tip of a long vine. This vine extends to slap at opponents who get too close.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its body mysteriously generates mercury, which it spits out when frightened. This metallic defense is as perplexing as it is effective.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME protect their keys from robbers by charging them with their thorny bodies. Their favorite keys often come from abandoned garden shacks.
Author: Ayner

Entry: The whisker-like protrusions are actually a pair of proboscis pointed enough to dig into solid stone. It clings to cave walls, digs into the rock and siphons minerals from within for its nutrition.
Author: sk372

Entry: It uses its powerful arms to knock ore loose from cavern walls. The ore it consumes helps fortify and strengthen its outer shell.
Author: .izik

Entry: In order to ensure its safety while it evolves, POKENAME evolved spikes as well as a durable shell around it. However, the extra defenses cause its evolution process to take longer than a normal Shelgon.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are very proud of the sharp spikes they bear as cogs. The exposed steel between the thorns shows evidence of large scratches.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: It floats gracefully above glades but drops with immense force if it senses a predator. The impact is strong enough to crack pavement.
Author: .izik

Entry: As a last resort, it latches onto an enemy and injects mercury with its jaws. This toxic act can be fatal if left untreated.
Author: .izik

Entry: While resting, POKENAME grows tusk-like spikes all over its body to protect itself from predators. These spikes are incredibly sturdy, allowing it to survive in hostile environments.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME covers itself with barbs as it hates being too close to other Pokémon. If you listen closely, you can hear soft humming coming from its mask.
Author: Hexx_Vixtar

Entry: Its spiky and robust body gives it adequate defenses, yet it still possesses a jumpy temperament. It leaves small pointed spikes behind as it flees, discouraging a hunter's continued pursuit.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its eyes blink brightly when searching for prey in the dark. It uses its thorns to pierce its catch before feeding.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME burrows into the ground in hopes of germinating the surrounding area with its spikes. Often, the soil it leaves behind is coarse and tough.
Author: Xephyr

Entry: It consumes silver ore scavenged from abandoned mines. A well-fed POKENAME gleams with a brilliant, metallic sheen.
Author: .izik

Entry: It swims through streams, its thorns wiggling as water washes over them. In battle, it uses its sturdy head to slam into foes with force.
Author: .izik

Entry: The thorns on the front of its heads mimic beaks and function like mouths. It uses them to grasp and consume food with surprising precision.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its tusk-like tongue to pierce Apricorns and lick the juice inside. If it tastes something sour, it flails its tongue wildly in disgust.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME shakes trees with its strong arms to knock down prey like Caterpie. It strikes fallen targets with its tusks before consuming them.
Author: .izik

Entry: It absorbs sunlight through its skin to gain energy. Its nose functions well on dry land and in water.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its combination of tusks and razor-sharp teeth gives this Pokémon an intense bite force. It plays by nibbling, causing many injuries to Trainers.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME use their tusks to crush berries and eat them. They are known to be friendly and docile but are incredibly determined.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: If POKENAME's tusk breaks off in battle, it blends into nearby foliage while it regrows. It consumes saplings to speed up the process.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME love searching for rusty metal to gnaw on. It's believed doing so helps with its teeth.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: Despite its fierce nature, it loves to nibble on the ankles of its Trainer as a sign of affection.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: It uses the large horn on its head to carve markings into trees, denoting things such as areas with dangerous predators or particularly lush food stores. Should the horn snap off, a new one grows back in a week.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME marks its territory by etching its unique signature in trees. Its blade chips but grows back stronger.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME's tusks are coated in a foul-smelling poison and can break concrete with a single strike. It trains at night to better protect its den.
Author: .izik

Entry: It's said that its flame comes from the will of fallen dragons. When angered, its flame burns brighter, and distant roars can be heard from its bulb.
Author: antomelon

Entry: POKENAME love being pet, but they sometimes get overwhelmed and will bite in retaliation.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. POKENAME have also been spotted sharpening parts of their tails on rocks.
Author: Elite01

Entry: POKENAME is known for its strong bite that can crush stone. Despite its intimidating appearance, it is a loyal companion to those who earn its trust.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: POKENAME primarily attacks with the horn on its head, which is strong enough to pierce through the hardest metals.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: The iron spikes on POKENAME's body often break off but regrow within hours. Ancient civilizations once melted these spikes into alloys for crafting durable shields.
Author: .izik

Entry: Powered by an ancient civilization's science, POKENAME's eyes burn red with the rage instilled by its creators.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: POKENAME dispenses a thin, sticky webbing from its tusks to trap foes. Once restrained, it spits a corrosive poison to incapacitate them.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's tusks improve its traction as it rolls about. An old folk remedy says that the dust it kicks up can cure brittle fingernails.
Author: .realthree

Entry: This Pokémon flies in erratic patterns in order to confuse its prey. POKENAME will strike its foe the instant it believes the prey is dizzy.
Author: .izik

Entry: It will ram into trees with its hard wings to knock Apricorns loose. It will taste each Apricorn once so it can determine the order it wants to eat them in.
Author: .izik

Entry: It prefers to spend its time in maple trees, drinking the sap from the trunks. Due to its diet, the mucus that comes off of its body smells like syrup.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME strikes its scales to communicate with others of its kind. If a scale breaks off, a new one grows within eight hours.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME becomes excited when it sees unfamiliar light sources. In its excitement, it accidentally releases clouds of brown Stun Spore from its tusks.
Author: .izik

Entry: It digs vast networks of caves underground to impress a mate. These tunnels can spell trouble for a city's infrastructure and stability.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME burrow endlessly through the ground, creating vast networks of tunnels that provide shelter and strategic advantage.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: Despite being genetically closer to Tentacool, POKENAME are known for sneaking into Haxorus herds in order to deter predators.
Author: mx_wellman

Entry: POKENAME's beaks frequently break off during feeding and regrow over time. When this happens, the other head eats enough food to sustain both of them until the beak returns.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME tends to chew unfamiliar objects with its tusks, which can get it into trouble. Thankfully, its tusks grow back quickly if they are damaged.
Author: noel5229

Entry: It slams its tusks against stalagmites, delighting in the resonating echoes. The sound is said to carry deep into caves, startling other Pokémon.
Author: .izik

Entry: When POKENAME uses all its electricity, its genes destabilize again. This can lead to a mutation that results in multiple tusks growing.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Its tusks are shed annually, prized by craftsmen for their unique properties. When ground into powder, they are used to create premium hair dyes.
Author: .izik

Entry: Using its clawed hands to climb trees, POKENAME are usually found gliding around the canopies in forests. Its hard tusks are used to deter foes.
Author: NyanDogeGaming

Entry: It slashes at foes with its claws and tusks in a flurry of strikes. Once weakened, it delivers a potent Poison Sting to immobilize them.
Author: .izik

Entry: It waits until Pokémon get close before striking, constricting and piercing them with pointed spikes. If any of its spikes happen to get chipped, it sharpens them with its tusks.
Author: darxer_

Entry: Its blade-like wings slash into cave walls, leaving deep carvings. These markings serve as a clear warning to trespassers in its territory.
Author: .izik

Entry: It raises its trunk high before unleashing a powerful Dragon Pulse. These attacks are strong enough to cause cave-ins if misdirected.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME bury themselves in the ground while metamorphosing. It's nearly impossible to crack its shell. If in danger, it spins around with its long tusks.
Author: darxer_

Entry: POKENAME's adaptation to have its long tusks grow from its head instead of its jaw helps prevent it from accidentally opening its mouth to the cold air of its environment, keeping vital body heat safely inside.
Author: .realthree

Entry: It becomes furious if construction occurs nearby, viewing it as a threat. With its metal arms, it unleashes destructive blows capable of leveling concrete foundations.
Author: .izik

Entry: It sprints along cave walls and leaps off to cleave stalactites with its tusks. It pays no mind to where the falling debris lands.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its crest, tusks and back plates are composed of an extremely durable and hard metal. One can see where a POKENAME has been by the scratches it leaves along cave walls.
Author: Holgast

Entry: POKENAME's powerful tusks are actually large ingrown scales, which it uses to cleave through dense forests. Its thick hide is resistant to most forms of damage.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME's tusks are sharp enough to cut through steel. Its body is covered in a thick dark-colored iron.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its petals are incredibly sharp, and they can slice straight through thick tree branches with relative ease. In combat, POKENAME can throw its sharpened flowers as a deadly projectile.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: A group of POKENAME were discovered guarding an ancient Unovan catacomb. Mistaking explorers for grave robbers, they resisted for weeks before being calmed.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's two heads hate each other and fight constantly. Owning a POKENAME whose heads cooperate is a mark of a skilled Dragon-type Trainer.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: It scrapes its tusks along cave walls to knock loose gems. The broken shards are promptly consumed as part of its mineral-rich diet.
Author: .izik

Entry: Using its sharp tusks, it carves into ore deposits to consume the fragments. This process is believed to prepare its body for evolution.
Author: .izik

Entry: It tucks in its wings and dives at foes, using its heavy tusks as battering rams. The impact leaves deep gouges in the ground.
Author: .izik

Entry: When excited, its tusks drip a green, gooey substance. Though harmless, the goo emits a pungent oil-like odor that repels predators.
Author: .izik

Entry: It leaps nimbly off furniture or terrain, performing elaborate aerial maneuvers. Its combat style combines karate and sumo with ruthless efficiency.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME takes down prey by running alongside it and goring it with its long tusks. Some cultures believe that possessing a POKENAME tusk will grant you victory in battle.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME uses its strong upper body strength to smash boulders. When this fails, it will use a horrendous Dragon Claw.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is known for a fierce and unyielding nature, earning it a place in the traditions of some cultures. Stone statues of this Pokémon are displayed during times of war.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: POKENAME is tasked with watching over its pack during times of rest. Its sharp tusks deter any threats from approaching their territory.
Author: noel5229

Entry: POKENAME is tasked with watching over its pack during times of rest. Its sharp tusks deter any threats from approaching their territory.
Author: noel5229

Entry: At night, POKENAME can be seen rolling across sandy deserts with ease. It often has arm-wrestling matches with Geodude.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: POKENAME is thought to be a lost child of a lost underground civilization. Researchers follow it from afar in hopes it will lead them to its home.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Its horn has the unique ability to sense others of its kind. This power grows stronger near ancient ruins, a phenomenon that puzzles scientists to this day.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME were revered as guardians of sacred temples in ancient times. They would stand near tablets inscribed with intricate riddles, awakening only to challenge travelers. Only the most intelligent could solve their puzzles and gain entry.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: The pearl on its head glows brilliantly when near ancient artifacts. Archaeologists are puzzled by this phenomenon, as the connection between the pearl and these relics remains unknown.
Author: .izik

Entry: It's said that POKENAME were formed from clay many years ago. Its aromatic leaf smells of rich and loamy soil.
Author: 22ndsolstice

Entry: It still retains the great hopping capabilities of a Natu, despite being made of incredibly dense materials. POKENAME can stay incredibly still for long periods of time, appearing as nothing more than a simple stone idol until danger approaches.
Author: El Fail

Entry: POKENAME runs off an energy source of unknown origin. It uses its large tail as a conduit to steal power from small electronics, then stashes the broken items in tree branches high off the ground.
Author: TheLastMaleNeko

Entry: POKENAME was supposedly made many years ago. It guides lost travelers with its circular lights.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME keeps tireless watch over the ruins it lives in. Because of its second head, it can stand sentry even when asleep.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME perches atop ancient temple ruins, crafting its nests from vines. These nests are often found near forgotten altars.
Author: .izik

Entry: They chew boulders into flat tablet shapes, carving mysterious etchings on each. These unique markings are thought to be ancient, but their meaning remains unknown.
Author: .izik

Entry: The tablet on its chest glows red with anger, warning enemies to stay away. Its rough skin becomes tougher in colder climates, making it an exceptional guardian.
Author: .izik

Entry: Many are found guarding desert tombs, the spirals on their larger mouths glowing white before delivering a deadly bite. Their eerie presence wards off intruders.
Author: .izik

Entry: Microscopic etchings have been discovered on the orange glass dome of its head. These markings appear to be writings from a long-lost civilization, but their meaning and origin remain a mystery.
Author: .izik

Entry: When deflecting attacks with its hardened head, the spiral on its chest glows briefly. The markings seem to react to impacts, though their purpose remains unknown.
Author: .izik

Entry: Long ago, POKENAME were gladiators in ancient coliseums. Though blind, it can sense enemy movements through the mane-like structure on its helmet, giving it an edge in battle.
Author: .izik

Entry: Archeological data gathered from ruins that were home to POKENAME suggest they were bonded to a child from birth, serving as a guardian and protector. They are often seen searching various alcoves and hidden spots, trying to find their lost partners.
Author: TheLastMaleNeko

Entry: Archeological data gathered from ruins that were home to POKENAME suggest they were bonded to a child from birth, serving as a guardian and protector. They are often seen searching various alcoves and hidden spots, trying to find their lost partners.
Author: TheLastMaleNeko

Entry: POKENAME burrows through the ground with relentless determination. Its mechanical nature assures its dominance in deserts filled with ruins.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: When POKENAME sleeps, it likes to be completely submerged in earth, sand, or clay. For some reason, wild POKENAME will never attack one another under any circumstance, even if it is a matter of life or death.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: There are ancient desert murals depicting swarms of POKENAME ripping up fields of crops and carrying them into the sky. Some scholars believe this legend refers to an old farming ritual, while others fear it was a sign of destruction.
Author: .izik

Entry: While POKENAME are capable of delivering devastating punches with their highly developed arms, the unfortunate placement of these appendages often trips them up mid-fight. As they age, their weight distribution changes to help counteract this issue.
Author: TheLastMaleNeko

Entry: This fusion is eerily close in appearance to carved idols found in a number of ruins. When given an order, it will carry it out relentlessly, never resting or tiring. Its power over illusions allows it to do this work very discreetly.
Author: El Fail

Entry: The tablet it holds is said to make those nearby feel uneasy. It floats silently through tombs with an unknown purpose, leaving an eerie presence behind.
Author: .izik

Entry: It burrows into dunes near desert tombs, camouflaging itself perfectly. When explorers approach, it leaps out to drag them beneath the sands.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can be observed flying set paths within the caverns it calls home, as if on patrol. It can stun and confuse attackers by flashing lights from the symbols on its wings and chest.
Author: sk372

Entry: The tablet it carries was once used by fortune tellers to glimpse the future. It glows in twenty unique colors when deeply stared at, but POKENAME will phase through walls to avoid unworthy gazes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are able to channel energy from the soles of their feet into explosive bursts of speed. However, due to their weight, POKENAME lack the ability to change direction mid-flight, often causing them to slam into things with very alarming force.
Author: TheLastMaleNeko

Entry: POKENAME colonies are found in the walls of ancient tombs, thriving in the darkness. These hidden colonies can be detected through the presence of warm spots on the walls.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME fiercely guards gems embedded in the walls of ancient tombs. Its vigilant nature has made it a prized protector in stories of treasure hunters.
Author: .izik

Entry: Making their home in dark catacombs, POKENAME uses echolocation to navigate the labyrinthine halls. Their agility makes them excellent fliers, even in total darkness.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME nests atop forested temples, its wings as light as air and made of an ancient cotton-like material. The origin of its unique wings baffles researchers.
Author: .izik

Entry: The spirals on its cheeks glow yellow when it prepares to attack. The mucus it secretes while moving is extremely slippery, making it hard to follow.
Author: .izik

Entry: The spiral on its belly glows brightly when POKENAME is in distress. During these times, the spines on its head appear to grow sharper, serving as a defense mechanism.
Author: .izik

Entry: Should ancient relics wash ashore, POKENAME will instinctively guard them with unmatched loyalty. It will defend these treasures with its life.
Author: .izik

Entry: Ancient gardeners are believed to have used POKENAME to monitor the health of fungi. They can detect when a mushroom is sick or dying with startling accuracy.
Author: .izik

Entry: Ancient blacksmiths once used its Headbutt to shape shields. The force of its strike was said to be strong enough to bend even the toughest metals.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME fights using the core on its head, which expels blasts of ancient energy. Sometimes, the core breaks off on impact, deactivating the stone creature.
Author: NexusShenanigans

Entry: POKENAME is often found drifting near sunken ships, as if still guarding some long-lost treasure. Divers cling to its jagged frame as it glides through the water, guiding them swiftly past coral and wreckage.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Thought to be a myth, POKENAME is fiercely loyal to its owners. They are now known to have been used as guard dogs by a lost, ancient civilization.
Author: Gummy Wookie

Entry: Their tails are equally good at digging and swimming. They eagerly helped people and inspired the creation of shovels and oars in ancient civilizations.
Author: Markusknight

Entry: POKENAME was first discovered on ancient wall paintings, with the living species being discovered much later. The hypnotic pattern on their abdomen has been depicted as ornaments.
Author: Markusknight

Entry: POKENAME is full of energy. They swim for prolonged periods of time, shining bright from its joints. When the time comes to rest, they shut down and hibernate on the river and lake beds.
Author: Markusknight

Entry: POKENAME uses its immense strength to lift and reposition stone columns in ancient temples. They are often found restoring long-forgotten ruins.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are self-assigned defenders of mountain villages. By rolling downhill at high speed, they can generate momentum into colossal punches.
Author: wigglypon

Entry: POKENAME lives in certain ancient sites. Due to its shape and matching holes on the walls, it could have been used as a key for specific mechanisms.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME rolls steadily through the corridors of ancient ruins. If it suffers damage due to collisions, it can collect new material for repairs.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It is speculated that all POKENAME are mentally linked through one large hivemind. They seem to follow orders given from an unknown source.
Author: kittyluv090

Entry: The pole it wields as a weapon bears ancient carvings. Researchers have puzzled for decades over where it obtains these unique relics.
Author: .izik

Entry: The spiral on its tablet glows brightly while it digs through solid rock. Some ancient miners employed POKENAME to create intricate mine shafts.
Author: .izik

Entry: These social Pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and antennae movements. Their camouflage resembles a Poison-type species with similar markings and will travel alongside them for protection against predators.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: When POKENAME gather to migrate, their cacophony of thunderous chirps can be heard half a mile away. This sound is considered a sure sign of spring.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The vines covering its body are feathered, allowing it to flick them for lift. This peculiar motion gives it the ability to fly for short bursts.
Author: .izik

Entry: Their camouflage enables these POKENAME freedom in the forest, as other Pokémon assume they are poisonous. They communicate about where to find the best berries to consume, and travel in small groups to maintain a sense of direction.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Its body grows intensely hot before transforming and reshaping into its opponent. If disturbed, its original beak may persist after the transformation.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's outer shell mimics a Fletchling to dissuade other bird Pokémon from attacking it. Its body will become warm to the touch when it is ready for evolution.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME uses its feather to control gusts of winds. It will sometimes get blown over on windy days.
Author: Elite01.

Entry: POKENAME flies in small flocks, using gusts of wind to spread embers across fields. It communicates with others through fiery patterns in the sky, signaling warnings or directions.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME chirps in rhythmic patterns, adjusting its calls based on the time of day. At night, the flames on its wings glow faintly, resembling distant lanterns in the dark.
Author: .izik

Entry: By channeling air currents around its wings, it increases the speed of its punches. This aerodynamic boost makes it a formidable attacker while flying.
Author: .izik

Entry: It patches holes in clothes left to dry with its sticky webbing. Despite its good intentions, the garments often end up stuck together.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is very friendly towards humans and Pokémon. It soars through the skies at Mach 2 speed, displaying it's elegant feathers.
Author: asyoko

Entry: Urban areas are seeing an uptick in POKENAME populations, particularly in Unova. Friendly and prone to singing cute songs amongst its siblings, POKENAME has become a popular pet.
Author: sk372

Entry: Despite having wings, this little Pokémon likes to walk around on the ground. It easily befriends other small Pokémon, sharing its food with them.
Author: Holzycookie

Entry: It rubs yellow ooze from its tail on the nests of other Pokémon. Although harmless, this habit often angers territorial Pokémon.
Author: .izik

Entry: It bounces off its springy tail to gain momentum before taking flight. This technique allows it to soar gracefully into the air.
Author: .izik

Entry: As POKENAME levitates through the skies, it creates dazzling displays of light with its pyrokinesis. At least, it tries to: POKENAME typically and accidentally causes small fires that it needs to stamp out.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It flaps its small arms as if flying before pecking at its opponent. The attack often lacks strength but shows its determination.
Author: .izik

Entry: It flies to the tops of canyons to knock down trees into the rivers below. This behavior is thought to help redirect water flow for its nests.
Author: .izik

Entry: If POKENAME is interrupted while photosynthesizing, it will mercilessly peck the offender until they leave. Since POKENAME's body temperature increases during photosynthesis, these pecks often cause burns.
Author: darkweavile428

Entry: POKENAME often mistake their horn for its beak, leading them to impale food rather than eat it. It's not uncommon to spot one wandering with a berry stuck on its horn.
Author: Techlaw

Entry: Its ears crackle with electricity before it dives to peck at its foe. The sparks make it easy to spot at night, even when ambushing.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is known for using its tail as a lightning rod to gather energy for its attacks. Despite not yet having grown out wings, POKENAME will still find ways to get into the air to try and glide.
Author: c0u51nv1nn7

Entry: Upbeat and affectionate, POKENAME is positively ecstatic to be able to fly and will joyfully flap around for the sake of it. Many POKENAME don't want to evolve, as they fear they may lose the ability to fly.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: A cowardly Pokémon that hides in trees. It floats about the bark of the trees, pecking at it, hoping for a small bug Pokémon to appear.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: On spring mornings, it chirps nonstop until it sees someone wake up. Feeling proud of its effort, it flies away thinking it has been helpful.
Author: .izik

Entry: It pretends to be a stuffed toy near daycares, blending in with ease. During snack time, it pushes over toddlers to steal their treats before flying off.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME soar after migrating herds of Stantler. A flock of hunting POKENAME is a common sight in the spring.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The feathers around POKENAME's neck keep it warm in the winter. Unlike its winged variant, it waits out the cold.
Author: .realthree

Entry: They fly low to the surface of lakes and ponds to drag their tails across the surface. They splash water onto bug Pokémon in branches above them in the hopes of knocking them down to secure a meal.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: They dig up and break rocks with their muscular arms to expose roots underneath. Afterwards, they dive headfirst into the ground to peck and rip apart the roots for consumption.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: As it ages, it grows extra wings made of gelatinous material. This fluid is hot to the touch but cools when near friends.
Author: .izik

Entry: When hunting, POKENAME makes a coughing-like sound that produces a small burst of flames. This behavior inspired a common saying wishing good health to the ill: “Fly away, POKENAME”.
Author: WhatAGoodDayToDie

Entry: In cold weather, it struggles to fly and takes frequent breaks. To stay airborne, it blows fire onto its wings to keep them warm.
Author: .izik

Entry: The large feathers on its back were prized by ancient poets. They believed writing with them would bring great luck to their works.
Author: .izik

Entry: If one encroaches near their nesting grounds, they spit a burning acid. If the acid touches someone, they will require proper and specific treatment in order to fully recover from the affliction.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: When building its nest, it searches for hot pepper plants. It squirts pepper juice on the base, enjoying the spicy sensation on its feathers.
Author: .izik

Entry: It buzzes across creek surfaces, leaving trails of heat in its wake. Tracking it becomes easy with a thermometer due to the hot air it generates.
Author: .izik

Entry: The egg on the back of POKENAME is used as a lure for its prey. POKENAME secretes a paralysing poison through the egg, and while its prey is immobilised, it will cook them with its fiery vines.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: When throwing a tantrum, it perches on tall trees and scorches nearby bushes with flames. This fiery outburst is often done out of spite.
Author: .izik

Entry: It uses its long neck to thrust its head underwater and catch prey. It avoids cold water as the chill saps its stamina.
Author: .izik

Entry: It sticks its nose into geysers to soak up the intense heat. This habit helps warm its nose during colder seasons.
Author: .izik

Entry: It raises its internal temperature while rolling, blasting powerful flames from its trunk. The combination of fire and momentum makes it formidable.
Author: .izik

Entry: The more delicious food it consumes, the brighter its flames become. A full belly significantly boosts the power of its fire attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is a notorious egg thief. When it runs at its top speed of 50 mph, it jumps into the air and glides for short periods of time.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: POKENAME builds its nests by carefully burning logs with controlled embers. It is highly territorial and will spit sparks at any intruders that approach its dam.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME moves so fast that it leaves behind trails of cinders in the air. If it spots prey, it strikes with a fiery dive before jetting away in a blur of flames.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its body is filled with a flammable liquid that jiggles as it moves. It spits this liquid at foes before igniting it with fiery attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: When searching for a mate, it flings its yellow feathers in a circular pattern. It performs an elaborate dance on a treestump that it has bitten flat.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME senses the fighting spirit of those around it and responds by increasing the intensity of its flames. It spars with others by launching small fireballs to test their endurance.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are fierce defenders of their territory, patrolling both ground and sky. If there are long scratch marks on the ground, it means a POKENAME has made its nest nearby.
Author: darxer_

Entry: POKENAME is very particular about its roses, using its beak and wings meticulously to keep them in perfect condition. If the roses are ever ripped, it will become enraged and stop at nothing for revenge.
Author: darxer_

Entry: The gelatinous material surrounding its body is intensely hot. To prevent fires, it avoids landing on flammable surfaces, even while resting.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's wings are soft like cotton, but they radiate intense heat. It perches atop treetops, basking in the sun to keep its flames at peak strength.
Author: .izik

Entry: Spinning on one foot, it flings hot needles in every direction to deter foes. The leaves on its head grow slower when it is under stress.
Author: .izik

Entry: It lands on plateaus and unleashes flames from its beak, creating intricate shapes in the sky. These fiery displays mesmerize onlookers.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lie in wait under the sand, only revealing the tail end of its arrow. Once the arrow is touched, it explodes upwards, dousing whatever it catches in lava-hot sand.
Author: darxer_

Entry: While its snout resembles a beak, it is covered in soft fur. It wags its tail excitedly before unleashing powerful Ember attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: It attacks fiercely with its beak and claws. Though it's very territorial, it's easily distracted by shiny coins.
Author: snescontroller

Entry: It performs somersaults in rapid succession, keeping foes off guard. While spinning, it blows flames at opponents with impressive precision.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME trains by carrying branches in its talons as it soars through the sky. Its powerful legs allow it to strike with kicks hot enough to scorch the ground.
Author: .izik

Entry: The stones covering its body heat up the longer it flies. It hurls these fiery rocks at prey before launching an attack.
Author: .izik

Entry: With both its wings and legs still developing, POKENAME exhibits a bit of a complex, displaying aggressive behavior. It snorts out steam and spits flame at anybody it sees, attempting to pick fights.
Author: sk372

Entry: A majestic creature often depicted as a symbol of rebirth in some circles. POKENAME is incredibly fast, reaching speeds fast enough to break the sound barrier. Scorch marks tend to be left along its trail.
Author: merclipse

Entry: It generates gusts of hot air as it sprints across the landscape. These zephyrs can ignite dry grass, leaving blazing trails behind.
Author: .izik

Entry: It slaps its tail against the water's surface to intimidate foes. Once provoked, it exhales intense flames to keep attackers at bay.
Author: .izik

Entry: It lulls opponents to sleep using hypnotic psychic waves. Once they are unconscious, it unleashes fiery bursts from its beak to overwhelm them.
Author: .izik

Entry: The silk that comes out of its mouth is warm to the touch. If left on exposed skin for more than ten minutes, it can cause a rash.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's normal form is soft and heated, described as being like warm gelatin. When transforming, it cocoons itself in flames before the fire bursts and reveals its morphed state.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME has become popular as a pet due to its soft and warm plumage and a tendency to cozy up to other, larger beings. It creates tiny flames when it chirps and sings to others.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are often seen collecting magma stones at the base of volcanoes to make cocoons. Their tails alone can reach 500 degrees Fahrenheit.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: It secrets a paint-like substance from its tail that it uses to mark its territory. When it gets in a fight, it lights this substance ablaze.
Author: admiralvermin

Entry: While POKENAME looks like a marine plant, it is actually a Bug-type Pokémon drawing in prey with mimicry. It causes serious burns on contact.
Author: Hellaluyeah

Entry: POKENAME is also referred to as "Sun Drop" by locals. It expels flames from its blade up to 5,500 degrees F.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: A humongous larva, POKENAME dreams about evolving into a mighty dragon someday. Its spikes are made of ice that never melts.
Author: VoxPoss

Entry: Before evolving, POKENAME wraps itself in a fibrous material that acts as a cocoon. Despite being still and inactive in this state, they are overwhelmingly hot to the touch. The cocoon erupts in a fiery explosion when POKENAME finishes evolution.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME floats around the deserts surrounding ancient tombs, clutching strange artifacts. During the day, it can hold the artifact aloft to channel the sun's energy and enhance its flame powers in battle.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME has been discovered within ruins within short distances of dormant volcanoes. Researchers theorize that old civilizations may have used them as warning signs, as it grows restless near active volcanoes.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is petulant and defensive, thinking others look down on it due to its size and posture. It's prone to throwing tantrums, as well as fireballs, at anything nearby when its temper flares.
Author: sk372

Entry: When fighting, it uses the sun to its advantage by positioning itself so the bright sunlight blinds the opponents and makes it harder for them to land a hit. Once the battle is won, POKENAME strikes a dramatic pose and spouts fire from its horns.
Author: milchik

Entry: POKENAME radiates its internal body heat through the red thorns on its head. It can fire its hot thorns at its opponents, causing excruciating pain.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is extremely possessive of any coins it purloins for its collection. To keep others from taking back what it stole, it will super-heat them with its flames so that nobody else can handle the heated metal but it.
Author: sk372

Entry: Old legends of will-o'-wisps rising from the ground in the woods may have actually been due to POKENAME. Their sticks light on fire when someone unfamiliar draws near, and they nest partially submerged in the earth.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: This larva uses heavy cannons to shoot water streams and push enemies far away. That's the only way POKENAME can protect their soft belly.
Author: VoxPoss

Entry: POKENAME's body is mostly comprised of its large mouth, leaving little room for other organs. It is thought this is why it has a relatively small appetite despite its size.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME latches onto light posts to absorb electricity for sustenance. This behavior often causes power outages in smaller towns.
Author: .izik

Entry: It scrapes the edges of its wings across its skull to sharpen them into deadly points, letting it cut prey as it flies past multiple times until they succumb to their wounds and it can feast on the pooling blood.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME uses its bone to crack open geodes and decorates its nest with the crystals inside. These sparkling displays attract prey like Sableye.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's feet are highly sensitive, detecting vibrations in the ground to track enemy movements. This allows it to sense foes even in complete darkness.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hones its agility by dodging droplets of water falling from stalactites in waterlogged caves. This rigorous training strengthens its evasive abilities in battle.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its tongue to wrap around ledges in caves and swing from stone to stone. It uses sound waves to locate its next target in the darkness.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: It emits a supersonic scream to terrify those around it. This serves as a deterrent while it waits for evolution to take place.
Author: .izik

Entry: Given its bulk, it cannot fly well. Despite this, POKENAME jump off cliffs hoping to soar, only to tumble to the bottom.
Author: CapWolfBane

Entry: When it spots burrowing prey like Diglett, POKENAME drills into the ground using its horn. It pursues its target relentlessly through underground tunnels.
Author: .izik

Entry: The inside of its mouth is warm and soft, and its body rather durable, making it perfect for protecting and incubating eggs. Daycares and Breeders have taken to using them to keep especially precious eggs safe from harm.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME untangles its vines to snare foes, reeling them in for a venomous Poison Fang attack. Its precision leaves little chance for escape.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME tails are a key ingredient in the 'Savory Cinnabar', a dish popular aboard the S.S. Anne. Lightly braised, they are served in a Colbur Berry-based sauce.
Author: .izik

Entry: Though it may look frightening, POKENAME is not aggressive towards humans. It's large mouth is for consuming vast quantities of flowers whole for their honey and other nutrients.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME constructs elaborate near-invisible complexes in caves for its nest. Its translucent walls and furniture are nearly impossible to detect.
Author: .izik

Entry: In the wild, POKENAME remain still until approached, then suddenly lunge out at their prey, sucking their blood. They use their psychic abilities to alter the perception of others to lure them closer.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME breaks off dead tree branches to fuel its flame-based attacks. It often forages in charred forests to find the perfect material.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are hyper-aggressive, loudly screeching at anything that looks at it funny. If you disturb a school of POKENAME, your eardrums will burst before they even have the chance to attack you.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It transforms its extended tongue into an imitation of its prey. Once another member of the species draws near, it quickly transforms back, wrapping around the hapless victim and dragging it into POKENAME's hungry maw.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's fangs are retractable, remaining hidden from sight until it spots potential prey. It swoops quickly and sinks its teeth into victims, draining their blood for nutrients that will hasten its evolution.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME never closes its mouth and consumes anything that fits inside. Its wings are nonfunctional as a consequence.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It has grown to its enormous size by devouring anything it can fit into its sizeable mouth. Rendered useless by its weight, its wings flap feebly behind it as it eats.
Author: houseoffallingflowers

Entry: Many describe the sights of POKENAME shedding its skin as disturbing, as its head will protrude from within the mouth of the layer being shed before it can escape its old skin.
Author: sk372

Entry: The floating crystal orb in POKENAME's mouth glows a vivid violet when a storm is imminent. Sailors see it as an omen of turbulent seas.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are a highly aggressive species found swarming deep in cave systems. Their stingers are so sharp and their attacks so quick and ferocious that even Steelix and Aggron are wary of their nests.
Author: sk372

Entry: Though it has no visible teeth, POKENAME still "bites" others as a form of mischievous play. After annoying its chosen victim, it flies off to hide in narrow spaces, tucking its wings to help it squeeze in.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME releases a dense Haze from its mouth to obscure its surroundings. It uses this tactic to confuse both predators and prey alike.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME weaves its web between stalagmites in dark caverns. It uses this sticky trap to catch prey unaware as they traverse the tunnels.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME thrives in dense forests, preying on smaller Pokémon like Pidgey and Weedle. It uses a single Supersonic to disorient its prey before striking.
Author: .izik

Entry: The sudden formation of eyes upon evolution was incredibly stressful for POKENAME, making them much more volatile than their previous form. Bright lights seem to anger them, and they often give chase to anything that moves too quickly.
Author: howlingstarr

Entry: POKENAME paralyzes foes with a Thunder Wave before carrying them away into the night. Its swift abductions have inspired many eerie tales.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's whiskers twitch excitedly at the sight of prey. If unable to defeat a Trainer with its bite, it will snatch an item from their bag and escape into the sky.
Author: .izik

Entry: The tip of its tail is coated with a potent toxin, making it a dangerous weapon. POKENAME uses its tail to incapacitate prey before feeding.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME rapidly flaps its small wings when either excited or irritated. Distinguishing between the two states is crucial in avoiding a nasty bite.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME's heavy frame is a result of the huge amounts of blood it consumes. Without specific training, this Pokémon will remain permanently grounded.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME flies around parks at dusk, drawn to the color yellow. It drains energy from anyone wearing yellow and steals their clothing as a prize.
Author: .izik

Entry: The red gem on POKENAME's crown glows intensely before it unleashes a barrage of Air Cutter attacks. It can break apart solid stone with ease.
Author: .izik

Entry: Should one be under attack by a POKENAME, the best course of action is to aim for its whiskers. Extremely sensitive and important for maintaining aerial balance, it will immediately retreat if they are touched.
Author: sk372

Entry: The teeth and mouth of POKENAME are very small and sensitive. It uses illusions to lure prey into a false sense of safety to more safely bite them.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: It hides in darkness, waiting to frighten prospective victims with a loud screech. Those who strike it in defense are hit with a stunning counter blow, incapacitating them so that POKENAME may feed on their blood.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME emits a powerful Screech when an intruder approaches its nest. The sound is disorienting enough to deter most threats.
Author: .izik

Entry: If disturbed while draining its prey, POKENAME glows a deep brown before exploding. This tactic ensures its escape from potential threats.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is incredibly squeamish and uses Mud-Slap to disorient predators like Charmeleon. It quickly burrows underground to avoid confrontation.
Author: .izik

Entry: Each and every sharp point on POKENAME's body can inject a potent poison if touched. It is most active at night. It can flap its wings and latch onto prey without making a sound.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME glides effortlessly through the night sky, diving in and out of clouds. Ancient cultures once believed its gleaming body signified an impending poor harvest.
Author: .izik

Entry: The hooded portion is attached to its neck. When it gets cold, its wings will radiate heat to keep the outer shell warm.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME cleans its horn by soaking it in ponds. A freshly cleaned horn can be wielded more efficiently during aerial combat.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon suffers from its high speed. Whenever they run, their tongue flops around wildly. Careless POKENAME trip over their own tongue because it got in the way.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: Most active on nights with a new moon, POKENAME fly without making a sound. Their fangs are too dull to properly bite into prey, so they instead keep around red berries to bite into, trying to play tough and appear intimidating.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: In the dark of night, POKENAME forages for its favorite foods, honey and the juiciest of berries. Trainers have been accidentally frightened off by the sight of POKENAME's long tongue dripping bright red berry juice.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's body is incredibly sticky, which allows it to scale vertical surfaces effortlessly. The body also radiates extreme heat, so it leaves a trail of burnt stone wherever it passes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME burrows into snow mounds with its wings folded tightly. It pokes its small nose out, sniffing the air for potential food sources.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME spins in swift, clockwise movements before diving onto prey like Metapod. Its razor-sharp wings slice through even the hardest shells.
Author: .izik

Entry: Rescuers sometimes deploy POKENAME to locate trapped survivors in caves. Its echolocation and small size allow it to navigate tight openings effortlessly.
Author: .izik

Entry: In ancient times, POKENAME's wings were prized by leatherworkers. They were used to craft durable leather for shields.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME opens its massive mouth when rolling rapidly toward smaller prey like Spearow and Sandshrew. Its speed makes it nearly impossible to evade.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its powerful serpentine body will constrict prey, before sinking its fangs in and gorging itself on blood.  Once completely drained of blood, it disposes the prey's husk in its gaping maw.
Author: sk372

Entry: The inside of POKENAME's mouth is humid, creating an ideal environment for incubating eggs. It fiercely defends this precious space from intruders.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's fangs naturally fall out just before it evolves. Long ago, knights sought these teeth to craft rings they believed would bring them good fortune.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME struggles to stay airborne with its stone-like body. When exhausted, it crashes into cliff faces to embed itself and rest safely.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME nests in power substations, where it bites into wires to absorb electricity. Its presence often causes localized blackouts.
Author: .izik

Entry: They work together to bring down prey and feed on their blood. Each POKENAME is not satisfied until it has completely drained 100 victims.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: POKENAME avoids nesting near water and flies for days in search of arid landscapes. Its stamina is remarkable, even in harsh desert conditions.
Author: .izik

Entry: It stalks in arctic caves. When hunting, it covers its face with its hair and wraps its wings around itself to appear less threatening.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME glides from its home near a mountain's plateau, screeching loudly at other predators who get too close. Its cries can be heard from up to ten miles away.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME coils itself around stalactites to sleep, using its spiny body as a deterrent. The sharp quills keep potential threats at bay.
Author: .izik

Entry: Although it is weak, POKENAME can produce a bloodcurdling scream that scares away the toughest of foes. It is often found in aquatic caves.
Author: Canada

Entry: POKENAME bites into oil barrels and consumes the fluid that flows out. This fuel is mixed with its toxic glands for powerful poison-based attacks.
Author: .izik

Entry: Chefs in Sandgem Town serve fried POKENAME wings as a delicacy. These wings are spiced with cayenne pepper and paired with Watmel Berry jam.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's powerful jaws allow it to chop down a cedar tree with a single bite. It uses the wood to build elaborate dens near rivers.
Author: .izik

Entry: Rural villagers once enlisted POKENAME to pound mochi with its precise strikes. This practice was vital in creating their traditional festive desserts.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hunts in shallow waters, swallowing multiple Staryu in one gulp. Its voracious appetite makes it a dominant predator.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME gathers and devours cave vines in large quantities using its massive second mouth. It stores excess food in its den for later.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME resides among large stalagmites, blending into the shadows to avoid predators. It only emerges at night to hunt.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its wings are incredibly strong and can support its body weight. It will quietly flap the wings while it sleeps.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can stretch its elastic maw to envelop entire Berry branches. It uses this method to strip all the fruit in one motion.
Author: .izik

Entry: The twig-like appendage on POKENAME's head turns dark red when warm. While hunting, it emits a Lansat Berry-like aroma to attract prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: Contrary to popular belief, male POKENAME do not drink blood. They play-fight with their siblings from a young age to practice using their fangs and venomous horn.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME uses its magnetic nose to detect metal objects on nighttime travelers. Once it identifies a target, it waits for the perfect moment to strike when they're off guard.
Author: .izik

Entry: As they grow, POKENAME's wings stay the same size, becoming more of a threat display than a means of flight. They protect their young while females hunt for blood with which to feed their offspring.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: It consumes metal ore to fortify its wings, allowing it to fly through dense tunnels. Its strengthened wings can shatter stone with ease.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME use their expanded vocal chords to mimic the cries of other Pokémon, cloaking themselves in an illusion and crying out to lure in prey. By the time the unsuspecting prey get close enough to see the illusion fade, it is too late.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: It drinks up to 10 ounces of blood during any feeding. Its ribbons makes it easier to hold its prey before it bites.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME is too heavy for its wings to lift it for long periods, but it unfurls them when facing off against a foe. If this display does not deter its opponent, it will open its jaw wide and release a disorienting screech.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME has an incredibly large oral cavity and a huge pair of wings which it can use to generate strong winds to protect itself. Zubat seek shelter in its mouth to hide from Trainers that try to capture them.

POKENAME has an incredibly large oral cavity and a huge pair of wings which it can use to generate strong winds to protect itself. Zubat seek shelter in its mouth to hide from Trainers that try to capture them.
Various murals have been found depicting a titanic oceanic serpent resembling this Pokémon. It apparently preyed on ancient seafarers.
Author: ansleehariot

Entry: Despite its menacing appearance, it is very playful. It loves to frolic in the moonlight with fellow POKENAME.
Author: gellyfishsh

Entry: POKENAME opens its enormous mouth to vacuum in prey like Hoppip and Cottonee. It often drifts silently before striking unsuspecting targets.
Author: .izik

Entry: It soars through the night sky, using its powerful legs to deliver crushing dive-bombs. Prey rarely sees the attack coming before it is knocked unconscious.
Author: .izik

Entry: Being nocturnal and agile, POKENAME is often employed by hotels for late-night room service. Its wings allow it to navigate hallways silently and swiftly.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME clings to the ceiling of caves, patiently waiting for prey. It pounces on its prey from above, devouring them with the mouth on its belly.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME uses its tentacles as whips to deliver powerful blows. Its attacks are fast and relentless, leaving its foes defenseless.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's mastery over its flames has made it a valuable asset for bakeries in Kanto. Its steady heat is perfect for maintaining optimal oven temperatures.
Author: .izik

Entry: In ancient merchant grounds, POKENAME was used as a sentinel against theft. If trouble arose, it released a deafening Screech to alert guards.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME acts as a perch for Zubat to safely rest upon between hunts. Since its unique body makes hunting for itself difficult, the Zubat share some of the prey they grab with it in exchange for its service.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME prefers to settle in forests recently ravaged by wildfires. The lingering heat provides a perfect environment for it to thrive.
Author: .izik

Entry: The two sides of a POKENAME's mouth each have their own brain, which often leads to them fighting over what they want to eat. Most of their nourishment comes from anything caught between the two sides while they are fighting each other.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Its sleek wings shimmer as it glides through moonlit skies, leaving a ghostly trail in its path. Its clawed hands are perfectly adapted for both midair combat and grappling foes, making it a fearsome predator of the night.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Oddly enough, POKENAME meditates during the day. At night, however, it is extremely active, devouring whatever it can, from small Pokémon to fruit.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The metal plating on POKENAME's body naturally flakes off over time. Ancient civilizations once used these flakes to forge durable medical tools.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's thick hide keeps it cool even in extreme heat. If it encounters a foe strong enough to harm it, it retreats without hesitation by flying away.
Author: .izik

Entry: With razor-sharp fangs and intricate gears, it's a swift predator. Yet, if its machinery malfunctions, it becomes a threat to anything nearby.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: Should it come across a sleeping Pokémon or Trainer, it will stand near and protect them while they slumber. It inhales large amounts of air through its massive mouth and expands its body to intimidate foes.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME will use its psychic powers to float in caves and use telekinetic blasts to subdue foes. It is primarily active at nighttime and seldom leaves caves during the day.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME emits powerful psychic pulses to stun its prey. Once incapacitated, it drains their energy with a devastating Leech Life.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its mouth and tongue grew before the rest of its body did, making flying and hunting difficult. Should it catch prey, it gorges on massive amounts of blood so it can go weeks before needing to feast again.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME hunts by diving into crowds of smaller prey and firing poisonous spikes from its body. It then feasts on those struck down by its toxins while the rest flees in fear.
Author: sk372

Entry: Tropical resorts rely on POKENAME during night festivals to cut coconuts for drinks. Its sharp tusks can slice up to ten coconuts in a single motion.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lies in wait in narrow cave entrances, hoping that unsuspecting prey will march into its open mouth.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: It lies waiting on dark cave floors. When a victim steps on it, POKENAME clamps down with its fangs and rapidly sucks blood from their ankles.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: POKENAME dangles its gem-covered tongue from cave walls to lure prey like Murkrow. Once close enough, it strikes with precision using a terrifying Night Shade.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME roll at incredible speeds before flapping their wings hard enough to launch themselves into the air. They open their mouths as wide as they can to capture unsuspecting prey from above, sinking their teeth into them and rolling away.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: The leaves on POKENAME's head emit a faint scent of tarragon. Chefs in Veilstone City use these aromatic leaves to prepare their signature dishes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME performs an intricate dance, gracefully waving its wings back and forth. This mesmerizing display often distracts prey before it begins its aerial hunt.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME performs a graceful ballroom-style dance before striking its foes. It finishes the performance with a devastating Venoshock attack.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hides within willow trees, cackling to distract unsuspecting targets. Its eerie laughter provides the perfect opening for an ally to strike.
Author: .izik

Entry: The caustic acid that drips from POKENAME's fangs can dissolve plant matter instantly. It uses this to clear out undergrowth in its territory.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's two venom sacs produce venom continuously. If it doesn't bite often enough, the built-up toxins can sicken even itself.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME's maw is so large that it can consume anything smaller than itself. Beware the acid that coats its skin and mouth.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME's fangs are razor-sharp, capable of piercing even tungsten. This incredible strength makes it a fearsome predator in its territory.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME silently glides through the night sky before dropping onto lifeboats to sink them. Survivors of shipwrecks are often pulled into the depths by its powerful grip.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME waits on the seafloor for smaller prey like Corsola to investigate its cave-like maw. Once inside, it will bite down on the prey.
Author: .izik

Entry: The mushroom infesting it has given it a taste for tree life as well as blood. Once it latches onto a victim, plant or otherwise, it will drain all their nutrients until all that remains is a husk.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's antennae twitch rapidly as it prepares to unleash a powerful Psybeam. If it overexerts itself, it will cover its body in dry leaves to recover while sleeping.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lets loose supersonic waves from its mouth, then blasts the foe with flames to cook them before eating them.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME releases Poison Powder from its mouth to immobilize foes. This ensures an easy meal before it begins feeding.
Author: .izik

Entry: It is often found deep in caves. Finding a POKENAME is a sign of nearby ore deposits to veteran miners.
Author: SupersonicLoki

Entry: When the jewel on its forehead flashes, beholders start feeling dizzy and confused. They can rely on powerful night vision, and, if blinded, echolocation as well.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: If it spots someone fishing near its pond, POKENAME will swoop down and steal their fishing pole. It uses the distraction to take their catch.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME hides near its waterfall den and uses Supersonic to ambush intruders. Its stealthy tactics ensure its home remains undisturbed.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME has incredible control over the strength in its paws. It is sometimes employed by spas to give soothing massages.
Author: .izik

Entry: During its raging tantrums, POKENAME will pummel foes into submission before draining blood via its sharp fangs. Once it's had its fill of blood, it becomes remarkably placid until it becomes hungry again.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME submerges itself in murky ponds, leaving only its ears exposed. It waits patiently for prey to wander close before attacking.
Author: .izik

Entry: During hot days, POKENAME submerges itself in lakes to cool off. Its deep inhalations of water can sometimes create whirlpools that drag prey into its reach.
Author: .izik

Entry: While it possesses psychic abilities, POKENAME will often forget this. In battle, it mainly uses its fangs, wings, and even its spoon to do damage.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: POKENAME uses its telekinetic abilities to construct intricate nests in tunnels. These nests are often lined with reflective stones to ward off intruders.
Author: .izik

Entry: This Pokémon likes to put its opponents in submission holds. When its prey is weakened, it will finish it off by draining its blood.
Author: Chazzwozzer32

Entry: POKENAME hones itself in the art of grappling, using its incredibly strong arms to take hold of opponents with a crushing grip. Once it has a victim in its grasp, it drains their blood, growing stronger while they grow weaker.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its four powerful arms allow POKENAME to crush most foes with ease. It fasts for long periods of time, as it only wishes to drink the blood of those worthy enough to give it a good fight.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME awkwardly waddle about while flapping their leaves in futile attempts to fly. Despite their lack of traditional balance, they still possess a surprising level of speed, managing to sink their teeth into prey when they least expect it.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME live in sea caves, hiding in dark corners and waiting for prey to swim by. It drags its prey into its cave and sucks its blood for hours.
Author: JokersWild

Entry: POKENAME sweeps its large mouth across riverbanks to ingest nutrient-rich mud. This sustains its energy for long flights.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME tears shrubs from cliff walls while flying and devours them mid-air. It prefers high-altitude vegetation for its meals.
Author: .izik

Entry: Toxic smoke billows out of its body almost constantly. If the smoke touches an open flame, it will explode.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's tail emits a sweet aroma, reminiscent of Pecha Berry juice. It dangles its tail into Trapinch burrows, hoping to snag an easy meal.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its wings are not strong enough to easily lift the weight of its body and the heavy Shellder together. POKENAME does not realize this, and will spend several minutes flapping futilely before giving up, and taking a nap.
Author: sk372

Entry: The magnetic charge in POKENAME's fangs prevents it from fully closing its mouth. This odd trait often leaves it frustrated when hunting.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME bites into wires in mining tunnels to absorb electricity. This behavior often leaves nearby equipment without power.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME wields its leek like a quarterstaff, stunning opponents with precise strikes. It then drains their life force to recover energy.
Author: .izik

Entry: Only the center head of POKENAME possesses a tongue, yet all three heads can taste through it. It will spend hours licking objects in a cave, craving salt deposits.
Author: .izik

Entry: When it spots prey like Krabby in the water, POKENAME dives in from above. Its large mouth snaps shut with incredible speed to secure its catch.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's massive mouth can consume multiple Mareanie at once. It employs a dazzling Confuse Ray to stun its prey before devouring them.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's body is composed of a viscous, sweet-smelling fluid. Its sweetness intensifies the more Berries it consumes.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's fangs are no more solid than the rest of it, and thus are not ideal for biting and puncturing the skin of foes. Their main purpose is to help with intimidation tactics to scare off intruders in its domain.
Author: sk372

Entry: It sleeps while clinging onto ceilings of undersea caves. It will wrap its tongue around stalactites to avoid falling to the ground.
Author: .izik

Entry: Prey that wanders too near a waiting POKENAME will find itself seized by a long tongue, then dragged within its mouth before it clamps down. Few can escape once its mouth has closed shut.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME breaks into hospital blood storage units to feed. Its ability to phase through walls makes it nearly impossible to stop.
Author: .izik
