Entry: When floating dormant beneath a stream or pond, wild POKENAME are nearly impossible to distinguish between the surrounding lily pads. The leaf on its back is poisonous to ingest, serving as a defense mechanism against any potential predators.
Author: thheartemis1

Entry: At night, POKENAME sleeps face-down in ponds. In the morning, it grazes lazily on nearby flowers growing along the banks.
Author: .izik

Entry: When floating dormant beneath a stream or pond, wild POKENAME are nearly impossible to distinguish between the surrounding lily pads. The leaf on its back is poisonous to ingest, serving as a defense mechanism against any potential predators.
Author: theartemis1

Entry: It wins battles with the expectation that it gets fed afterwards. As such, Trainers opt to feed it packets of Packaged Curry because it is cheap and easy to find.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: They swim on the surface of lakes and rivers, as they require clean water to wade in. They float to people who are having picnics or fishing by the water's edge, eager to join in on the fun.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME channels electricity through the lily pads on its head. It shocks small Pokémon like Caterpie when they approach its pond.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME joyfully flies over ponds, singing as it glides. It prefers to sleep floating peacefully on the water's surface.
Author: .izik

Entry: When submerged, POKENAME's cotton-like innards expand. This bizarre adaptation greatly boosts its physical strength in the water.
Author: .izik

Entry: Logy often uses the overgrowth of its marshy home to hide its lower torso from view. Its reason for doing so is unknown.
Author: .realthree

Entry: When suffering from intense headaches, the lily pad on POKENAME's head turns brown. Eating berries can ease the pain temporarily.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME spends its days playfully splashing in ponds and streams, bringing festivity to all Trainers. At night, it sleeps upside down, using its lily pad as a buoy to float gently across the water's surface.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: When they enter Pokémon contests, a Trainer may include a Green Scarf to help foster innovative displays of brilliance. They are known to excel at providing new ways of aquatic entertainment, utilizing the Green Scarf to amaze audiences.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It floats along the surface of the water to steal snacks and vegetables that fall into the water. It prefers bland and watery food, which is why it goes for cucumber slices first.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It wanders into schools or parks to seek out picky eaters to steal undesired food from. It loves bland and watery treats, so these picky eaters remove cucumbers and other vegetables from their salads for it to eat.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME wander along swampy shores to ensure that no intruders threaten the safety of the marshlands they call home. It is believed that POKENAME are vengeful spirits from ecosystems polluted beyond recognition.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME are native to swamplands and tropical coasts, where it uses its lily pad mimicry to stealthily make mischief. It delights in biting through fishing nets or psychically causing headaches in boat pilots so they run aground.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME's shell contains water and consumed herbs that steadily brew while it basks in the sun. A steam cloud billows from its shell when the mixture has reached the perfect temperature, with the resulting tea being considered a delicacy in Hoenn.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: It is known to help gardeners sow and water many types of berries by carrying water on top of its head. However, it digs up spicy ones such as the Figy Berry and tosses them aside instead.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: They become intoxicated on a Hopo Berry whenever they find one, which helps calm them down before they sleep. When they wake up, they may become confused and unable to recognize where they are for a moment.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Though exceedingly rare to find in the wild, POKENAME appear to be comfortable living just about anywhere, from the rockiest mountains to the busiest cities. It is highly social and often lives with other Pokémon.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: When POKENAME hears the melody produced by rain, all the cells in its body are galvanized, and it begins moving in rhythm. Because it gets its nutrients from the water, it can dance on the mud all day long without feeling hungry.
Author: ._term.

Entry: It will dance in front of people at parks or picnics in an effort to steal food. It especially goes after salads, which is its best chance at a few courgette or zucchini slices.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are drawn to festivals and celebrations, revelling in the positive energy. They feed off the atmosphere and push people to continue partying beyond their limits—their presence can cause dangerous exhaustion.
Author: Katie

Entry: The object in the center smells like a perfectly ripened Pinap Berry. If a Pokémon touches any of POKENAME's touch receptors, it clamps up like a shell, crushing the prey inside the trap, where it will later be digested.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME's trance-inducing dance binds observers in rhythm, forbidding escape until its ritual concludes. Legends claim interrupting its performance invites calamity, as vengeful spirits torment the offender with relentless misfortune.
Author: vhscopyofmeangirls

Entry: When POKENAME hears festive music, super-heated foam pours from its nostrils which can severely burn those it touches. When the music dies down, the foam stops too and POKENAME searches for coal to refuel.
Author: darkweavile428

Entry: POKENAME are man-made Pokémon created a long time ago, ordered to protect humans. Legends state that they did the complete opposite, forcing the best sorcerers to trap them in a stone statue.
Author: Eminemace

Entry: POKENAME's shell can produce 200 pounds of Stardust daily. The color of the main body determines the color of the dust.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: POKENAME paint with a bioluminescent substance, which produces beautiful colors and light. This paint is very expensive and is only sold to famous artists.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: POKENAME has a field of radiation around it, which it uses to hunt prey within caves. The radiation is so strong that it melts cave walls, which is why POKENAME has very weak claws.
Author: animecreep4

Entry: Upon breaking its shell, POKENAME starts levitating off the ground, rarely burrowing down again unless slumbering or feeling threatened. Its spikes glow in the dark, unless covered with dirt from digging.
Author: Krune

Entry: Only found deep in space, POKENAME are thought to bring very good luck to interstellar travelers. On occasion, these Pokémon try to use their supernatural powers to help these travelers return home safely.
Author: garliclol

Entry: When POKENAME sings, its heavy, rocky shell steadily breaks away.The louder and longer it sings, the higher it flies, making this Pokémon a popular symbol for young artists.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: When POKENAME sings, its heavy, rocky shell steadily breaks away.The louder and longer it sings, the higher it flies, making this Pokémon a popular symbol for young artists.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: Due to its magnificent wings, POKENAME are loved by kids. So much so that a racing game has a track based on them.
Author: pokebio

Entry: POKENAME has grown so dense that it has developed an accretion disk of orbiting gaseous matter.  It is advised not to touch it.
Author: bostroms

Entry: POKENAME focuses its psychic powers to keep its physical form from fading away. It fights by telekinetically shooting star-shaped pieces of its shattered shell at foes.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: It gallops across the galaxy at incredible speeds, chasing after comets and meteors of which it eats. If one happens to see a shooting star followed by a second, it may actually be a POKENAME chasing its next meal.
Author: merclipse

Entry: It is a very deep sleeper, only awakened when its outer shell breaks. If left uncaptured, POKENAME may never awaken naturally, leading to its demise.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: The trumpets on its back are able to produce sonic blasts powerful enough to shatter boulders. Despite this, POKENAME are very friendly and can be seen parading around with other Pokémon.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Its enemies don't like to attack it, since it uses its thorny bulb as a deterrant. It then uses the flammable toxin it creates to counterattack.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: Reports of troublesome POKENAME have arisen. In these reports, the Pokémon will simply nap in the sun during a battle, basking in its nutrients.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: They have yet to master their Fire-Type attacks, so they recklessly smack their small bodies into their enemies no matter how dangerous it may be. They won't stop spraying silk until they have fully wrapped their opponent up.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: When upset, POKENAME sheds molten tears to ignite its club for battle. These searing tears leave deep scars across the nearby landscape.
Author: mbo1064.

Entry: POKENAME wander around rocky crags outside volcanoes, using the flame on their tails to defend themselves. They harden the scales around their body to endure attacks before swinging around their tails to set their foes ablaze.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: According to legend, before the invention of Poké Balls, POKENAME would leave the humans who raised it to migrate in flocks to parts now unknown, all in order to find a mate, never to return.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME prepares for its pranks by floating out of sight with pyrokinesis, but those mighty flames heat up its surroundings. Whenever one gets uncomfortably warm, they should be prepared for mischief.
Author: squawkabairdy

Entry: POKENAME is extremely cocky; it's hard to dissuade it from anything it attempts. Trainers must keep a close eye on it to keep it from danger.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Its small body can hardly contain the rage that burns within. It spouts jets of fire with every chirp.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: POKENAME live in swamps. They use the gas produced by the rotting vegetation there to fuel their fire.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME arcs its flaming tail over its head to ward off predators. They are very territorial and will try to burn anyone that aggravates it.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME marks its territory by burning a fire line that can only be seen from the sky. A fool who steps across a mysterious trail of ash is likely to face death from above.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: When POKENAME soars across the skies, it leaves behind a bluish-white trail of light. This light brings joy to all who see it before it fades.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: Faster than sound, it blazes across the sky as a blue-white ball of flame. By the time POKENAME's shrill cry is heard, its prey has already been skewered by deadly talons.
Author: Ozydamians

Entry: One POKENAME stands sentry as the rest of its pack sleeps. The flame on its tail flares threateningly if any predators come too close.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: Reports of troublesome POKENAME have arisen. In these reports, the Pokémon will simply nap in the sun during a battle, basking in its nutrients.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: The cactus that is on its back has started to bloom. Anyone who tries to harvest this cactus will be met with a fiery surprise.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: With its bulb beginning to bloom, POKENAME can convert solar power into fuel for its flames. It can also spray this corrosive fuel to attack its foes.
Author: Benevolent

Entry: It is a violent and aggressive Pokémon. POKENAME has a volatile temper and will attack what it perceives as foes on sight. If it wants something, it will do everything in its power to get it; trying to take something away from it is a foolish idea.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME radiates a faint purple glow as its fiery tail pulses in sync with its emotions. It drifts through shadowy areas, drawn to intense heat sources.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: The flame on its tail consumes a lot of energy, so it is constantly searching for prey. When it spots something edible it strikes aggressively, constricting with burning scales and biting with venomous fangs.
Author: Baverbrugge

Entry: An aggressive and ornery Pokémon that wants to be the apex predator in its territory. When feeling threatened, POKENAME will rear up, its hood expanding like a bellows, and hiss loudly, acrid flames crackling between its fangs.
Author: Baverbrugge

Entry: POKENAME steals non-fertilized eggs from other Pokémon. It then cooks them with its flames and feeds them to its young.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: The fire coming from POKENAME's pocket burns at the perfect temperature for frying. Fiercely determined to improve, POKENAME often feed other Pokémon.
Author: Leshii

Entry: A small fusion with a fierce attitude. Take care when trying to pet it, as its ears are constantly burning.
Author: howlingstarr

Entry: POKENAME can stay afloat with little effort, as its broad wings catch the hot air rising from its tail. A sting from this Pokémon will burn for days.
Author: RoboSoup

Entry: On exceptionally warm fall days, POKENAME are found darting through the undergrowth. Unless it's been rainy, these appearances can lead to wildfires.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME leaves deep scratches in the ground as it runs around. It scatters embers in its wake.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME is a vicious predator, hunting constantly to compensate for its speedy metabolism. It eats anything smaller than itself.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Tourists enjoy traveling to craggy mountains to watch wild POKENAME train. Their kicks can cause even stone to break in a fiery burst.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME's claws help it keep its grip on muddy riverbanks. The heat it pours into the water is enough to alter the local ecosystem.
Author: .realthree

Entry: A common pest in their native region, POKENAME were traditionally warded off with noisemakers mimicking running water. Today, speakers are used to produce similar sounds, which POKENAME avoid to protect their tails.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: It is unknown how the cactus on its back could even grow since it is constantly set ablaze. The cactus contains many toxins that render it inedible.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: Colonies of POKENAME fight each other for territory and must frequently relocate their nests as borders shift. Females are often seen struggling to carry large tangles of nesting material in their arms.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME are impassioned and stubborn Pokémon, frequently vying for dominance. POKENAME in the same colony only put aside their differences to care for the colony's young together.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME lives on steep mountains. It uses its sturdy legs to leap from ledge to ledge to chase prey.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME's tail is always ablaze. When it runs through the forested mountains of its home, the strong winds strengthen its flames.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The light, heat, and smell of human settlements often attracts packs of POKENAME who cause much grief due to their flaming tails.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME's martial arts are deadly because of the wickedly sharp claws on its extremities. The faster it moves, the hotter its fires burn.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME has a rebellious nature and is always up for a fight. If the situation becomes uncomfortable, its tail spews threatening flames.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME has a rebellious nature and is always up for a fight. If the situation becomes uncomfortable, its tail spews threatening flames.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME has a strong ego and competes with other members of its group. Whoever loses a territorial battle must leave the group forever.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: POKENAME's water attacks are mixed with a substance that helps its flames burn hotter. The blue crest on its front sizzles as it prepares its next move.
Author: .realthree

Entry: This haunted war pick instantly melts through armor and flesh in one swing, making it the bane of armored foes.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME's flames engulf its whole blade when it is angry, but dwindles to a single flame when it's calm.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: As POKENAME's mastery over dragon flame grew, its outer armor took on a crimson hue. It's revered in old stories as a knight that vanquishes evil.
Author: nvisionluminous

Entry: As the most ferocious of its family, POKENAME creates sparks when it roars in anger.
Author: SupersonicLoki

Entry: In the early summer, the rising stars of a POKENAME swarm will follow the moon into the night sky and fight until the strongest evolve. After a swarm was drawn to Mauville City one year, they began limiting light pollution during this time of year.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: It becomes agitated quickly if it senses its Trainer is in distress. When agitated, its flames burn nearly twice as hot.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: Due to their disposition, there are not many POKENAME in the wild, but they make up for it in impact. Their rampages are unmatched, only simmering down once the POKENAME collapses from exhaustion.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: It exacts its revenge on the owner who disowned it by burning down all of their toys. It breathes fire by opening the zipper on its face.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: POKENAME insists on continuing to use real fire with its costume. It's constantly distracted by trying to keep the rest of its costume from burning.
Author: howlingstarr

Entry: Despite this Pokémon's rabid demeanor, POKENAME struggles to sustain itself due to its sluggish nature.
Author: scapz

Entry: POKENAME get fired up very easily. This Pokémon often collapses after getting burned out, and some never recover.
Author: scapz

Entry: Despite its angry appearance; POKENAME is extremely protective of those close to it, often walking between its Trainer and any threat.
Author: SupersonicLoki

Entry: POKENAME are not known to commonly evolve in the wild, but by cultivating its natural competitiveness from a young age, it can become a tenacious member of a Trainer's team, though they struggle to give their teammates a chance to shine.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: Despite the apparent chaos of a POKENAME swarm, it operates under a strict dominance hierarchy. A POKENAME's position is determined by its prowess in combat, with the strongest sporting tails that glow a bluish-white.
Author: .fedoraman

Entry: POKENAME churns its gears together at high speed to create large gouts of flame. Its intense nature drives it to try and create increasingly fiery bursts, indifferent to the damage it causes its surroundings.
Author: sk372

Entry: The flame on its tail doubles in size when it gets excited. It constantly seeks for opponents to fight with and has fun doing so, even if it loses.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: Every mask carried by a POKENAME resembles the Charmeleon it knew when it was alive. They are known to weep late into the night, longing for the days when they were alive and physically stronger.
Author: crumple_2

Entry: Lost miners will follow a distant glimmer of torchlight hoping to find the surface, but POKENAME is leading them astray, deeper into the earth.
Author: RoboSoup

Entry: Intense fires rage within the thick smoke that covers POKENAME's body. When it hunts, it engulfs its prey in that smoke and waits for it to suffocate.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Without legs, POKENAME can't move very quickly. The range of its fire attacks more than makes up for that, however.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The thin layer of scales that cover POKENAME are soft to the touch. Though affectionate, they have been known to inadvertently set Trainers aflame.
Author: .realthree

Entry: After evolving, POKENAME becomes less friendly toward other Pokémon, often picking unnecessary fights with wild Pokémon. Its loyalty to its Trainer remains strong, but it sometimes fights ally Pokémon, making it difficult to train.
Author: itsthenewisaiah

Entry: The average temper of a POKENAME is short. This Pokémon now refuses to get along with any Pokémon, including those owned by its own Trainer. Thankfully, it shows more restraint now that it has evolved.
Author: itsthenewisaiah

Entry: The peppers that grow on POKENAME's head are so spicy that they have been known to cause damage to the mouths of those who eat it. Despite that, POKENAME-flavored chips are still a favorite snack of many.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The peppers that grow on POKENAME are rarely used for culinary purposes because they tend to trigger allergic reactions in humans. Trainers that are raising a POKENAME are advised to wear gloves and avoid touching their eyes.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Though POKENAME's peppers aren't very spicy, they contain a compound that causes the temperature of matter it makes contact with to rise. Consuming too much of this substance can lead to internal combustion.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The fire blazing from this Pokémon's ears flares a vivid blue if it is fed sticks. POKENAME has a difficult disposition to deal with, but it is highly valued as a Pokémon partner.
Author: .realthree

Entry: It takes a lot of heat for the odd stick in POKENAME's tail to combust. Even when it's not flaming, the stick can cause severe burns when touched, so it makes an excellent weapon for POKENAME.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME are solitary creatures by nature. When they practice their fiery attacks, they stand on the highest point so that everyone nearby can see the display and be warned to stay away.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The smoke emitted by POKENAME's fire gathers around its neck. When it wishes to hide its presence, this smoke can expand to conceal its movements.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME produces molten clay from its neck that it lobs at its opponents. It uses the flame on its tail to keep the clay in its molten state.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: If POKENAME is discovered as it attempts to sneak by, it confounds its foes with a blast of blistering heat and smoke from its scarf.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME's every movement is accompanied by explosive blasts of smoke from its knees and elbows. It uses the blinding cover of this haze to strike with absolute surety against its bewildered opponent.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Fusion energy has awakened its draconic genes. It is extremely ruthless and will incinerate anyone it sees, including its own Trainer.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: Unruly POKENAME will pounce on travelers to rob them in broad daylight. Their arrogance is their downfall, as they pick fights they cannot win.
Author: RoboSoup

Entry: It slams its large tail onto opponents before viciously incinerating them. Due to its lack of wings, it moves slowly and often stomps while walking.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: Capable of launching fireballs at 800 degrees Celsius, POKENAME's body radiates a similar level of heat. Any overcooling can make it very sick.
Author: cipherlingarde

Entry: The back of its shell sports a huge fire. Because of this, POKENAME is often used by campers as a campfire.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: POKENAME spin themselves on their shell during battle, creating a whirlwind of claws and fire to attack. The burn marks around the back of a POKENAME's shell is a sign of pride after many battles.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: This Pokémon has two flamethrowers on its back that expel short-range flames. When angered, though, the flames can reach a distance of over ten feet.
Author: Soup1900

Entry: POKENAME loves to antagonize people by setting things like their clothes or hair on fire. Even if you put out the flames, they have a chance of reigniting weeks later.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is said to be the remnants of Poké Balls that failed to capture a Pokémon. They can be found in garbage dumps and polluted areas.
Author: spagalapof

Entry: From hunting grounds to excavation sites to graveyards, POKENAME's name rings true, first with its mole-like body then with bones it's modified.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: It digs through mountains, collecting fossils along the way. Its impressive collection attracts archeologists from far and wide.
Author: .izik

Entry: Despite its towering size, POKENAME is more docile than a first glance would suggest. It only turns aggressive should trespassers ignore warnings and intrude upon the Diglett nesting areas it protects.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its ears act like shovels, helping it tunnel through the ground. Once it surfaces completely, it will change form, adapting to its new environment.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: POKENAME has become incredibly useful in construction due to its ability to create perfect stone cubes out of thin air. However, it is overly protective over the block it sits on and doesn't let anyone touch it.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Thanks to being part Snorlax, POKENAME doesn't grow weak when exposed to light because of its thick body. During the daytime after eating plant roots, POKENAME searches for dark and cool places to sleep, such as caves.
Author: mbavenger64

Entry: Thanks to being part Snorlax, POKENAME doesn't grow weak when exposed to light because of its thick body. During the daytime after eating plant roots, POKENAME searches for dark and cool places to sleep, such as caves.
Author: mbavenger64

Entry: Thanks to being part Snorlax, POKENAME doesn't grow weak when exposed to light because of its thick body. During the daytime after eating plant roots, POKENAME searches for dark and cool places to sleep, such as caves.
Author: mbavenger64

Entry: Its nose twitches uncontrollably if it senses danger nearby. This warning signal alerts allies to hidden threats in the area.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME creates a large network of underground tunnels filled with many webs. It will constantly patrol its tunnels, patiently waiting for something to get trapped in its webs.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME have been spotted in local farms recently. Any farmers trying to get rid of them without the proper equipment are in for a world of hurt.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: It is known to dig and meander for miles at a time in a straight line, leaving a trail of debris behind it. Construction workers have trained it to dig a ditch alongside roads to prevent flooding.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is often mistaken for being an Alolan Diglett. Unlike the Alolan Pokémon, the hairs of POKENAME are smooth and soft.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: It swings its head rapidly, flinging sharp stone horns at enemies. This tactic disorients attackers and provides an opening for escape.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is often seen visiting beaches and ports. It is capable of making vehicles out of sand and dirt.
Author: Neonriser

Entry: POKENAME are often mistaken for a discarded bag of items while they sleep out in the wild. Their eyebrows are always pristine.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: It burrows through the ground as gracefully as a Mantine swims in water. It can gather enough speed from underground that it can launch over an entire field.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: It can manipulate sandstorms, keeping its den clear of debris. This ability makes it an expert at surviving in arid environments.
Author: .izik

Entry: The sand flowing from its body is used by glassblowers in Hoenn to create delicate flutes. These instruments are prized for their clarity and beautiful tone.
Author: .izik

Entry: It prefers digging through harder surfaces, finding sand too boring. This preference makes it well-suited for excavating ancient ruins and hidden treasures.
Author: .izik

Entry: The eye-like indents at the top of its skull do not actually allow POKENAME to see, but they will glow when POKENAME uses some moves, such as Metal Burst. It will constantly seek out ore to devour.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Urban legend states that if you hold your ear towards the ground, you can hear POKENAME singing from inside its tunnels.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: It seems that POKENAME carries Diglett on its back from field to field. You'll only find it on fertile soil.
Author: spagalapof

Entry: It is said that POKENAME goes around dark tunnels in order to ambush and pop up behind unsuspecting prey. It may currently be among you right now.
Author: Xenophacilus

Entry: An iconic and well-loved fusion. A popular kids toy, named Mr. Dighead, was modelled after it.
Author: howlingstarr

Entry: POKENAME detects and digs up nearby buried objects as if it were treasure. It's recommended that Trainers keep their POKENAME away from graveyards.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME's appearance of being wedged in the dirt beckons one to pick it up, but it evades would-be wielders by sinking further into the ground.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: It gathers rocks as it emerges from the ground to protect its sensitive body from the sun. The strength it carries while fighting with its crystalline horns leads people to theorize it has a much larger body underground.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME burrows a yard underground, eating the roots of plants. Farmers have pulled up fresh vegetables only to find bite marks taken out of them.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME surfaces in dry riverbeds after heavy rains, its rocky limbs stirring up nutrient-rich soil. Farmers once believed its presence was a blessing for abundant harvests.
Author: segmoph

Entry: This Pokémon waited for eons to be completed with truth or ideals. It eventually gave up and decided to go into agriculture instead.
Author: barthandelus_real

Entry: POKENAME love to go spelunking in unexplored caves and will collect a single rock from there to add to its rocky flowers. Its red-tinted visor protects its eyes from sand and dirt.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: A Diglett has taken up residence in the tomb of a mysterious unknown artist. It is said that it keeps the memories of the deceased in its memory.
Author: elevn.

Entry: It relies entirely on its sense of smell through its bright red nose to perceive the world. This keen olfactory sense helps it track food and detect danger.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME dwells deep within the ground, only emerging when it observes a wish it desires to grant. If someone attempts to dig up POKENAME for selfish reasons, they will be turned to crystal and entombed deep within a cavern.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME communicate with one another through electrical pulses and self-caused seismic vibrations. They are able to understand one another through several miles of earth this way.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: By opening and closing its jaws, it churns the sand around it into a raging whirlpool. This makes it impossible to extract it from its surroundings.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: The flat gems embedded in its wings glow a bright auburn when it flies. This dazzling display attracts both prey and curious onlookers.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its thick skull is strong enough to break apart boulders with ease. This digging technique allows it to navigate through rocky terrain effortlessly.
Author: .izik

Entry: Scientists have recently discovered POKENAME uses its large eyes to see inside dark tunnels. It is said they sing in order to communicate to one another from long distances underground.
Author: Rakunk

Entry: The unseen portion of its body is said to extend over 30 feet in length. This hidden feature gives it an advantage in both hunting and defense.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are almost blind, due to spending their whole lives either in pitch-black caverns or in the tunnels they dig. Instead, they use ultrasonic waves to detect obstacles while flying, and their sense of smell to detect prey while digging.
Author: Bofe Alcerune

Entry: When only slightly beneath the soil, it keeps its horn exposed while chasing prey. This horn's presence helps it track targets via their vibrations in the dirt.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME bury themselves in the ground with only their rocky fins exposed. They use these fins to carve through rocks, slipping into narrow cracks to get into caves to try and get some rest in private.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: Spotting a POKENAME is considered good luck in cold regions because it is especially equipped to till soil enveloped in permafrost. Farmers' children make a game of building small shelters to attract them.
Author: Wormspawn

Entry: Its tunnels are filled with a spicy-scented red goo that enhances plant growth. Farmers appreciate its fertilizing effect on crops.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME came into being after a Diglett took control of a discarded rock body. Its head will dip in and out at high speeds to dodge attacks.
Author: serversizeme

Entry: It can dig rapidly by spinning its arms, reaching speeds of up to 40 miles per hour. If it can't dig into the terrain, it is forced to waddle slowly.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: It can throw its hat as a weapon, using it to strike foes from a distance. This hat is crafted from its favorite stones, making it both stylish and dangerous.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is a symbiotic relationship where PALOSSAND will act as a protector for a group of DIGLETT, however it struggles to handle more than three.
Author: ServerSizeMe

Entry: Due to being made completely of sand, POKENAME became the home to a colony of Diglett. It is unknown if this is a symbiotic or parasitic relationship.
Author: serversizeme

Entry: Found in deep and cold caverns, POKENAME feast on gemstones and minerals they dig up. Though they have bouts with Sableye, they will sometimes work together to find food and split their treasures.
Author: TeatedTiten

Entry: POKENAME digs through gravel with ease, using its sharp, armored scales to break apart stones. It chews on tree roots underground to absorb energy and sustain itself.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can be found near pumpkin patches, tunneling through the ground to create fertile soil. It will whip farmers with the vine on its head if they try to touch it.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME are commonly found in canyons. There, they battle for turf by firing mud shots at each other.
Author: pokebio

Entry: It symbolizes friendship and lasting love. A glimpse of it on one's honeymoon brings good luck to the newlyweds.
Author: spagalapof

Entry: This fusion, known by many as "Dugduo," consists of two Diglett sharing a body. They always emit sounds as if the two of them complement each other's speech, but sometimes it feels like they expect a third Diglett to be talking.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: It makes tunnels beneath botanical gardens, feasting on the roots of plants. Gardeners must work diligently to prevent it from damaging prized flowers.
Author: .izik

Entry: It often burrows up into farms to steal crops that might ease its aching head. Because of its pitiful expression as it does so, most farmers can't bring themselves to chase it off.
Author: sk372

Entry: People often think that they saw the body of a Diglett, though it was, in fact, a POKENAME. This Pokémon can burrow, and it pulls its prey under the earth.
Author: Ayutac

Entry: It's said many Diglett coming together sometimes build guardians to protect their burrows. The mechanism through which it gained life is unknown.
Author: Fuade

Entry: The shyness of this underground horse is legendary. It'll only come out of its hole if there's nobody around for 100km.
Author: spagalapof

Entry: POKENAME always keep their feet underground, ready to burrow when needed. Sometimes it gets stuck while digging if the leek it's holding is too big.
Author: Frokachu

Entry: POKENAME channel an otherworldly power to make little windows between rocks that they use to observe or greet people they take an interest in. Strangely, these windows are completely invisible when viewed from the other side.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: A Diglett got tired of plowing the land on farms, so it made a deal with a Haunter to terrorize the farmers.
Author: elevn.

Entry: When its Trainer cannot sleep, POKENAME will sprinkle some of its special sand into their eyes, which will cause them to doze off.
Author: empty_set

Entry: POKENAME are the rulers of large groups of Carbink. The sceptre they carry is unique to each tribe and is passed down to a young POKENAME by their parents once they are ready to rule.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: POKENAME are often found surrounded by extremely sturdy gems, which it uses to fend off predators like Sableye as it rests.
Author: quitecomical1997

Entry: Shards of the crystals on its body splinter away should POKENAME hit a wall too forcefully. These discarded pieces have begun to become popular material for accessories in mountainous regions.
Author: sk372

Entry: Dubbed the “Princess Of The Sea” by some sailors, POKENAME swims gracefully in coastal waters. It dives to the sea floor in search of gems to add to its tiara.
Author: Dragon_Hunter_70

Entry: The tourmaline along POKENAME's body helps it contain any excess electricity, building up energy as a sort of generator. When it enters battle, it will shatter off fragments of crystal to remove its limiters and fight at full force.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: The flame on POKENAME's head burns bright pink due to a great concentration of lithium. Studies show that when subjected to high pressure and temperature, the wax which drips from its body can yield lepidolite, a beautiful lithium-based crystal.
Author: bollocksmen

Entry: They drop molten shards, which when refined and processed can produce a Flame Orb. They abhor everything aquatic, as even a small amount of water rapidly lowers their internal temperature.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME moves slowly across the cavern floor, searching for fine crystal dust to grow its crown. Because its body is camouflaged against the cavern, POKENAME is the origin of many local rumours about living crystals.
Author: leandermalurt

Entry: POKENAME is very affectionate and loves to give its jewels to anyone it likes. Just keep your distance, as POKENAME's hugs are powerful enough to compress rocks into diamonds.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: A POKENAME is very affectionate by nature, believing that constant attention and flashy gifts are the best way to make someone feel special. It often uses its Trainers' money to purchase these gifts, not understanding when they get upset.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME is lavish to the extreme when expressing affection, showering those it adores with shiny gifts and sweeping gestures. Its elaborate displays inspire romantics who wish to propose in a grandiose manner.
Author: sk372

Entry: Born from polluted runoff steeped in the bottom of diamond mines, POKENAME's sludgy body is full of precious gems. These shiny, sharp stones protect and aid them in battle.
Author: yuni_hermit

Entry: POKENAME reflect light off of their jewels in order to disguise themselves as diamonds. In reality, their gems are made of cinnabar. If a miner gets too close, POKENAME will purposefully shatter spare gems to release liquid mercury.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: It twirls its soft pink vines into heart shapes to charm others, often using them to lure in companions. These vines also release a sweet fragrance that calms nearby Pokémon.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: It hides among blooming flowers, blending perfectly with heart-shaped patterns along its back. When frightened, it releases a sugary scent that lulls predators into drowsiness.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Its been observed that after a POKENAME explodes in the wild, the breeding rate of other Pokémon sees a sharp increase for a time. It's believed that a certain type of Pokéball is based on POKENAME's appearance.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME resembles a Love Ball, and has a sweet behavior to match. It is known to be dangerous due to exploding into glitter at the slightest shock.
Author: aberry8286

Entry: Though it presumably means well, the effects of a POKENAME explosion are considered dangerous, as it could render an entire city's population too focused on amorous relations, to the detriment of every other facet of life.
Author: sk372

Entry: Its glossy shell gleams faintly with soft pink hues, resembling a ripened fruit. Forest dwellers believe spotting a POKENAME during spring will bring a season full of love and abundance.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: When POKENAME attacks, its bubbles always take on perfect heart shapes. These bubbles are sometimes harmless but nevertheless often dazzle foes.
Author: .izik

Entry: It is known to wrap its tail around another POKENAME when it feels lonely, which helps it feel safe in the seas. If it wraps its tail around a Trainer, it is said to be a gesture of true comfort and affection.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME spits heart-shaped bubbles at scuba divers who wander too close to its underwater cave, warning them away.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME live in lakes near wedding venues, their pigmentation derived from the petals that are eventually swept into the water. When weddings occur, they float to the top of the surface and watch the event with keen interest.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME swim in lakes near wedding venues, the petals giving their scales a pink tinge. They celebrate alongside couples and release pink bubbles into the air when excited.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Areas where swarms of POKENAME roam are popular romantic getaways. It's said that should a wild POKENAME follow and flutter close to a couple, they will have a long and blissful life together.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are mild-natured and do not mind the presence of people. Sometimes, poachers prematurely rip off POKENAME's heart-shaped limbs and sell them as decoration. Thankfully, they can regrow back over time.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It floats close towards beaches in summertime, observing passerby. If it detects a group of people having a happy time together, the orb on its body begins to glow with a radiant light.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME was once used to scam those who couldn't afford a proper Luvdisc to give to their loved ones. Its affectionate personality and cute appearance made it become an acceptable gift in its own right.
Author: sk372

Entry: When it witnesses a kiss, POKENAME swims in heart-shaped loops. Some believe it survives solely on the emotional warmth of others.
Author: .izik

Entry: When flying across water is not feasible, it passes Surf Mail across the sea to different continents. The letter in the bottle has become obsolete, as it ensures that the letter arrives at the destination without getting wet.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME's first documented appearance was on one of the oldest and most successful of online dating sites. Rumors say if it appears after one receives a romantic message, it's a positive omen towards a blossoming love.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME avoids violence by reflecting light into a dazzling prismatic display using its scything blades—briefly blinding those who see it. These blades are made of the same mesmerizing material as heart scales.
Author: EvilGammon

Entry: POKENAME is a very affectionate sort, often hugging those it likes and refusing to let go for several minutes. Sleeping against a slumbering POKENAME often induces pleasant dreams of romance and love.
Author: sk372

Entry: Under a microscope, POKENAME's scales are heart-shaped and shimmer faintly. Ancient texts claim they were once ingredients in love potions.
Author: .izik

Entry: In old traditions, groomsmen would be sprayed by POKENAME during the ceremony. The ritual was believed to bring marital happiness.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME emits a soft glow that can infatuate almost any Water-type Pokémon. Many mistake its light for a sign of true love.
Author: .izik

Entry: It's said that couples who witness POKENAME's glow on the first day of a new year will stay together forever. The light flickers red when it is happy.
Author: .izik

Entry: Their natural habitat is recovering from pollution and as such they live in natural reserves such as the Safari Zone. When they feel homesick, a vial of Sea Incense helps them feel at ease.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: If it spots couples by its lake, POKENAME gathers tufts of cattail and presents them like bouquets. It's said to celebrate love wherever it finds it.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME drifts over parks, releasing a Razz Berry-like scent from its leaves. It's rumored to spark sudden crushes in those beneath it.
Author: .izik

Entry: The mud POKENAME creates is used in wedding makeup, believed to strengthen love. It is said to keep bonds strong through hardship.
Author: .izik

Entry: If POKENAME sees two people it believes are compatible, it spits mud at them. The odd gesture is seen as a lucky omen.
Author: .izik

Entry: When approached by someone in love, POKENAME releases psychic waves. These waves suppress feelings for twenty-four hours.
Author: .izik

Entry: With each step it takes, POKENAME releases heart-shaped petals from its back. These petals are often collected and sold to be used during weddings.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: When it senses a widow or widower swimming nearby, POKENAME's stalks glow pink. Though no one knows how it detects grief, it seems to follow them to offer comfort.
Author: .izik

Entry: This cheerful Pokémon delivers heart-shaped gifts that explode into confetti upon impact. It thrives on affection and disappears when sadness lingers too long.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME are raised and kept in lavish restaurants, flying above patrons in patterns during certain holidays. Particularly enthusiastic lovers can pay to have them create bubbles to heighten a romantic dinner experience.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME soars above wedding venues, chirping joyfully. Its pink metallic feathers glint like stars in the light.
Author: .izik

Entry: They demand attention and gifts, particularly shells, scales, or other aquatic objects. To give them a droplet of Mystic Water is seen as the highest praise they can receive, and as such, it is given to them sparingly.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME sleeps atop coral reefs, gently blowing heart-shaped bubbles. Divers theorize its dreams are filled with forgotten romances.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME do not have the greatest eyesight, so they use bubbles as a natural way to magnify. If these bubbles pop in the middle of a dive, they will not be able to get back to the surface.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: Legend says POKENAME's venom can cause someone to fall out of love. It is feared at weddings despite its graceful flight.
Author: .izik

Entry: On the back of a POKENAME grows plentiful, delicate pink flowers that are carefully plucked by skilled herbalists. The petals are used to craft rare perfumes that are said to stir deep emotions.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME sheds its tough heart-shaped scales every now and then, and each new set of scales is even brighter and shinier than the last. Ancient people that used to live near the beaches used these scales as a decoration for their armor and weapons.
Author: milchik

Entry: If POKENAME senses a destined couple, it tries to trap them together inside a large, shimmering bubble. This can be incredibly dangerous for the couple.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME frolics around in piles of petals during cherry blossom season. Sadly, when the trees revert back to green, it falls into a deep depression.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: The liquid that oozes from its wings carries a subtle emotional influence, known to stir feelings of longing in those nearby. Trainers say it's drawn to people who miss someone deeply.
Author: milchik

Entry: It encourages people and Pokémon to pursue partners who they know they are already compatible with. If POKENAME knows two partners are lying to one another, it will raze down their house in boiling rain.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: It encourages people and Pokémon to pursue their own ideal romantic partners. If it learns of one partner repeatedly treating another unfairly, it will raze down their house in a localized thunderstorm.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME appears to heartbroken humans caught in storms, silently offering comfort with a gentle touch. Those it approaches report feeling a strange warmth and clarity, as if their sorrow has been lifted.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME clings to the bottom of surfboards using its sticky innards. Finding one is said to herald meeting your true love within a day.
Author: .izik

Entry: Folktales say pressing one of POKENAME's keys to your chest can heal heartbreak. Many lovers keep its keys as charms.
Author: .izik

Entry: After building its lodge, POKENAME chews a log into a heart shape and places it on the roof. If it cannot find a log suitable to its design, it may use a thin stone.
Author: .izik

Entry: In ancient times, witches kept POKENAME in aquariums, believing its scales held power in love potions. The recipes that included these scales have been lost to time.
Author: .izik

Entry: It is always seen with a bright smile, proudly showing the rose-shaped flower blossoming at the tip of its tail. The happier it feels, the more its petals unfurl under the sun.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Upon breaking its shell, POKENAME starts levitating off the ground, rarely burrowing down again unless slumbering or feeling threatened. Its spikes glow in the dark unless covered with dirt from digging.
Author: Krune

Entry: POKENAME is often found underwater, tracing heart-shaped loops in coral reefs. It's drawn to lonely Trainers and is said to lift their spirits with its gentle, mechanical hum.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME roams around romantic hot-spots, inviting couples to rest beneath the shade of its parasol. Those that accept its kindness provide it sustenance, as POKENAME feeds off the feelings of love emanating from the couple.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME swims in schools alongside honeymoon cruises. Despite its sharp teeth, it rarely bites, focusing instead on basking in affection.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME carves stones into heart shapes with its sharp teeth to mark its territory. No two heart stones are exactly alike.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME builds its nest near newly married couples. Its gentle presence is seen as a sign of lasting love.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME clings to cruise ships if it senses a couple on a honeymoon. Some say that it feeds off of the couple's affection, though its method of siphoning love is unknown.
Author: .izik

Entry: The spines on POKENAME secrete pink venom that numbs the heart. Victims often describe a temporary inability to feel love.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lures prey like Magikarp with the glimmer of its Heart Scales. Once close, it delivers a venomous strike to incapacitate them.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME can turn the hearts of those who were once sad into happiness. No one understands why it can do this, as only those blessed by its love have encountered it.
Author: animecreep4

Entry: POKENAME reside in areas around waterfalls. They can detect romantic thoughts and create pink bubbles out of excitement during marriage proposals by a waterfall.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: The Luvdisc portion of POKENAME mellows it out, even when in a more powerful state. It still remains dangerous thanks to its physical and special might, with even accidental hits dealing potentially fatal damage.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: Researchers are unable to tell if POKENAME's segments are separate sentient Luvdisc or if POKENAME is simply mimicking the appearance of a horde. Experiments have proved that separate pieces respond differently to external stimuli, such as petting.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME expresses its desires for friendship by smacking its Heart Scales. Observing POKENAME has caused some cultures to make musical instruments out of Heart Scales, the music of which are said to promote love and companionship.
Author: lunacharlotte

Entry: POKENAME continually sheds Heart Scales as it grows, making it popular among collectors and certain traditional merchants. A POKENAME's first shedding is considered especially valuable due to their delicate construction.
Author: lunacharlotte

Entry: POKENAME trains by swimming through rough tropical waters. Rather than using its Heart Scale-laden scales for defense, it tries to keep them safe, relying on Water-type attacks in minor scuffles.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: If it senses heartbreak on the shore, POKENAME charges with claws out. Though terrifying, it only wishes to give a hug to the person.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are avid collectors of Heart Scales and will do anything to protect their collection. To be gifted a scale by a POKENAME is considered one of the highest honors.
Author: Alumed

Entry: It shoots bursts of heart-shaped bubbles at wedding or anniversary events, especially during photoshoots. Its precision control over these bubbles allows it to guide them back into focus.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME stores rainwater in its lilypad-like head. Drinking this water is believed to ease emotional pain from lost love.
Author: .izik

Entry: When it becomes excited, the flower at the end of its tail sprays a fine pink mist into the air. Trainers claim the scent of this mist can inspire powerful emotions.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME are rented out for outdoor picnics during first dates, as they are friendly yet unintrusive. They meander around an area and create opportunities to start or shift a topic.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Golf courses train these creatures to rest in one spot for hours at a time, creating randomized obstacles to putt around. POKENAME are sedentary creatures, which makes resting in one spot quite easy.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Psychic energy from POKENAME's gem is said to erase memories of lost love. Whether curse or mercy, those affected forget what once mattered most.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its mighty wings scatter sparkling heart petals wherever it flies, creating breathtaking trails across the sky. People believe that following these trails would lead to true love.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: It floats quietly in warm shallows, exhaling delicate bubbles that drift to the surface in pairs. Couples believe spotting one on a date will bring good luck in love.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: POKENAME's tentacles have a toxin meant to induce feelings of placidity and affection in those afflicted. It drifts along the ocean currents finding pairs of people and Pokémon to induce or deepen their friendships.
Author: sk372

Entry: With its many tentacles, POKENAME can sting and induce pleasant and even romantic feelings in several people at once. POKENAME has been reported interrupting yacht parties in order to incite love among the guests.
Author: sk372

Entry: It often drifts on the surface of calm ponds, sometimes making heart-shaped ripples with its tail. Fisherman believe that spotting a POKENAME before casting a line will bring a day of good fortune and clear skies.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: The shell on POKENAME's tail periodically drops pearls that it often gifts to others, particularly couples it happens to spot. It likes to adorn its shell with the shiniest of the pearls.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME reside in shallow wishing fountains where lovers wish for a successful marriage. It is an auspicious sign when they eat the coin lovers throw into the water.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME consume discarded boxes of chocolate after certain holidays, as they enjoy the leftover sweet treats on the inside. The ink on the boxes is digested and brighten their pigmentation.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: It fires shimmering pink bubbles from the cannons on its back, each bubble bursting into a soft scent that attracts friendly Pokémon. Some say the lake where a POKENAME rests will be blessed with peace for years.
Author: jaminmcready

Entry: Pearls produced by POKENAME are often used in romantic necklaces. They are treasured gifts exchanged between lovers.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME lives under inhabited trees. When prey is near, it will rise from the ground and use its leaves to crush it.
Author: habibiluigi

Entry: This trio of Digbones have decided to take different roles for survival and efficiency: an excavator, a crafter, and a hunter.
Author: abstrusepaladin

Entry: After evolving, they keep developing their roles and honing their skills. Thanks to the efforts of the crafter and its new workbench, now the excavator has a more advanced shovel, and the hunter has better weapons at its disposal.
Author: DoodleDoo

Entry: After evolving, they keep developing their roles and honing their skills. Thanks to the efforts of the crafter and its new workbench, now the excavator has a more advanced shovel, and the hunter has better weapons at its disposal.
Author: DoodleDoo

Entry: The faux faces on its wings intimidate predators. This is a good thing, because POKENAME is generally oblivious to its surroundings.
Author: .realthree

Entry: A Pokémon that lives alone in caves, loneliness had driven it to create cloth puppets that it considers family. It lost its sanity long ago.
Author: dinner8480

Entry: POKENAME are in constant shock due to becoming bald upon evolving. It moves its hips in panic over being found.
Author: HoundRyS

Entry: POKENAME's pincers each have a mind of their own, though they still cooperate with the body. It will hide underneath the ground while waiting for prey, and then crush them with its pincers once the prey gets close.
Author: DarkWeavile428

Entry: Despite the three bodies not being able to fit within its shell, they will never accept a larger shell unless it is from an Omanyte. They will bury the shell in the ground to stop themselves from getting swept away.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: While POKENAME may move slower than normal, its bigger body can cause more dangerous quakes. When eating plant roots, one of POKENAME's heads eats more than its other two heads, hence looking bigger.
Author: mbavenger64

Entry: It slithers its heads out of the ground to intimidate prey, creating a fearsome display. Its body grows daily, sometimes reaching lengths longer than a subway car.
Author: .izik

Entry: Each of its three heads has its own mouth and stomach. If it does not eat for a day, its noses will become extremely cold.
Author: .izik

Entry: The three separate heads on POKENAME's body are capable of individual thought. The nose in the middle spins 360 degrees.
Author: auroraeuphoria

Entry: POKENAME is capable of creating vehicles and weapons entirely out of sand, dirt, and rock. No one is sure how they manage to do it.
Author: Neonriser

Entry: This subspecies of POKENAME is capable of creating vehicles and weapons entirely out of materials from the seafloor. It's known to be very aggressive.
Author: Neonriser

Entry: It can smell a fire burning from a mile away. If a POKENAME smells a campfire, it will flee in the opposite direction to avoid the traveler.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses its head to have their Diglett comrades ride on top of them. They parade as a simple Dugtrio before popping up and wailing at foes.
Author: awiralonprime

Entry: Its heads often forget which one should control the main body, leading to comical, spinning movements while levitating. This lack of coordination is oddly endearing to Trainers.
Author: .izik

Entry: They live in canyons, surviving by eating dead bushes and twigs. This diet sustains them in the harsh, arid environment.
Author: .izik

Entry: A great friend of nature, it brings Diglett from arid zones to better lands. All farmers hope that POKENAME will deposit its Diglett in their fields.
Author: spagalapof

Entry: If anyone dares to tread on its ground, it holds them in place with its three blades. The end of its sash is long and broad to more swiftly feed on the life force of larger Pokémon and is muddy to prevent escape.
Author: clickonflareblitz

Entry: Aegislash absorbed Dugtrio into its swords, forming POKENAME. It manipulates the ground with its blades, allowing for swift underground travel.
Author: zic

Entry: The three heads of POKENAME all think exactly alike, allowing it perfect coordination while digging tunnels.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME bound their legs together in the ground as a testament to their deep friendship. Now united within the earth, they joyfully move as one.
Author: slowforest

Entry: When one head grows tired, the other two allow it to rest by taking over control of the body. This teamwork ensures it stays active for longer periods.
Author: .izik

Entry: Each of its three tongues ends with a small head that latches onto prey. These heads work together to drag victims beneath the sand.
Author: .izik

Entry: It slams its thick skulls into stones, breaking them apart to consume the gravel. This behavior strengthens both its diet and its sturdy heads.
Author: .izik

Entry: Its extra heads wiggle frantically, constantly advising the main head of potential danger. This hyper-awareness makes it difficult to sneak up on.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME is the top pick for explorers in the search of deeply buried lost treasures. However, they need to be trained and well fed with enough minerals - otherwise, they may eat all the precious gems before bringing the rest to the surface.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: The muddy slime it secretes smells sweet like pastries but is highly toxic. Consuming it is a grave mistake, despite its tempting aroma.
Author: .izik

Entry: If a member of a Dugtrio is separated from its group, it becomes more aggressive in its solitude.  Hunters expecting a mere Diglett will find themselves faced with ferocious resistance if they try to pick it off.
Author: sk372

Entry: Splicing Dugtrio with itself appears to have created a leader. Diglett come and go from this small community as they please.
Author: xtjs2018x

Entry: POKENAME blasts mini-heads from its cannons. Somehow, nobody knows what the bottom of these mini-heads look like.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME disguises itself as a Dugtrio by burying half of its body. When Trainers get too close, it attacks with psychic power.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: Somehow, its sand makes people fall asleep.  Scientists tried to make it into an insomnia remedy, but it has no effect unless POKENAME sprinkles it.
Author: empty_set

Entry: POKENAME is constantly dreaming about money. When Trainers play with and cuddle this Pokémon It steals everything they can from them.
Author: ZombieShinx_

Entry: POKENAME feeds on change left on the roadside. While it can eat other metal, it prefers coins made of silver or gold.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME uses the bones leftover from its fish meals as a weapon and tool. On occasion, it has also been seen using it to comb its fur and groom itself.
Author: sk372

Entry: It grows excited should it see coins of any kind. A POKENAME's nest is filled with wallets, jewelry and miscellaneous currency.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME's furry tentacles partially conceal an eerie, mysterious head silhouette within. However, they also serve another purpose: nabbing treasure.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME sniffs out the unique scent of money with its large nose. It scrounges around most human homes, wriggling into tight spaces where loose change can be found.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are known to shapeshift into valuable objects and stay motionless for hours. Gullible shoppers often find out the Big Nuggets they bought are POKENAME only after they bring them home.
Author: VibrationJaveline

Entry: POKENAME makes for an excellent pet as it is said that owning one will bring you good fortune. However, they like to be independent and don't show a lot of affection toward their owner.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: While it's often sought out for its cuteness, POKENAME typically sticks to more menacing Pokémon for protection.
Author: Inksans201x

Entry: POKENAME strives to evolve with some riches in its body. When a Trainer isn't looking at it, it will reveal its hook-like arms to snatch any coins it can find in their pockets and hide them inside its body.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: Despite its round body, POKENAME moves quickly when pursuing shiny objects or food. It naps during the day to prepare for nighttime treasure hunts.
Author: mbavenger64

Entry: Unlike its Kanto counterpart, POKENAME will only hunt for food like berries and Poké Beans. Anyone who disturbs their sleep will deal with the rage of the prideful and crafty Alolan POKENAME.
Author: mbavenger64

Entry: Despite its rotund body, POKENAME moves swiftly when chasing shiny things and delicious food. POKENAME spends most of its daytime napping for late-night treasure or food hunting and also loves napping on top of its shiny objects.
Author: mbavenger64

Entry: It supposedly brings good fortune as long as its Gold Leaf remains intact. Removing its leaf will cause it to wither, so it furiously scratches anyone that attempts to touch it.
Author: bacondlx

Entry: POKENAME regularly goes diving in rivers and lakes to search for shiny objects, especially coins. If two spot the same prize, they latch onto each other in a biting contest until one yields.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME keeps stolen coins hidden under its wings. When under attack, it will shake its body around violently, making a disorienting ringing sound with all the coins stored inside its shell.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME frolics with playful sparks and mischievous charm. It is an adorable companion and can be sold for egregious amounts of money.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME enjoys picking up loose change and sharing it with others. The only coin it will absolutely refuse to part with is the one upon its head.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's cat-like instincts compel it to chase its own tail. POKENAME's rat-like instincts compel it to run away from itself when it does this.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: The coins around POKENAME's face absorb and store sunlight and heat. It goes into low-light areas and shines the stored sunlight onto wilting plants to help rejuvenate them.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME will wander during the night time and steal anything shiny that catches its eye, from coins to gems to lone Meltan or Aron.
Author: Marvin the Marrow Muncher

Entry: This fusion is prized by unscrupulous types, as each strike on the creature seems to form coins. While the coins appear golden, inspection reveals they are made of pyrite. Thankfully, POKENAME does not seem to mind being struck.
Author: Blake

Entry: POKENAME pleads with its cute face and small whines in order to receive handouts from people. Few can resist, and as a result POKENAME has a reputation for being an extremely spoiled pet.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME's body is made out of molten gold, shedding shards of gold when its body starts to harden. People attempt to collect these hardened fragments to sell them at a high price.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: It bathes regularly to keep its body shiny. If POKENAME covets something you have, it will cry loudly until it gets what it wants.
Author: lazyarcanist

Entry: POKENAME fires solid gold coins from its mouth with surprising force. Shots from POKENAME are not life-threatening, but they are likely to cause painful bruising.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: Their love for shiny coins makes them the perfect companion for bank tellers by helping them count money, though there's always some money missing.
Author: pankiwi

Entry: Its rattle is made of loose golden plates; they create a sound similar to coins jingling against one another whenever POKENAME shakes its tail. Pokémon who are attracted to shiny things, such as Murkrow and Sableye, are POKENAME's main prey.
Author: milchik

Entry: POKENAME are known for their love for expensive paints and materials. Some criminals use them to paint counterfeits to sell for high prices.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: POKENAME love to go on adventures to spread good luck and cheer to everyone around them. It is said when it evolves, it becomes more selfish.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are known to be excellent scam artists. They are commonly found in the big cities, utilizing various tricks to gain a fortune. POKENAME are also astounding team players, often helping each other out with their practices in secrecy.
Author: the_smirker

Entry: POKENAME loves shiny objects. When it comes across something shiny, it will gnaw on it vigorously. Their teeth often chip due to this habit.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: POKENAME pecks at shiny objects it finds. Only when it sees a different shiny object will POKENAME lose interest.
Author: themicelegion

Entry: A happy POKENAME is considered a good luck charm for traveling merchants. Legend says if you appease one on your journey, you will become wealthy.
Author: .izik

Entry: Gold would normally be too heavy and soft for a sword blade, but it's able to repair itself. It can detect treasure, its presence visibly exciting it.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: Fascinated by shiny objects, POKENAME can be easily befriended by prospective Trainers by offering it something that sparkles.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME are often kept as a pet by people who hunt for treasure. They have developed a sixth sense for anything valuable and will emit a flurry of sparks if they are nearby anything that is worth a lot.
Author: speciessaladmallory

Entry: POKENAME uses the sharp glare of its coin and tail to lure unsuspecting bird Pokémon like Murkrow. Once they approach, it pounces and drags them back to its den as prey.
Author: elite01

Entry: Despite its fur being made out of gold, POKENAME is incredibly lightweight. Painters have described POKENAME's eyes as resembling deep-blue sapphires.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME is popular among the wealthy due to its beautiful golden roses. However, POKENAME is a very selfish Pokémon and will never let anyone touch its roses.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: A domesticated POKENAME has been observed to be a somewhat reliable coin bank. If it's not fed or loved well enough, it will consume all the coins inside of it instead of storing them.
Author: to_heck_and_back_

Entry: POKENAME are drawn to objects that make a pleasant sound when ultrasonic waves are bounced off of them. Every POKENAME has its own unique taste in sounds.
Author: bee4082

Entry: Finding a POKENAME in the wild is said to be a sign of good fortune, though it is quick to shock any that press their luck and try to touch its coin.
Author: Alumed

Entry: POKENAME can be found destroying pizzas in front of any cameras it can find. It is unable to take anything seriously, making it a nuisance.
Author: Skymaster426

Entry: It has been written that a house visited by POKENAME will have incredible luck. However, as POKENAME usually robs these houses in the night for valuables, some historians have speculated that these legends were being sarcastic.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME uses its single paw to beckon travelers in snowstorms to safe shelters. Its appearance is fortuitous, so it's used as a symbol of luck.
Author: .realthree

Entry: Despite looking like gold, POKENAME's body is actually covered in shiny wrappers. Underneath the reflective exterior is mounds of garbage.
Author: musicsheep.

Entry: POKENAME like to lure greedy humans into the woods to steal their money. Occasionally, they nest inside of fallen trees and flood debris.
Author: tenta

Entry: POKENAME appears to have the ability to alter chance. Any Trainer foolish enough to use POKENAME to gamble will lose their fortune to its greed; both in winnings and luck.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: POKENAME has an insatiable greed for wealth. If not maintained with a Trainer's own money, it will wreak havoc in cities to absorb precious gems and cash into its hoard.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: If POKENAME thinks someone will take a shiny object it wants, it will scratch them relentlessly. This blind fury usually leads to losing the object.
Author: PokePower

Entry: Its fur is very dense and fluffy, which is why it is often used for winter clothing. It is also a popular companion in cold regions.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Despite its size, POKENAME is very playful. A Trainer needs a lot of patience to train it, but will be rewarded with a loyal companion in the end.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: When POKENAME opens its eyes, it hexes anything it looks at with a ghastly curse. If you spot even a hint of red in its eyes, it's already too late.
Author: 8xviktor

Entry: Its claws are made of metal. While they look constructed of gold, it is actually a material that is more similar to iron.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME usually sneaks up on prey with retractable claws, as using its oversized pincer leads to exhaustion during prolonged hunts.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: If a POKENAME notices a traveler wearing fine jewelry, it will attempt to steal the trinket with silky string. Due to its poor aim, it usually fails.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME are arrogant fighters, but have something of a code of honor. They prefer to fight a weapon-wielding opponent, if only so they may dramatically disarm them in battle and gloat.
Author: sk372

Entry: While normally a kind and helpful Pokémon, it jealously guards the gem it carries. It will hold a lifelong grudge against any who attempt to take it.
Author: knilk

Entry: It carries a large egg-shaped gem in its pouch. POKENAME establish a heirarchy based on the size and redness of their gems.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Not all of the yarn in POKENAME's body is attached to it. There are several extraneous strands that have been dragged along for the ride.
Author: .realthree

Entry: The gem on the head of a POKENAME is coveted by poachers. Its shine and purity increase based on how angry the POKENAME gets.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME rules its waters with cold precision, its glittering form gliding past like a serpent. Other Pokémon part before it, knowing it does not tolerate disobedience.
Author: mgfox_66676

Entry: POKENAME are incredibly proficient hunters, using their transformation abilities to hide almost perfectly, then pouncing on flying Pokémon when they land to rest.
Author: VibrationJaveline

Entry: Its diamond-hard claws allow POKENAME to crack through the shells of other Pokémon. It adores shiny objects and will commonly grab lost jewelry or small pearls to take back to its den.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME jealously guards its favorite gem by wrapping its tail around it. It will leap to defend it at the slightest provocation.
Author: howlingstarr

Entry: It's often claimed that POKENAME was the reference for creepy Jack-in-the-boxes. They are sometimes seen crawling on city walls and roofs.
Author: holgast

Entry: They are considered a lucky Pokémon to raise, as their pheromones release Luck Incense into an area. These pheromones only work on people and help promote a magnanimous feeling after losing a battle.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME hangs from strong tree branches using its strong tail while using its whiskers to sense disturbances in its environment. When it senses prey, it drops and snaps its tough jeweled shell around the target.
Author: pjporwoll

Entry: POKENAME is a fierce hunter, but also a highly finicky eater. It hunts and eats only certain parts of prey such as Arbok and Raticate, then leaves the rest for scavengers to pick at.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME is a crepuscular Pokémon. Strong sunlight hurts its eyes, so it often squints during the day.
Author: .realthree

Entry: POKENAME's fur repels water, allowing it to swim swiftly. Combined with the hearing ability of its large ears, it can find and pursue prey with ease.
Author: CaramelDog

Entry: POKENAME's fur repels water, allowing it to swim swiftly. Combined with the hearing ability of its large ears, it can find and pursue prey with ease.
Author: CaramelDog

Entry: POKENAME's fur repels water, allowing it to swim swiftly. Combined with the hearing ability of its large ears, it can find and pursue prey with ease.
Author: CaramelDog

Entry: POKENAME's fur repels water, allowing it to swim swiftly. Combined with the hearing ability of its large ears, it can find and pursue prey with ease.
Author: CaramelDog

Entry: Respected by humans and Pokémon alike, POKENAME is the ultimate feline. It only shares food and fortune to those it truly trusts.
Author: kill_the_wabbit

Entry: It treats most other Pokémon with disdain, since its sheer size has left it with few natural predators.
Author: dicedragon20

Entry: POKENAME functions as a finely forged sword as well as treasure detector, determined by the mood of the Persian head pommel.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: This POKENAME was once wielded by a legendary treasure hunter. The explorer was said to have been able to verbally communicate and understand it.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME has many admirers, though prospective Trainers should be warned it is fickle about who it shows it's affection to.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: POKENAME thinks of itself as king in a literal sense and will attempt to rule over other Pokémon living in the same area.
Author: Snugglessam

Entry: This variant of POKENAME is very popular in the fashion world. Many men's clothing lines will feature POKENAME sporting the latest trendy fashions.
Author: char_latte3412

Entry: With its aerial speed and quickness of claw, POKENAME is adept at taking anything it wants. Most often found in urban areas, it will snatch up prey and human meals in equal measure.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME sports thick, coarse fur in place of armored plates. However, its ability to groom its coat is often impeded by its axe-like tusks.
Author: CaramelDog

Entry: POKENAME sports thick, coarse fur in place of armored plates. However, its ability to groom its coat is often impeded by its axe-like tusks.
Author: CaramelDog

Entry: Vain and territorial, POKENAME will not suffer the indignity of anything being in close proximity to it. With a disdainful backhanded flap of one wing, it spreads embers all over any who would dare invade its space.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME gets extremely excited over shiny objects and will take anything shiny without a second thought. It will sometimes even get mesmerized by its own golden claws.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME are known for stealth, often seen ambushing small prey or stealing food. Their soft paws let them scamper about silently.
Author: CaramelDog

Entry: Anything POKENAME touches will turn into a toxic, gold-like metalloid. Its entire body is comprised of this mysterious substance.
Author: musicsheep.

Entry: POKENAME will spread spores on spots it claims as its territory. The spores are harmless but irritating to the eyes and nose of anything but itself. Trainers have found that spraying POKENAME with water helps discourage this behavior.
Author: sk372
