Entry: Lurking amidst the shores of beaches, POKENAME are highly territorial. The Mystic Water they dangle can lull unsuspecting beachgoers and swimmers into a gentle sleep, one that moves from a soft tide into a raging whirlpool of nightmares.
Author: PixlHoopa

Entry: POKENAME is naturally violent and seeks torment upon any prey it may see fit. The large claw traps its victims into a bound state, where it then swings a pendulum to toss them into a nightmare of hurricanes and floods.
Author: PixlHoopa

Entry: The brightly colored ball on POKENAME's back expels noxious powder when popped, deterring attacks from predators. This defense has inadvertently led to the injury of many a clueless beachgoer.
Author: imademyselfdothis

Entry: POKENAME waddle along tropical beaches, sleeping under the shade of palm trees. They like to pinch anything they find, from berries to coconuts. This usually leads to POKENAME accidentally pinching another Pokémon.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: Since Pokémon Fusion has become more widespread, more and more fishing lines have been cut thanks to POKENAME. Their hefty pincers prevent fast movement, so they often drift with the current.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME float in the ocean, using their fins to glide through the water with ease. POKENAME will dig into rocks using their powerful claws whenever they need rest.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are regarded as unlucky by fishermen, as their crab arm is thought to scare away good luck. As a result of being underfished, POKENAME are widespread and populous, found in many aquatic places.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME isn't normally aggressive or territorial, but it will make an exception when gathering honey for its young. It uses its sharp claws to chase away rivals, but if proven weaker, POKENAME will blow bubbly wings to fly away.
Author: ._term.

Entry: POKENAME scuttle along the seafloor, snapping their claws as warnings to predators. They quickly tilt their bodies to strike with their claws, using their arms to catch themselves and push back up onto their feet.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: POKENAME live on small beaches located on remote islands, dancing from dusk until dawn. POKENAME wave their claws in the air during the dance, releasing ecstatic psychic energy that keeps them awake.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: The fusion of Krabby and Magikarp has almost nothing to distinguish it in battle or behavior. Most POKENAME are created solely to be a high-priced delicacy in restaurants serving fusion cuisine.
Author: sk372

Entry: Using their many legs, POKENAME scuttle across the ocean floor in search of food. When pulled out of the water, POKENAME become enraged and soar into the sky to sink ships, slamming into them.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME can be found in aquariums, as they are caring and gentle. As a result, POKENAME are trained to dive and ferry folks down underwater, using the air vents on their shell to maintain an air bubble to breathe.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: While the antennae on its head no longer attract prey, POKENAME does not notice. The pincers now snatch unwitting victims around it without effort.
Author: ziggaway

Entry: POKENAME use their eggshell to protect themselves, along with their baby claws. POKENAME will make a high-pitched gurgle to call for help when in danger.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: In its coastal habitats, POKENAME boasts a crustacean shell with curious wings. Its graceful charm captivates those who encounter it along the shores.
Author: anarchaz

Entry: POKENAME fly extremely erratically and constantly crash into their surroundings. Fortunately, even its most delicate components are very durable.
Author: Staghorn

Entry: Floating in the sky above beaches, POKENAME use a large cotton spore to hang from as they sleep. POKENAME only descend from the sky when it is time to eat and always have one claw gripping onto their cotton spore.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Its chitinous shell is extra thick to protect it from predators. It will burrow a hole in the sand and lie still, waiting for an opportunity to ambush prey.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME use their claws and barbed body to protect themselves. To dissuade predators from biting them, POKENAME grip onto the predator with their claws before stabbing the predator with their barbed bodies.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME's powerful pincers are strong enough to crush Shellder shells with little effort. Its body produces a lot of heat while in combat, so it stays in the water to keep its body cool.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME are keen-eyed hunters of the icy tundra, stealing eggs and food from other Pokémon when they are away from their burrows. POKENAME will monitor the activities of another Pokémon before burrowing straight towards their meals.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME have a large beak that they use to pierce prey. Their crustacean-like legs give POKENAME more stability when hopping on land, allowing them to waddle into tight spaces.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: When resting, it freezes the water around it. It uses this ice as a protective barrier, ensuring no predators disturb its slumber.
Author: .izik

Entry: POKENAME live together with coral that grows on their shell, as the coral helps strengthen their claws. In exchange for this, POKENAME help the coral spread, migrating from one coral reef to another.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME use their fins to swim along the ocean floor, using their claws to grab onto food. Despite having legs, POKENAME do not use them, preferring their fins.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME use their tentacles to wrap around shelled prey before prying open their meals using their hooked claws. When two POKENAME fight over the same meal, they smack their claws against each other until one of them gives up.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME float above the ocean floor, their wingspan casting large shadows below them. POKENAME have claws attached to arm-like antennae that they use as extra protection.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Making canvases out of stone instead of parchment, POKENAME use their sharp claws to carve into stone. POKENAME utilize many art styles, ranging from realistic to abstract to stylized statues.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME entertains itself by picking up small objects from the ground like shells and acorns, then tossing them into the air to shoot down with lightning bolts as a method of target practice.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME likes to pinch itself with its claw to stay awake or to focus. It doesn't hurt POKENAME because it is used to the feeling. Besides the big claw, it also has two smaller claws that are always closed.
Author: gamelord64

Entry: POKENAME use their claws to swing from vine to vine, leaping across branches in the jungle. Their claws are sharp and can break open coconuts, allowing POKENAME to eat the fruit inside.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME have large mouths that munch on berries, preferring ones that grow closer to beaches. POKENAME prefer wide-open spaces, as their wings get tense if confined for too long.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME uses its eight shell-hardened wings like paddles to swim across the sea. When it comes to land, it can skitter onto the beach like a crab.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: The pincer extending from its face is actually a mouth. It clamps onto unsuspecting Pokémon and sucks out fluids like a bug's proboscis.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME is quite the prankster. Its favorite activities are stealing trinkets and scaring strangers, only to reveal its face from behind its mask and giggle.
Author: leonian1586

Entry: POKENAME can carry hundreds of small Krabby on its back. If you play music around this Pokémon, the Krabby will cheerfully click their pincers to the beat.
Author: Mistymagius

Entry: POKENAME waddle in flocks to preserve warmth. They huddle together and protect the weaker POKENAME by having them stay in the middle of the group.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: When POKENAME buries its shaft in the sand, it appears to be just a discarded claw. Alerted by its ribbon, the axe flips to execute its victim.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME use the spray of bubbles from their body to reflect light off of themselves, creating mirages to blend into their surroundings. If anyone gets close enough to see through the mirage, POKENAME will ready their claws as a warning.
Author: Wildheartrazorfangs

Entry: The pincers on its head make excellent weapons. When threatened, it will bash its head into targets and clamp its pincers onto foes.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: Using their aquatic wings to soar through the air, POKENAME slam their claws into opponents. POKENAME also use their grip strength to pinch opponents.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME have a rotund shell that has spikes and extends its innards to form a claw to grab onto meals. Their claw is slimy to the touch, sticking onto berries and snacks.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME uses its melodic voice to lure its victims into holes it digs in the sand. The sound waves of its singing voice lure only the tastiest prey.
Author: MrPeach774

Entry: POKENAME swim in the sea, finding rocky reefs to lurk in. POKENAME can be found rubbing against rocks, scraping debris and filth off their scales.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME bury themselves in wet dirt and sand, protecting their soft underside. If anything moves near one's claw, it'll be grabbed and dragged into POKENAME's shell to either be eaten or discarded.
Author: ohok3441

Entry: Fluttering in dark caverns, POKENAME travel in colonies, overwhelming both prey and predator with their sheer numbers. It is said that POKENAME colonies can gather up to 50 individuals before splitting off.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are found in factories, using their bodies to absorb excess electricity. Scientists rely on POKENAME as a failsafe if any electrical equipment is damaged.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME have a large mouth that can stretch as wide as its head, which it uses to swallow food whole. POKENAME do not use their claws, as they are tiny and cannot reach very far.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME dance by swaying and scuttling side by side. The good vibes of these dances often mesmerize viewers and amplify psychic abilities. People often bring POKENAME to festivals for this reason.
Author: entomoxie

Entry: POKENAME uses the bubbles on its back and tail to seem bigger, with little-to-no success. It uses its powerful jaw and claws to attack if threatened.
Author: ._term.

Entry: POKENAME have claws attached to their aerodynamic fins. While this does slow POKENAME down, they remain some of the fastest creatures in the sea.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME use their claws attached to the center of their tentacles to attract prey. Once ensnared, POKENAME inject poison to secure a new meal.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME have soft tentacles that can harden into sharp barbs to capture prey. When not on the hunt, POKENAME prefer to hide under their large shell.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME carry the shells of once-living Pokémon as they scuttle along shores. Many children feel a deep sense of nostalgia when they are around these creatures, as though a familiar pet has returned.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are docile and calm, communicating using quacks and waving their claws. This method of communication is sophisticated enough that local sailors can tell if a storm is coming by observing POKENAME that are on beaches.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are friendly and clever, using their quacking and claws to guide each other to patches of litter. POKENAME then clean up that area so that they can invite tourists to their beaches, beckoning ships from their sandy shores.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME use their sturdy claws to dig out small holes in sandy beaches to use as their homes. These watering holes that POKENAME create allow Pokémon typically found in more swampy areas to make their homes closer to the beaches.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: A few pieces of Clever Mochi are all it needs to be happy. It knows it needs to slice and share its mochi because its mind reading powers can detect the slightest of envy.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: The bulbous heads of POKENAME are protected by a hard shell and are difficult to penetrate. Their claws are small but nimble, burrowing deep into the ground to protect their soft underbellies.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME have a shell-like helmet and two large claws that excavate the earth beneath them. Once POKENAME create suitable burrows, POKENAME will rest in those burrows before starting the process over again.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME have sturdy arms and sharp claws used to dig deep into the ground. POKENAME are picky with their sleeping habits and refuse to sleep unless the ground is freshly dug up.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are sedentary Pokémon, sleeping for up to 22 hours a day. They use their tails to slowly drag food to its mouth before falling back asleep.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME uses its psychic powers to lure Pokémon in the area to sleep before taking food from sleeping Pokémon. It is said that POKENAME is oblivious to the pain that its tail feels, as though the tail was put to sleep.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME crawls on its stomach across the ocean floor, using its claws to grab onto food. POKENAME prefers warmer climates, as it has yet to develop enough body mass to preserve enough heat.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME slides across the ocean floor by freezing the water in front of it. POKENAME prefers colder climates as it is easier to freeze water in such climates.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME scuttle into factories to seek out nutritious sludge. They use their large claws to scoop sludge into their mouths until full.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME drag themselves around with their weak claws, crawling around to gather seaweed on the sea floor. POKENAME are unable to move quickly, as their shells inhibit their range of motion.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME has a heavy shell that makes it slow and relatively immobile and is vulnerable if flipped on its side. However, POKENAME can still move due to its claws and small legs helping it crawl and remain upright.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME blows bubbles in a hypnotizing rhythm. In this way, it lures unwary targets into its lair, which is often located in dark caves.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: Only the bulkiest of POKENAME will be able to yank the hefty anchors off of a passing ship. Those who do so are able to use it as a weapon to defend against hungry Carvanha.
Author: avidclown

Entry: POKENAME have two sets of claws, their front claws able to crush steel beams. If pollution is present in the ocean, POKENAME will attempt to claw at it in vain.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME, armed with colossal claws and a formidable horn, prowls the deep ocean floor, hunting down ocean Rock-type Pokémon as its prime prey.
Author: velvetmitsu

Entry: POKENAME love bumping against palm trees, then opening and drinking the coconuts that fall from them. Groups of POKENAME are commonly seen dancing, though it's unknown why they do this.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: POKNEAME keeps its singular pincer in great condition; if it falls off, POKENAME will fall into a deep depression. The pincer is known for being extremely flavorful, so POKENAME is often targeted by poachers.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: POKENAME are somewhat territorial and live together in groups. They cut through fishing lines and nets, so they are difficult to catch. Their pincers will begin moving again for a short time if cooked.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: They tend to prefer swimming in high-current estuaries, hunting down small and weak Water-type Pokémon. In the winter, POKENAME tend to flee to the ocean.
Author: bobosmith01

Entry: Able to regenerate their limbs, POKENAME sometimes lose an arm in a tight crevice or when hurt. POKENAME are able to regrow such limbs quickly, some doing so in only 24 hours.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: A ferocious undersea hunter, POKENAME possesses incredible crushing power in both its claws and its jaws. Even the strongest shelled Pokémon are crushed in mere seconds if caught.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME are a favorite of the tourism industry, as their air vents on their shell can be used to maintain a bubble for tourists to breathe in. In the event of emergencies, POKENAME are also known to defend tourists and bring them back to beaches.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME is a vibrant and social Pokémon. It often hunts together in small packs, and it has been known to take down large prey such as Swampdos.
Author: thatguy4115

Entry: POKENAME lurks in murky riverways, remaining stationary for days on end on the river bed while it waits for passing prey. When it senses something it can eat, it bursts into motion using its powerful pincers.
Author: Katie

Entry: POKENAME have two large claws that are the size of their torso and hug itself when in danger to appear larger. If POKENAME hear a cry for help, they will rush over to render aid to those in danger.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Its claw-like tail is quick to grab and crush prey, but is too short to feed its own mouth. POKENAME tosses its meal into the air, then scuttles beneath to try and catch it in its jaws.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME must shed its skin every month to keep its body healthy and shiny. The exoskeletons taste very similar to Klawf Sticks.
Author: dodoowner_

Entry: POKENAME exist in a symbiotic relationship with coral, as the coral provides extra defense for POKENAME. In return, POKENAME ensure the coral are protected from predators and pollution and collect garbage into piles away from coral reefs.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Its claws are strong enough to snap metal in half. Outside of combat, Trainers bind its claws so it can't hurt others.
Author: the.the.the.the.the.the

Entry: These Pokémon love helping out other Pokémon and even humans with whatever they need. Lots of Pokémon tend to sleep next to POKENAME, as it's a great protector.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: It gathers sand, mud and other materials in its super-heated claws to mold into projectiles. This molten ammunition impacts opponents with the force of meteors.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME can snap its big claw at the underwater speed of sound, creating a sonic boom that destroys the eardrums of everyone within a 100 km radius. Doing this leaves its arm completely destroyed, taking weeks to regenerate.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: Despite POKENAME's appearance, it is quite friendly and loves to play around at the beach with humans.
Author: kcjole

Entry: POKENAME's shell is one of the most durable materials in the known world. Ironically, its gigantic claw is one of the only things with enough crushing power in order to damage it.
Author: foolish_weasel

Entry: POKENAME hustle around tundra environments, looking for fish Pokémon to eat. POKENAME rely on catching up to slower Magikarp.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME's overgrown axe head also means it's outgrown its previous hunting method. It can now cleave slow, well-armored victims in one fell swoop.
Author: abstrusePaladin

Entry: POKENAME cuts off portions of its own claw to feed its offspring. So, the babies are left alone for some time, well fed, while POKENAME goes hunting and regenerates it.
Author: epping_forest

Entry: It flies around beaches looking for food. Its size makes hunting difficult, so it has adapted its claws to extend from its sides to hunt from the sky.
Author: Patch_Bros

Entry: The claw on its tail is incredibly powerful. However, due to the weight of its claw, it relies on dense limbs made of bubbles to keep itself balanced.
Author: MelodyDeLune

Entry: It lures Krabby into its mouth and traps them. If it fails to capture anything, it will scurry across the shore with its claws.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: POKENAME hides in ocean caves, resting peacefully. It only comes out to scare away fishermen that interrupt its sleep.
Author: imagine1.

Entry: The timbre of POKENAME's voice lures in prey twice its size. It uses its oversized claw to crush foes larger than it.
Author: MrPeach774

Entry: Flying in damp caverns, POKENAME flap their wings to glide silently through the dark. POKENAME crush rocks and shells with their claw-like mouth in search of food.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME dance from dawn to dusk, waving their claws into the air. It is said that these dances change the weather, summoning rain to a given area.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME have a sleek shell atop their head. Despite the shell weighing as much as another POKENAME, the aerodynamic shell does not encumber its speed.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are cunning, as they wave their claws and quack to communicate when ships are arriving. When ships dock at the port, POKENAME wave their claws, hoping for snacks from various sailors or tourists.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME have a fully developed language, using their quacking and claw movements to detect changes in temperature and humidity. In some laboratories, POKENAME work alongside scientists to predict stormy weather.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: Anyone POKENAME's claws snap down on is knocked out in one hit. If threatened, it will crawl on all six of its limbs, moving at a tremendous speed.
Author: hampterbychoice

Entry: It grips onto its opponent using its large pincers and swings them around to tire them out. While its pincers are clamped down, it releases a burst of bubbles onto its target to secure victory.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: The pincer on its tail catches prey on instinct and drops it in front of its face when its at leisure. It may take hours for POKENAME to realize food has been delivered, however.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME scuttles around the shallows of beaches, picking up small creatures to eat. The shell-like organism surrounding its body derives sustenance from the scraps that fall from POKENAME's mouth as it chews.
Author: sk372

Entry: POKENAME crawl on the ocean floor with their claws clearing the debris in front of them. POKENAME do this because they prefer to slide on smoother surfaces, as debris and other irritants cause them pain.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME slide on their stomach along the ocean floor by freezing a path in front of them. These paths allow POKENAME to wander without worrying about colliding with debris on the ocean floor.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME use one claw to help them crawl along the seafloor and swap claws to give the other one rest. One claw can lift twice their body weight above their heads, but POKENAME requires great effort to do so.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: POKENAME are heavy and bulky, but their protective shells and hefty claws help protect them from attacks. However, POKENAME can use their claws to smash and pry off parts of their shell, shedding weight for speedy escapes.
Author: quackquackattack

Entry: To avoid scaring off prey with its fearsome claws, POKENAME hypnotizes them with its pendulum. Its claws and jaws can crack even the toughest armor.
Author: Kurator Chorby

Entry: When strolling across beaches, Trainers may find POKENAME scuttling about in the sand. They often have competitions to crush the largest rocks they can find with their massive claws.
Author: avidclown
